description:
I havent reviewed this place! Gasp!

I am a donut fanatic. This place is out the way, and isnt close to me but after hearing so many good reviews, I had to stop by

I got a normal sugar coated donut and chocolate glaze. Best ever! Luckily no line when i came. Pretty small inside. Grab and go kinda place
author: Lynn C.

description:
Long line at 1:30 in the morning. The donuts are tasty for sure. But they're made in mass quantities and sold to drunk individuals. Bob's Donut is in the Marina, but it has the interior of a late-night burrito spot in the Mission. 

I'll reiterate that the donuts are tasty. They're not even that greasy or oily. I think piling hundreds of them in the store window and serving 24/7 needlessly lowers the quality of the experience. I'd be interested to go back in the morning.
author: Neil S.

description:
I don't get why this place gets such raving reviews.

3.5 stars rounded down to 3 (to balance it out haha). 

Pros are 24/7, great service, and donut challenge!
Cons are that these donuts are just for me, convenient and not bad. Are they the best donuts I've ever had? No. However when fresh, they are delicious, but what fresh donut isn't. 

I also rated lower because a couple of times I went, I actually had a cold and/or stale donut. The third time I went, I just got the one that just came out of the deep fryer and glazed. No idea what the flavor was or what it even was, but it was good. So maybe it's a freshness thing. 

But still not the best donuts I've ever had. Just a convenient late night donut fix. Not better than your average donut shop.
author: Josie W.

description:
I went here with my boyfriend for dinner, yes dinner, and we tried a couple of items
Old fashioned glazed: really nice and the right amount of sweetness.
Old fashioned maple: great maple flavor, perfect balance of dough and topping. Sweeter than just the regular glazed, just what I was looking for.
Buttermilk maple: This one had too much of the dough, so it felt like a lot of bread with very little topping on the top.
Apple fritter: Not very good. My boyfriend really liked it, but I guess I was hoping for something with more sugar. I've had some really good Apple fritters before, so I had higher expectations.
Will definitely go back to take on the donut challenge some day soon.
author: Haylee M.

description:
Bob's donuts is opened 24 hours a day and 7 days a week! What more do you want from a donut shop? One hot day, my coworker and I decided to stop and get a lot of donuts to bring back. I had one custard for my SO, and a few other variety of donuts like two custard bars, two fritters, some bread pudding, and the big ass giant donut.

By the time the donuts were eaten... the custard had a sour taste to it... not thinking that it could have gone bad.... but my coworker decided to call and ask if the custard had a lemony taste to it. One of the employees,  Jeff picked up the phone and told her that it's not supposed to be sour or taste lemony for the custard one. He told her to come back anytime and he will replace the donuts. All the donuts had the custard cream all over them so none of them could be eaten. 

We went back to the donut shop on a colder day and told them what happened. The guy at the register was near Jeff and he heard the conversation. So he was nice enough to help us. Instead of getting the custard we got the bread pudding since it's supposed to be THAT good. 

Basically what we paid for and what was replaced, we're supposed to pay the difference, but since the difference was so little, he waived the cost. I am very happy with the customer service and their bread pudding REALLY good. 

I am on a keto diet, but it was worth breaking keto for that bread pudding! 

Will definitely be back since it's a few stops via bus and a block of walking!
author: Eugenia W.

description:
Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop is on the west side of Polk between Clay and Sacramento.

I took the California street cable car and disembarked off at Polk and Bob's is just a few blocks north.  This place has a complete old school feel to it and their products are proudly displayed at the front window of the store front.  The normal doughnuts are on the bottom shelf but the eye level top shelf has some pretty crazy sized doughnuts which are about the size of a cake.

To me I'm a fan of the old fashioned so I went with an old fashioned glazed.  They have more of a surface to glaze ratio and also have more of a crunch than the softer cake type doughnuts.  With a small coffee it came out to only 2.60 and was exactly what I was looking for as far as a morning coffee and treat went.

For the short time I was there sitting near the back there was another lady making the pink folded boxes ready for all those take out dozens of doughnuts that were going to be sold.  I swear there was a wall of boxes and considering how tasty these treats were I can see why this place sells so many sweet treats.
author: Lambert P.

description:
Fuuuuuuuck. 

Originally I rated this place 3 stars due to an unfortunate event in regards to their giant donut, but since then I am happy to say they deserve 4 stars AT LEAST. 

For someone like me who is scared of the streets of San Francisco, I have made multiple trips to the city just for these donuts. I can't help it. I'm hooked. I'm addicted. The large variety they offer, the fact that they're always soft when you receive them AND the next day as well, and the fact that they're opened 24 hours is enough to get my vote. 

It's a super basic shop inside. You have two small tables to the side and then some counter seats, otherwise you're basically stopping by to get some donuts to go. Donut prices are also very affordable for what it is and where they're at. On my most recent visit (like.. 2 days ago.. hehe.) I was able to get 8 donuts + a dozen donut holes for around $15. That's way less than what I would've paid had I gone to Krispy Kreme and only got a dozen donuts. 

While it seems odd to give a donut shop such a high rating, they truly earned it. The workers are always friendly and open to giving suggestions and you're basically able to fill your munchies if you were to come to the area high. Plus, people tend to bar hop on Polk St. so the fact that you're able to drink some then get some donuts should be enough of the deciding factor. 

Parking may be a little tough as it is in the city and every spot is pretty much metered unless you park further away. I normally come here around 9 or 10pm with my friends and we were always able to find parking nearby.
author: Venus L.

description:
$3 for 1 dozen glazed donut holes and $1.5 for single donuts. Bob's is open 24/7 so whether you want a donut with your morning coffee or something to help you sober up as you walk down Polk this is the place to go. 

Bob's has that old school donut shop feel with the counter tops facing their large screen TV playing black & white shows/movies. It's not the fanciest place to sit, but it's a trip down memory lane. 

I like Bob's donuts because they have the dense donut texture that I really enjoy. They also glaze the donut holes just enough but not to the point where they're drenched in sugar like other places. Bob's is also known for their large donuts so if you're up to the challenge you can get your name up on their wall if you can consume the entire thing in just a couple of minutes.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Walked by and saw there was no line so I had to stop by... Not sure what the appeal to this place is but there is always a line. I saw some new items in the window so I grabbed the banana fritter and the pumpkin scone. The pumpkin scone was done pretty well and you could taste the pumpkin. The banana fritter I wish had more crunch to it but you there was a faint banana - ness to it. At $2.95 a piece they were ok but I can't help but buy into the hype when I pass by this place
author: Lindsay C.

description:
To an unassuming passerby, Bob's Donut may seem like an ordinary small, mom and pop donut shop.

Honestly, writing this review about donuts is going to be hard because well ... it's fried dough and it's 24 hours- plus if it's good enough for Kaskade, it's good enough for me!

Stopped in with my gal pals and grabbed a crumb donut. Cakey, crumb donut that was not too dense or sweet. Good ratio of crumb to cake. Not mind-blowing by any means, but did the trip for my donut craving and allowed me to indulge in nostalgic feels. 

Didn't have to wait too long in line, but there was definitely a line. Love the old school vibe of the place with it's limited stool seating and donuts out in the glass case, definitely a vibe that is fleeting with time.
author: Janet N.

description:
I don't recall the first time I was here, but to my best recollection I wasn't drunk, lost, or stoo-pid. Yes, it was the time vampires and werewolves roam the streets, plus a few zombies and lady boys to add to your diverse collection. Like many say the best time here is after a night of binge drinking or being kicked out of your overpriced loft, or both! 

Ahh Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop. The spot hipsters and millennials think "they" discovered, yet ask any Polk street vagrant and he'll tell ya... Bob has been around since 1960! Here's from the lips of Bob...

"Bob's Donuts opened in 1960 as a family owned and operated establishment that has become a cornerstone in the Nob Hill community. Our family continues this tradition to this day, dedicated to preserving the art of making handmade donuts. We are proud to be one of the last independent donut shops that still make our donuts and pastries from scratch. Our donuts have a classic taste..."

Now don't expect fancy here. Expect something from Hill Valley from Back to The Future, sans the root beer float and Chip. You can expect counter stools and small rickety cafe tables. Stacks of pink to-go donut boxes clutter half the counter top and a crew somewhat as dated as the stools. On my latest visits a couple of younger employees liven the place up. One kid blasts gangsta rap behind the counter! No longer is it only Bob and grumpy beehives working. I'm not sure if the latest hires are to entice the young hipster drunks, but it seems to work with the myriad of customers I saw - coming and going. Old and young, all wanting donuts! I've had the maple bar, old fashion plain, chocolate donut, cake donut, glazed donut, etc. I have yet to try the legendary apple fritter or the gigantic donut! 

Bob's Donuts (did the hipsters add "pastry" to it?) is one old school donut shop! The coffee is average at best, but damn it works at 2am. The donuts on the other hand, are exceptional and always freshly made. Fluffy AF! And yes, Bob has a loyal following not only with the drunks, but those that know the warm fluffy donuts freshly pop out before 5am. 

All in all, I recommend trying Bob's at any hours at least once, but if you want the full effect come after midnight and before the sunrises. That's all part of the Bob's Donut urban 'lore. Try the donut eating contest Bob has going too - that might be fun (or annoying) with a group of sniffling hipsters, but I'd refrain from the contest showdown with the pimp vs. John. Yet, today Bob's Donut is no longer just for the drunks and hood rats... it's for all to enjoy! 

And "she ain't nothing more than a pit-bull with lipstick!" I think I heard Bob say that once... well it was Twilight time! Maybe I was drunk! Or perhaps the drunk behind of me! Uggh! Bob!
author: Eric R.

description:
There are not very many places in SF where you can get two incredibly large donuts for $3, and Bob's is the place to go for that. 

The line looks intimidating, but service is lightning fast! I was incredibly impressed at how quickly we were in and out. 

The donut was yummy. Donuts are always yummy, but this donut was super cheap, came to us immediately, and was a delight. We ordered a chocolate donut and a glazed.
author: Jenée S.

description:
Bob's is so good. 

I had been many times late night after bars. Specifically I have found myself there late night people watching and enjoying a fresh donut on Halloween for the last few years. 

I finally tried the crumb donut. It will be hard to beat that anywhere and ever again. I'm a true fan.
author: Andrew W.

description:
It's not bad but I also had better (aka Bill's Donut in Dayton, OH) 

Ordered an old fashion glazed donut. It was fried pretty well so it's not as soft as I would like.  I tasted a hint of cinnamon on it. Overall, not bad at all. 

Had a friend who tried their challenge of a huge donut in 3 minutes  it equates to 14 donuts for around $12., my friend only finished half of it. That was still 7 donuts in 3 minutes. Needless to say, it was super impressive!
author: Yuan Z.

description:
What bad could there possibly be to say about Bob's Doughnuts? I'll tell you now, NOTHING.

I came here on the recommendation of two different friends during my most recent trip to SF. They both said it was a must if I was visiting and looking for the authentically good spots that the city has in terms of food. On my last day my friend and I said why not and made our way to Bob's.

Located in the Nob Hill neighborhood, the spot itself doesn't look like much from the outside but the second you walk face first into the smell of freshly made doughnuts you know you've found something good. Its a long shop that has stools and tables where you're able to sit at. Besides that this spot seems like a place where people come and go on a regular basis.

When it came time to order I stuck with a chocolate eclair ($4.50) that was definitely screaming my name as I looked over all the glorious options they had available. This spot is also known for it's massive doughnuts (basically the size of a human head) that goes for about $12. Definitely an ideal dessert to tackle with a friend.

After we ordered we walked to a nearby coffee shop with outdoor seating and enjoyed our desserts. This is definitely a good option if you're looking to stay in the area to enjoy what you just ordered.

The service and staff were great too! They were patient while we were making our decisions and gave us all the information we needed when we had questions about their products. DEFINITELY make a trip here if you can while in SF.
author: Nicholas C.

description:
Quick take: Donut Challenge


I was introduced to Bob's Donuts as the place to be if you had a hankering for a giant donut. This giant donut is the equivalent to 15 regular donuts. Eat this donut in 2 minutes or under and get it for free. 

So we go and check this place out at 11pm on a Saturday night. This shop is open 24/7 and there is a line. Although freezing and cold we can still feel and smell the excitement and wonderment of this giant donut.

We ended up ordering a regular glaze and a maple glaze donut. They have donuts that are on display at the window but they serve freshly made donuts off of other racks in the kitchen.

Maple glaze is to die for. Yummy moist fluffy donuts covered in maple glaze. Regular glaze is good too but not as good as the maple in my opinion.

I highly recommend a trip down to Bob's. Maybe you might get lucky and witness a challenge.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Amazing... this place is dangerous because it is only a few blocks away from my house. The reasoning is that if I climb those hills to Bob's and then back.. I have then earned my apple fritter and glazed donut..

Definitely get the apple fritter if they are there.. (actually don't get them.. they are not very good at all....) 

Try their maple glazed too.. their crumb donuts are what they are supposedly famous for but I honestly prefer their apple fritters.. wait hmm I meant to say their maple glazed...
author: Eleana H.

description:
After trying the donuts here, I can confirm that West Coast donuts are way better than East Coast donuts. I got a dozen donuts for $24.75, which is a little more expensive for a tiny donut shop, but still definitely worth it. 
I tried the original glazed, cream filled, buttermilk bar, apple fritter, crumb donut, and old fashioned glazed.  My favorite one was the original glazed- soft, fluffy, and overall the best glazed donut I've ever had. The apple fritter was also very good- buttery and crunchy, with a good apple cinnamon flavor. I didn't care much for the cream filled or crumb donut even though they say that's what they're known for. 
Best donuts I've ever had! Highly recommended!!
author: Angela W.

description:
I'm into the environment because it's sorta divey and small. Definitely a local hot spot. You can tell it's a small business. That being said, we came in and there weren't many options left. They are most known for the crumb (which I didn't get). I settled on a glazed jam (topped not filled) and glazed cake. The jam was strawberry, the doughnut overall was just okay. Messy, sticky. The dough was soft. The cake doughnut was not good. It was too greasy for me. 

I'm giving 2 stars because my girlfriend liked the jam one a lot. Other than that, I wouldn't come back. It's cool there is a doughnut challenge though.
author: Wennie H.

description:
Bob's Donut is open 24 hours, which was a selling point when I found out about them. We were leaving the Union Square area and moving to our friend's house in the Balboa Terrace area and wanted to stop somewhere to get breakfast for the next morning. We had a 6:30am wake up time to get to Sausalito for our shuttle to Muir Woods, so not a lot of options for breakfast.

There was a small line out the door when we arrived around 10pm on a Saturday night, but it goes by very quickly. I think we got about 7 doughnuts in one box. I had their chocolate old fashioned and a regular glazed old fashioned. Others ordered the regular un-glazed old fashioned and the glazed yeast doughnuts.

All the doughnuts still tasted really good the next morning and we gobbled them up before we arrived for our shuttle.
author: Michelle T.

description: Every time I visit a new city, I try to find myself a donut shop, especially if there is a well known one such as Bob's. Bob's did not disappoint. Even before walking in they have a display of several of their donuts from the outside. One thing I think they should add are labels to identify what flavors were in the window. The best part is that they are open 24/7! I stopped by around 3 PM and there was only one other customer at the time. I was looking for something simple so I ordered a glazed donut and ate it at home several hours later. It was very fresh, tasty, soft, and the frosting was perfectly coated. They do have 3 small tables and some stools too if you wanted to sit and enjoy your donut and some coffee. I didn't try the coffee so I can't comment on the taste. They also accept credit card.
author: Dave S.

description:
I know the doughnuts here have been the talk of SF for years, and I've been here several times before, but was craving doughnuts (thanks to fab fellow yelper, Cheryl M.), so thought I'd give it another try. I've always viewed Bob's as mediocre, because I'm always comparing raised glazed doughnuts to Stan's in Santa Clara, which is my all time favorite, specifically for their raised glazed.

Don't repeat my mistake by coming here on a Friday afternoon! After being told they were completely out of their raised glazed and crumb doughnuts, they informed me that Friday's are notoriously busy for them, as many folks order dozens to bring into their offices. The owner said people sometimes purchase 10 dozen on Fridays. Can you believe that beautiful sight?!? They were going to make more later, but I was certainly not going to stick around for 2 hours for raised glazed doughnuts. 

As a result, I ended up purchasing:

- an apple fritter - I like the slightly crispy glazed parts on the outside, but the inside is way to doughy for me. Very very few bits of apples actually inside theirs, but I'm not really in it for the apples anyway.

- doughnut holes - These were my only alternative to the raised glazed, which, again, they were out of. I think these were sitting around for a while, as they were a little dry. These, I find, tend to be good only when they're super duper fresh, which these most definitely were not.

- an old fashioned glaze - In general, cake doughnuts tend to be my least favorite, but theirs was surprisingly good. They had just made these, and they were perfect! Ever so slightly crisp on the edges with just the right amount of glaze. I should've just bought 2 of these and would've been happy.

There are also some ginormous doughnuts that you'll see in their window. I mean huge, just see my pic. If you can polish one off in less than 2 minutes, you get the doughnut free, a t-shirt, and your name on their Hall of Fame. Maybe Joey Chestnut can do his stomach expansion training with these if he gets bored with the hot dogs. Always best to vary your workout routine, after all. 

Ambiance? Absolutely none, as you can tell from my pic. No old fashioned diner-type charm even. I'd take my order to go, like most everyone else.

While I was there the workers were laughing about a customer who had just phoned, requesting doughnuts formed in the shape of a letter. The owner chimed in about a call she recently got from someone who wanted a doughnut made in the shape of the Transamerica Pyramid. Now, that's a creative and an interesting business venture for someone with an entrepreneurial doughnut spirit, though unlikely very profitable. Anyway, the doughnut maker nixed all that when she said they only make doughnuts in one shape - round. That was my laugh for the afternoon.

Overall, I still think of Bob's as a mediocre doughnut joint, and would save all the calories here and "spend" them all at Stan's in Santa Clara any day. However, if you're craving doughnuts and in the area, Bob's is a good option, as opposed to any of the chains, even Krispy Kreme. Just try to avoid Friday's if you want to avoid the sold out disappointments I experienced.
author: Lori N.

description:
When I walked in, I was instantly hit with the fresh smell of donuts and other sugary yet delicious pastries. I was a little bit intimidated that the place didn't have a menu, but the cashier was welcoming and understanding. 

For a 24 hour donut shop, the set up of the interior could've been nearer and the mass amount of donuts should be more regulated (because really, who's gonna order 150+ donuts before all of them go bad?!?)

I just got one original glazed donut and since there wasn't any pricing listed in the store, I'm assuming it was around $1.20?? Luckily for me, they just made a fresh batch of glazed donuts and I snagged one while it was still fresh.

Immediately astounded by the crispy, flakey outer donut, yet soft inside, I accidentally gobbled a bit before taking a picture. There were some chocolate marks from making other donuts, but eh, extra chocolate is still good chocolate.

Overall, wish the place was more structured and organized in terms of the interior and donut making, but great overall customer and bomb diggitty o
author: Megan L.

description:
My son has a list of places he'd like to visit because they have interesting or unique things to eat that he would like to try. This place was on that list because of their one pound donut.

I told my kids to get ready because we would be driving to San Francisco just to try that one pound donut. We went into a parking lot nearby and had an attendant valet my car because I stress with parking on the street in San Francisco.

When we got there, only three people were ahead of us. We were so excited to each order our one pound donut that we talked about it in line. The people ahead of us had no clue about that donut but guess what... Now they did and so they ordered that. When we went to order they only had one left. They had 3 more that had been ordered over the phone. The people that ordered them didn't even order them to enjoy them. They did so to do that stupid challenge where if you swallow it up like a savage in less than 3 minutes it would be free. Yes, I'm a little salty about that. Hahaha! They didn't even put a dent on that donut but they messed it up and had us witness the revolting show. 

We ordered the one available and a few of the regular sized glazed donuts. They were all absolutely delicious! So airy. Even the one pound donut was airy. We ate some of the little ones and split the big one because we all wanted to taste it.

We were told that we should order ahead because it takes over an hour to have the giant ones ready. We will definitely do that on the way to San Francisco from now on even if we are there for other reasons. 

When we were leaving, the line was crazy. There were over 40 people outside waiting. The place is tiny so anything more than two people in line spills on to the outside.
author: Betty R.

description:
I never knew I loved donuts this much until I came here.

Came here at 8pm after eating dinner nearby (i.e. was not drunk). They were JUST done making a fresh batch of glazed donuts out of the frying pan and I asked to get one from the hot, fresh batch. It was the best donut I have ever had in my life. It was like beautiful, beautiful carbs sent from the lord above to melt in my mouth for I was a good boy and ate salad for lunch today. I don't remember what happened next, but the donut had disappeared by the time I could think again.

I also got the chocolate donut- which was a good donut, but not "the best donut ever" material.

Each donut was $1.5, so I ended up paying $3 total. They accept credit cards and apple pay. The place is tiny with limited seating (counter stools and tiny cafe tables). 

Will definitely come back here, sober or drunk (maybe both in one night).
author: Karanveer M.

description:
Coming from Canada, land of the magical goodness that is Tim Hortons, I wasn't the biggest fan of Bob's Donuts. The donut just felt so heavy - as I bit into the pastry, I could feel oil oozing out... not pleasant.

Other than its oiliness, the icing + topping combinations were nice and the donuts were very fresh tasting. There's so much variety too - apple fritters, ring donuts, filling donuts, plain donuts, other pastries, so be prepared to make a tough decision or just buy a dozen or two.
author: Monica X.

description:
Yes. They do live up to their hype. 

It's comparable to Stan's donut in the South Bay.

Fresh donuts. Sweet on the outside and a blend of enough of airiness on the inside. It doesn't taste too heavy but that's dangerous part because you could end up eating more than anticipated. 

Good thing it's not too close to me or else...I'll come here everyday.
author: Ngoc P.

description:
BOB, you're doing everything so well! Can't remember the last time I had donuts this good!! No bad choices here; my favourites were the classic glazed donut, or the raspberry jelly filled. Both were fantastic! A nice bonus is that they're also really cheap!

The place itself is a welcoming hole-in-the-wall deal. The staff were friendly, and the donuts fresh. They don't mess around here, coming back 100%!
author: Mati K.

description:
I NEED QUIK DESSERT and it's 2am! Where do we go that's open right now?  Bob's! Let's go there and get a dozen donuts.

Bob's is open 24/7/365 and is constantly making donuts.  They're staple donut is the HUGE Glazed Donut that FITS entirely IN the pink square box.  The pastry makers only make them at certain times of the 24 hours, so you should ask or call to find out when. (Btw, this huge donut is great for parties, get a few ...... dozen! HAHA!)

When I stay with my daughter in SF, we go here for the late night dessert fix.  Yay, I am definitely a fan 4-Star.
author: Randy L.

description:
The donuts here are good for people who like simple and classic flavors. They don't have any of the trendy kind of cereal donut flavors but they do a mean classic glazed donut! 

I got the strawberry jam and a classic glazed donut and both were good. But I definitely think that the glazed donut is better than the jam and if you like filled donuts in general you should get the cream filled ones instead. The jam was okay but just not really to my liking I think it felt one dimensional in flavor? Like after one bite I was like okay.
author: Lena L.

description: This small hole in the wall (pun intended) is A MUST when visiting San Fran! It has self delve coffee  (Colombian, medium roast, and water for tea). The sugar raised is so soft and delicious. They have a hybrid between an eclair and a Boston cream donut ! I'm having the one that "looks" like a Boston cream, but is filled with raspberry jam. How can you NOT come here??? It's a short (15 min.) wall to the Cable Car Museum. I highly recommend both!!
author: Shawn W.

description:
Tip- order online and pre pay for the big doughnut.

SOOOO worth the hype! Got the big glazed with sprinkles and it was so fresh it just melted in our mouth. Honestly might become something every time we come to the city. 

Great artwork and wonderful service.
author: Rashni R.

description: Best donuts I've had in a long time. My favorites were the cake crumb and the old fashioned glazed, but I have a feeling everything they make is delicious.
author: Kirsten H.

description:
Came here on a Friday afternoon to look for their giant donuts, but unfortunately they were out til later on for their pm batches. We still got our donut fix...
The next day, bright and early, we attempted again to get our giant donut. Arrived about 9:30am and there was line out the door. At the window there was only 6 giant donuts left. Luckily by the time we got at the register we got our giant  crumb donut. it was HUGE, it perfectly fits the pink donut box.
Donut was good, fresh and they don't lie about their crumb donuts being the best...it was the best!!!
The lady that helped us on both of our visits were very nice and helpful...will definitely pay them a visit again when I come back to SF.
author: Maricel J.

description:
1/27/18

Screw Voodoo.  Who wants the gastronomic equivalent of a botox'ed to hell alien-face saggy cougar, coated in 10 layers of fresh skin and lip acrylic?  No, we don't like silly all-show wedding cakes covered in that nasty fondant either.  No.  Give us just goddam good tasting doughnuts thank you!  Don't matter if they're ugly.

And man, they are UGLY.  Hell, if it weren't for the line out the door, even at the dead of a winter's cold night, one look through the window would instantly petrify you at the thought of eating these doughnuts...

Cracking icing, deformed shapes, inconsistent and messy toppings... like seriously Bob???  You still practicing crayon in kindergarten?

.....
........ What the f is wrong with those people in line???

...
One bite.

Just one frickin' bite.

Have napkins nearby to wipe your tears.  Trust me.

5/5

#sanfrancisco #doughnut #donut #star
author: Dean C.

description: Beyond rude and horrible treatment of customers! Can't believe people would give money to a place that offers such terrible service. I have a food allergy and politely asked three different staff members for help to see if I could safely eat the donuts. I don't typically write these types of reviews but was so appalled by this place. No one would help or seemed to care. The main guy checking people out dismissed me so I tried asking several other people who directed me back to him. He rudely pointed at a box behind the counter and told me to read the ingredients, as if I could see them from that far away. I am very shocked and disappointed in the way I was treated here. The place also looked disgustingly dirty so not sure it's sanitary anyhow.
author: Katie C.

description:
Bob's is a tiny little donut shop tucked away among the business district and suburban neighborhood of downtown San Francisco. It's truly unique in its own right offering the classic donuts in addition to their monster sized donuts fit for a family of four. Believe me when I say it's the size of a stack of 5 dinner plates. They host an eating contest for only the bravest eaters who think they can finish the thing in 5 minutes or less; offering prizes and recognition to the victors.

Of course aside from their baked goods, the service is just as sweet. It feels like a real mom & pop shop and you can expect kind and gracious service. This was a great stop on our visit to the area, and it certainly earned each of their 5 stars.
author: Patrick B.

description:
I am not a donut fan.

I repeat: I am NOT a donut fan.

I've shared this story in a few reviews: I'm the girl who asked her mom for a pork chop birthday cake as a kid. (I'm not a fan of sweets in general.)

One day, we got Bob's Donuts at work. I thought the name rang a bell, so I went on yelp. Sure enough, I had the place bookmarked. (Another note: any dessert/ice cream/sweets bookmark I have is for friends & family, so it's not that I was actually interested.)

That said, how can a girl say no? I love trying things, and one of my biggest frustrations in life is actually NOT being able to enjoy donuts.

Everyone's obsessed with them, from Homer to my friends to Jimbob down the street. The only one I've ever remotely enjoyed (and I've tried MANY over the years) was an apple cider donut at an orchard back in the Midwest.

After perusing Bob's selection, I went for a cinnamon donut and the cake crumb. Both were AWESOME. The cinnamon came out on top, but I enjoyed the center of the cake crumb one (ironically, without the cake crumbs...).

The cinnamon donut came freakishly close to that one great donut of my past, and for that, I'm grateful.

Dear Bob: Thanks for giving this girl a delicious donut. Mission accomplished.
author: Nic Z.

description:
B loves donuts and so here we are.

We ordered a few and as I held one in my hands, I didn't think much of it. Looked like all the other donuts I've tasted before. I take one bite of their glazed donut and my mind is blown. This is probably the BEST donut I have tasted so far. Super light, not overly sweet, the dough had a perfect chew, and there was no greasy/mouth coated with sugar aftertaste. These puppies go down easy and that is very very dangerous!

I think if we lived in San Fran, B would be here every week. You guys are so lucky to have this mouth watering donut place. 

Now my tastebuds are spoiled, thanks Bob's.
author: Kimberly J.

description:
We came here on a Sunday hoping to get the massive donut for a friends birthday, but they were already sold out by the time we got there just before noon. The staff are very friendly and let us know they'd be baking off more of the giant donuts between 3-4 pm. Unfortunately, we had plans to be elsewhere so we decided we might as well grab a donut and other items while we were here.

My friend order a plain glazed old fashioned donut and a chocolate glazed. Boring I know, but they didn't really have much to choose from by this time. So, lesson learned - come super early bc they don't keep the full stock for a brunch bite craving.

Me and the BF ordered a normal glazed old fashioned, an almond ring, and a savory Ham and cheese croissant. By no means do I consider myself a donut connoisseur, but based on the high reviews on Yelp I definitely expected something tastier. The glazed donut was good but not grand, the almond ring needed a little more flavor love, and the savory croissant was good but would have been better if it was warm with the cheese slightly melted. If you're expecting something to Krispy Kreme; don't bother bc you'll have wasted your time. This is a smaller establishment that makes their donuts in batches based off foot traffic times. This also means that each batch of products might vary so I'll need to come back to give it a second try when items are fresh out do the fryer. For now, Bob's is at par level.
author: Amber H.

description:
Stumbled upon this place at 11pm. Thought it was just a huge line for a club, but no, it was for donuts!!! Couldn't tell if there were a lot of people because they were drunk or if its actually good. Did a quick, cheeky check on Yelp and decided to stay in line.

Line wasnt that bad and you get to just stare at all the donuts on display so its actually one of the better line experiences I've had ell oh ell

Got the plain old fashioned, crumb cake, and sugar raised. Bf liked the crumb cake but I thought it was too sweet. Also I'm just biased towards liking plain donuts (ya like just the bread and nothing on it). Donuts were of good quality AND prices were reasonable. These three donuts came out to $4 and I was taken aback because I'm so used to outrageous SF prices. Like maybe that's still expensive for donuts but I just have no idea???

Anyway, this place def deserves a visit!
author: Stephanie K.

description: If you aren't getting a raised glazed, you're doing it wrong. Some of the best doughnuts I've eaten in a very long time. Yeasty, chewy yet fluffy goodness.
author: Kelly Z.

description:
There is a lot of hype to this place because it opens 24/7, divey and near clubs and bars. The food is...not really the emphasis here but rather a snack to have after drinking at nearby bars. 

Its oily and the oil they fried in was never changed or cleaned (seemingly so). My boyfriend bought 2 boxes just to try but at the end throwing them all away because our throat starts to itch due to the oil.

Fritters, donuts and all others does not have the depth in taste. The oil overwhelmed. 

Coffee is from Yuban Ground coffee from the coffeemaker machine (drip).

Space is tight and mostly 2 seats per table. 

But overall, we will not come back again. Sorry!
author: Tracy W.

description: Their donuts are to die for! I've never had tasted donuts in its most chewy- not too sweet, excellent softness. Parking is a little challenge, but will definitely come back. I've now got a nice treat idea for coworkers as the day comes for potluck days.
author: Che C.

description: This place is great for late night sweets cravings. I wasn't overly impressed by the crumb donut here (surprisingly since it is so heavily advertised), but the maple donut and ice cold milk were great.
author: Sarah W.

description: Believe the hype. The best donuts with be best glaze and frosting you can find. Donuts are fresh anytime of the day. The dough is amazingly fluffy. A must stop. Try their crumb donut! The cinnamon bun is vegan. They have giant donut for purchase. One drunken night I will need to come here for the giant donut challenge.
author: Grace H.

description: Stopped by to grab a couple donuts, the cashier was really nice. The donuts were on display and plenty to choose from. It was pretty cool seeing the person whose frying, flipping, draining and glazing the donuts right behind the register. We didn't go crazy buying a ton of donuts but the 5 we got, 2maple glazed, 2 crunch donut where really good. The flavors were indescribable!! Definitely a great donut shop q
author: Tracy H.

description: This place is sick. It's family owned and I'm always a fan of family owned establishments. They have this massive donut challenge where if you can eat a donut the size of a NBA basketball, you get your name featured on their hall of fame list. Their donuts and eclairs are really good!!
author: Steven Z.

description:
I decided to order their signature giant donut for my donut lover friend's birthday. Since I was flying down to LA, I called a day ahead to make sure it was available. The lady that picked up the phone took my name and number down to reserve one giant crumble donut ($12) for me to be picked up later that day at 6pm.

I placed the donut in the fridge overnight and left it out to thaw for the full next day. The donut survived a bus ride, hour flight, and another 3 hours to Big Bear Lake. By 11pm that night, we were singing happy birthday with a giant donut before devouring it. The crumble is so yummy and the donut is very fluffy. It amazes me how they thoroughly fry such a huge donut so perfectly. Bob's giant donut is such a great replacement for a cake!
author: Cindy Z.

description:
It's pretty hard to make a bad donut, from what I know about donuts. This place seems to have some insider knowledge that most Americans seem to like larger versions of regular sized objects...

I went there expecting to find a normal sized breakfast item, and low and behold one GIANT METEOR SIZED GLAZED DONUT! I bought it took the largest bite I could muster, feed a small family with the crumbs that had fallen from my mouth, and shipped the rest of the donut to Eritrea for the relief work there, and I haven't been hungry since... and this was last YEAR!! 

In all seriousness I definitely did not sent that donut away, I ate it! Granted it took me a while. 

It's hard not to like a place like this... Bobs (big) donuts. 4 out of 5!
author: Cal J.

description:
My friends were in the area and looking for a dessert place around 9 PM. Unfortunately, not many dessert places are open at that time around Nob Hill..but Bob's Donut was! So we walked a few blocks to the shop, and there was a short line at this time. We asked for any hot donuts, which thankfully there were a few. We got a variety of glazed, chocolate, and maple. They were okay..nothing superb or amazing about the donuts apart from it being nice and hot. My favorite was the glazed. The chocolate and maple were a bit too sweet for me. 

The servers were helpful in getting us warm donuts though which we appreciated! There isn't much seating area, so it's better for a grab and go. Also isn't the cleanest place to want to eat in..but pricing is cost affordable. I would suggest coming here once for the experience, but for donut snobs, would suggest going elsewhere.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Never judge a book by its cover, and this is the perfect example. 

Bob's Donuts or shall we call it Bob's Heaven? ...

San Francisco's best kept secret! If you are looking for the best real deal donuts in town this will be your destination. Simple but the most delicious freshly baked donuts.  Believe it or not 3am is the best time to get a hold of a fresh batch or early in the morning. Imagine a fluffy, moist, light, and the perfectly sweeten  treat. 

My recommendation is to stick to the basics, Chocolate Glazed and Glazed (not the sugar glazed, that one is too sweet) Apple fritters are the bomb. 

Your best option here is take out,  find a place (next door) on Polk Street with great coffee and pleasure yourself .
author: Brenda Z.

description: Awesome.... donuts should always be this good.  This isn't you run of the mill donut chain, it's a family with multiple generations pushing out some of the best donuts America has.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Simple, quick, and delicious.  Three words that sum up this tiny little donut shop. Some days they are out of particular items, some days they aren't.  It's all about the day and timing of your visit.

I had a maple donut and loved it.  It was fresh, warm, and had a great flavor.  I was very happy with it. The shop is very small.  There is seating inside, but not a lot.  It can also get crowded, so I just took mine to go.  

The staff is friendly and helpful.
author: Abby L.

description:
We started off at the Apple fritter 

glazed doughnut 

and a chocolate donut

There's nothing spectacular but I'm glad I 

made the trek
author: B I.

description:
These are probably the best donuts ever!!!! I just love them. They are always delicious. The best is when they are fresh and warm! This time, we had a chocolate covered and a cinnamon sugar. Both were really good. Cinnamon sugar  was still warm when we ate it. Drooling just writing these words. 

4 stars BECAUSE... They NEVER have my lemon filled donut when I go. Got it the first visit hot and fresh, but, since then, like 3 more visits, they never seem have it. Makes me sad thus negative 1 star.
author: Shannon O.

description: Rounding up from 3 1/2 stars. Believe it's overrated on Yelp. Had apple fritter which was average. I like them crispier around the edges. The bread pudding was average but really, really sweet. At 1:30pm the donut wasn't super fresh but the bread pudding was. I should have asked what was most recently prepared. Why round up to 4 stars? The guy who helped me today was so friendly and upbeat and clearly loved his job.
author: Ottis M.

description:
SOOO GOOOOD. I went a little drunk (they are open 24/7) so it might've tasted a little better than it actually may have been lol but it seemed fresh even though it was late at night. 
I think it was cash only though and they gave us a few more donut holes!
author: Yeonhwa S.

description: Was not impressed! I was visiting from Chicago, a fantastic doughnut city, and I wanted to try a hyped up San Fran dessert before I left town. I saw a bunch of stuff about the massive doughnut here, which is definitely what drew me in. The outside looked pretty dingy...the inside was the same. I asked if there was a menu, or even prices for that matter, and the employee basically told me what you see is what you get in a rude manner. OKAYYYY THEN. So I had to go back outside to see what the selection was. It was a Friday afternoon and everything was incredibly old and picked over. I figured that was sort of the aesthetic? As long as it tastes good, right? Well, there wasn't a single thing that impressed me about these doughnuts. Dry and forgettable. All you cali people need to come to the Midwest for some real doughnuts. Mad I wasted my calories on this place.
author: Maria E.

description:
Donuts are never healthy, so if you're going to get one you might as well go all in.

The donuts here are simple and delicious. They have a big variety as well, including donut holes and the screw-shaped ones. 

The donuts I got were $1.50 a piece - which I suppose isn't cheap but it's worth a try. 

It's a popular spot so expect a line, especially later in the evenings.
author: John L.

description:
Where to begin? Bob's offers the perfect sugary confection to either start the day or follow a meal. We went with a couple different old fashioned options - chocolate and maple. Both were still warm and seriously delicious and decadent. I also had some of their freshly brewed Colombian coffee. It was the perfect pairing.

If you're in the area, don't miss out on this local delight!
author: Steve S.

description:
I was really hesitant before coming here because I was nervous it wouldn't live up to the hype, but Bob's definitely delivered. We came here for dessert on a Friday night after dinner and waited in a super short 5 minute line. 

1) Crumb Donut - My absolute favorite thing. I really don't know how to describe it besides melt-in-your-mouth gooey with just the right amount of crunch from the crumb. I would wait in any kind of line for this donut again. 
2) Apple Fritter - This huge donut was like a cross between a cinnamon bun and an apple donut with its chunks of apple and swirls of cinnamon sugars. My boyfriend said it even almost reminded him of a funnel cake thanks to its deep fried nautre.
3) Donut Holes - I don't really care that much about donut holes, but my resident donut hole expert says that they're pretty good. I still think the specialty donuts steal the show, though, so if you're trying to limiting yourself I would choose something else. 

Overall this place was definitely worth of all 5 stars. Definitely an SF institution worth checking out!
author: Jenny D.

description:
I know doughnuts. Well. Too well. 

And these are my favorite doughnuts. Period. Anywhere. 

It doesn't really matter which ones, though I am partial to the apple cinnamon fritters, raised glazed and maple frosted (don't underestimate the maple)...whatever you do, get em hot and fresh!
author: W N.

description: Good donuts, fresh, fun late night treat.  Loved the variety.  Everything seems to be made on sight.
author: Ryan K.

description:
3.5. Why is it I feel so hesitant to buck the trend of everyone's 5-star reviews to leave my insignificant and piddly little opinion here about Bob's Donuts?

Well, I found Bob's by walking down the street. 
Line moves fast, and the woman working the counter was so nice.
If they're out of something, they're out. Cool. 

Got a sour cream donut (dealer's choice), regular with chocolate glaze, and 2 apple fritters. $10. And honestly... I'm not so sure why people love them, except that they're hot. 

Chocolate glaze- the dough didn't really have any flavor to it, and neither did the chocolate glaze. It was kinda unappealing, so I threw the other half away. 

Apple fritters just tasted like cloyingly sweet grease. 
Sour cream one was nice texture and tasty. 

I can even look past the fact that these are some of the ugliest donuts I've seen. I mean, beauty is only frosting-deep, right?
author: Jocelyn C.

description: This place is open 24/7. Donuts are freshly made around the clock. I went with my husband on a Sunday night and there were only a few people in line. Expect a line for this place because the donuts are so good! Worth the wait!
author: Sophia K.

description:
Bob's Donuts is located on Polk Street in Pacific Heights between Clay & Sacramento St. There is only street parking with meters available in the busy area. The interior has a couple tables with chairs and bar style seating along the counter.

Donuts are made freshly throughout the day at various times. Follow them on social media because they post their fresh made donuts. 

Ask the person at the counter what donuts are fresh or hot. You can't go wrong with any freshly made donuts. 

Besides their fresh donuts but what really sets them apart from other Donut Shops are their Crumb Donuts and Apple Fritters. Most Apple Fritters I had were very hard, dense and oily. Bob's Apple Fritters exterior is hard enough to hold its shape but the interior was pretty soft and airy while not being as oily compared to other places I tried. I didn't try to Crumb Donut but my wife did and she loved it. That's her favorite donut and she said Bob's Crumb Donuts were really good. 

If you're in the area looking for good donuts then come by and give them a try. Just need to be a little patient with parking in the area. Don't let the line detour you because this is a pretty popular spot. I seen lines at various times throughout the night and early morning. The lines move efficiently and their open 24/7. They also accept Credit Cards.
author: Paul V.

description:
Pros: They're open 24 hrs! Came here after the Halloween Pub Crawl for a snack around 10pm and they were still frying up fresh donuts! Lots of variety at such a late time and the line was out the door. They seem to be known for their super large donut the size of a cake! That'll be great for sharing. Very cute art wall on the inside with various donut painting and drawings.

Cons: Small shop with tiny tables for two. They place raw dough trays on the counter where anyone seated there can poke and contaminate. Notices a few drunk guys making stupid bets and dare for their friend to eat the dough.

Ordered: Maple Sprinkle Donut

Would I recommend: Yea I'll come back here for a donut if I'm in the area again. Definitely one of the few places on Polk that opens late if you're craving something sweet.
author: Terry N.

description: Ayyy the hype is real! I had a crumb donut and an apple fritter for a little over $4 total. The crumb donut is legit the softest I've ever had. Like, can I turn it into a pillow and rest my head on it so I can not only dream about these donuts, but dream ON the donut too?! Kay cool. The apple fritter was yummy but nothing that set it apart from other good mom and pop donut shops. But definitely everything a fritter should be. Crispy outside and squishy inside. I'm so bummed this place doesn't have blueberry cake donuts. Please Bob, I know y'all would make dreamy blueberry cake donuts. I'm begging.
author: Lexi R.

description:
They make donuts as big as my face! But this is hands down the softest donut I've ever had in my life. And I've had plenty of donuts before.. 
The lady working the line was so nice, she was the only one working the cash register, cooking and packing the donuts when I was there at night. She overheard me saying how good and soft the donuts were and gave me an a freshly made donuts to my friends and I!
author: Majes W.

description:
I came here around 6-7pm on a Sunday evening and they were busy making fresh donuts! There was a short line but it moved fairly quickly. They had a number of options including the extra large donuts but I opted for the original glazed. The donut itself was soft and fresh but the glaze was... almost non existent? It had no flavor and just tasted like a plain donut. I'm kind of disappointed because of the hype I've heard of this place. 

The staff were kind and answered any and all questions that people had regarding their donuts.
author: Maggie W.

description: Their donuts are really good! I only gave 4 star because I wanted to do the giant donut challenge but they told me that their giant donuts came out too small that day for anyone to do the challenge. Either way, I had the giant sprinkle donut and it was fluffy and perfect! I had it with a  side of milk and it was amazing!
author: Zsolti H.

description:
The donuts are pillowy soft. They're sweet but not sickeningly so.

The chocolate croissant is buttery, flaky, and with a touch of saltiness.

Reliably open 24 hours a day.

Sold yet?
author: Cici T.

description:
Customer Service was amazing as the worker greeted us and recommended his favorite donuts.

His donut recommendations were pretty good. My favorite donut was the chocolate sprinkle one. They were just too overpriced for my liking.

Overall, I would recommend because the donuts were tasty and the customer service is wonderful.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Fresh fried donuts at all hours? Count me in!

If you want to be kind and share, get the huge glazed donut.  You will definitely impress friends with this biggie.
author: Bella B.

description:
We were in town and a friend recommended checking this place out on a Sunday night.  Perfect because I was really craving a donut and this place is open.  With so many reviews and this place has such great star ratings, I was curious and yet, very excited to check this place out.  

We know parking was going to be tough, so we opt to look for street parking and walk about a block to get here.  Right away we noticed there was a line out the door!  Mind you it was a Sunday night and it was pretty cold outside.  Still a line!  Man, I was getting more and more excited wondering if the hype is real.  

Standing in line we can see through their display window the array of donuts they had for sale.....Especially those huge donuts that I swear were calling for me.  Since it was my first time here, I asked for a dozen of anything the cashier recommended.  We had a great mix of glazed, chocolate, sugar, cake, etc donuts.  I couldn't wait long enough to take a picture as I bit into my first donut of the night.  

I've been to many popular donut places: Sacramento, Portland, Vegas, San Diego, but THIS place was as good as it gets.  I'll for sure be back to get TWO dozen: a dozen for the ride home and a dozen for home hehe.
author: Troy T.

description: Their known for their larger than life donuts. They're good, and you can't go wrong with the large glaze and share with a group. However the one that takes the do-nut for us was the normal size crumb donut. It was so moist, fluffy, cakey goodness. Crumbs are my go-to any chance I get at other shops, but here, I was so excited and my family was too... so much so we enjoyed it so quickly that I forgot to snap a pic of it. Will need to come back for more Crumb!!! If there's a line, it's worth the wait.
author: Andrew T.

description: This was one of the worse giant donut I've ever had here. It was burnt and hard. I ordered this giant donut to be picked up today Saturday 8/18. This gal said it was her first day at work and she made this big donut. The one I got on Thursday was nice and soft and delicious but the one I picked up today was horrible!!!
author: Katy L.

description:
The climate might change, our President might change his temperament as frequently as a cranky two year old, but Bob's doesn't change. In a world of instability and chaos, there rests an innate desire yearning within all people for some consistency and comfort. Bob's provides the world with that consistency and comfort. 

The buttermilk and old-fashioned maple glazed are out of this world. If you're used to eating dry old-fashioned/buttermilk donuts, get used to not getting used to not eating dry old-fashioned/buttermilk donuts. (Yeah, that last sentence was a stretch, but I stand by it.)
author: Enrique F.

description: Good Donuts! Cute place. Old school, making donuts out front where you can see. Regular customers were friendly. Regular coffee, nothing fancy. Awesome donut art work on the wall!
author: Kelly W.

description: The best donuts I have ever had! We came twice during our three day stay in San Fran. Highly recommend the maple cake and the ham/cheese croissants. So delicious!
author: Dana N.

description:
I enjoyed the donuts here! My family was telling me how good it was but I didn't know it could've been much different than an average donut somewhere else. 

The workers were nice as well. I asked one of the guys here if I could try a donut hole and he allowed it and even gave me extra to give to my siblings to try it. The donut holes were so good! Soft and airy donut holes which are the best kind. The crumb donuts were delicious too!
author: Monica N.

description: Great doughnuts for a good price. This place offers good food with that home town feeling. The doughnut challenge is a must.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Usually not a big donut guy, but get your ass to Bob's if you're in SF. From the puffy glazed twist to the scrumptious apple fritter to the crumble cake sugarbomb, this was a great way to start our first morning in the Bay Area. 

There was a small line when we were there at 9am on a Saturday, but we moved through quick enough. Our four donuts cost under $10, and for how damn amazing they were, I consider that a steal. 

One time at Bob's was enough to make this my go-to spot on return trips to SF. Well done, Bob. Well done.
author: Shane K.

description:
You want the giant donut. Repeat, you want the giant donut. I can vouch that it does not go stale after 4 days (and possibly makes great bread pudding even if so).
 
Without the giant donut, this family-owned spot is a great place to get a snack (and especially well-priced for fresh donuts, though be prepared to not have your top choice around during certain times). My friend loves the apple fritters but my favorite is the maple glaze. Simple but hits the spot.
author: Heidi L.

description:
The donut shop that is known for THE BIG DONUTS! Heard of their donut challenge?  If you eat one of their big donuts within 3 minutes, you get Bob's donut shirt and your name is listed in the Hall of Fame.  If you finish in 2 minutes, you get a refund for the donut ($9.95), free drink, Bob's t-shirt, and your name listed on the hall of fame.   Location is not the greatest and finding parking is difficult.  

::Donuts::
I've tried the BIG Chocolate Donut with Sprinkles; it was huge!  My daughter and I only took a couple of bites; it was very filling.  We were lucky to get a fresh one, the donut was still warm.  On another visit, I got the regular chocolate bar.  The donuts were average but it was exciting to get a BIG donut. 

::Customer Service::
Very friendly.  

::M's Notes::
-Inside seating
-Steer Parking
author: MarVy S.

description: Really amazing donuts and excellent staff. The owners are down to earth hard working people. Highly recommend!
author: Lilly K.

description:
Found this place because my friends were hungry late at night (~11pm) and there weren't many great options open. Would definitely come back!

SERVICE
Was great! Our first time here and there weren't any menus around (heard something about them being stolen?), but the cashier was really nice and patient, helping us choose the donuts we wanted.

VENUE
Nice, cozy feel. Kinda dangerous being around here this late at night because everything SMELLS TOO GOOD and it's too hard to resist buying a couple of donuts to go.

TASTE
Somehow resisted the temptation to eat this until the next day, but my apple fritter was still tasting pretty amazing! Kinda wish I had eaten it while it was still hot, but I didn't want to eat so late at night. 
I'm not a huge dessert/sweets/donuts/etc. type of person, but I would definitely eat (share) this again!

OVERALL
Had an amazing experience and would definitely come back to try different types the next time I'm in SF!
author: Crystal L.

description: I came here on the recommendation of a friend & this place is everything I wanted it to be (I hate being underwhelmed & definitely did not have that experience here). There was a short line that moved quickly at around 1030p and although there isn't a menu be assured that they have your favorites. The staff was super friendly and I ordered 3 glazed donuts, one for me, one for my kid and one for my friend.. however as soon as I got in the car & had my first bite I knew that the other 2 donuts would not make it to their destination (I'm a truly horrible person I know) as I just had to demolish them all.. I was literally annoyed that I only ordered 3 donuts! These donuts are literally the best I've ever had and as I'm writing this review I'm considering a drive into the city during morning commute just to get more (yes they're that good). So if you go, make sure you order more than 3!
author: Skipper M.

description: You can smell Bob's from a block away. Donuts are made fresh and are delicious. The original glaze or chocolate donuts are tasty. Melt in your mouth good! Don't let the appearance fool you, great donuts are made here.
author: Juan M.

description:
I'm not exaggerating when I say that Bob's fresh maple doughnut was the best doughnut I've ever had in my life and was worth the $2 or whatever that it cost. Just the right level of chew, sweetness, fragrant aroma, and warmth.... it is the omega doughnut. 

On the other hand, my fresh chocolate doughnut was great but not the transcendental experience that the maple doughnut was. Still great chew, texture, and size but the chocolate flavoring was fairly one-dimensional and almost artificial.

This place is dangerously good and makes places like Dunkin' Donuts taste like sugared cardboard.  Keep walking north to get to a good boba shop - Teaspoon to go with your doughnut.
author: Andrew H.

description: Bob definitely loses the donut war against Stan. After making the trek and waiting in line at midnight, I definitely had set my expectations higher. While these donuts are good.... almost all donuts are good. If you were in the area then sure stop by, but don't make a journey of it.
author: Noah P.

description:
Came to Bob's Donut after a longggg day trip to Sonoma only because my GPS took me through the neighborhood and I knew it would be open :P 24/7 is pretty freaking sweet sometimes (literally).

Waiting in a line as per always with here. For some reason, it goes prettyyyy slow but with only 1-2 people working I guess that's fair. Too bad it was chilly in the city and we had only packed for a hot day in sonoma! After maybe 15 ish mins, we made it to the front shivering and a bit hangry. The croissants came out justttt as we rolled up to the register so I got one without a doubt! I also got a french crueller which is hands down my favorite donut ever and I pretty much always just get that and I'll be a happy camper.

The Croissant was HUGE and suuuuper good. Delicious artery clogging goodness and it was light and airy but also densly filling... how is that possible?! It filled me up super quick, almost to the point I couldn't eat my french crueller. But I mean c'mon it's a french crueller, I will always be able to eat a good one ;) and I inhaled it within a minute. Wash it all down with a nice cold carton of whole milk and you my friend, have a YOLO late night supper that you'll probably feel bad about for weeks but also will never ever regret.

I need to get those croissants in my life. You should too!!
author: Nerissa C.

description: Bob's donuts are  more like the traditional donuts that I remember from back in the day. The glaze raised donuts have air bubbles which makes for a nice chew. The cake donuts are also quite nice. I'm sure the fresher they are, the better they will be. I live in Oakland, but when it comes to donuts and pastries, I will travel, lol.
author: Anthony W.

description:
Donuts are good, but this place has a lot of hype around it.

Love getting the eclairs and maple bars from here but wouldn't recommend getting the giant donuts just to eat. The giant donuts start to feel a bit dry and bland without the higher ratio of glaze to donut like the regular sized donuts do, so unless you're just here just to take a pic for the gram or to send to your mom, stick to the normal size donuts. Also would recommend asking them whatever's freshest because it'll still be nice and warm and extra delicious, and staff are super nice about it.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Wouldn't it be sad if you traveled all the way to San Francisco only to miss the best Donut Shop on planet earth? Yeah that would suck wouldn't it. So don't waste anymore time and head over to Bob's. I'm a regular there, half dozen crumb every weekend for the last year. The owners are the sweetest people on planet earth, and their donuts just melt in your mouth. This really is a great American donut shop. "Must-Eat" in San Francisco.

10 Stars.
author: David B.

description:
An Average Donut for an Average Name

My travels to San Francisco brought me and my girlfriend to this highly rated Donut Shop. I read the reviews and I was excited for some simple awesome donuts.

Chocolate Raised
Maple Buttermilk Bar

I do have to say the taste of the chocolate and maple flavoring was very good but I don't think it was at an outstanding level for me, like how everyone is saying. The dough was soft and it tasted good. The only thing that makes this place stand out is their gigantic donuts which by my guesstimate looked like about a dozen donuts combined. 

They are pretty good donuts. I just had better simple donuts elsewhere. 

Official Review: 3+
author: Dan B.

description:
Simple and sweet (just like Bob's Donuts).

I have never had a better donut in my life. EVER. 

Sorry, Sublime's in Atlanta, Leonard's in Honolulu, Peter Pan's in Brooklyn, Hole's in Asheville, Christy's in Houston, and Gibson's in Memphis (@Alton Brown). To those that I have never tried, I apologize, but the new king's name is Bob in San Francisco. These unassuming donuts will melt in your mouth and then your soul, because yes they can.
author: Adam C.

description:
So freaking good! They open 24/7 so I was able to get my sweet tooth fix after a dinner! 

I ended up getting a chocolate old fashioned, a cinnamon sugar doughnut, a glazed doughnut and the apple fritter. We also got a small pint of their whole milk to chase the doughnuts down with.

I really like how simple the place is. Right down to their doughnuts and milk. I haven't drank from one of these milk cartons since middle or elementary school so it was definitely a shock! But so much nostalgia!

Anyways, my favorite doughnut was probably the chocolate old fashioned followed by the glazed. 

We went around 10 PM on a Saturday night and waited in line for about 5 minutes or so before we were served. 

Awesome doughnut place!
author: Belle L.

description: The donuts are amazing. Great customer service. And great atmosphere. Line was a little long but would definitely go back.
author: Luigi P.

description:
Donuts were OK. Not sure what the hype is about. 

A homeless man literally right outside the donut shop threatened me, so I unfortunately just had a bad experience here.
author: Jenny C.

description: Hot fresh and delicious, what more can you ask for?!? Not the prettiest shop but damn it's yummy
author: Debra D.

description: Highly recommend the apple fritter. Unassuming place that stays open to serve the late night crowd. The super doughnuts looked intimidating but seemed to be a hit with others on line.
author: Michael S.

description:
Veni, vidi, vici.... I came, I saw, I conquered..... These donuts are no joke, by far, the VERY best donuts my mouth has ever laid flavor to.  I had the raised chocolate, crumb, glazed, and cake donuts with chocolate and sprinkles. EACH WAS FABULOUS!!!! 

If you're in the area and want to try out some donuts...STOP HERE! Park your car illegally, but safely, run in, and grab you some... They might just be worth the parking ticket....
author: Silvia D.

description:
Came here late on a Friday night. This place is always open so you don't have to worry about them running out of donuts. I tried three different types on my visit:

Raspberry jelly donut with chocolate - looked great. jelly had a strong flavor but the donut lacked a firm texture so I was quite disappointed with this one

Crumb donut - this was more of a dense cake-like donut and definitely enjoyed it more than the jelly donut. Would be great with coffee or milk

Glazed donut - I was going to give 4 stars but the glazed donut bumped it up to 5! Super delicious, came out warm and had a nice doughy yet fluffy consistency to it. Very well made donut, almost like a bigger KrispyKreme glaze donut!

Service was quick, only waited in line for 5 mins. Prices are on the more moderate side. Would have loved to try the apple fritter but it was $3. Overall, this place is one of the more popular donut spots in the city for good reason. High quality donuts and open all day!
author: Brian G.

description: I came here with fairly high expectations as I was strongly recommended this by a friend who is local to the area and because of the good ole Yelp community. Unfortunately, I wasn't really a fan. For perspective, I'm originally from NY/NJ area ie the best place ever for doughnuts/bagels/coffee. I decided to stick with the basics and try out the chocolate frosted donut, apple fritter, and cake doughnut. They were all solid donuts but I'm not sure what the hype is all about. Maybe I chose the wrong type of donut or just had too high of expectations. The hype may be more so related to the fact that this place is 24 hours. It wasn't a terrible experience--the place was small but had a good amount of seating. The woman behind the counter was also a sweetheart. There is one thing I cannot forgive though--the coffee is conveniently self-serve but inconveniently terrible.
author: Maysa M.

description:
The best donut shop ever!!! I'm your average person, I don't eat donuts every day but I indulge in them every once in a while. And this place is worth your time. I know there's usually a line out the door for this place but the line goes by pretty quickly and believe me when I say it's worth the wait! Disclaimer: I came here at 3 AM after going out and had the late night drunchies. BEST DECISION EVER. It was only a 10 minute wait in line and the donuts were just as fluffy then if you were to get them in the morning or during the day! We ended up getting a whole dozen and taking them home that night! They were gone by morning LOL

My boyfriend has also picked up donuts while in the city and brought them home to us (we live about 30 minutes away from the city) and they were still fresh in the afternoon. I love a good traditional glazed doughnut, and this is the place to get one. They're so fluffy and LITERALLY melt in your mouth. What a great place, you definitely need to stop by if you're in the area, or even if you're not!
author: Alejandra A.

description:
The Yum: Donuts are nice and fluffy. They sell HUGE donuts. Nice variety of the classics. Bobs donut challenge!

The Yuck: Parking can get gruesome but if you have a friend or someone in car just drop them off and tell them to grab it haha.

I've been here 5 times already and 3 of those times I came just for the big donuts that they offer.  I've tried their glazed, maple, cinnamon, cake crumb, and their apple fritter. My all time favorite is their maple donut but their other donuts are just as great. Like what can go wrong with donuts haha. What makes bobs donuts special is that their donuts have this unique fluffy and airy texture when you bite into it so its a must go to place if youre a die hard donut fan. The huge donuts they offer are ~$10 and can also easily fill 5-6 ppl or 2-3 very hungry ppl. If you're down, they have a challenge where if you can finish the donut in under 3 min you can get the delicious donut for free, tshirt and on the hall of fame. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Eric L.

description:
Disclaimer: I'm not a donut fan. 

It's funny. Friday morning, my boss brought in a two boxes of these Bob's babies. And then, another colleague brought in a box of Krispy Kremes. 

BUT, I wasn't impressed by Bob's Donuts. Krispy Kremes was better. I tried the raved cinnamon one and glazed one from Bob's. Meh. If I'm going to be consuming all these calories, I might as well consume butter. Hence, the Krispy Kremes, hands down.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Had a crumble and chocolate old fashioned donut, both were good. Pretty reasonable pricing around $1.25 each. If you want the big donut get there early cause it was sold out for us by 7pm on a Saturday.

The environment is more of a pit-stop. Not too much seating and a little dirty.
author: Monica G.

description: 24 hours, they take cash OR card, and the donuts are the fluffiest, freshest, most delectable freaking donuts I've ever had in my life. Even if you're just visiting the city doing touristy stuff, I'd highly recommend making the detour to Nob Hill for Bob's.
author: David G.

description: Great job Bob. After eating dinner we swung by Bobs on National Donut day around 7pm. The girl who packed our donuts obviously hates her life. I mean look at these two donuts smooshed together. Dang. How hard is it to put a couple donuts in a paper bag? Don't get me wrong, the donuts are great, but damn.
author: Marcus S.

description: Wow.  We arrived at 10:00 am.  No line and these were truly the best donuts I have ever had.  Worth the bus and cable car ride.  A must do while visiting san Francisco.
author: Linda S.

description:
The 5 stars are solely for an apple fritter fresh out of the fryer. Oh. my. god. DIVINE. It's the best thing $1.95 can buy. If they don't have fritters, ask for what's hot (the best time to come is later in the evening if you want fresh donuts). The old-fashioned and crumb raised donuts are stellar.  

The best thing about Bob's is that it's open 24 hours -- because you never know when that donut craving will hit. Whenever I'm in the city, I always find a way to stop here.
author: Elyse W.

description:
This place is by far my favorite donut place in San Francisco. I first came here after reading a Yahoo (yes, people used Yahoo to read things is back in the day) about it being the best donut place in America. Yes, in all of America. 

The donuts are always freah and have an amazing fluffyness to them. They are almost beinget like. They even have a giant donut that's the size if a cake. 

They also serve coffee and milk. The place is a little on the small size, hut the donuts are meant to be consumed as you walk down Polk street.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
I finally made my way to Bob's Donut after hearing my boyfriend raving about it. They have a wide variety of donuts and the have HUGE donuts! There is a donut challenge, where if you eat the big donut in 2 minutes you get your money back and 3 minutes and you'll get a t-shirt and a picture of yourself on the wall. Personally, I cannot do it, but my boyfriend will someday, I will update here of how he did.

Unfortunately, I didn't get to try their actual donuts here, only their donut holes since I was going to be eating the House of Prime Rib later. So this was a pre game before my dinner :D The donut holes were quite delicious and for 6 of them it's only $1! SO CHEAP! They make fresh batches quite often, and I like how they are not very sweet and crispy. I will definitely be coming back to try their actual donuts!
author: Natalie L.

description:
Visiting from Chicago and my brother in law brought us here. Chicago is very big in donuts and this place is as good as any in Chicago! 
We got the chocolate eclairs and a regular sprinkle donut to try. I know, we're basic people lol
The chocolate eclairs were probably the best I've had. The chocolate was not overtly sweet and the dough was soft and perfect. 
The sprinkle donut was good. Not as good as the eclairs, so I wouldn't rave about it. 
There was a line out the door, so there was a wait, but I think it's worth the wait. It was great seeing that a lot of the people in line with us were locals and not just tourists!
author: Aakash S.

description:
I cannot even begin to tell you how awesomely fabulous this place is!!!  Found this place on a stroll through the city by chance... noticed the line coming out the door and said alrighty let's give them a shake.  EVERY time we come to the city now we stop here!

The donuts are amazing!
The coffee is the best anywhere.
The service is always with a smile!
The prices are great.

They have a really neat atmosphere and if you need something to do you can try their donut eating challenge!  I have seen a few try, but never complete.

Apple Fritters are the way to go!

Make the stop, wait in the line, you deserve it!
author: Deanna L.

description: My husband and I searched this place out on the recommendation from another tourist we ran into while visiting San Francisco. Boy were we thankful as this turned out to be one of our hands down favorite places during our visit. The donuts are amazing. You must try the jelly and/or cream filled. So sad we don't live here so we can come back. My husband still mentions this from time to time wistfully stating, "Remember those donuts from San Francisco. God they were amazing!" Give it a try, you won't be sorry.
author: Audra E.

description:
Ahhh!!! These donuts are pretty amazing. I was craving some sweets Saturday afternoon so my boyfriend suggested Bob's. This place really knocks it out of the park in terms of donuts.

I had the apply fritter without knowing that they were well known but still -- really really loved it. It was huge and chewy. It wasn't sickeningly sweet either. I also got this cinnamon/apple cake slice - I don't remember the exact name, but it was also incredibly good. It was quite sweet and the thickness of the slide made it so that I could only have a few bites at a single sitting. But I couldn't stop eating this cake slice throughout the course of 2 days.

Came here at around 2 PM and there was no line. This made our visit even better because we had somewhere to sit. The shop itself doesn't seem so remarkable from either the inside or the outside, but I'm now a believer of the fact that this unremarkable setting creates the most remarkable things.
author: Jenny W.

description: Their cinco de mayo specials were odd...but their maple and crumb donuts were soooooo delicious! My daughter and I came on a Saturday afternoon and were pleased to find parking and to find no line out the door!
author: Evelyn N.

description: Apparently this place is so poppin' that if you show up at10:30 am on a Thursday, you're late.
