It was down the street from my hotel so I decided to pop in before we started our day, and while MOST of their donuts were gone, the apple fritters, which are my favorite anyway, just came out of the fryer. I got two of those, a jelly donut, and some coffee. The jelly donut wasn't anything special, but the apple fritter was one of the most insane things i've ever had. I hate to say it, but it topped the apple fritter's from my favorite home town donut shop in Boston, which is VERY HARD TO DO. Wow, wow, wow. I have no words to describe this thing other than wow. You'll just have to try it for yourself.
author: Taya A.

description:
Solid crumb donut, and the giant crumb donut cake is worthy as a celebratory birthday, anniversary, or just because cake. Call in advance to place your order. 

Another star item was an apple pie like bread pudding (unsure of the name) displayed in the window. 

I look forward to returning to try the apple fritter.
author: Thao L.

description: Great donuts!  We stopped by and tried some fresh out of fryer - very good.  Service is good.  Place is simple but clean.  Definitely worth a stop if you are in the area.  Kid friendly as well (we had a pile of kids with us and they loved it).  Of course what donut place is not kid friendly? :)
author: Aman B.

description: I was in charge of picking up donuts for a friends birthday so naturally I choose Bob's. I arrived around 8am and there was already a line out the door, but it goes quickly. A friendly lady greets you at the counter and assembles your order - note for first timers, it's best to have a good idea of what you want/like going in or you're going to get an assortment which might not include what you personally love. If I'm going to eat a donut, it's going to be an old fashioned but for the rest of the guests, I got apple fritters, cake crumb donuts, and regular glazed. Also a pro tip: if they have a donut that just came out of the fryer, ask for it!!! Hot and fresh is the best part about this place and if you get a dozen fresh from the fryer, you won't regret it. Price point will put you right under $20 for a dozen, so roughly $1.50 a donut but more for the bigger ones like the apple fritters. Overall, busy busy place but the selection is fantastic (if you get there early enough as they tend to run out of the popular flavors early on). From what I've heard, going late late at night, say 3am, is prime baking time but for some of us that is just a bit past our bedtime!
author: Kara N.

description: I knew about this place from their famous giant donuts but we walked past this place one night, late, around 10 pm and I didn't see any in the window. But we wanted to pick up breakfast for the next day so we grabbed a few plain glazed donuts. I wish I had tried them fresh. But they tasted pretty good the next morning. Fluffy and not too sugary. And I'll have to go back for the giant donuts soon.
author: Alison W.

description:
If donuts are on your mind, day and night, you will go nuts over these. 
Bob's is open 24/7 and is probably making some donuts at this very moment. 

In my opinion, the best time to visit Bob's is around 2am, after Last Call, right before you go to bed. 
The later the better. 
And yes, there will be a long line, even at that hour but once you see the donut artist pouring them into the fryer, flipping them over with drumsticks, and coating them with thick sugary frosting, you will have no doubt in your mind that this is where you should be. 
Let your eyes linger on each of the trays that are being brought out and placed at the window and let yourself fantasize about eating a giant donut all by yourself. 

Once you're inside the shop, the aroma of freshly fried donuts will envelop you into a dreamlike state. Ask the cashier for whatever's hot. Get ready for blissful donut heaven. 

The End

Donut Terminology 

Chocolate, maple, & glazed available as:
Raised 
Old Fashioned
French 
Buttermilk
Cake

Crumb
Powdered
Apple Fritter
Giant Donut
Filled Donuts: Custard & Jelly

BYOC if you're a coffee snob and do NOT order anything that isn't a donut. Thankfully, they take Credit cards but they Don't have a bathroom. 

If you have time to sit at the bar, you'll probably get to watch a cool cult classic like Blade Runner, Taxi Driver, or Terminator on the flat screen. Good times.
author: Mitzi G.

description: There's a reason people line up down the street for these donuts.  The reason is "fresh".  The best time to enjoy donuts is when they are freshly made and Bob's makes sure they are the freshest.  I like to go in the evenings when the donuts are still warm and soft.  No matter what your diet is, come by and give it a try!
author: Paul S.

description: Little place with big donuts. I caught a whiff of apple and had to have an apple fritter. Huge and delicious. The old-fashioned donut also was great.  The person behind the counter was extremely nice and deserving of the trip alone, you might as well get a donut too though!
author: Robbie P.

description:
Get your donut for the day! :) 
I got the jumbo maple donut. It was so freaking delicious. It was so gigantic that it fit in a cake box!
My sister and I ate it for lunch and dinner.
author: Hannah L.

description: Open 24 hours a day 7 days a week for when you get hungry and thirsty at 2:30am after obsessively compulsively cleaning your floor by hand with a towel for 4 hours. Ahem... I mean the universal "you" as in when one gets hungry... whatever. This place is awesome, the donuts are awesome and the best flavor is the one they just took out of the oven. Which in my case last night was an unfilled maple glaze bar. But I also got the chocolate cake donut and the crumble cake donut. And an apple fritter and a plain glazed...with milk and apple cider. Don't worry I didn't eat it all...at least not all at once. Don't skip the cold apple juice. It surprisingly tastes great with the maple donut for a fall themed snack!
author: Bunny C.

description: Adequate Chocolate glazed donut and the soft plain croissant are not getting any stars. Everything that may have been good about this place is overshadowed by the fact that the crumb donut was doughy and undercooked, the ham and cheese croissant was tiny, burnt and just hard and gross and the guy working the register was fucking rude. I don't care if you work in a small shop with a line out the door, it's not that hard to be basically pleasant.
author: Eric D.

description:
Pretty disappointed by all the hype for this donut shop. My friend and I came on a Tuesday around 3 pm, and there was no line and maybe one other person at their sit-down tables. We came after hearing so many people talk about "the challenge," which is basically eating a large donut (worth $12) in 3 minutes or less. But after arriving at the shop, we decided to just get the regular donuts because we had just finished having lunch and didn't have much space left in our stomachs.

I liked how they had a variety of options besides just donuts. When we went they had cinnamon buns and chocolate croissants! Chocolate croissants?! Yup. I've been on the look out for the best chocolate croissants in the NorCal area, and was pretty excited to try it out. My friend on the other hand got a buttermilk donut. We also got a cake crumble to-go for another friend. 

I think part of my disappointment with this place was when we were paying for our donuts and we asked the owner to see how big the big donut was (out of curiosity and to gage how much space we need in our stomachs for next time). She turned around to show it to us, and then proceeded to tell us that she didn't think we could do it because she hadn't seen any girl finish "the big donut" before. Yikes! I just looked on their website and see girl names, so I don't really know what she was talking about. 

My chocolate croissant was very mediocre. The only good thing about it was it had chocolate filling throughout the croissant, unlike many others that just have some parts filled. I tried a bit of my friend's buttermilk donut and thought it tasted okay. It definitely had a distinct taste because of the buttermilk. I think the donuts would have tasted better when fresh, or at least slightly heated up. We decided to heat it up using the microwave provided by the front of the shop. But I soon realized that after heating it up my croissant got flat instead of the crispy and flaky I wanted (my fault).

Despite the change in texture of my croissant, I was able to finish it and still thinks it tasted pretty good. But it's nothing to write home to mother about. My friend, on the other hand, was not able to finish her buttermilk donut (and this is coming from a girl who LOVES donuts). The cake crumble that we got to-go was also not that great and also went un-finished. My friend thinks its because it lost a certain air of freshness to it.

All in all, I was disappointed by this place, especially because there are so many good reviews and people talking about this place. To top it all off, I was very turned off by the half-gallon of half-&-half milk for the coffee just sitting out on the counter for who knows how long. Probably won't be coming back any time soon, but I really do want to give this place another shot (perhaps sometime in the far future).
author: Tammy C.

description:
GIANT DONUT?! YES PLEASE! I'll keep this review short and sweet since I think you must try it to truly understand. But what I will say is this. It took me not one, not two, but three round trips in uber( about $48) plus the cost of the donut ($12) for a grand total of $60( yay I can do basic math) and I'm not even mad, loved every single bite of the amazing ness that was my giant chocolate covered sprinkle donut!

The workers there are also all super nice. They let me preorder a donut since they were all out when I went at the beginning of the day. I guess they only make those donuts a few times a day and about four donuts at once. 

If you love donuts. Actually no if you are a person you need to try this place NOW.

P.s shout out to the guy behind the counter. He was running around putting in work making donuts, ringing people up, everything. You go dude!
author: Maricela V.

description:
2,200+ reviews at 4.5 stars?! Mind boggling! The Yelp stars and number of reviews led me to this donut shop after finding out my first pick, Mr Holmes Bakehouse, was still closed at 6:45am. "Sure, why not. Let's check out Bob's since they're up the street." If you're thinking the same thing, DON'T DO IT!

The cool thing about this donut shop is that it's Open 24hours. So I get it. When you're hungover, hangry, and stuck in this part of the city, Bob's donuts are the shiz. But when you're sober and bright-eyed to take on the day in the big city, I'd recommend going in with a blindfold on if you're that desperate for a donut and can't drive elsewhere.

The donuts were fresh and priced right. But, I don't think these reasons alone would bring me back. The cooking area was filthy, the long-haired donut maker should've been wearing a hair net, and we were invisible to the cashier as we stood directly in front of her while she continued to talk to someone who was already seated and with a donut in hand. And get this, she completely stuffed half a dozen donuts into a small brown bag when there were pink donut boxes in small and large sizes stacked everywhere. She smashed all of our donuts into the bag! Sloppy. That's why I don't have a photo of the donuts!! My +1 and I ate two donuts and chucked the rest. End of story.

In hindsight, I should have walked out the door soon after the red flags for service and cleanliness were waving for being terrible. My bad.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Just arrived on a red eye from Honolulu and the plus 1 wants to venture into the city by the bay.......hello it's 5 fricken o'clock! Nothing is open but the local coffee shops and maybe some donut shops. 

Fast forward this event......so the goal was to find the cruffin store in Nob Hill. We found it. Just our luck it was still closed. We wanted some food and coffee so we went up the street around the corner and BAM....Yelp led us to Bob's Donuts. 4.5 stars and thousands of reviews. Ok so this place is legit right? Sorry not the case here. Just from the beginning the lady behind the counter never acknowledged my presence and mind you I was standing directly in front of her staring at her as she babbled to a seated customer. Ok maybe they are good friends, but damn say something! Like, yo Island boi, I'll be with you in a few. Acknowledge I'm there. Anyway, that was just the first of the negatives I noticed. 

So the donut fryers were busy, as it should be because heck it's a donut shop and it's early in the morning. People want that sweet fried pastry all glazed up or filled. What I noticed is a dirty, unorganized prep area. The food service saying of "clean as you go" did not apply here. Even the donut maker was grubby. The shop itself was littered with trash under the tables and chairs. Nothing was wiped down. 

The donuts themselves weren't even presented well. Glaze on them look like a bunch of kids put them together. We ordered about a half dozen mixed donuts and was baffled when the lady stuffed all 6 donuts in a small bag. Really?!?! Ahhh where's the presentation? Donuts that I ate were ok. I've had much better. 

So my recommendation to anyone looking at the 4.4 stars this shop has on yelp.......IT's A FACADE!! Turnaround and go elsewhere. Save your money!!

Sorry Bob's Donut House, you're an epic FAIL! Count me out in the next visit. Fix your issues, then may maybe I may return to re-evaluate your shop and service.

Russ P
author: Russ P.

description: Rated one of the best in the country. Found this place while on vacation and the kids researched must visit places while looking for donuts. Now this is a go-to stop when in town. Better than Voodoo Donuts unless you absolutely have a dire need for Cap'n Crunch cereal or Fruit Loops on your donuts. Bob's just does the basics extremely well. Extremely well. Open 24x7 the mornings & evenings/nights are the optimal times for a larger, fresh selection to choose from. Bob's is up on Nob Hill. Check em out. Won't disappoint.
author: Jim M.

description:
All the items here, whether the donuts, fritters, or other baked goods, are seriously good, and seriously filling.

For example, the donuts are old-school cake-style treats that are quite fresh - the polar opposite of the empty calories you get from unfulfilling Krispy Kreme fare. In fact, the staffer here made a point of noting which items were fresh out of the oven and still warm, and which items weren't. 

Gosh, for donuts it doesn't get any better than this, and there's a special bonus in that Bob's is open 24/7. Perfect for those late-night buzzed / hangry post-bar cravings, or for any time of day.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Dear Bob,

Thank you SO MUCH for making these donuts. I can die in peace now knowing that the best donut I've ever had is in SF. So fluffy, fresh, and delicious. I love you. Please make more donuts. 

Sincerely, 
Donut Queen
author: Melissa C.

description:
Is there such a thing as a bad donut? I don't sure think so. So what makes a place great and a place that is just pretty good? I have no idea. 

That being said, I like Bob's donuts. It has had a cult following for years and I'm glad to see businesses like this still thriving in San Francisco. Hopefully they own the building so it will remain the same for future generations of San Franciscans :) 

I ordered a raised glazed crumb donut post Swan Oyster Depot and boy did it hit the spot. Soft, sugary and light. Perfection. 

Highly recommend.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
You aren't hip, cool, hot, slam, juice, happening, Scooby-Doo, in, or any other adjective of merit if you don't know about Bob's Donuts. Get extra stars if you know what time the fresh chocolate cruelers come out of the pot. You've got to eat them within 10 minutes while they're still super fresh. Usually come out about 11:15pm & they also do em in maple and vanilla. Peeps in the know line up down Polk Street waiting for their favorite donut to come up at all hours because they are open 24/7.

Every once in a while they have a great deal on the internet. I don't remember where, maybe Groupon. $10 for a dozen donuts and a free Bob's Donuts T-shirt. You have to pick em up at the store.

Kind of an amazing place at 3:00am
author: Neil W.

description: I have tried many apple fritters and donut joints because they are my love language and carbs are my weakness. You could say I'm a fried dough connoisseur of sorts!! So, when I say I had the BEST apple fritter and crumble donut I have every tasted in my sweet 25 years of life, I mean it with every sugary, powdery inch of my stomach. Truthfully, I tell you, if you are near or within a days trip, you MUST go to Bob's donuts and pick these two items up along with all the others because I'm sure they're amazing!!! Then, come to LA and drop one off to me because I am having withdrawals. You'll start salivating at the window display, which is so precious and exactly what you want to see off the street in San Francisco. It is also well kept and clean! So, feel free to sit and enjoy because you know delayed gratification sucks, or hop in an uber and offer the driver one of your donut holes because you still shouldn't wait to eat it and it's rude to not share!
author: Avery H.

description:
24/7 donuts, enough said. Seriously, where else can you get a fresh warm donut after some late night drinking on Polk street? Donuts are fluffy, pillowy sugary goodness.

Best donuts: Maple glazed, Glazed crumb donut and Apple fritter(ok, technically not a donut but delicious)

I'm intrigued by the giant donuts but don't think the glaze to dough ratio would be to my liking.

Long line at night, but it's worth it!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Not going to lie I came here after a night of drinking and was drunk beyond belief. Let me tell you the first bite was orgasmic.

Coming from Colorado eating donuts as drunk food is a dream come true! Especially when they're fresh and melt in your mouth. As your typical fat drunky I order 2 donuts and their apple pandowdy (which is huge). Their original glazed donuts must have just come out of the fryer or something because it was so moist it essentially dissolved as soon as it hit your lips. The apple fritter was pack full of flavor and had an insane amount of apples in it. Finally the apple pandowdy (essentially bread pudding with apples) was monstrous.

My only complaint was the apple pandowdy seemed to be somewhat overcooked and was dry however I saved the majority of it for the morning and with coffee it tasted amazingly hungover

Awesome spot if you're craving freshly made donuts, even better if you had a few drinks.
author: Ryan N.

description:
Ever since my coworker brought in some donuts from Bob's donuts a couple months ago, I've been kind of obsessed with their old fashioned donuts. One night after grabbing dinner in the TL, my friends and I were craving dessert and decided to drop by Bob's for some donuts.

There was no line when we arrived around Sunday at 10 pm, but there was a small line by the time we left 20 minutes later. 

Being the indecisive people we are, we perused their selection for a couple minutes before deciding on our orders. We also couldn't help but admire their GIANT donut on display...it was bigger than my head! Definitely want to get that for a friend's birthday or a party at some point.

I got two old fashioned donuts and an apple fritter, for a total of $7. My second old fashioned donuts was every bit as delicious as the first one I had in the office. What I love about it is that the glazed part outside is kind of hard (in a nice way) but the inside has a soft texture, so when you take a bite of the donut, you get that nice contrast between the harder outside versus the chewy inside and it is SO good!!!

I had the apple fritter the next day for breakfast. It was a solid apple fritter but nothing that blew me away. The old fashioned's where it's at here :D

The shop is long and narrow. There are some tables off to the side along with a handful of bar seats. Because it was pretty late, it wasn't crowded at all and we were able to snag a table pretty easily.

I wish I was in this area more often; I'd definitely stop by every time!
author: Dianna H.

description: Good donuts. Went at 11 ish and most donuts were gone. Super disappointed but what we got was good. We really wanted the big ones that they're known for!! It was a sad day lol.
author: Ashley A.

description: Great donuts but selection is very few and the service was very terrible. They should just hire more workers
author: Felicia J.

description:
I deeply love Bob's Donuts. It is a beautiful place, a temple. I lost my way once, but I found myself again, and when I did I was sitting at a table at Bob's, custard bar in hand, coffee sitting before me. I had an open notebook, I was looking for something I could not find and still have not. On the television was playing some sort of film that was deeply inappropriate for public exhibition, some kind of horror, but it was an ungodly hour that seemed to exist outside the twenty-four of normal time, and so it was natural to the handful of us marooned in that donuty limbo that the normal rules would not apply. It was unclear if they would ever apply again.

Bob's Donuts is no obvious secret, belied by numberless reviews and references, that line that stretches long on weekend nights. But it whispers to that secret longing, that fire of desire contained in your heart - a desire that may be light and noble, but is just as likely to be dark, something to make of you a marooned soul girded by an impassable sea of custard and crumb.

To find oneself in such a stranded place is an obscure kind of pleasure, one that is hard to convey to one's self, let alone to another soul with this poor tool we call language.

The apple fritters are really good.
author: Greg P.

description: Absolutely the best no frills doughnuts. Always fresh, always available and absolutely amazing. I am so happy I live close to this place.
author: Lovely L.

description:
Usually would give these guys top rating. Last night one of their employees was extremely rude. Probably isolated incident but had to be addressed. Got to front of line, no line last night for some reason, probably bc of this guy's terrible attitude...And before my girl and I could even decide or think about it he kept rushing us saying sarcastically, "what kind of glazed do you want" what kind of glazed do you want, what kind of glazed do you want. 

I told him to show a little patience next time and he pushed back. Not okay when people like ourselves came from across city for these great donuts to meet such a poor attitude.
author: Michael M.

description: Classic old-fashioned glazed donut was exactly as good as I hoped it would be!
author: Ryan K.

description:
Sweet baby Jesus. This place is damn good. It's all the things. First, the donuts themselves are served fresh... like so fresh they are still making them when you walk in the door. Second, the atmosphere here is whatever the opposite word for pretentious is. You'll see a homeless dude lined up for his fresh donut right behind some newfound techie millionaire on his overpriced iPhone. Third, the place never closes. Like literally... if there's a zombie apocalypse they aren't closing. 

Sure, they don't have milk on tap or gimmicks. But fat people are welcome here 24/7 and that's something I can appreciate.
author: Adam M.

description: Best donuts and most unique donuts I've ever tasted! Oh my gosh. Amazing. Make sure to try the crumb donut. Best thing ever! And the buttermilk donut is unlike anything I've ever tasted. Best donut shop ever.
author: Chelsy D.

description:
Definitely Bob's Donut is the BEST PLACE I ever try until today. You have to try these donuts once in your life. We need a Bob's Donut in Montreal, it'll be a succes. Not very expensive and the donuts are so taste. The personnal are very friendly and it explain why this is a really popular place. 

Ne vous fier par à la décoration de cette pâtisserie, cela ne reflète pas la qualité de leurs donuts. Le personnel est super sympathique avec tous leurs clients et il y a toujours une file d'attente. Mon amie et moi avons essayé le donut qui est gros comme une tête et le coût n'était pas cher quand on le partage. J'y retournerai sans faute si jamais je reviens à San Francisco.
author: Catherine L.

description:
This place was straight fire! After going on a dinner cruise, I was longing for something sweet. I did a little yelp searching and came across this establishment.

When we pulled up, I noticed that the line was about 20 people deep at around midnight. That was the point at which I knew I probably picked a gem. 

I went with the Apple fritter and a glazed. They were both super on point. The glazed was still warm. When I was in line, I could see the donuts in the fryer. This is definitely a spot that I would visit again if I were back in the bay area. You should definitely check it out!
author: Colin C.

description: The crumb raised donut is amazing! Best I've ever had. But avoid the donut bread pudding thing - way too heavy. I guess if you like cake donuts you would like it...
author: J D.

description: Came here on a late Friday night and there was a long line and wait. The store itself was pretty small. We probably waited about 30 minutes? We ordered their famous crumb donuts, some maple ones, a chocolate bar, and some ham and cheese croissants. We didn't get to try everything until the next morning but everything was pretty good! This place lives up to its hype and def worth the wait. I'd come back for their crumb donuts and ham and cheese croissants. This place is 24 hours so you should def check it out whenever you have the time!
author: Alexa-Ferl S.

description: Omg the best in San Francisco! Our late night family tradition when in San Francisco. The giant donut is BOMB.... Definitely worth a visit!
author: Joel C.

description:
Tried the 3 minute challenge, failed miserably. I got about halfway though. 

Read the reviews beforehand so I knew to call in advance to make sure there was a donut waiting for me if I wanted my choice. I bought the crumb (rookie mistake) because I had never had one before and wanted to try it. I should've got the glaze.

Take smaller quicker bites, drink smaller gulps of water, come starving.

Good donut.
author: William B.

description:
I absolutely love the donuts here... they are fresh and moist, soft and fluffy, heaven on earth. 

My favorite donut had to be the chocolate bar filled with custard. The custard is not overly sweet. The donut bar itself is fresh, soft, and moist. And the chocolate glazed on top is just enough.

They have a super giant donut that's really cool. It would make a great replacement for a birthday cake! And the best part is that they are open 24/7! 

I'd recommend avoiding late nights as the lines can be long... but still worth the wait when you have to have a donut :-)
author: Mee V.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 11am. Parked in the 30min spot across the street (in front of the gym). Wait time was ~5mins.

Wow! This is one big donut. Warm and buttery and soft and yeasty and deliciousness. It took my husband and I two days to finish this diabetic-dream-of-a-cake. I will never go anywhere else for donuts again.
author: Ana V.

description: This is by far the best doughnut spot I've been to. What makes this spot so good is how unpretentious yet delicious it is. Doughnuts are consistently fresh, fluffy, melt in your mouth. Not that dense dry taste of places like voodoo, or overly sweet like some of the "boutique" places. My faves are the crumb and the maple, but you honestly can't go wrong with any pick.
author: Chelsea T.

description: This place is nuts. The giant donut is about the same size as a huge, ravaged, ran thru vagina... and that's not a bad thing for donuts. Enjoy!
author: Steven L.

description: Has this place sold or  Did just some  donut recipes change?    I remember some  donuts being heartier but bobs is still #1 for a late night sucrose fix!
author: mark t.

description: You know what the best part of eating in an average sushi joint? Walking to Bob's Donuts after!  Seriously, they're open 24/7 and their donuts remain yummy especially late at night. Get the "bigger than your face" glazed donut!  You'll be glad you had it.
author: Jay F.

description: Out of this world doughnuts. I bought doughnuts to last a week and ended up eating them in one sitting. No regrets.
author: Nolan S.

description: I felt a little silly going into the donut store a block away and not getting a donut.  I almost regretted not doing so, until I saw the window display at Bob's.  Donuts as big as your HEAD!  Amazing.  I did not have a big gigantic one, for the record.  Just a regular sized donut.  It was fresh, flavorful, and awesome.  This spot is opened 24 hours.  I will happily come back here next time in in San Fran.
author: Laurie V.

description:
Let me put you up on Bobs donuts 
Controller of the warm deep fryer that charms cobras 
Mostly it was aggravated ulcers over goat's legs
Will they go for maple, custard, buttermilk or wolfsbane?
Hm, late after your Cinderella pulsate and crash I was rotating casts 
Picture if you will a witching hour on a weak night in the trenches 
Where paranoia dead-ends in a bright fluorescent heaven
With sprinkles, I know right yum 
Whether tummy ache or fever
Keep the funnel cake, I'm honey glaze in vitro
author: John O.

description:
Best donuts in the city!  Affordable & delicious.  

The storefront is old school - nothing fancy, but the staff is great, and there are always fresh & delicious doughnuts. 

So many great options - the apple fritters, old fashioned, glazed... all SO good.
author: Sarah Louise H.

description:
As I walk in somebody is taking the monster donut challenge. Eat that beast in 3 minutes and its free. We are all rooting for the guy and its as exciting as watching a good game. The place is a bit smoke filled but for a moment the whole place has eyes on this guy.

Hes a bit portly and looks like an eater. I have high hopes in the guy with the exception I see a milk box next to him - no doubt milk is too filling - if he wants to be successful he will need water... and probably a lot of it.

Its Monday late night and I take a look at the offerings. Buttermilk with raspberry and the bread pudding catch my eye. The donut is great as usual. Fresh as there is high turnover here. The lady working there seems to be constantly making more and more. She expertly flips each donut in the fryer with large than life chop sticks as I'm there.

The bread pudding was just as mediocre as it could have been. A large portion but the straight-from-the-can taste of the apples on top wrecked it. I don't think apples belong in a bread pudding from the getgo.

Sadly the young man wasn't able to finish the monster donut. I think he just needs to ditch his milk box and try again.
author: Stefan T.

description: This place is amazing especially when you have a sweet tooth at 9pmthey are open 24 hours and the doughnuts are the best I have ever had the make them so often that your garentee a fresh one. The huge display doughnuts are just as good when I went to buy one I exspected my wallet to cry but it was only 12$ I was dumbfounded . It was cooked perfectly. I recommend this to anyone who is visiting go here go big and enjoy this place it's the best doughnut shop every! Staff is awesome everyone feels welcome!
author: Raven T.

description:
This place is loads of awesome because 
24/7
late night movies 
all sorts of walks of life up in this bish 
blocks away from where I work and..
who doesn't like donuts? 
exactly.
author: Hannah M.

description:
When your sweet tooth is talking the only way to shut it up is to stuff a big ole donut in your pie hole. My baked good of choice is the maple bar- the librarian of donuts. 
The only version of this classic that Bob's had available that day was filled with custard. Wow,?that was the upgrade I never knew I wanted. Made my dewy decibel day!

Clean old school donut shop with friendly staff.
author: Carole B.

description:
Bob's Donut is a definite tourist stop...but so much more since the locals love it just as much, and make sure they engage visitors as much as possible.
They don't have standard pricing for a dozen donuts but their prices certainly not outrageous!
The shop is small and quaint; the donuts were delicious and amazingly fresh!

And my kids said they were still soft 2 days later when they finished them off after our return home!
We will DEFINITELY be returning the next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Nikki C.

description: My Favorite 24hr donut shop in SF. Apple fritters are huge and the best. I actually came late last night after going out but the line was super long. I couldn't get the craving out of my head and ended up back today to get some. Still a line but a more manageable wait. Definitely worth coming back to satisfy my sweet cravings!!!
author: Diana N.

description:
Mrs. Bob helped me out again today...she was surprisingly pleasant and smiley... then we were talking and she said she almost died from being anemic and was in the hospital earlier this year. Probably changed her perspective in life. I like this Mrs. Bob better. 4 stars. 

Prices went up though.
author: kim w.

description:
Is it a mirage? Am I finally seeing Bob's Donuts, where the brigade of gargantuan donuts is casting ominous shadows on the sunny sidewalk outside?  Yes!  Yes, it is!  I've finally arrived to conquer and divide these donut mongerers, specifically the big cahona - the one they call the doomsday donut (just kidding, no one calls it that, but me).  

Why do I dub it thee doomsday donut?  Well, its quite simple actually.  You are doomed to either the walk of shame by failing to eat the entire donut in the 3-minute challenge, or you are doomed to have a date with the toilet after ingesting the entire donut in an unnatural 3 minutes time.  Like I said, either way you are kind of SOL.  So all this talk about a 3 minute challenge - what is it, right?  Here's the dealio: if you love, love, love donuts you at least owe it to yourself to put your love to test in Bob's Giant Donut Challenge.  If you think you may be able to eat a 3-lb donut in 3 minutes or less, then step right on up.  To participate in this challenge, you must first make a reservation (yes, an actual donut reservation) where you list what time you'll be in to complete the challenge, and what type of yeast donut you want.  Do you want chocolate icing?  Do you want sprinkles?  Once you're donut is specially made, you have 2 minutes to eat the entire donut if you want a refund (it's a $10 donut, y'all), a free Bob's Donut t-shirt and your name on the wall fame.  Eat it in 3 minutes and you get everything except the refund.

Okay, with the logistics out of the way - I was crazy enough to try (TRY, being the operative word) and compete in this challenge.  Because I'm all about sprinkles, I asked for chocolate icing and sprinkles on my donut...but looking back now - that wasn't the wisest choice.  If you are going to do this thing, make the donut as plain as possible...every little sprinkle counts.  Without recounting my entire failure, I'll just say that I did not complete the challenge.  I, the self-pronounced donut queen, did not pass the test...I'm a failure to donuts everywhere.  Despite this atrocity, I loved the dense donut.  I'd like to say that I remember all donuts that I eat, but this one was definitely one for the books.  Even if you don't order up a giant donut, the regular-sized ones are just as fantastic.  My fiancé and I both loved the apple fritter along with the long john!  I mean, these are some sexy donuts, and they aren't badly priced either.  

If only I lived in San Francisco, Bob's Donuts would be my newest watering hole!  I do believe that Bob's Donuts is a must-see, amongst all the other attractions, when coming to this wonderful city.  No great city would be complete with a great donut shop.
author: Lauren K.

description:
This review is from the perspective of "drunk Mike". I've never experienced this place sober because except for Tuesdays and weekends, I never have the time to drink on Polk St. On with the review...

OH MY GAWD THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! It's open 24/7 and conveniently located on Polk St. for a post-puke snack. The people that work there are incredibly friendly and are willing to be patient while you drunkenly attempt to slur your order. Their donuts are amazing, almost better than finding $20 in your pocket from the last time you wore jeans. But let's be real, you're gonna be hungover in the morning and will probably need food. Do your sober self a favor and order a dozen, bring it home, and leave it for yourself in the morning.
author: Mike K.

description:
The apple fritters are to die for!! If you are close to this shop I recommend the apple fritters. They are extremely delicious and worth the wait. Once I arrived there was a line out of the door and you can see the donuts on display. We waited no more than 15 minutes. We all wanted to try the enormous donuts they have so we got the crumb donut. I thought that it wasn't going to taste good because of the size, but every bite was heaven. It was soft and tasty. Would definitely come back for the donuts and apple fritter! 

On a side note: parking here isn't great so you might have to park a few blocks down.
author: Krystal M.

description:
Huge crowed of people served more efficiently than I've ever seen! Impressive!

It was Santa Con and tons of people were out and about, but by gosh, the friendly employees at Bob's kept that line MOVING!  Two people getting ordered and another two ringing people up.

Now that the friendly efficiency is mentioned, let's get to the donuts themselves!

AMAZING!  Fresh, hot, moist and perfectly scrumptious.  I loved the sprinkly ones and the old fashioned!  I'll definitely be back for the enormous donut next time.  A friend told me that Bob's is famous for them, so I've got to try next time I've got a sweet tooth in the city!

I'll definitely be back and tell friends too.  Probably one of my favorite donuts I've ever had!
author: Kevin K.

description:
I am an active junkie of two things: Slurpees & Apple Fritters. 7-Eleven has the lock on the former, but I'm ALWAYS challenged to find a consistently made Apple Fritters. 
I was pointed to Bob's while in San Francisco by a friend. Having had so many similar recommendations for other bakeries, I went there with little or no expectations.
Bob's has it DOWN. Their Apple Fritters is THE GOLD STANDARD for me now. 
They are not only fresh, but large, generously coated with frosting that creates a PERFECT crunchy exterior that surrounds a moist, cake-like interior, with more sumptuiously spiced chunky apple globs I've ever experienced. And that's no hyperbole!
author: Blue F.

description: The donuts were edible, but I'm giving this place a more generous rating because the girl behind the counter was so sweet and told me her grandmother bought the place in the 70's when I asked her how old the place was. I really wanted to love these donuts but I couldn't  maybe i should have come when I was totally drunk, which is never. Oh, that came out way too snarky, I just meant, that perhaps these donuts  would be so much tastier if it was 1:00 AM, I was really hungry, and a bit drunk.
author: Andrea Y.

description: Bob's is awesome, and right there on Polk. It is a well known joint, that almost always has a line, and is open late. The line is the best form of advertising for this place and almost never dies down. Come here if you have the drunchies, and are looking for something sweet. The donuts are cheap, and I am a repeat customer. Much love for Bob's and all the kind staff that work there.
author: Ross S.

description:
I used to work at a donut shop in high school on the east coast. I have eaten many donuts in my life. 

Bob's Donuts puts them all to shame. The freshness and flavors packed into each donut is astounding. It's like tasting a donut for the first time.
author: Kurt N.

description: Wow - 7:30pm and the guy is in constant motion serving customers AND making fresh donuts!
author: Robert M.

description: I would have loved to try their donuts but this happened! Literally walked in and out of this establishment. I had my order ready and the party ahead of me put their order in. The young lady asked for glazed donuts and donut holes - HOW IN THE HELL DO YOU RUN OUT OF DONUTS IF YOU ARE A 24 HOUR ESTABLISHMENT? It was basically "whatever we have out is what we have" - a handful of cinnamon crumb donuts, maple covered donuts and cake donuts w/choc icing and sprinkles. I'm glad that I didn't go out of my way to come here just to try their donuts. Looks like i will stick to my local donut shop, Dunkin' Donuts or Krispy Kreme and patronize them.
author: Hunner N.

description: My vegetarian husband and stepdaughter will turn a blind eye at Bob's as a giant tub of LARD is brought out to fry the donuts in. This is hilarious to me, and understandable. Bob's donuts are amazing! It's all about getting them immediately off the fryer. An SF gem.
author: Camille L.

description: Classic, tasty, and freshly made donuts. The inside of the shop is much, so it's a grab and go sort of spot for me. I tend to relive my FUNemployement days starting at Swan Oyster and blissfully ending my leisurely lunch at Bob's. Yum! This place is great and I hope it never goes away!
author: Lisa R.

description: Loved the EPIC LARGE DONUT! Great celebration any day! Donut hack: visit at 1:30am and get donuts right away! Line was super short and delicious late night food! Love how it's ope 24/7 including holidays!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Yup, it's true. Best donuts I've ever had in SF. And it's open 24/7. Bring cash to tip if you want to be extra nice (you should, cuz it's 24 hours), and don't be surprised if you find yourself walking out with a magical pink box of dough.

I love Bob's. I've always found myself here some time in the evening, whether for drunchies or just because...I mean, donuts, amirite? I absolutely love their regular glazed donuts and donut holes. So fluffy and delicious. Even the day after! You can't go wrong with the original. Their old-fashioned's are a bit smaller than the ones I like in my hometown donut shop, but I love the variety of glazes from regular to chocolate and maple...so good. Buttermilk is also great, but it's not as light and fluffy as I like them usually, and although I'm not a fan of anything with cream inside...the sandwich ones look amazing.

You can't miss Bob's. Either there's a long line out the door, or the smoke and delicious aromas will draw you inside. There is poor ventilation inside, so I feel so bad for the workers (they're Japanese-owned...ganbatte!), but they do have coffee and milk to go along with your bites if you choose to eat inside. 

The place is warm, small, but filled with love and efficiency. Everybody needs to go to Bob's. Sure some may say it's not worth the wait, but I gotta say these are the best no-frills-down-to-earth-donuts you'll have in SF. Oh, and they do the donut challenge here too :)
author: Jodi H.

description: Decent donuts, definitely not the best I've had. Did not have a broad selection of donuts at the time we went (around 7p). Restaurant was disgusting inside, so don't stay and eat!
author: Justin H.

description: Nice quick place to stop for delicious doughnuts. They had a big variety, maple anything is delicious. Friendly staff. Not a large place or lots of seating but there is a few booths available.
author: Raegina R.

description: Ohhh so much meh!! Donuts are....hmm... donuts. OK - not great but not terrible - but the place, the place is terrible. Messy, dirty, slow. Not a chance in of coming back...
author: Ed C.

description: WOW! haven't tried the apple fritter yet but looks amazing! Donut holes are bomb. Wanted the big donut but no way I can eat all that!
author: Lilli O.

description: I should have tried the crumb donut.  Did the regular glaze.  A staple that you should excel at if you are the best of the best? I thought it was okay.  I'd say try their novelty items if you're feeling adventurous.
author: Cindy S.

description:
California is doing something right... it's the only place that i've seen that has multiple 24/7 donut shops :D

After a meal that had way too many sake shots, I drunkenly uber'd my way to nearyby Bob's.... My yelper friends, if you've never smelled fried dough and sweet glaze while hammered then you're missing out.

I ordered the maple old fashioned, maple jelly filled, raised glaze, and an eclair.

Maple Old Fashioned - An often overlooked pastry, the old fashioned is actually a quite impressive pastry... Textural contrast from the crunchy exterior to the moist cakey interior... add some vanilla glaze finished off with some maple glaze? Godly.

Raised Glaze - a donut that's served fresh from the fryer might be one of the best bites that can ever be created on earth.... I want to give a shout out to Patrick at Bobs for looking me up with another one... I thought it was extremely nice of you and want to say thank you

Maple jelly Filled - a strawberry filled doughnut with maple glaze... by this time i was honestly just high of my sugar binge but nonetheless, it was a tasty donut

Eclair - a boston cream pie is one of my favorite pastries... you have your pate chaux pastry that's filled with custard.... add chocolate ganache on top? unbeatable.

Bob's reminds me of California Doughnuts in LA.... both are superb in delivering delicious donuts during the time of the day where nothing good happens
author: Peter H.

description:
Very worth a trip to Bobs if you are in the neighborhood and are hungry for donuts. 

This is a unique shop with a overall good selection of donuts. They are made onsite. The chocolate sprinkle donut is outstanding. I did not try the coffee( taking a cab right afterwards), but it smelled good. There are several donut shops in this neighborhood, but I'd hit Bob's. 

This place has on old school feel with a cool ambiance. There was a line there at 8 at night the other day. Worth a try.
author: Thomas H.

description:
Has everything you need for a late nite treat on the street! Great prices, good service and Kung foo (movies, that is!)

They keep it real and have a cool two man crew. I'll be back next time with friends for coffee :)
author: Penny N.

description: Give the crumb donut a try, it's worth the calories. My daughter loves the glazed and the cake .
author: Pam W.

description: Awesome. Really big doughnuts that were oh so delicious. A must visit if in San Fran.
author: Violet D.

description: The apple fritters are to die for!! It tastes like apple pie + cinnamon roll! They're huge and an last you for a couple of days. I also got the glazed donut and it was really good as well. And super cheap. I'm sure if I lived in SF I'd have donut runs-it's super cool that they're open 24 hrs. I would definitely go back!
author: Preeti R.

description: The glaze donuts are delicious! Soft on the inside with slight crisp on the outside. But the fritters will knock your socks off. As we were leaving with our dozen, the line was out the door- even at 11pm.
author: Elle W.

description:
Guys. I'm a doughnut connoisseur. Okay not really, but I hashtag my doughnuts from around the world so that's gotta count for something. Anytime I see a doughnut shop rated as "#1" on Yelp, I get über critical: but guys, Bob's donuts are everything I want in an all-American classic deep fried piece of dough. 

We had a raised maple and a raised crumb doughnut. De-licious. I would even say one of the best maples I've ever had. The light, airy dough melts in your mouth, similar to the lightness of a Krispy Kreme but with MUCH more quality. 

We were only the 3rd person in line and it still took about 10 minutes because they really take their time with their customers so if you are in a rush, or just want a quick doughnut, go to the place 2 doors down. All in all, I will DEFINITELY be coming back!
author: Mikkel J.

description:
I got the giant glazed donut and shared with 3 other friends. They were weaklings and couldnt not finish their slices. 

Pros
Salty dough
Modest glazing
Perfectly fried
Slightly undercooked in the center

Con
None
author: Song K.

description: Tasty and cheap, but barely any selection, especially for a place that's open 24/7. I wouldn't return, nothin special overall.
author: Natasha K.

description:
I'm a glazed old fashioned kinda gal. 

The infamous Bob's Donut alluded me for months until "one" cheat day, I decided to treat myself. All the donuts looked dayumn delectable. That's some crispy, sugary goodness. I "had" to get a glazed old fashion. Not only did I get a glazed old fashion, I got a gift from the donut gods. There was a hint of lemon juice in the icing, which made it more flavorful than a typical glaze. The donut cake itself was beautifully crispy on the outside, while also warm and fluffy on the inside. I could also taste a hint of a spice like nutmeg, or something of that nature, which elevated the donut. I'm so used to donuts that depend on the sugar for taste, but I could tell this that this one, although similar in looks, was different. Now I'll probably spend each of my upcoming cheat days at Bob's Donuts. Totally worth it!
author: Joanna S.

description: I think the crumb donut is the best donut I've ever tried. It is so light and fluffy. The apple fritter was amazing as well.
author: Kim A.

description: Every donut shop should be judged on a plain glaze donut...at least that is my opinion.  Bob's thankfully did not disappoint.  The dough was thick but with a wonderful softness and a light, perfect amount of glaze.  I was disappointed they were out of apple fritters especially since they are supposed to be a 24/7 shop but I guess that leaves me longing to come back.
author: Gena L.

description: This place is not cash only anymore, they accept card. Just an FYI for anybody (: super good place would recommend 10/10
author: Oksana G.

description:
I wished I was able to try all the donuts.  I guess I can blame myself for not stopping by when I first spotted this place (while on the bus) when I visited back in late April.

Back in SF again, I stopped in one early morning, picked up a few donuts for my mom and I.   I bought the jelly filled, chocolate glazed, the old fashioned which I thought was a crueller and coconut donut.  There may have been another type that I bought but I forgot.  The donuts were tasty and made fresh.  They were soft and moist.  I definitely wanted to buy more and taste all of the types of donuts available but I would've been eating donuts for that whole day and that would've been no bueno to my heart and waistline ..lol..
author: Ming T.

description: So not overrated. I had the apple fritter - which totally lived up to the hype. My friend got the sugar coated plain donut, and it was literally the softest, fluffiest donut I've ever tried. You're missing out if you don't visit!
author: Aishani P.

description: Got a chocolate raised donut and the chocolate icing is a dark chocolate and not very sweet. Not a big fan of the donut.
author: Alyssa H.

description: My absolute favorite donut shop in SF. Always fresh & delicious; especially the maple old-fashioned!
author: Houston G.

description: Super good donuts! There's usually a line for them, luckily I didn't catch one on a Saturday afternoon. The donuts are always fresh!! Staff is friendly and fast paced. This place is open 24/7/365
author: Carla C.

description: Donut shop + open 24/7!!!! Whenever my boyfriend and I are in the area we try to pop in to grab a donut or apple fritter. The fresh ones are the best because they are so warm and fluffy that they just melt in your mouth. I think they start selling the apple fritters after 5pm. The prices are reasonable. There's some stools at the bar and a couple of tables to sit at. There's usually some kind of documentary playing on their TV. The only bad thing is that it's hard finding street parking in this area.
author: Nicole S.

description: Best donuts hands down!!! The cake crumb donut is the perfect coffee donut but let's talk about this other donut where they dip it in a maple frosting.... boy oh boy, that thing took my mouth to outer space! So freakin good! I had a little left over so I enjoyed the remainder with my coffee. So good!
author: Amar P.

description: Bob you're a dangerous man. Why do you have to make all these fluffy cloud like donuts near my residence? It's hard to resist when you're so close by. Anything you pop out the fryer is always the best stuff out the bunch. Fresh, warm and gooey fried goods. I'm glad you're not cash only even without a credit card minimum! Alas it makes it even easier for me to indulge. If I ever feel gluttonous enough I'll step up to your giant donut challenge but until then let's just keep it to the fryer.
author: Virginia Y.

description:
You're telling me I can have fresh-made, extra soft donuts at any time? Sold! I came here with friends after a night out (around 12am) and there was a line out the door. The line moves pretty slowly which was a bit frustrating. My friends and I decided to get a bunch of donuts and split them.
We order 2 Crumb Cake Donuts, 1 glazed donut, 1 chocolate eclair, 1 apple fritter, and 1 HUGE donut.
The Crumb Cake donut was my favorite. It was soft, fresh, and the right amount of sweetness. It felt deceivingly guilt free! I definitely recommend that donut.
The huge donut is fun for a picture but it tastes just like their smaller donuts.
Great place but not worth waiting long for.
author: Aya E.

description:
I'm so sad because the first time I came here, I thought it was the best crumb donut I've ever had! It was so good and left me wanting more, which is why I stopped by again at lunch to get another crumb donut. First off, when I was waiting in line, I soon observed that there were a lot of flies flying around the donuts. Close to the donut I wanted to order!! As soon as I saw that, I was just about to walk out of the store. But the lady asked me what I wanted right when I wanted to walk out so I just bought the crumb donut anyway. 

Walking back to work, I took it out of the bag and ate a bite. As soon as I ate it, I see that the donut had black marks on it. I examine it even closer to make sure it's not just burnt marks and it wasn't. If you closely look at the picture I attached, you can see that the whole bottom of the donut just looks so dirty... After that, I just threw my donut away immediately. It's okay because the one bite I ate wasn't that satisfying anyway. Sigh, so disappointing. Only reason why I'm not giving it one star is because of such a good donut I had the first time around.
author: Annie H.

description: Service is rushed but perfectly fine. Bought 4 different types of donuts, ate one and threw the rest  away. Not great, not awful, just edible. Very doughy and greasy. Will not be going back.
author: Kimberly A.

description: The donuts are just terrible.  The chocolate donuts tasted like burnt oil. The maple did not taste like maple and had other unknown ingredients included in them. At a dollar fifty per donut it is a ripoff!
author: Kevin S.

description:
This was our second visit to Bob's. They have flat-out the best coffee of any donut shop I've been to in my life. As well as the most friendly donut server ever. To top it all off, the donuts are DELICIOUS! 

The only negative was they were out of Buttermilk Bars (my personal faves) so I was kicking myself for not arriving earlier (it was a bit past 10 am on a Sunday...).

If you like great donuts and coffee, you will not be disappointed at Bob's. Unless you are simply very hard to please.

Bob, we can't wait to come back! :)
author: Robert S.

description: Bob's is a cool little hole-in-the-wall type donut shop. When I got there mid-day, staff were busy frying donuts - good to know that it's fresh! I opted for my favourite variety of donut, a sour-cream based one (maple was my flavor of choice). It was great, overly sweet, but I guess that's to be expected.
author: Daniel A.

description:
My friend and I came here after dinner and we were stuffed. Knowing me, there is always room for dessert. I ordered the glazed and man was I in heaven. The eggy, fluffy dough and glazed combination is like no other. It was the best doughnut I ever had and I've eaten quite a few doughnuts so far. Hands down one of the best. I think the waitress is quite cute. There is a community vibe too this place. People come and grab to go. The workers know a majority of their customers by name. The shop has an old coffee shop/diner decor. I will definitely be coming back. 

WAIT FOR FRESH BATCHES!!!
A FRESH GLAZED DOUGHNUT AND MILK IS HEAVEN!!!!!!
author: Brian C.

description: Oh my god whenever I go to the city this is ALWAYS my last stop before heading home. It's so fucking good. The doughnuts are light and airy...not too sweet and not too heavy or oily. I love this place. It's always packed and they make doughnuts fresh like every 15 minutes. THE APPLE FRITTERS ARE HUGE IT TAKES ME 3 DAYS TO EAT THEM!!! I'm an apple fritter connoisseur and this is the BEST I've ever had.
author: Brandy A.

description: Was eating at Crustaceans and walked by Bob's.  First time here and surprisingly great donuts and service.   Staff was wonderful.
author: Ron C.

description: They're very good donuts here  Maybe best in the city.. Love their croissants they have a buttery sweet taste of them Their glaze twist donuts and their sticky buns are very good  Best time to get donuts between 2 and 4:00a in the morning they  are there nice and fresh ......
author: Frankie L.

description: I love this place!!!! I really wanted to get the big donut for my friends birthday so I called when I got off work to see if they had any available. The lady working was extremely nice and said there were fresh ones coming out right now and she would hold one for me! I picked up a huge chocolate glaze donut with sprinkles and it was only $12. Not only did the donut look awesome,  but it tasted so yummy! Perfect balance of fluffy and doughy, exactly how I like my donuts! I could seriously finish the whole thing. This will definitely be a treat I get for all special occasions(:
author: Courtney N.

description:
What's not to like - one million varieties of doughnuts and some pretty humble coffee 

An office favorite " it's Bobs "
author: Mr. J.

description: Jelly doughnuts the best!  definitely worth the wait in line.
author: David W.

description:
This is a not so hidden gem that you must check off of your list. 

Go here now.

This is an old, dusty, always open dive with the BEST old school donuts. They are not good because I have a childhood memory or are famous, they are just good.
author: Justin S.

description: Delicious doughnuts. Wonderful staff and very chill environment to eat doughnuts. We got the giant doughnut and had coffee. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone who's visiting neighborhood to check out!
author: Michael W.

description: Lets just say I was hungover and things weren't going well. We had bought the giant donut the day before, and it literally saved my life.  So while I still think the place has a lot to work on, their giant donuts are pretty good and honestly saved my hung over dummy self. I'm willing to give them another shot after they "saved" me. 'Nuff said.
author: Benny H.

description: The maple donut is like a biting into a maple pancake cloud of goodness! Grab a coffee and sit at the bar if you can!
author: Anjali P.

description:
THE APPLE FRITTERS THO

Seriously tho really great spot for pastries, wish I could have tried everything, but these donuts are massive and rly could only eat 1 per visit. 

Bob's is one of those niche spots that is really focused on their craft. While the selection was somewhat limited (I went late at night) the fact that they were even open at 9pm was a testament to their commitment to a truly fiery donut. They're seriously open 24 hours a day. 

My Apple fritter was figuratively on fire. As my mouth was dancing with joy, I told myself maybe 3 times: "Giff you need to stop, save it for later dude", but I couldn't bare the thought of a single bite being lonely and ended up devouring it methodically over the course of 1 hour. (Did I mention they're pretty big?) 

Oh, I'll be back.
author: Giff D.

description: The chocolate cake donut is delicious.  The glazed donuts are out of this world.  Everything here is great.  The service is excellent.  This is the top donut I have ever had! Great!
author: Henry V.

description: Came here with a friend for the doughnut challenge. Unfortunately they don't have that many flavors for their big doughnuts so I settled for the glaze.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
This is my favourite donut shop in the world. It's so good we came back twice in two days before heading back to Vancouver. 
Donut is soft and fluffy without being overly sweet.
author: Liz W.

description: There's only 1 type of donut here as far as i'm concerned, the crumb cake donut.  I've tried a couple of the other ones: the glazed, the crumb glaze, the maple, and they are all meh tbh.  The crumb cake on the other hand is one the BEST donuts I've ever had.  You have to get them fresh, and they will melt in your mouth or fall apart in your hand.  You will want to keep on eating them, you will not be able to eat only 1.  So my advice if you go here is get the crumb cake and a lot of them.
author: Anthony M.

description:
Bob's Donut is one of my favorite places to visit on Polk street. I recently visited on a weekday night after dinner (the line is far out the door on weekends) to grab my favorite desert. 

This time though, there was a surprise. The folks ahead of me in the line decided to do the lesser known Bob's Donut challenge. The challenge: eat a massive donut (12" diameter) in less than 3 minutes. If you do, you get a free Bob's Donut t-shirt. If you do it under 2, you get a free t-shirt and your donut is free (these gargantuan donuts cost 10 bucks each). Apparently, only a few people try each week, with 6% doing it under 3 minutes. Only 20 talented individuals have done it under 2. Go for it if you're up for the challenge!

Besides the entertainment, I thoroughly enjoyed the fresh chocolate frosted donut. The perfect balance between fluffy texture and melt in your mouth goodness. The vibe is old school casual, with pour-it-your-damn-self coffee pots and batter splattered around behind the counter. If you come at the right time, you can watch the entire donut making process in action as they flip and dip them in hot chocolate bins. What a treat!
author: Behnam S.

description:
I really wanted to try the giant donuts, but we came in the afternoon.

We put Bob's to the test with two old-fashioned glazed donuts since they were out of regular glazed and the infamous giant. They were nicely balanced between sweetness and a crunchy texture.

I just wish they had more variety available since they're open 24/7.
author: Niki P.

description: Stopped here for the first time after catching a late night movie and was pleasantly surprised. The donuts were great and not price gouged like most modern donut places. Will definitely be visiting again next time I'm in the city.
author: Jack K.

description:
These donuts are out of this world! Except.... at a certain point of the day there really aren't very many options. (which I expect) a bit but they had racks waiting with some fresher donuts. 

If you want something in particular I recommend coming early (like all amazing donut shops)
author: Kaley K.

description: Best Donuts in SF!  Live the cinnamon rolls and anything maple!  Always fresh! Every time I am in the City this is our to go spot for donuts! We are here today for National Donut Day!
author: Robert R.

description:
What a gem.  

Came here to buy a box of donuts before heading out to dinner, you know... dessert?

There was only 2 people in front of us, by the time we reached the counter there was a long line waiting.  I heard that the line can become massive and it did.  It was around 8:15 on a Friday night.  The line gets pretty long because the sweet old lady working there (probably the owner) is taking her time talking to you, punching in the donuts you select on the ipad.  She is so sweet and kind. 

We ordered the crumble donut, which is all I'm really going to talk about.  It's a smaller size, it's moist and crumbly.  The flavor is great and two days later it was still so tasty.  We got an assortment of donuts and all were tasty and good.

Of course, when we're back in the area.. we'll be back from some tasty treats!
author: Stephanie B.

description: This was the best stop we had in SF - we ended up going every night on our trip. No-nonsense donuts where you just get what you can from what's available. And honestly, it's the best crumb donut you'll ever have in your life. Make the trek, get a baker's dozen, and eat the night away.
author: RJ S.

description:
Vampire donut shop: Average staleish donuts during the day come to life with freshness after midnight. Large donuts are fun to share with a large or small group.

Great service for vamps and non-vamps alike.
author: Christine M.

description: Everything from the 90's diner vibe to the incredibly nice staff, it feels like you traveled back in time when you come here. And oh my, the chocolate rainbow donut we ordered was delicious. Get the HUGE size and Instagram it. Make your friends jealous.
author: Danny E.

description: The donuts were delicious and the staff was incredibly nice and friendly.  So glad I checked this place out, and definitely enjoyed the two donuts (cake donut covered in maple and a chocolate covered risen donut).  Highly recommend!
author: Jonathan T.

description: After catching Deorro at Temple we made a pit stop before heading home! We didnt do the challenge but we still bought the big O donut to take home. I must say the big donuts were not that great. Not enough frosting and too much dough. Doubt I can beat the donut challenge since I had a tough time just eating a portion of it. We did also purchase some crumb donuts and I must say those are a must try. I am not a crumb donut person but I ate two! This place is open 24 hours and the line was long at 2 am but it was moving quick. Bunch of different type of people in line waiting to try Bobs. Pricing is good and cheap. I was expecting it to be super expensive due to the hype and reviews. The workers here are super cool and nice. Area sort of sketchy at 2 am but everyone is minding their business. Id defin return if I am in the city!
author: Thuyvi M.

description:
Arrived at 8:30 AM on a Thursday morning to a hearty selection of donuts galore. Line was quick & service is friendly. Got 2 giant donuts (glazed rainbow sprinkles & crumb) & 2 donut holes for $24 flat. They accept credit card or cash!

10/10 choice for surprising your coworkers with for their birthday and wedding celebrations :) They loved the huuuge donuts! The quality is still top tier even though the donut is 10x the size of a normal one. Soft and doughy inside!

Definitely will be coming back.
author: Melanie W.

description: I live about 5 blocks away and used to enjoy walking to Bobs and to grab a light fluffy fresh raised donut.  Within the last couple of months Bobs has been disappointingly inconsistent. They seem to never have any raised donuts left and when you finally get your hands on one it's nothing but oily dense sadness. When they don't have any raised I usually opt for the donut holes in which  is also oily. I've been there about 5 times hoping for their old amazingness but left feeling cheated on cheat day.
author: Rica P.

description:
Omg how was this my first time to this magnificent place.  It is so good.  Easily one of the best raised donuts I've had.

$1.25/raised, $1/cake donuts.  Hole in the wall with some small tables and bar seating inside.  Open 24/7.

Their raised donuts are fantastic--super light and fluffy, not greasy.  I like their chocolate glaze--taste is more like the milk chocolate frosting you'd buy in a tub at the market (which I like :)), and consistency is closer to that than the typical thin sparse glaze at other donut shops.

It's no wonder some couples use the big versions for their weddings.  These donuts are that good.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Decent novelty eatery for donuts. Not outstanding yeast, nor is it gourmet, but ok. The portions are hearty and filling, apple bread pudding seems to be of "old country" which was nice and not overly sweet. We enjoyed but probably will be a singular visit as it was fun to be had once as a SF hype, but that's about it for these travelers.
author: Annalise B.

description: Delicious traditional donuts. I usually love getting their apple fritters, they are huge with nice size chunks of apple. When they are out of fritters, I get the crumb donut which is amazing.
author: Jameela F.

description:
I wanted to fall in love with this place, no exaggeration here because I love me a bomb donut!

With sooo many rave reviews, a couple from my fellow Yelp buddies, and some of my co-workers hypin this place up I just knew I would be in for a real treat!

Maybe I came too early, 6AM to be exact because I was beyond disappointed before my dozen old fashion glaze donuts were even placed in their box.

One thing that drives me insane is the smell of bleach.  An older lady was washing down the sidewalk in front of Bob's and you had to maneuver around her in the hopes of not getting your shoes all wet. I get it, you have to clean....but maybe another time, this would be helpful so customers taste buds aren't being hijacked by the smell of bleach and soap, YUCK!!!

I am all for the "hole in the wall" type places that look a little eery to the eye, but come on!!

In the window is a heap of different donuts. You can barely tell which is what because they are packed on top of each other, super disorganized and gross looking.  I could tell right away that these donuts WERE NOT FRESH!! They looked super crusty and dry, at least a couple days old (see my pics below).  The cases to the right were super empty and looked dirty.  In fact, this whole donut shop just felt icky to me.  The overall presentation of the donuts was very disappointing to the point where I lost all desire for an old fashion glaze. 

A dozen donuts for $12?!! HA!!! Bob's should be ashamed when they are giving you crappy, stale, below average donuts.

I won't be back.....sit tight....I will show you what a REAL donut looks like =)
author: Sabrina J.

description:
I have a lot of respect for establishments that are open 24-hours a day. When do they find time to clean? Do inventory? Calculate sales figures? etc... 
Other bakeries don't have it much easier. I've seen many bakers start prepping around 4AM, most likely earlier, to accommodate people who need sugar. Thank you for the carbs. 

I used to achingly wake up at pre-dawn hours to work east coast hours. I am not a morning person, so sometimes (many times), I would run late, but Mr. Joy would kindly cart me off to work to save me a few minutes. Little did I know, after he dropped me off, he headed over to Bob's Donuts. He said before the sun comes up is the best time to get a doughnut. Not all selfless good deeds are selfless. lol, I kid of course.

I had never been inside Bob's Donuts. I've never been crazy about doughnuts. I like them okay, but I just prefer other types of baked goods over doughnuts. Mr. Joy has brought me doughnuts from Bob's a couple of times and I think they're pretty good. 

I've heard about how popular Bob's is, so when I finally paid a visit, I was surprised that it was such a bare bones shop with a less-than-attractive display and simple counter. It looked like any other neighborhood doughnut shop. 
Even though presentation doesn't seem to be one of their priorities, they make up for it with a huge selection. There are the usual glazed doughnuts & filled doughnuts as well as fritters, eclairs, bear claws, cinnamon rolls, danishes, & croissants. Then there's the BIG Donut, a comically large cake-sized doughnut. Apparently they do a Big Donut Challenge - finish it within 3 minutes. It looks do-able. I think I'd like to take on this challenge.
author: Joy W.

description:
THE BEST.

I love this hole in the wall doughnut shop - everything from the old Asians serving you that look like they've been doing this since the '50s to the lack of interior decor that's never been changed. You would think this place is cash only but nope, they take card. Love that too.

Of course I have to rave about their apple fritters. You absolutely have to get this. It's crispy on the outside, perfectly glazed, and filled with ooey gooey doughnut like cake that's moist and warm with chunks of apples inside. YUM.

Tragically, they ran out of it one time when I went there around 10am. Apparently, these fritters sell out fast in the morning (especially on weekends) but they start making them again around 6pm and usually don't run out at night. Good to know!

I've also tried their old fashioned and that's delicious too. You just can't go wrong with this place.
author: Sue C.

description: Had the old fashioned glazed donut. It was a dense, greasy and tasteless blob of dough. Any Dunkin' Donuts fare is 100x better than this.
author: Ellie G.

description: A donut shop icon. I first stopped by over 25 years ago when I lived in the City. I'd be here in the evening for the really fresh stuff, and on my way to work early AM. It's still here and the donuts (chocolate old fashioned is my fave) are still bad for me.  So be it.
author: Eric B.

description: WOW. Finally a donut place in SF that's not a disappointment. Softest donuts you'll ever consume, hands down. Cheap price, many options. The crumb donut fell apart in your mouth as well as the chocolate glazed. It went well with the milk they offered in mini fridge! Genius! I respected that so much. I can't wait to come back and split the big one with my friends.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Quite literally the best donut that I've ever had. Coming from Chicago, where there's a gourmet donut shop on almost every corner, this spot takes the dough to the next level. I couldn't just pick one, so I got 7 to try. The apple fritter was fresh, and light on the inside unlike other fritters I've had. The maple glazed one again had a great fluffy center with a well balanced maple frosting. Now the best one hands down was the crumb cake donut, I wish I got an entire box of just these. This is the best donut I've ever had.
author: Dillin R.

description: I had to try this place after hearing that this was Swaggy P's favorite restaurant.  Came with my family on a Saturday evening around 10pm and there was about 15 people ahead of us in line.  The line moved relatively quickly.  We tried the chocolate raised, sugar, crumb, chocolate sprinkles, and this apple donut (can't remember the name of it).  I really wanted to try the apple fritter but they were sold out at the time.  We really enjoyed everything we got.  Much better than Krispy Kreme and any of the other donut places we tried in San Francisco and along the peninsula.
author: Chi Y.

description: Nothing extraordinary for having to stand in line.   Lured by the reviews of having vegan donuts but they don't carry them as a regular item. So no donuts for me. They will openly tell you. My family ate donuts and were not impressed. I would rather recommend King Pin Donuts in Berkeley. I loved them before becoming vegan and the family loves those donuts.
author: Carlos C.

description: I bought one of their huge donuts for a birthday dinner and it was a huge hit!  The donut tasted great too!
author: Lan T.

description:
I don't know who or where Bob was, but this Asian lady won me over with these donuts. This was by far the best donut shop I've ever been to!! Open 24/7 I walked in buzzed around 2am to meet this lady who was frying donuts with a full house of customers. Every donut I ordered was so good, soft, and fresh!! 

I plan on coming back to The Bay soon, and I will be stopping here every time!! This place is a must go when you are in town!!
author: Shon M.

description: Bob's looks unassuming, but once you try the goods you'll know why it's a longstanding neighborhood spot. Delicious donuts, $1.75 milk cartons and hot coffee can be had here. I walked in on a Wednesday afternoon, and there was no line or anything, just a few timers sitting and chatting. There happened to be a fresh batch of donuts ready, and I opted for chocolate old fashioned as well as a maple bar plus milk, which cost $4.90 altogether. The donuts tasted great and I can only imagine the other flavors tasting just as good, even the giant donuts Bob's is famous for. I'm glad this place is nowhere near a BART station because I would be going way too often if that were the case!
author: Edwina D.

description: Don't fall for the hype.  We were staying on Van Ness, walked a few extra blocks past 3 bakeries to get the famous Bob's.  Average donuts. And the coffee? Bland. And the service? The lady rushed us, never cracked a smile and gave the impression she could care less if we spent 20$ on donuts there.
author: Mary H.

description:
Whatever Bob's recipe is, he best keep it secret! I tried the traditional cake donut with maple glaze and sprinkles. Super delicious, the only critique is the doughnut was heavy on that malty taste. Still super good though. 

What gets the "Hands-Down-Delicious-Come-Back-For-More Award" is their old fashioned donut. The thing tastes like a funnel cake with icing. Definitely a unique twist to the old school classic.
author: Irvina K.

description: OMG!!! FRESH DONUTS AVAILABLE 24 HOURS?? Am I dreaming?!?!  I went twice on a recent trip to San Fran... once around 3pm and once around 9pm... and both times they were FRESHLY frying the donuts.  And YESSSS they are absolutely amazing.  First time, we HAD to get the giant donut.  The giant donut was good and would be able to feed 10+ people... I've seen pictures of people using the giant donut as their wedding cake!  The second time I came, I opted for just a single glazed donut... and that was heavenly.  The freshest and tastiest and BEST EVER donut.  The donut was tastier in normal size... lighter, fluffier, more glaze per donut inch lol.  The giant donut was good, but it was much denser... more for the pictures and the novelty of it.  Both times I went, they were out of their famous apple fritters... will have to try next time I go back!
author: Priscilla P.

description:
Try EVERYTHING!!!!! Don't sleep on their pastries, this is not JUST a donut shop.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Popped in because I have a massive sweet tooth and ended up leaving with twice as much as I needed. Went back later in the night to get some things that weren't ready at the time, was not disappointed.
author: Anthony A.

description: Constantly churning out fresh hot donuts, they were so good. Definitely recommend if you're nearby, I loved them!
author: Shiva A.

description:
