Donuts!!! 24/7 donuts that are cheap and delicious is a universal yes. 

The glazed is so airy and fresh. I even liked the chocolate glazed donut, which I'm not usually a fan of. But the chocolate icing did not offend me.

I wished there were signs to provide more explanation of what was available, but it was kind of a guessing game. 

It's honestly nothing out of the norm as far as a donut shop goes, but they got the recipe down.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Came here after brunch (if I wasn't full enough already lol) because I heard good things about this place from my co-workers. They have this giant donut, which if you can finish in a few minutes, you get it for free. I was tempted, but I just had brunch and was going to go to Alcatraz afterwards so I didn't want to plague my friends with a seasick friend haha.

- Timbits (I mean, donut holes): these are so nostalgic of the True North strong and free :P I've never seen a non-Tim Hortons donut shop ever sell donut holes, but I guess here in America there isn't any Timmy's haha. Anyways, these donut holes were so nostalgic of little bites of Canada hehe. 
- Classic Glaze: this was recommended to me by my co-workers, being the one donut that isn't overly sweet, and the best of all. I would say it lived up to expectations! It wasn't too too sweet, and light and fluffy on the inside.
- Maple Old Fashioned: this wasn't the best, which is partly why this is 4 stars and not 5. The dough felt like it was drenched in oil and fat (well, it's donuts so what was I expecting haha) but I definitely liked the regular donut batter is a lot better. It was pretty funny because one of my friends said that the maple tasted almost like curry LOL. I guess that's one way to describe it? XP

You wouldn't think there's any notable service at a hole-in-the-wall and donut shop like this, but the cashier guy was really nice. The folks in front of us had ordered a dozen classic glazed donuts, and he was recommending they try an old-fashioned one, but the couple said they like their classic glazed and they were fine, and so he gave them a free old fashioned donut in their box to try! That was nice of him. Overall, I was quite content with the sugary treats, and I'd definitely come back to have another classic glaze soon!
author: Joanna C.

description:
By far the best donuts I've ever had!  And that's saying a lot because I've had quite a few in my lifetime. 
The only bad thing is that I don't live in San Francisco and can't have these regularly and they've spoiled me by raising the bar for what donuts should be!   
On top of the donuts being amazing, the service was upbeat and fun!  
If you even like donuts a little bit, you should go here - you'll be so glad you did!
author: Renee J.

description: Holy banana peels, that was a great chocolate frosted donut. Best ever, actually. And the glazed was like a cloud of deliciousness! Way to go, Bob's!
author: Renee L.

description: Had the giant  and the chocolate frosting donut- its was toooooo gooood! Its was disappointing that we couldn't sit indoor (its a bit old and mot dog friendly), that's why everyone take TA.
author: Anat S.

description:
BEST DONUTS I'VE EVER HAD!! Literally, not even exaggerating, THE best. Almost as if they melt in your mouth.. as I'm writing this I wish I had at least 3 of them to satisfy my craving.

It's a small location with a bar if you can't wait to eat your sweetness. Oh& they even have mega sized donuts in case your feeling a little crazy. 

I love you Bob!
author: Ashley J.

description: When we arrived at Bob's around 9:30 am, they were already out of the apple fritters and crumb donuts, so we tried the apple pandowdy and a few plain glazed donut holes instead. The apple pandowdy weighed almost a pound! It was tasty enough, but I don't think I'd crave one. We were pretty disappointed they were out of the apple fritters since that's one thing most people rave about in the reviews. If we're in the neighborhood, we may or may not visit again.
author: Devika S.

description: Very disappointing, will not go back at all. I have been three times, to hope for a change and it only got worse. I ordered a dozen of cake doughnuts with glaze at 5pm and was told they make fresh ones at 10pm and to be there to pick up my order at 10:30pm. Well I arrived at 10, also waited in line with 25 people in front of me, to get to the front and be told my order was not only not ready, but not right!! Also they say they don't glaze the cake doughnuts, wow when I've had them glazed before!! Such a horrible experience!! Will not be back.
author: Kristie S.

description:
So this is where everyone is getting those GINORMOUS donuts I've been seeing everywhere on Instagram! Well, you know I just had to go see it for myself, and I definitely was not disappointed! 
The shop itself is small and tight on the inside, yet it truly has that mom and pop nostalgia to it, which makes it even more inviting and comforting to grab a seat at the bar and consume your sweet treat while you watch the friendly cooks make more! 

I highly recommend getting their famous huge donuts (which are about $8 and a little bigger than a dinner plate!), but get there early, because this place is so popular and they run out fast! 

Everyone who works there seems to enjoy seeing both tourists and locals getting a kick over seeing these behemoth doughnuts, as well as all their other delicious regular sized donuts, which made our doughnut-run experience even more pleasant! 

A must see in Russian Hill!
author: Kyrie S.

description:
As another night of fun and camaraderie came to a close in SF my friend noticed the line of people in front of Bobs. It was around 12:30AM. I wouldn't call myself a donut person in any regards but I wanted to accompany my friend while she sobered up. 

I did my due diligence for this place after the fact and it turns out that we did all the necessary things to make our experience very similar to the other reviewers that gave this donut shop such high praise.

- Visited the shop during the sweet-spot period: 12-2AM when the donuts and pastries are at their freshest.
- Noticed that the line cook was deep frying a batch of cinnamon rolls and decided to order that as we were guaranteed it would be freshly made.
- The visit occurred after a night of at least a moderate level of alcohol consumption where the mind state is slightly altered but slowly recovering.

My friend and I were *very* happy at our cinnamon rolls, which we consumed with sips of milk. Each bite was simply perfect - the dough was still quite warm and very fluffy and pillowy so that it easily dissolved in your mouth AND there was just that right amount of glaze so that you can taste it but you can still taste the dough. I don't like too much glaze on my rolls as it can make a roll just taste more like sugar and make it past the sugar threshold for me.

Keep in mind that for a perfect repeat visit the following conditions I listed earlier must apply. I can't visit later in the day as that would ruin my appetite for the next meal and the dough wouldn't be as fresh. From previous experiences with donuts I don't appreciate them as much when I'm stone-cold sober, even if it was paired with great coffee. Should I find myself in the area again late night after a good drinking session, I know where to go to sober up. I also hope that the stars align and we find ourselves in the front of the line when the apple fritters are being made.
author: Isabella B.

description: Have you ever had a deliciously doughy donut BIGGER than you face? No? Then, you MUST experience this place! They are open 24/7 and have a variety of Big Ass Donuts!
author: Christine M.

description: I wanted to try this places because it's well known, and supposed to be outstanding! It wasn't bad, however I've had far better donuts. The donuts just tasted old and oily, which I know is part of coming in when they haven't been freshly made. But the almond ring was really dry, I had a couple bites and it wasn't bad I'm guessing it's delicious fresh. Unfortunately, when I had it it was obviously old and so I can't rate it assuming how good it must taste fresh. The Apple Pandowdy was actually gross though. It left that film of oil around your mouth which is not something I wand when I'm already feeling guilty for splurging on such a dense sweet treat. You can tell they just use their old unsold donuts and chop them up and mix them with apples and icing to make this. It looks glorious, however the taste was pale in comparison. I'd recommend maybe just  trying their regular donuts and coming when they are making them fresh.
author: Kathleen F.

description:
I got to try these oh-so-popular donuts due to my brother snatching a box at night and waking up to these donuts in the morning!

My brother said he waited in line for 40 mins in order to snatch some of these babies up. According to him, these are supposedly the best donuts in the SF area; thus, I had high expectations. 

The Original Glaze is my favorite so far. It was super doughy and chewy which I really enjoyed. Compared to Krispy Kreme's donuts, these are way more doughy, chewy, and less sweet. You don't feel that unhealthy while eating these because they don't taste overly oily and sweet. The original glaze is a classic but a must-try for good donut shops. You just gotta try the classics first before rollin' into the wild ones. 

The Maple Glaze was a good runner-up. I still liked the original glaze more; however, these were still pretty good. These were sweeter than the original glaze and it obviously had a maple syrup kinda flavor to it. This is a must for the syrup lovers out there!

The Apple Fritter was my least favorite I'd got to admit. I know people go nuts for these but apple and cinnamon flavors aren't my favorite flavors in the entire world. It's also probably because I ate this one last, which was over a 3 day span. So obviously the Fritter wasn't fresh, hot, or crispy anymore. However, I still thought this was good! 

Final verdict: If I ever get a chance to stop by Bob's Donuts again, I'd definitely will! I hope to try other flavors and their donut holes, even the gigantic donut sounds super good. Possibly I can finish it in 3 mins and win a cool shirt? Maybe.
author: Amy H.

description: A great greasy donut after a night of drinking and fun... open 24 hrs and very friendly.  We got the monster donut as a birthday/ cake ... cheaper than the parking garage for dinner  only $11.00 after tax
author: Jay T.

description:
When I read about the donut challenge at Bob's, I just had to try it. I gave them a call, placed an order for three of the ridiculously large donuts, and came in at 7 AM to give it a shot with two of my cousins. None of us finished the donuts in the allotted three minutes, but I got close and finished three quarters of it. Once the time was up though, my eating didn't stop. Even after consuming what is probably the equivalent of 9 donuts, I kept picking away at the addicting donut. IT'S THAT GOOD. 

Although I knew Bob's is highly regarded, I thought the challenge donut wouldn't be as amazing as the regular donuts. I guess I figured it would be just about the quantity and not the quality, but I was wrong! Instead of the sheer size of the donut being the most memorable aspect, I found that the amazing taste was the most memorable part. Bob's makes the best old fashioned donut out there; no doubt about it. I definitely want to come back and try more than just the glazed donut.
author: Naeem B.

description: Always fresh and they are always open!! Sometimes their is a line at 2 in the morning, but its worth it!! Everything I have tried so far (and thats alot) is great!! Have not tried something that my family and I were like Meh too....
author: Jan-marie V.

description: Very unassuming shop. I nearly walked past it! Apple fritter is incredibly delicious and enough for two.
author: Carla S.

description:
So sad... Wanted to love this place after a long time ago remembering it was on Saveur's  Magazine list of top donut shops in the US. 
Not quite sure if was the late hour in which we stopped by to satisfy our sweet tooth, although the owner and his wife were in the process of making, frying and putting out freshly baked donuts. We ordered a couple raised glazed, a cake chocolate sprinkles and a couple glazed donut holes. Not impressed.... The raised were so greasy and overly sugary, actually made my children throw them away in the trash--- what? Kids throwing away donuts?!?! (Insert sounds of screams). The cake sprinkles donut was like a dried up, wrinkled, pathetic round version of a donut. 
O'well. Onto other donut vision quests...
author: Danielle G.

description:
Not a late night guy these days.
But that's the nice thing about donuts and sweets in general... there is no clock on it.
Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night... give me MY SUGAR!
Just kidding.
My friend recently asked me stop here and pick up a few things for her.  In doing this, the aroma from the sweets that line their front window and counter immediately drew me to browse.  Two things in particular caught my eye:  apple fritter (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ZQU1I2lkX0rmp2vYiAVt9g&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) and maple bar (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bobs-donut-and-pastry-shop-san-francisco-2?select=snGLOdbHkP8ky5iJpOceTA&reviewid=vFpOZEvBiP8UcermUs3UwA) .  
Let's just say that this isn't that green logo'd franchise place kind of food, this is hearty and heavy as I remember eating them as a kid.  
Walking in, you'll find this to be a throwback place, something you'd remember from the mid '70's.  There are seats and tables on the left and back while the counter and cashier area is to the right.  Polk Street used to be a hot nightspot, but things have calmed considerably since the advent of the South of Market.
Definitely a local neighborhood place that I'll visit again.
author: Mike C.

description:
BIG DONUT! I came here once with a friend in the past and really wanted to get their giant donut, but they had run out of the batch they had made in the morning, and they weren't going to make anymore until a lot later in the night, so I ended up leaving disappointed. Last night, I decided to stop by here after dinner in the city, and I was absolutely delighted to see their giant donuts through the window of their shop. The place was super popular at night, and there was a long line out the door (given that their ordering service is quite slow). The staff here are very friendly and the donuts were mouth-watering as we watching them make fresh donuts while waiting in line. 

When my friend and I finally got to order, I decided to go with the regular glazed giant donut. I was so excited to eat it! My friend and I ate a couple slivers of it, as we cut it like a pie. It was really really moist and not overly sweet. I loved it! I brought it back home and can't wait to munch on this donut periodically for the next few days.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Wow. Their crumb donut ($~1) is the best tasting donut I have ever had in my entire life - and I'm really into donuts and have tried many of the best shops in California (incl Dynamo) and on the east coast (i.e. Dough in NYC).

I've personally never been into crumb donuts but this one was seriously the best tasting donut imaginably possible.

I also love that such amazing tasting donuts are priced so affordably - all in the $1 range. Place is also open 24/7.

I highly recommend the crumb donut but not so much the glazed or other donuts even if they're right out of the fryer - they are good but in my view, not exceptional or meaningfully differentiated from other donut shops.

Just a heads up while they have seating, it's more of a pickup place. The ambiance isn't super amazing.
author: Amy G.

description: I went to Bob's donut after concert at Social Hall around 10 PM. My boyfriend and I were slightly hungry and luckily bobs donut was open! I got the donut holes and they were good! Surprisingly around 10 PM they were popping! They had a good variety of donuts and I was afraid they would be limited since it was so late but luckily I was wrong! Definitely check this place out!
author: Katty X.

description:
The donuts look very appetizing, and they really do have some that are the size of your face. The reason for my "Meh" review is the counter person. The little old lady who packages your donuts and takes payment needs to do something else in the business. She was short in patience (bad bad bad customer service), and right after handling boxes and putting drinks in the fridge, used her bare hands to pick up the donuts we requested and put them in the boxes (2 dozen). To be sure, she did have the small square of white wax paper nestled in the palm of her hand, but she used all five fingers to grip and handle the donuts! Then after taking payment, she went right to the next patrons order without washing her hands. After such a long trek to get to this highly reviewed donut shop, we had to try them...grossness aside. 

So yes, if we got sick or anything started growing from our tongue it would have been completely our own fault at that point. LOL.

The donuts were meh and greasy. I've definitely had better, but my favorite spot is all the way in Pinole at A La Mode donut shop :-( . I would still say its worth maybe trying this spot IF they would reassign the little old lady (is she the owner? Maybe she should stick to the books), and reassess their grease. I'm sure that on a good day she can be very charming and not annoyed and frazzled by every customer with a large order, and I'm sure she usually washes her hands before handling food with her bare fingers, but she wasnt and she didnt that day, hence my review. 

On the positive note, the young girl donut maker looked like she really knew what she was doing!
author: Veteran m.

description:
Just ok.  Nothing special.

My donut credentials: Top Pot, Donut Plan, Kane's LaMa'rs, Union Square, Knead, Allie's.
author: Chuck A.

description: Even at 7 pm the donuts were still fresh and really delicious. I am definitely planning to come again!
author: Nida Ö.

description: Polk street often gives me a slum feeling.. I was just happy to find this place. Felt like having a piece of SF history when you buy a donut and have coffee here at 6am in the morning.
author: Paul T.

description: Fresh & H.O.T. I'd walk up hill both ways for these donuts. You can buy the freshly made donuts in the display window or you can get a hot donut right out of the fryer. Just ask for a hot one, it'll be worth the extra wait.
author: Leann H.

description: I walked a mile and a half out of my way to try this place out on a buddy's recommendation when I was visiting San Fran. It was worth the walk.  If I had made the walk out the first day rather than the last, I would have likely made the walk every day. The crumb donut and the cream filled crumb donut were my favorite. I have had a better fritter, but this one was pretty dang good.
author: Mark L.

description:
One time, I walked a mile each way, uphill, to grab these donuts at about 11pm. Another time, I ordered from Grubhub to have them delivered. These are really good donuts.

The Apple Fritter is absolutely amazing, especially when you're drunk, with the right amount of spices in every bite. The raised donuts are fluffy and the crumble is yummy. I have not tried the Big Donut yet, as it feels sort of a special occasion sort of deal.
author: Brandi R.

description: I stumbled into Bob's one evening after indulging in the bars of Polk Street, but nevertheless excited to sample some of Bob's donut finery.  We double parked and made a mad dash inside, selecting the freshest of their assorted favors, including their highly acclaimed Apple Fritter.  Now keep in mind- I consider myself a pastry aficionado with highly discriminating taste buds.  I'm not easily impressed!  That said, in no way was I prepared to experience a pleasure so intense, that a deep, inner moan escaped me after sinking my teeth into my warm, crispy on the outside, soft & moist on the inside apple fritter.  Sweet, rich, amazing. Carnal.  Do not live your life without this experience. Go immediately, take your loved ones, and savor the incredible deliciousness of Bob's Donuts.
author: Christina V.

description: I tried only one donut here but man oh man did I wish I got a dozen. 24 hours Bob's donuts is a small pick and go kind of shop that serves the classic simple delicious donut. They offered an assortment but I can only unfortunately opine on the delicious crumb donut and OMG that crumb donut was super soft and moist coupled with a spectacular slight crunch from the crumbs. Just excellent execution and quality of a donut. Great place for some good quality, cheap donuts!
author: Michelle L.
Alexandria T.

description:
Very solid doughnuts best eaten when fresh.  My friends and I came by after a late night out and the glazed and chocolate donuts definitely hit the spot.  The cake versions were great too, moist without being overly heavy.  I'd pass on the custard-filled though as it tasted like that from any other shop.

When you come by, do make note of what's being freshly made as those will invariably taste the best.  Thankfully, should be very easy given the high turnover.
author: Eric F.

description:
Get the chocolate/ maple glazed donut with filling!

filling is light, texture of donut is light too. Slightly too sweet to my likings. But they are great ! 

Expect a line
author: Hester D.

description: Fresh af freaking donuts, only 4 stars because too much sugar frosting imo, but I'm a health nut. Walked past this place since we were in the area and would gladly walk past here many more times!! We got the apple fritter donut and old fashion glazed!
author: Acacia O.

description:
Bobs is seriously the BEST! Everything is super tasty and the massive donut is legendary!
Definitely worth visiting!
author: Jennifer G.

description: If you're looking for donuts that aren't fancy but are delicious with great service. This place is for you. There's not a huge selection just your basic glaze, maple, chocolate, old fashioned, sprinkled donuts and you should not leave without getting their apple fritters. Especially when they are freshly made. So glad we decided to come by. Everything was delish!
author: Elaine D.

description:
I am not a donut fan but this place always get my attention.  I always see a long line when I walk by there (I live in that neighborhood).

Today I passed by there around 2:30pm and surprisingly there was no line.  I ran in and got half dozen donut hole and a sugar donut.  

Omg the donuts were so good.  It was fluffy, crispy and not too sweet.  So regret that I got two kinds....I should get more to try .
author: Liza T.

description:
I like big donuts and I cannot lie...this place is just wrong (yet so right) on so many levels. Ginormous donuts that have to be shared (unless you're interested in being put into a diabetic coma, that is). Of course this place would be located near several gyms (one being mine, of course), so it was only a matter of time before I would stumble upon this place on my walk to/from the gym.

And stumble I did...right into several donuts, both big and small. It doesn't help that there's a constant line outside this place, and a full window displaying the "goods", giving folks even more time to decide on their options...and how bad they may want to ruin their diets. But trust...it's all worth it!

Likes:
-donuts galore (just think of it as donut heaven)
-variety of options
-CHEAP (and that's hard to come by in this city of cranes and high rents)

Dislikes:
-it's so hard to say no to these freshly-made donuts!!
author: Tracy T.

description: Bob's donuts has the best donuts I've ever tasted! I've been here twice, once late at night and once during midday. They didn't have much variety when we showed up midday, and although the donuts weren't fresh, they were still delicious. Buying their donuts at night time is a completely different story though! Be prepared to wait in line for the freshest, yummiest donuts you've ever tasted. The line goes by pretty quick. If you can, try to get them to go. The inside is very small and there's hardly anywhere to sit.
author: Anita F.

description: These donuts are completely worth the line outside you'll probably have to wait in. Whatever the amount of donuts you're thinking about getting...add 2 to that and that's what you should get. These donuts are cake donuts with classic flavor options. It's a San Francisco must.
author: Olivia D.

description: Best doughnuts n town; ask any police officer! (And I really have!) good selection, including monster big doughnuts. Get a tee shirt too!
author: Douglas A.

description: If Bobs ever closes, San Francisco can be reduced to an ashy heap and I would no longer care. Amazing donuts and one of those classic SF spots I cling to as the city turns into a nonstop parade of hoodie-clad phone-staring sneaker monkeys standing in 2-hour lines for $15 ramen. Plus, my wife drunkenly left her purse at Bob's one night after getting blitzed on fritters and the staff had it waiting for her. I love you, Bob's. Never change.
author: Drew H.

description: Caramel glazed donut was absolutely amazing! The girl working behind the corner was super sweet because it was our first time there. She recommended all of the fresh items available and not one thing we ordered was disappointing. Can't wait to go back
author: Kerry G.

description: Don't get me wrong the donuts from here are really good, but I think it's the pricing that needs some work. I ordered a dozen of regular glazed donuts and I was surprised I didn't get a discount. Usually, other donut shops would be selling a dozen for slightly cheaper since all the donuts were glaze but that wasn't the case at Bob's Donuts. When I was told it was $18 for a dozen I was disbelief because again I thought there would be a discount but none was present. Besides that their donuts are really good and would recommend it to everyone.
author: S M.

description:
To be honest,  I don't even like sweets, normally.  Bob's was a suggestion from someone that knows me and my lack of a real sweet tooth.  I'm the dude that prefers another slice of steak at the end of a meal..  not fresh scoop of soft serve or the last bite of that "killer" tiramisu.

I checked this place out on a whim after hearing about how good these circular rings of Heaven would be after a long day of hiking followed by bar hopping.  Holy cow!  I tried an apple fritter that was fresh out of the oven, and now, I'm a changed person.  Go to Bob's.  Get *anything* fresh out of the oven.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Kendall B.

description: Procuring a donut bigger than my head stands as a momentous occasion in my life. I easily settled on the chocolate with sprinkles variety, and walked in and out of the little shop that is Bob's with a satisfied smile on my face, clutching my prized pink box. Minus $9 but plus immeasurable happiness. I actually didn't expect the donut to be amazing since there was a possibility that the size factor could render it gimmicky more than anything, but rest assured that it is quality. The outside was gently crusty while the inside doughy, with the only sweetness coming from the chocolate topping so a good balance of fried bread flavor and sugar. I was ready to brave a nightmarish parking ordeal in order to get my giant donut, but I think I majorly lucked out--really, the donut and I were meant to be--and found a spot right around the corner on Van Ness without any circling around. GO!
author: Amy G.

description: The maple donut is absolutely amazing. I have had a lot of donuts in my life and bob's is just the best.
author: Tina L.

description: Got donuts here every day of our stay in San Francisco. I loved the powdered raspberry jelly and my boyfriend loved the vegan glazed (he's not vegan, it's just that good and slightly less sweet than a regular glazed) The staff could not have been nicer and they even gave us a donut hole on the house. So lucky our hotel was only a few blocks away because we could not get enough.
author: Marlee B.

description: Best donuts ever! They're fluffy, perfect consistency and flavor is just sweet enough to make you want to go back for seconds or even thirds! I love all their flavors so try whichever you prefer because it's all good!
author: Judy N.

description: Second attempt as street parking is limited a success! Delicious soft doughnut, got the custard filled and the do not skimp. Also had to get the jumbo for the photo op
author: R W.

description:
So much yes!!! 
First, the donuts are delicious. Fluffy and sugary delightful selection.
Second, there is a donut challenge to eat a donut the size of your head in two to three minutes!!!!
The woman working there was a sweet woman who was very friendly as well as the shop is popular! From regulars to new customers the door was always opening so go early.
author: Victoria R.

description:
I realize that for many this is Mecca when it comes to fried dough, but not for this cowpoke and his gal. We are in our 50's, meaning we have seen a few donuts in our time, and these were just sad. 
We consider ourselves fans of all things donut and that's why we were so disappointed with this place. 
The donuts here are over fried, plain and simple, making for one ugly donut, not to mention bad tasting (I told you not to mention that). 
Sorry kids, but if this place were not in the middle of your drinking district, and hence your hunger for something fried, 
then this place would  solely be an outpost for the lonely and bereft... 
and cops.
author: Taz B.

description: I was in from Chicago and I had found this place on one of those Business Food Insider videoclips scrolling thru Facebook. I loved it the moment I walked in, they've been around for decades and everything inside still looks original - I dig the vintage!! Their coffee list is kind of weak & generic at best. Now let's get to the big ass donut here, first off its AMAZING! It's definitely huge so scarfing it down in 2 minutes or less isn't for the weak of stomachs (you get a t-shirt & your name on the wall if you do). They offer it in different kinds but I with the glazed, cause how can you go wrong!? It's one of those places to me where I would just have to stop in every time I go and visit San Francisco. So if you're in this town, scope this joint out!
author: Mark S.

description:
I did not like the donut. It was fresh but not great tasting at all. Maybe the other reviews built it up too much? 
It was a buttermilk donut covered in chocolate. It felt like eating a piece of lard it was so greasy. 
Had one bite and that's it. Really not worth the hype. 
The place is not what I would call clean.
author: Marie Chantale S.

description:
It had been years since I visited Bob's, but after stopping by at Anjalee Thai Massage next door, I had a hankering for a donut.  It's a good thing that the time between visits has not lessened the quality of the donuts!

Even though it was an early Sunday evening, there was a moderate line as I took a look at the donuts on display.  I ended up getting a chocolate frosted raised doughnut, and this warm and freshly made creation was awesome!  It was so good, I told my friend that I would do Bob's Donut Challenge on my next birthday in a food-induced dopamine haze! As a bonus, it was nice seeing them make the donuts in real time, inspiring me to consider a career in the donut arts.  Hey, if I could make donuts as half as good as what they make at Bob's, I'd be in carb heaven!
author: Keith H.

description: I would have loved to review the donuts but they didn't have any of the kind I wanted. No raised donuts at all. I was told the giant donut would be an hour and only if I ordered ahead.  No cinnamon rolls. The website makes it seem there are always donuts. Always giant donuts. It would have been nice to know I needed to pre-order.
author: Christy T.

description:
Love this old school non fancy donut shop!
Had the pleasure of having a freshly made apple fritter the last time in. Divine!
I walk here every time I'm in town. Good stuff!
author: Doug S.

description:
The donuts at Bob's speak for themselves. Don't say you haven't been warned: these donuts are seriously addictive.

Any donut just out of the fryer is melt in your mouth, sugary, gooey heaven. The maple one is to die for and even a simple warm glazed one is perfection. I can't wait to try the apple fritter. 

The shop is simple with trays of donuts at the windows inviting you in and stacks of pink boxes in the back waiting to fill the inevitable large orders. It's open 24/7 and the prices are unbeatable. If I lived near Bob's Donuts, I'd be here every night.
author: Shira W.

description:
Absolutely the best doughnuts anywhere. 
Homemade, fresh, great atmosphere. 
Visiting from Florida and stumbled across this place, WOW. 
Actually ate doughnuts for dinner there one night and left full !!
If you are in San Fransisco stop by, you will not be disappointed.
author: David D.

description: This place is amazing. It's open 24 hours and the donuts are freshly made. I had the apple pandowdy and I highly recommend it if you like Apple fritters. On top of the amazing food, the customer service was welcoming and friendly. I'll definitely go here again.
author: Nerise M.

description:
They weren't messing around when they said the Apple Fritter was fiyah...

I've been to Bob's on a few occasions now... having failed the Donut Challenge once and being scarred forever from the experience. 

Now I can just line up and be at peace with myself and enjoy their Apple Fritter, cause it's that good. 

Bob's is as good as it gets when it comes to donuts and pastries in the city.
author: Sam K.

description:
The best thing and worst thing is I live within walking distance of this place. The donuts make me extremely happy, especially when I get whatever just came out and is fresh. I love getting donuts a little warm, with some milk...and these are perfect for that. My favourites are the glazed old fashioned donuts, and the rich buttermilk loaves. Before I moved nearby, it was an ordeal to visit Bob's so they were a nice treat. Let's just say I went out of my way to get them when I was about to have surgery. My rationale was if I didn't wake up after the operation, I might as well enjoy a delicious buttermilk loaf before I died! My 13 year old also loves them, so whenever she visits, we go visit there. It's a great place to take out-of-town visitors, and Good Vibrations is also across the Street with a vibrator museum, if you want to really entertain your folks (Going to Good Vibes for an event was how I found out about Bob's !haha)!

1 star redacted because I dislike waiting in lines that end up in narrow doorways- especially as a person who uses a walker for ability. People are trying to squeeze past you, and I get anxious and pissed for experiencing feeling like an obstacle, when there is a long queue.
author: Robin W.

description: Stumbled by this hole-in-the-wall place on Nob Hill a few times, there was almost always a line and I couldn't resist getting a couple donuts for myself. Very affordable and delicious, no wonderful it's so popular! The lady working at the counter was very sweet as well. If you need your sugar rush, look no further.
author: Rick B.

description: People come here for the giant donut. Which had flies buzzing all around. The cream filled was pretty good. Everything else was subpar. I would avoid. There are better options
author: Chad E.

description: First of all I will say that the donuts are DELICIOUS! That said, I don't know what type of oil they are fried in but hunty hunty let me tell you -- those donuts tore my stomach up! I mean all of us - hubby and son - we were nauseous. Now we all know that donuts aren't the most healthy and in fact , fried dough with sugar is anything but healthy. However, my intestines are on fire the morning after. I normally eat healthy and this was a treat night situation so my body was probably shook by the infusion of grease and sugar, but we ALL were racing for the bathroom. Maybe it is the type of oil used to fry the donuts? But like I said, they were delicious. Great going down but hell on earth going out! Have the Pepto Bismal ready!
author: Kathryn S.

description: I am bewildered why people love this place.  Donuts are like sex, even when it is bad it is good.  Well, this disproves that saying.  These donuts are worse than grocery store donuts.  Honestly move on.
author: Michael C.

description:
Old fashioned chocolate donuts are to die for.
This shop is a block away from my house and I cannot have enough of these sugary treats!
author: Aditi S.

description:
Its a donut shop.  Donuts were all good.  Apple fritter was crispy and greasy, what I was expecting.  Kind of cool about being open 24/7.  One of the cheapest things I ate in SF

Steve
author: Steve M.

description: I love donuts, and moving to the Bay Area gave me quite a shock: No. Dunkin'. Donuts. But .. but .. America RUNS on Dunkin'! Anyway, I was happy when my friend, a SF native, suggested Bob's after a night of a few libations. The line was pretty intense even at (somewhat early, "late night"-wise) 10:30 pm, but we were not leaving without some donuts. I loved my raised chocolate donut but it needed something - JIMMIES (sprinkles). For some reason, only cake donuts can be blessed with sprinkles. I don't think I'm alone when I say: Add sprinkles to the raised chocolate donuts! Please. :)
author: Sarah B.

description: Omg I finally got so lucky when I was at Bob's that they were making the French Donuts it has been so long and so many tries that I have gone to Bob's and they have not had the French Donuts it's always a sad occasion but today they had them so I must write a 5-star review the chocolate French Donuts are so good they melt in your mouth they are one-of-a-kind truly amazing worth every penny it is one of my favorites sweet items ever Omg I'm going to remember this for a while!!! Mmmmazing!!!
author: B A.

description: Donuts have never been my favourite treat. Now that I have delighted myself eating in this donut shop I adore donuts. I tried the challenge donut, a chocolate cake donut and a maple donut
author: Adrián B.

description: I haven't had a donut in over 3 years...and I'm better off because of it.  When I heard about Bob's Donuts I had to break down.   The guy recommended the apple fritter which was fabulous.  He also said "ya gotta try a crumb cake" so I did.  Also excellent.  If I never eat another donut I'm satisfied.
author: Andy P.

description:
I had a friend who now lives in the East Coast who always boasted of Bob's Donut shop. She would literally come here during the wee hours of the night. Being from the South Bay, I never actually felt the need to go to a donut shop, they all were the same to me. I was wrong.

You might think Bob's Donuts is one of those subpar donut places with stale donuts. You might think it's just another Krispy Kreme. These donuts literally melt in your mouth. They're super fresh tasting. That's all that needs to be said.
author: Deepti N.

description: Best donuts I've had in yrs. Im a donut kind of guy these are very delicious.1 out of 10? I give it a 20.
author: Junior R.

description:
I wanted a really fun, unique confection to take the stead of a cake at my wedding. Cakes are great, but kind of boring and not my faaaaaavorite dessert. And, I love donuts. Solution? Giant donut from Bob's!

We stopped in to sample the flavors we wanted for our big day - honestly, I don't need much of an excuse to scarf down on delicious fried dough. We ended up with old fashioned glazed, crumb cake, crumb yeast (favorite, hands down!), and cinnamon.  Bob's was SUPER helpful and had 150 of the freshest donuts ready for us to pick up for our wedding, plus a giant crumb yeast donut for us to slice into. Thanks to bob's, we had the perfect sweet ending to our new beginning!
author: Sherry W.

description: The apple fritter was raw inside but the other batch of fritter was so burned the shop was hardly breathable from smoke. The old fashioned had no cakey center at all, it was all hard. The raised maple was ok. Btw, 70% of the donuts looks bad whether it was very uneven frosting or many smooshed donuts. We were shocked as we've been coming here for years. The young man who rang us up said "the millennials have taken over," when we asked where the ladies were. Not sure if I'll return. So sad.
author: Nicole J.

description: Great find.  We were looking for something sweet to eat on Sunday night.  Fresh donuts that aren't too sweet & not greasy.  The old fashioned glazed was my favorite, my partner loved the apple fritter.
author: Just K.

description:
The young man at the counter could not have been nicer or more patient with my questions, as it was my first visit. He told me what had just come out (the raised doughnuts) so I got two of those. 

Couldn't resist biting into one as soon as I got back to the car: heavenly. Still warm, very soft, perfect dark, slightly bitter/not too sweet chocolate glaze atop it. 

I'll definitely be back, and hopefully I'll have good luck with the parking as I did this time!
author: Maura B.

description: You go here for the BIG A** donut! Thats it! Line wasnt too long, large selection other than the giant donut. Well worth it because it was delicious! Please try the hype! It was also not overpriced.
author: Justin P.

description: Love this doughnut shop. The rise doughnuts are the best especially when you get them fresh from the fryer and dipped in chocolate. Massive drooling will occur. Same goes for their bars. Their crumb donut is good and they have that massive donut that's the size of your head. My all time favorite item here is the apple fritter. I can go on with a buttload of adjectives to describe how good it is but people who go here need to get it. Just look at my picture!
author: Andrew T.

description:
Wonderful Donut Shop! Recommended by a friend as "The best donuts he has ever had" and they lived up to the hype. I don't know if I have ever stood in line for donuts before but if they always tasted like these, I would. 

We split an old fashioned (A+), cinnamon (A++), regular glazed (A+) and, cake with chocolate icing (gave it to our uber driver but I can only imagine it was at least an A+). 

Amazing Donut Shop in Nob Hill area!
author: Rob P.

description: Parking on the street is  hard to find, but it's worth of driving. You can request a huge donut, you can use the picture from yelp if you don't know what to order and they will make it for you. The service are friendly they deserve a tip, the Donut is sooo good. I'll definitely coming back on this place again.
author: Erwin B.

description: The worker dropped the pan full of donuts and put it back on the rack and said "you didn't see that." The place is filthy. The donuts are less than mediocre. Frosting from a tub, and it's not even good. These are either fake reviews or people must not know good donuts or service.
author: Andrea R.

description:
I was super excited to come here for dessert after having dinner in the area. I am a donut fanatic and the fact they also serve the extra big donuts made me want to visit them even more. However, after eating my donut, I thought it was just mediocre. 

The donuts were good, definitely better than other donut shops I have been to in the past, but it wasn't mind blowing. I guess I had high expectations for this place due to their high ratings and 2,000+ reviews. I do like that the donuts are made fresh (or at least they were when I was there) and it's also a plus that they are open 24-hours. However (the deal breaker), the gentleman that helped me out was rude and very unhelpful, which bummed me out even more.

Overall, it's an okay donut shop. I wouldn't mind coming back in the future to try out their other donuts and maybe even get the extra big donut for fun, but I wouldn't make a special trip out to the city just for them.
author: Julia L.

description: Stumbled in here on a drunken night. Never waited in line for a doughnut in my life but ya'll, it was worth it! The huge doughnut was made and glazed right in front of us and it was only $10 bucks. Totally worth it!
author: Kelly S.

description: Chocolate donuts were so fresh and so clean, ain't no body dope ass me, I'm just so fresh and so clean!!! I love you Bob donuts!!! So worth waiting in the cold!
author: Kathleen L.

description: Massive doughnuts!!! Fluffy good stuff! You can't miss them!!! Oh by the way they can make you costume doughnuts!
author: Alexis Z.

description:
I don't know how to convey to you how tasty these donuts really are. Let me just describe a few in detail and let you make your own judgement. 

Old fashioned original glazed: firm on the outside, glazed to perfection and soft and just moist enough inside to get the delicate doughy flavor. 

Apple fritter: crispy conglomerate of dough straight out of the fryer and immediately dipped into a special glaze, filled with chunks of cinnamon sugar apple intertwined with melt in your mouth dough.

Chocolate bar: do you like chocolate like, a lot? If so, then just get this because the chocolate glaze is to die for.

I'm making myself hungry for a donut #cheatday
author: Maya R.

description:
Nothing special about this place. Your typical generic donut shop. One of my least favorites. Breading is hard and thick for their thinner ones. The glaze crumbles and falls each time you take a bite. Super deep fried and oily. 

Their custard ones are decent, only because the custard overshadow the dryness.

Service is good but not spectacular.

How this place got over 2000 reviews with 4 1/2 star rating is beyond my compression. What a waste of a drive out here.
author: Marian L.

description:
Best donuts in SF hands down. Seriously, believe the hype for this one. It's always pretty busy so there isn't really a time when it's "slow"... also, parking sucks here. The donuts here are always so fluffy and warm. They're constantly making new batches to provide fresh ones for customers. I will be back for more...

Def worth trying and finding parking for! Plus, the staff is incredibly nice. Thank you Cesar!

PS: TRY the donut holes. So worth indulging in.
author: Stefany Z.

description: They do classic donuts very well. They don't need the flrou frou. Just with the classic donuts, I think they're better than the donuts you pay too much money for. They seem to always make donuts, so they're always fresh. Popular.
author: Patty A.

description:
The special thing here is the way they do the filled doughnuts. They slice the doughnut in half, then put the filling in like a sandwich. This solves the two problems I have with filled doughnuts: 1) gummy dough surrounding the filling, 2) not enough filling!  So what you have is a doughnut torte! :-)  Some are bar shape and some are round shape. The only difference is in the shape. 

I got the cinnamon roll, apple fritter, and a pastry cream filled (the yummy pudding kind) with chocolate icing. The filled doughnut was the best. Through the cinnamon roll and apple fritters were good too, but fairly standard.

Then they have these mondo, ginormous showcase doughnuts. That would be insane to eat. Don't even think about that. Oh and ah and move on.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
My dentist's office is super close to bobs donuts so I came here after getting my teeth cleaned (lol)...

Unfortunately they ran out of the big donuts but I got a cake donut and a chocolate donut and they were AMAZING!!! So light and fluffy :)
author: Kelly C.

description:
The home of the best apple fritter in town.

And the best 24 hour donut shop in town.

When I was 22 years old (many years ago), this is where I got the donuts that led to the discovery that donuts go great w bourbon.  

They really do.  

I don't remember what particular bourbon it was.  But I'm confident that any high quality bourbon will pair nicely.  And I blame my bestie, who was going through a phase where she had to have bourbon sours everywhere we went.

Remember that scene in The Seven Year Itch when Marilyn Monroe realizes that potato chips go great w champagne?  It was just like that, except w Bob's Donuts & bourbon.  

The city's peppered w several other old & divey small donut joints for sure, but Bob's is the creme de la creme.  

This is not Dynamo.  Apples & oranges!  Nothing gourmet, hipster, or organic here.  These are strictly old school.  Like the donuts The Fonz had on Happy Days.   

I do love Dynamo.  But I still love Bob's.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
This place is really old. It's been around for a long time. I've lived in this neighborhood for so long, and I passed by this shop a million times. I finally went in the other week and got one of their donuts. 

The reason why I've never really cared to try it was because I thought the donuts displayed in the window looked old and stale. Boy was I wrong! 
The donuts here are good! I was pleasantly surprised.  

I got the crumb donut. My nieces got the chocolate with sprinkles. They liked it too. It doesn't have that greasy oil taste like some donuts do at other places. The coffee wasn't great but it was cheap. It went perfectly well with the donut. 

I don't care if this place is a hole in the wall, they know how to make the donuts. 
How do you really spell it? Doughnut, or donut?
It's always been a mystery for my niece.
author: Edie G.

description: We came to bobs donuts twice but this last time the donuts had this odd burnt flavor. It tasted like the oil was old. We had a hard time getting the awful flavor out or our mouths and ended up throwing them away.
author: EJ A.

description: Nothing that special about the donuts here. They are overpriced. Place is grungy. I just don't understand what the big deal is. The donuts are soft but that's like any other donut.
author: Sofia J.

description: So I found this hole-in-the-wall place on SpoonUniversity where they raved about the donut that's the size of your face. I came around 11 AM and bought the last giant-sized donut and I could tell why people liked the janky place- it was ran by 2 people, one older woman who was really helpful and smiley, and a younger dude who was working the donut fryer. They don't use extensive over-the-top machines like Krispy Kreme but instead just have one stove to fry all the donuts. The donut was huge but $12...not sure if it's worth the price but cool joint!
author: Amy T.

description: You guys ever dreamed of a donut melting in your mouth on the first bite?! This place makes your dream a reality! Hands down this is the best place for a warm glazed donut! I've never been more addicted to donuts ever in my life until I came here! If you can try to get their fresh out of the oven glaze donuts and trust me your life will change and you will never be able to go back to all the other donuts in the past!
author: Kimberly D.

description: I was over the moon with these heavenly delights!! Was slightly intimidated by the line but it's really not that bad. It's a very small shop and you order near the entrance. Def worth the wait for these FLUFFY bites of heaven! Glaze and maple were 5 star!!
author: Danielle H.

description: The doughnut bites taste like tasty melted butter and sugar especially when they come straight out of the fryer ! I also tried their chocolate croissant which is average-- Tartine's is much better.
author: Y W.

description: The best donut holes I've ever had. The lady in the counter is super friendly. The first time I went there and ended up going there four days in a week after that. The donuts have a very nice texture to it. Only issue is the parking if you are driving in that neighborhood. I always wanted to try the crumb donut but the always run out. If you're in the area definitely a place to visit.
author: Saurav S.

description:
Step 1. Get pumped & listen to Aesop's Rock song, "Fryerstarter" about Bob's Donuts.
Step 2. Walk down the street after eating pounds of prime rib to Bob's Donuts. 
Step 3. Ask what's fresh/hot/just made.
Step 4. Order those doughnuts. If these doughnuts are not the buttermilk doughnuts, order chocolate/maple buttermilk doughnuts in addition.
Step 5. Consume doughnuts shamelessly. 

I've never had doughnuts like Bob's Donuts. As tasty, as fresh, as moist, as crisp, and as warm. Sweet-- but not TOO sweet. If you ever get anything from here, let it be the tasty buttermilk doughnut. I cannot emphasize how good it is. 

We also got some apple fritters and some normal chocolate and glazed doughnuts. The apple fritters were absolutely BOMB. The normal doughnuts were average and not anything special. However, the buttermilk and applefritters seriously make-up for it.
author: Andrea K.

description: So delicious!!! One of these donuts after a few drinks- definitely worth the wait in the line. Also, no shame, I definitely bought an apple fritter for breakfast and it still tasted fresh when I ate it in the morning.
author: Sarah T.

description: We got tickets for the BIG B bus for the weekend where yoy hop on amd hop off and did the night tour on cold night and our tour guide we had said this was the BEST donuts in town. So there wasn't and actual stop near by where we can get off and try it out, so the next day right before we left town to head up to Napa Valley, me and my wife stopped by to try it out and ohhh man this was the spot.  Freshly made and great service.  Definitely a spot we'll be stopping by when ever were in SF.
author: Jesus A.

description: I'm so lucky I live 5 minutes away and I know the times to go to miss the long line. The line goes by pretty fast though. They have the best crumb donuts, long Johns, glazed etc
author: Angel P.

description: These are the best donuts I have ever ate and they have great customer service. Literally no other donut shop compares they are ridiculously delicious
author: Balveen M.

description:
This place is open 24/7! At first, my friend and I were skeptical about going to a donut shop past 1am in the city; however, this place was well lit & you can see the donuts being freshly made which was nice! Most of the cooking and coffee making is done right in front of you so you don't have to worry about how the food is being handled. The people there were kind enough to assist you with every need; however, it would be nice if they could smile or show they are welcoming a bit more. I know it was late, but this place was delicious and I wouldn't want their customer service/ presentation to be lacking. 

They have a wide variety of donuts, but at night they keep it to a few kinds. I recommend getting whatever they are cooking fresh that day/ night! Comes out soft and warm which makes it much more enjoyable to eat in my opinion. 
The crumble donuts are SO GOOD. 

Overall, we were thankful for a late night coffee spot to be open after attending a concert that ended late since we had to drive back to Sacramento right after.
author: Amrita P.

description: Donuts are made fresh and very delicious BUT The clips and the photos of this shop is deceiving. The shop was not welcoming. It is tiny and has almost no room for a big group. It was messy and dirty looking, and no public restrooms. It also does not have a menu list with prices so you don't know how much you'll be spending until they pack it up for you. (I got a dozen: 4 glaze, 4 oldfashion, 4 sprinkles for $16. My sister got 6 glaze, 6 sugar for $18. We were confused about the difference since I asked for customized purchase.) Adding on, the staff (specifically the older Asian woman) was not polite. I get it...people have long days...but she knew this already working at a popular shop. (She huffed and puffed when I had misheard her and she had to do the extra work of putting donuts back.) She also didn't use gloves or tongs or wasn't careful when handling purchases. For these reasons, I won't go back and I'm giving them 2 stars.
author: Julie L.

description: I'm no SF local and as an outsider, it's absolutely refreshing to visit a place with so much character and history. It's a small shop with THE MOST delicious donuts I've ever tried. However, that was not the only highlight! The naturally warm welcome of the older lady behind the counter stroke me. The cordial older locals that hang out there in the morning while reading their newspaper stayed embedded in my memory. This place just makes me smile... if you're in SF, don't miss Bob's magic!
author: Varenka R.

description: Pretty good donuts, but definitely on the pricey side. Our favorite is the creme brulee, which is unique and delicious. Also got to try the spicy chicken biscuit. Was fresh and covered is sauce, recommend trying that as well. Overall good experience
author: Andrew M.

description:
Came on a super late night on a rainy Saturday! Line was outside the door but ran super fast! 

Well worth it! Tons of choices but I got the following:
-cake cinnamon and sugar: reminded me of larger versions of Trish's donuts at fishermans!! Delicious!!! 
-regular glaze: my husband enjoyed this! 
-maple glazed: my sis enjoyed this! 
Moist and chewy!!! 

They had fresh chocolate donuts! And they were still frying more in front of our eyes!! 

I would say great donut shop, I usually don't like donut shops unless it's stans from Santa Clara or Randy's down in LA but I'm glad I finally got to try this place :) thank God it's open late after bar hopping, how can you resist some good Donuts :))
author: Monica G.

description: Fantastic donuts and service! Definitely one of the best donuts I've had in the world.
author: David S.

description:
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 2

Delicious doughnuts. Any time of day or night. Enough said. 

Seriously, though. Bob's offers every type of classic doughnut you can imagine, and chances are good that whenever you arrive something will be fresh from the fryer. Even at the busiest times (late night weekends) the line goes quick, and this place is crazy cheap - $5 will buy you plenty to share with friends. Great spot!
author: Hannah L.

description:
Where else could I spontaneously get a giant donut at midnight? I really came for the novelty of it (and I was craving something sweet), but to my surprised, it was actually really good. The giant donut fits a whole cake box and the one we got was maple with sugar. The donuts itself was fluffy, the maple was a tad too sweet, but I liked the sprinkles even though it was spill all over me every time I took a bite. 

Overall, I actually really like the donut. Bring a party to share your donut with because it took me at least a week to finish it and then I gave up and thew it away. Sorry, donut :(
author: Sophia Y.

description:
After finishing up a yummy dinner with a friend of mines at Brenda's French Soul Food, we decided to walk over to get some donuts for dessert. I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but I've heard lots of great things about Bob's Donut. I never got the chance to try it and was happy that we went. There was a line out the door on a Friday night at 9PM. The line wasn't too bad but it was sign that I was going to have a pretty delicious treat. I got myself an old fashion donut and my friend ordered an apple fritter and a chocolate one. Can't recall which one it was. The old fashion donut was so good. A classic donut, but it was really moist and not overly sweet. Just perfection!

Price wise, it's very affordable. Disregard the appearance and don't let it deceive you. I find these kind of hole in the walls to be the better places compared to Krispy Kreme Donuts.
author: Connie C.

description: Bob's suddenly disappointing!!Someone tell me what in the world went wrong here...I ordered a few pieces of old fashioned donut with chocolate, apple fritters and fruitcake. I'm a regular but this time I had to get my order and hit the road. I reach for a donut and I get these half sized pieces??? What the hell? Big big disappointment. Not what I saw on the counter. Then the fruitcake thing for my teenage daughter:Disgusting. She was worried it was her tastebuds, so I had a bite and  I had to scrape my tongue to get that fishy rancid flavor out!  Oil gone rancid or what? Bob? What's going on? Do we have to take a bite of each thing to make sure it's alright before leaving...I've never been so disappointed!!
author: Janine M.

description: One of the best doughnut shops I've encountered. If your lucky enough to get a fresh batch you will be impressed. Prices are fair. Service is great. Check them out. I'm there at least 3 times a week!
author: Kevin M.

description:
Ah Bob's the place that I went to after a break up day after day, eating donuts, crying, and watching x-files at the counter. One of the women asked me if I was okay, and I sobbed through the whole story of my break up with a crumb donut in my mouth. That was a low point a few years ago. But I will never forget the kindness of the employees. This place is comfort to me.. I mean how can you not feel comforted by a bunch of warm donuts, staring at you saying "eat me and you'll feel better"?! I usually get whatever is warm (which if you haven't tried yet, you need to head down there asap and try it). No judgement if you also emotionally eat. No shame people! Listen if you've had a break up, lost your job, or needing a way to deal with the lack of gun control laws in this country, or the President and his daily disappointment: Bob's donut is the place. They don't judge they really don't. So if you show up to Bob's please be in a non judgmental state towards yourself. Treat yourself. Eat the big donut just for fun. Don't feel guilty about your trip here. That will be the only thing ruining your experience. So leave that guilt, calorie counting BS at the door. Nothing about these babies are healthy and that's why they are so fucking glorious. 
Please also be aware that there is an elderly woman that works there. Be nice to her, and don't get aggravated if it takes a while for a dozen donuts. Be grateful that you have the luxury of buying some donuts from Bob's. Seriously though, this place is cozy, and glazed with super cool art from locals on the back wall. If you're feeling adventurous, they also have a donut challenge. You must eat the big donut in less than 3 minutes. You'll get your name on top of a list of all the other glorified donut eating champs.
If you haven't been here as a local, shame on you. And if you're visiting, definitely stop by. The donuts are cheap, fresh, and done the traditional way. No over the top icing designs on these babies. I so admire them for staying the same over all these years.

Cheers to Bob's donuts for being delicious 24/7.
author: Alex D.

description:
At first glance, it just looks like an average traditional donut shop. I thought Bob's only got high ratings because of the giant donut novelty or that people come after drinking at the bars. One bite into my crumb donut was enough to disprove my theory. The dough was soft, fluffy, and not overly sweet. 

Note: No fancy donuts here so don't come expecting that. Also I was told giant donuts must be pre-ordered or first come first serve
author: Betty C.

description:
Love the apple fritter here! It's only $2.25 for a fairly large serving size. It's perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

They serve a variety of other donuts including a HUGE glazed donut (enough for a group of people to share). The service here is always great. There's some seating inside and it's open 24 hours!
author: Linda X.

description: Some days you just got to have a donut.  Today was the day. Night was young, belly craves sweets. Haven't had a greasy apple fritter for a long time, years? Apple Fritter please, or was I that formal. He put it in a brown bag, as though that would stop me from engulfing it. I thought I timed it right to get the donut and get on the bus.  Darn, by the time I got to the bus stop, the bus pulled away.  You know what that means, the apple fritter was meant to be eaten. Eaten I did and it was better than I remembered, less greasy, and tiny pieces of apple.  So good, I ate the whole thing and the bag was left with their logo.  Well, I wasn't able to snap a picture of the apple fritter (2.95), but I can at least snap the cute bag.  Poor wasted bag.
author: Helen L.

description: Unbelievably good donuts. The place may not look super inviting but the pastries are incredible.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
Holy moly, Bob's just brought my love for donuts to the next level. 

Like my love was real before but it now runs deep through my sugar coated veins. The classic glazed is what did it for me. Perfectly glazed, perfectly fluffy, and perfectly still warm.

There was a line at 9pm and a flow of freshly cooked donuts to keep the eager patrons happy.

I definitely recommend going by at any time of day because they are open 24/7.
author: Erin B.

description: Fries dough equals heaven  and this place is no exception. My daughter learned they had donuts the size of a cake. She wanted to go the entire time we were in SF. We finally made it on the last day. She got the big do it with sprinkles of course. I tried the apple fritter and then went back and got several more. OMG. They are the best fritters I have EVER had. I live on the east coast. Can Bob's come to my neck of the woods? If I make to San Francisco again I will definitely return.
author: Misty W.

description: Came back to get donuts for the office. Used to come here when I lived in Nob Hill years ago, I'm glad Bob's is thriving and still around!  They always have the freshest donuts, amazing Flavors and variety; prices have gone up a bit, but hey I was coming here 10-12 years ago. Variety includes fresh  glazed, cake raised, old fashioned, chocolate glazed/sprinkles, jelly filled, custard filled, twists, buttermilk bars, and on.  Their apple fritters are a blend of sweet, cinnamony apples, crunchy donut edges and fluffy doughy goodness.  I luv their raspberry donuts and cream filled chocolate glazed.  They also make these HUGE 18" donuts, more like large donut cakes as big as your head! These are sure to be a donut heaven surprise for anyone.  Located on Polk street in Nob Hill, parking is ok, hey it's San Fran.  Must get donuts now....Ggaaaaaa, "think Homer Simpson". So good!
author: Rhondi S.

description: Best donuts I've ever had! I'm normally and ice cream person but whenever I'm in San Francisco donuts are king. Well only BOB's donuts are king. I tried the glaze jelly filled and it was AMAZING!
author: John H.

description: They make the best donut in Bay Area! I don't really know how to explain but they just do. If you haven't try or you thinking should I  try or not. You should go now. There're donuts are fresh and I have nothing to complain.
author: Lily L.

description:
I'm not sure how this place got 4 and a half almost five stars..their customer service is terrible and the shop is so filthy. I would not recommend this place to anyone at all! 

I came here to buy some donuts for my family and my first time experience here was terrible. The old lady who worked during dinner time gave me attitude when I asked for a box. I explained to her that I'll be traveling far with it and instead of understanding she gave me this dirty look. Wth? Then she asks me what I want. I asked her if I can have 2 glazed chocolate donut then  she raises her voice and says "WHICH GLAZED DONUT. WE HAVE A LOT OF THEM!" I told her nicely " the ones by the window. You only have one kind it looks like." Then she talks back to me saying " well we have maple and regular glaze!" I was pretty speechless and got upset that she talked to me that way. I should have just walked out. Ppl behind me looked at us like what's going on. Maybe she got upset because I asked for a box?? I don't know but I would NEVER go back to this filthy shop again.
author: Sora K.

description:
yumyumyum. i've lived here for a good while and never made it by this place. finally!

i just polished off a crumb donut i picked up this morning. no line and we got 2 small crumb donuts and 1 glazed donut for 3.25

glazed donut: soft and delicious. the test of every donut shop. really good. not overly sweet. definitely not like a safeway donut...

crumb donut: soft and cakey, i'd definitely eat another. 

i mean, you really should just go and try them.
author: Vanessa S.

description: I stop by here every time I'm out in SF. I can't help but go for the glazed donuts. This time trying their glazed cake donuts. Normally I wouldn't eat it because of calories but I just their guarantee that their donuts will not get me fat.
author: Vic K.

description: Amazing donuts!!! Our favorites are the apple fritter, raspberry jelly donut, and the glazed old fashioned, but you really can't go wrong. Delicious and affordable bite to satisfy my 1 am sweet tooth.
author: Rachel U.

description: Best, freshest, yummiest donuts EVER. If you haven't been, you MUST EXPERIENCE Bob's.
author: Kate K.

description:
This is the best place to get donuts in the city. Cake and crumb donuts are on point here. 

They've also got a huge donut challenge and if you eat it fast enough you get a shirt and it's free. Alternatively you could bring this to a party as a desert for like 12 people.
author: Eric S.

description: Not a great place to look at but these people know donuts. A must if you're in the area.
author: Matt E.

description: Smelled this bakery as we were bar hopping and knew we would hit it up at the end of the night.  Their donuts are so fresh!!!  Soft and warm and melted in my mouth.  Can't wait to come back here next time I'm in the area.  Oh and the chocolate glaze, plain glaze and maple glaze were what we ate and you honestly can't go wrong with the classics!
author: Marie E.

description: The big donut runs out within 30 mins of them making it so get there early. There's not always a line. The service is good.
author: Zepheena H.

description:
There is Happy donuts, Rolling Pins, and then there is Bob's. This is by far the most amazing, delicious donuts in the WHOLE bay area! Bar None! Anytime my family or I are in the city we make Bob's our lat stop before leaving the city to bring home our shared-and-very-worth-while-guilty-pleasure. 

The donut shop itself is not much to look at, you have your resident panhandler who after 4pm is asking those on line for spare change. Speaking of line...there is always a line! Sometime a short line, sometime a line going out the door and that is A-Okay! The line moves fairly quick and for those (who like me) get anxieties when order you will have plenty of time to make up your mind *wink*
author: Nubia B.

description:
Donuts are fresh, fluffy, and delicious. 

Best part? They're open 24 hours!!
author: Carrie L.

description: Place was dirty. Had a glazed & chocolate bar. Nothing great. Could have been fresher. Bummer as we thought it'd be a lot better based on yelp rating.
author: Marie C.

description:
Yes, there will most likely be a line, but it goes fairly quickly. You cannot go wrong with a french cruller! I am not a huge fan of donuts (my knowledge of them runs as far as Dunkin) so I only came here to indulge my husband. I was however, sincerely and pleasantly surprised as soon as I bit into the french curler. You just have to try it to understand. You will never look at donuts the same way again! 

You see them making the donuts behind the counter. It's cool to watch the glaze go on. It's nice to know that they're fresh! I was however, disappointed that they had run out of custard- filled. I will just have to go again! :)
author: Mariam Z.

description:
This place was delicious ! It was all about taste there which is what I'm looking for . The prices were also very fair . We had the traditional looking maple and sprinkles donut , a raspberry powered jelly donut , and a custard filled chocolate donut . I'd recommend all of them . The jelly was my favorite it was a perfect amount of sweetness , the maple with sprinkles was good especially if you like sweet , and the custard was thick and creamy and very subtle in a delicious way . 

Go to this place and try them all . 

It's got some seating inside for couples but remember don't judge on appearance just got for  great donuts . The window display pulled us in !
author: Rebekah R.

description: Great place for great donuts and coffee! The customer service is amazing and the donuts are even better! I definitely will be going back next week next month next year.
author: ski b.

description: If you are visiting San Francisco or live in San Francisco,  you must try this donut store.  They make everything fresh and keep fresh one all day long. I like their donuts. Because is not sweet but really really good.
author: Pryo H.

description:
This is where I like to spend my calories. I rarely eat this stuff, but these doughnuts are 100% worth it. Perfect balance of sugar and fat. Not overly greasy and not sickeningly sweet. 

Crumb doughnuts all the way!  Maple glazed old fashioned. Regular buttermilk fritter (Apple ones taste like canned Apple). Have both yeast and cake doughnuts which is awesome because half the family likes yeast and other half cake. 

So friendly.
author: Beth K.

description: Best donuts in SF!!! The custard filled chocolate eclairs are drool worthy. Try a buttermilk donut. It will change your life.
author: Joy M.

description:
Place is DIRTY.... the lady made fun of me when I did not pronounced correctly "glazed donut". Which was super super rude, I am sorry English is not my first language lady.

Donuts are good but since the place is so dirty I won't return there.
author: Nathaly M.

description:
YOU MUST GET THE GIANT DONUT!

I know you are looking at the giant donut and thinking "Oh, boy. It seems like a very bad idea." 

And I am here to tell you, it is, in fact, a great idea and you will fall in love with the first bite. If you can't finish it, just share the love with others :)

It's cheap for its size and it is delicious! Get the chocolate glazed. It is the best.

All the other great things have already been said in all the other reviews, so I have nothing to add more other than convincing you to become a fatty and go for that giant donut.

Or become the office or birthday hero for bringing the giant donut instead of a cake. How clever. You are welcome.

You can also add extra topping or cream "filling" for an extra charge, if you would like.

Enjoy
author: Solongo B.

description: Very old donut shop, don't think it's a trendy shop bc it's not. No fuss old school shop open 24/7. Donuts are really fresh even when I'm there at 3pm donut still tastes really good.
author: Teanna T.

description:
RUDE RUDE RUDE. 

I just left this place.  1/27/17 @12:28am

I ordered a croissant for a colleague, and 3 donuts.  The crumb was mine the other 2 for my son.  The order was for 3 different people.  He put the croissant in the bottom of the bag and piled the donuts on top of it.  OH, and he gave me a cake crumb.  He didn't bother telling me they didn't have  the raised crumb.  Last night, the guy made me a raised crumb....that was nice.

I was here last night.  The folks were really nice so I returned.  But the guy tonight?  NIGHT and Day.
He obviously lacked common sense.

I was shocked so I said, can you put the donuts in a separate bag?  He hands me a bag and gives me a wax paper.  Really?

There's 2 people behind me.  It wasn't like there was a huge line.

I asked to quickly borrow his tongs, he ignored me.

The donut maker helped me instead.  He was there last night and he's nice.

I was angry.  I never get angry but this guy was so rude.  I told him, I know you guys get great reviews but it's no excuse to be rude.  I was polite until he was rude!  I left and called him an asshole.  He said I was too. I never call service workers by such names but he made me mad.  THE ARROGANCE IS GETTING TO THEM AND IT WILL BE THEIR DEMISE!!!! I'm calling it now.  Whoever that guy is, he shouldn't be dealing with customers.  He had facial hair and he was white about 6feet tall with dark hair.  If he's working avoid him.

Me?  I'm not spending a dime here.  And trust that my entire network won't be either because of how this guy treated me. FIRE HIM!
author: Ivy M.

description:
PROS- It has a very unique concept because the donuts are so large. Legit larger then the size of your head.

CONS- THE DONUT TASTED SO BAD. It doesn't taste fresh and it was super doughy. Unless you want a picture with eating such a large donut, please don't come here. It's not worth it !!!!

-Kristen

1 star from Kristen. Edmund wasn't here to rate today.
author: Kristen L.

description:
To explain how good this place is, I would have to be smarter.  What they do here does not seem complicated...  This is a 24 hour establishment.  They are constantly churning out amazing warm donuts.  If you have a favorite kind of donut, you'll probably find it here.  Apple Fritters.  Check.  Old Fashioned.  Check.  Sprinkles.  You betcha.  And so much more.

The way to do it here is to ask what is fresh and warm.  You can always find terrific warm donuts.  They are rich and decadent.  When you get a freshly made Donut this is a must try.  I'm not normally Mr. Sweet-Tooth, but the blend of warm-doughy-goodness is perfect.

I'd like to tell you that the majority of my trips did not come after midnight.  That would be a lie.  It is either a blessing or a curse to have this here 24-hours a day.  

Go, Bob's.  Go!
author: Adam S.

description: What. The. How is this even real? Like heaven on earth. Theres been a line out the door Sunday night at 10pm twice now! Crazy. I love you Bob's. I love you. Thank you.
author: Megan B.

description: i've always wanted to try the big donut here, so my boyfriend and i bought the big cake crumb donut for ~$9. it was fresh out of the fryer too! we took it back to the apartment to measure the diameter and the donut was a little over 9 inches haha. the cake crumb was so freaking delicious! because we already ate dinner, we were only able to eat 1/4 of the donut. this was such a great ~$9 purchase. we're definitely come back here for the donuts hehe.
author: Sylvia H.

description: Try the pastry. Try the bear paw. Ask the owner about their T-shirt in medium size (they never have it). But I really come here for one thing. As the sign at the door says "best crumb donuts"...ever.
author: Hyon L.

description:
Expectations lead to disappoint. 

After hearing about all the hype of Bob's Donuts, my friends and I finally decided to make a trip down here to check out the goods. When we came there around midnight, they had freshly baked glazed donuts and chocolate donuts. We came here specifically for the big donuts and when we bit into it, my friends and I could tell it had been sitting out for quite some time. 

The quality of their donuts isn't anything soft like Krispy Kreme but it isn't too doughy either. I'd say it has a nice balance but doesn't have leave a lasting impression for me.
author: Alizen R.

description: Very friendly lady working the place. This place gathers regulars for the service and donuts. I didn't try the big donut but it did look unique. I had the creme donut with chocolate on top and it was delicious! The apple fritter was good as well. It wasn't warm and I'm not sure if she would've warmed it up if asked but either way it was still good. I would go back :)
author: Han N.
