description: This is my favorite donuts store, open 24/7, we can always get fresh donuts even in midnight. So delicious and cheap.
author: Cecilia C.

description:
It's all about the raised glazed and cake crumb!  Hubby got some donuts for us to share.

Chocolate bar had too much cake and the custard inside didn't have much flavor.  Raspberry jelly filled was standard, but still tastier than Mr. Holmes' filled donuts.  Also none of the donuts were overly sweet.  I always love glazed and this one was delish.  The cake crumb donut..omg!  So moist and delicious with the crumbs on top.  I typically don't eat cake donuts but this one, I could have gone for seconds.  

Unfortunately they don't do half dozen or dozen deals.  I'll definitely have to go back and get an occasional sweet treat for us when I'm in the area.  Gotta love that they're 24 hours as well.  I know that there are a handful of drunkards that go here but wouldn't you rather have a cheap slice of pizza when you're drunk?  I think donuts are a little more to be appreciated.
author: Cat C.

description: Not gourmet doughnuts but who cares? This is what a classic doughnut was like when I was a kid. There can be a line out the door but fear not. It moves quickly. And they take credit cards.
author: Teri Y.

description:
The line outside Bob's at 1am in the morning - one word- LONG!

Stopped in after a concert with the wife - this has kind of become our thing - on the hunt for a donut and cup of joe after a concert. 

The glazed donut and donut holes - sold 4 Stars.

The old fashioned and chocolate old fashioned - just ok. 

The service was friendly and with a smile. 

They showed us the gigantic donut for the donut challenge they run there - it was massive - I doubt anyone could eat that much donut in 3 minutes ... If you're out there and you've done it - you rock my friend! 

They are open 24/7
author: Darren F.

description: Amazing donuts always fresh. We have been multiple time and have always enjoyed. On thanksgiving we got a box of 12 and our server put in am extra 2. Great staff
author: Ryan M.

description: We visited Bob's late morning on Saturday, and we were SO disappointed! After reading the rave reviews, we expected something extra-special, but what we got was below average in taste and above average in price. We paid $5.50 for 12 tiny donut holes and one jelly donut. In addition to being much smaller than other local donut holes, they tasted stale (I like my donut holes to be crispy on the outside, but these were hard throughout). My husband's jelly donut was just okay.
author: Karen M.

description: not as great as expected. Didn't have the large donuts to try so ended up trying old fashion and jelly-filled ones. Just OK and not that great.
author: Reza F.

description:
I stopped in here a few weeks ago while checking out my new neighborhood. I had previously seen a line down the street during off hours so I figured this place must be something special.

This place is something special as I don't consider myself a donut person; however the donuts here are fresh, soft and just delicious. I tried a glazed and a chocolate covered both where excellent.

If you have a donut craving then this place is a must try.

Oh and they are open 24 hours and cash only but the prices are incredibly low for SF.
author: Corey H.

description:
Not gonna lie, I came here for instagram. Left with a great photo, a fully belly, and plenty of donuts to-go.

Line moves really fast. Totally worth the wait. Some seating inside the restaurant. Love that you can see them make the donuts right at the front of the store. Made fresh throughout the day. 24/7. Cashier was the cutest grandmotherly figure in the world.
author: linda y.

description: Crack cocaine. This place is a beacon in the neighborhood. Last seen 11pm, crackheads lining up outside for sugar crack. Last seen 8am, more working crackheads lining up for sugar crack. This place is crack cocaine. I don't personally sugar or crack, I prefer salt, but I do enjoy the vibe of the enthusiasm this place brings to the sidewalk.
author: Juls C.

description: Short review here, the fritters are straight fire . We came on and they just pulled a batch out of the fryer. It literally fell apart in my mouth...
author: Jaylen E.

description: Best donuts ever. Open 24/7. I can't ever decide what I want, so I get everything.
author: TravelingHungry ..

description: This is a San Francisco gem. Denis and I are both SF natives but Denis had the honor of bringing me here late on Valentine's Day because he wanted to share the deliciousness with me. Apparently this place is open 24hrs! In the storefront they have their donuts displayed so you can think about what you want before you go on. There a line though! As you walk in there are various donut related art pieces and a few newspaper cutouts and front pages of this place's niche in the Sf culinary and comfort food scene. We got 3 donuts and milk for about $5. The cashier was calm and collected even though the place was super busy and he was the only one working. He even took the time to give me donut recommendations and described the flavors to me since I'm not a donut connoisseur. Donuts were delicious and I would definitely go back there again when there is more of a selection.
author: Gladys M.

description:
As a donut aficionado, I truly wanted to love Bob's, but their yeast donuts fell short of what I consider to be great.  The lady working at the counter was nice and helpful as she patiently suggested I try their most popular item - the apple fritter, which she spoke highly of, saying it was "the best in the world".  I also ordered a plain glazed donut and a chocolate glazed.  

There was a guy hacking loogies in the place, so I decided to get the goods to go.  I was staying only a few blocks away, but by the time I got back to the hotel the grease from the donuts had seeped through the bag, rendering it completely translucent.  It didn't bother me too much though, because if I wanted to be healthy that day I would have had a protein smoothie, not a fried pastry.  Anyhow, I couldn't wait to sink my teeth into those babies so I took a bite of each one successively.  And honestly, I couldn't really tell any of the three donuts apart from each other.  They all tasted the same and were greasy to the point that I could feel the oil gushing out of the dough as I chewed.  The texture was crumbly and dry which is rare for yeast based donuts (unless they're stale and old). But I think I was most disappointed in the apple fritter as I couldn't find any trace of apples in it and especially after the woman raved about it.

I'm willing to give Bob's another chance, say, if someone brought them in and/or they were free, because my friend says the crumb donut was amazing (perhaps it's cake based?) but I won't be going out of my way for these anytime soon.
author: Virginia T.

description:
There's nothing like a hot (or cold) Bob's donut.  The fact that they're open 24 hours and they're constantly making them ensures fresh donuts.  If I'm not there at the right time, they run out of my favorites.  I'm happy with the glazed donut but would love to get an apple fritter soon.

The line moves fast and it's worth going out of your way for these.
author: Susan C.

description: Not breaking any new ground, but this is the single best donut I've ever had. If I could cook these down and shoot them into my veins I would be a junkie living in a box outside the place. The people behind the counter are awesome too, just not intravenous awesome like the donuts.
author: Tom L.

description: Best donuts period. I really don't need to explain much more. Crumble donuts like old fashioned is what they're really known for not round ones like Homer Simpson's favorite haha. I personally think 1 plain and 1 maple are are a perfect combination. They balance each other out, maple crumble is a bit too sweet for me almost, that's when I take a bite of the plain old fashioned ;) and best part is that's $2 FLAT. These guys have great customer service and always offer napkins too. Big fan, I'll be back.
author: Angelo A.

description:
Super chill service, answered all my questions with a quiet calm. Smokey room with stools and flat screen tv, like a well lit bar. 
Went at midnight and got some freshly glazed donuts. It was the softest fluffiest pillow of carbs I've ever had, with just the right amount of sweetness. Though you probably want to take it to go.
author: Jenny P.

description: Big donut was awesome!  Definitely seemed like a different texture and density compared to their normal size donuts.  The big one is denser, but still very soft.  We got lucky in that they were just pulling out some fresh ones from the fryer, so we got it made to order and it was hot and super fresh.  The smaller ones are actually better I think, as they are lighter and obviously more practical for normal consumption.
author: Matt W.

description:
If you happen to be nearby and hear a sizzle coming from the frier, wait your turn and than pick  whatever just came out of that bubbly oil of goodness. 

French Crullers (chocolate or maple), Crumbled Cinnamon and Cinnamon Rolls are my favorite. 

A hot Apple Fritter is a delicious work of art.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Don't tell me this town ain't got no heart, you just gotta poke around.

This place is a little bit of heaven. Donuts so good they'll keep you coming back again and again. 

That's exactly what we did on our last trip to the city. The dough is fantastic - not too sweet. The palm oil they are fried in helps make them not overly greasy like some donuts and adds a subtle sweetness you won't find in low grade fried dough. 

And that custard! Oh the custard. There's Something old world about the custard - slightly tangy, just like it should be. Bob's donuts has an old world feel as well. A neighborhood joint the kind of which is quickly fading away as people start craving new over tradition. 

I'll take tradition over new and flashy 98% of the time. Bob's is it. We'll be back again and again.
author: Chris S.

description:
5/5 Stars

HOT 'N FRESH

After 8 hours of partying, a couple of my friends and I had a little sweet tooth craving.  Being new to The City, my friends suggested going to a 24-hour donut shop.  I was totally down for that. I just sat back and let them lead the way.
We parked along the side of the road and I saw one store lit up with a glass window filled with donuts.  There were two Asian workers, one frying donuts and another taking customers' orders.  The bar table was empty so we took a sat.  We asked for the freshest donuts.  We all got a carton of milk to accompany our amazing experience.  They gave us a knife and started to serve us plates of hot donuts.  Seriously they were amazing!!! Freshly glazed donuts with the frosting still drying over the warm donut.  As donuts were being made the workers began to joke with us and kept making custom orders for us.

They would freshly dip donut holes in the maple and chocolate frosting.  After several plates of donuts, lots of laughs, a front row view of "how donuts are made and frosted," and a milk carton later; we were stuffed.  We lost count of how many donuts we ate and the workers did too.  Together we worked out a very discounted price.

Best donut shop ever!!!!

1. AWESOME SERVICE
2. AMAZING DONUTS
3. INSIDE SEATING
4. CHEAP PRICES
5. 24 HOURS
6. GOT MILK AND COFFEE
7. HELLA OPTIONS
author: Jordan Aaron C.

description: I am a huge donut fan and I had high expectations for this one given all the hype and social media attention it's been getting but sad to say I was so disappointed. The place is small and cramped and the donuts were just ok, nothing special. In fact I would not even crave for these donuts. Sad.
author: Karissa A.

description: Honestly nothing really stood out about these mediocre donuts. The apple fritter, maple old fashioned, and chocolate bar were good but we never finished them even after bringing them home. The counter was littered with boxes and the frying area was messy.
author: Cheryl W.

description: Not a gourmet donut place by any means, but still had a small line at 11pm (the benefits of being open 24/7). At that hour, a lot of things were already gone, but we still got a decent selection for our breakfast the next morning. Note: they don't keep as well as some gourmet ones do; some turned soggy the next morning, but they are cheap and still give you the sugar high you crave.
author: Ling X.

description: Great donuts! As ordering donuts the guy helping us told my son "I hope these are the best donuts you've ever tried in your life".... I must say, they were!!! Those glazed donuts are BETTER than Krispy Kreme donuts!
author: Norma S.

description: Good donuts plus they have a giant one that takes up an entire dozen donut box. Will go back next time I'm in the city
author: Brian M.

description:
So many doughnuts, so little time. (Or so little stomach room!)

I sent the roommate here to buy me some doughnuts while I was at work. Since he knows me so well, he got one of each.

August 2013
*Doughnuts: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bobs-donut-and-pastry-shop-san-francisco-2#bahaKbGz-b7eiF1_6Fcsrw

Flavors:
*Glazed
*Chocolate custard filled
*Apple fritter
*Chocolate
*Crumble
*3 different Maple
*Cruller

My favorite was the custard filled as I love custard. I also enjoyed the cruller as it it was light, fluffy and not too sweet. And of course, a couple bites of the apple fritter makes me a happy girl.

A nice sweet ending to my day!
author: Elena N.

description:
24/7 great donuts and the price is right. Sugared raised jelly filled:  tender yeast dough, and sugar on each bite. Chocolate iced old fashioned:  1/4 inch crispy edges and the icing reminded me of old fashioned fudge. Warm glazed buttermilk was a bit oily, but you could peel the exterior crunchy layer and the cake inside is perfect. Glaze was just right. 

Kudos to the awesome guy working who asked if we wanted a bigger squishy donut or one with more fried crispy edges. He totally understood that after walking a mile or more to eat at this shop, you want the donut of your dreams. Thanks!!
author: Rachel S.

description: Just came across this place on a 3 am random adventure. They serve fresh donuts that are fluffy like a cloud. Will recommend going here if you are in SF.
author: Sarvagya Vatsal S.

description: After hearing about Bob's on Murph and Mac on KNBR, we were actually trying to go to the Oyster place next door but they inexplicably stopped serving. I saw the Bob's sign and quickly switched gears from oysters to donuts (who doesn't, right?) and the only phrase that comes to mind is "homemade donuts." They're not weird robot donuts that come out of a machine. I picture some dude (Bob maybe?) sitting there handcrafting donuts. I've not had donuts like this before and I'm now ruined for any other donut. Happy Donuts will never be good enough now.
author: Brian B.

description:
Fresh donuts as they are made in small batches.

Great for late night snacking.

Order line can run from non existent to a 15 minute wait.

Too bad the place is filthy. They could use a nice cleaning.

The Asian guy is stingy with the napkins so you will have to ask for some.
author: Evan W.

description:
Did i come here too early??? Sooo disappointed. After reading all the great reviews, i came here with high expectations. I also read about the excellent customer service and that it was highly recommended to ask what was the freshest donut. I arrived at the donut shop with enthusiasm, 
Me: hello, whats the freshest donuts right now?
Chinese lady: what do you mean? They all old fashion
Hmm maybe she misheard me..
Me: what would you recommend?
Chinese lady: they all old fashion.

Great, guess ill just choose whatever my confused self decides on. I chose some sort of apple donut/cake and an old fashioned chocolate donut. Surely enough when i got home i ended up with a staled donut and a mushy apple cake.
author: Carmen A.

description: We decided to do donuts this year instead of cake for our son's birthday party.  With about 40 kids to feed, it was FAR easier than slicing up cake, and it was a fun change for the kids.  Bob's really delivered! The raised donuts were delicious! They were able to add sprinkles to our raised glazed and our chocolate frosted glazed donuts.  For the birthday boy?  A donut the size of his head, of course!  We ordered through the website, easy peasy. Picked up at the designated time. Everything was boxed up and ready to go, and the XL donut was just being finished (and super fresh).  I highly recommend ordering a ton of donuts from Bobs for your next event!
author: Sherri H.

description: If you want donuts, Bob's is definitely the place to go. They have a big donut that you could use as a birthday cake, and it's great for getting donuts for the office. The store always smells really good, and it's hard to walk by without wanting to eat a donut. Good prices as well as lots of variety.
author: Lauren A.

description: These donuts are so yummy and fresh i can honestly say their glazed donuts are better than Krispy Kreme :)
author: Mimi S.

description: Delicious. Glaze is always my favorite. Light and fluffy. They slice open to fill their jelly donuts. Also their crumb donut is a MUST!!
author: Rebecca E.

description:
Proper donut shot with some pastries.

I know only one better donut shop, it's in Union City. But Bob's donuts is a great place. It's better than most donut places in bay area I've even been to. Sure it's a bit dirty, oldfashioned with workers covered in flour and sugar, stained kitchen equipment, but does it really matter? 
What matters is how good donuts are and how cheap they are. Believe me donuts are great here: just a right amount of sugar - not too much like most donut shops and not too little. Great stuff, hard to find. 

It'pretty cheap - like $2 pastries, $1.75 med coffee.

5 stars all the way!
author: Artem M.

description: Place is going completely downhill. They are coasting purely on their reputation and hype. Donuts are getting smaller every time I visit. Lately they have been selling meager donuts that clearly no one put any care in making. Last 4 times I've gone they've had no apple fritters. Bob's used to be amazing but at this point it's no better than your average donut shop.
author: Marc H.

description:
Crumb donut and apple fritter are where it's at.

I like how things are strewn haphazardly. Nothing looks very pretty, but looks are deceiving.
author: Shannon L.

description: Maybe I went on an off morning but I don't see what the big deal is. The place is messy and the coffee is out in the open... which isn't very sanitary. I really wanted to love this place but I didn't taste the freshness...
author: Kendal W.

description:
Come by to Bob's if your close by Polk Street! It's worth the trip to buy their deliciously made donuts.
I finally made my first trip to Bob's today during the early afternoon. Quick and efficient service was provided. A kind & friendly older lady was able to help me with my order. She's the best! 
I was able to buy what I wanted there, which was an Apple Pandowdy, Cheese Danish, and (freshly baked and came right out of the oven when I was there) coconut lemon bar. 
(FYI, total cost of all these baked goods = $6.50. Talk about a good deal, too!).
I will definitely be back to try out their other donuts and/or whenever I crave donuts. And another plus is to experience their excellent service again.
author: Vivian L.

description: This is what happiness looks like. If you see my previous reviews you see that I am a bit of a donut connoisseur. This is my new favorite and Im bummed that I live an hour away to say the least. San Francisco is so awesome for its unique people, places things and ideas. Let me tell you! 24 hour donut shop is an awesome idea! 12" mega donuts is an awesome idea! They display the donuts in the window. These folks are geniuses.
author: Joe P.

description:
I went to Bob's when I was on my road trip. My brother, cousin, and I heard about their challenge and we just had to try it. If you're attempting the challenge you need to call in advance and reserve it, the donuts take about 4 hours to bake if they don't already have some on hand. They had a bunch when I called in the night before. 

This donut is HUGE. I totally underestimated the sheer size of this thing. Two minutes gets you a refund, (the donut is 8$) a t-shirt, and your picture on the wall of fame; Three gets you the t-shirt and the picture. I personally had the maple doughnut. Needless to say, I finished only half in the three minutes. 

Normally, after scarfing something so dense that fast, you'd except to be kinda sick of it; however, after the three minutes, I kept on eating. It was simply that good. It was fluffy, moist, and tasted fresh; Bob's is hands down the best donut I've ever had.
author: Omar B.

description: Amazing servers and donuts, and I don't usually eat cake donuts but these were crispy perfection.
author: Niekia F.

description:
I've known Bob's for years, but it took a very stormy day to bring me in here in search of a little brightness to the day that we ALL wanted to stay home on.

What better than sweets than a big box full of classic donuts! I knew Bob's would be open, so I stopped in and got a dozen. My coworkers loved the donuts, even after the power went out, there was nothing left to do but indulge. 

They have this giant doughnut that is the size of a cake, it's pretty awesome and can't wait to bring that one to the next party. Here's your doughnut, where's the knife?!
author: Rebekah T.

description: Stop at this small local donut shop on Wednesday morning their was a short line but move quickly didn't had to wait long. Staff was friendly. I decide to pick a big shareable glaze donut and apple fritter. The shareable big glaze donut smell good, when take a bite had little crisp, light, airly and tasty delicious. It last the family for couple days. The apple fritter was deep fry donut, light, moist and can taste the apple. Good quality donut for the price you pay. Would come back here again. I would recommend it to my friends, family and donut lovers.
author: Gruber T.

description:
A warm donut from Bob's is one of the best things in the world! So fluffy and pillowy and perfect.

Best service, no minimum on credit cards, and delicious donuts! Can't go wrong here!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
This donut shop has their inventory in the window front which draws a bunch of people into the store

It's a small and quick shop that clearly is known for its taste 

We grabbed some maples, choco sprinkles, and glaze donuts

You can order a few days ahead for a large donut (the size of your head)
author: Catherine C.

description: I'm a fan of Bob's. We order them a lot for team meetings at work.  But, I had to dock a star this time because I called ahead for a 2 dozen pick up and asked for an assortment of donuts to appease the different tastes of our group since I was ordering for a team of 20 people.  I was disappointed to get to work and open the box to find basically 12 plain donuts and 12 maple donuts.  That is not an "assortment" and it's rather boring, so next time I guess I will have to go in and hand pick the donuts instead of calling ahead for efficiency.  Otherwise, Bob's is great.
author: Jake A.

description:
I'm led to believe that all the 5 start ratings of this place were done by people at 1 or 2am, as they just left the bar, lol.  It's a great place for a binge snack, but that's about it.  I'm sure the donut's taste a lot better straight off the baking sheet ... and since there is a line at 2am.. the best time to get fresh donuts at this place is from 12am - 2am... just FYI.

I was craving a donut yesterday around 4pm...  I've commonly walked past this place at late night and the line has been out the door 10 deep.  It's right in the heart of Polk street, between all the bars, so it makes sense that it's a one stop shop for all your late night eating needs. The two donuts I got were:

- Raised Maple donut with sprinkles on top
- Maple glazed French Cruller.

I'm not sure how long the donuts had been sitting, but they didn't look fresh.  They were smaller in size than I expected, but that didn't really bother me.  Each donut was $.95 cents I believe, which was actually more than I suspected.  IMO, they are worth about $.60/per, but that's neither here nor there.  

The first donut I tried was the Raised Maple... it was really soft, and extremely sweet.  Not your "ok this is sweet", but "damn! this is nothing but sugar!"  About three bites in to it I realized why people like them so much.  There is a ton of sugar packed in to these small things, which will make you sick if you have too many.  By the time I finished the first donut, I was ready to run a marathon.  I bit in to the french cruller and could only eat half of it before I had to throw it away.  

The place was ok, but not the best I've ever had.  Highly unlikely I'll return.
author: Jared N.

description: 5 stars to the best donut I've had in the bay area! Tried the regular glazed donut and the one stuffed with jam! The quality of the dough is incredible! Just love it!
author: M. Amin E.

description:
OMG their glazed donut is so fluffy Im gonna die! 

One of these days I'm going to go for the big donut and finish that off all by myself. I hear it's like eating 20 of the regular-sized donut. The girl at the cashier highly recommends it. She says they always sell out by the end of the day. 

I've seen line go out of the door, especially later at night. I like their staff--friendly and accommodating.
author: Yad L.

description: After seeing the lines the night before in the middle of the night I was excited to try this place in the afternoon the next day. I got a chocolate eclair and everything was up to par. The donut was fresh and the service was extremely friendly. I wouldn't say the place was the cleanest but it was so friend me so fast and so tasty.
author: Conor S.

description:
Came here since so many people have reviewed this place and they have a really good rating. I actually never heard of them until I was in town on vacation.

Stopped by after having dinner with my family. I've become a huge donut snub. I've tried hundreds of shops in SoCal, so I'm pretty picky about my donuts. I ordered three of the old fashion donuts they had on display since those are favorite. I got two with chocolate glaze and another with chocolate glaze and sprinkles. 

For your every day donut fanatic this place is great. My mom even said "these are so fresh." But for me who is a hardcore donut fan they were good but not the best. Donuts were a bit dry and didn't taste that fresh to me. I'm willing to go back give them another shot.
author: Carlos P.

description:
Still the best donuts I've ever tasted!  They're nothing like the kind you've had from a grocery store or any other donut shop.  Amazing.  All of the flavors are a hit.

The only downside is that you'll likely have to walk a ways to get here, as it is on a busy street and there is rarely any parking.  But that's San Fran for ya.

Definitely recommend.  A must have!
author: S.Y. K.

description: Best donut i have ever tasted in my whole life  the chocolate donut is my favorite. It's a donut like no other  I always come back for bob's donuts whenever i'm in town.
author: Mary Janica T.

description: Seriously! This place is the spot. I love the donuts here. I love that it's open after a concert or sporting event. I love the hot donuts. There is usually a line so plan accordingly.
author: That G.

description: We had the maple glazed donut and croissant. It tasted fantastic. The service was awesome too!!
author: Phuong Rose S.

description: PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE!!! Don't be like other businesses that in order to cut costs you sacrifice quality!  The new mixes or recipes you are using are horrible.  The twist I bought yesterday was tough.  The old fashioned donuts were just too white inside and flavorless!  Just because your icings are flavorful, does not mean your actual donut has to be flavorless and obviously of poorer quality than just a month ago.  The fritter had a hair in it!  Unheard off!  Please, fix all that or I will never stop at your shop again and worse, I'll bad mouth you!
author: Emilia G.

description:
I'm not sure I've ever smelled a place so heavenly. Walk in and you'll know what I'm talking about. The smell wafting off the cinnamon apple fritters will grab you by the nose like an old cartoon. 

The visuals are just as good. Now, the space itself ain't nothin' fancy but it's filled with these perfect pillows of glazed goodness and let's be real, that's all you're going to want to look at anyway. I went basic--a few glazed and one apple fritter. I got my bag of treats and couldn't even wait. I dug right in as soon as it was handed to me and....oh my God. Incredible. The glazed doughnut all warm and melt in your mouth like. I wanted to weep tears of joy.

The apple fritter? Crunchy in just the right places, soft in the middle, and chock full of cinnamon and spice. I loved it. LOVED. 

Big ups to my pal Jeffery S for showing me the way to Bob's. But also curse him for now no other doughnut will live up!
author: Annette J.

description:
YUMMY!
I randomly went here twice since it was the one of the few places that was open late adnt hat we could grab a quick dessert/bite.
I love that they may the donuts fresh and you can actually see them making the donuts right behind the counter!
There's no labels so I kind of had to point to what I wanted and although the worker told me what the flavors were I honestly don't really remember everything we got.

The crumb donut is proclaimed to be the best and it truly was amazing. I love how soft and fluffy the donut was. Definitely one of the best donuts I've EVER had.
The apple fritter was also really yummy. I've never been a fan of apple fritters and in general am not a fan of warm fruits in my food but the apple fritter has a slight hint of the taste of an apple and it did have some apple pieces as well but it was delicious. 
The sticky pecan roll (?) is something I thought I would love the most but it did not amaze me as much as the donut and the apple fritter. 

I would HIGHLY recommend the apple fritter and any of the donuts.
I've personally never had to wait in a long line which is great and I love that the place is open 24/7.
author: Julia K.

description: Probably the best don't you'll find anywhere for under a dollar. Maybe the best even for $3. These donuts are a perfect indulgence of the tradional donut sort. You want a yeast glazed. They got em. You want a maple cake. Have that too. Jelly filled (yessssss please). Ya, and you can get em 24/7.
author: Brian B.

description: Great spot to get a cup of coffee and a donut, or 2. We tried several different donuts. All were great. Service was very good too.
author: Danny S.

description: Their donuts are nice, hot and fluffy. Every time I visit the city I stop in for a donut. Their classic and nostalgic and it's a great place to have a treat.
author: Emma B.

description: Amazing!!! You cant stop eating them! They melt in your mouth!! The chocolate cake donut is the BEST
author: Laila A.

description: While we were getting ready for our elopement in San Francisco we decided to get lost for a little while and lucky us we stumbled upon Bob's Doughnuts. Best mistaken that's ever happen to us. They were the good'ol fashion doughnuts with a little love and care baked into each one. We loved the apple Fritter!
author: Ty-Lin G.

description: The buttermilk bar is literally heaven in your mouth.  I tried about a dozen of their donut options and all of the donuts were excellent. There was a constant line both times I've been, but it went pretty fast and was well worth it!
author: Ritza A.

description:
If you ever get lucky and make it during a time something was just fried and dipped, it is absolutely heavenly.  Seriously, like, melt-in-your-mouth, soft deliciousness.

Any other time, the donuts are still really good.  Glazed, crumb, chocolate twist, anything.

Open 24/7, and the guy (bearded, tattooed) behind the counter is really nice.  Stood there and explained the difference between raised donuts and, um, breadier, thicker donuts?  I've already forgotten, but at the time, very informative.  

There's always some movie or other playing on the TV, so you can sit at the counter, and hang out a bit, or just get them and be on your way.  

Great place.
author: Charlene S.

description: I came here last week because of the high yelp reviews. There was a line but it wasn't very long and moved quickly. The raised donuts were my favorite. They were very moist inside. I also got a crumb donut which was very good. The prices were fair. The old-fashioned glaze donut was very tasty as well. It was crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside. They were pretty dense donuts but tasted delicious. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Erin M.

description: Holy cow, that giant donut is bigger than I thought. Donuts were great, I tried a bite of a bunch of them. Glazed and apple fritter were really good. Line was really slow but it was a nice day so no complaints.
author: Joe O.

description:
Best doughnuts I've had. Not overly sugary, fresh.

Excellent service

Coffee and milk are also sold here
author: Z ..

description: Worth the hype. Best doughnuts I've ever had. The jam/jelly donuts are delicious (the amount of sugar practically burns your mouth but it's worth it). Don't be put off by the dingy interior- this is not your standard doughnut shop!
author: Kieran S.

description: Bobs is the best donut place in all SF. I have to come here every time I'm in the city
author: Alex H.

description: This was our first bakery visit on our trip to SF. Glad we tried this place. The apple bread pudding is phenomenal and I don't usually even like bread pudding. I only tried it because my BF ordered it but I ended up eating half of it! We got an apple fritter and croissant but had to take those to-go since the bread pudding was so filling.
author: Kim B.

description: Let's preface this by saying I was born eating donuts out of the womb. Today I had a reservation nearby and had some time to kill. I'm attending my friends annual Friendsgiving later this evening and wanted to get something sweet. Bobs donut was nearby and open 24/7 so I decided to stop by and see what the fuss was. There was a short line leading to the cashier and windows of donuts looked unappealing.. maybe the donuts on the cooling tray may be decent? We were up next, the older Asian women was holding down the fort but I could tell she was less than stellar about the line and me.. maybe a bad day? I ordered a dozen mixed donuts, 3 dozen donut holes and 1 freshly glazed classic in hand. With all that she was still hesitant in giving me a box considering I paid $24 which was a bit much for donuts but whatever. The donut in hand was delicious (what donut isn't) but it was hard to eat considering she treated us so terribly and seeing her treat non Asians with such esteem. Also it was hard not to notice the sticky walls, dirty countertops and lack of utensils used while handling the donuts. I will not be frequenting this donut shop as other places such as j. jorgies is equally as good, cheaper and have cleaner facilities.
author: Estella L.

description:
I buy a box of donuts every time I'm in town. There is always a line but it is definitely worth the wait. I usually get glazed ring donuts and crumb donuts. They are amazingly fried to perfection. I love donuts that are fluffy with a lot of breading but also not skimpy with the glazed icing. 

ONLY reason it's a four star is because I had a bad experience this one time with the lady that worked there. She was very rude about putting FOUR donuts in a box (which I have done many time before) and overcharged me for the donuts (maybe because she was bitter about giving me a box and I didn't realize this after the transaction was over). You don't expect me to hold four donuts individually right? But they handled it well once I confronted another lady about the overcharge and even gave me an extra donut. Just a one time bad experience but I won't be returning quite often because of that.
author: Eva L.

description: Had the apple fritters and since they were out of the voted best crumb donut they made us a special glazed crumb donut which was awesome. Excellent fresh donuts even at 10pm
author: Crystal A.

description: Super soft and delicious donuts. Be kind to the older lady behind the counter. And know what you want when you get to the front.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
When my usual donut shop closed down I was in search of a new place to get my morning deep fried sugary fix.  I tried Dynamo (and I think they taste great but it was a bit too far to travel to the Mission and the donuts are a bit pricey).  Yelp led me to Bob's Donut's.  Bob's is open 24 hours so that is cool.  I went around 6:30AM on a Saturday morning.  Donuts were cheap so I picked up a bunch just try them out.  Overall the donuts were not super fresh (in fact they were a bit stale), and they were all quite greasy.  Perhaps they don't make new donuts Saturday morning...  I tried the Boston cream and an apple fritter.  The apple fritter was over cooked and so greasy it was inedible.  

This place gets a few stars are being open 24 hours and cheap.  I bet the donuts are substantially better when they aren't a day old.  I would stop by again to give it another try.
author: Paul W.

description:
APPLE.
FRITTER.

That's all. It's good hot OR cold. Fried perfectly and crispy on the outside and magically soft, fluffy, and moist on the inside (especially where there are the apple chunks and cinnamon swirls. MMM!)

It's simply magic. Especially if you love apples / cinnamon. THIS IS A MUST. It's what dreams are made of.

Their yeast/raised donuts here are meh to me, but the cake donuts are good! And I don't even usually like cake donuts.

Also - I love that this is still very much a mom and pop shop even with all the foodie hype. You stay you, Bob's.
author: Emily C.

description:
Haha what a place! HEAVEN of donuts 
No matter what time you come, you see fresh donuts. And different size, which is incredible. 
Love love this place.
This is my donuts go to spot. And should be yours as well! Trust me!
author: Jenna F.

description:
I didn't take a picture but oh my god these were the best two donuts I have ever had in my life!!! Soooo warm and crunchy on the outside and dense and soft on the inside. I had the maple buttermilk, freshly made and the crumb cake. They were so nice, it cost $5 for 4 donuts and one milk, and they're open 24/7.

I'll definitely drive to the city to get a box of those!! Thank you so much!!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Look, I'm an overweight guy who loves fried stuff so you can totally trust my review. This is THE most popular donut shop in the city so I will just tell you the important things:

1. Cheap, the donuts are cheap, that's what keeps a lot of people coming back
2. Fresh, because it's cheap and people keep coming, they keep making
3. Long lines, because it's cheap and fresh, people keep coming and more people come and boom, long lines. HOWEVER. Most of the time the line is long only because the service speed. This is a way for businesses to create artificial demand by slowing down service, causing a line and making people think this place is good and therefore, more line! There is no reason this place can't hire a extra person to pick the donuts and have 1 person taking the cash.

The sole reason I am giving this place 3 stars is because of this shady business tactic. Don't get me wrong, their raised donuts are great, but you're already at a point where you don't need to keep people waiting in line to create more demand.

PS: They take credit cards too, no minimum
author: Da X.

description:
It was finally time to see what all the fuss was about. The first time I had ever heard of Bob's Donuts was when my roommate (when we were living in San Diego) received a gigantic donut via mail... like who sends one of those across the freaking state?! Pretty awesome. 

I was instantly impressed by the variety of donuts displayed in their shop window. At that point, you just can't resist. It was a donuts and coffee kind of morning for me and my boyfriend. Service is lightning fast. We ordered the apple fritter, apple danish, regular glazed donut, and jelly-filled glazed donut. All of these were phenomenal especially with coffee to wash them down. 

We sat down at one of the small tables and eventually moved to the bar seating, where others were reading the newspaper and watching the game on TV. Felt like home. I've heard that Bob's Donuts gets busy more in the evening since it's open 24/7 and would make a great late night snack. It was not too busy around 9AM on a Saturday, but I'm sure it depends on the day. Either way, totally worth a visit... or two... or three.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Giant seat cushion donuts, regular size donuts, donut holes, and other fine tasty pastries make this a great go-to place when you need something sweet. Friendly staff great sweet stuff to eat.. and affordable.
Love the giant donut !!! Big as a face !!
author: David S.

description:
Even though we visited Bob's in the middle of the afternoon, when none of the donuts were fresh, we still had fantastic donuts.  I got a plain glazed donut, which was light and airy, and lightly frosted.  My wife got two crumbly donuts, which also were light, and were cakey and (of course) crumbly.  Both were exceedingly yummie!  I wonder how good it is first thing in the morning?


[  What do you call a man with no nose and no body? --- Nobody knows.  ]
author: Michael S.

description: I can always go for a chocolate sprinkle donut and Bob's Donuts knew exactly how to reel me into their shop with the window display. The shop itself is nothing spectacular, but it is fun to watch the guys dropping the donuts into the deep frier. The donuts themselves were ok at most to be entirely honest. Sprinkles were not evenly distributed on the donut, which is not ideal for this flavor. I still like the base of this donut in comparison to the large donut establishments.
author: Vats A.

description: Came to SF for a getaway weekend with my boyfriend and I found Bob's Donut's on Yelp ! (: I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with one of their "Big Donuts" for his birthday. I called to place an order (very hard to get a hold of them by phone) so I emailed them instead and got a pretty quick response ! (: They seem to be pretty busy at all times of day so I didn't get too frustrated with the phone situation. I placed my order on Thursday to pick up on Saturday through email. When I picked it up on Saturday, it was ready when I needed it, the cashier was a very friendly lady, and the donut was DELICIOUS. Most importantly, my boyfriend was very happy with the donut ! (: I'm very happy that I found this place !
author: Nyomi M.

description:
I was in the area checking out a cafe late afternoon and I stumbled on  Bob's on Yelp. I am not as impressed as I thought I would be with this donut shop. There is definitely a good variety of flavours and donut options. To be honest though, through the window, I could not really choose one that was appetizing. They did not look fresh and they seem to look dry. 
I asked one of their staff, what their popular items were. She listed a few but suggested I go for the freshly made ones that were in a cart behind her. She indicated that the fresh ones were either the old fashion glaze or the old fashion chocolate glaze. I opted for the simple glazed one to share with my fiancée. If this one was good, I would not mind going for seconds or thirds lol...unfortunately this "fresh" donut didn't do its magic. It was dry... I expected it to be a bit cakey and fluffy since it is an old fashion donut but it was crumbly and not as enjoyable as I hoped for. It was also really sweet and I honestly didn't think the donut was fresh...
I really want to give this place another chance due to the raving reviews. 

Maybe waiting in line for an actual fresh batch will do the trick :P next time perhaps!
author: Daphne W.

description:
Oh my Goodness......Well worth waiting on line at 1am!
Unlike any other donut I've ever had.
author: Keisha D.

description:
Yes I'm a believer. 

2am donut run guarantees you a few things:
1. A line of annoying drunk bros 
2. A seemingly eternal wait while smelling the tantalizing freshly fried dough
3. Freshly fried donuts
4. Mouthgasm after eating #3
5. Immediate regret for not getting more 
6. Assess if additional wait with #1 is worth it - the answer depends on your drunkenness and your Uber wait time

Amazing fresh donuts right out of the fryer. Fluffy, warm, and so delicious! Reminds me of Kingpin in Berkeley, but probably better..
author: Michelle K.

description: I just looove that place! Native land of the most delicious and perfect doughnuts!;)))
author: Galya M.

description: I've been here a couple of times and my hubby and I always make sure we buy a few donuts to bring home . His favorite is the jelly donut which is always sold OUT, but maybe 2X when we stop by they didn't have them !
author: Gloria L.

description:
Original glaze. Chocolate cake. Crumb.

Original - chewy but not doughy, good amount of glaze, and the right amount of "melt" or give when you bite into a donut

Chocolate cake - when these are piping hot, they're slightly crispy and cake-y, but definitely more donut than cake, which makes the texture really pleasant

Crumb - when piping hot, these bad boys are like crispy double deep fried donuts. on the crunchier side of texture

That list of awesome donuts gets longer and longer every time I come here. The apple fritters and old fashioned donuts here are great too, but they're just not my style.

They are reliably open all the time, how can you say no? And they're pretty cheap. The extra ginormous donut isn't good unless you like your dough to glaze ratio high.

Oh, and Pro Tip: the trick is... get the donuts that are the freshest at the time you go. Those are always the best!
author: Joanne Y.

description: part of me wishes that this spot hadn't been discovered to the level that it has been, because now there's always a crazy line down the block! But I agree with the length of that line-- Bobs is hands down the best donut shop EVER, and one of the true san francisco gems that hasn't changed a bit. I love how they're open 24 hours-- you can grab a donut (or several) to go, or sit for a while and have your donut there with a carton of milk or cup of coffee --- and their prices are amazing!
author: Haley D.

description: I got an Apple Fritter and it had just come out of the oven so it was warm and delicious. This spot is open 24 hours and the young man that was running the front was very kind and asked the perfect questions. They have a selection of extra large donuts as well if you wanted to get something to share outside of the dozen. There is a line and it moves pretty quickly. The coffee was also really good. The hardest part was finding parking. I did happen to go on a Sunday evening, so parking is free and so if you do go on a Sunday, plan in parking in the garage around the corner or double parking (which is what I ended up doing).  Please stop by here as you won't be disappointed. Next time I go, I am going to get the double glazed donut.
author: Nikki G.

description: I stop in here once in a while for super fresh old fashioned donuts and pastries. This place is great for a late night snack too!
author: Preferred C.

description:
TL;DR - The best, at ANY time of day.

If you're looking for some artisanal bs, Bob's is NOT your place. They make delicious, fatty, indulgent doughy treats.

My favorites are, everything! Jk.

Maple old fashioned - Can't go wrong with this one.
Glazed - Mmhmmmmmm. 
Maple Buttermilk - More dense and decadent than the old fashioned.

The one type I would stay away from would be the cake. Idk... its not my style, but might be yours! Its a cross between a yeast and an old fashioned (a little dry for me).
author: Crystal Z.

description:
That HUGE doughnut doe!!!! We came here on a Friday evening around 10:30pm. There was about 5 groups ahead of us but we were served fairly quick.

Ambiance
Parking: 
* It's SF soooooo good luck. Street parking as usual. I'd recommend bussing it if you can.

Seating: 
* Seating is pretty reasonable. Though their donuts are popular, it's moreover a type of to-go kind of thing. However if you must sit, seating available for a about 30 people for groups in a crowd or even a party (of 4).

Feels: 
* In regards to aesthetics, it wouldn't stand out or catch your attention as it is like your everyday donut shop with its general hustle and bustle. However the
the donuts at the window will generally hook you. Seeing all the simple variations and the line will intrigue you. Inside is just your typical donut shop decorated with some raves and reviews validated by local papers.

Food:
HUGE crumb donut and a chocolate glazed donut.
* In regards to flavor it's simple but kudos for serving a huge donut, especially in the different flavors of glazed, crumb, and chocolate, you only get those in carnivals and generally 1 flavor only. In regards to size, it took 3 people 3 days ( late night snack, breakfast, breakfast) to finish it up. Boy oh boy was that a monster. 

Customer Service:
The servers were polite and quick. What was admirable is they gave me an honest wait time..you know how people say 15 but ends up being 30....yeah. Their 15 minutes was actually 15 minutes.

Overall:
5 stars. I doughnut know about your thoughts but this place is awesome! The price was affordable, the experience was definitely memorable, and the donut was delicious. I admire it's uniqueness for the huge donut and the challenge. If you're on a late night out or an SF adventure, this is a place worth checking out.

TL;DR Tips:
* Open 24/7 for a late night bite!
* IS THAT A CHALLENGE!?!? Check out the Bob's Donut challenge
author: Leland S.

description:
This local donut shop has a reputation for being the number one spot after your night-out to finish it up with something sweet. And oh boy, when I say sweet, I mean SWEET. 

Forget about everything you learned in nutrition class and indulge in deep fried pastries like jam-filled donuts, or cinnamon-enriched apple fritters. Also forget about your cholesterol and live life to the fullest.

Or, maybe not. Seriously, that stuff here is heavy. Sugar-carb heavy. Too much for my tastebuds.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Giant Mother Effin' Donuts!

Bob must have hired Wayne Szalinski's shrinking device and switched it in reverse to target amazing glazed donuts.  Nothing can go horribly wrong with that.  The growth spurt of these donuts looks quite strange.  All I know now is that they need to blow up one of those apple fritters that big and I'll shrink myself so that I can live inside of it and feed off of it for the rest of my life.  

Thanks Wayne Szalinski!
author: Alex P.

description: Ordered two large chocolate sprinkles! And devoured them before we could take a pic. So amazing!! And it's really the softness of the dough.. I will totally come back!!! Great for parties. So delicious
author: Monica C.

description:
The employees were very nice. swift and fast. The only downside is I coudn't find napkins and they were so busy that I didn't want to ask for any. My friend was given some with their order so I just took one of theirs.

- These donuts are made to be eaten fresh. We bought 6 but they are way better fresh. The trick is if you do want to take them home is to heat it in the microwave for 15 seconds and they will taste warm and melty.

We had:

- the buttermilk donut: tasty, different from a heavy cake donut.
- crumb donut - very good. the crumbs are made of donuts. so its donut squared.
- applefritter got one fresh out of the fryer with glaze. Very good. very tasty. Super sweet, almost too sweet (I was eating these between lunch and dinner so it was kind of weird, I was hungry for dinner but filling myself with donuts)

All in all, its open 24 hours and they serve deliciousness. The employees LOVE their job and are very friendly and nice. It is family owned. I will come back when I'm around.
author: Samantha D.

description: I'm not sure why this place is supposed to be good. I got an old fashioned as many suggested and it tasted like any other. Maybe because it wasn't fresh from the fryer? I can think of many other donut shops I like better.
author: Jen K.

description: Karma baby! As in, I hadn't planned on stopping here but this place suddenly appeared before me! I wasn't hungry but stopped and got 2 for later. Later is almost 24 hours & I just finished 2 great donuts! After having bounced around in my bag all day they didn't look so great so pardon the ugly pic. Got the Boston creme & a maple cream bar. The dough was so chewy & fresh tasting & the custard was not too sweet. Just the right amount of frosting to add yummy sweetness. Run don't walk here & get your donut on!
author: Bridget D.

description: I would start by saying that this place is located in a very sketchy part of the city. I thought I was in the wrong place when I walked in here. The pictures on their website and yelp must be old and/or staged for a one time shoot. The place is very dirty and gross. The donuts are not very good and certainly not good enough to overlook the nastiness inside.
author: Claudia F.

description:
Horrible service.  I've been looking forward to coming here for over 6 months.  I've looked at photos, followed them on Instagram, became a virtual "fan."  To get here and have the lady at the counter be so extremely rude to me, it's disgusting.

Also, by the time we made it through the line on a Sunday morning at 9, they had almost NO donuts left.  No big donuts that they advertise, no crumb donuts, nothing.  Absolute, utter disappointment, waste of time and money to get over here on my vacation.
author: Christy T.

description:
Hit gold on my first visit here. Gold = fresh APPLE FRITTERS!! They came fresh out the fryer (after having cooled down, of course).

I'm not big on apple fritters but theirs was definitely an exception. I couldn't pass it up after watching them layer the glaze on. It's consistency was like a funnel cake. They're huge, I recommend sharing one, or not...because they're that good. As for the other donuts, they were good too. Classic. 

They had some pretty nice Bob's Donuts t-shirts in Giants and Niners colorways with the bridge. Grabbed one for the boyfriend as he's a donut lover. Pictures to follow.
author: Glecie C.

description:
I never liked traditional donuts until I tried this place out. Just a simple glazed traditional was enough to tickle my taste buds and leave me wanting more.

This place is definitely one where you can't judge a book by it's cover. A hole in the wall type place that serves some of the best tasting pastries out there. It's amazing how something so simple can taste so good. In your first bite, there's a slight crisp from the deep fried goodness that instantly melts in your mouth. (Haha insert inappropriate giggles)

Seriously, I've been very loyal to my hometown donut shop that it makes me feel guilty about liking any other shop, but this one is a definite must try.
author: Michelle B.

description: SO good. I used to stop by here on Mondays mornings for a little pre-work treat. Every donut is delicious! You can't go wrong here.
author: Allegra G.

description: Small hole in the wall donut shop on Polk st i SF. Went with a friend after a formal event to finally give it a try and this place did not fail. Surprised to see a line out the door especially at 12 am in the morning, but I see why it's worth it. The place is opened 24/7 , a local mom& pops shop, and they make their donuts fresh!! Great service! It was a bit of a long line, but worth it. Would definitely come back to get more donuts. I would however, update the shop and make it more modernize and not out dated.
author: Danika P.

description:
Came here with the intent to have my first donut of 2016 to be a great one. 
The fresh glazed raised donuts are so melt-in-your-mouthy, pillowy, sugary pieces of heaven! Definitely worth the wait or coming back for fresh ones. Even though donuts became trendy in the last few years, this place is going on strong for good reason. 
The crullers here are also fluffy, chewy, and delicious! The bakers and service staff are super cute and welcoming. Will come back here as often as possible; dtill need to try a buttermilk (my ultimate fav)

Update: the fresh buttermilks are insane. This place is golden
author: Lisa J.

description:
3.5 Stars :) This place is good....BUT.....I've had donuts everywhere I have traveled and there are just many places that are better than Bob's. I would go back if I was in the area, but it's not a place that makes donuts worth dreaming about. It's not a place I would go out of my way to go to. 



24/7 donut places rock though!!!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
If you love your donuts then please visit Bob's donuts. I only like jelly donuts and Bob's has a good one! It is on the small side but has just the right amount of jelly. It isn't too sweet and it doesn't taste like Smuckers jam like other donut shops. (Name not to be mentioned)

Parking is difficult being that it is Polk street but just go early if you can and get the best selection. They have tons to choose from and many rave about the crumb and apple fritter.
author: James H.

description:
Imagine a donut the size of your face. Or imagine a donut the size of a pink donut box that usually holds a dozen donuts. That's how big their donuts are! They literally look like cakes. We ordered the gigantic donut with maple glaze and we had a lot of fun eating it. I have to admit that I love donuts because of the icing. When the donut is that big, you get less icing and more dough. If I were to stop by Bob's again, I would order a regular size donut. The gigantic donut is more for the novelty. We also tried a regular size buttermilk maple donut, fresh & warm and it was so very delightful. Grab a carton of milk and you'll be in heaven. 

Service was extremely friendly. The line moves quickly. There's also a groupon available for Bob's right now if you need a dozen donuts. Happy eating!
author: Denise H.

description: Best donuts! Apple fritter has a nice crunchy outside, moist perfectly cooked inside. Packed with flavor. Their old fashioned is flawless. Fun to watch them making donuts in line but seating is very limited, so definitely plan on pick up. Also loved they were making fresh batches through the day instead of just in the am - it was 5pm when I was there. I will be back! * I have not tried the massive donut but looks cool.
author: Bailey K.

description: Stumbled across this place while walking back from a karaoke bar and forced my friends to stop to try it. The line was full of drunk hangry people but that was part of the experience. It was around 2:00 in the morning and took 15-20 minutes to get the donuts but they were GOOD -- I got the apple fritter (I think it cost $2.90) and even though it wasn't warm it was delicious. My friend got the crumb donut and I'd definitely recommend that one.
author: Marissa F.

description: After reading so many great reviews below, I had to try bobs donuts. I've heard about the donuts "the size of your head" and had to try it out myself. Maybe I'm missing something but besides the size of the donut the taste was VERY average. I will give them the benefit of the doubt since I went there at 9 am and didn't get a donut fresh off the fryer. Perhaps I should've tried one of their specialty donuts. I do have to give them credit for making donuts that big  and if you're not a mighty eater like myself I'd recommend splitting the donut with a friend or two.
author: Susamita K.

description:
WOW WOW WOW! These are some amazing donuts! My favorites are the Maple Cake Donut and the Buttermilk Maple Donut. They have a microwave near the register that you should use to up the deliciousness of your donuts if you're eating them there. 

Some friends and I attempted the donut challenge. You basically have 3 minutes to each one of their LARGE donuts. It's hard; only 2 out of the 5 of us succeeded, which is above the average 10% pass rate. If you want to take the challenge be sure to call in the day before to reserve a big donut because they sell out fast! I failed the challenge, but still enjoyed the rest of the large donut, AND a Buttermilk Maple Donut afterwards!
author: Mark C.

description: Old fashion donut was the best donut I've ever had. Should  add iced coffee to their menu!
author: Nick R.

description: Really fatty donuts...not that clean in the restaurant either. Disappointing after reading so many top places to eat in San fransisco-that wasn't one of them for me.
author: Ashley W.

description:
After seeing countless reviews about this place, I had to stop by and see what it was about. At the time of this review the apple fritter was mentioned in 467 reviews. That is a lot of hype! This certainly warranted my attention.

The window display certainly was impressive. The interior looks like a run down diner, but in my experience that can often be a good thing when it comes to pastry quality. 

Unfortunately this did not turn out to be the case. I could not have been more disappointed with the dry apple fritter that I ordered. In some parts it was coated in that thick congealed opaque sugar paste you often see on old donuts, in other spots it was basically dry bread. I tossed it after a few bites.

I suppose I should have realized that part of the reason this place gets so many good reviews is that it is open 24/7 and can be one of the only options at the end of long nights of drinking. Sadly, I was neither drunk nor tired so it gains no extra points from me. Pass on this unless its 3am.
author: Mark O.

description:
No giant donuts when we arrived. 

Rude, "obviously, bro"-type attitude about it. 

It was basically, "What, you only want giant donuts? F off then.". Maybe not in those words.
author: Andy O.

description: Got a crumb donut for $1.25. Nothing exceptional. It actually seems overly sweet for me. What I did not like about this place is that there's no menu and not everything is displayed. There are some items placed behind the window but there are more different items in the back. You have to be already familiar with their products to order.
author: Melody H.

description:
Theeeeeeee best donuts I've ever had. My boyfriend and I came in around 12am, and they had fresh donuts! Friiiiiggggggin perfect! We could smell the deliciousness as soon as we stepped out the car. The line was long, but it moves pretty quick, I mean.. How long does it really take to just buy donuts, right? 

We got a dozen donuts, 4 glazed, 4 chocolate, and 4 maple, and a dozen donut holes. All warm and delicious. The dough is just perfect. 

Service was meh, it was pretty busy, so I guess it's understandable. The guy at the counter walked away to grab donuts that my boyfriend ordered even though he wasn't done talking.. So my boyfriend yelled out the rest of our order.
author: Pauline E.

description: This was amazing!!! The donuts were so fresh and fluffy and the ladies that helped us were really nice. I recommend the apple fritter but really anything from here will he good! Come before 9 am to miss any long lines!
author: Donna F.

description:
Was heading to do some damage at the vintage shops when I smelled the sweet sweet scent of deep fried, cinnamon sugar, glazed over pastries. I had to know where it was coming from! 

Thirty seconds later I saw a small line coming out of this super lowkey shop that had fresh donuts in the window! I have a slight donut obsession so I had to contain myself but OMG they had so many choices and they were so cheap. 

I ended up getting a cinnamon sugar cake donut and then a classic maple glazed yeast donut. Sh*t melted in my mouth like butter. 

And the little old lady who I assume owns the place (or has worked there for a really long time maybe) is so sweet.
author: Anayo A.

description: Overrated. I would hate to see the donuts the people who rate this 5 stars eat. The pricing is okay. My Apple fritter might have been better had it not been burnt. We also tried glazed and chocolate with sprinkles. Both were nothing special. Well that's not true, the glazed was large, but does the gimmick matter when the product itself is mediocre? If you need a donut and it's 2 in the morning then check this out, but if any other donut spot is open then you may as well go there.
author: Emma M.

description:
This place is perfection. I have been to King Pin in Berkeley and I thought I loved that place. Sorry, but hello Bob, who has won a place dear and near to my heart at 2:00 AM. 

After a good night in Polk, a donut craving hits and you just want some good fried dough. I have seen all the people who get the giant donuts (it's a cake size donut, that on its own is amazing), but I opted for an apple fritter. 

I don't think I have had anything like that before with the fresh dough, the apple inside, and then the cinnamon. I got it for 1.95, and they were on the cooking rack. I picked it up to find it too hot to consume. It was TOO FRESH, which is a never a problem for me. It just hit the spot just right and made me a happy man. 

I will be back very soon!
author: Albert H.

description:
It sucks that hipsters are taking over everything in sf. Seriously, I mean like everything. Before the hipsters started moving in, bobs was this little doughnut shop that carried the best doughnuts. There was never a line out the door. You can always get a good sized doughnut.

Now, bobs has increased the prices, made their old fashioned doughnuts super tiny and now uses bags with a logo on it. Sucks that bobs is moving along with the hipsters and changing everything. I truly hope their recipe doesn't change and it doesn't get bought out by some techie that works in the financial district and lives in the marina, pac heights or nob hill.
author: Reese E.

description: I went there with friends at 2 am...donuts were still coming out fresh and hot. We asked the front guy what he recommended and he said get the fresh donuts. Although we didn't get to try the apple fritters or crumb donut, we shared the glazed donut, the chocolate glazed donut and the maple glazed donut. It was delicious... esp with a carton of whole milk. There's nothing like eating a donut minutes from when it was pulled out of the fryer. It was flaky and airy. I'd recommend getting the plain glazed donut. It had the perfect amount of sweetness to it. I'm giving 4 stars because I haven't tried the other signature donuts but hopefully I'll be back and try them.
author: Stella L.

description: You'll find old-fashioned and traditional donuts abound in this no-frills shop. The crumb donut was insane and I could probably eat that sweet, apple pandowdy once a day. Thank God I don't live in San Francisco. Also, the 24 hour schedule is dangerous but helpful for anyone with midnight/drunk cravings. I support it.
author: Eric L.

description: Giant glazed donut the size of my head only for $8.95! Got it when it was still warm! Currently eating this while trying to write this review! It's so good omg!! I can't stop eating! Gonna have diabetes soon.. Lol but oh well! It's fluffy and moist! #legitdonut !! Must try! And they had such good customer service! The white guy behind the counter was so nice and sweet!! Highly recommend !!
author: Shirley G.

description:
Bob's! You let me down a bit, Bob. I've no doubt that most of the great reviews for Bob's were influenced by drunken cravings. Which is fine, everybody needs a spot to load up on carbs at 2 AM after partying on Polk.

I, however, was stone cold sober, just looking for some pillow-y carbs to sink into at 2 AM like the depressed as fuck bitch I am. So I drove 18 minutes, got a parking spot right outside of the joint and peered through that window with the Angel Beams of Light coming through. On a Saturday, this place is poppin'.

They ran out of their famed fritters so I got 6 donut holes and 1 crumb donut. Crumb donut was pretty stale and both that donut and the holes tasted like they were fried in some bad oil. Not soft, either. Service was fine.

I mean, if someone puts a donut from Bob's in front of me, I'll eat it. Of course I will, it's a fucking donut. But I'm not sure if it's enough to tempt me back. Or maybe you can just chalk up my bad review to me being a depressed-ass, sober bitch who was bitter at all the drunk tables of friends inside while I ate my donuts sad and alone in my car. Maybe donuts at 2 AM taste better with friends :'(

It gets a C+ (2.5/5 stars) from me.
author: GG C.

description: Bob's Donuts should be on everyone's bucket list of places to go in San Francisco. Their unique giant doughnuts are fantastic. You buy one expecting that it will taste like a typical glazed doughnut, but I must say it taste way better than that. I loved this little gem of a doughnut shop. The coffee and drinks are alright...the doughnuts are worth the buck spent on.
author: Julie H.

description: After all the hype... I bought two big doughnuts and one apple fritter. Ugh! A greasy mess... not to mention the oil they fried them in was old and that was the only flavor i could taste, Old, fried oil! And the lady behind the counter was very pushy  and almost RUDE. No thanks Bob, you can keep your Oil and Dough, I'm good.
author: Stacey R.

description:
This place is something you HAVE TO TRY in SF. 

Price: Look to spend at least $2 per donut

Parking: street (metered)

Food:
Definitely order the old fashioned donuts: we ordered chocolate and glazed. They were the perfect size, perfect crunch, and perfect softness inside.

We also ordered the GIANT HEAD SIZED crumb donuts ($9) for a friend's birthday. They're still working on it for breakfast every morning.....

Notes: Staff is super friendly. Cash + Credit.
author: Krystle T.

description:
If there's one weakness I have, it's a good apple fritter. At $1.75, these mammoths are a steal and are typically twice as much elsewhere. They have a nice crispy glazed exterior with a soft moist interior, complete with well-distributed apple bits and cinnamon marbling. YUM! 

The raised glazed donuts are nice and fluffy and heavenly when they're fresh. Old-fashioned chocolate and the maple bars filled with custard are amazing too! 

If you're here for the first time, be sure to scope out the donuts in the front window before getting in line. Some donuts aren't always readily available and it's hard to see what's there once you get sucked into the line that never ends. However, the wait goes pretty quickly. 

Bob's is open 24/7, the service is friendly, and the prices are crazy affordable. You can pretty much get anything you want without feeling guilty about how much you're spending. How you feel after you finish eating 5 donuts is another story though. I always intend to get two fritters, but I end up with a bag of donuts that I can barely close...but it's because they're so delicious! I can't help it! Thanks Bob's for feeding my addiction at all hours and keeping this donutholic happy :)
author: Deanna Y.

description: Used a few Big Ones as a birthday cake, absolutely amazing but make sure you pre-order a couple days before to ensure you get one.  I didn't know what to expect from the crumb donut until I found out it is a donut covered in crumbs from a glazed donut and boy is it good.
author: Evan G.

description:
Bob's, I wish I knew how to quit you!

There's usually a line out the door for a reason. Sure, often times it's drunk people after 9pm, but even drunk people deserve awesome donuts!

If I was honestly checking in every time I stopped in here, I'd be the reigning Duchesses supreme. So there, my dirty secret is out, go ahead and judge. I LOVE LOVE LOVE Bob's donuts. I do have some ground rules though, for starters I can only get one if I've walked there, because the .8 mile round trip from my apartment TOTALLY burns off the calories, right??

Great thing is they are making the donuts fresh around the clock. So you're never getting anything stale. My favorite donut used to be the chocolate bar, but I haven't found any like the ones I used to get in SoCal. Bob's has broadened my horizons, yet thankfully not my waist line. The crumb donuts are truly the BEST. I have a preference for the raised crumb donuts, but the cake crumb are a close second. I'm also a big fan of these amaaaaazing cinnamon roll raised donuts. So I don't completely hate myself, I cut that one in half and eat the second piece the next day. 

Everyone who works here is very friendly. You'll usually find the nice older lady working in the afternoon/evenings. She loves to chat it up and seems to really enjoy interacting with her customers. 

So when you're venturing down Polk St, just let your nose lead you towards the delicious smell of freshly made donuts.
author: Amanda F.

description: This place is super good! It definitely lives up to the hype. I tried the maple donut and it was delicious--flavorful, sweet, and plush. It was one of the best donuts I've ever had. The ambience is great, too. It almost feels like a diner one would find in a 90s sitcom. If you're going through SF, it's worth stopping by.
author: Emilia C.

description:
Wow... Came all the way down here for their donuts BC of thousands of reviews... Old/ dirty facility, mediocre donuts and the cashier lady cannot be any ruder. 

Well. Never try , never know. Not worth a trip guys!
author: Mel D.

description: I don't get the great reviews. The jelly donut is like bread not a donut. It's a jelly sandwich. $1 for a box?? Are you actually discouraging people from buying more than two things? Not worth the calories.
author: Nancy R.

description:
We originally stopped in to try one of the giant donuts but they were all sold out and would have any more for a few hours. After waiting in the long line, we were just happy to get some donuts. Located right on Polk Street and open 24 hours this is the spot to go both pre drinks & post drinks on a Saturday night. We had the glazed raised and a chocolate glazed donut that we watched get dunked in dripping hot chocolate sauce right in front of us. YUM! 

The flavor of the donuts is really unique. They are really funky looking & if I didn't trust the long line of people stuffing their faces with these donuts then I'm not sure I'd have tried them. So glad I did! The unique dough flavor and fresh glaze on top is so delicious & you can't beat the location!
author: Kari G.

description: Came after a friend had told us how amazing their donuts were. We bought the giant glazed donut with sprinkles and were VERY satisfied. I was afraid it would be dry and dense like most donuts are, but it was SO moist and fluffy! I'll definitely be back!
author: Johana M.

description:
Love the donuts but service can be rude as hell. For example, I asked for a dusting of cinnamon on my cinnamon donut (theirs is usually light to begin with so I do this every time). The guy didn't want to do it so instead said it wouldn't stick and thus, "that's gonna be all the cinnamon." There was no line or anything. 

Seriously? Kinda weak.
author: Meredith S.

description:
Donuts. Simple and delightfully delicious. Bob's Donuts is definitely the place to go. It also helps that it is open 24 hours a day so it can satisfy your donut cravings ANYTIME. 

My donut cravings are usually around 10:00 PM and luckily for me, they make fresh donuts around then! I would suggest getting whatever they are making at the moment- I guarantee it will be tasty, fresh, warm, and desiring another one.

Plus, the workers here are super chill and will patiently wait for you to decide which donut(s) you want. There are so many to choose from that ordering probably takes longer than actually eating one donut. If there is a line, it's well worth the wait.

They also accept credit cards- including Amex! Win.
author: Grace L.

description:
Probably the best donut shop in San Francisco.
Probably the best donut shop in San Francisco.
probably the best donut shop in San Francisco. Lol
author: Miguel Y.

description:
I do agree with some reviewers here that Bob's is overhyped, but that doesn't mean the donuts aren't deliciosoo.

I came here around 730pm on a Saturday night and the line wasn't too bad, it started getting busy around 8 though. Try to avoid prime hours (aka whenever Polk gets active) if you don't wanna wait.

We got the maple-glazed and sprinkled cake donut as well as the chocolate glazed old fashioned. I highly recommend the cake donut, it was gooooood.
author: Vivian W.

description: So good! Definitely go for the buttermilk if they have it. When they are hot and fresh they are fabulous! Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because I have gone before when their donuts were clearly very old and it was too tough to eat and not enjoyable. This has only happened once so maybe an off day. I would still highly recommend
author: Emily C.

description:
I wasn't planning on eating donuts the day I walked into Bob's. Someone mentioned they wanted to stop by and I figured a donut could be tasty. Let me tell you... it wasn't just tasty. IT WAS ONE OF THE BEST DONUTS EVER. Look, this is not some fancy donut shop with bells and whistles. They seem to put all of their effort into concocting the most tasty donuts this side of the Mississippi. 

My friends and I walked into this small unassuming shop on a Thursday evening. We had just been talking about whether or not they would have the selection or quality we desired as it was later in the day. I asked if they had any maple donuts as I didn't see any in the display case. The guy at the front (who was very friendly) said he did and pulled one out of the "freshly made" tray. It wasn't hot out of the oven... but it had that lingering warmth that told me, it was fresh. I paid my $1.25 for my donut and sat waiting for my friends to join me at the counter. 

Now before I tell you about the experience I had ingesting that donut, let me tell you what I look for in a donut. It's actually really simple: 1. It needs to be fluffy and 2. It needs to be sweet but not hurt my teeth when I bite into it. 

BOB, you have nailed it on the head. The first bite into that perfect morsel was such an experience I inhaled the rest. INHALED. I promptly got up and purchased another one. It was so freaking delicious. It's probably a good thing I don't live in San Francisco or I would be a lot squishier than I am now. 

If you are looking for a donut shop that will give you the most delicious classic donut experience... go to Bob's. He won't let you down.
author: Lindsey R.

description:
Glazed donuts to die for!
They kicked it out of the park at tonight's The Yelp Literati event.
Donut holes you could put on a stick. Samples of apple fritter, french, glazed, coffee cake, etc etc. sigh...burp...
author: Joanna T.

description: Delicious donuts - great service. Definitely coming back when I'm in the area!!!
author: Mio W.

description:
300!

(And here are some more numbers):

2.5 stars for the Cold War USSR interior.

FIVE (5) STARS all the way for Bob's donuts!
