Oh my goodness, sweetness, buttery, custardy, soft and melty deliciousness!

I bought a dozen on a Groupon and it came with a T-shirt my little boy didn't want to take off for a day. He loves the T-shirt because he loves Bob's Donuts and ate 4.5 donuts the day we brought the box home. 

(I had to hide the box inside the microwave because he was so obsessed and sugared up)

I  giggled at the sign in the store window that says "The best donuts ever" by "some guy who really likes donuts."

They don't take themselves so seriously except for their delicious donut-making which is **world class.**
author: Jennifer O.

description: A fatty kid must in San Francisco! Expect a little line any day of the week but for good reason. Besides Krispy Kreme in the south I've never experienced HOT donuts anywhere else. All of their donuts are incredible from the simple glazed raised donut to the massive Apple fritter. They never fail to disappoint and the cashiers are always so warm and welcoming. Treat Yo'self get a half dozen for yourself! Lol
author: Jovone W.

description:
Actually where else can you get a better variety of donuts for a reasonable price and at any hour?!

From the cruller to old fashioned and the fritter, the quality and friendly service at Bob's is top notch.

Cheers!
author: Joseph L.

description:
Friendly and super sweet staff! Love talking and making customers feel at home! 

Donuts were amazing! Some of the best donuts and are classic! Don't miss out!
author: Yolanda C.

description: Freshly made donuts. Open late late late. Perfect post bar stop. Worth the wait if there's a line. Melts in your mouth deliciousness so amazing you actually think it's worth the calories you're putting in your body. You get to watch them make your donuts right before your eyes, which doesn't make it any healthier, but at least this shizzaz is insanely fresh!
author: David A R.

description: Melt in your mouth donuts. Line gets long anytime of the day but worth it. Happy my friend lives right around the corner from here!!!
author: P J.

description:
Fresh, delicious, open 24 hours. 

There is a line at 10pm on a Sat night, at a donut shop, I mean seriously!

They sell coffee and small cartons of milk too, too bad no soy or almond options.

The maple bar with custard is to die for.  Get it.
author: Yue L.

description: I called in one night at 10:30pm asking if they had the giant glazed donut. They said they wouldnt make the next batch until 1am so I gave up and tried the next day. I went in this time hoping they had my donut but they only had maple. I asked if they could make the giant glazed and they did it! It took 15 minutes as they seem to have a method to their madness but finally those big guys were up. It is so interesting to see them make it but it also deterred me cuz I saw it dripped in oil and then glaze. Oh well..It was my birthday and I can eat the fattiness if I want to. They were super nice and made a quarter with sprinkles and added a donut with a bite size one on top to make it a cake. They gave me a candle and everyone sang for me. Super cool workers and guests you got there. As for the donut, it is huge. It isnt fluffy like the smaller versions which I would have liked. I could sorta taste the oil that it was fried in which sorta made eating it without feeling guilt even harder. Whatever, I got my insta photo and ate a huge ass donut haha. I was told that 15 regular donuts make up that big one but its half the cost. You can do the challenge as well if you finish within 2 minutes..you get that free donut and a shirt. Good luck....your tummy wont like it.
author: Amy H.

description:
Apple Fritter: 5 stars
Crispy and sugary and perfectly-textured large.

Maple Eclair / Long John: 4 stars
Soft delicious bread filled with Boston cream custard.
author: Letitia L.

description: I'm not gonna lie this place has fantastic doughnuts!!!  Highly recommended and the guys that work there are very nice and personable. 5 stars
author: Anthony L.

description:
Since my friend told me about Bob's back in May, I've been waiting for the opportunity to visit and fall in love with the donuts like so many other people have. This weekend we made it. I can't help but wonder what the big deal is (?). 

From arrival, to looking through the display window, to eating our selections - the most appropriate descriptor I can think of is, disappointed. Or sad. Selection (mid-day on a weekend) was incredibly minimal, prices were not clearly labeled - so unfortunately we spent $2.5 (eek, really?) on a meh raspberry jelly and $2.95 (wow!!) on a mediocre custard filled. For that price, I'd expect slightly bigger donuts in a much more glamorous pastry shop. I respect hard-work and a 24 hour establishment (it's not easy), however I will not be returning.
author: Christina L.

description: Cool place, noticed it while bar hopping in the area because there was a line lit the door. The coolest thing about this place is that they continue to make fresh donuts so you get the freshest little ball of sugar that you can possibly get. The crumb one is for sure the best one we had here. If your in the area, do yourself the favor and come try this place out. The experience itself is well worth it.
author: Ryan S.

description: Loved Bob's. The apple fritters are the best. We watched someone try and win the giant donut eating competition. No chance.
author: DB B.

description: 5 stars and nothing less. Thank god I live too far away to walk here. I've tried every donut place in SF and Bobs rules.
author: Jennifer R.

description: My daughter and I thought we would skip dinner and simply go out for a mid-evening treat. Well, even the best laid plans will go haywire when you encounter Bob's Donut and Pastry Shop. Start your Modified Eating Plan tomorrow because Bob's can't wait! Oh warm, glazed donut, how we love you so!
author: Wendy A.

description: I had to stop and get a donut during my first trip to San Francisco. I had heard about this shop for the donut challenge. Those donuts were huge! I just got a dozen of regular glazed donuts and they were delicious. Better than an donut I've had in the LA, MS, and AL area. There was a line but it moved quickly! Definitely need to try it out. Shop wasn't impressive.
author: Savana L.

description:
I grew up with Dunkin Dounuts and Krispy Kreme my entire life. Mom and Pop donut shops are hard to find where I'm from. So when a friend told me about Bob's a was a little hesitant. I mean they can't be that good right? WRONG. They're better than good. They're AMAZING!!! On to the breakdown...

Decor: It's your typical hole in the wall, not in the donut haha. Nothing really on decor. There is a table with a few chairs for those who really run out of breath climbing all those damn hills in San Fran, but for the most part this is a take out only type of place. It was clean and sanitary. 

Service. I've been there multiple times and I've never had a bad experience. The cashier is always patient and makes suggestions if it's your first time and if you find yourself at the rare occasion that there is not a line the greet you with a warm hello and a smile.

Food: I sort of mad at Bob's for their donuts. I live on the east coast (between Orlando and NYC mostly) and I can only make it to San Francisco a couple of times a month. They have completely ruined eating donuts for me. No one, and I do mean no one, can make an apple fritter like Bob's. Omg... just delicious. It more than melts in your mouth, it's just this soft, fluffy, sugary, just... it's good. Trust me. The regular glazed, yeah just as good. The donut holes..... I mean did you expect me to say anything other than they're fantastic?!?! Seriously you can't go wrong. pick anything. I'm sure you'll love it. Just don't eat all of the donuts when I'm in line. Or better yet do, that way I can get one fresh from the fryer.
author: Chelsea E.

description: Amazing chocolate croissant stopped by for breakfast with the family on the way out of town. Great place to get a quick breakfast or snack. The kids all loved their donuts.
author: Ben H.

description:
Simply put, if you don't get an apple fritter when it's hot and fresh, then you're seriously missing out. Like, DONUT FOMO TO THE MAX.

I'd write more, but then I would have to hop in a Lyft and go there now... I just can't do that to myself.

Just trust me.
author: Gabriela K.

description: Def worth the hype if you're looking for a sugar spike, I ate 3 donuts and was way too many but I had a good buzz if ya know what I mean, I went with the original glazed and apple fritter and they were both excellent, the glazed was still fresh and the glaze broke up nicely
author: Mike V.

description: My previous review is still true, but when I cut into the giant donut at home, I discovered that it had several pockets of raw dough.  I threw it away so that no one would get sick.  They need to figure out a way to fix that problem with their giant donuts.
author: Teresa M.

description: Heard a lot about Bob's Donuts as the "must try" donut shop in San Francisco. We headed straight to Bob's for dessert, after having a wonderful meal at the Nob Hill Cafe. We were blown away by the giant donuts on display!! I ordered a cinnamon roll, and both my sisters had the glazed donuts. Their glazed donuts tasted airy, fresh, pillowy-soft melt in your mouth deliciousness!! My cinnamon roll on the hand was not that great & just "ok". A little on the dense side & did not taste...fresh. I have had better tasting cinnamon rolls. I wish I would had ordered the crumb donut instead...oh well...next time. The place could be a little "cleaner"...but I guess it is part of their neighborhood "charm".
author: Cynthia R.

description:
I saw this online while planning our day trip to San Francisco. We saw the gigantic $8 donut and we had to try it out!

This is located in the city and parking is a little hard (duh. It's San Francisco). It is a pretty small shop with about 4-6 tables that seat 2 and a counter showing the donuts available to be devoured. Seeing other reviews say that they usually sell out of the big donuts quickly, I called in ahead of time and ordered the gigantic donut with chocolate glaze and sprinkles.

Service is a 5/5. They weren't busy at all when I went Wednesday afternoon and we were taken care of quickly and efficiently. The lady at the cashier (I didn't get her name) was very friendly. She made sure we were happy with our order before letting us go.

The donut was superb! Maybe it's a hit or miss, but our donut was cooked to perfection! It became my breakfast, lunch and dinner, and I was sharing with my cousin, too! For $7.95, it was worth the price, despite being a little expensive. However, I think this was a great treat once in a while (though I wish I could eat it everyday!)

I had a great experience with this donut shop. I can't wait to come back and try something else!
author: Ciara Lene G.

description:
I've been here twice now and I still don't understand why everyone raves about how great this place was. I've been here in the afternoon and late at night. I've tried their donut holes, maple bars, and a regular glazed cake donut. I still have yet to be impressed. The donuts just taste like your typical donut from any donut shop. 

Last time I was here, I waited 10 minutes before anyone appeared to help me at the counter. I looked around for a bell or something to notify the staff, but I wasn't able to find one. Also, the interior of the donut shop looks very run down and slightly dingy. I didn't notice before because I would always just get my donuts to-go. 

After reading some reviews, maybe it's the fact that I haven't gotten freshly fried donuts. Maybe if I'm in the area, I'll give Bob's Donuts another chance.
author: Melanie H.

description:
Donuts are good.  But I would not say they are awesome.
Old school shop however - makes it worth coming to.
author: Lewis C.

description: Have been buying donuts here for decades.  The donuts now are very small and definitely not the same as those we grew up on and loved.  The old fashioned glazed donuts are never available if you try to buy them mid-morning.  It used to be that you could pick up a dozen anytime to share anytime you felt like it.  We're looking for a new favorite donut shop now even though this one is close to home.  Too bad you changed so much Bobs!
author: Marcia Y.

description:
Come to this place strictly for the apple fritters.  They make them fresh around 9 or 10 pm.  Fresh donuts brings a crowd and expect to wait if you arrive after 10pm. If you go in the morning, you may be lucky if they have any left.  They have the best fritters i've ever tasted so it's worth waiting in line. A little greasy, but if you're eating a donut, you're not probably not worried about health.  Eat this with some milk and you're good to go.  

The fritters alone are 5 stars, but their other donuts are just average.  

Note** Apple fritters are not nearly as good the morning after.
author: Jaylin C.

description:
Get ready for your cholesterol level to become at an all time high with the deep frying and sugar coating of donuts that they serve up at this place!

Ordering up one of each of their donuts that they offered, their donuts were simply mediocre.

I suppose this place can get quite busy when you're craving for something fattening delicious during the late night wee hours.  

Other than that, their donuts were passive.
author: Tiffany D.

description: The apple fritter (im a connoisseur) was good. The old fashioned glazed was solid. The cinnamon-sugar was daymn good. But O. M. G. The regular glazed donut was biting into a sweet piece of heaven. No exaggeration. Like one of the best donuts I've ever tasted. Go to this place. Behold the glory of this perfect donut. Bring cash
author: DW S.

description: Yes, there is a line but more importantly, yes it is worth it. I have donut fiends at home and trust me when I say these were amazing. They have a giant donut, and I mean giant, apple critters, French donuts, custard stuffed etc etc. but if your wondering what makes this place have a line when there are two more places 100ft away with no lines, it's the fluffiness. They have a mouth watering fluff to their dough that most do not. Don't believe me ? Buy a dozen donut holes and just try one. If you want them even better either buy them right after 2 am with a hot and fresh batch or wait till you get home and pop one in the microwave for 7 seconds, you'll thank me later.
author: Daniel G.

description: Fantastic place to get your donut fix. We walked 30 minutes mostly up hill to get here from China Town and it was worth the walk. We were recommended to this place by a local and we were not disappointed. It's a hole in the wall with a line but those are my favorite kind of places.
author: Carlee C.

description: I think this place is kind of overrated given how much hype is around it. The donuts are affordable, and the shop is open 24 hours - but I don't think they're as great as people say they are. I'm not comparing it to fancier donuts, but I think I could get a classic glazed donut anywhere, and I get the same experience without having to wait in line like I have to do here. I've been here twice now, and I have the same feelings about it. I'll be back if I'm in the area and if there's no line out the door (unlikely), but I won't actively seek it out.
author: Steph V.

description: Best donuts in the Bay Area. Their crumble old fashioned are incredible. Make the trip to Bobs
author: Dave S.

description: First of all...let me clear a bit for those 1 star of Bob's Donut. This is considered as a local community staple for the locals and any visitors who can appreciate its raunchy vibe that makes it unique. If not, you can go to one of those upscale homogeneous emulated version of Bob's Donut where you love to throw $5 dollars for a coin size donut and hang (socialize) with your friends over conversations with no substances and pretend to be open minded when you really aren't! If you feel happier sipping on $7 dollar organic coffee and believing that the label fair-trade is good for the community because you are a supposedly community conscious. Fuck you dude! Giving the farmers $1 dollar extra for a ton of coffee is basically like saying for every $30 dollar breast cancer shirt you buy the company will donate .01 cent to the cause or for every $1000 of Nike shoes you purchased... .25 cent will go towards building a community. Love you out of touch bubble living fake no substance whack people.
author: Seng S.

description: No gluten free donuts at all or ever, do not waste your time! Bummer because one of the reviewers said there were.
author: Joan B.

description: Revisited with open mind. Sunny day, good breeze, warm thoughts. Delicious, crisp glazed old fashioned with no after taste.  Notes of vanilla and lemon. Chocolate iced cake was perfection-with-a-hole-in-it. Line out the door at 3:40 pm. Quick service. Did get one of our orders wrong. Place still complete dive. But with low overhead, very affordable. Four donuts for four dollars. Apologize to everyone for not eating here before now.
author: Bob J.

description:
Best glazed raised donut we have found in SF (or any other city).  My husband and I have tried SO many donut places (it's a common "weekend treat" for us).  If we're looking for a good 'ole glazed/raised - this is the spot to go.  

My favorite is the big donut - it's much more chewy/fresh than the smaller versions.  We usually stop in early on a Saturday morning when we have visitors in town to share amongst all of us - it's always been a hit.

I believe they are also known for their apple fritters (which smell delicious), but we prefer the raised style.
author: Rachael S.

description:
The one and only home of the infamous GIANT donuts. If you know me, you know that donuts are my absolute favorite pass time so I was beyond ecstatic to have finally tried this place. 

*GIANT crumb donut = BEST decision ever.
author: Anna T.

description:
I see a lot of non-locals making Yelp-fueled pilgrimages to this place looking for the World's Greatest Donut. Let me save you a trip - you're not going to find it at Bob's. Their donuts are average, so you might as well stay in Fairfield or NYC. 

And that isn't the point of Bob's, or the reason it's been around for 70 years. Bob's in the only place in this part of the city where you can get a pastry while walking your dog at 5AM. They're made right there, and are crazy cheap. And the service is always friendly, despite god-knows-what kinds of drunk, homeless, city underbelly-ites they have to deal with on a daily basis.  A neighborhood institution, for folks in the neighborhood. Health score = 96/100.
author: Nick C.

description:
Perfect!! Simple donuts at an affordable price. 3 donuts cost us $3.95 which is an absolute bargain. Full of flavour and very mouth watering donuts. 

Definitely make sure to check this place out. Crumb donuts & Cinnamon scroll for the win!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Holy moly wholly!!  

Them APPLE FRITTERS are DA BOMBSZZZZ!

Apples, crunchy, glazed sugar, and all that deep friedness makes it tastes so good!  So amazingly good!!

Love the novelty jumbolicious donuts they serve too!  Good for photo opts but best if you don't down one on your own :)  If you do, kudos to you!!!
author: Jenny T.

description: My kingdom for an apple fritter! Get 'em while they're hot, late at night, worth the wait. I swear I won't have a hangover if I nab one of these sweet babies after a few local cocktails. Sometimes one just has to say "diet be damned" and treat your mouth to the carnal goodness of Bob's donuts.
author: Dee C.

description:
Ummmmmm yummy in my freaking tummy! I love apple fritters! And Bob's donuts makes an ahmazing one!  Yes, the line might be long,  but it's really worth the wait. They're pretty friendly... even when you freeze up during order because there are so many choices!  

The best thing is that they're open 24/7 woo if you're lucky, you might just get a fresh one or two in your box!  :)
author: Frances C.

description:
My friend (who isn't a donut fan) brought me here because it was close by, had stellar reviews, and I was just really craving donuts. We came in the middle of the day, probably around 2pm when there were a few people around the shop. In the window I could see a not too wide assortment of donuts, but they had what I wanted to try all the same. Inside, it was pretty dingy - didn't feel the most comfortable ordering from this place. But hey, health score reportedly fantastic so, what the hell.

I got an apple fritter, which may or may not be a donut depending on who you ask but personally tells a lot about this donut shop. Terrible. I really hope that the particular fritter I received was way out of the ordinary. The glaze was way too sugary (I get it - it's glaze so sugar is expected, but there's a point when it becomes too much) without a cinnamon flavor, and somehow (maybe it was fried for too long?) the inside was soaked in oil. I took one bite and it was truly one of the most unappetizing donuts I could imagine.

I also got a plain glazed, which was nothing out of the ordinary really. It wasn't cloud-like in softness or delicately sweetened, nope just your average glazed donut.

I judge a donut shop on the simple things. If you can't get them right, I just can't move forward from there.
author: Krish B.

description:
I just ate an entire glazed donut under 30 seconds about 5 minutes ago and I am so glad I gave away the other 3 to my family or I would've polished off the rest of them before realizing the sin I've committed!

Hands down the best donut I've ever had in my entire life. I'm usually unable to finish an entire donut without feeling gross immediately afterwards but these donuts keep me wanting more. I'm usually a Krispy Kreme kinda gal mainly because they melt in your mouth and are small enough so that I don't feel as bad about inhaling them. However, the sweetness in KK's glazed donuts tend to overwhelm me.

Bob's on the other hand are light and pillowy. I was worried there wasn't enough glaze covering them but I was pleasantly surprised by how perfectly mellow the sweetness was. I don't feel obligated to chase them down with coffee or milk although they would still be the perfect beverage accompaniment! I often find that most donuts leave a slight oily/greasy aftertaste in your mouth but you won't find that with these here donuts!

I also couldn't believe it when I found out they're open 24 hours! My coworker bought an apple fritter and some other donuts one late night and said they were all freshly made. I can't wait to come by soon to grab some fresh donuts after some late night drinking!
author: Ivy Z.

description:
Go at 3AM and make sure to get something that's FRESH out of the oven, whatever it is.

You will wolf that whatever fresh thing down without manners, mouthgasm, and regret nothing.. at least until the next morning.
author: Tian Q.

description:
So good. So cheap. 

It's the place to go for non-artisanal donuts.

I have to say that although the apple fritter was great, the simple glazed was my favorite. He chocolate covered one was good too. But to me it's clear that the simple standard ones are the best here.
author: Mariko F.

description:
We stopped by Bob's on the way out of town this past weekend.  I have to say, I was not expecting to have the best doughnut I've ever had in my life.  But it happened. 

I got the last maple bar they had left, took a bite, and what is this? Custard filling!  After the shock I realized that it was.... awesome! 

Seriously though, the idea of putting custard filling in a maple bar is absolute genius.  After how good it was I'm really surprised this is not the most popular doughnut in the world. 

The only complaint I have is that they only had one of these incredible maple bars left.  We fought over who got to eat it (everyone wanted a bite) and it was gone before I could take a picture.

Five stars!
author: Michael T.

description: Tasted the glazed donut as well as the chocolate glaze with sprinkles. I was a bit disappointed at the size of the chocolate glaze as it was not even half the size of the glazed at the same price. Taste wise: both were very fluffy and airy. Def fresh and unique compared to the typical dunkin donuts. There was no line but the only thing was that there was no menu. You pretty much order what you see on the cooling racks behind the register. I would def go back for the regular glazed donut.
author: Karen K.

description: I came here on recommendation from a friend. Their donuts are indistinguishable from at 7/11 donut. Their coffee is good. The huge donuts are funny. The kitsch on the wall is cute. I wouldn't go out of my way to try it if I were you.
author: Betty N.

description:
Good lord Ol Mighty...freshly made Old Fashioned straight out of the fryer...DOES it GET Any BETTER!!!! 

I also had the chance to try a chocolate éclair and crumb donut. I am sad to report they all were no where as good as that Old Fashioned but then again is it really a fair comparison?

Éclair filling lacked sweetness and the texture was too doughy
Crumb donut was a solid straight forward bite

Overall Thoughts 

Any donut that is fresh out of the fryer I am sold but those that have been sitting out lack a certain wow factor
author: Eddie W.

description: Donut holes seemed a bit stale and the apple fritter was a little too sweet / sugary.  The glazed donut had a good flavor, but I would have prefer less density.
author: Kristine B.

description: We had the giant donut with chocolate and sprinkles and it was great. However, I wish they had more seating inside and a fan or something. That place was HOT AF. We ended up walking to Lafayette Park to eat.
author: Sam C.

description:
Awwwwwww yeeeeeaaaaaahhhhhh
Hot, fresh, greasy, tasty donuts at 4pm. Deep, rich chocolate flavor, tasty extra crumbly crumb and perfectly sweet maple.
We came here in the mid afternoon because a long line had formed so obviously people knew what was up. So good. So bad for you. So perfect in that way donuts should be. They are a little on the small side but they were a DOLLAR. And service was quick, friendly and you get a donut out of it.
You're welcome.
author: Kaylie L.

description:
This is place is not overrated.   

hands down this is one of the freshest best donut I have had.

Food:   (4/5)   I ordered Apple fritter donut and it was amazing. The top was warm and crumbly.  I splitted with my friend.

Service:  (3.5/5)  the line was kind long but moved a long very quickly. Be prepared to wear

Atmosphere:  (45/5)  very small place.  But it smelled very delicious
author: Michael W.

description: Super fun place to visit. I was pleasantly surprised how good the big glazed donut tasted. The owner was really sweet. We waited in line (which told me it had to be good) and it was definitely worth it.  My husband had the chocolate (and he's a donut connoisseur) and he loved it. It's definitely worth hunting this place down for dessert. I won't make a trip back to San Francisco without stopping by Bobs Donuts.
author: Charli G.

description:
While 7x7's annual "100 Things to Eat Before You Die" list is certainly imperfect, I have to say - they were dead on to include Bob's Donuts on the list.  By nature, donuts are guiltfully delicious for the most part, but these Apple Fritters are freaking amazing!

In nearly every way, the APPLE FRITTER exceeded my expectations.  Despite its larger than expected size, the donut wasn't doughy at all.  The outside had a terrifically crispy crust and the inside was moist and soft.  More importantly, the taste was spot on - just the right amount of sweetness and apple flavor.  Too bad (for me) there was only one donut for all of us to share!

As much as I loved the fritter though, the other donuts we tried didn't make as much of an impression.  To be honest, the FRENCH CRULLERS (Frosted and Chocolate) and the BUTTERMILK DONUTS (Frosted and Chocolate) didn't seem all that different from what you can get at any other donut shop.  The French Crullers were light, airy, and a bit creamy, but the frosted one in particular wasn't all that flavorful to me.  Both buttermilk donuts were better and pretty solid overall, but it's important to note they're heavier than regular donuts (hellooo buttermilk!) so be prepared.

Despite the fact that they're open 24/7, you shouldn't be surprised to come across a line no matter what time you go.  Yes, they're that popular (1300+ reviews...for a DONUT SHOP!).  And be sure to keep an eye out for their jumbo donuts too!  I'm a bit tempted to come back for one of those, but I'll definitely be back for more fritters!
author: Mike L.

description: Um Yaaaasss. So worth the wait! The donut is so fluffy and yummie. We got the big donuts and was around $6. The line was long and took awhile since there was only one cashier. I would say that it was worth standing in line for the first time experience but I prob wouldn't wait next time I'm craving them.
author: Ruby G.

description:
Love this greasy spoon. The lady who runs/owns?  the shop is a sweet loveable version of Seinfeld's soup nazi. Be ready to order to keep the line
moving. :)
author: Mike M.

description: Always come here around 9pm or after bar hopping 1:30/2am when they make fresh donuts. Just get whatever they're making right on the spot. You won't regret it. There's just something about after a long night of drinking and/or eating and biting into a hot fresh donut. If I'm ever on Polk st, I always try to hit up Bob's. It's almost like a staple thing to do if you're on Polk. I knocked off a star for sanitary reasons. Not gonna stop me from going to Bob's though.
author: Melanie J.

description: Fresh and available 24 hrs a day. I love the apple fritters the most, along with their lemon bars and jelly filled donuts. Every time I visit the city, I crave going to Bob's.
author: Alice S.

description:
It has always been a goal of mine to get their 2AM fresh glazed donuts...how I was going to accomplish this since I'm not from SF, I didn't know.

BUT one night my boyfriend and I were at a show in SF that ran past 1:30. We walk out and my boyfriend asked if I was ready to go home. I looked at the time and asked if we could go get some donuts and I knew he was thinking  something along the lines of "This fuckin' fatass really wants donuts at 2 in the morning though". We got there just in time for the fresh warm melt in your mouth donuts and we both knew it was worth staying out a little bit later for.

About a year later we find ourselves in the area (for swan oyster) and decide to pop in. It was about 5pm on a friday and their selection was VERY scarce...especially compared to their 2am options. Thankfully though they were in the middle of making a fresh batch of french crullers..omg these were SO FUCKING GOOD; slightly crispy on the outside but extremely light and just melt in your mouth almost the way cotton candy does. I could have easily had a dozen to myself...but I only had one and a crumb donut which was very good as well.

Highly recommend this place :D
author: Melissa C.

description: So I've been waiting for the ultimate munchies for Bob's donuts. Walked past plenty of times so last night I waited in the line and as we got closer the  cleanliness or lack there of became very apparent.  It's filthy inside.  Whole containers of old or discarded donuts huge buckets of uncovered chocolate and frosting looked pretty gross. Two guys in the whole place and no one seems to care about the mountains of crap I everywhere. We got a donut each and I had a hard time sitting there it was so gross. I get the hole in the wall vibe but the level of  gross was very real. The donuts are tasty just wish the store was better maintained for a place that serves food.
author: nancy w.

description:
Went in at 2pm on a Sunday... they had JACK.
Every tray was empty except for a few pathetic items.  
I don't get the hype of this place.
author: Margaret W.

description: The apple fritter and maple bar were my favorite. The customer service was excellent too. Ended up going to the coffee shop 2 doors down to get an excellent espresso to top it all off.
author: Jason B.

description: The donuts are served warm, soft, fresh, and DELICIOUS! They're generously sized so you definitely get your money's worth. The staff is super friendly and playful, which I loved. Seems like a place you could chill for hours! I didn't see any menus anywhere, and their website is outdated, so you kind of have to look around at what they're frying up to see what you can order. So far I've the apple fritter and cinnamon bun, both of which were amazing! I'll be back to try more!
author: LoLinda G.

description: Okay so the crumb donut is a MUST TRY....the other donuts I would say Meh...so so but the crumb is amazing in taste, texture and overall deliverance of an amazing donut. It could probably win in the county fair. Cashiers are friendly and I enjoyed reading a little of the history of Bob's via the newspaper article taped to the wall inside the narrow dining area.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Came early in the morning on a Sunday before the Bay to Breakers race and the line for donuts was surprisingly short. The donut shop itself is tiny and unremarkable but get these amazing donuts to go and sit somewhere beautiful while you enjoy them! The fluffy, sweet crumb donut was to-die-for but even more incredible was the fried apple fritter, served slightly warm and filled with chopped apple and cinnamon goodness.
author: Sol C.

description: Can not tell you in so many words how AH-MAZE-ING these donuts are!!!!!! They're incredibly soft and chewy and fantastic! They last way longer than any donut I know (if you don't eat all of them In one shot!) I got a half dozen and wasn't able to finish them all with my BF! Had them for breakfast the next morning! The softness was still there! The maple flavor was my favorite!!! EVERYONE NEEDS TO TRY THESE DONUTS! Make the trip to San Fran! :)
author: Alice L.

description: Really disappointed in quality of donuts, I remember comming hear about a year ago seemed as if I found a new spot, purchased some donuts for the fellows at work they had nothing good to say wasted money here box's still full.as I tasted the donuts they taste like old oil just was not worth the money terrible I don't want to give a star cause that would be lying
author: Todd B.

description: Stopped by this little shop last night around 11pm and there was a pretty long line. This is a really small place with basically just a couple racks of donuts and a small bar/seating area that faces toward a TV. There was only one lady working so the line was moving pretty slow...but when we finally got our donuts it was pretty worth it! She recommended the crumb donut, apple fritter, and the freshest one they have (at the time I was there it was the buttermilk donuts). So I got the original glazed, crumb donut, cinnamon sugar cake donut, and chocolate buttermilk donut. My total was about $5. The best was definitely the crumb donut!! It was soo good and stood out amongst the others we got. I also liked how they sold little cartons of milk -- I haven't drank milk like that since I was in elementary school! So cute. Overall, I will definitely be back for more of those crumb donuts!!
author: Alyssa W.

description: Ok, saw the lines outside this place at 9pm on a Friday and said, heck yeah! Donuts!! We shared the plain sugar -  so soft! -- which was the bready type, a small maple glazed, which was cakey and yummy. But the best was the fresh off the fryer cruller. I think my eyes popped out of my head it was that good. Reminded me of zeppoles. So airy and eggy and light. I would have gotten right back on the line to get more if the line wasn't that long. Even saw a Postemate on line...which is giving me ideas right now as I am typing this review.
author: Stephanie L.

description: By far best donuts in the area. Great, quick service! Will definitely be coming back!
author: Stephanie N.

description: We got the giant chocolate glazed, raised glazed, and crumb. They were all delicious! I especially liked the giant raised chocolate glazed because it tastes great, it's awesome to see such a giant donut, and it's v picture-worthy. We went at 9:30 AM, and they weren't warm or super fresh - but still delicious and everyone should go. Also weren't super busy at 9:30 AM on Saturday, shockingly.
author: Lauren G.

description: The smell of the cooking donuts drew us to this place.  Then we saw the display of handmade donuts in the window that included a 9" x 9" donut!  They even have a donut challenge, eat one of the 9x9s in 2 minutes or less and it's free!  Will be going back here everyday left in our stay.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I had purchased a Groupon for Bob's Donut place a while back, and I got to redeem while I was in the city a few months ago. I ended up choosing several just plain glazed donuts with a few other different types consisting of chocolate & powder sugar ones. I soo loved the plain glazed donuts the most cause it was the perfect amount of sweetness & it was pretty fluffy. I also got a tshirt too because the Groupon included a dozen donuts with a tshirt.

If I happen to be craving donuts in the city, I'll definitely come back to Bob's!! :)
author: Amy C.

description: Fritters!  The apple fritter is the only donut I ever eat. Bob's makes a good one-light and not oily at all.   It happens about twice a month when the stars align, as I have missed my usual healthy brekkie at home and am walking by Bob's and there is not too long of a line.  There usually is only one woman working the counter at 7 in the morning and the line does not move quickly.  Their usually people in line in front of me who are buying a large box with an assortment of donuts for their office, which takes her some time to fill.  But hey, I guess that is proof that their donuts are good.  There are several choices for donuts in Polk Gulch with Star Bagel, Olga's Donuts and Donut time within a 8 block radius.  Am never there late at night, but hear Bob's sells lots of donuts when the bars get out.  The thought of having a donut after drinking and about to sleep does not seem like a great idea, but the taste of Bob's Donuts must bring em' back.
author: Derald C.

description: They had a wide variety of doughnuts all tasted delicious they were able to accommodate all 6 of us. My wife had 1 of the big doughnut and it was so comical how big it was. We will definitely be coming back
author: Matthew P.

description: Love their donuts, love that they are open 24 hours. At some hours the wait can be long, but it is nice to know at the end of the line there is a calm smiling person taking her time to attend to your donut needs.  Another reason which makes me like this place more? Lost my wallet there with a wad of cash at 2 AM. I retraced my step there the next day and my wallet and money was waiting for me at the cash register. Thanks for the honesty, service and amazing donuts.
author: Tittu T.

description: Who needs a birthday cake anymore when you can buy a GIANTS DONUTS! haha. I love the giants donuts. It's always yummy and people love it! Prefer glaze over any other. Unless you order ahead of time, you buy from what they have. There is always a line on Friday mornings and weekends. They do open 24 hours, even if there is a line, its a short wait.
author: Sandy B.

description: So the best doughnut in the city! I usually come late night after work and if the DoughGods are in a good mood you will walk into a fresh batch that has just been glazed. Crumb-glazed raised is fire, crumbcake bomb, and a greasy warm glazed raised is heaven.
author: Kyle L.

description:
5 stars for their raised donuts! 

0 star for everything else, including the donut bread pudding monstrosity. 

Overall, 3 stars.
author: K. S.

description: Someone please tell me what is the hype... taste like any other donut spot. Maybe cause im not a fan of sweets but i wont wait in no line for no donuts... but they did give out little cute nicknacks for valentines day that i gave to my daughter.... thought that was way cooler than the donut!!!
author: Theresa M.

description:
We enjoyed both the regular glaze and chocolate glaze donuts at 7:30pm.  They're super fresh, tender, and light without being dry.  What really stood out for us is that the glaze is thin and not too sweet.  In other words, just perfect.

Although we prefer donuts more dense and almost chewy, for the type of donut they make, Bob's gets it right!
author: Gina T.

description: I've been here a lot and normally it's good. But today it was not so good. It looks like there donuts are getting smaller. The old fashioned are tiny and the Owner Older Chinese Lady is Gross & not sanitary. I caught her eating crumbs off the trays while packaging donuts and licked her fingers then handles people's donuts. I was so grossed out. I bet if the Health Inspector came here this place would not Pass!
author: v v.

description: This place is legit. Sat in for about 30 minutes just taking in the smell of donuts. In that time period, 5 or so cops came in. Cops know good donuts right? That's how I knew I came to the right place. Donuts are my soul food. These donuts are amazing. Do your soul a favor and stop at Bob's.
author: Ana + Eric D.

description: If you haven't had a crumb donut from bobs you are missing out. The wait in line is well worth the apple fritter that awaits! Don't bring large bills, card is accepted. Any time I'm in SF I stop for a dozen for home and a fritter for the walk to the car!
author: Rob D.

description: I grew up getting doughnuts and pastries from here! Love them! They never disappoint and will continue being a fan till the end!
author: Tiff L.

description:
Best glazed donuts ever, yes, yes yes! If you like your donuts fluffy and not too sweet, seriously, go for the raised glazed donut. It's a classic that just won't die for a reason. Cinnamon rolls: bomb. Chocolate donuts: delicious. Cheap coffee, cheap milk. No frills, no fancy hipster ambiance. Like seriously, what else do ya need?

I can't even begin to tell you the best part. Is it that the donuts are dirt cheap? Hell yeah. Is it because they're open 24/7? Perfect for that late night donut craving.

If you find yourself bar hopping on Polk Street and would rather get something sweet instead of the savory hot dogs, GO HERE. But that late at night you'll find a line forming... but I promise it goes by pretty quickly.
author: Bettina P.

description: This place was ok, but not anywhere near the best donuts i've ever had. We went close to 8pm so there really wasn't much selection. They had some sprinkle donuts which were nothing to write home about and we also got one of the giant glazed donuts (unfortunately no sprinkle ones left) and it was just ok too. The crumb donut was tasty though! The lady at the counter was really sweet and talkative though, so it is probably a great neighborhood spot but if you're a tourist looking to hit "foodie" spots, I wouldn't go out of your way here.
author: jessica c.

description:
Just came at 5:25am on a Saturday morning.  Drive across town because of their 24/7 schedule and great reviews...  the first 4 things I asked for off the menu weren't available...

Walked off disappointed and decided to wait 30 min for Noah's bagels to open.
author: Buddha B.

description:
Saw this place after eating a super delish lunch at Common Sage and had to stop in. 
A real donut "dive" but pretty yummy. They have giant donuts but we opted for regular size maples; one cake and one crumb. 
Both were good. Not breathtaking but pretty yummy. 
Interesting crowd!
Not the cleanest place, like I wrote above, a bit of a dive.
author: Only Hell Yes Y.

description:
Delicious donuts! Great selection, open 24/7, reasonably priced - $1.25/donut. 

Accepts cc!
author: Minnie S.

description:
Best donuts hands down. Their old fashioned are awesome. Light on cakeyness, heavy on glaze/sugar. 

I feel cooler for having eaten there.
author: Anastasia K.

description: Get whatever is fresh! Everything was delicious but I especially enjoyed the maple glazed, custard filled donut. We stopped in everyday on our visit to San Francisco!
author: Julia T.

description: Found this place through Yelp and had to go because of the reviews. Was on the last day of a week long trip to SF with my boyfriend so we stopped here and grabbed doughnuts for the airport (to have while waiting to board our red eye). Waited on a short line outside that took way too long, as there was only one employee working and she was moving slowly. Actual atmosphere was nothing special and the employee couldn't answer what one pastry actually was - but boy were they delicious! Got a chocolate frosted doughnut, a crumb doughnut, and a piece of something that seemed to be apple cinnamon. Wish we could have seen one of those huge doughnuts, but it was worth the stop!
author: Jessica M.

description: We just tried Bob's for the first time ever. It's Monday night at 10 pm and we walked in and asked what we should order. We were advised to order whatever was just freshly made. So, we got maple buttermilk bars that were just seconds from the fryer. I have never tasted anything so heavenly in my life - the best donuts ever!!!
author: Brad L.

description:
Was looking for a dessert place near my hotel and was surprised to see this place was highly rated. Maybe I wasn't lucky to come when they had freshly fried donuts. First time I came it was late in the evening yet there were several people in line. I got chocolate glazed and cinnamon sugar donuts. While not bad I wasn't blown away given the reviews the place has gotten.

Decided to give them another shot early in the morning. They still did not have fresh donuts and the selection was pretty limited. I decided to get a cinnamon twist and that was definitely much better than the donuts I'd previously eaten. Was hoping for a better experience but wasn't impressed by this location.
author: Allie S.

description:
For awhile now I've been wanting to see what the hype was about and I finally was able to give Bob's Donut a try...   

I bought a French crueller and to my disappointment it was the WORSE I ever had..  It was flat compared to most and was dry and stale tasting..   In all my life, I've rarely had a French crueller that was dry!  And sad to say this was my first!  As you can imagine, I didn't finish the crueller..   After that big disappointment, I almost unwillingly reached for the other donut which was a chocolate bar..   It wasn't as bad as the french crueller but it wasn't good either..  Sad to say this trip to Bob's was a complete disappointment..

My advice..   Don't believe the hype!
author: Ester E.

description:
It's a San Francisco classic, am I right? Good donuts, good price, kinda seedy interior, always open, central location. 

If you don't like donuts don't come here.
author: Tommy W.

description: The lady stuffed our donuts into a bag after coughing in her hand and not using a glove as a barrier at least. Pretty unsanitary. Its really not that hard, just wear gloves. I can't imagine how clean their kitchen in, had to throw out these donuts
author: Mark A.

description: If your looking for a great donut go here . I used to live around the corner and I would come here either after the bar or before work . Fresh donuts and awesome service make this place my favorite donut shop in the country .
author: Brian D.

description:
Cool donut shop. Definitely feels like a local hot spot but the donuts are ok and the coffee has a 75 cent charge refill. I wouldn't care to leave a rating as my experience was ok but they should have a very noticeable sign that says refills cost money. Wouldn't have filled my cup a quarter of my cup if I knew that--since i never fill my cup all the way because it can get cold. So I paid (2.35-- 1.35 plus 1 for refill)or a small when I never even drank the amount of the whole cup. Seems petty on my end right? Well it seemed petty to me as well to charge a customer that didn't even fill up the halfway the first time around. 

Bottom line? Donuts are decent. Not the cleanest place. Customer service isn't really what I'll expect moving forward on my end. So...won't be coming back here unfortunately.
author: Hermes P.

description: Love the donuts ! Great ambience and yes the coffee was fabulous!
author: Bessie A.

description:
WHAT HAPPENED TO BOB'S DONUT?

I can no longer say this San Francisco's best donut.

Something is very wrong, and the users sense, but the management won't admit anything.

The donuts have got smaller. Again, that on it's own that might be OK. But, both the management trying to convince regular customers that nothing has changed. But, it has.

And more important,  they just are no longer great. For long-status customers are saying, what happened? Just like, overnight, one of the best donuts in The Best Area, kind of... suck.

I will try to be loyal, and give it a couple more times. But, this better get better. :(
author: BigJohnS F.

description: Donuts were good, wish mine were warm.
author: Marissa S.

description: Not super fresh or awesome tasting.  I'll go to Krispy Kreme any day over this place. Oh and don't bother asking what is fresh. The lady will lie and say everything is fresh when it's not.
author: Maria T.

description: Difficult to find parking since it's near downtown. The donuts are cake-y and delicious. The traditional glazed donut is great! We got the giant one and it's so cheap.
author: Anna L.

description:
BEST. DONUT. PLACE. EVER.

This place is absolutely delicious, and it's even better that it's open 24 hours. The donuts are so fluffy and warm. When they're fresh out of the fryer, it makes them 100000% better. Every time I go, I always order three donuts: a crumb donut, a glazed, raised donut, and an apple fritter for the road. Absolutely delicious. The selling point of this place is that there's nothing fancy unlike voodoo or blue star (in Portland, Oregon). There's no fancy peanut butter donut or bacon donut. Just a simple, delicious, glazed, raised donut. Whenever I'm in the city, I always make an effort to come here.

note: the line does get pretty long at times.
another note: make sure you know what you want when you get to the register. these people aren't there to make friends, they're there to make to sell donuts.
author: Jon W.

description:
tl;dr don't go there on Monday nights.

I don't usually leave bad reviews, it pains me to leave the two star review for a place that has such great reviews. I went there to pick up a few donuts Monday nights, they literally had no donuts left. The lady who worked there said that no one would come in on Mondays to make the donuts, all the reviews about the availability of the donuts any time of day might be only caveat to early mornings and late nights. 

But that's not the reason why am leaving this two star review, the lady who work there had just about the worst customer service I've experienced in the bay area. I said it was my first time there, and I wasn't familiar with some of the old-fashioned donuts that they offered. I'm not a big donut buyer, if you can't tell already. I had asked one question about the donuts and her face was just filled with contempt and disdain.. The rest of the transaction was.. unpleasant. I just smiled and paid. I honestly don't blame her for having a bad attitude because she was the only one who is working there, but she had such a great attitude to everyone else. When she was serving the next customer, she even said out loud that she liked customers who knew their donuts and their order ahead of time. I just found that so rude. 

I'm not saying the donuts are bad, I just had a bad experience.
author: John Z.

description: Amazing donuts. The crumb donut is the bomb. Great place to hang out with some friends in line
author: Scott P.

description: Not a bad donut, but not great either. If you're in the mood for some sugar and flower it'll do you just fine, but don't expect anything gourmet.
author: Brad G.

description:
This place is getting me fat. I love it so much that every time I come here I get 10-15 pieces of donuts at once. Not gonna mention about the types and the best ones since I love most of the donuts from here. 
I must say this is the place to come if you want some fresh donuts and at midnight they usually start making the new batches. 
Best part is they are open 24/7.
author: Nujhat Nashia R.

description:
Love this place, almost always serving hot donuts and 24 hours. 

The panhandlers who hit up people in line outside are super-aggressive though, they'll hit you up again on your way out & it's just like aah ruuuuuuun!
author: Nick F.

description: I really need to either stop coming here or just cool it for a while. Their cinnamon sugar along with the chocolate raised donuts are too addicting. It's almost become a ritual to stop by when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Wow! Perfect donuts! Fresh, made daily in the shop. Truly a San Francisco treat, Well worth the stop! You won't be disappointed!
author: V M.

description: Stopped by here literally on my way to the airport during my last day visiting San Francisco. Saw the amazing reviews and had to try this place. They serve mostly your basic donuts - glazed, chocolate, old-fashioned, etc. But they also make donuts the size of a cake! We got to see them make it fresh right behind the counter. Ask for the freshest donut and get that! The glazed donut I got was the best I've ever had. It wasn't greasy and did not make me feel gross after eating it.  I love the simplicity of this donut shop; classic flavors done perfectly.
author: Anna C.

description:
The raised maple donut and sandwich-type donut with raspberry filling doe.

Hell. Yes.

Soo soft and melt in your mouth! I thought only Krispy Kreme could do that. Boy, was I wrong!

(Only when it's fresh and HOT!)
author: Shruti D.

description:
Holy smokes. Bobs is the ish. Super delicious donuts. 

Here's the lowdown.

Ask "what's hot". Buy 3 of those. 

Get an apple fritter. Is it 8:30pm??

Do the secret dance that gets you double donuts. Just kidding. #nottrue

Tip well.
author: Joe N.

description: I don't know how I did not know about this 24 hour donut place when I was younger and clubbing regularly - their donuts are EXCELLENT!  Especially the fresh ones - which seem to be readily available as there was a line out the door the whole time we were inside - turnover was insane!  While the line may seem long, it moves quickly - definitely worth the short wait to get delicious donuts!
author: Lyn Y.

description: The donuts here are FANTASTIC and the service is quick. I walked up many hills to get here yesterday before leaving San Fran for Palo Alto and enjoyed the maple glazed cake donut along with the chocolate old fashioned. I probably could have kept going but common decency and a looming heart attack told me to stop there. But man, these donuts are so good and I can't wait for my next trip to San Fran to eat even more!
author: Carolyn L.

description:
I stumbled upon this place 2.5 years ago when I was about to break a fast. I seem to keep stumbling back. Seriously, do you want a huge donut all to yourself? Dude, go to this place.  
Do you want a wonderful, melt in your mouth, glazed donut? Get in there. 
How about an apple fritter that makes you second guess all your healthy decisions in life? What are you waiting for? 
You can always rationalize your decision by taking a friend along for the ride.

I could go on and on. The point is, this place is legit. Stop by a corner store, grab a gallon of milk, drop in to Bob's, and have a glorious evening with a dozen of your hottest friends. Go around midnight, that's when a lot of the magic begins.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I got an eclair or "long John" that was soft and fluffy. The custard was ok, but had an aftertaste. 

The service was friendly - Sonia the owner or manager was very chatty and fun/quirky. 

I've had other donuts from them, the glazed and maple glazed and they never disappointed.
author: Lana C.

description:
I live close by and often walk past a line out the door (especially at 2 AM). So when I came in I had higher expectations, but was also weary -- simple glazed donuts are by far my favorite, and I abhor old fashioned donuts. Bob's seemed like an old fashioned donut kind of place.

So I was excited to see they had a fresh batch of glazed donuts out. I ate one ... Nope. Too dense. If you are like me, and can't appreciate the old fashioned style donut, skip this place. There are thousands of 5 star reviews so I know mine won't make a difference, but I  wanted to represent those who share my unrefined donut palette. #krispykreme4lyfe #sorrynotsorry
author: Cynthia W.

description: Best donuts in the bay area...hands down! Open 24 hours to satisfy your sweet tooth no matter what time of day. I'm a fan of old fashioned donuts, and their cake donuts are to die for! I haven't been able to get one of their massive donuts, but the employee there told me they sell out quick, so it's best to call in an order. Trust the reviews on this one!
author: Michelle C.

description:
SHUT THE FRONT DOOR. 
But not literally. Because the front door is where you enter this teeny tiny establishment stuffed to the brim with sweet treats and everyone's fave circle-shaped confection. Renowned for their delicious delights, Bob's brings you that hole-in-the-wall dive-y donut establishment aura while still offering the refined tenets indicative of good baking. I probably would have been able to resist the lure of this donut shop if it weren't for the fact that their storefront faces all the donuts out onto the street, to tempt all us passersby. Touché, Sr. Bob. Tou-f'n-ché.

Whenever I'm in the area, I stop by for a ridic satisfying plain ol' glazed. But a few weekends ago it was my birthday and I was working nearby and decided, F IT! I'm gonna eat two crumb donuts for breakfast even though I know diabetes is destroying the black community. Totally worth it. (Sorry future generations!)
author: Gabrielle T.

description: Great donuts. Just a heads up if you're anything like me and only want to go for the donut challenge, they require a days notice. Pretty disappointing because it's not listed anywhere on their site
author: Lucci R.

description: They were making fresh glazed crumb doughnuts so ordered them. They were doughnut heaven!!! I wanted to order their famous apple fritters but they were sold out  must b so good. Hope to get next time!
author: Liz D.

description: Cool vibe.. the donut makers and cashier were very cool. Had my favorite donut (old fashion glazed) fresh out the oil pit.. Melted in my mouth.  Been here a few times before just but never had them fresh out the pit.  Nice place to check out on the late night, or early morning during a long bike ride!
author: S H.

description:
Bob's is amazing, for donuts. Whenever I'm within a mile from Bob's I make the trek over!

The old fashioned and raised donuts are consistently perfect. Tried non-donut items (blueberry muffin, apple bread pudding) but did NOT enjoy them.
author: Meg A.

description: Best donuts in the US, bar none. Fresh, exquisite circular puffs of deliciousness, Bob's is our go-to place for the classic donut. Every gem is perfect, in flavor and texture. So happy we found this bakery!
author: Tracie G.

description: Five stars purely just for the apple fritter, especially when I can get it fresh! It's one of the best donuts I've had, even though it is on the sweet side. I've heard from my friends that the other donuts are pretty good too and that their croissant is bomb, but I always go there to fulfill my apple fritter cravings. Also, Bob's is open 24/7 and everyone working there is nice! What's not to like?
author: Trisha V.

description:
OH MY GOD!!!
The Bear Claw has apples and they use Palm Oil. 
I finally understand Homer Simpson.
author: LisaDay K.

description: I stopped by to grab a donut and I'm glad I did. This place is great fast and good donuts. Keep on going guys I will be coming by soon. Cheers
author: SAMAY A.

description: Great donuts! And an awesome selection too! Find of donuts that I've never seen. They sometimes get a long line but they go through it quickly.
author: Zach H.

description:
Going out of my way to comment on the RUDE RUDE RUDE lady at the cashier. Terrible
Customer service!!!!! But , good donuts. But left with a bad taste in my mouth after the older lady working gave me attitude when I asked what kind of donuts they have left.
author: Sara S.

description:
The San Fran police ordered right behind me. yep. The place is legit. Check out the photo, donuts and a cop ordering inside. 

As I walked to Bobs one morning I was a bit concerned that it wasn't there or I passed it, but then I smelled them... mmmm donuts...it was a small donut shop with a bar and window for donut shopping. 

I enjoyed the crumb, old fashion and the apple fritter and I'm bummed to say that they just weren't that great. The fritter needed more icing and apples, I had to dig through the thing to get the apple goodness I expect. I was not a big fan of the oil they used on the donuts, it had a certain taste to it that these buds didn't like. I didn't even finish one of the donuts, not like the Donut King. 

I'm giving them 3 stars because they are obviously a SF donut icon and the cops like the place. Maybe I ordered on an off day?
author: Casey S.

description: Old fashioned donut shop but today the donuts were too greasy, too chewy, too heavy handed and too roughly made. We had the maple glazed, the chocolate glazed old fashions, the crumb cake donut and a raspberry filled donut that was so clumsily made that it was just 2 oily slabs of dough glued together with a thick layer of too sweet red gel that made the whole thing unappetizing. Maybe it was an off day or maybe the Labor Day holiday crew. Have been here before when donuts were better.
author: E W.

description:
I want a doughnut to wow me, and the crumb cake - an all-time favorite doughnut type of mine - fits the bill at Bob's. It was everything I wanted it to be and had to restrain myself from eating a ton of them. The cake doughnut itself was not dried out and full of flavor, and the glaze and crumb topping were perfect. I love the mixture of textures from the softness of the cake to the crumble of the topping to the slight crackle of the icing. 

All their other doughnuts could suck for all I care (although I know they don't). They can just keep making this one and I'll be happy for life.
author: David B.

description:
If I were a natural donut-fanatic, I may have given this spot four stars. Usually, I don't enjoy donuts but mr. Bob's is merely just an old glory tale -even I could tell. 
If you're the type that raves about Dunkin', sure you'd like this place. Not some unforgettable gem, though.
author: Grace C.

description:
I've only been here once and considering that I live in NYC I probably won't be here again. BUT, I ordered two donuts and a small carton of milk. Couldn't believe the lady when she told me it was only $3.75! 

Shortly after arriving to my friends apt I dug into the maple glazed donut and was sooooooooo happy that it reminded me of the deliciousness you find in a pancake! 

Following day on my plane ride home, two hours into my ride I ate my glazed donut and I regretted not buying more before leaving! It was super moist even after being in a bag for a night and the glaze was sweet and sticky and glazzy! 

Just perfect!
author: Arielle R.

description:
i love donuts!!
i could seriously eat one for breakfast everyday and probably as a side dinner dish as well
OH hey Bobs is open ALL THE TIME!
So you could technically come here during dinner and bfast the next day
Bobs is that good
author: Natasha I.

description:
Came here around 1 AM after watching a movie at the Metreon - I was looking through Yelp for some cheap and good place to eat opened past midnight and there wasn't much, but came across Bob's Donut and I had just so happened to past by it when I read the review. 

Parked a few streets away and when the bf and I got there, there was a pretty lengthy line that didn't look as if it was moving at all. So while I was waiting, I looked up the reviews on Yelp for what was good. Apparently they are really famous for their apple fritters! Anyway, all of a sudden a bunch of people from the clubs just rushed behind me and I was pretty much surrounded by drunk people who were very loud and eager for some donuts. 

After about a half hour wait (it's kind of like Porto's where they take your order and gather up your donuts and ring you up before going to the next customer), we were finally at the front of the line! There were way too many options. We got a bunch of random donuts like a custard/blueberry danish, glazed donut, sugar donut, the freshly baked apple fritter, maple donut, donut holes, a chocolate donut with custard filling - the total came out to be around $8 which wasn't bad. 

So was the apple fritter as good as Bob's Donut proclaims? I would say yes, but only if you eat it fresh! It's very sweet and cinnamon-y with lots of flavor. It was pretty big, and I couldn't finish it until the next day and then it wasn't very good. Donut holes were all right. The custard danish was good. The maple donut was pretty good, too according to my boyfriend. We had a lot left over that we couldn't finish and the custard filling donut got bad so I had to throw that out. 

Overall, a very nice hole-in-the-wall place with friendly servers and donut-makers! There are people who just sit at the tables, waiting for fresh apple fritters. Everything looked really good, but there were just too many different options that it was really overwhelming, esp. with the line behind us. They take card too! 

Must try if you love donuts!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Bob's goes from 4 to 5 stars because of the sweet little Asian woman that was manning the shop when we stopped in. She makes a mean donut. She was very polite and very friendly and extremely talkative, all rarities for little Asian women in the food service industry (at least from most of my experiences living in New York).

The place itself is as bare bones and ghetto/depressing looking as possible, but I think that contributes a lot to its charm. No music, no decorations, no frills, no nothing (except for the abundance of signage and newspaper clippings showing off how good and renowned the place is). It feels like an old school coffee/donut shop, and it's fun to eat at the counter and chat with the aforementioned friendly woman.

We got the much hyped about apple fritter (7x7 list), and now I definitely believe the hype. My wife loves her donuts, and she said it was one of the best fried things she's ever eaten, and I would have to agree with her. It was slightly warm, and delicious in every possible way. We also got a classic chocolate donut with rainbow sprinkles, which was also awesome.

I regret that I just had a massive burger and fried chicken and macaroni and cheese for dinner; otherwise I would have done the big donut challenge. Even those massive donuts looked delicious. If I'm ever back in San Francisco, I'm gonna make sure to hit up Bob's earlier in the day to make sure I have more room to waste myself on a lot of that fried goodness.
author: Mike C.

description: Great donuts! We came by around 9am on a Wednesday... donuts were a little cold but still tasted good. The whole shop is a little cluttered and doesn't look very clean. But the lady working was very kind and the donuts were not over priced!
author: Allie K.

description: Awesome donuts and pastries. Small place but worth the try!
author: Joana R.

description: If you love donuts, go to Bobs. Go for the classic glazed donuts. It's crusty in a good way.
author: Tan H.

description:
24/7 Donuts.... What could be better?

Bob's has great customer service and even better donuts. They're soft, freshly baked, and just sweet enough. I can't really say which is my favorite donut so I would recommend taking the cashier's rec!
author: Kerry G.

description:
FRESH DONUTS at midnight?!  YES PLEASE! 

Bobs totally caters to the late night crowd and makes fresh donuts almost all the time!  The apple fritters were amazing!  The glazed donuts were good too!

If you're crazy enough - do the donut challenge (you have to finish a large - I mean large, like the size of my head large - donut in 3 minutes or less).  It's pretty popular so call in and reserve one as I've heard they sell out!
author: Beverly E.

description:
Oh Bob how I love you! I love your maple donuts, apple fritters, glazed, sugar, chocolate, & jelly donuts! 
I love everything at Bobs except for the massive lines that randomly pop up, the times when there is only one employee for the massive line, and not the stores fault, but the weirdos that seem to frequent this place. 
If you're in the area, please do visit this place for a donut!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
F-ing delicious! Line out of the door, watching them make fresh, variety, cheaply priced, quickly serviced, quaint, and a definite hot spot for locals. 
Addictive. Straight up addictive.
author: Mikey L.

description:
Bobs Donuts!!! Home of the best donuts in San Francisco, and they have a donut that's as big as your head and if you eat it in 2 minutes or less..YOU WIN!! It's free, you get a spot on the coveted wall of fame, and a tshirt. Like a Man v. Food challenge! 

How exciting?? Until you show up, and find out that they don't have any of the Donuts and don't know when they'll have more. Guy was very rude, Service clearly not a priority, they must feel because of their reputation that they don't have to give a shit any longer. 

 How does a business that builds a reputation and social media presence based on a huge donut, not have them?? Only 1 guy knows how to bake them? 

So we asked if we could buy a shirt because we called earlier to ask, since we are from across the country we thought it'd be cool to have. And we were told yes. The guy asked me what size I was so when I told him he said "Sorry, we don't have any in that size or next size up. Have a good night."

We will never recommend this place, and when we visit San Francisco in the future we will never return. 

Disappointment doesn't do it justice.
author: Evan S.

description:
Took a Lyft just to go here and waited in line for half an hour at 2am. Worth it!

It was actually my first time and I wasn't expecting much because I'm not really big on donuts, but wow - Bob's were nothing short of amazing. The wait isn't that bad because you can see all their available donuts displayed in the window. Take it as an opportunity to be efficient and choose what you want ahead of time to make the line go faster! My bf and I apparently have no self-control after a night of drinking and ended up ordering 14 donuts (we actually typed them all in my phone while waiting in line to show to the cashier haha).

My favorites were the apple fritter, raspberry jelly donut, crumb donut, and the original maple and chocolate. They were pillow soft, perfectly dense and sweet just like donuts should be. The only thing I didn't really care for was the bread pudding - I remember it being a bit dry. 

Oh and the donuts are pretty cheap too! I think everything is under $2. Love this place - I wish I lived closer!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Yum yum Yum!  Bob's is the spot for Donuts!  Chocolate Old fashion and a small milk!
author: Noa H.

description:
I don't understand the fascination with Bob's. Measuring Bob's against some of my favorite NY donut spots (what up Doughnut Plant and Dough!) just isn't fair - they after all are 2-3x the price and are a totally different species of doughnut. But w/r/t a basic no frills doughnut, I'm not sure if I'd choose Bob's over a Dunkin Donuts or even certain supermarket doughnuts. And I certainly wouldn't wait 20 minutes (during off-peak hours at that!) for a Bob's. 

My issues with the doughnuts here: unless you get a piping hot fresh out of the fryer doughnut- which btw is generally almost impossible to screw up so I wouldn't consider that as evidence of a good doughnut- I found Bob's cake doughnut to in fact be a blob of greasy, cold, hard and somewhat stale dough. Maybe we made a poor choice by choosing a variety that had been sitting by the front window for god knows how long (although there was no way of knowing they'd give us one of those doughnuts until it was too late)-- but they shouldn't be serving those if they're no longer any good. Even if donuts are only 90 cents a pop! The yeasty doughnut, which was served from one of the rolling trays (and not from the pile by the front window), was somewhat better. Softer and fresher for sure, but still packed with a greasy sugary punch. I guess it's convenient having a place like this open 24/7- especially after a night out. But Bob's is definitely another prime example of how Bay Area Yelp reviews (4.5 average???) confound me.
author: Jen H.

description:
If by chance you arrive and the donuts are fresh, it will probably be one of the best donuts you've ever had! BUT, if it's not fresh, it will probably be mediocre. Some of my favorites that I've had here are the old fashioned and the buttermilk!

The donuts are good and reasonably priced. No $5 fancy schmancy gluten free dairy free soy free nut free craziness here.
author: Ashley D.

description:
I knew that my first trip to San Francisco would have been a travesty if I wasn't afforded the opportunity to visit Bob's at least once. After all, Bob's, from what I understand, is a SF institution. So, before we left the city to make our 1-hour-long excursion up to Napa, we made a pit stop for some of Bob's famous, sweet delights.

As you approach the storefront on Polk, the intoxicating aroma of fried, sugary goodness overwhelms the olfactory system, propelling it into a crazed overdrive. That distinct donut smell, the donut smell that is ingrained into the walls of the building due to years of incessant frying and glazing, animated me to action, and I had an extra spring in my step as we neared the doorway. Indeed, I was a happy boy.

No visit to Bob's would be complete without the infamous Apple Fritter and a cup of coffee. I believe my travel companion opted for one of the attractive danishes that was being showcased. The Apple Fritter was fresh, crispy, and embodied everything an Apple Fritter should be. I recall that the danish, too, was quite tasty, although I was somewhat disenchanted that my companion didn't buy a donut, instead. After all, we were at a donut shop. Nevertheless, I try, as hard as it may be, to keep in mind that he doesn't get the same type of thrills over sugar as I do, just as I don't share his obsessive passion for grease-laden potatoes, eggrolls and any other items that can conceivably be thrown into a frying vat.  But I digress...  

The interior of Bob's is very homey. It's certainly one of those neighborhood familiarities that everyone knows about and can identify with in some sort of fashion. I absolutely love the mom-and-pop feel. If I was a local, I fear Bob's would certainly be one of my regular haunts. Luckily, geography is on the side of my waistline.
author: Gary R.

description: Great donuts, just wish they made more throughout the day. I dropped in at 1pm and there were just a few left, not very fresh. Can't really knock them for that - not many places have fresh donuts middle of the day - but I wanted an apple fritter and they said it would be hours before they made another batch. Just sayin, go early or late in the day. Sadly I don't live in the city so neither are an option.
author: Jeremy M.

description:
We spotted this place while walking on Polk street on a Sunday Afternoon. The place does not look very appealing from the outside but after seeing great reviews about it on Yelp we decided to give it a try. 

The guy at the counter recommended that we try the old-fashioned donuts since they were fresh out of the fryer and still warm. We went with his suggestion and got two, one glazed and the other chocolate old-fashioned. Boy, they were amazing. The fact that they were warm and fresh added to the taste/experience.

I would go back to try their other items as well.
author: Varun A.

description:
Decent donuts, but unfortunately not worth the hype. We originally ordered two custard filled donuts. We were given just plain chocolate donuts. After telling the staff, they happily have us the correct donuts and apologized. Both donuts tasted alright. The custard was a little "eh". The donut store I go to back home had tastier custard. These donuts were definitely very sweet.

Overall, nice people who work here, but I thought from the reviews that these donuts would be mind blowing. Maybe I should get the apple fritter next time.
author: Kat H.

description: Hands down the best, least pretentious donuts ever. Grab several and a carton of milk, sit at the counter, and all your worries will melt away. The traditional raised donuts with regular glaze, maple glaze, and chocolate are amazing!!!
author: Molly W.

description:
I had grand plans to go bar hopping in the FiDi (Local Edition, Novela, etc.), end up in a DRUNKEN STUPOR, Uber it over to Bob's in Nob Hill to get a GIANT DONUT the size of my head so we could post pics with it on Instagram, and then hang with some pimps and hoes in Tenderloin on the way back to our hotel in Union Square.

In actuality, the bar hopping was a smashing success and we did Uber it to Bob's, but of course, they didn't have the giant head size donuts available around midnight on a Saturday.  They had a line out the door and fresh warm donuts. These aren't the exotic gourmet doughnuts I'm used to being spoiled with in OC & LA, but Bob's executed theirs well and they were all the rage in this area.  Everything looks more appealing when it's hot off the press.

My appetite wasn't what I expected it would be so I only got one standard maple donut for 95 cents.  It was delish and almost tempted me to buy more.  Instead, off we went to Tenderloin for some more adventures, where the "products" were anything but fresh.

When I returned to Bob's in the morning on another day, they still didn't have the giant donut, were even out of glaze, the donuts we got were not warm at all, and the napkin dispenser was completely empty. Boo.
author: Brandon C.

description: Big fluffy donut for $8 dollars!! I'm down! It tasted amazing esp at 2am after the bars! It was freshly made, fluffy, not overly sweet, and not overly greasy. Thinking about it makes me want another one!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Danishes.

Bear Claws.

Apple Fritters.
author: Alice L.

description:
Really delicious!
Yesterday, Friday night leaving the bar at 12:15am me and the bf past by the donut shop and the long line call my attention! 
We decide to take the line and give it a try! The line was half way to the window and I took us around 20m to order since it was only one person helping the whole store.
I am not complaining at all because the glanced donuts are really good!!! I got 4 of them and it's worth!!! Good job donut makers! The donuts are amazing!
author: Kim K.

description: Been here numerous times on various trips to SF, and have never been very impressed.
