Invariably it is always a small amount of traditional type donuts on offer in a seedy looking grungy little locale.  Last time I was there, I had a crumb donut which was fine...nothing special, not terrible or particularly good.  This time, we went at about noon on a Sunday and they had almost nothing.  Crumb donuts?  No.  Apple fritters?  No.  Crullers?  Nope.  We asked for each one of those, one by one.  When I asked how long until some crumb donuts, the lady told me "I don't know, a few hours."  The window was half filled with some stale looking cream filled donuts and a couple other choices.  This was pretty much how my other experiences have been, except this one was markedly worse.  Frankly, the place is kind of dirty looking, the selection has always been mediocre to terrible for me, and when I have had a donut, they have not been anything special.
author: A. L.

description:
1. Ambiance/Location
2. Service
3. Value
4. Taste 
5. Perks/Extra

1. Small feel...like a NYC donut shop. Love it
2. Quick and friendly!
3. Delicious and cheap...nuff said. 
4. Tastes awesome! I mean...its a donut. :) But even more amazing than a regular donut. 
5. They are open SUPER late!! I mean...the rest of the topics were spot on but I'd give it a 5/5 just for that. Thanks guys. I cant say its a perk but they have the largest donut I've everrr seen!! Great for a picture or special moment with 10 friends lol
author: Denelle S.

description: No better place to get fresh warm doughnuts. Only problem I have is trying to not stop and get a bite to eat. The aromatic smell captivates me forcing me to get doughnut. It is no fair if you think about it. The smell is too strong of a force to fight.
author: Joseph B.

description:
I just had my favorite yeast raised glazed donut.
It was pretty good.

They were out of the chocolate old fashioned, jelly-filled, and my other favorite, the chocolate-glazed.

I hear it's fresh late night, but I don't know when I would go that late for donuts. And there's a line. no thank you.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Uh, prepare to hate yourself for eating a crapload of donuts in one sitting.

My friends and I stumbled here on a Friday night after a hanging out at a few bars. The line was long, but it went by quickly. Plus it was entertaining watching people ogle and press their faces into the glass window where the donuts are being freshly made. Each time they came out with a new batch, you'd hear the whole line breathing with excitement and claiming that they're going to get the fresh batch.

When it's our turn to pick and choose-- well.. we couldn't really make up our minds so we just got whatever we saw. 

They weren't kidding when they said their crumb donut was one of their best pastries. It was soft, dough-y, and the crumbs just melted in my mouth. So perfect because it wasn't way too sweet-- it was just perfect.

We also had a Maple Bar, and that also just melted in my mouth once I took a bite out of it. Same with the glazed donut. *Heart Eyes*

Their apple fritter is also a popular item. 

I can't remember the other pastries that we had-- but I'm sure we enjoyed every moment of eating it lol.
author: Grace H.

description:
Friday late afternoon & they only had crullers and cake donuts left...boo. I really wanted a raised sugar donut. The guy working there said the closest to that would be the cinnamon sugar cruller. Def not the same but it was sooo good in a different way. Eggy,  light and fluffy. So glad he recommended it... wish I got a dozen!  :). minus one star for the lady (maybe owner) making me feel bad that I only had a $20- and horrible parking situation on Polk


 ((PS there was a sign no bills bigger than $20 FYI))
author: Denise L.

description: The night might be dark, but the first place I will take you after the late night flight from Las Vegas to San Francisco is Bob's Donuts for the energy of the group waiting outside for the best donuts in the city. After a long after the drive up to the city airport, the donut shop located where I used to study in the early hours on Polk Street had a standing line outside waiting to buy donuts near midnight. You can still study there. Intelligent, wise, foodies, and local neighbors stand in line at 2 AM and 3 AM for the fried donuts at Bob's Donuts. Lines outside of a donut parlor? I used to read college text books at the counter. Now it was standing room only as two dozen customers waited to buy glazed old fashion donuts. Robin the Chef said, "People in the neighborhood set their alarm clocks for 1:00 am and 2:00 am in the morning, because that is when I make the apple fritters. Their alarm goes off. They wake up, get out of bed, come in here to buy the donuts, and leave with a box of fresh donuts; Then return to bed. We are famous for our apple fritters." My son basked in the energy. Chef Robin's display of handcrafting fresh, fried cake batter into halos made of butter milk, sugar glaze, mocha and chocolate frosting; The donut shop wins awards for crumb donuts, buttermilk bars, raised maple, and extremely large round donuts nearly twelve inches in diameter that have an eating contest attached; But I didn't get all the facts on the eating contest.
author: Thomas Chase Leo S.

description:
Parking can be a hassle when you're in the city and if you dont have a roll of quarters to feed the meter, you could be SOL...

On our way to the Swan, we got a good spot and fed the meter with the change we had...not enough time in the meter and out of change, we needed about $3 (HELLA hungry and SO CLOSE to The Swan too!) I go to the corner store, lady says " I only change one dollah"......The hardware store tells me the same, the pizza joint's too busy,
and I finally stop in to Bob's and the lady behind the counter says if I buy something, she'll hook me up-THANK YOU!!! So I get an Apple Fritter( it was aight), She changes my Lincoln
and I hustle back to the meter, then we rush down to get in line for our oyster fix. Note to self...Carry a roll of quarters at all times when you're in the city!!!!ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(251/365) "Change Please!"
author: Nelson Q.

description:
My friends and I decided to make a late night trip out here since it's open 24 hours. No, we didn't drink nearby. So yes, we did it backwards but what's wrong with getting a good doughnut fix while sober!?

APPLE FRITTER
Was gooooood! The apple flavor is subtle but you get the soft chewy crunch of the fruit bits. The hint of cinnamon reminded me of apple pie but instead of pie crust, it's a frosty doughnut. Yumm (:

CRUMB DONUT
Tastes like fried. With crumbs on top. Haha, in a good way! I'll probably get this again to try to figure out if there's actually any real flavors in it.

If the display doesn't have a particular doughnut out, just ask for it. They may just have it on the rack instead. I'll be back - I'm sure I'll crave some doughnuts after a night of bar hopping next time!
author: Sandy T.

description: Hot fresh donuts at 3AM. Do you need any other reason?!!!!
author: Michael B.

description:
***Not another review of the apple fritter, in fact, not a big fan of the apple fritter from Bob's***

Always wished this place isn't so convenient for me. Since these delicious round pieces of fried dough are freshly fried at 2AM, and I get around this area at 7AM, it is always an option to stop by this place and get a quick and guaranteed fresh breakfast. 

Get the Crumb Cake Donuts!!! Little crunch and little softness with every bite. These treats are no doubt the best donuts I've ever had, not quite sure if I can ever go back to the normal glazed or sugar donuts:/ You won't regret eating empty carbs after this deliciousness.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Bobs Donuts, how do I love thee!
Oh, let me count the ways.
In fritter form with apples abound,
Or simply maple glazed.
Your lines don't daunt me
Your crumb tops, they haunt me.
The buttermilk bars turn me into a drip
Though as for your coffee...
Well, I wouldn't take a sip.
I'll just stick with milk and forever be true,
I love ya Bob's.
No really.
I do.
author: Dana D.

description:
What a treat! 
I was visiting my sister in SF and she insisted that we go out at 9:30 PM for donuts-and it was worth it. 

Thursday night at 9:30 PM and their chocolate glazed donuts were hot, fresh, flaky, and delicious. We sat there and talked for a bit and out from the back came a beautiful, wonderful, and huge rack... of APPLE FRITTERS!! We stared at them make it and even pre-bought one. 

So worth it the guilt. Hot, sweet, gooey apple-y goodness. I can see why people started pouring in at that time to grab those super super fresh fritters. 

Love it!
author: Shelley K.

description: Place is so great.  Open all night and the guys are great to visit with.  Very nice, friendly place with good donuts.
author: Scotty G.

description: The donuts when they come out fresh are off the hook. Crumb is superb. The apple fritter is also excellent. Great service by Jeff. Deserves special mention. Really nice guy who has a very positive demeanor. In a fast moving place like this, he calms it all down. 5 of us went and we certainly didn't expect world class service at a donut shop but got it --- thanks Jeff!
author: Sai S.

description: Amazing donuts and super nice staff! I love the apple bread pudding and the glazed old fashioned doughnut.
author: Jasmine L.

description: Despite the awesome reviews, I wasn't entirely impressed with Bob's Donuts. None of the donuts are labelled and there's no menu, so if you've never been before, you basically just pick out random donuts and hope you'll like them. When I asked the woman what flavours they had available, she seemed irritated and didn't even give me a straight answer. I ended up randomly picking 4 small donuts which weren't bad, but weren't great - I've definitely had better (and bigger) donuts from Tim Hortons and Dunkin Donuts for the same price. Although, I do regret not getting one of the big donuts, because they were about the size of my head.
author: Carolina S.

description:
These are the best donuts I've had in sf. And trust me I've tried a lot of different places. 

Their old fashioned ones are Top notch!!
author: Mark T.

description:
I'd rather go to Krispy Kreme (ya ya I know I'm an infidel), but I'm not a donut lover (id rather eat salty/ savory things than sweet deep fried dough)

That said, it's worth visiting for people who love donuts. It's 24h so any time is a fine time to visit. They have giant donuts (perfect as a bday "cake"). Plus, the ppl working there are older. I love that. 

3.5*s
author: Sam W.

description: Small, run down donut shop. Gets very busy and the service is mediocre but the donuts are superb. I'm not sure how the other reviewers thought the donuts were soggy. They were perfect in my book. Even with the horrible parking, I would still stop by the next time I am in SF
author: Judi H.

description: Average donuts. If you get something fresh and hot they're better. Maple and crumb were good but not better than what you'd get at a chain like Krispy Kreme. The donut bread pudding "Apple Pandowdy" should be avoided. It was tasteless.
author: Steven C.

description:
Wow! We found this neighborhood donuts shop when I and my friend were walking by Polk st and saw many people going into the store.
French donuts with cinnamon sugar were awesome. Wow, really one of the best donuts in the world:)
I also love their almond ring:)
author: Maitai N.

description:
By far the best donut eating experience I have ever had.

I stumbled upon this treasure in the middle of the day with my cousins walking through the city.

We were attracted by this little shop with people surrounding the front window and lining up outside.

When we approached the store we saw the most beautiful donuts (bigger than the size of my head).

We were lucky that we came when they were making them fresh - absolutely delectable :)

My cousins and I are totally hooked and are in LOVE with Bob's donuts.
author: Kirpa W.

description:
Doing donuts.

Stupid: www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=donut&defid=335227

Smart: Old fashioned plain donut and a chocolate chip cookie for $2 and change. Both were rich and chewy and the kind of thing yours truly eats only after a few hours dancing.

Enjoyed the effort and the reward.
author: Jason B.

description:
Open 24-hours. 
Just bring cash, they're a small business...and how many donuts can you possibly eat that would require a CC. 

$1.75 for 12 donut holes or $1 for 6. 
My friends loooooooves the chocolate donut. 
There are vegan options! 

This is the place to be after a night of drinking, dancing, and singing. 

Friendly staff. Donuts are constantly being made - FRESH! even at 1:30am! 

I did hear that you shouldn't touch the display case or else the owner gets pretty upset. I guess you should try to remember this when you're buzzed.
author: Jess W.

description:
Oh-em-gee!!! There's just something about eating fresh, fried dough that gets to me. It was delicious!!!!!

Of course the line was out the door on a Friday night after midnight, but who cares. You can just stare at the window display filled with scrumptious looking doughnuts.

When it was my turn to order, they had just taken them out of the fryer and placed the glaze on. I asked what they were and the cashier replied "Buttermilk. They're really good."
So, I got a plain one (you can also have it dipped in chocolate) and a chocolate glazed doughnut. (which I saved for the next day and it was STILL good!)

I foregoed the milk and dove straight into my doughnut. I was in heaven! I don't think I've ever had a hot, fresh doughnut and if I have, this one "takes the cake!" hahah!
It was crunchy on the outside, had just enough sweetness and melted in my mouth. I need to go back now!!
author: Mimie L.

description:
I moved to Russian Hill a few months ago, and always saw a long line outside Bob's at all hours of the night, so I had to see what the fuss was all about.

The setup: A few racks of donuts by the window for your viewing pleasure, and racks of the freshest batches just behind the counter. Some seating inside but usually filled during late night.

Cost / food: Low prices all around; about $1 for a donut and 2-3 for most of the other products including chocolate croissant, cream filled, apple fritter, etc. Most donuts (raised, old fashioned, cake) with either maple or chocolate glaze.

The verdict: Slam dunk all around! Donuts are extremely fresh and perfect for basically any occasion, including birthdays, post-game munchies, or just a casual stroll along Polk street

Pro tip: go with whatever is on the rack directly behind the counter (the freshest batch). Even if the flavors or varieties aren't what you otherwise would've ordered, the freshness of that batch will take you to another level
author: Shawn R.

description:
This place is the bomb. It's a small and no frills kinda place with limited seating. There was a line even past 11pm. I've been here more than once and the owners have been nothing but sweet and friendly. They have my favorite French cruller which many other donut places don't have (California bakery near civic center has it too for all those fans out there. And you're welcome!). 

I've had the crumbly donut, the glazed original and the French cruller. Freshly made and soft. The perfect donut. When I was there at 11+pm on one occasion, I spot the last couple of French cruller. I ordered one but the lady was soooo nice to tell me that they're not as fresh since they've been there all day. She also gave me an extra one since the one she picked out was rather tiny. How sweet is that?!?! On top of that, she offered me samples of something that tasted like bread pudding. So yummy too!! I'm forever a fan and there's nowhere else I'd rather get my donut from when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Erica Y.

description:
Fresh donuts at midnight. Maple (and I don't particularly like maple) or chocolate. Cake donuts. Old fashioned donuts. And that fritter.

I'm in SF a few times a year, usually, and this has become a tradition. It's an old-timey shop. A dive, really, with a bar, a few little tables, and a TV that's always showing the most random and often inappropriate movies. 

There's a guy who comes in late and turns the crank on that machine to pop out round delights into impossibly hot melted lardy oil. They sizzle, then he flips them with giant chopsticks. Then he lifts them out, they cool but for a moment and he's throwing them into chocolate or maple topping. Then sprinkles. Then you order them for less than a buck a piece and you eat hot, fried donuts.

My first visit ever was magic. Like a hazy, drunken stupor of hot donut. But last time I knew what to get, and when to go, and it was exhilarating. Like completing a wartime mission. Or being part of a secret club. Or, you know, like a late night sugar rush. I went two nights in a row.

It's no fuss. There's milk and donuts and a select few pastries. But if you can go late at night, that's when the magic show goes on. Go for the show. For the live donut making right in front of you. And then watch all the in-the-know locals show up for a freshie after 11pm.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I remember  leaving the fancy Doughnut Plant in NYC disappointed. Nothing compares to the simple joys of eating a traditional, old school donut like the ones offered at Bob's!

No matter what time I come..whether it's 7AM or 3PM or even 2AM...there's always fresh donuts offered 24/7 here. No longer is Bob's cash only - they now take card with Square.

All their donuts are good. They're famous for the Apple Fritter but their Cake donut, Maple donut with and without filling), Sugar donut, Jelly Donut and Glazed Donut are all so good. Sometimes I find that even the simplest ones are best here. So fluffy and not too heavy. All range from $1-2 with a few exceptions. 

They also have fresh coffee so sometimes I get a cup of joe with a morning donut. Mmm mmm MM!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Haha this place is now a major joke. They must have changed their recipe? When the husband/maker was there I asked the wife why the donuts were so tiny? I asked if they were 2 for 1.00?
She said, the "cake" donuts have a different texture. Well that's fine but if u were to see how decrepit, tiny and weird these donuts were you'd ask the same.

Like others have mentioned their filled bars are lame too. I got a chocolate one with barely any chocolate on top, too much plain dough and for the lamer price of 2.25

They must be trying to cut corners to hire a janitor because this place is sooooo dirty and they never seem to care to clean the front or back area of counters.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Oh my god!!! They have the best donuts in town!! You have to try the glazed donut here!!!!!
author: Amrita S.

description: Best donut shop of all time!!!! Their customer service is exceptionally good! And their donuts my oh my are their donuts the most delicious donuts I've ever had!
author: Salwa R.

description:
Craving donuts? REALLY craving some donuts? Look no further! Giant donut to the rescue!! 

I had one of those cravings at 10pm. So onward to Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop. Thankfully the line wasn't long to get some food, it was raining pretty hard outside. Oogled at the giant Crumb donut, thought about the consequences for about 1.5 second, then reached my wallet to pay for it. I savored every bite and saved some for the next day. Also got the cheese danish and the white powdered covered donut. All of them were very good, even better after you warmed it up. Definitely hit the donut craving spot in my tummy!

Well, to be honest, I didn't eat the donut all by myself. But I think I could. Eating this crumb donut is like going to a Boiling Crab. Got my napkin ready, got my bib ready, and a big plate to catch all the crumb, as well as a broom, haha. Crumb donut worth every single penny! The white powdered donut was also very very good, finished it up before I even had a chance to reach for the car key. Also the Cheese danish was just right with the amount of filling, and not too sweet or overpowering on the cheese. I will come back, for sure!
author: Andrew I.

description: Best donuts I've had in SF! They are open during the late hours of the night, making this a perfect spot to grab a late night snack after hitting the bars of Polk Street. The key is to order the donuts that are freshly made on the donut rack (not the ones in window). The apple fritter and maple glazed are must haves. I will definitely be back, probably far too often!
author: Ryan S.

description: Love the apple bread pudding and old fashioned donuts. I always stop by Bob's when I'm in SF. Excellent, cheap donuts and friendly staff. Can't miss.
author: Dane C.

description: Heard raves about this place and every time I drove by, there was a line out the door. Tonight, I was finally able to check 'em out. One star for the guy hustlin behind the counter. Another star for the price (quite cheap). The donuts (I ordered a maple and chocolate cake) were significantly small and the choco tasted like a "spongey" burnt version of the choco donuts by Hostess. I was NOT impressed. They didn't even have a shelf showcasing their donuts; they were located on a metal tray on the other side of the register counter and you couldn't even see half of them from my side of the counter. I'm confused as to why this place has so many high ratings. Lee's Donuts is better. I'm just glad I only paid $3 and some change for the donuts (and a small coffee).
author: Monet T.

description:
If you're looking for a basic traditional donut shop with no frills, Bob's Donuts fits the bill. Both their cake and raised donuts are melt-in-your-mouth goodness without being too overly the top sweet. The apple fritters were a little too greasy for me, really not my jam.

It's located right on Polk Street, so you can pop in for a donut intermission between bar hopping. Open 24 hours a day, so anytime can be donut time. 

Looking to indulge a bit more? They also sell the giant raised doughnuts as well. Get your cameras ready for this Instagram worthy treat!
author: Minh N.

description: Didn't care for it! We get donuts all the time back home and we did not care for the taste for some reason. And we tried different ones.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Drunken nights... and donuts .... donutssss.....!!!

Massive, massive donuts! Had a really hard time to figure out what donutttt I should get! Is there a choice for EVERYTHING????? At the end of the night... I ended up getting the apple fritters ... noms! Not a bad choice .. delish! :)

5 stars! Cheap, massive donuts!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Always get whatever it is that is fresh out of the fryer!!  Doughnuts are nice and warm; a tad oily, but it's honestly one of the best things ever.  Had the French cruller and old fashion fresh out of the fryer and they were beyond amazing!  They were crispy yet light and fluffy.  I always leave, wishing that I bought more!

Their crumb doughnuts aren't that great though.  The flavors are there, but the doughnut itself is soft and soggy.
author: Samantha C.

description:
I have been coming to Bobs since 2001. I truly adore this place, it's a destination. I hold all other donut shops in comparison to Bobs. 
Bobs makes donuts from scratch, and they are always fresh. They have no pretentious wacky donuts (except the incredibly large donuts), just traditional fare done very right. My favorite has always been the French style donuts- they are light and puffy and can be eaten in 3 bites. Which is why I always get six and I don't share!! 
They are open 24 hours so you can stumble in anytime to get a fix. I believe it is family owned/ operated, and I almost always get the same counter girl (since 2001!!) who is always smiling despite having to deal with tenderloin crazies and drunk yuppies. I salute you!!!
The place has been around forever and is an SF institution. I recommend to anyone living or visiting the Bay Area to try it.
author: Iliea S.

description:
God answered my prayers with these fresh, warm donuts. Visited at 11pm and these guys were cranking out donuts nonstop. I'm guessing this place is always buzzin. Worth every calorie.

Service was fast and friendly. Donuts are legit.
author: Kelly S.

description: Who doesn't love doughnuts ? This place rocks! Fresh doughnuts and Colombian coffee. Mmm I like the chocolate , plain, fritters , custard. The mom and son team got it down
author: Cecilia D.

description: Tasty and fresh donuts any time of the day and night. I've never had a donut covered in crumbs and must say the one they serve is so delicious. I was a little surprised the place is listed as one of the best donut shops in the state since the selection and flavor is pretty basic. Good try!
author: YelpMadeMeDoIt L.

description: Eh, not so great anymore. The buttermilk donuts and the raised donuts are still good, but their old fashioned donuts are wack. The lady who owns it is nice but the husky guy in the beanie cap is rude and too short with you, also likes to rush you a lot. And when I point to a specific rack where I want a donut from, he turns and gets one from a entirely different rack on the other side of the room, The next time I'm going to call him out on it when there's no line, so I don't have to worry about people being nosey and getting involved when I curse him tf out. No customer service skills at all smh.
author: Marquis A.

description:
I am fortunate (my hips would disagree) enough to live near a couple different places that masterfully craft exceptional options (including old fashioned, dark chocolate sea salt, and sweet potato ginger). While I am by no means a donut connoisseur, I do love me some sweets, fat, and centuries old deep fried "pastries" (of which I eat plenty of now given said proximity to donut shops).

That being said, I would never come to Bob's for a donut.

I came in here around 11pm with a group of friends and we tried the following...
- The original: Fresh and hot, but it tasted like a a mouthful of bland dough and grease.
- The apple fritter: This tasted burned and stale. Where was the apple? Or for that matter any flavor at all? I LOVE all things apple, but I had to bin this.
- The maple: Probably the "best of the worst". Nice crunch and hint of maple, but again... meh (however, this is the one I would eat again, for the record).

Some other reviewer said that Bob's creates "classic donuts that aren't gourmet." You can still create a "classic" version of something that's a mind-blowing experience. These are just executed properly. In my opinion, I don't think the donuts here are remarkable. I came here hungry and ended up throwing away almost the entire donut I purchased because it just wasn't worth it (neither was the coffee which tasted old). I'm sorry to say that if I closed my eyes and took a bite of a Bob's donut, a Krispy Kreme, and a Dunkin' donut I'd be hard-pressed to figure out which was which.

Yes, Bob's is open 24/7. Yes, it certainly does give off a "cool" vibe. Yes, the prices ROCK. But are they worth going out of your way for? Maybe if you were in the best of company (like I was), then perhaps (side note: the art on the wall here at Bob's WAS worth coming to check out and by far the thing I liked the most). Otherwise? Meh.
author: Steff D.

description: A no-frills non-trendy donut shop with delicious apple fritters!  I ordered the glazed donut, but could not stop eating my friend's apple fritter.  :)  Also, they sell these HUGE donuts that look like cakes!  We did not buy it, but I took a picture of it because it was so amazing.  Only 6.95, I would've bought it if we had more people to eat it!
author: Helen T.

description:
Bob's. If you're on a diet or watching calories, stay about six blocks away in all directions!
Bob's is amazing. Their artistic interpretation of what makes a donut, while staying true to a delicious recipe, creates a premier sweet tooth experience.
One day, I might take home one of those giant donuts and put myself into a sugar coma. They're the size of a dinner plate!
Bob's. ..I love your donuts!
author: Jesse M.

description: This place rocks. Walked by the store and was hypnotized by the array of fresh donuts in the window. Asked the lady what she recommends and she suggested the crumb donut. It was only $1 and was probably one of the best donuts I've had (and I've had a lot of donuts). The crumb was soft and crunchy and cinnamony and sweet and it was just overall a great donut. Will definitely return.
author: Zara A.

description: Such a great place for a donut! Got the apple fritter-amazing balance of flavor a and the gazed donut (plain and with chocolate)- they both were so light, fluffy, and soft also great flavor.
author: Sarah R.

description:
24h donut place. Perfect for Krispy Kreme craving.

I came here with friends for a late night hangout and we got a bunch of stuff. They actually sell gigantic donut, about 12'', for around $10.

I got the normal glazed donut and it tasted like a fluffier Krispy Kreme. My frd got the donut cake?? In maple, which was warm and dense. 

Everything tasted good, especially with milk
author: Ruxin H.

description: We went around lunch time so not much of a line on a Sunday. I had a maple donut and and crumb donut. I would highly recommend trying a crumb donut if you like a little crispy texture. The donuts were so so good! It's a must try!
author: Heidi B.

description:
Bob's is everything you want in a classic donut shop. Open 24/7, always rotating what's fresh, delicious, and affordable.

Pro-tip: send a box of a dozen or more donuts to your significant other's office for her birthday or anniversary. If she doesn't appreciate it, seriously reconsider your relationship because who doesn't love donuts?!
author: Jon P.

description: A lot of hype didn't look very clean I don't know I just didn't think that where was that great.
author: Azita H.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by this hole in the wall donut shop. It was open 24 hours, there was trash all over the front of the store, and there were groups of rowdy people hanging out at a donut shop at 2 in the morning? Sounds like bad news.

It was wonderful news. Sweet, fluffy, succulent news of some awesome donuts. We ordered the Crumb donuts, one raised and one cake. Each have their own texture and are probably some of the best donuts I have ever had. My personal favorite was the raised crumb donut because it was fluffy and airy. If you want a denser (and danker) donut, try the cake donut.

Service (4 stars): The owner of the shop was working at the cash register and he was very courteous to me. Considering that it was 2 am, he was helping all of the people and being very patient with the slightly more than intoxicated customers at the tables. There was a gentleman who came in cursing at the owner, and scaring away some of the customers. The man continued to attack the owner by calling him names. The owner stood up for himself by telling him to "get the **** out of my store, we don't need that here." I respected that, even with the vulgarity. 

Bottom line: Late night donuts? YES!
author: Ivy T.

description: This is about as old school as you can get, including the prices.  Fritters, crullers, raised with sugar and the best are the filled maple bars.  Prices are old school, too, you can actually get something quite good for a buck (filled are a bit more).
author: Chris K.

description: Not sure what's so great about these donuts. Is it because they're open 24/7? We got the crumb donut and traditional chocolate one. Both were meh.
author: Kristen T.

description: Heard from several locals this was the best doughnut shop in town, and bob's did not disappoint. If you're in the neighborhood hit this place up!
author: Tony J.

description: As if this place needs more reviews... Anyway, even if you are drunk or stoned and ambling home starving, just walk on by b/c these donuts are just the usual grease bombs no better than the Safeway bakery which you could score for 1/2 the price and none of the 'tude from all the bridge & tunnel 20 somethings you will be waiting in line w/ after last call at the bars.  Why end up hating yourself even more b/c after you eat any of these you will.
author: Rose B.

description:
I'm not a regular at Bob's. Donuts are decent, but too much attitude in the service. Bob's is more hype than quality. 

I went there last Wednesday night near closing time intending to get a chocolate and a glazed doughnut. They were out of the glazed so I was trying to locate another option. I described it to the cashier and even pointed at it but he refused to look at where I was pointing, and said "Let me train you. Count down on the number of trays to the tray that has your donut." Which I did, and got my donut. But he could have just looked at where I was pointing and that would have worked too (there weren't many donuts that would have confused him). 

Note to management - "Let me train you" isn't a polite way to address a customer.

On top of that, the shop is grungy and dirty. Clean up your place.  

Contrast Bob's to a place like VooDoo donuts in Portland which also has a long wait (much longer than Bob's in fact). They don't let the wait compromise their service, and they don't give their customers attitude.
author: Ravi R.

description:
I had the will power to walk by the beautiful display case of temptation once, but the second time around I succumbed to my sinful desires.

It was 9 pm and I was full of Indian food but nevertheless the wifey and I had to share a crumb donut.

Something happened then, something that hasn't happened for 25 years, I ate the best donut of my life.

I kid you not when I tell you, that crumb donut was complex and absolutely perfect.  I had no idea that a donut could actually be that good.  

Now the only problem is, how do I walk down Polk without having one?
author: Joshua S.

description:
Open late!! Another joint I've only been to after 2am, usually tired as hell after a night of bar hopping. It's dingy like most late night donut shops, but there's usually a long line at these hours, mostly full of drunk people. Get the apple fritter if your stomach can take it and oogle at the gigantic sprinkled donut they usually have on display (we always dare each other to buy it, but none of us have ever done it...). 

I wouldn't go out of my way though, and neither should you because it will only bring disappointment. There's nothing particularly special about this place aside from it being open late!
author: Lily C.

description: Open 24 hours and located on Polk, those are the best aspects of this place. Besides those two things, the donuts are mediocre and expensive, the service was rude (no, not charming) and the place is dingy. A lot of Millenial Instagram Hype.
author: Karena H.

description:
There are few things in life as wonderful as a bobs donut fresh out of the oven - and I honestly can't think of any of them right now. Two bobs donuts fresh outta - haha there! 

Seriously though, just ask what just came out and go with it, especially if it's the apple fritter or the glazed old fashioned. 

Cold donut - 4 stars.
Hot freshness - 5.
author: matt w.

description: Get whatever is fresh! We have come to Bob's Donut several times, usually after eating a huge meal at the House of Prime Rib. Although we are pretty stuffed full by the time we hit up Bob's Donut, we always somehow have room to squeeze in a few donuts.  Anything fresh is super awesome. We have tried ones that were not hot, and those were okay to good; however, the nice, hot, and fresh ones were the best. We have had the glazed donut and old fashion donut fresh. They were making the giant donut while we were there, but we did not have time to stay and wait for it that time. My fiancé will not let me forget that we could have had that huge donut. He reminds me about it every time we talk about donuts or pastries, so we are definitely coming back. Hopefully they will have that giant donut ready for us next time.
author: May N.

description:
Where to start with Bob's Donuts? Let's just say I have a love/hate relationship with Bob's for 2 reasons, 1. My boyfriend makes me drive there at 2AM to get the fresh batch of donuts after he comes back from drinking & 2. I always end up breaking my diet to eat these delectable dounuts! Okay, I guess that's not Bob's fault for my hate relationship with them. They can't help the fact that their donuts are just so damn delectable! 

Like I stated, my boyfriend and I usually come around 2AM when the raised donuts are fresh out of the fryer. Although there are times the line is 3 stores down because the night clubs are all closing at the time, I don't mind the wait because the freshness is worth it! 

The (I think) owner is amazing. She's super nice and even when she's totally slammed she's very attentive to everyone's needs! =)

Top favs:
1. Apple fritter
2. chocolate raised donuts
3. glazed raised donuts
4. old fashion chocolate donuts
5. ham & cheese croissants 
6. the huge donuts!
author: Loraine E.

description:
We saw that Bob's made a Yahoo list for the 10 best donut shops in the nation. We were new SF residents. So, of course we had to go try it on a random weeknight.

The apple fritters are what this place is known for, but we decided to go with our standard, chocolate glazed.

The chocolate glazed was fresh, which made it more delcious than most donuts we've had before, so we went for another.

We got the chocolate bar with cream. Again, fresh, soft, and delicious. So, we decided to go for another.

Next up was powdered cake. Tasty, yet again. So what do we do? Yes, go for another!

Last up, crumble cake. 4 for 4, tastes great yet again.

Eating donuts here makes donuts from every other donut places taste stale in comparison.  Most of the greatness comes from the freshness and high turnover of their donuts.  At times, there was a line out the door.  But the line moves quickly.

Ya gotta try it at least once, and try more than one! And wash it all down with a milk at the end. Dee-lish!
author: Nadeem A.

description:
-- THE BEST DOUGHNUT IN THE BAY AREA -- 

Okay - if you have been following my post... you know that after "MY CANH"--  this is my next destination before heading home.  It is a generous way to complete my evening especially after clubbing.  Getting all that sweets and that carbohydrates along with that coffee -- prevents that nasty hangover when I wake up!!  Get the picture?

The best time to come here is around 3:00 AM especially on Friday's and Saturday's.  Otherwise, anytime between 11:00 PM to 2:30 AM I guarantee you will be waiting in line for awhile.  Why -their fresh batch of doughnut holes and the rest of their pastries usually cooked at that time.  So everything is hot and fresh!!   

I usually buy their GLAZE DOUGHNUTS and it is always warm and fresh.  I also highly recommend getting their FRENCH DOUGHNUTS HOLES .....and I leave the best for last -- try BOB'S ALMOND RAISIN PASTRY.  It is out of this world!  The dough is so fresh, the almonds and the raisin are so crunchy and moist - you will absolutely be back for more.  I guarantee it!  

The owner is so nice too - I keep forgetting her name -but every time I come back -- usually around 4:00 AM - she remembers everything about me.  What I like -- what I don't like!!  She is amazing!!
author: Edwin R.

description:
I discovered Bob's when I moved to SF 5 years ago and have gained numerous pounds, made friends with the employees, and have introduced every traveler or anyone passing by to these delicious donuts.

Bob's is open 24 hours a day like a donut shop should, and they make fresh donuts every few hours-like a donut shop should (but most don't) I don't know if I consider it a blessing or a curse that I live close by, but it sure makes me feel like an excited fat kid coming up to the glass display of donuts every time. Drooling and trying not to eat everything I order before I even head out the door. I always go for the apple fritter, meringues, crumb & glazed donuts, and ham & cheese croissant, and am never disappointed. I'm also looking forward to getting one of their ridiculously large donuts for a friend's birthday soon-who wouldn't like that? ;) 

The best part of coming into Bob's is waltzing in around 2AM, around the time they start making a fresh batch, and asking for a freshly dipped glazed donut to be double dipped. The glaze still so hot and the dough so soft, there is nothing that compares to that little slice of doughnut heaven on Polk. Mmm...I'm about to head out and get myself a pink box right now-see you guys there!
author: Anna G.

description:
They've got the BEST and freshest donuts in SF. They also have the most massive donut ever. If you come early enough, you'll see. It's probably twice the size of your face.

Tip: The freshest batch are always the ones on the rack directly behind the counter. Just ask them which ones they are, and you get to enjoy a terrific warm donut.

PS: They're open 24 hrs/ cash only.

More deets and pics here: http://cyneats.com/best-desserts-in-san-francisco/
author: Cynthia L.

description: Best donuts ever! They always have a line outside of the shop, and they always have something hot that they just made. My favorite is the crumb donut, which goes nicely with some milk! It's in a great location by the bars, but sometimes parking can be really difficult to find.
author: Monica K.

description:
Literally the best donuts I've ever had, and I'd say that I make donut eating somewhat of a sport. 

Maple glazed donuts FTW. The end.
author: Nikki D.

description:
On an unusually rainy San Francisco night, I have to say Bob's was quite a pleasant surprise. It made the gut-turning ride to get there totally worth it, even though our taxi driver had a major death wish (re: rain+roads=slippery driving conditions, especially downhill=slow down).

But yeah this place is a total dive straight out of a '70s detective flick -- the type of flick you forget the name of but you only ever catch a few minutes of it a time while flipping channels and then you try to look it up on Netflix but realize it's too awful to even stream, well, anywhere but that one TV channel that only shows really bad movies. 

And you're OK with this, especially when you add in the layers of grit and the grime and the giant $6 donuts the size of your head. It all reminds you of that one classic donut shop back home that somehow survives to this day despite the Krispy Kreams and the Dunkin Donuts popping up all over. And the fact that, here at Bob's, you'll run into cool kids from across the globe who are eating said head-sized donuts is a novelty all its own. Plus the regular size donuts are only like a $1 and so you eat two of them even though you just had dinner but it's all right because when's the next time you'll be here around midnight on an especially rainy night in San Francisco where all the cab drivers have death wishes?
author: Will S.

description: Exceptional donuts that are worth standing in line for. I take my daughter here to split the huge apple fritter and read the nytimes at the counter. Don't wait, just go!
author: jason c.

description:
Bob must be paying people to write these 5-star reviews. I've seen a better selection of donuts in the dumpster behind a Dunkin Donuts. 

I showed up at 930p excited to see what all the hype was about. There were 3 options, glazed, maple and chocolate old fashioned cake. None of them looked appetizing. I maintained my resolve and ordered a maple and a chocolate just to see if the donut's taste somehow defied its appearance. It did not. 

I would never go back and I wouldn't recommend anyone else waste their time here. Totally overrated!
author: Andy W.

description:
Oh my my the best damn donut I ever had..I bought 2 and a croissant ...croissant wasn't too good oddly with all the fresh creations coming out steaming hot and put in the window..cant wait to go back and try other home made pastries...long line but worth it ...the other donut i ate for breakfast and it was awesome too...don't be cheap get a drink to go with it...this is a experience
You don't want to miss
author: Kurt h.

description:
Why is it so hard to find the infamous giant donut here? It seems you must arrive at the break of dawn in order to have a chance of staking one of your own.

But hey, donuts.

These guys definitely know their donuts. My favorite so far is the crumtastic Crum Donut, just because the sugar and butter remind me of childhood and all those terrible bags of Hostess donuts we'd always get after school.

The day will come when I find myself with a freshly baked giant donut to impress all my friends, but until then this place is a legit go-to for donuts at any time of day.
author: Anthony N.

description: Great donuts when hot (really not as good when they are cold). The staff is super friendly here and there's a large variety of pastries to choose from. Totally worth the wait!
author: W D.

description:
I am so, so ridiculously happy with this place. Donuts are always wonderful, but they are even more wonderful when you can buy an ENORMOUS donut for $8. I got that instead of a cake for my best friend who loves donuts, and needless to say, it was perfect. The owner is one of the sweetest people. I also do not think she is the Bob of Bob's Donuts, but who knows? All I know is that this place makes a damn good donut. You can also call their number and you get a list of automated messages that will tell you EXACTLY when they start making the fresh donuts. Yes! A donut schedule! How beautiful is that?!

They don't have a special "dozen", so each item is purchased a la carte. For the pillowy clouds of fresh-made deliciousness you get, that is totally fine. Taking these donuts into work netted me loads of thanks, hugs, and general statements of how awesome I was. Basically, if you need a boost of self-esteem, buy your office a round of Bob's. Chances are most of your office mates will thank you, cut many of them into silly small pieces due to some diet, and you will still have plenty of donut leftover. If that's not a win, I don't know what is.

Maple is my favorite, but I am biased because maple donuts are the best. The owner agrees with me. I'm probably never going to stop by at 2am for a donut because I hear the lines are astronomical. I stopped by at 830am and there was no line, but many of the donuts were also out. If you want a Big Donut, call ahead and make sure that some are still available, or you will be sad and without a Big Donut.
author: Robbin A.

description: Went in for the apple fritter and left a huge fan of the glazed doughnut!  I personally like an apple fritter that has crispier edges.  The ratio of apple chunks and cinnamon was perfect.  The size was perfect.  Four stars for apple fritter.  The glazed was the five star surprise.  Light, fluffy and not too sweet.  A perfect doughnut for a cup of coffee!
author: John Eric P.

description:
Bob's Donuts is responsible for what might be the oddest sensation of my adult life, in that in one simultaneous moment after biting in to a super sweet freshy fried donut I hated myself and everything I was doing to my body while being in a state of pure pastry-powered bliss. Diverting your Uber driver to Bob's will both be the best and worst decision you will ever make.

It's probably good that I don't live in San Francisco, and instead can only hit Bob's when I'm there for a work trip. It's too good, for the sake of my own life, it's probably better that we've got a mountain range between us.
author: Eli H.

description:
Do you remember the Simpson's Halloween episode where a 50 foot tall Big 
Boy-esque statue with equally big donut is destroying Springfield a la Godzilla?

I'm not saying that would ever happen but . . . 

with DNA splicing and nano technology advancing at the rate it's going, it could
be possible to have a hoard of spidermen and women,
along with folks like Hiro from Heroes,
and monsters from the movie Pacific Rim (does anyone else think that title sounds dirty?) walking around SF one day.

So when that day does come . . .

and one of these giant Big Boys are searching The City for a ginormous donut,
he would simply stop by Bob's and pick up one there.

Bob's big donut is no joke!
And in my younger days, I would've eaten a dozen of those things.
But nowadays, just the sight of one of those things puts me in a sugar coma.

So I opt for a regular sized maple, and it was so good
that now I'm thinking maybe I might have to have one of those big boy donuts after all.
author: Dan B.

description: I wouldn't necessarily come here for the ambiance but the donuts are a whole other story. Fluffy, soft, sweet and usually fresh.
author: Shireen K.

description: Drove an hour to try this place out at 11pm. Selection wasn't fully stocked - was hoping to try their apple fritters or check out their giant sized ones but picked up a chocolate raised and a sugar covered raised donut, two old fashioned donuts, a jelly donut, and a raspberry danish. If you're a fan of yeast donuts this is the place for you. They were soft and chewy - don't expect airy or (light) yeast donuts. I always judge a donut shop by their chocolate covered raised and man were these tasty - the chocolate glaze on top didn't slip right off and the chocolate wasn't mediocre at all like Rolling Pin. It was delicious. The jelly filled isn't really filled - it's a raised donut cut in half smothered with jelly - this too was delicious. The old fashioned donuts were not my favorite and my advice is to stick with donuts and away from their pastries.
author: Angelica C.

description: I love camilla, because she gives me my morning chocolate croissant, blueberry muffin, and smiley 6:30am hello. It really doesn't get much better at that time of day, bless her heart.
author: Michael K.

description: Bob, you naughty minx.  I wanted you to shrink my waist and expand my wallet and you did exactly the opposite.  Forgiveness can be had in exchange for more donuts.
author: Amber M.

description:
Great little shop.  Lady who worked here was super nice.  We were talking about the local crazy lady outside pooping on the street.  While I was buying my sweets...LOL.  It's San Francisco, what can you say?

Picked up a chocolate croissant and the pandaddy.
author: Michelle M.

description: Yessss what fantastic donuts! So fresh and soft! Had a chocolate covered and glazed covered so good, so worth the calories you just burn it off walking the hills :). The staff was super nice, they apologized that the didn't have certain donuts at the time at I went, not a big deal at all! Any donut you get here will be delicious and amazing!
author: Amanda C.

description:
With damn near 1500 reviews, there isn't much to add. 

Reasons why Bob's donuts is freakin sweet: 

1) open 24 hours

2) cheap 

3) AMAZING DONUTS 

4) fresh donuts since they're always so busy 

5) AMAZING DONUTS

After a night of bar-crawling on Polk st, my friend insisted we head to Bob's donuts. We walked in and he asked the guy working for whatever was fresh, which happened to be maple glazed old fashioned donuts. His fat ass had two, I had one. He also got a low-sugar Vitasoy which I promptly made fun of him for, and then promptly took back when he shoved it in my face after I took a bite of my donut. 

Get that vitasoy. Trust me. You're welcome.
author: Angela L.

description: Came here with the bf around 12 in the morning and there was still a line out the door! The window is filled with donuts and cookies and as you step inside the old Asian man behind the counter is constantly frying up fresh donuts. We had an apple fritter and a fresh glazed bar. DELICIOUS. My bf even left with a souvineer t-shirt lol
author: Linz C.

description:
Someone once told me, "There's no such thing as a good donut." That person (who shall go unnamed) is undeniably wrong. Not only is the Queen of Sweets running the shop/taking orders super duper friendly, but this place also makes all their own jelly, glaze and custard filling from scratch. #NOM
Seriously though, every single one of Bob's doughnuts I've tried has been mind-blowingly awesome. It's something about the dough they make; dense but airy, complex and buttery. F-off, Krispy Kreme! I'd be 300 lbs if I lived closer and had less self control. 
Oh yeah, Bob's is open 24/7. Try ANYTHING custard-filled or covered in crumbly stuff.
author: Sasha A.

description: The apple fritters are out of this world!!!! Especially since they came fresh, right out of the fryer. The perfect drunk snack after a night on the town! The cashier was super sweet and hilarious, I will definitely be back!
author: Julie L.

description:
I was having lunch down the street when I noticed that Bob's was nearby. I heard about their delicious donuts and I knew that I had to try. I swung by right after lunch and noticed all their donuts displayed in their window--very enticing! 

I typically like apple fritters and I noticed that there was only one left! There were a few people ahead of me and so I quickly went in line. It was probably silly and selfish (and fat) of me, but I was sort of hoping that no one wanted the last apple fritter. Ha! Lucky me, I ended up getting the last one!

The apple fritter was amazing! It was crispy, soft, cinnamon-y, and had yummy bits of tender apples. I can only imagine how much more delicious it would have been fresh. As I was leaving, the employees were prepping the stoves--it looked like they were preparing to make more donuts. Too bad I did not have time to stick around. 

I really like the taste and quality of the donuts from Bob's. I also like that the staff is so humble and friendly. If I lived in the area, I'd definitely come back again.
author: Lien T.

description:
Other than being open 24/7, I really felt like this was just your run of the mill donut shop. While I appreciate it satisfying my late night cravings, I've had better and cheaper donuts.

The apple fritters were only OK and tasted a little burnt. It had a decent amount of apple filling, but it really was just average. The cinnamon roll donut we got was also just average. Heated up it tasted a bit better, but it just tasted a bit stale.

Lastly if the late night cravings do hit and you find yourself here, remember that it is a cash only establishment!
author: Jimmy C.

description: Disgusting-looking little place with disgustingly-good donuts. I got a dozen and so I tried (almost) them all! How can you not when each donut is only like $1.50 (I think) each!? Line was down the block so you know it is good. The people working the place were pretty unaccommodating and sarcastic, as if they didn't want you to buy their donuts. I said I'd buy a dozen or two and they just rolled their eyes instead of being happy about making money. Is this the San Francisco way? I don't know but I hate it. Tangent aside: donuts here are way better than your average place. Definitely stop by if you're on Polk.
author: Lucy C.

description: I fall little bit deeper in love with this place with every bite. If there's a line it's worth it always asked for with hot you won't be disappointed
author: Ginger S.

description:
Why say no when you can say yes?

Monday night around 10 pm, there's no line.

Even their standard glazed donuts are phenomenal.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Love Bob's Donuts. A visit to the city isn't a visit without a stop at Bob's. I stop in at least twice each pass, though nowadays I usually end up getting a couple donuts each visit instead of the full on box. 

The nice lady who runs the shop always recognizes us, or pretends to anyway no matter if we visited last month or a few years ago.

Don't like donuts, they have a huge variety of bakeshop goods besides donuts so your likely to find something delicious but get there early, they only make enough for the days expected crowd. For those referencing Dunkins, Bob' is superior, DD lost my business many times before I finally gave up on them permanently. Bob's is consistently spot-on and REALLY worth the trip!.

Bob's is a dying breed, visit them now! With the gentrification of Polk happening I don't expect them to be around much longer unfortunately; though I hope I am wrong and we can patronize them another 30+ years.
author: Nick W.

description:
This place should be banned. I will start a petition to shut it down.
If I lived in San Francisco, I would get really really chubby all because of Bob's Donut and Pastry Shop.
I swallowed 3 glazed donuts in a matter of maybe 20 seconds? Then I went back and got more... I repeat -  I am glad Bob's Donut Shop is 1300 miles away from me.
 
By any chance, do they do mail orders? I hope not...
author: Lana S.

description:
Open 24 hours? Can't go wrong with a late snack....yummmmmmmy 
They have a super HUGE one...
author: Alessandra T.

description:
These are the best donuts that I've ever had and that's all that really needs to be said. 

I would recommend trying one of whatever's fresh and hot and one maple buttermilk bar. I came here two nights in a row and they didn't have fresh buttermilk bars either night but they were still incredible. I really don't have words for how good they were. The employees were very helpful as well, I think the guy who helped us was Brandon and he was extremely nice and offered great suggestions. 

A must-try.
author: Azim D.

description:
Never thought I'd end up at a donut place after the bars, but it's one of the smartest (and dumbest lol) things I've ever done. After a night at Sudachi, friends and I walked into Bob's around 1am, and we had the freshest donuts you could ever eat -- straight out of the deep fryer. The donuts were hot, fluffy, and covered in a shiny glaze -- of both grease and sugar NOM. There's not much seating, but seeing as though we devoured the couple donuts we ordered within minutes, it wasn't a huge issue. 

Craving late night donuts? Hit up Bob's. CASH ONLY.

And the giant donuts you see in the photos? It's cool to try once, but probably best if you get that fresh too, and have people to share it with. I bought the last one, a sugar donut, later in the day and am not sure how long it was siting around. Oh well, at least I can say I tried it.
author: Camille B.

description:
Hmm, not sure I get the hype. I went to Bob's upon recommendations from friends and ordered a single plain glazed donut for breakfast. The donut was really good, but didn't seem THAT fresh. It may have been sitting out for a while.

In general I felt like the place wasn't very clean and I was practically harassed by someone asking for money inside. All part of the charm?
author: Julie B.

description: One of the best donut places I have ever been to. People rave it and its legit. My boyfriend and i come here all the time late at night since we're always in the area and I love the crumble donut and maple donut. It's so fresh and soft and the service is great! The nice asian lady working there is always welcoming and making sure that we get what we want. I have yet to try their huge maple donut but once I'm off my diet perhaps I'll try it! HAHA. But definitely worth a shot, its 24 hours which is AMAZING! Do some drinking on polk, some clubbing in downtown, and come here for donuts, thats what I call an amazing weekend!
author: Amy Y.

description: Got my crumb fix tonight. With chocolate milk :P. Nothing fancy no foo foo gourmet stuff. Just a real donut to satisfy a craving 24/7.
author: Louisa D.

description:
Having lived in Boston for a few years (the home of Dunkin' Donuts), it's heartening to me that the Bay features so many independent donut shops that are much-loved by locals and tourists alike. I needed to stop here after hearing so much hype.

It is, indeed, a little seedy here - as a lady, I felt a bit uncomfortable seeing some questionable-looking men hanging out inside. But I picked up my cake donut, which was definitely satisfactory and super cheap, and ate it while continuing my walk down Polk.

Granted, I haven't tried a huge variety of what's offered here, but I didn't feel explosions in my mouth when I took a bite of what I had. Nonetheless, I'm looking forward to expanding my experience of Bob's.
author: Shendi X.

description:
Stopped in late afternoon for donuts... not much selection available.  Picked up a Cinnamon French cruller and a Chocolate custard bar.

TASTE: *** [Cinnamon French cruller was interesting, never tried a cinnamon before.  It looked all squished & deformed, but the taste was good... spongy, eggy center, chewy lightly spiced shell.  

A different story with my other donut... the Chocolate custard bar was disappointing!!!  This too, looked slightly squished... but to my disappointment, the taste was sad.  The donut itself seemed fresh, but the custard wasn't "real" custard.  The filling was somewhat translucent, lighter than what I'm used to... as if they added cornstarch to thicken it... to avoid from adding more egg yolks in order to lower food cost... shame.  I'm very picky with my food.  I tend to eat specific things and so I know when things deviate from the norm.  Translucent custard, this i know... shame.]

CONVENIENCE: *** [Located on Polk St., metered street parking, small shop, look for big blue awning.]
AMBIANCE: ** [Donuts left out in the open, uncovered at window display. Slightly dim inside, doesn't look clean, small space. Shop appears to have the makings of a small "diner" atmosphere, perhaps the remnants of the business before?]
SERVICE: *** [Not bad, not great, nothing special. Lady uses iPad to ring up my purchase.  Funny... seems like that's the only up-to-date equipment in the shop.]
PRICE: $ [1.20 for cruller, $1.75 for custard bar]
OVERALL: **/* [2.5-stars... for nothing great & nothing special.  Too bad I'm not a fan of apple fritters... seems like that's a popular items in the other Yelp reviews.]

Just pass... it's not worth the trip.
Nuff said.

[#30 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]
author: Lily Y.

description:
Donuts at 3 am ? 
Oh yeah! 
They have such good donuts... you can eat them  24 hours a day but for some reason, at 3am they seem more like a delicacy than junk food.
author: Amy C.

description:
I had heard about Bob's doughnuts.  I ended up with a crazy doughnut craving one night, and a native lead a group of us to Bob's.  We trekked a little over a mile through the Tenderloin and got there around 11:30 PM, and our guide knew the entire staff.  So they happily showed us what was fresh.  The doughnuts were around $1 a piece.

I had a glazed cake doughnut and an apple fritter.  The glazed doughnut was straight out of the fryer, and it was amazing.  The inside was perfect.  I can't even describe the amazing factor.  The apple fritter was good but slightly over cooked.  It was not freshly made, though.  I bet a fresh one would be amazing!

Honestly, just go in and get what is coming out of the fryer.  The fresh doughnuts were out of this world.

The staff was really nice and very cool.  Definitely make a late night trip to Bob's.  You won't regret it!
author: Amanda J.

description:
Came here after the bars at 1:30am. The longest line! We waited about 25 minutes for our apple fritter. The apple fritter, how from the fryer was crispy on the outside, but I was surprised that there wasn't much apple in it. This made it less sweet which I am not complaining about. We also had a crumb donut, which was just okay nothing really unique. I also ordered a cheese danish that I had for breakfast and that was pretty good. I like that the filling was also not overwhelmingly sweet nor a large amount. The breading itself was good and also had some sort of glaze on top that I liked.

Overall this shop had some good stuff and also very nice service. The cashier lady was very nice.
author: Katherine L.

description:
I am a fairly well rounded donut connoisseur and this place is pretty awesome. I brought a dozen donuts into work and they were a hit. Everything from the maple glaze to the apple fritter(my personal favorite) were all very good. Definitely a place to stop if you have a carb focused sweet tooth.

 It does not have the sleek look that accompanies most new 'nice' donut shops, however the product is great. The store has been around since the 60's so the history of the place is just an added bonus.
author: Steven N.

description: I love donuts and gave this place a try twice now, both times sadly disappointed. They look way better than they taste.
author: Harpal G.

description:
When you're out in SF on a late night, drunk from drinking at a bar on polk and having an urge to be a little naughty, Bob's donuts is one of those indulgences. 
They have regular classic donuts and pastries, good when you're drunk or just want to fat-ass. I somehow always get their huge donut (the size of a plate), just cause the novelty of it. Other winners are the crumb and apple fritter, otherwise stick with the classic glazed.
author: Julie B.

description: I don't get what's the hype about the huge donuts here, it's honestly not that great :( I came here to get two huge donuts-one for my brother and one for my friend. My friend has told me about the huge donuts here before and raves about them all the time so for surprise gift, I decided to get him one. I came here around 3 and it looked a little run down and a hole-in-the-wall type of shop but I already expected that from the yelp reviews. So I got the two donuts, and the total came up to $17. Kinda pricey for donuts but I thought "hey they must be THAT good", by the way they didn't even have a menu so I wasn't expecting it to be that much. I got the chocolate glazed one and the maple glazed. When I got home, I tried the maple glazed and it tasted just like a regular donut, but it wasn't even fluffy/puffy. It was kind of hard and bland, especially the parts with no maple, aka the bottom of the donut. I was expecting more from this place but I'm pretty disapointed, I feel like the only reason this place is famous is because they are the only shop to carry the huge donuts but if Krispy Kreme were to start selling those, I would much rather buy it from there. Sorry Bob's!
author: Celine C.

description:
It was around one in the morning. We were looking for something to satisfy our sweet tooth after an evening of karaoke and Korean food. We found ourselves here. 

Loved how you gotta choose your donuts outside through the window display. Or if you're lucky, you can pick one off the racks near the fryer. That's when you know they're fresh. I asked for an apple turnover, but the guy behind the counter was like, "if you really want something apple, you gotta get an apple fritter. We just fried them." Well, you sold me on that one.

As we sat at the bar with our donuts, coffee, and cartons of milk in hand, we watched one of the guys from the back come out, took a BOX full of LARD and dump scoops upon scoops into the fryer. We watched the blobs melt into the already warm oil. It was so mesmerizing. My friend was like, "omg...we're eating that." And I was like, "Hey...that's what makes it good."

Thanks Bob :)
author: Grace L.

description: Mention that you found this place from yelp and maybe they will give you a little something extra. The lady that works there, I assume is the owner, was so nice. Gave me a deal on my cronuts and threw in a little something extra. No long lines for cronuts here. Though the trend may be gone, these cronuts are yummy and with the different toppings they have, you will be sure to find a favorite. They also have regular donuts with funky toppings too.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
My heart rate is beating so so so fast right now.

Okay, I admit, I did eat 3 glorious donuts (1 glazed and 1 chocolate French cruller, plus 1 cinnamon cake donut) in the span of 10 minutes...so I only have myself to blame...

Damn those French crullers. I couldn't resist INHALING them.

Anyhoo, I had the Groupon deal of $12 for a dozen delicious donuts AND a custom t-shirt. Who can say no to that!? A note for those with the Groupon (which you can still buy): "Must use promotional value in 1 visit. Valid for raised donuts, old fashioned donuts or crullers (chocolate, maple, glazed), or cake donuts (chocolate, powdered sugar, cinnamon, maple, crumb). May substitute larger and/or filled donuts at a reduced quantity." Essentially, you can fill that pink box with circular, unfilled donuts.

My favorite was the FRENCH CRULLER, which I've never had prior to the ones at Bob's. It's a fried, ring-shaped choux pastry that lends to a very light and airy donut. I first chose glazed, which looks more like crumbled sugar and totes tastes like a churro--soooooo good. The chocolate cruller was almost as good, except the chocolate sauce they use is distinctly artificial tasting. Slightly ruined it :/

I also grabbed a few RAISED DONUTS made with yeast, which yields your typically large and fluffy donuts. The dough was airy and stretchy, and glazed is always my favorite. Maple tends to be too sweet, and it's no exception here.

They also have chewy CAKE DONUTS, which results from a cake-like batter made with baking powder or soda. It's denser and crumblier, and the CINNAMON (with a hint of nutmeg) has a kick to it.

Playing off the cake donuts are the OLD-FASHIONED DONUTS with their iconic ring-around-the-ring crust. They're dense and crunchy--not my favorite (I like 'em fluffeh), but still good.

GET THE GLAZED FRENCH CRULLER. Be wary of the artificial chocolate and the overpowering maple glazes. And watch out for me at the gym sporting my new Bob's branded donut t-shirt.

DONUT MESS WITH ME.
author: Adele F.

description:
One of the top 100 things you must eat in San Francisco before you die according to 7x7.com.. For real??! After coming here I'm not going to trust a word those guys type again. Incredibly disappointed!
I came here one Saturday with fellow Yelper Tram N contemplating sharing one of their giant donuts just so that we could say we had tried it but once we got here they had all sold out. Just as well really, I'm sure our Heart and Arteries would have thanked us.
We just about to leave when feeling a little bad at coming and not buying anything I decided I would get just one donut with the intent to share with Hubby later yet looking at the rather sad looking display of donuts in the window I wasn't filled with excitement, until I remember the Apple Fritter (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bobs-donut-and-pastry-shop-san-francisco?userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA#WAnjgQpUJUxrB0qbw38Eew) was on this 7x7 list so I snapped one up and left.

Sharing it with Hubby later we were actually pretty disgusted. It was so greasy yet also somehow very dry and with minimal Apple and I paid $1.75 for this? I was so displeased the majority of my half ended up in the trash.. there's no way I was going to waste calories on something so mediocre.

I really do not get the hype with this place at all. The only conclusion I can come to is that because it's open 24hrs the majority of the clientele here are on their way home from a night out drinking and Bob's is a prime example of how almost anything tastes amazing when you're wasted.
author: Emmalouise B.

description: No matter what you get at Bobs it tastes amazing, i drive from an hour away to get Bobs almost every weekend. Would recommend to anyone and its conveniently open 24 hours a day!
author: Carrie C.

description: I really liked the extra dense buttermilk donuts and the meringues, but thought the regular donuts were not terribly remarkable.
author: David T.

description:
MMMmm fattening donuts worthy of clogging some arteries.

Supposedly it's been in business for over a hundred years! (Per staff)  Currently and for some time now owned by a different family, but still maintaining the original recipes of donuts.  The lady says their busiest time is late night (3 am), once the bars have come to a close.  Most times you might hear the tunes of a street performer out front, while a slew of boisterous people wait in line for a dreamy doughy donut.  This is not an upscale shop by any means, it's old fashioned reminiscent of an old school shop where people come to get a quick bite and a decent cup of Joe.    

Based on reviews and my love for donuts, I visited here with my Broil and we enjoyed a few of their bakery donuts and very average coffee.  The draw was their apple fritters and chocolate glazed donuts the size of a dinner plate! (Only $5.50)  We were lucky to hit them up while a fresh batch had just come out of the oven.  Fritters were awesome, also got some cake like donut with bread pudding with apple stuff layered, chocolate eclairs and then contemplated the plate sized donut.  I convinced the lady to fill the enormous donut with crème filling which she was willing to do at no charge!  However, being that we were riding classy in the convertible, not enough space to keep that donut and my luggage without something getting messy.  Maybe another time.      

Cash only!
author: Jacob J.

description: We love donuts, the Massive donuts are amazing looking, but the rest are equally as good as they look. No donut aftertaste that most places cause. We had the buttermilk with chocolate glaze, wow. The rest usual suspects, glazed, sugar raised, crunchy, maple long johns...yummo
author: L W.

description: Love!  They're amazing and the people who work here love their job, you can just tell. Happiest place ever. Donuts and croissants are huge and delicious.
author: Elyse H.

description:
I came here the night that I got into San Francisco because I had heard so much about it and I was craving some donut-heaven.  This place definitely didn't dissapoint!  I love small donut shops with stools to sit on, while you can watch donuts being made.  Their coffee wasn't bad either!  I told my wife I would be here every night if I lived in SF, which it's probably good that I don't since I would be gigantic!  
Everyone talks about the apple fritter.  It was good, but my favorite was the maple raised.  It was so soft, delicious, scrumptious, amazingness.  I'm definitely a follower now!  Will be back fo sho!
author: Joe H.

description: The apple fritters are awesome! I love this place. Rebekah is the best employee! The line is worth the wait.
author: Kabir J.

description: As a SF native I must say its not that great. I don't know why everybody is raving about this place. The oil batch they fry it in looks like the oil hasn't been changed in 20 plus years. Makes it look so unappetizing. The donuts itself have no flavor. They taste really bland, oily and stale. Just bleh. Sorry Bobs, I'll stick with Krispy Kreme lol. I gave 2 stars because the people who work there are really nice, just the pastries are a no-no in my book.
author: Sonia R.

description:
Overhyped and stale donuts.

We came around 11AM.  I ordered the apple fritter & glazed donut.  Both came out stale and didn't taste good at all.  We didn't even finish it.

I would've enjoyed Krispy Kreme 10x more.
author: Mike T.

description: The longest wait for donuts! FIRST AND LAST TIME GOING TONTHIS PLACE!!! First time visting i end up eating what looks like some type of animals hair! Stay away you dont know what your eatting in this place!!
author: Liyanna C.

description:
My boyfriend and I hiked through a valley of hookers and prostitutes through the tenderloin district in order to get these donuts and my oh my was it worth it!

We went at about 12:30am-1am and we were standing in line for probably about 10-15 minutes, apparently according to the guy in front of us this was the best time to go, because that is when the "donuts are coming out of the womb AKA the fryer" you know it's good because of the line that forms outside of the place especially that late. One of the most exciting parts is when the line moves up enough for you to look through the window to see all that Bob's has to offer for you, there are so many different types of donuts!

When we finally reached the head of the line, I saw the big pink boxes that signifies sugary pastry delights! We ordered a bunch of different donuts, my favorite being the Apple fritter which is light and airy, and has lots of apple chunks in it, and their glazed was perfect as well, it was light and airy just like the rest of their donuts were. Some other favorites were the cinnamon and sugar donuts as well as the powder doughnuts. The cashier was extremely nice and patient with us and she was great at giving suggestions when she heard we were all the way from Florida. 

Overall the experience was amazing, and the donuts are out of this world, we had so many donuts we kept the leftovers in out hotel room unrefrigerated and they tasted as delicious and airy as the night we bought them for abou 4 days afterwards! This place is a MUST GO to if you're a donut fan, or if you're craving a little something sweet.
author: Nathean M.

description:
We went for a walk along Polk street and came upon Bob's Donuts. The giant massive donut beckoned us into the shop where there was a tiny line (lucky us!). 

I think my mom and I both heard/read about Bob's donuts but we completely just lucked out and found it. We decided to just get something small and share:
- Apple fritter ($2) - I'm a fan of apple fritters and this one was pretty good. Would have been even more amazing if it was fresh. 
- Apple bread pudding ($2.30) - my mom wanted to try it. Wasn't bad but I wouldn't order it again. Had a couple small pieces of apples in it but wasn't that tasty. 

Seems like a lot of locals go here. I dunno about the bad service but the lady seemed nice enough (maybe because I gave her a tip? That apparently put a smile on her face). Haha. 

Good spot to grab something sweet after dinner.
author: Jonny M.

description:
"Oh man did you get Bob's?" asked a bar-goer on the street close to 2am. 
Why yes I did. 

If there's any box more iconic and joy-inducing than Tiffany's turquoise little box, it has to be Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop's pink box of sugary goodness. Now I'm not too much into sweets but there is something about going to Bob's for some fresh donuts after a few pints that makes it satisfying. 

Beyond donuts, they have some pretty delectable pastries too. I was advised by friends to definitely get the apple fritter and they are good. It's nice and crispy but moist on the inside with just the right amount of apple sweetness to it. I was most impressed with the cheese danish though. It's a wonderfully creamy and rich cheese filling encased within a flaky pastry. Just like the apple fritters, it was just the right amount of sweet.  Did I also mention that it's huge?

On the fence if Bob's is a late night indulgence or a walk of shame for me but either way, I'm glad it's there following some Polk Street pints.
author: Jon L.

description:
I've always heard about this place but never got the chance to go. I stumbled upon Bob's because my boyfriend parked my car a block away while we were dining at House Of Prime Rib. Even though we were stuffed from dinner, I couldn't miss the opportunity to try some of their donuts.

Since it was my first time (yes, even though I was born in SF) I didn't know which donuts to get so I just asked the cashier to give me a dozen variety + one croissant that my mom wanted. The total came up to about $13.

When we got home and opened up the box, I immediately grabbed a chocolate donut and bit into it. My first thought was that it was light and a little crisp, which I liked.
