I'm not a big fan of donuts because most donuts have too much dough and sometimes I'm confused if I'm eating a pasty or just a loaf of bread. Bob's had the right amount of dough and sweetness. I'll definitely come back when I'm around Polk street!
author: Liezel D.

description: The french crullers were fantastic (I recommend the maple one) and the services was excellent. Very quick and easy. Also had some type of apple cake/bread which was amazing! The croissants were very buttery, a plus for me. Overall, I liked it but would only return for the crullers.
author: Laura D.

description:
The big donuts is so big that I can sit on it.  Wow....

I bought the groupon deal and I must say that it was well worth it.  A shirt and a dozen donuts? Yes please.  The area is not what it is expected since I walked here all the way from Union Square.  I also imagined the shop to be nicer than others but it was just a regular shop.  The women who helped us was nice and patient since I was taking forever to pick my dozen.  

I would recommend the old-fashions, apple fritters, and the maple bar.  Yummy.
author: Jackie N.

description: We come here after every night around Polk  Street and it is definitely a huge plus that they are open until so late. Just get anything fresh out of the oven and you will not regret it - also makes for a great breakfast if you are around the area since they also serve milk and coffee.
author: Dana N.

description:
Bob's looks more like a coffee shop than a donut shop.

absent the donuts trays in the window, one wouldn't know donuts and pastries were the stars in this place. the "fry cook" isn't busy making fries, it's donuts he frying. yep 24/7, the donuts are made in plain sight behind the counter.

eats: creme filled danish  & nut covered donut(2.6)
-donuts/pastry very sweet
-almost melt in one's mouth.
-fresh tasting

crumbs:
-open 24/7
-too habit forming, glad i don't live around here.
-saw a donut/pastry 5" across..
-didn't see any pricing
-coffee sold=farmers, passed.
author: Victor G.

description: I heard the line at Bob's Donut is usually long, but the line is definitely worth the wait. The donuts are absolutely fresh, soft and fluffy! I personally thought that the raised donuts are exceptionally amazing. I got them in original, maple and chocolate flavor. The staff is friendly. I will definitely go back for the raised donuts and to try the cinnamon sugar cruller!
author: kaaaathy c.

description:
Things don't always quite work out the way you hope it would.  In the end I know I'm worth it so happiness will come eventually and w/ this, I will come back to Bob's again because I need to get that gigantic donut as they were all out.  

Who the hell buys giant donuts?  Apparently a lot of people.

Their regular selection looked like any other ordinary donut shop, nothing seemed to jump out at me.  Emmalouise B. bought an apple fritter but I left empty-handed.  I was OK w/ that since I had my sugar fill for the day but of course as soon as I got home, I regret not getting more at Sift Cupcake and Dessert Bar and Pretty Please Bakeshop.
author: Tram N.

description: Biggest doughnut I have ever see, and it taste amazing too. I will be back after my sugar rush comes down
author: Vimal P.

description: Stopped by the other night around 8:30pm as it's one of the few donut shops open 24/7 with stellar reviews. There was a good selection and the donuts tasted fresh. Ordered two of the cinnamon and sugar donuts.  The line wrapped around the storefront and parking was a bit of a challenge. Overall I'd say it was worth the trek.
author: Wendy R.

description:
Oh My Apple Fritters!!!

After having dinner at Nick's Cripsy Tacos we walked up blocks away and we found this famous SFO donut joint our friend Francesca M. referred us to. Really I had no clue that this place was just around the corner.

When I first saw this place I was like hmm... just typical donuts maybe will pass, so my wife and I just continued to just stroll the boulevard. After walking blocks pass homeless guys talking to themselves and constantly asking for cigarettes, checking out restaurants and browsing an adult novelty store, then seeing this place the second time around, oh what the heck were coming from 3000 miles away lets give this place a try.

Service was pleasant, you see them prepare donuts maybe 24/7 it seem like but
all I wanted was a frosted Chocolate donut, and my wife ordered the Apple Fritters.
My first bite of my Chocolate donut, pure freshness! choco infused! 
My first bite of the Apple Fritters, Boom! freshness, sweet warm infusion!

Im just going to talk about the Apple Fritters going forward: this were the best i've ever had, there was softness to em' blend with sweetness, and I'm not sugar coating this like sugar coats on these fritters. There are some Mom and Pop joints that serve these and they are either, bland old and rock hard!

Bob's Donut and Pastry shop is awesome they make donuts fresh than Fresh Prince, they make Apple Fritters straight from Johnny Appleseeds backyard!
author: Jon B.

description: Such a cute establishment! Their donuts are smaller and less dense which I really liked. I'm surprised that their prices remained low despite their popularity. I got the sugar donut (which deceivingly looked like an apple cider donut) and the one that they're known for... Which I forgot but it's posted on the door and it ended up being $2! If you're in the area and are in a food lull (aka between lunch and dinner and need a snack), swing by!
author: Lisa T.

description: Good donuts, but 9 out of 10 times the slow line prevents me from being able to buy. Bob's could make so much more money if they only added another cash register $$$$$...but I suppose my waistline is fine that they don't. ;) So despite living in the neighborhood Bob's Donuts remains a once in a great while purchase.
author: Brian M.

description:
Great for late night carbs + sugar, in a city that is really lacking with respect to post-last-call munchies. Not the absolute best donuts I've had (New Yorkers - I'm a die hard Doughnut Plant fan. I've also heard Dynamos is up there), but a fantastic deal $5-$6 for 4 donuts.

The more freshly made here, the better. So even if you have a favorite flavor, double check to see what just came out of the frying vat.

We tried maple, apple fritter, and some other stuff (my drunk friends ordered). They were all good, though the maple was super sweet and the apple fritter had more frosting than apple.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Crunchy donut was amazing. Regular glazed was light and fluffy!
author: Matt S.

description: This place is bomb! If you don't know what to get/don't have a huge preference, just get whatever's fresh. Don't underestimate the taste of a hot and freshly made donut. These donuts are unbelievably delicious! I got a fresh chocolate and fresh glazed and a non-fresh one topped with cinnamon. Although they were all good, the fresh ones were a league above! Eating with milk or coffee is the perfect compliment! Would definitely come back again!
author: Joshua S.

description:
I have a strange relationship with donuts. There's never a time the thought of "damn I'd really love a donut right now" goes through my big head, but when there's a fresh one right in front of me.... /GOBBLE GOBBLE. EAT ALL THE DONUTS.

Bob's is open 24 hours and they make fresh donuts around the clock. Fresh donuts alone are delicious, but a fresh donut at 2am after a few drinks is kinda like...freaking amazeballs. I had a fresh glazed and oh my goodness, it was so damn soft that I could barely pick it up. It's like picking up a fluffy cloud and then feeling guilty of eating something so perfect. 

I also tried their apple fritter which is one of their most popular picks. I don't know if it was because it was cold but I wasn't too amazed. I had a bite and went back to my perfect yummy cloud. Noms.
author: Judith L.

description:
The donuts taste okay, but not when I've only gotten half the order I wanted and definitely not for the price I've paid. ($35 for 12 donuts! Though this did include delivery.) 
Also, when a order specifically requests to not add something, DON'T add it! 
You lot are lucky nobody at work is allergic.
Thanks for the breakfast anyway. But maybe next time pay attention to requests better?
author: Lunetta K.

description:
So thanks to my amazing Yelper Katy H. who wrote: "Pro tip: Go at 11pm and get them hot n' fresh!"

I did exactly that (no line at all! score!) and walked up to the woman pulling the apple fritters out of the fryer and dousing them with thick, gooey icing. 

My face: ( O _ O )

She announced they were ready and the few people waiting clamored around for their order. Naturally one of those were ordered along with a maple covered yeast ring. 

My face after trying the still warm maple one: ＼（＠￣￣＠）／

This was the best donut I've ever had. I thought I had my favorites (please see my review for the The Donut Bar in San Diego) but this takes the cake. Melt in your mouth perfection. I don't trust people who don't like donuts...have a Bob's one fresh out of the fryer and you will melt yourself.
author: A.J. S.

description: Delicious. Crispy outside and doughy on the inside. I've had my fair share of dunkin donuts and krispy kreme. This definitely tops them both. I got the chocolate, sugar frosted, and a small coffee - came out just under $3.
author: Annie L.

description:
I thought I had the best donuts at Donut King by my house... Although those are super good, nothing compares to the deliciousness and fluffiness of Bob's donuts! I've never had such a pillowy donut in my life! Not only are the donuts fresh out of the oven all day long, but they are open 24/7! The workers are super nice 
also! 
I took 6 donuts home and had a couple the next day and they tasted like I just bought them. They stay fresh for a long time. This is hands down, the best donut shop.. Maybe in America! :)
author: Briana V.

description:
After a filling dinner, my friends and I went here for dessert.   They just made the apple fritter, so that was a must to get.  We also ordered glazed donut holes to share.  As our friends were from out of state, he had to get the large round cake size donut.

He choose the glazed one and was amazed by the size when it arrived.  We thought he would not be able to finish it, but he surprised us all.  The entire donut was gone in no time.  As he put it, "It was a really good donut. It was fluffy and airy and not dense. That was damn good donut."
author: Marck N.

description:
I've always seen this place it looked pretty good but never decided to go in.
Today at work I wanted a Donut  so bad, so I decided to try this place.
Amazingly fresh and fluffy and good pricing!
author: D M.

description: By far one of the best doughnuts I have ever had...Some of the things I like about this place...They are open 24 hours, they have great doughnuts, they have almost any type of doughnut you could want...The only downfall I have ever experienced here and what keeps me from giving them 5 full stars is...sometimes it seems like the staff can have attitudes especially the staff late at night...
author: Shawn M.

description: The plain donut when fresh is absolutely amazing. Great local gem! Get a mixed dozen and hang out at the counter with the regulars. These donuts are made from scratch and taste like it.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Pro tip: Go at 11pm and get them hot n' fresh!

I was in town with a coworker on a business trip and he stopped in his tracks and told me he'd gotten a great recommendation from another friend (on Yelp, of course!) and that friend was at Bob's Donuts getting fresh sweet treats. We followed his lead, met him there, and hung out with a few other folks getting their donut on.

There were all kinds of donuts and sweet treats in the window but the real trick here is to wait for the freshies to come out. I got lucky with a super fresh and hot apple fritter but I ate a cruller that had been sitting for a bit. It was still great but after the amazing fritter I realized I should've waited. 

There are also various other baked goods, drink options like milk, juice, coffee, and there are tables to sit and hang out. Prices are dirt cheap, yay! I'll definitely be making this an annual stop when I'm in town for work.
author: Katy H.

description: Great little spot, delicious donuts and excellent service. The old fashioned donuts are amazing. The lady who works there is so nice and friendly.
author: Rachel A.

description:
This is the best donut spot in San Francisco.

Best time to go is when they are fresh out of the oven. Even if they aren't, they are still amazingly good. So soft, fluffy and delicious!

Love their glazed plain donuts and their glazed cruellers. They even have super size donuts in where you can customize your glaze. There's always a line when they are fresh. So be patient and prepared to wait.

The service is good here. The owners, especially the wife is super sweet and always chats it up with you during your visit.

Donuts are about like 85-95 cents, how can you say no? And they are generous in size!

Perfect late night snack for when you are in your drunken glory.
author: Natasha S.

description: Way too greasy, nothing special, don't understand the hype.
author: Delphine L.

description:
I had a Groupon to try this place.  Even though this place is close to me, I had not been here for some reason.  I am not normally a big dessert person, but every once in awhile, I do crave a good glazed doughnut.  I was a little surprised that they don't have chocolate cake doughnut, but since I had a deal to redeem, I was open to try their wide selection of white cake doughnuts, plus I got a Bob's tee shirt for my bf with the deal LOL!  

Between me and my bf, the 12 doughnuts I got were gone in 2-1/2 days!  Woo!  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, and we will definitely be back for more.  Thanks, Bob's!
author: Maile N.

description: I want a donut right now, so I am walking over there now.  That's how good this place is.  If there's a line for a donut at noon, they have to be that good and I am worth it and I am amazing and it's Friday and I don't really care what you think.  This is old skool no frill fat-face donuts and they are always good!
author: Matt P.

description:
I've been to Bob's a few times. Every time I've gone, there wasn't anything freshly baked which was disappointing but I guess the universe just didn't put me at Bob's at the right time. So since it's open 24 house a day, this joint can be for any occasion--breakfast, lunch, dinner, post-intoxication, etc.

As far as their product goes, they serve pastries that will be satisfying. Glazed goodness awaits you. If only you somehow knew when they put out freshly baked goods, you would be a happy camper. Maybe there is a way to know, but who really goes out of their way to be there for that. It's one of those situations where the universe needs to put you there at the right time to enjoy Bob's creations.

When I went, they were using a Square to accept credit cards. They probably still do, but who knows if they're using something different now with all the new payment technologies.
author: Marlon T.

description: I came here for the first time a couple of days ago and boy ol boy was I glad. So so good. These are real donuts!!! Flaky fresh and fabulous!!
author: Rachelle S.

description:
Bobby Bob Bob.. Can never say anything bad about Bob's.  These guys crank out donuts 24/7 and taste like heaven on earth. Despite where they are located, they get in a lot of interesting characters. Not only are they friendly to their customers but are very patient with you. Its not easy picking a donut or two, especially when you are a bit drunky monkey from hanging out at the Polk Street bars. 

This is another donut shop that is down the street. Don't know why they even are still in business, guess its for the lazy drunk people that can't take the extra steps to Bob's.

If you are ever stuck in your choosing, you can always ask anyone behind the counter. They know what's up. [Side note, they are known for their apple fritter]. My suggestion: ALWAYS GET THE ONES THAT JUST CAME OUT OF THE FRYER. You won't be disappointed. You'll be able to know what clouds will taste like. 

This place does not have the capacity to hold a lot of people, so if you can find a seat, grab it-cause they go fast. If you go there frequently (raises hand) you will most likely meet the owner Jan and shes is always there making donuts at obscure hours. You'll also meet some regulars that come out to Bob's at particularly weird hours like if you go there at 3am. One week I was at Bob's almost every single night and was there at 3am or 4am.. why? Cause.. I'm weird.


Bob's Donuts spoils you. I can not eat donuts from anywhere else cause they are just not up to par. 

Even if you don't eat your donuts that night, they still taste just as good the next day.
author: Samantha E.

description:
No where else can you experience that fresh out of the fryer taste where the cake batter has not yet cooled, where its still gooey from the warmth and the chocolate glaze has not yet set.

Come at 1030PM for fresh cake and buttermilk donuts and 930pm/130am on Fri/Sat for fresh apple fritters, 130AM for every other day.

This place doesn't ever close, but come at night for the fresh donuts. It's never really the same when they're cold
author: Vince E.

description: I'm not sure why there are so many 5 star reviews. I think this place is just ok. I usually come in the afternoon, and there aren't many donut choices left. Also, the donuts taste a little stale here. And there's never anybody at the register!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Dropped by last night after drinks.  My friends and I ordered a variety of donuts that we shared with each other, and my opinion for each individual type of donut varies.  So here goes:

Apple Fritter: 5 stars.  An apple fritter isn't something that I'd typically order since I'm not a fan of the fruitty baked goods variety, but this was awesome.  Hot, crispy, fresh, and surprisingly cheap for its quality.  There's a reason this was branded one of the "Things To Eat In SF Before You Die".  Check.  Or, well, partial check... cuz I just had a piece of my friend's

Crumb Donut: 4 stars.  I think at Bob's, the smaller, more dense/sweet donuts are better than the bigger, more light-doughish ones, and this is one of the former.  

Chocolate Ecclair: 2.25 stars.  Something about this donut that just wasn't right.   So, this is one of the bigger donuts I spoke of above, and, while the inner non-custard portion of the donut is fine, the outer shell of the donut threw it off.  For such a decadent donut, the unfrosted outside of it was dry and "blah", kind of felt like I was eating a generally okay donut that was coated by bread crust.  The custard filling was this light white stuff that's different from the thick, yellow-whitish good stuff that's usually inside.  And while this is more of a shallow point, the ecclair was cut in half, versus intact and injected with custard, making it kind of sloppier to eat.
author: Frances L.

description: Not good, super dirty. Only came here for the giant donut which I hear they will make for you if you ask for it. Not true. Was told 'all we have is what in the window'. Sorry, not gonna eat whats in the window when your restaurant is filled with flies. Left without purchasing anything.
author: Marina G.

description: Good, friendly customer service, but the donuts themselves warrant 2 stars or 3 at best. Simply not very good. I did try the donut challenge and I came up short. The woman working was very, very nice and the challenge was fun. Maybe if I picked the right donut on the right day, it would be better, but I was underwhelmed. I have been to many great donut spots all over the country. The Bay Area is simply not a place for good donuts when this is about the best they have to offer.
author: Alex N.

description:
You can't go wrong with any donuts here. The crumb donut is 100% my favorite, but the sprinkles, maple glazed, chocolate covered, donut holes and jumbo donuts are all amazing as well. 

My roommate wanted a "donut cake" for her birthday so of course I came to Bobs to get the donuts to make it ... It was the biggest hit at the restaurant when the waitress brought it out and everyone that got to eat it was in heavennn. 

Anytime I have guests in town, this is def a spot I have to bring them. Amazing for breakfast or late night, it's hard to pass by without walking in.
author: danielle a.

description:
This year, I want Bob's donuts for my birthday. No cakes please!

 Recently, my friend from D.C. visited me. And on one early morning she wanted some good donuts at 2am. We found this place which opens 24hours down on crack st, I mean Polk Street. There, she bought all sorts of maple donuts (obviously a fan), and I got a cheese danish that looked bigger than normal. Anyway, it was the best cheese danish ever! As for my friend, she loved Bob's donuts so much, she took a dozen back to D.C.   

Note: *Minus points; the old Asian lady that works there is very rude: cocky and condescending (ignore her). It's not very easy to find parking. Watch out for hot-mess trannies and crackheads. Bring hand-sanitizer, and pepper spray (just in case).
author: Po S.

description: Yes yes yes!!! The donut holes are stellar and if you're lucky to get a maple glazed long john (no filing) you're life will be changedddddd! That pink box is everyone's favorite so it's obviously a crowd pleaser!! Don't bother getting the coffee from here though, SF has so much more in that department and Bob's simply sticks to what they know.
author: Amy V.

description: Big disappointment, not a donut shop you want to visit mid morning. Greeted by a man saying "all I have is what's in the window" which looked like a mangled mess. Not sure how this place made it into magazines, but maybe the people who wrote the articles went drinking first? And the big donut challenge they say makes them famous, they were out of. But we could come back the next day and they would save us one. No thanks. Guess you have to be drunk to appreciate.
author: Angela B.

description:
We were walking around waiting for another restaurant to be opened, so we decided to walk around and saw how yummy everything looked like by the window. 

Don't underestimate this place, that place is bomb.com 

The walnut roll was YUMMY! And who knew this place was open 24/7? Ill be back very shortly. 

DEFINITELY A MUST!
author: Michelle V.

description: When you can share one delicious glazed doughnut with 10 of your closest friends, you know it came from Bobs!
author: Miss H.

description: A little dense and greasy for me but I was just shy of getting a fresh donut so that could be the reason. I will certainly be back just for the environment alone. Up next, the big one!
author: Kristin O.

description: Donuts are good but not worth the slowness. Stood in line for ten minutes and they only served 2 people. Drives me loco how slow they are sometimes!!! If I waited 10 minutes while they served 10 people, I would actually be ok with that.  But I sometimes can't stand inefficiency.
author: Jen N.

description:
I USED TO LOVE BOB's DONUTS. 
The crumb and powder sugar donuts were outstanding. I got two crumb donuts today. The donuts were small, thin and greasy.  So disappointing.  No way will I ever go back
author: Helen W.

description:
Open 24/7 and serving up classic donuts averaging $1/piece... what's not to like about Bob's? They even accept credit cards now!

Favorites include the crumb donut, sugar donut (powder or glazed are both excellent), and anything filled with that heavenly custard.
author: Jessica K.

description:
.95 for a donut.

we had the chocolate dipped cruller. IT WAS STILL WARM with a little crunch on the edges. went back in and bought another. they were out of the popular apple donut but i'll definitely be back when i visit SF to try some more flavors. i hear the way to do it is to try whatever was JUST made. can't go wrong with anything fresh!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
The long crullers are top notch. The crust is perfectly sweet and buttery with a bit of crunch where the sugar started to caramelize. It's the effect you want from a proper coffee cake or pineapple upside-down cake.

Everything else my group tried was good, but not remarkable. Note that the filled donuts are sandwich style, sliced in the middle with the filling spread evenly inside.
author: Mohammed A.

description: Great donuts... open 24 hours :D
author: Avani K.

description: This was an awesome little shop with cheap but delicious donuts. The Chinese woman working there was friendly and helpful. The donuts were small and a but crunchy but I think that was the style they were going for. And each donut was only $1! It's a cool place to check out if you're in the area.
author: Ray K.

description: Donut or onion ring?? The size of a plain old fashion is totally not cool. I am sure the prices flour and oil haven't gone up that much!
author: S A.

description: Custard is the best in SF.   Not to sweet to allow the taste of the chocolate bar or glazed donut to be savored!
author: Courtney K.

description:
I'm not usually one to get that worked up about sweets... but I love trying new things and usually try to listen to suggestions from locals about what to eat. So glad I listened on this occasion!!

Holy sweet mother of fried glazed dough!!

Totally indulgent and absolutely delicious... I'm almost sorry I've tasted them because now I want more!

Don't be put off by the very simple shopfront... go in, say hello (staff are really friendly), grab a donut (or two or three), leave a tip (go on!) and enjoy!
author: Guida B.

description:
Some guy who likes donut once said Bob's Donut has the best crumb donut...ever. So I walked in and bought two crumb donuts, then left it in my car, and next morning (on Sunday) microwaved it and....well....what happened next is pure ecstasy. I still can't explain it.  The crumb donut is THAT good. 

So when entering Bob's Donut, prepare yourself and get ready...the Pastry Gods have brought this place down from donut heaven for you and me.
author: Hyon L.

description:
Okay so Bob's is definitely better than Dunkin Donuts(local californians likely don't know all about D.D. but us East Coasters know the deal, comparing it to D.D. isn't saying much), however, they got nothin' on my fave donuts in Brooklyn/NYC. I appreciate the wide variety- they have a variation of cakey/yeasty donuts along with crullers and apple fritters. I personally am a fan of yeasty donuts and my favorite was the maple glazed. I think the only thing going for this place is that the donuts are very fresh which makes them taste moderately better than your typical donut, however, nothing that has me craving to eat these bad boys again. 

The only reason I gave 3 stars over 2 is that they're open 24 hours!! Basically, the only place I can get my late night grub on. San Fran needs to get on the late night food action, as a New Yorker, I was dying every night having to eat dinner/dessert so early!
author: Kayla C.

description: This was a wonderful experience! So fun and so good!!!! Seriously one of the best donuts we've ever tried!
author: Ashley A.

description: Best Donut ever !!! regular or with filling, they are all the best!!!!.  hole in a wall type of store, but makes fresh and fabulous donut..
author: Marnie P.

description: Oh man. These are the best donuts I have ever had!! Pretty slim selection, but that's OK -- they are delicious. My mouth is watering just thinking of them! My favorite is the regular glazed, while BF loves the crumb. Definitely stop by here for a no-fuss, delicious, flakey donut.
author: Sam C.

description:
Bob's Donut shop is solid! It's open nonstop, and always has freshly baked donuts. 
We're lucky I suppose because we live within walking distance and can have fresh donuts at absolutely anytime we want since they never close. 

At 2 AM, it's packed with drunk bros who have the munchies. There's always a line during bar hours and right after last call, but the line moves pretty quickly, unless of course you get a drunk group that orders countless donuts they'll never finish including the behemoth donut. 

The staff are super friendly too. The lady working happily chatted with us while she got our donuts and told us about the different varieties. I told her I'd have to come in when they didn't have a huge line out the door so I can hear about the different types. They make so many different kinds of donuts and pastries and I have no idea what many of them are.

I absolutely adore the gigantic sized donuts they make. I haven't tried one, but I just love that they make an unrealistically large, 10x the size PARTY DONUT.

The prices are a bit higher than what you would expect for an average donut shop, but they're pretty darn good. 

This is definitely the good times, party donut shop. The crowd is always fun and the donuts always please.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Unfortunately not very differentiated from any other donut shop in my opinion. The time I went (9am on a weekend), no donuts were hot, so it really was just like any other place. Very, very sweet fillings.

For great donuts, try Stan's Donuts in Santa Clara, CA. The guy makes them in front of you and they sell out every day. My bet is that Bob's never sells out.
author: Chris B.

description: Went here on an early Saturday morning, the buttermilk bar, cake donut and ham & cheese croissant were on point. I was kinda disappointed about the apple fritter, it tasted like a generic cinnamon donut. BUT that won't stop me from coming back for more...and als9 checking out nearby restaurants
author: Julla E.

description: The older manager picks up the donuts with her bare hands before handing them to you.  She is also generally grumpy lol.  The donuts were okay, but nothing special.
author: Sammy T.

description: Best donut place in San Francisco. It's cheap, has a great selection, and, most important, the donuts are fantastic. The staff is friendly. They accept credit card. Open 24/7. Favorite donut: chocolate old fashioned.
author: Sam S.

description:
You know, I tried really hard to like this place, but I think I keep going at the wrong time or something. Every time I go, their donuts are stale, old and simply blegh. I 100% agree with this reviewer:

"Not impressed. Donuts all looked pathetic and shriveled. Asian lady behind the counter could not care less about being there. I don't know what you all are touting here, but this was a major let down."

Let's see... I've gone at midnight, 8.30pm, 9am... what am I doing wrong? When and where are these fresh donuts?!

I'm hesitant to give Bob's the two stars that I think they actually deserve though -- I had some of my friend's crumb donut and thought it was pretty tasty. So maybe I'm getting the wrong things? So far I've had their original glazed donut and a plain danish... but okay, it's a little worrisome if they can't get the classics right. Never a good sign. 

Ugh, somebody prove me wrong and just let me know what time to show up here for the best experience. Please.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I've frequented Bob's Donut for better part of past year, and most of my donut runs were done early morning and once or twice in the evening, NEVER with the drunk & high whathaveyous crowd late at night. It's a pretty good place for donuts, the late hours are fantastic for partying folks, and they accept CC (super low minimum, if not none). The must haves from this donut shop would have to be Morning Bun/Roll (with chopped nuts on top), Crumb cake donut, and the Apple Pandowdee (sp?). The younger workers can be little off depending on the time of the day. The kitchen, the display, and the serving trays could REALLY use better cleaning and sanitation. The donuts keep getting smaller and smaller for the same price. I also wish they'd put up labels again...

Sadly, I don't think I will be returning after my most recent visit. Sonia the elderly Asian woman was weirdly brusque, flustered or some shit, and almost rude to me despite my having been served and talking to her many times. It was kinda shocking that her behavior suddenly changed that day :( And I had purchased several dollars worth of baked goods too. And to make matters worse, I PUKED within 20-30minutes of eating donuts from Bob's, nothing else.
author: Clare Y.

description:
I officially dub Bob's donuts to be the best donuts -- EVER!

Obviously with a near perfect rating with 1600+ reviews, my little rave is not going to make a difference in directing people to try their donuts, but here's another five-star rating from an overly satisfied yelpie!

A lot of times I try hyped up food places I end up thinking they're overrated. But Bob's isn't one of them. Their donuts are seriously the best I've ever had. From their classic glazed to the crumb to raspberry-jelly to maple cake donuts, from their chocolate eclairs to their famous apple fritter, everything they have is utterly delightful! Random note-- their cinnamon coated French cruller tastes like a churro in donut form :O. (No, I did not try all of these in one sitting. It happened over the course of time, I swear!)

Unfortunately, because of my  "diet" (aka the diet that I never started but is always in the back of my mind that I should) I have to resist and limit myself to these confections. Otherwise, I wouldn't mind reaching for one more often. Beware of their addictiveness.
author: Hannah P.

description: These donuts are more than awesome! Let's just say we were so full from eating dinner, stopped here to pick up tomorrow's breakfast and ate the donuts before even getting back to the room. The donuts are ridiculously fluffy and moist. You don't even need teeth to eat these donuts, you can literally gum it! So take a donut home to grandma. This will be a go to spot whenever we are in town again. Until then, I will meet you in my dreams Bob's.
author: Roxanne S.

description: My cake doughnuts from Bob's were ok. The cinnamon roll I ate the next day was great - and the fact that it lasted that long is a huge plus. Also, the person behind the counter at Bob's was so precious and friendly - what the heck... 4 stars just for that.
author: J T.

description:
What about Bob? Oh, I'll tell you about Bob. Bob's Donuts, that is. 

This place is perfect at all hours of the day-and I say that because they're open so late. I've frequented Bob's during the day and during the later hours. The donuts are always fresh-tasting and inexpensive. I love when they just pull them out of the oven! I've bought these donuts for coworkers too and they're always a hit. Tip to get the giant sized donut at least once! My favorite is the cinnamon sugar although they're all really great.
author: Salma R.

description: We were told about Bob's because of their apple fritters but there isn't a donut there we didn't absolutely love! Boston Cream is like an eclair and the glazed melts in your mouth. Amazingly inexpensive for the size and quality - nothing fancy just fantastically sweet and delicious!
author: Israela B.

description:
I hate to knock down my own good review of this place, but the last time here was pretty gross.

I bought over $25 worth of donuts. Some were fresh out of the frier: mmmmm, that's the best taste!!

However, as my wife was eating her donut, she let out a yell as she was pulling away a chunk of donut attached to a hair!!! Oh my.... Now, this was not a hair ON the donut, it was a hair IN the donut!!!! Dark, black, and long.... Yuch!!!   (We don't have black hair.)

Now what? I had a bunch of great-tasting donuts, but the mental image of hair in all of them. I took the donut back, after taking pictures, and didn't make a big deal about it (the place was crowded), and they offered me more donuts. I am terrible at complaining, obviously, since I accepted them.

So gross. 

Later, after thinking about it, I probably would have just tried to get my money back for everything uneaten because that hair meant that EVERY donut was getting that hair, and maybe more, mixed in, along with any dandruff, lice, flakes, and whatever else hair could have in or on it!! Blechhh!!!

I probably will skip this place in the future, which is just as well as I don't need all that saturated fat clogging my arteries, anyway.

Sorry, Bob.
author: Rob I.

description:
Shit is always over rated
Waited inline for 30 min for theyre 'famous apple fritters' which ive had before and theyre decent

and they didnt 'have them until 9pm' what a joke! Waited in line for nothing! Everything else they sell is crap and super cheap/classic Chinese quality garbage!  

Polk street in general is becoming a
Huge disappointment the more i go else where and frequent other places

Put a SIGN UP if you dont have FRITTERS which is what keeps you in buisness, your garbage is not worth a line
author: Andy H.

description: A dear friend of mine gave me the gift of a gigantic donut. It was my first enjoying a donut form this bakery. The size in itself is ridiculous. You could feed a family of 5-6. It's so BIG!!! The size was impressive. The texture was soft and fluffy exactly how I love my donuts. It was absolutely scrumptious! Definitely going to try other giant donut!!
author: Karina V.

description: Went here because we wanted to check out the giant donut. It isn't what I was expecting at all but I got a regular glazed donut and a crumb cake donut. Both were good but not really worth the hype. If you are near than its worth a stop by but wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Josh S.

description: The smell of freshly baked donuts brought me in. Good selection. Offers donuts bigger than your face. Fresh coffee. Sometimes there is a line but it goes very quickly. It is very convenient for me since its on my way to work.
author: Cynthia T.

description: This met my expectations and they were high based on the reviews. I stopped by on a Friday night around 9. There was a short line but it didn't take long. The guy behind the counter was really nice and didn't make me feel rushed. The famous crumb donut was good and I got a chocolate buttermilk right within minutes of being frosted. I've been disappointed by so many donut shops, I'm glad this wasn't one.
author: Rosanna D.

description:
If you want sophisticated donuts that keep you feeling light after you eat them, look elsewhere. If you want basic beezy donuts that will probably clog your arteries after three bites....BUT will leave you feeling great initially and satisfied...THEN COME ON DOWN TO BOB'S.

Honestly, at 2am as you stumble around Polk St after a night of debauchery and nothing else is open and your sweet tooth is calling to you...how can you not want a fresh donut? Now, I highly recommend the small donut holes or the apple fritter...the donut holes are small enough for you eat in one to two bites, but you can definitely stop eating them before you feel like you're gonna explode. The apple fritter--now this is a beast you need to be able to tackle...or else if you don't finish it in one sitting, the fritter will just marinate in its own oil and get soggy...and cold... I mean, unless that's how you like your donuts, then by all means do what you gotta do!

This place is CASH only...the worst feeling is to be hangry and craving a donut, to only discover that you don't have any cash on you..

So to summarize in four sentences: I like Bob's. I like the donut holes. I like the apple fritter. You should come try Bob's.
author: Rachel C.

description:
I just realized when I'm not drunk or stoned that Bob's donuts are completely mediocre donuts. There's nothing special about them, so I dunno, I've had better donuts in San Francisco. If we're talking about innovation and all that chef-y shit, I have to say that a lot of people had done more. And a lot of people had done what they've done but better in many delicious ways. But props to them for keepin' it together. I like donuts so I can't complain. More power. LOL!

And they also have to like fire their staff or something. No offense, but most of those people are rude. Tadaaa!
author: Dominique S.

description: I would give this place Zero stars! I ordered and pre-paid  a big donut for my son's bday and when I came to pick it up they didn't have it! Lady told me the baker called in sick... apparently there is only 1 person who can make the big donuts and the bakers can't?!?! What the hell!!! Now my son who can't eat cake won't have anything to blow on his bday... this place sucks!
author: lester m.

description: The donuts are good but the service is really bad. Especially from the guy with the beard and a hat. He seems so annoyed when somebody has a question or request different donut. He is consistent with bad customer service. Maybe he should do something else and not dealing with public.
author: Greg P.

description: Crazy good donuts that were so incredibly fresh. I came for the old fashioned and the fritter but stayed for the crumb donut and the donut holes. Highly recommended.
author: Michael K.

description: Best donuts, worst service. I buy donuts here occasionally and each time I brace myself for arguably the worst, least hospitable experience. But oh the donuts.
author: Kristine M.

description:
Bob's is no yuppie hipster artisinal local organic 4-dollar-per-donut donut shop.

Bob's is keeping it real with the skillfully perfected classic donuts. They are known for their crumb donuts (so light and fluffy) and their buttermilk donuts, but it's all good and entirely worth the stop if you find yourself in the neighborhood.

The block just needs a decent coffee shop.
author: Marcus C.

description: I usually don't eat doughnuts often, but I was around the area last night and got dragged here by my cousin and sister around midnight. They have such a wide variety of doughnuts and other pastries here, and my cousin ordered the famous apple fritter for me. I was amazed at how the bread was so soft and not too sweet, topped off with delicious little apple chunks inside and a yummy glaze on it all. It's amazing how people come here quite often and they even make coffee at night probably for those with the graveyard shift-goers. I'd totally come back for the apple fritter. If you aren't feeling adventurous, they have your usual glazed and chocolate doughnuts here.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
A friend of mine and I made a wager on me eating their huge donut in one sitting...I lost. 

We went on a Saturday night, as expected there was a big line. Once we got to the front of the line, I ordered their giant chocolate glazed donut with two small cartons of milk. The donut was awesome because it was warm and fresh. 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone whose visiting San Francisco and have spare time on their hands.
author: Sal B.

description: By far the best donuts we have ever had! Our favorite was the crumb donut and the maple buttermilk! The lady who owns it was so sweet and very helpful.
author: Haleigh B.

description: One of my fave treats is any of their chocolate covered custard filled pastries.  Too bad the little lady behind the counter can make the treat a bad experience.  She'll  put the big long john in a small paper bag (squishing it) and when you ask for the slightly larger bag, she goes on and how much each bag cost (jeez, really???).  I guess the 75 cents extra I give her isn't  enough.  Service is important so I don't  go back for myself, but I buy donut holes on a regular basis.  All of their donut varieties are old fashioned delicious.
author: Lois L.

description:
The donut challenge
One full pound of doughy yum
Someday I will win

Open through the mogjt
Never too late for donuts
Everything is good!
author: Bryan C.

description:
If you are in SF and need a great donut, Bob's is the place to go. Order whatever is hot and get ready for a party in your mouth. 

If the apple fritters are hot it's your lucky day. Go to the nearest convenience store and buy a lotto ticket after you eat it, and get ready to have enough cheddar for a donut party every day of the week for the rest of your life!

Sam out.
author: Sean Z.

description:
Have you ever eaten deep fried cotton candy?  Me neither but after taking a bite of their sugar donut that's what came to mind!  Sooooo gooooood!  Light and fluffy with the sugar grain texture like you are eating cotton candy.

No five stars yet because I wasn't impressed by the apple fritter, which I heard was the best... But perhaps it was my mood or that I got donuts after eating at House of Prime Rib but I'm going to be back based on a bite of the heavenly sugar donut!

Line was out the door, granted you get served at the door but regardless, we were still 6 deep at 9pm!
author: Marc L.

description:
apple fritter, apple fritter, apple fritter. I would take their apple fritter over anything I could get at crispy kreme. Heck I might raise my first child to work here someday so I have an unlimited supply . Any questions? 

P.S. Open 24/7. Dieters need not apply.
author: Norris T.

description: Amazing donuts - get the crumb donut for sure. Everything is made fresh all throughout the day. Don't be surprised to see a line at night.
author: David W.

description: I've been visiting San Fran for 6 days now and have been to Bob's 6 times. Need I say more? The donuts are friggin dank and the prices aren't that bad. Who cares if the environment is a little grungy I'm not going to a donut joint for the decor...
author: Tyler H.

description:
I jumped on the recent Groupon for a dozen and a tee at Bob's Donut! i was soooo excited. It seemed like an appropriate time to cash it in around midnight after drinks and karaoke. Not to sound dated, but Polk street is a happening place. I don't wander around these busy streets enough. Didn't know the nightlife here was so big. I must be living under a rock...

Not a big line at Bob's for a friday night almost saturday early morning. Too early i suppose! Or everyone knew a fresh batch was coming later. I think i arrived just when they were starting to clear out of an earlier batch. I still choose a solid dozen donuts, making sure to get a famous apple fritter in the box.

I stocked up on:
Apple Fritters
Old Fashioned - Glazed and Maple
Crumb
Powder
Sprinkles
Chocolate Sprinkles

I love the cakey-ness of their donuts. The apple fritter is a little too much for me actually. It's definitely a good donut but i'm more of an old fashioned kind of girl.. pun intended......
author: Samantha L.

description:
HOLY MOLY! Maybe it's because I haven't had a donut in AGES, but this place is AWESOME! We walked in at around 10:30pm asking for some fresh donuts after dinner. My friend from HK has been wanting donuts for a long time so I suggested this place to her and told her that it's the best in town! Little did we know, right when we sat down, a man came out with a huge medal pale with batter in it. We watched him make the donuts right in front of us! They were so cute and donut-y! hahahaha! I don't know about you, but I thought that was cool! ANYWAY!

We ordered 5 chocolate donuts (4 with 1/2 sprinkles) all at $0.85 each and stuck candles on there and sang happy birthday. The whole joint joined in with us! She was blushing to the max. The first bite of that donut was amazing. The chocolate all over my lips with a crunchy outside and a warm soft center. OHMAHGAH, I would've finished that thing so fast, but I told myself to savor it. Too bad he just kept making chocolate ones, I wanted a glazed one.. that's okay! DEFINITELY coming back soon!
author: Linda K.

description:
I think they have the best donuts on the Bay Area. 
I usually take the big donut. It's so delicious! 
Yesterday there weren't big donuts, so I took regular glazed donuts... well, they were still  hot! I have never tasted hot donut! Yummy yummy!
author: Scilla L.

description:
Overall: this place has the freshest donuts, straight out of the fryer and into your belly

Pros
- French crullers are amazing here
- staff is super friendly
-other donuts are great too, I haven't had one that I didn't like

Cons
- no restrooms

Sidenote: 
- You can call ahead and pick up your giant donut order, but don't be a punk and cut the line just to pick up. You need to wait in line like everyone else.
author: Michelle D.

description:
I've eaten bobs donuts several times, but it was always brought to me in the pink donut box. Pretty good plain glazed donuts, nothing amazing. Doughy, chewy insides with a wet slightly soggy glaze. Fairly strong oil flavor. Don't  understood what the hypes all about. 

Today, I went to the store in person to buy a box. Now, I don't think I'll be eating donuts from here anymore. The place is a hole in the wall, which is fine, but it's a really really dirty hole in the wall. Now I have a hunch why there is that strong oil flavor... 

This is what i saw, you can come to your own conclusions... 
- Foggy window front with old and mushy looking donuts
- Flies around the old mushy looking donuts
- Donuts being fried in oil that was black colored
- Newspapers covered in oil lining the counter immediately next to the frying donuts
- Hot water from the coffee pot stand poured into a dirty looking pan of chunky and old chocolate fudge, then mixed, before donuts are plopped on top.

I'm now becoming convinced the high rating of this place is because there are frequently fresh donuts, it's cheap, and bc they are open 24/7. The end.
author: Jessica W.

description: This review is for the donut bread pudding, not the donuts. Get yourself a nice, heavy slab of bread pudding made from day old donuts, with additional chunks of apple thrown in. Delicious and original. I don't really eat donuts, so can't offer an opinion on them. The experience of standing in line and being waited on by the older lady is simply San Francisco at it's best, and most original. Nothing pretentious here, no hipster douchebaggery, nothing complicated. If you need that donut, or donut bread pudding, use Postmates, they deliver from here FREQUENTLY.
author: Richard V.

description:
So, maybe I'm spoiled as far as doughnuts are concerned, but I'm going to break from the popular consensus in my review of Bob's Donut & Pastry. We visited at around 8:00 on Sunday morning and got a chocolate glazed old fashioned, a raised glaze, and a raised crumb doughnut. The doughnuts were good, but not great. They didn't taste terribly fresh, even though we came fairly early in the morning. The shop
itself is really divey and grubby. I didn't feel comfortable having my kid eat there.
author: Terri D.

description: You must try the crumb donut!  So delicious.  Also we bought maple, chocolate cake donuts and a huge donut .  Went at 6:25pm and there was a short line, but staff was friendly and donuts were great.
author: Alexis A.

description: Bobs donuts is worth the hype and the long line especially when the donuts are super fresh & still warm....even if they aren't though it's still good. I've always been satisfied with my experience here. Other donut shops in the city simply don't compare to Bobs. The chocolate raised donuts are amazing!
author: Allie M.

description:
OMG, these apple fritters are the bomb and they are as big as my face!!! So delicious!!!

Why the 4 stars instead of 5? Well, it took my hubby and I  3 tries before finally were able to experience their FRESH donuts.  First time was after our wedding anniversary dinner at HOPR and they didn't have much selection, but we bought an apple fritter.  I thought it was good, but not blown away for some reason.  The second time, we were in the area and again, the donuts were not fresh and not much selection, again we came home with an apple fritter.  I thought that one was better than the first we bought.  

Third time was a charm, since we went back for a third try last night around 10P and OMG, lots of donuts in stock. There were donuts on the racks! 

I felt like hit the lottery when the hubby said, "the box is warm!!"  We took home 3 apple fritters and one chocolate raised. They were delightful!!!!!!  

A trip to Bob's donuts will now be a "must" when we're in the city!

But yes, I totally think this is the best apple fritter I've ever ate!
author: Dawn D.

description: One of the best donut spots in SF. The location is a congested but it's worth the drive to come. I tried their glaze and it's damn good.
author: Selvin J.

description:
It was the sweet smell of Apple Fritters that loured me in on a chilly, San Francisco evening.  Fresh, and HOT from the oil, perfection.  Great staff, who have to deal with the occasional Polk Street drunk or Crazy, so be polite and TIP.    

Places like Bob's make me think there really is a 400 pound man begging to get out of me.  I could easily eat donuts from Bob's all day.
author: EC N.

description:
I was hoping for a much better experience but I really have nothing positive to say about my visit today. One, there were about 5 trays of treats in the window, and nothing in the displays inside. They only had cake donuts. The giant donuts looked ill, they were crushed and soggy like they were old.

We were there around 11am so you'd think they would have some fresh ones. So we ordered 2 cake donuts and they were super soggy. The woman proceeded to take approx 2 minutes to bag them, and another minute to make change for $5. While waiting I got to focus on the surroundings which were really old & run down. It's definitely a to-go kind of place. 

I'm disappointed, as the pictures and reviews here were not what I saw today, it may just be an off day?
author: Venus S.

description:
I appreciate the fact that this place is open 24 hours. However, my sober taste buds were not impressed with the much raved about apple fritters. 

Don't get me wrong, they were NOT BAD... Crunchy on the outside and soft/warm on the inside. What turned me off were the oiliness and lack if apple bits. Firstly, the apple fritter was so greasy I could feel it ooze out of the gap of my teeth at every bite! Secondly, I barely tasted or saw any apple bits inside. 

So basically, I was eating a giant greasy cinnamon bun.
author: Betty T.

description:
Donuts were legit. The texture is more doughy than cakey. Nice chew to it!
The lady behind the counter tried to rush me into making selections. There's no one in the store except me and her...How are you going to rush me, when I'm choosing DONUTS?! You lose a donut point for that.
author: Kay H.

description:
I used to come here after drunken Polk street bar crawls BEFORE Polk Street became the bar central zone.  Yes, young whippersnappers...back in the days when recreational drinking was my competitive sport of choice this was where I indulged.  Fast forward to 2014 and my first return to Bob's and this time with my bikini sisters and no alcoholic stupor.  OK...still as sinful and delish as I remember.

Honestly, my favorite will always be the chocolate iced cake donuts.  Yet, today, I opened up the world of possibilities of...tah-dah, apple fritters.

Be-ware...the sugar fairy definitely resides here.  Mmm mmm delicious!!!  Off-season dirty bikini bulking approved...  Ohhh soo good to be oooooh so bad... I am so gonna pay for this during cutting season, but so worth it!!!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
EXT. POLK STREET -- NIGHT

Our hero, you, is walking down Polk Street. Their friends have deserted then in favor of Pizza to satiate their drunken munchies. 

But our hero knows better--or their nose knows better. From up the street wafts a delicious aroma and they walk towards it.

It is the smell of donuts. But not just any donuts. FRESH donuts. And not just any Fresh donuts, my friends, these are BOB'S fresh donuts.

From behind the counter the smiling baker pulls a tray of steaming donuts then dips them, one by one, into a pot of warm milky glaze. From there he tosses them in crumbles.

No words are exchanged.

He only smiles and passes you two and a carton of milk.

They melt in your mouth and you enter into nirvana.

Amen.
author: Tis T.

description: Hey hey...  Didn't think I could find an old school donut shop in the city.  But pretty darn good.  Great crispness   flavor and selection.   11.30a and there is still a line out the door.
author: bill b.

description: Good,moist,big donuts. Value was there. Apple fritter just a taaaad overrated on here, but it's damned good. I was expecting a goodly experience.
author: Frank M.

description: Went there around midnight on a Tuesday. The smell inside was amazing. Grabbed a mini chocolate cake doughnut and a regular chocolate glazed doughnut. Both tasted fresh. Will be back to try others.
author: Suel S.

description:
I've always wanted to go in and get that glazed donut the size of my head. Sadly, I stopped by after a particularly hearty dinner, so that wasn't going to happen, no matter HOW MUCH I love donuts.

Instead, I got a regular chocolate-glazed donut and a small carton of milk. Even at 5pm, that donut was amazeballs! Sat at the counter next to a very attractive man who watched me choke down that donut and take huge gulps of the milk. Luckily, that man's a good friend of mine, so he didn't judge me too harshly.
author: Adena B.

description: The donuts are amazing.  I loved the apple crumb.  The lady helping us was so sweet and helpful.  It's my kind of place...a hole in the wall.
author: Teresa T.

description:
I made a special trip into the city to try Bob's donuts this weekend.  The selection was pretty lean for a Sunday and I had the glazed.  It was OK but nothing to write home about.  

Maybe I hit it on an off day.
author: Drew M.

description:
Dear newly single girls
Bad break up? Are you eating your feelings? Ok well make your 2am binge worth it!!! Two words APPLE FRITTER! Have it fresh out of the oven. You'll forget all about The D-Bag, and proclaim your devotion to Bob. You can always get reacquainted with your new man Gym next week. For now embrace your mal-adaptive coping mechanism!
author: Melanie K.

description:
Would you guys stop going with the over-the-top praise for this place? They're not re-inventing the wheel, its just donuts. Comparable to most other cheap donut spots. 

Of course their donuts are good...they're donuts! They still use the same flour, same glaze, same chocolate, maple etc. The same usual suspects like raised, old fashioneds, holes, twists, etc., as other places. 

Because of the volume they sell, they make fresh donuts at higher frequency maybe so you probably have had FRESHER donuts here than other places. Like most fried things the sooner it was cooked, the better it is. The apple fritter isn't made better than anywhere else. It probably was just fresher.

I used to go here often. My diet has changed so I don't frequent it as much and I'm not on Polk street late-night because Im not a douchebag. The lady that would be there on my visits was very nice and always remembered me. I got great donuts because I didn't just pick my favorites, I asked which were the freshest. So I got to try a variety over the years and the freshness made it great. I've had the not-so-fresh versions and they are as average as  most other donuts you've had.

Don't expect a life-changing donut like some of these reviews are saying. Expect a fresh donut...which of course still is a great experience.
author: Monsieur_Meursault _.

description:
Stopped by because all drunk friends and people on the street were raving about how amazing it and it was a shock there was no line. 

Donuts were mediocre. I would recommend trying the donuts they just made as they taste the best when they are warm. 

What made the overall stop the most disappointing is that the guy who worked there was ridiculously rude and clearly hated his job/life for having to be there. I think that he completely ruined the experience at Bobs. The "fresh" donut that he recommended was not warm nor did it taste that fresh. 

Not sure what the rave is about but if you want a sweet/donut fix I guess you can stop by if it's on your way.
author: Roshni P.

description: It's a 24-hour donut place. And the donuts are good. I'm not a donut expert, so what's not to love about it? There's always fresh things coming. I like the simple vibe of the place. And I like the filled maple bars. Everything I had there was also good, though. Old-fashioned, raised etc. The lines can be a bit irritating. I mean, a line for donuts at 10 PM on a Thursday?
author: Lucas C.

description: Soooo good. But...from the only three star review I see, I understand it's best to order whichever donuts are freshly made and still warm.
author: Loree A.

description: As an out of towner, I wasn't sure that Bob's could live up to the hype. I ubered over to get some doughnuts and wasn't sure if I was at the right place. It really doesn't look like much and nothing was labeled so I had to just ask what they had. I got a little of everything they had. It was amazing!  The apple fritter was my least favorite, but the raspberry filled, cream filled, and crumb were to die for. I'm craving them again now!
author: A B.

description:
I promised that I would go back to Bob's after the bars* closed on Polk to try one of their FRESH maple, glazed donuts. Well, I kept my word and I have to say that it was probably the best donut I have ever had. E-V-E-R. It was absolutely heavenly and there are not enough words to explain the doughy, sweet, deliciousness that is Bob's Donuts. You just have to go try it for yourself. I swear you'll love it!

*Alcohol did not influence my opinion on Bob's Donuts ;)
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I have never had such a mouth watering, fried to perfection cake donut in my 29 years. So fresh and so mean are these donuts! Crispy on the outside and  soft deliciousness on the inside. I tried a old fashioned glazed donut which was a melt in your mouth scrumptious piece of heaven. Also tried the cake donut with chocolate and sprinkles. At 4pm our donuts were fresh and still warm. 

I will drive from the east bay just to have these to satisfy my late night cravings! 

Job well done, Bob!
author: Sylvia J.

description:
This is definitely the type of place you stumble into late at night when you and you're friends are craving some bomb donuts. I've tried the original glaze, maple buttermilk, and the cake donut (not all at once!). They were oh so fluffy and melt-in-your-mouth delicious!

The donuts are super cheap and I love that its open 24 hours!
author: Elaine N.

description:
No, no, no, and NO! 

The 7x7 magazine is all wrong with having the "drunk at 2am" apple fritter as #80 on their bucket list. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GXu3PD4IPsxIHpo011aydg?select=xlqLNxjl0MYNZ4dfQVRl6w) 

Listen Casanova. The thing that you definitely want to sink your "you know what into" over here is their moist, gooey, juicy, sweet (but not too sweet), fragrant (only when it's fresh), comforting, apple thing. 

To me it's like, say it slowly .................. warm, apple pie. 

#69 on my top 100 eats list = Bob's Donut's - Apple bread pie thing (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GXu3PD4IPsxIHpo011aydg?select=Ra0r0Z9j1Zv5LGJbGcYwQA) and (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GXu3PD4IPsxIHpo011aydg?select=M9sP8iylHup6L_whd4xvgw)

And this one time, at band camp....
author: Earl G.

description:
This place will ruin your diet. Tread lightly. Everything is delicious. I had the chocolate croissant (pain au chocolat) and it was pretty darn tasty. Then I tried a regular glazed donut, also great. Prices here are relatively low, so get over here!

The staff was a little short with me, but everyone has those days and it didn't impact the quick service. I have to admit, it was hard not to continue ordering treats.
author: Jarvis J.

description: I've been to this place 5 times and 3 of those times have been phenom BUT lately they are not so great. They don't seem to have fresh donuts anymore. It's so disappointing.  What's up with that? If they go back to the greatness I remember, I'll give them a 5!
author: Melorra G.

description: The first time I had the donuts here (at night) they were delicious! definitely worth 5 stars. The next time I went (late afternoon) they weren't as good though. Maybe the donuts are baked at night, definitely going to try my luck again.
author: Bhavya K.

description:
I came here after a late night of whisky drinking and bar hopping with great hopes because of the many rumors I heard about this joint (mostly being that this place opens late).  I will now affirm that that rumor is true: it indeed was open, and it indeed was late.

I was buzzed and Bob's is buzz-worthy. 

I made a van full of I-want-to-purge people wait 30? 40? minutes as I bought a dozen donuts all to myself.  Literally no one in the van wanted to eat any with me but I wasn't complaining.  That's just more donuts for me.  

I did not know which donuts to choose so I told the worker to just choose all and any dozen she felt like choosing.  I gave her freedom.  Call me America. She was nice and grabbed the ones that were fresh for me.  I do-nut know what I like more than donuts besides donuts being offered late at night. Me and the patron behind me struck a conversation about how often he frequented the store. His loyalty to the donut store hyped up the place even more and the wait became that much more excruciating.  

I devoured three donuts.  DOH!
author: Brenda L.

description:
While in San Fran I had to check out Bob's...so much so that we actually left a bar at 1:00 am to get to the donut shop before the last call crowd. I figured since I'm skimping out on two whiskey diets, i would treat myself to their most infamous donut - the apple fritter. SO. GLAD. I. DID.

Living in NYC, I've had my fair share of pastries from Cronuts, to Georgetown Cupcakes and everything in between. West Coast came in with a bang though! Bob's offers a great variety and really you can't go wrong with any donut, even a traditional glazed. When you get to the counter ask what are the donuts of the hour (they make a new donut batch each hour), they are warm and freshly glazed.  

So go ahead, have a donut or two, your taste buds will thank you and give you a real reason to use the :O face.
author: Leslie M.

description:
One time, I walked to Bob's Donuts from my apartment in the Tenderloin at 4:30 A.M. 

A pimp followed me almost the entire time, stood behind me as I ate my maple bar, and tried to get me to become his newest prostitute.

"You have a boyfriend? Well, I can teach you things to make him happy, if you know what I mean. I'm a coach. That's what people call me. Coach," he said, smiling and winking.

I risked my personal safety and could have been a victim of sex trafficking all because of these donuts. 

WORTH IT.
author: Jenn C.

description: The line is always out the door when I go, but it is because there is only one cashier and she moves very slow. The donuts are very fresh and still don't taste amazing. Way too sweet and greasy. All of our stomach hurt after eating about half a donut.
author: Ivania M.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of sweets -- I generally avoid chocolate, hate frosting, and turn down dessert.

But I love Bob's. It's old and worn, with deeply unflattering fluorescent lighting. That doesn't deter the crowds. This San Francisco stalwart is open 24/7, drawing lines that extend down the block in the middle of the night.

Have you ever watched fresh donuts being fried before your eyes? Smelled hot maple glaze being drizzled over piles of crispy dough? Tasted a moist, crunchy yet airy donut that's neither too sweet nor too heavy?

If not, you know what to do. Go right at midnight, when the donuts are freshly made and still warm, and treat yourself to some of the best donuts in America!
author: Tiffany W.

description: This place is very homely, love the donuts . There was a big line here when we arrived so I figured that this place must be good. I tried the chocolate glaze and sugar donut and it hit the spot. Will definitely be back next time I am in in town.
author: Wade Y.

description:
I have to give five stars to a donut shop that serves up fresh, warm, melt-in-your mouth glazed circles of gooey goodness at all hours of the day or night. The line out the door is a testament to their awesomeness. 

At 2am, the crowd is as diverse as the donut selection - drunken bar-hoppers, couples, students, even a hooker or two (seriously). No one can resist the allure of a freshly-fried original glazed Bob's donut in the post-clubbing hours. 

You can't go wrong with original glazed or an apple fritter. Trust. Bob's puts all other donuts to shame.
author: Mariela D.

description: Love this place. Friendly staff if you luck out there won't be a line, but the wait is welcome. They are always making more donuts so you have a good chance of getting a just out the frier fresh one that you want. This is quality and quantity. Yes bobs.
author: Cameron K.

description:
This place is amazing--- and now with square, they can take CC's.

Pros:
Amazing donuts
They offer a big donut 
Best crumb donut in SF
Open 24/7
Offer milk/coffee/juice
Friendly staff
Fresh donuts 

Cons:
They run out of glazed and maple twists
Long lines at 2AM

For awhile they offered a Groupon-- totally worth it!
author: Alli J.

description: I was pretty excited to visit this place.  We tried three different donuts (bear claw, apple fritter, and sticky bun) and they were pretty good, but not what I was expecting.  I'll give them the benefit of a doubt that their donuts probably taste better when they are super fresh, but they were just mediocre when I went there.  The people are very friendly and the prices were reasonable.
author: Ryan W.

description: The worst service ever !!!! I asked to buy a large donut.  I was told it would be done, I waited an hour and the guy just blaintly ignored. He made hundreds of regular donuts while I waited. When I asked if he could through in 2 of the large donuts we were waiting for, he said no. Right on for your customer service Mr. DONUT MAN. Hope you move up the ranks and make it to Donut General you donut peasant.
author: Josué T.

description: Warm donuts during the late cold hours!
author: Sagar J.

description:
Finally went here after talking about it for such a long time.  The donuts are outstanding.  I didn't get the giant donut this time (I'll be back...), but I did get a crumb and a chocolate glazed donut.  Both were top notch.  Easily among the best I've ever had.  Well played, Bob's...well played.

Staff is super friendly.  They've got a lot of places to sit too.

Highly recommended.  I'll be back.
author: Brian B.

description: This bakery has some of the best donuts and pastries that I've ever had. The apple fritter is something they're very well known for and you can never go wrong with the morning bun or various donuts. They also have giant donuts that would be a great alternative to getting a dozen donuts for a group!
author: Charlotte A.

description:
I've been here sober and I've been here drunk, and each time was awesome!  The staff is always friendly, and the atmosphere is non pretentious and just has that old school  hole in the wall feel.  I can't remember the name but the last donut I had there was a glazed buttermilk thing....holy you know what it was good!  It's a donut shop, better than most donut shops, better than grocery store donuts and nothing like the fancy novelty ingredient donut shops (nothing wrong with those btw.)  Hope that helps!

Protip:  Just ask for what's hot and you won't be disappointed.  Also, wear a scarf in case you get stuck outside waiting in line.
author: Tiffany C.

description: This little hole in the wall place was great. You can watch them make your donuts fresh and what more could you want than a 24/7 donut place. The crumb donut is their specialty and I can see why
author: Sarah J.

description: I got the doughnut that's the size of my head. It was very bready but the fact that it was so huge made me happy. I haven't tried anything else there but it smells nice in there and there are almost always people :)
author: Grace H.

description:
Do you like sugar? Do you like buttery flakey goodness that melts in your mouth and leaves you longing for more? Then this place is for you! 

This was my first time dropping in to grab a doughnut from here even though I pass it on my work commute EVERY day. Now, I'm hooked. The staff was friendly, the line moved pretty quickly and best of all when I brought the doughnuts to work and sat down with my cup of coffee my mouth watered. I have tried quite a few doughnut shops in my life and will have to say this is one worth writing a review about! Recommend anyone to go and try this place out!
author: Katerina L.

description: Just point to whatever is cooling on the racks behind the counter--you won't be disappointed.
author: A. B.

description:
#&$*#&*$!!  That window display at Bob's is an extra 5 pounds waiting to happen.  Fortunately, I'm on the thin side...but it still targets that core area.  Nonetheless - that window display is like bait on a hook luring you in for the kill.  Today after my dentist appointment (yeah, after I got my teeth cleaned), I decided to walk on Polk.  Bad idea!  I swear that I was NOT thinking donuts or "do nots", but slowed down when a shiny glare from the window caught my attention...along with the smell.  It was well stocked with donuts and pastries all smiling at me saying, "you're just bones.. go treat yourself...c'mon".  I should have crossed the street earlier, BUT since I was there - I went with their most popular item...the apple fritter, $1.95 and very yummy.   I ate the whole thing.  Wish I didn't, but did.  I really should have just stuck with something lighter like their butter horn or old fashioned.  Sometimes less is more...and all I needed was a few less bites of guilt.  Definitely need to work out today to make up for this!

I've tried their giant donut.  It looks way more intriguing than it tastes...very doughy and dense.  Too much chew...if you ask me.  I recommend skipping that all together.  Go for a variety instead.

Personally - I really miss their chocolate walnut shortbread cookies.  They stopped making them since it didn't sell well :(
author: Alvin J.

description: Donuts after clubbing? I was sceptical but oh my days, such a good shout! Light, tasty and authentic American donut and at a great price! Made the Uber home 10x better. Cheers!
author: William M.

description: Some of the very best donuts in the area. Very much a no-frills place, but the donuts are always fresh and tasty! Line can vary greatly by time of day, but generally service is quick.
author: Brennan K.

description: I am not giving it a 5 only because I have not tasted everything they've got. Short and to the point. Danish- cheese and the fruit flavor. On point. Donuts- must have the Crump or what I call Boston cream (chocolate or Mabel toped) oh wow, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. Oh and I almost forgot. You can get little milk cartons like when we in school
author: Lissett R.

description: deceiving.  when my wife took me here i was expecting a bigger, brighter, more commercial establishment.  i actually walked away after looking at the doughnuts in the window display.  presentation is not their strong suit.  i digress, the doughnuts and apple fritter were absolutely incredible!  i mean really really amazing.  so simple, so light and tasty.  true story- the next day we were leaving san francisco and before heading to the airport decided to make one last doughnut run.  we ended up jusssssst missing our flight and spent the next 22 hours in various airports trying to get back to south florida.  was it worth that?  no lol.  but damn close!  no regrets.
author: Joey C.

description: The donuts are amazing! The prices are low. Totally worth the line!
author: Anjali B.

description: Best donut shop I have been to by far. My girlfriend and I shared a huge glaze donut. I was expecting a "normal" donut taste that you get with regular donut shops, but I was wrong. The donut was great! I want to try them right after a fresh batch is made!
author: Kenyatta C.

description:
No nonsense really good donut. They keep it simple. Classic donuts...none of the trendy donuts you see today. 

Will be back for sure.
author: H L.

description: The apple fritters are amazing! I don't usually eat doughnuts, but Bob's doughnuts are mind blowing. HIGHLY recommend!
author: Hannah T.

description:
I have been holding onto my groupon for Bob's Donuts for months now so when I had the chance to finally use it, I was ecstatic!

First off, this whole groupon ordeal was a no fuss ordeal for people still holding onto it. I was able to get my t-shirt and a dozen donuts (only the ones with holes qualify) in a short and efficient time. I immediately had the glazed donuts and was happy to find them super fluffy and delicious. It was almost like taking a bite out of a sweet cloud. 

Anywhoo, if I am given the opportunity to be in the same neighborhood again, I would definitely swing by to try their popular apple fritter and giant donut. nomnomnom.
author: Eva L.

description:
I ordered the maple donut with sprinkles and our son got the chocolate donut with sprinkles. I forgot what my boyfriend had.

The lady on the register was very nice to us. I forgot my wallet in the car so my boyfriend had to run back to get it. She didn't mind and didn't give us any problems for it. 

We sat on the stools and when he came back, she helped us and explained to the other customers that we were in line first. That was a nice gesture because we didn't have to wait again.

Now for the donuts..... The maple with sprinkles was delicious! It melted when I took a bite. Wish I would of had some milk though! The donut tasted fresh and really sweet. We enjoyed them!
author: Yee W.

description:
By day, Bob's seems just like any other donut shop.  By night, there's a line out the door and it's open 24 hour and makes donuts fresh around the clock!  What a place, I can't believe I'd never been here before.  The best part is you can ask the cashier which donuts are freshly made, and those will come out still warm!  The donuts are pretty cheap, but be warned, you may feel sick after eating 2-3 of them. :)

Bob's also has a GIANT donut (maybe worth 6-8 regular donuts?) that if you finish the entire thing you get your name on the wall.  I probably will never try it, but gotta love a local challenge to aim to reach.
author: Gabrielle L.

description:
I never eat donuts anymore and I thought I'd give Bob's a shot. 

Apple fritter was DELICIOUS and they're open late. I think I came by at 1 am....So good!
author: Ashley B.

description: Good price, nice staff, tasty fresh donuts- bummer you have to trek around a shady part of SF to get there however it will help you burn off calories if you walk.
author: Travis N.

description: Great, fresh donuts opened late. According to some guy, the crumb donuts are the best crumb donuts and by golly, they are! Also try the freshly baked glazed, maple and buttercream donut. If coming with friends, they make these HUGE donuts for sharing. Happy eating!
author: Sarah N.

description: Picked up some fresh donuts at about 2am. Busy like always and great tasting donuts. The rainy weather seemed to complement the warm and tasty donuts, just saying.
author: Alonso M.

description:
Good gawd! Food coma! 
We totally had this place booked mark.
