Considering that I'm a sugar sweet tooth and a fatty, I had to stop here! Giant chocolate doughnut, watching the man make it right before my eyes was mouth watering! I'm so glad I got this out of my system. 
Hasta luego
author: Patty And Sergio R.

description: The. Best. Donuts. Ever! I live in Florida and I want to visit SF again for these donuts! The maple glaze was amazing. I wonder if they ship.... ;)
author: Kerri P.

description: Fresh donuts at 1:00AM? This place would be busy even if their donuts were mediocre, which they aren't. The donut holes melt in your mouth, the buttermilk biscuit is as rich as I've had, the maple on the maple bars is just the right amount of mapley. Everything is very good. Who says nothing good ever happens after midnight? They've never been to Bob's.
author: Christopher L.

description: My children loved the donut holes. The apple fritter, their best seller, was also excellent. This is a traditional mom and pop style donut store - if looking for gourmet donuts and fare, check out Mr Holmes Bakehouse
author: Oink A.

description: Walking by, decided to try this place.  The donut I had was amazing! The glaze donut melted in my mouth! The crumb donut was delicious! Yummy!
author: Aeon N.

description:
This is THE place to go for giant donuts, in lieu of a boring old birthday cake. They come in 4 flavors: glaze, maple, crumb, and chocolate. Wanting to buy all 4, I asked the gal, Amanda, was and she said glazed and so went with that one. It went over so well with the lucky birthday boy, who was nice enough to share with neighbors who couldn't help look over in amazement at the ginormous sugar ring that was also really tasty. 

Call ahead since they will sell out. I even covered the thing with freshly made donut holes just for kicks. Thank you Amanda! You are lovely and I appreciate the free birthday candle that saved me a trip to the store. And they're open 24-7. I'd give 6 stars if I could.
author: JoAnn P.

description:
Pros:
- apple fritter-- not too greasy, but nicely glazed and fried
- "hot cross bun" - I wish there was more fruit glaze because it was so good!
- giant donut (seriously larger than a cake)
- plentiful seating indoors
- large selection of donuts

Cons:
- employee recommended that we didn't try the giant donut because it was our first time. I guess it's not as tasty as the other donuts?

Bottom line: I would love to go back in the morning and have a donut with coffee. If you're fast at eating, you should try the 3 min giant donut challenge :) I don't think I recommend you go too far out of your way to eat here though...
author: Jiann M.

description:
They make fresh donuts and cater to the late night crowd! 

My favorties have to be the ham and cheese croissants and the maple cake donuts. I like the apple fritter too but i feel it sometimes can be too sweet for me. 

I love bob's donuts and love how I can get a donut at any hour of the day!
author: Christine W.

description: Grease! Grease! Oh $u?c@!  Reflux!  Prevacid!  Enough said? Same old boring selection as other donut shops, but these were fried in shortening and allowed to soak up whatever awful substance they fried in. Gross! Gross!
author: Douglas P.

description:
the BEST donut I have ever had. in my life. 
got an old fashioned one hot and fresh out of the oven in the wee hours of the morning in preparation to dance all night, and it basically melted into crispy, sugary deliciousness on my tongue.

i am pretty sure the glaze got everywhere in the backseat of my friend's car, and made for funny conversation later as people discussed "what's this dried white stuff all over the backseat of your car?"

anyway. worth it.
author: Rose K.

description: I don't get it. Had an apple fritter that some had said they were amazing. I have had some that are very oily but today it was on the dryer side. Sorry Bob but it's just basic, either oily or not. Now if there was the balance of it being in between and a notch up of apples and cinnamon.... then we are talking
author: A D.

description:
I am only giving 3 stars because although the chocolate old fashioned I got was good, there was not enough chocolate. It was just drizzled on the top-didn't cover the sides!!! The texture of the doughnut really doesn't need chocolate but I want the chocolate! That was the only downfall. Obviously still ate it because it's good.

My friends and I shared the LARGE glazed doughnut that's bigger than my face. That was good. You can definitely feed a group of people with that thing. Get it-why not? Wish they had the chocolate available at the time.

I would go back despite my 3 stars-I would give them a second chance to change my mind...I mean, they're doughnuts...who wouldn't give them another shot right?
author: F T.

description: These donuts were the best.  Fresh, sugary and delicious.  Yum!
author: Deirdre B.

description:
Open 24 hours!!!
Finding parking is difficult in this area, but not so much really late at night.

I seldom buy donuts nowadays, but Bob's is an okay place if u crave donuts. This is a no-frills small shop, a little scruffy. Like most fried foods these donuts are best right after they've been made.

Bob starts to make new batches of donuts every night, starting around 9 or 10pm (this was straight out of the owner's mouth, sometimes he starts at 10pm, sometimes he starts at 9 or 9:30pm - either way, come later). He makes one or 2 trays of each kind, the popular french crullers and apple fritters start at around 1am. So the best time to come is around 2am (only if u have nothing else to do), when all are done, cooled and glazed.

Cash only.
author: Luis C.

description:
Bob, you are my savior.  

My light at the end of the (Broadway) tunnel. 

My lighthouse in the storm. 

My saving grace in these drunk times.

My extra boost of energy when I'm slightly too tipsy to drive and my bf is passed out on the passenger seat next to me. 

My sugary apple fritter at 2am. You and I are going to be creating more memories until the end of time.
author: Janice C.

description: I'm now adding this place to one of my favorite spots in SF and will bring my children here next time I come. Like for sure. Each donut was better than the next but I'd have to say the maple glazed was our favorite.
author: cat s.

description: Super friendly service -- answered all my questions even when I only bought one donut! The apple fritter was tasty with tons of apples.  I can't say too much since I haven't eaten too many apple fritters in my life, but it was tasty! Mine was not warm or fresh out of the fryer, but still delicious and not too oily or sweet.  Also, the giant donuts in the window were eye-catching.  I can't imagine eating one to myself!
author: Tramy V.

description: Yes, yes, yes -- the 5-star reviews are totally accurate -- donuts here are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G..!!   Raised (vs. cake) donuts are light & fluffy, but also with that yummy doughy quality.  Could probably eat a half-dozen they're so good.   Definitely worth the trip.
author: Merrick W.

description:
I love donuts, probably too much, and Bobs doesn't help kick the addiction. I heard about Bobs and after reading some reviews I decided to check it out. It's a little bit of a walk from me, but that's probably a good thing.

First time I went there we grabbed a box, a couple glazed jelly, a couple glazed, a giant crumb donut, a chocolate frosted, a few glazed jellys, the apple fritter, and this donut cake chunk (it had a nicer name but I forget it).

The donuts are to die for. The giant crumb donut was amazing. So soft, and sweet, and tasty. Best thing I have ever had. All of the donuts we had were great, except for the fritter, not my cup of tea. But, the girlfriend likes it, so to each their own. 

The donut cake chunk thing was delicious, and so was the jelly's. We are moving out of the city when our lease is up, and I will miss being close enough to walk to Bob's. 

Damn you Bob.. Now I am a slave to your delicious pastries..
author: Justin W.

description: Hooray for old school donuts! Just a tad over-fried for my taste, but so, so good. And also...the GIANT donut?! Come on, guys. So awesome!
author: Elicia R.

description:
Yeah, really good donuts, got the apple fritter. That thing was amazing.

I only gave it four stars because I don't know what a 5 star donut would be.
author: eric c.

description: CAUTION! Rob the zombie works here! If you ask him to repeat anything you get the look of death. I got it and ran all the way back to my hotel and spent the night awake clutching a broom for protection. Other than the frightening employee the doughnuts were good.
author: Alex B.

description: I've visited this location based on reviews. I was not too impressed, the selection of donuts was very different than your usual flavors. They definitely were not fresh as described. I went first thing in the morning before an early flight. Was not much to brag about but was not bad, if you're in the mood for a doughnut this will do.
author: Samantha A.

description:
So I really am not a huge donut fan, and so I'm really the last resort anyone should ask about donuts.  But I have heard about this place, just because the apple fritter is on the 7x7 list.

The apple fritter was okay.  Liked that it had pieces of apple, but it wasn't even warm.  The maple old fashion on the other hand was great , but not as good at top pot donut in seattle (which had a stronger maple flavor).

Props for being open 24 hours!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Nothing is as delicious as a hot, fresh, fried doughnut!  Arrived at 11pm and the young doughnuteers were fresh frying right behind the kitschy counter where we sat and enjoyed ta, hot doughnuts and Alien on the TV.  Friendly, old school SF crowd and service.  Eat whatever is hot and fresh - you won't be disappointed.  This is how a doughnut should be.
author: T L.

description: This rating is only for taste only. (And when it's not warm out of the fryer) I went in thinking I would taste the best donut of my life due to the amount of positive reviews on Yelp. 3pm on the weekend you wouldn't see warm donuts coming out of fryers that yelpers rave about. What I got was overly sweet, overly greasy, overly soggy pieces of donuts. The service is friendly and fast. Taste - Not worth making a trip for it.
author: mona k.

description:
A review years in the making...

Clearly Bob's doesn't need another review, but I'm gonna give them one anyway.

Bob's just gets me excited...from the smell of fresh sweets being baked as I walk in,  to the appealing mounds of donuts in the window display,  I can't help but smile every time I know I'm going to pay a visit.  

Plain and simple, the Apple Fritters are a must here at Bob's. Enough said. 

I also enjoy the Break Pudding which is moist, flavored with subtle hints of cinnamon and maple, sugary glazed with perfectly cooked apples on top.  

I would however, skip on the Sticky Bun that's topped with caramelized walnuts. The bread was just too dry.  The Lemon Coconut Bar is also a hit or miss...Sweet and tangy, but sometimes too sticky, and sticks to my teeth too much. Hehe.  Love the coconut shavings to top off though. 

Simple review, for simple satisfactions.
author: Cass J.

description:
Open 24-7 and churning out their precious cargo of apple fritters right around 2 am nightly, this is one delicious shop!  And there's something nice about being able to watch them make the donuts right in front of you...it's very....honest.

This is also a great place for crowd-watching, as waves of everyone from drunken hipsters exiting the plethora of nearby trendy bars to brooding middle-aged loners seeking respite from their insomnia flow through here.  Cramped, unpretentious, and very reasonably priced, it's nice to find a lit, open storefront in the middle of the murky San Francisco night.  The staff is friendly, too...a donut tastes that much better when it's served with a smile, a please, and a thank you.

Where's the 5th star?  No bathroom.  Hmmm.  Where do I go when that coffee I slurped down with my donut runs through me?

Alas, home.
author: Amy L.

description:
It is exactly what it is! I convenient, 24-hour donut shop that not only makes great donuts, but huge donuts, too.

We came for the big-a** donut, 'cause that I mean c'mon. It's a big-a** donut. It was cakier than normal donut, but what do you expect when you need tons of dough for a donut of that proportion.

Alright in my book.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
Why can't I give more than five stars?

They may not be the greatest donuts in the world (they should be in the conversation though), but they're hands down the best I've ever had.  We stopped in on a whim as we were walking past, and five minutes later (and two more trips to the register), we had to re-evaluate what a donut could be.

I've become a disciple of the Church of Bob.
author: Will M.

description:
Hi, um, did you know there are donuts that are so big, you can sling it around your middle and hop into a pool with it as a floaty? Because they fcking exist and they are HERE.

This massive donut takes up an entire cake pastry box, is smothered in chocolate, and is the dizziest, doughiest fever dream of donut lovers everywhere. I came here for my friends birthday and between three of us, we couldn't finish it. So unless you want to take home massive hunks of donut (which let's be real, would be more of an honor than a punishment), eat it with at least four people.

Their chocolate sauce is amazing, and when we came late at night, their donuts were still warm (mmm). Some guy asked for a cup of chocolate sauce and they let him have it, so if you're a fan, I'm pretty sure you can buy some of the sauce to smother over your breakfast pancakes or all over your body to marinate in the awesomeness.

I didn't try any of their other donuts, but I can't imagine they would be any less delicious than this beautiful, giant, novelty item.
author: Janet W.

description: Found this place while researching SF's best on Pinterest. Hot donuts available 24/7? Yes, please! Stopped here around 9pm on a weeknight, while it was raining, and there was a line out the door. It had to be good! The inside was really not what I expected - I pictured a cute little bakery or even just something like Dunkin Donuts. Upon arrival, I saw lots of donuts stored in the window... They didn't have anything in cases whatsoever. My OCD self was freaking out a little bit about that. I still had to try. Got a cinnamon sugar donut. Pretty good, but not the best in the world.
author: Heather J.

description:
Oh Bob, you're so naughty. Open 24 hours a day. You are just too easy! Stroll on in during anytime of the day/night and you'll find a good selection of donuts to choose from. 

Although I finish my box of 6 practically in one night, I didn't think the donuts lived up to the many 5-stars raving. I actually found the beloved apple fritter overtly fried-tasting and uber sweet. I wanted to love it so badly too! 

PROS:
- LARGE donuts. I might have used a fork and knife to eat them.
- Open 24hrs a day!
- Special BIG donut...bigger than the size of your head. Who wouldn't love this?!

CONS:
- Difficult to find street parking on Polk. Not Bob's fault tho.

NOTE for next visit: the fresh donuts start coming out around 11pm at night!
author: Mindy C.

description:
This place is awesome... Where do I start?!? One, they are open 24 hours...two, they are constantly making doughnuts! This means you can always get something that's super fresh and literally got out of the fryer! And third, the staff always has a smile and can make recommendations for any flavor! 

Another thing I find great about Bob's is there is a doughnut that is honestly as big as your head! In fact, if you can successfully eat the whole thing in under 3 minutes...you get your name on a very short list...plus some other great bragging rights! 

Some of my favorite treats from here are: ham & cheese croissants, chocolate glazed cake doughnut and the eclair!
author: Honey F.

description:
The allure of hot donuts right out of the fryer is enough to get any red blooded American males heart racing. Fresh, golden, and deliciously dripping in a glaze or icing of your choice that just won't stop running because of the hot pastry goodness beneath it is a sight to behold! At Bob's you've got two chances to witness this, 9:30 and midnight, but what I really want to see is when they make their GIANT DONUTS! These babies are bigger than a hubcap and must weigh a ton! On my recent visit I walked in to find a skinny young guy trying to make his way through this mammoth monstrosity... ON HIS OWN! It was larger than his head and required two hands and every bit of arm strength he had to hold it up. Bob's has a challenge surrounding this legendary creation, but based on the sign on the wall, not too many brave souls had succeeded. I was impressed by this guy's determination, so I captured it in a photo you can find on the Yelp page, but one look at it and I knew there was no way I could take it on! 

I settled on one of the glazed cake donuts that had just come from the fryer. It was warm, crunchy on the outside, moist and soft on the inside, just the way a good cake donut should be. The glaze gifted this donut with the sweetness that satisfies only the most ferocious sweet tooth. For me, it was too sweet, and after just a few bites, I handed it off to a friend to be finished.

This place is a local legend, and I had hoped to learn about it from the very staff that takes the time to make Bob's Donuts daily. So with a sugar high like no other, I asked the guy behind the counter "Who's Bob?". The reply, "No one". Well he must've been someone, so I prodded on trying to get the story of Bob. All I could get was that he was a guy who opened this shop in the 1940's. This was a very sad version of what I'm sure is a colorful tale about a very caring and passionate individual. So what's the lesson? This is not a place you come to at 10PM for customer service.  :(  Maybe on my next visit I'll learn the lore!
author: Michael T.

description:
Went here with a girlfriend while visiting SF for business. These were the best donut's I've ever eaten, hands down. The glazed was light and airy with just enough sweetness without feeling as though you were eating a circle of sugar. The apple fritter - which I wasn't aware was the popular item, it just looked amazing on the racks, fresh from the oven, was a dessert masterpiece. It was fantastic the day of, and just as delicious the next day. 

We arrived around 7:30pm on a Friday night - no line, plenty of options and attentive service at the counter, but we took a bag to go. Also, we got 6 glazed donuts, a fritter and another cinnamon-sugar creation that was amazing for $8. That's the cost of two donuts in NYC, so I was sold.
author: Samantha E.

description: Soooooo good! Not much to look at, but don't let that fool you cuz the donuts are the best!!!!!
author: jasmine w.

description: Lived in the neighborhood for 30 years before relocating due to job issues. Was a Bob's fan for years. Since it's been "discovered," I'm sorry to report that on my first trip back in years, the donuts are about HALF the size. Seriously these are the smallest donuts I've ever seen at a donut shop. Still fresh and delicious, but can't go over 2 stars because they are so, so small. Why skimp on the size when you have people lining up to pay $1 a donut?
author: Nitram N.

description: You know a donut shop is good when there are people lined up at 9:00pm. They have a huge selection. My daughter loved the cream filled with chocolate frosting. The maple bar disappeared from the bag before I even got a chance to eat it. The kids don't even like glazed donuts and those somehow mysteriously disappeared! Their donuts are fresh and you can tell that they are careful to only use top quality ingredients. Service was great. Someone in the back noticed the growing line & came up to the counter to help. I wonder what would happen if they filled a donut with sprinkles & topped it with custard?
author: Jenn N.

description:
When you can polish off half a dozen donuts, a ham & cheese croissant, and a pint of chocolate milk (and all after you've been out drinking), you don't know whether to pat yourself on the back or berate yourself for poor life decisions.

I came here with a couple of random dudes (how I get myself into these random situations, I do not know) and demanded bacon. What I got was even better: ham and cheese expertly folded into buttery and flaky croissants. Do yourself a favor and order five of these.

And don't bother choosing donuts based on flavor. Instead, ask for what just came out of the oven. THIS IS KEY! When I picked at all 12 donuts, the best were the warm ones---it didn't even matter what flavor they were.

I asked the guy behind the counter if he was Bob. He said yes. And then when one of my companions asked him about the shop, the counter guy scoffed and said, do I look like Bob? I know I had been drinking, but I'm pretty sure I was sober enough to be confused...
author: J J.

description:
I love Bob's!  Whenever I'm in the area, I always make sure to stop by to pick up a donut or two.  This donut shop isn't fancy.  In fact, it's a little outdated, but their donuts are amazing.    

Within reason, I feel like Bob's has gotten more popular over the years.  Especially since they've advertised on Groupon.  Their donuts are always freshly made and you can always count on your sweet tooth/donut cravings being satisfied.  One of my favorite donuts to buy is something called the pan dowdy?  It's basically a slab of soft, warm, apple filled bread pudding like thingy.  It's not a donut and it's not the shape of a donut.  It's basically a slice of what is similar to bread pudding.  Try it!  You'll love it.  Don't let a small slice of this fool you.  A small slice of this is pretty heavy.  I've also tried their standard glazed donuts, chocolate donuts, apple fritters, and french donuts.  All of them being really good.  The one thing I've always wanted to try is the extra large donuts they have.  I've always thought that this would be pretty fun to get and to take pictures with just because it's pretty ridiculous in an awesome kind of way.  

Bob's is conveniently open 24 hours and only accept cash so make sure you have some when you visit.
author: Christine D.

description: Great donut shop bc its. Always fresh the donuts are about  $1 per donut but well worth it. They dont reuse over night and the staff is knowledgable and makes this donut hole that is to die for. I highly recommend  it and they  are open late
author: Nan P.

description: Delicious, and very fresh. Definitely worth the hype. Make a trip, you won't be disappointed!
author: Therese M.

description:
This was the only place during my 4 days in San Francisco that I went to twice. Twice! Nice, comfortable people; nice, plain jane comforting seating. Mostly local patronage, unlike the Swan Oyster. But most importantly - excellent donuts! And it just blew the roof off the top of my yelp scale to hear that they are open 24 hours a day! How awesome would a 3am, fresh donut excursion to go here be??

One SFer I talked to remarked how there are no Dunkin Donuts there and they were actually looking forward to one eventually coming. I just couldn't believe it. San Francisco - I love your commitment to keeping the chains out, please stay true to the donut.
author: Jeff O.

description:
Finally in the Nob Hill neighborhood, there was no chance I'd pass up on trying this place of SF renown.. Showing up in the afternoon to a little joint reminiscent of a 60s (or is it 80s?) coffee shop, my options were already a little limited (I didn't see any raised chocolates left), but I ended up nabbing an apple fritter and a crumb doughnut.

Impressions? Good, but not mind-blowing (Pro Tip: toss the doughnuts into a toaster oven for a few minutes at 200F, including the preheating phase). The crumb doughnut was easily the star of the two, for both flavor and texture (crispy on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside), while the apple fritter was a bit too dry and doughy. I do like the fact that both of these doughnuts, especially the fritter, were not as overly sweet as many a doughnut shop will make them, but I did feel like the fritter was a bit lacking in flavor (not sugar mind you, but flavor).

Total came out to $2.60, cash only, though I don't know the breakdown of the prices - which, I hear, supposedly fluctuate depending on who's working the register. Also, the germaphobe in me was a little irked that the elderly Asian woman grabbed my fritter with her bare hands, especially after handling money from customers. Speaking of which, can someone explain to me why Bob is an elderly Asian lady?
author: Johnny W.

description:
Most definitely the greatest donuts I have ever ate! We got the chocolate bar, apple fritter and plain ring glazed donut!!! All of them were so fresh, warm and deliciously more-ish!!! 
The price is so good and the staff are super friendly!!! This is a must visit donut shop whilst in San Fran!!! Dunkin who? It's all about Bob's!!!
author: Ailbhe B.

description: We loved the donuts! The price is great, it's so fast and opened all the time!!! Really nice!!!
author: Samantha B.

description:
THIS PLACE IS FRIGGIN AMAZING. I don't know how else to convey this.

I've never had donuts this fresh in my life.  Unlike most donut places who make their donuts at 6:00am, this place makes them all night long (and maybe all day, not sure since I've only been there at night).  The best strategy is to just walk in after dinner and ask them what's hot and fresh, or point to what they are literally taking out of the fryer and glazing right behind the counter. 

To be fair, these are just classic donuts.  Nothing gourmet here like Dynamo Donuts, or Donut Plant in NYC.  If you're not eating them when they're freshly made, they're just regular old donuts.
author: Amy M.

description:
First let me say Bob's is a San Francisco Institution and makes the best donuts and pastry anywhere.

I only gave it 2 stars because like many long time locals I have had it with Sonia the very long time server who tends to Bob's most days other than Sunday.

The food is great but you will find Sonia bad mouths everyone and is constantly griping about serving anyone anytime under her breath if the boss is not around.  When the boss is there she is charming and respectful otherwise she is a shrew and a half to deal with.

Sonia has been at Bob's for something approaching 30 years and has turned into a sourpuss over it.  It might help if the current owner gave her meal breaks off instead of requiring her to work through her meals.  Anytime Sonia tries to grab a bite people come in and interrupt her meal which would make me grouchy too.  Still this is no excuse for hassling her customers.  

I recently met several long time locals at other places on Polk Street and asked them why they were not at Bob's?  In both cases they told me they were sick of Sonia gossiping and making negative comments about everyone.  It gets worse when Sonia's boyfriend hangs in the store with her...

If you can stand Sonia's bad attitude or don't go in that often maybe it is OK, otherwise there are several other places nearby who have kindness toward the customer rather than hassling them you will enjoy.
author: Dalt W.

description: This is my go to spot for breakfast on those days you wake up and feel like you need to treat yo self. The apple fritter is very good as I believe it is known for - but pretty much every donut is a freshly made sugary and warm piece of perfection. I usually grab coffee elsewhere to go with it. I try to limit myself to 1 visit a month but it can be hard to resist!
author: Derek S.

description: I can see why this has rave reviews!  They've gained a new fan in me!  I found the donuts delicious, including the apple fritters.  I think they are on par with Krispy Kreme, if not better.  The regular ones were on the smaller side but that is fine, and they weren't dry at all even though I got them in the evening.  My coworkers liked them too.  It'll win you friends in the office if you bring some.
author: a f.

description:
Sadly, Bob's goes on the list of places that we can't understand why people wait in line for. 

After a night out drinking, we came to Bob's to try his famed apple fritters and other goodies. At 1:30am on weekend night, we were amazed to see a line out the door- one that took us 30 minutes to finally order. The apple fritter was surprisingly on the dense side (think store bought Entenmann's) with just a few pieces of apple bits and didn't taste particularly fresh. We also had a jam+custard danish that also was average. Perhaps we should have gone with the donuts? (They were certainly being freshly made). Overall, a disappointing venture for baked goods although at least it was cheap (only $3.50 for both our items)!
author: Amy D.

description: Donuts were extremely fresh but something seemed to be missing. We had glazed, chocolate glazed, and maple glazed. I'd say they were ranked in that order from good to just ok. Would give them another try in case they were off their game when I tried them.
author: Bobby C.

description: Don't now what the fuss is about. It's great that they open late and the donuts are cheap. Otherwise the quality is very mediocre, perhaps only a tad better than what you can find in a box in a grocery store. I got the most popular donut, the crumb cake, and it was not good. Would not return but if I do, I would get something hot.
author: Michael P.

description: My favorite donut shop!!! They make fresh donuts throughout the day and are opened 24 hrs. Having a fresh, warm, sweet donut at 2 in the morning is a great feeling. My fav. item are their apple fritters. I've tried apple fritters from many other places but nothing can compare.
author: SanDee W.

description:
Very small shop with only few pastry options but the original glazed is amazing ..  I ate it few hours later since I had just finished lunch and it was stool very soft and fresh .. wasn't too sweet which is how I like it .. the older lady working the counter was really sweet and patient with my questions .. 

I went at 11 am and there wasn't a line which was nice .. but maybe that's why the selection was limited .. everything may have sold out .. Idk . I would def recommend stopping by .. especially with prices being very reasonable :)
author: Jessy W.

description:
OMG! Their giant donut. OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
 I read the reviews and I knew I had to try it.  
First off, the lady that helped us what cute and comical. All the donuts they had seemed pretty good but I had my eyes on the giant chocolate donut. Once we got it, omg. It was soft and crunch and pretty doughy. The chocolate glaze was the best chocolate glaze I've ever had. It was rich and chocolatey. It was so good. I'm kind of bummed we weren't able to finish it because it was a pretty big donut. But it was worth every bite. 
SO DARN GOOD.
Hands down my favorite donut spot in Norcal and Socal.
author: Raquel C.

description: Good donuts ..Not sure what to add. Parking on street can be a pain. Kids loved the donuts the got..
author: Manoj N.

description: Very delicious. Fresh and warm. The glazed raised  donuts were the best! The lines move pretty fast which is defiantly a plus!
author: Elmira Z.

description:
So it's taken me months to decide what my 400th Yelp Review is going to be.  I of course wanted it to be something special and something that I love and then realized that I haven't written a review on Bob's Donuts!

I could basically live here...actually I may have. The donuts here are so simple yet that's what makes them so special.  If you're really special, maybe someone will get you a giant donut...which could be the next best thing, unless its paired with Bi-RIte ice cream...now that would be truly amazing.

The standouts here are the original glazed donut, the crumb donut and the apple fritters.  You can't go wrong with any of them and you should probably get 4 each because donuts are meant to come in a dozen.  Grab some chocolate milk...obviously for protein and you got yourself a complete meal.

If you are in love with donuts, then you absolutely must stop by here.  Did I mention they are open 24 hours as well?  Yeah...I know.

Extra Tip - Their t-shirts make excellent workout wear.  The t-shirt also gives you a 99% chance that I will probably ask you out on a date as well.
author: Joel C.

description: Came here to try their giant donut.  And, oh boy, it didn't disappoint.  You would think with such a massive donut it would somehow be too dry or oily or whatever.  It was not!  We got the last chocolate donut and it was delicious!  Nice and fluffy.  Mmm :)  It's definitely big enough to share.  The bf and I could only eat half since we were on a food adventure that day but I could've eaten the whole thing (jk, I would've tried...).  Only downside, no free coffee refills :(
author: Stephanie T.

description:
DELICIOUS DONUTS 24 HOURS? SOLD!!
Came by this place after stuffing ourselves at Craw Station. 
I've never seen a donut shop with their display right in front of you on the sidewalk in the glass case flaunting all their choices. It definitely lures you in. If I were just walking by the shop, I would most likely go in and grab me a few just because of their huge display. 

I can see how parking can be difficult because it's all street parking, but we were lucky to get a spot almost right in front on a Thursday night around 11:30. 
There were already a few customers when we got there, and most of the seats were taken, so we took the donuts up to Twin Peaks and ate them there.

When we got to the cash register, it was kind of hard to order if you don't already know what you want and what the donuts are, because there's no labels on any of them.. I'm not huge donut person, so I felt like a noob when I couldn't tell which donuts were which...and the difference between a raised donut or a caked donut? or something like that.. I didn't want to bother the cashier by asking her which is which, so I ended up getting an apple fritter and my friends got some chocolate one, a cinnamon bun, a powdered one, and 2 others that I can't remember.

But my apple fritter was SO GOOD!!! It's probably my go-to donut when I can't decide what else to get. The dough was so fresh and soft and fluffy, but the outside was still kinda crisp from the frying and the cooled glaze. ahhhh just thinking about it right now makes my mouth water! I don't know how often they make their donuts, but mine was definitely not more than an hour old I think. Old donuts seem to have that stale-ish inside where you can tell that the bread has been sitting there for a while cause its stiffer towards the center. These were so soft throughout the entire donut. 

I would definitely come back here if I come back to SF in the future!
author: Kimmy U.

description: I'm sorry, but I think their original glazed donuts are totally overrated! I don't get the hype...
author: McKelle H.

description: This place is AMAZING! The doughnuts are so fresh with the perfect amount of crisp! The gentleman working was super friendly too!
author: Lauren W.

description: I took my players here for breakfast on our drive back to sd... So glad we went, there was lots of variety, very friendly, would definitely come back! Only reason they got 4 instead of 5 is because they only had filled or cake chocolate donuts, and I wanted a plain. Lol otherwise great!
author: Andrea A.

description: Wasn't expecting fresh donuts being made so late at night but you can find them at Bob's! When we got there they had just pulled out a fresh batch of the Apple fritters and wow it was goood! Apple fritters can be super sweet sometimes but this one was just right and was so delicious when it was a little warm -- definitely a must try when you come here. Even though there was a line forming out the door,  the lady at the register was sweet and helped my friend and I with our selections. We also tried a glazed donut. The donut dough was fluffier (not sure how else to describe it) than a usual donut and I quite enjoyed the difference.  I'd say if you have to pick just one thing,  get the apple fritter. It's a pretty big one too and you can't go wrong!
author: Renu A.

description:
OMG
So addicting. They have the biggest donut have ever seen. These are fresh. A line out the door on weekend nights formed by the drunk people after the clubs and a night of drinking. A touristy location. Try anything with apple in it
author: Roman J.

description:
I have been seriously sugar-smitten... blame it on Bob.

That fluffy, soft, perfect crumb raised donut... man, you've got to get your mouth on some of dat....

However, the apple fritter sold to me was a bit dried out and not the super yumO that it's highly touted to be. Why sell me a stale donut when I already told  you, fellow Asian lady, that I have bookmarked Bob's for 2 years, and finally have had a chance to be in Polk Gulch?!

Lastly tried: the apple bread pudding... it has a crust on that thing! Too jellied-up for my tastes...certain bites were perfect on the square, and others made me down hot tea faster than a speeding bullet. 

I'd stick to the raised and forego the fancies. a 24 hour donut shop in the heart of SF!
author: Jana C.

description:
Anyone interested in bringing a cake to a pot-luck, is an IDIOT...

...bring a giant DONUT instead! (see photo)

XOXO
author: Diane N.

description: Seriously though, I can't stress enough how awesome this place is. Fresh donuts around the clock, what more could I ask for? Easily one of the best glazed donuts and fritters in the nation, if you have any possible contenders then please do let me know!
author: Christian R.

description:
I don't get it.  We went in the early afternoon and there was barely anything to choose from.  It didn't look clean and the old Asian lady behind the counter was more concerned with the homeless people out front verses helping us.

When I think cool donut shop, I don't think this place.  I think of a cool spot like Voo Doo Donuts.  Sorry Bob.....if that is your real name....
author: Brian S.

description: My fiancé brought home a box of donuts last night. It was my first time to have ever heard of this place. It was hands down THE BEST glazed donut I've ever had! It was so soft and delicious! It is definitely addictive.
author: Tanisha K.

description: I tried Bob's for the first time last weekend and can't stop thinking about their donuts. So fresh, so warm, so soft, so tasty. You won't regret it.
author: Sally S.

description: Following a friend's suggestion and 2 bus rides, we finally arrived at the most quintessential doughnut shop in the city.  The doughnuts were fantastic and the owner is super kind.  I will be back each time I am in town!
author: Andrea B.

description: Apple fritter not worth the hype, tastes like crunchy apple pie, typical American donut shop.
author: Henry C.

description:
I'm drooling a little thinking about Bob's donuts.

Everyone we've taken to Bob's loves the old-fashioned donuts there. I happen to enjoy the french crullers (regular, cinnamon and maple-glazed).  If there's a donut you love, ask. Not all of the donuts are visible from where you order.  I want to like the regular glazed, a standby at other shops, but it's just not great at Bobs.

 I'd note that the timing of your visit is important.  While it's open long hours, fresh donuts don't seem to be cooked 24/7, which makes sense.  Late afternoon in particular seems like a bad time to go.
author: Amy L.

description: Terrible! WHY do you think this is good? Gross and dirty, bits of donut everywhere. Dirty looking guy using bare hands to make gross looking donuts. Looks nothing like the fake pictures. Sick!
author: M M.

description: Individual donuts were awesome, but i ordered their HUGE donut for a friend for her birthday...half of it was uncooked!
author: Tim T.

description: Late night stop after Buena Vista.. And they are making fresh donuts as we speak! Yummy!!!!!
author: Therese W.

description:
Saturday night food adventure with my friend and he suggested we try this place out. 

We arrived around 11:30PM and  the line wasn't as long as we thought it would be. 

**HEADS UP: Finding parking is pretty difficult, so be ready to walk a couple blocks**

We ordered the big glazed donut and received complimentary donut holes & OMG, DE-LI-CIOUS! The donut holes and glazed donut tasted amazing and definitely mouth watering. The donuts were soft, warm, fresh, crispy, and fluffy. Fresh donut goodness! Definitely plan on coming back if I ever crave donuts. 

If you want to find a donut heaven in the city, this is the place!
author: Hazel L.

description:
Open 24 hours? CHECK!
Fresh? CHECK!
Great after literally driving all over the city? CHECK!

A group of us passed by this place while on our way to dinner, and knew that we were going here right after we finished. 

There was a line out the door, but with good company, that's never a problem. Looked up what they were known for here on Yelp, and had my mind set on their Apple Fritter. My opinion? Go with just their simple glazed donut, everyone else got that and I was the only one thinking "Ehh..." Hence, my three star, A-OK rating. We'll see how I feel once I get just the glazed donut!
author: Sammie T.

description:
$7 for the biggest donut you've seen in your life or at least a long while. While in line I learned that the record for consuming one of these big boys (equivalent to an estimated half dozen donuts in one) is about 1 minute and 45 seconds. The prize for such a feat? Free indigestion and pride?

Each bite expanded once inside the confines of your mouth. Warm, moist, expansive- ideal for sharing with a few people in between bar-hopping.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Went here to take on the Monster donut challenge. Let's just say I got owned. I had 1/3 of the donut left when I was done.  I didn't want to try any other donuts afterwards.  2 of my friend were able to complete it. And everyone that came with said the pastries here are well worth it.

Must try? YES! Open 24 hours. Sometimes lines out the door
Try again? Yes.
author: Thomas N.

description: Old school flare with great attention to quality donuts! The service was so great today with a big smile! I like the maple glaze raise donut buy the cake donuts are always to die for! The apple fritter is also crazy good!
author: Brent T.

description: Love their freshly cook donut hole. I dont care if its 3am and itll take 30 mins to get here. I will drive to go here and get my damn donut hole lol. I would kill 30 pieces of donut hole in one sitting hahaha. Thats how much i love their donut.
author: Kristine L.

description: Best creme filled donut I've ever had! Also the coffee cake looking thing is just the most delicious thing I've ever laid eyes on. Going back soon  for the giant donut challenge.
author: Taylor C.

description:
Our friends brought over some for us and it was so good especially the cinnamon sugar soft doughnut.

 Hmmmmm...
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Nice staff :)
My sister and I went to get donuts for the first time here. We saw the apple fritter is the best seller. So, we got that and a glazed donut. The apple fritter is not crispy and the middle seems not cooked. Don't think I will get that again.
author: Ervi L.

description:
I wanted to give you more stars, but I probably went in at a wrong time so all I got from this place was a cold, stale GIANT donut.  Sad, wasnt it?!  

I first found Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop from "GOOGLE OFFERS" but i thought my boyfriend and I prolly wouldn't have time to stop by this place while we were on a 5-Day trip to San Francisco/ Oakland, so I decided NOT to buy the offer!! GrRrrrRrrRrawh~  Anyways, friends and I went to Bob's for late night (about 11:45 PM maybe) and the store was widely empty with a few customers probably because it was on a week day (night).  We ordered a "Giant Glazed Donut" to share.  Yes, a Giant! It  was really big (8" diameter) and seriously the biggest donut that i had ever seen in real life!  Cute!!  We cut it up into 8-10 slices and everyone took a slice!  The friends said it was good but both my boyfriend and I thought it was bland, and cold, and no more than JUST A-OKAY!  It would have been a lot better if it was served fresh and hot (or at least warm!) and glazed more generously!  I like donuts and pastries with lots of glazing/ frosting or whatever that makes life sweeter!!

We saw some donut cakes coming out fresh from the fryer so we bought three of 'em to share among the five of us.  YESH! Those were very good and delicious because they were fresh and hot and sweet!

FYI:  
1) Cash only
2) Open 24 hours a day, which is really cool!! 
3) No decaffeinated coffee (while i was there) so you better watch out and get a carton of milk or a bottle of fruit juice if you are going in for late night but looking forward to going to bed afterward.... 

Since Bob's Donuts' been around for so many years, everything inside this super duper uber old-school shop feels like Antique!  Fascinating, isnt it!!  i love the decors!
author: Ada L.

description:
Did I really just buy a 10 inch chocolate glazed donut from here? 

Someone please make sure I don't do that again...EVER!  

Thanks Bob.  Good stuff, just not good for me.  Nothing personal, you're just too good for me.
author: Maria S.

description:
If there's any stereotypical American food I can't stand, it's the donut. Laced in processed layers of sugar, infused with globs of fat, and so uncomfortably dry and mushy at the same time that it leaves the most unpleasant feeling in your mouth. Bob's enlightened me to a new world of possibilities where a donut can actually taste amazing.

If you come on a Saturday night, prepare to wait in line. Along with burritos, donuts are some of the most sought after drunchies. If Bob's opens a location in the Mission, that combination is very well possible. 

- Raspberry Jelly Filled Donut: I grew up eating sufganiyot, the Jewish version of a jelly donut. Bob's is hands down the best I have ever had. The dough is so delicately fluffy and mild. The jelly just oozes out in perfection. It's not too sweet and is the ultimate combination of rich raspberry flavor and blissfully fried dough.

- LARGE DONUT: To this day, I still can't fathom how they pull off making these. Who would be crazy enough to buy one? Apparently we were, to the point where we ended up getting two. The dough is cloud-like, gently melting in your mouth. The hype of M&Ms or 50 Cent melting in your mouth doesn't even come close (no homo). The flavor is all in the topping, which blends wonderfully with the rest of the donut. 

My friend who initiated the excursion here ended up leaving the 2nd donut at our afterparty spot. The next morning, her first text wasn't "Hey are you hungover?" or "Hope you got home safe." It was "Where is my donut? -___-" That just proves what kind of addiction Bob's can trigger. 

The comparison to your average Dunkin Donuts and Krispy Kreme is simply heaven and Earth.
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
#78 on the 2011 7x7 List: Apple Fritter
#80 on the 2009 7x7 List: Apple Fritter

-Tasty?  Yes - imagine an apple pie and a donut having children.  These tastes like that. 

-Service:  Very prompt.  You stand in line, you pick out your pastries, you pay and you walk out!

-Ambiance:  Old school bakery with limited seating (check out pics)

-Worth the trip/try?  After a night of drinking or a quick breakfast?  Yes.  Coming all the way to cross off an item on the 7x7 list?  Then share one fritter with the three friends accompanying you - it's big enough.
author: Winnie L.

description:
What can I say? Best donut in all of America. Hands down. No lies. Open 24/7. 

It's so fun watching them make donuts I've considered getting into the donut biz. But then I'd have to compete against Bob's and I'd be out of business right quick. 

Greene out.
author: Doron G.

description:
This place has a very big rep.

My friend recommend this place to me since I'm always in sf at night. I didn't really know what to get and at the windows there wernt much. 

My first impression:
It's a tiny donut shop that reminds me of the old days. Few tables. A bar counter. Since I was here late, it was kinda creepy looking. 

What I loved about this place was the donuts were pretty tasty. I didn't know that this place was known for their gigantic donut! If I had known I would have gotten one.  Should have yelped it first. 

What I also find interesting was the shop right across the street. You'll see what I mean when you get there. (: 

Once I'm able to go again, I'm sure my review will change from 3/5 to 5/5
author: Melanie L.

description:
On the seventh day when God was resting, Satan created the donut. He passed the recipe on to Bob. Bob makes delicious donuts. Satan is jealous. God is fat, feeding off donuts divine. 

This is the cool donut shop in the cool part of town. So it has that working against it. But c'mon, the donuts are delicious! What more do you want? 

Tell the mob of drunk three year-olds yelling and barfing in the streets to get a grip and then get a freaking donut. 

Replace soul with donuts. 

Get drunk off donuts. Get fat and miserable and hate your life while stuffing your face with delightful donuts.
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description: Go here if you're in SF. There was a line when I went which I was super surprised by because its a freaken donut shoppe. Its a lovely place to grab donuts, and apple fritters. If you eat the entire huge glaze they have you can have it for free. We didn't get to finish it. So I did not get it for free. I enjoyed this place and would go back.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Purrrr-fection!! Freshly out the oven my nose led me to Bobs! They are irresistible.. Freshly baked, these donuts are ooey gooey goodness!! The glazed donut is the way to go and don't forget to get some milk to help wash down the goodness!!! Bobs donuts puts all other donuts to shame!
author: Adrianna P.

description:
I mean...it's Bob's................

Get 'em fresh (10:30pm till 3isham?) and grab a milk ( they are so nice and chilled! ) . You will walk out of there with a smile :)

Every single staff person here is friendly and cordial...EVEN when dealing with highly inebriated folks that can't decide between a maple old fashion WITH sprinkles or without -_-


Love Bob's!!
author: Selina W.

description: This place is so cozy! Definitely a hole in the wall! Great prices and the owner was super friendly:) she gave my friend an extra donut
author: Celia A.

description:
Contrary to other yelpers I actually think the apple fritter is not the star at bob's. It's VERY sweet, almost cloying. 
 
I'm a lover of the classic glazed and also the crullers. Both are so moist, perfectly sweet and always fresh tasting. Boyfriend and I usually polish off 3-4 when we go. The staff are so nice too and I love watching them make things the old fashioned way. No donut track here. Being open 24 hrs is a blessing and a curse when you live within walking distance..
author: Emily H.

description: Best yeast doughnuts !!!!! Omg so amazing chewy doughy goodness !!! Went in line around 2 am and they had yeast made! Don't just buy one because you'll want 4 more after your first bite!! Soooooo frickin amazing!!! I got the glazed ... Goodness
author: Brianna L.

description:
I was craving donuts the other day and found this place with 4.5 stars 1000+ reviews. I got the apple fritters and while the first bite seemed a bit dry, the middle part with the apples was so tasty! I wish I lived closer! On another note, maybe it's better I don't live so close.

Tip: Opened 24/7 & Cash only
author: Christine C.

description: I recently read a click bait article about the best Donut sod in the country.  Bob's was not on the list.  I got angry, like "Hulk Smash" angry.  If you ever had a Bob's Apple Fritter you would agree with me.  Best donut shop.
author: Floyd F.

description:
Come late, at donut-o-clock, when the freshly fried sugary goodness is peaking. Dodge a hooker, laugh at the drunken youth, and bask in the deliciousness that is a Bob's donut.
Before this I had never had a glazed old-fashioned that was so fresh as to still be crispy. It's divine.
author: Genevieve S.

description: Lucky for me, my friend who is a local introduced me to Bob's Donuts.  I am not a huge donut fan but I must admit that the donuts are excellent and usually extremely fresh.  At my friends prompting, we ordered the large glazed donut with chocolate frosting.  When I say large, I mean about the size of a tire on a Smart Car (ok, a little smaller but definitely big enough to serve four people or more).  I thought the novelty of the big donut would be just that, but it was delicious.  Service was friendly and I thought the donut was very reasonable priced.  I think it was about $4.
author: Courtney K.

description: If you haven't noticed, San Franciscans don't wait in line for anything... except for these donuts. People actually stare at you in amazement that there is a line at all. This place is great & charming.
author: Shana A.

description:
Happy belated Donut Day! That was the glorious day that the bf and I tried Bob's Donut's for the very first time. And what an experience it was. A delicious one.

He chose a simple glazed twist while I had the apple fritter (I remembered it being on the 7x7 must-try list). We also added a small milk to balance it all out.

While most people seemed to take theirs to go, we decided to sit up at the bar while we enjoyed our sugar coated eats. MAN were they good. The glazed twist was comparable to a Krispy Kreme glazed (my #1 in the donut world). My apple fritter did not disappoint in the least. Both were delicious and I will definitely add this to the list of go-to places when I have people in town. 

If you have the time, I would recommend eating your donut at the bar, just to have the full experience and see all of the little gems that make this place such a classic.
author: Emily S.

description: Bob's Donuts is definitely the best donut place I've visited in SF, and I've been to a TON of SF donut shops. I've tried the apple fritters, buttermilk, glazed old fashioned (with & without maple), maple bars, and regular glazed donuts.  My favorites were definitely the apple fritters and the buttermilk. Unfortunately, they're often sold out of them, so you might want to place an order ahead of time (also place an order if you want one of their giant donuts). I also really liked the glazed old fashioned, but you should probably avoid it if you don't like overly sweet food.
author: Cici A.

description: Bob's is an old late night favorite. I do wish they would renovate however you just can't fault them for being a small family business.
author: Molly R.

description: I love this place. It reminds me of being back in a local pastry shop at the jersey shore. Locals are chilling with coffee and watching 50s reruns and the lady at the counter is super friendly. Of course the most important part, the donuts, are great. Many flavors and pastries as big as your head. An absolute neighborhood gem.
author: Bennett J.

description: Ever since living for 6 years in NYC I was never impressed by DD, and even less so now that I'm in California. I'm pretty sure that the rating of these bone dry, below average McDonalds of donuts is carried on by recent (emphasis on recent) east coasters who haven't tasted better dough, better sugar, fresh ingredients and just overall better everything. Then again, I'm guessing the same people would vote White Castle ahead of Umami when burgers are on the line, cause they still live in 1994. Yup, and Zabar's  is still the epitome of gourmet stores worldwide. Keep on believin' east coasters.
author: Nickolay T.

description: When you get them fresh, there's not much that can beat bobs P E R I O D . Grab a 2% a dozen donut holes and a chocolate bar....you're set.
author: Alex K.

description:
Lucky I showed up right when they made a fresh batch of donuts. The smell was wonderful and the people were nice. 
I ordered a dozen mixed donuts and the big donut. All except the big donut were soooo delicious. Fresh, warm and perfectly made. I would definitely get donuts there again.
author: Stormtrooper N.

description:
This place is definitely a must when it comes to stops in the Bay Area every time we return!  There's no other place like it when it comes to donuts.  The best donuts come out at about 10:45pm.  My go-tos are the eclairs and the buttermilk donuts with either chocolate or maple frosting on top.  My mouth waters just thinking about them!!

The staff are great too.  The young lady working the register popped out an eclair once after finding out we lived four hours away!

As a pretty health-conscious person who typically does not eat late and watches the carb and sugar intake, I can't help but make an exception for these donuts because they're that amazing!
author: Jeannie C.

description:
My mouth literally starts to drool if i even THINK about Bob's hot, fresh, ooey, gooey, crispy, perfect donuts.

We wandered in around 10pm on a Friday night and were just going to get our usual go-to chocolate old-fashioned, but noticed a row of people sitting at the counter, not eating anything, just waiting waiting waiting. And staring at the fryer. As soon as the hot apple fritters came out, all those people jumped in line. 

WOW. We inhaled round 1 and got back in line for more. And then we went back again the next night. (We have young kids and don't get out that often, much less up to SF, and THIS is where we went on our one child-free weekend! TWICE!)

Go after 9pm-ish, and get whatever is coming fresh off the fryer. It is reminiscent of the first time I had a hot fresh Krispy Kreme, times 10. Simply amazing and perfect.
author: Jen Y.

description: Well, I came here for the big donut and I was sad to find out that none were out and the next batch would be out much later. So having to improvise, I got a crumb donut and 2 glazed donuts. The crumb donut was absolutely phenomenal and the glazed donuts were fresh, warm and airy. Very good donut shop.
author: Waldo M.

description: Walking into this place I thought, "okay, okay...how great could this place be?  A donut is a donut."  Wrong...Wrong!  Bob's does donuts like Morimoto does Japanese!  The donuts taste fresh, they have that initial crunch followed by that pupil dilating chew that will sky rocket you into sugar euphoria!  I am a sucker for Krispy Kreme, but this place just takes the cake, er...donut?  Highly recommended.
author: Josh S.

description: I bookmarked Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop since forever and I finally got to try them out today! We came here early in the morning and there was already a line out the door. I split half an old fashioned chocolate donut and half a crumb donut with my coworker. Unfortunately, the donuts were not warm nor as fresh since they made it earlier in the day. The old fashioned chocolate donut was kind of dry. I felt like I have had better elsewhere. But my favorite has got to be the crumb donut while the old fashioned chocolate donut was alright.. I've got to admit that the crumb donut might be the best donut I've ever had. It's very crumbly, yet soft when you eat it. It was just amazing!! The next time I come back, I definitely would order the crumb donut again!
author: Philana C.

description:
Bob's lives up to the hype.

Came here after a night out & ordered pretty much everything on the menu & nothing let me down. Go for the crumb donut on your first visit. The raspberry filled donut tasted like a cross between a donut & an extremely light cake-- too good. The baker gave my friends & I fresh donut holes while we watched them make everything in front of us. Yep, we were amazed.
author: Catheria S.

description: Some of the best and fresh doughnuts I have ever had. Open all hours of the night, which is great after a night out
author: Oliver G.

description:
As far as donut shops go, you could do a lot worse than Bob's .

I so enjoy when any of their fine donuts just emerges from the fryer but am particularly fond of Bob's old fashioned and buttermilk donuts, no glaze.

Yessiree, if you're in the hood, in the mood, then don't leave yourself to say to yourself 5 hours later, "If I'd only gone to Bob's."

Mmm, mmm, good!
author: Jay D.

description:
O how I miss Bob's! My first stop on the way to work, and the reason for most of my weight gain. If you're looking for something like voodoo donuts (don't be crazy) this isn't your spot. If you want a good traditional donut and a hot cup of coffee from a 
neighborhood landmark, head to bob's. Donut fix after the Hemlock, head to bob's.
Bad date, yup... bob's! Also look on groupon, from time to time they'll throw up
a deal.
author: Yousef K.

description:
Only been here once. 

Those donuts looked pretty darn tasty, despite looking through a janky, grundgy window. 

And then you walk inside, and it looks semi-run down. There's these small tables to sit at and a long counter with stools. 

Donuts were too fresh walking in, but still got the big fat glazed donut. I can't say it was too special. I think the size of it was what made it so fascinating. 

It's funny how everything in that place seems like it's in piss poor condition, but when the person rings you up, they use an iPad. haha
author: Arnold H.

description: Large assortment of donuts and sweet and savory croissants. Milk. Coffee. Has it all.
author: Tashina B.

description:
A giant chocolate glazed donut bigger than my head?! Yes please! Not only was it delicious, the picture of me taking a giant bite out of the giant donut is one of my most liked pictures on my instagram page. Haha.

It's always open (24 hours) and the donuts are usually fresh. Come early for the big donuts or just order ahead. It's a great place to come by for a childhood snack, boxed chocolate milk and a donut.
author: Mindy T.

description: Delicious donuts! This place is a little hole in the wall donut shop that makes really solid, amazing and cheap donuts. Plus its open 24 hours! We got the french crawler with chocolate glaze, plain glazed, apple fritter donut, jelly and cinnamon. They were really soft and fresh donuts, a must try!!!!
author: Josephine L.

description:
There are 2 things that I do not eat: Apples and Bananas. 

There is nothing you can to make me eat the slimy, pungent mess that Bananas taste like to me... But Bob's....oh, Bob's... your apple fritter has made me a believer in apples!

I discovered Bob's on one of my "fat" days. I call them "fat" because I was supposed to work out after dinner with my bf, but instead we got lazy and walked to Bob's and had a donut instead. I rationalized it by reasoning that I had gotten some form of exercise in by walking to Bob's instead of taking the bus. 

I had heard of Bob's before, but nothing could prepare me for the delectable Apple fritter. I don't even eat Apples or anything apple-flavored and these were SO GOOD! The apple flavor is very subtle. If anything, the fritter's overwhelming taste is cinnamon. But the best thing about the fritter is the texture. It has a great crunch on the outside! 

I finished off my apple fritter with non-fat milk. You know, because I'm watching my figure. After Bob's, I then walked to Victor's and had a slice of pizza. Did I mention that I'm going on vacation in one month and I'm on a diet?
author: Monelle A.

description:
I did have a maple doughnut and no I was not drunk. It was actually at an odd time when I devoured my delicious doughnut. It was around 450 pm if I recall on a Saturday afternoon.

There were not many choices since it was an in between time but I was happy with what I ordered. I initially was a little weary about the freshness of the doughnut since not many choices were put out but when I bit into it, it tasted very fresh. The dough was very fluffy and soft. The sweetness probably didn't help my past issues with cavities but whatever right? I have decent dental insurance.

Just be sure to simply order what's shown on display. Some dude kept asking the Asian lady (maybe the owner?) if they had glaze doughnuts. She kept insisting that they only have what's offered at the display window but he kept asking like an idiot, all the well holding up the damn line. The Asian lady kept complaining about that gentlemen while holding my doughnut. I was just thinking to myself, "just give me my doughnut!". Despite that mini ordeal, these doughnuts rock. And they're open 24/7. Can't beat that.
author: James K.

description: Line was out the door at 2 am on a Saturday, but apparently that isn't anything out of the ordinary. Anyways, it was well worth the wait. I ordered a giant donut (that I brought to a party and 11 people shared, I couldn't eat all of that in a day!) and a regular maple donut that was fresh off the fryer. I could have cried tears of joy after my first bite of the maple it was THAT good. Highly recommend if you're in the neighborhood and in the mood for some donuts.
author: Emily P.

description: Disappointed with their donuts. Ok so this place is open 24/7, a place to go when the bars close. The donuts are good when fresh out of the oven like at most places. But last few times the donuts have sucked.
author: Cup C.

description:
Upon first glance, Bob's is honestly a bit dismal and dingy. But any place that has FRIED DOUGH dipped in a sugary glaze HAS TO BE GOOD! 3.5 stars!

And yes, the fresh donuts did not disappoint. One tip, ALWAYS ask "What's fresh?" right when you walk in. Get right to the good stuff, don't mess around and entertain the other meager offerings.

Even at 10:30pm, the cake donuts we consumed were fluffy, crunchy, warm and delicious. We also had the old-fashioned donut (1 hour old) and it was delightfully light with great texture and an almost savory-sweet thing going on. We watched the donut master roll out donuts into the hot oil with the donut contraption, and then he quickly flip flip flipped all of them with sheer skill and two chopsticks.

Love how they have a sign that says CASH ONLY, but they haphazardly covered it with a sticker for Square. So rejoice credit card holders everywhere! Now you can pay for your Bob's donuts with a swipe of your card, even if the total is only $2.25.

Late night donut adventures can be had thanks to Bob, whoever he is.
author: Alison T.

description:
*cruller review only*

First time here was on a Tuesday at about noon. We went in and got some donuts and left. The donut I picked up is called a cruller. Little did I know it was the best donut I've ever had! Light. Fresh. Fluffy. Moist. Airy. Eggy! Soooo good!! It tasted like a churro donut. I should have boughten more!!

Must go back...

Next visit- Saturday at 11:00pm. What?!? There's a line?!? No way! Ppl were standing in line to buy 1-2 donuts. I don't like standing In line. Who does?! I was planning on buying a dozen crullers before I knew there was a line. Now I wanna buy 2 dozens! 

Waited for about 15 minutes in the cold and finally it's my turn. 

Me- I would like a dozen crullers please.
Worker- um we only have 7
Me thinking @&!! U only have 7?!? Wtf?

Lesson learned- if you want crullers, go early and on a weekday when there are no lines.

Every time I go to the city now I wanna stop by bobs and get crullers :-) and maybe try other kind of donuts too.
author: Irene L.

description:
5 stars for donuts FRESH. This place is open 24/7
we went there at like 12:30 am? and there was a line (maybe 10 minutes?)

but the fresh donuts were light even though they were covered in chocolate or maple or clear glaze. YUM! MUCH better the Krispy Kreme

the crumb donut is a cake donut, covered with donut crumbs. A little too sweet for my taste. so I would give that a 3 star. 

DEFINITELY you should come and eat here before you die. One for the bucket list. 

though I would suggest getting whatever is fresh off the fryer.

The people that work here are really nice.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
What's BIG and ROUND, filled with a lot of FAT COMPOSITION, and SOFT when you TOUCH it? 

Answer: Bob's Donuts!!! 

....And Bob has them SUPER SIZED just the way I like them. For only $5.50, I was able to cop myself the GINORMOUS glazed donut. After taking a billion pictures of it and with it, I carefully planned my strategy to maneuver through the donut. NO HANDS!

Don't ask how I did it but I was able to consume half of this monstrous donut with my special donut-eating-skills before knocking out with a minor case of food coma. The taste of the donut was perfect -- not too sweet, not too plain. A bit crispy on the outside, fluffy and soft on the inside. 

I bet I could finish the entire donut myself if my family members didn't salvage the remains of my donut while I was snoozZzZzing. Next time, I'll be sure to grab two super sized donuts: one to share and one all to myself!
author: Christine L.

description:
There's a cult following at Bob's Donuts among restaurant industry folk. I love coming here after work and shootin' the breeze with other cooks from around the City while stuffing our faces with sugar morsels of fried dough. 

7x7 Magazine will tell you to go for the Apple Fritter, which you should; however, I just can't get enough of a fluffy raised glazed donut. 

Truth is. Everything here is good, just so long as you stop by after 11pm when they come out nice and hot!
author: Phillip L.

description:
Donuts = good. Especially the fresh ones!

Service = friendly

Payment = cash only...but it's worth it!  Don't be a dumbass...bring CASH.

Seating = limited.  Booth or two-top tables.  Choose wisely.  

The best thing about this place...is coming here after 1 a.m. and seeing the drunk-asses try to use the non-existent bathroom and walk into their kitchen....and get yelled at for it.  lol   Oh and listening to a bunch of drunk-asses outside ranting and raving about the donuts...bwahahaha
author: Fannie S.

description:
This place was two blocks away from my apartment and open 24/7.

We've been here a few times (usually after 11pm) since it seems that quite a number of the people in my life don't share the same sentiment as I do about these donuts. 

They're a lot more dense and doughy than I prefer, and not as soft and airy in the inside. Not really worth the calories, in my personal opinion.

Maybe I have to be drunk enough to enjoy these?
author: Asha S.

description:
1300 got!!!

Wife Grouponed a dozen donuts from this joint prior to leaving the isles.

We made a special trip up to Nob Hill just to redeem this thing. 

Angry looking Chinese lady in the store and we forgot to print out our Groupon...not a good sign. 

We walked into the store and Chinese lady was all smiles with her Ipad. 

"No problem, just give me the Groupon number."

She even gave us a T-shirt with the deal. 

"You look like large, but I only have medium." 

I'll take whatever compliment I can get. 

We had her choose our dozen and we got an apple fritter for the road. 

I just about did an about face to the store after eating a bite that apple fritter. 

*Devine hand of God placed on head when eating this thing*

I was in tears it was so good.
author: Michael M.

description:
My 500th review. Whoop whoop!

The thought of challenging myself to devouring a donut in under 3 minutes gives me some incentive to return. That, and the fact that their donuts are pretty damn good. Had a freshly made chocolate glazed one and nearly burned my mouth because of it. I have no patience when it comes to indulging in the sweet stuff. Our group hung around just long enough to try to convince another group to partake in the challenge as well, but to no avail. They had already stuffed themselves at the House of Prime Rib, the to-go bags being evidence of that ordeal. The person on duty even gave us a free apple fritter to split. NOM. I'll have to get myself focused for when the time finally comes to take on Bob's challenge. If all goes as planned, there will be 10 of us stuffing our faces with that fried doughy goodness. Look out for my update review.
author: Rhia R.

description:
Best donuts I've ever had (and I eat a lot of donuts!) 

Best old fashioned donut by far.  I was lucky enough to have one freshly out of the frier.  It's the only way to eat it.  When you go, you must get whatever is fresh... fresh is the best!  I can't wait to go back.
author: Aura J.

description:
My friend had heard about this place as a "go-to" for donuts, so we got lucky and found parking near here during a Saturday eve.

You won't exactly get a full idea of what's available simply by looking at the window display - they have their donuts on racks and are constantly cooking, so you need to come in and ask. My friend got a dozen and asked the staff to pick the assortment - cool idea!

I went for chocolate and glazed versions of the raised (traditional) donuts, and a few glazed old-fashioned. So the one star off is for the old-fashioned, it was a bit too dense for me. That said, I really like that they're not overly sweet (I mean, a couple Krispy Kremes are you go into diabetic coma), and even a couple of days later, they're STILL good with about 15 seconds of microwave time.

I'm seriously sad that my box is now empty. I shouldn't have shared.
author: Trish A.

description: Despite being a 24 hour dougnut place this place appears not to make doughnuts around the clock, which is dispointing as I walked be 2 times this week in later afternoon and the dougnuts were super picked over and no one was making dougnuts.  I walked by another night around 730 and they were making crawlers which for me are the worst doughnuts, and the rest of the dougnuts were picked over.  I happened to be there today at 830am and they had most of their dougnuts in this time.  Is time they had twists in, which are my favorite and they were great.  Just wish I could get them other times of the day... Maybe it's for the best.
author: Zachary S.

description: Great place to hit up after a night of hitting the town. Crumb donut? NOMNOM. I tuned into my childhood and got a carton of milk with my crumb donut.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Stumbled upon  Bob's while visiting San Fran and walked in just as they were pulling out a fresh batch of glazed donuts. Grabbed a glazed and a maple old fashion. WOWWWWW They were both delicious, but the glazed donut was by far the best I've ever had. While out two nights later I passed by Bobs again and they had a huge Line outside! They're open 24 hours a day, don't pass up on this place :)
author: Michelle E.

description:
I used to live right off of Van Ness and have probably walked past Bob's Donuts at least 100 times! i've always wanted to try it but have held off just to save on calories and it's so hard to resist every time - Bob's Donuts smells like one big pile of chocolatey, caramel-y, and doughy heaven!

Finally this past Friday, my friends and I decided to try it out after having dinner nearby because we wanted dessert. We thought Bob's would hit the spot: delicious and cheap donuts, how can you go wrong? Bob's highly exceeded our expectations -- we tried 5 different of their donuts and "wow" is all I have to say. Between the 5 of us, we got the following flavors: apple fritter, chocolate custard, caramel, original glazed, and a regular chocolate one. All of the are warm, fluffy, filled with probably 1000 calories each, and so delicious you won't know what to do with yourself. 

It all comes down to personal preference when deciding which one is your favorite. I'm a big chocolate person, and I think overall, my favorite one was the chocolate donut (chocolate frosting on top), with custard stuffed inside of it. It was sooo chewy and creamy and had the *perfect* balance of everything in it. Not too much chocolate or custard. One of my friends loved the caramel one (this was probably my 2nd favorite) because it was simple and just hit the spot. The other three loved the apple fritter one the most, the donut that Bob's is famous for. It's super delicious and if you see them making it, you'll see them pour a tonnnn of milk over the donuts which probably infuses tons more calories but lots more goodness. The apple fritter one is super different and unique and unlike other donuts I've had, but I'm just a chocolate sucker at the end of the day.

You should totally come here after a meal or in the morning - or just whenever they're making fresh batches of them. Bob's is NOT to be missed! I'm glad I only tried it now though - if I had tried it when I actually lived nearby, I would have probably gone everyday and would be 15 pounds heavier right now. :)
author: Priya G.

description: Great donuts, sell out fast so get there early for good pickings!
author: John L.

description:
SO this makes me the 1002nd review!  The sheer number of reviews really astounds me.  Apparently, this place is so in to their customers and their business they check these reviews NIGHTLY.  Because I assume they get that many...

Well, I came from the movie theater on date night with my guy and found this place on the Yelp app on my phone...

Do I have to say anymore than:

1. Open 24/7.
2. HANDMADE doughnuts made round the clock
3. CHEAP coffee
4. CHEAP pastries.
5.  Friendly service.

To put it all in a nutshell, my boyfriend and I ordered 1 small decaf coffee, 1 regular large coffee, 1 chocolate doughnut (that was fresh out of the fryer and unbelievably heavenly), 1 scone, 1 blueberry muffin and 1 croissant and the total was $7.25!!!!!!!!!!

Go there you will be a happy camper.

GOLD STAR.
author: Jillian K.

description:
Wow - with all the really great reviews I expected so much more!  I saw the picture on a Groupon and was craving donuts for a couple days so we got this deal.  First you are limited in the selection if you do buy a Groupon to whats been thrown in the window which is not appetizing at all and basically just thrown in there not stacked like the pics - though I was there around 5pm.  I opted to receive fewer donuts to get ones fresher off the racks (though the type was listed on the Groupon).  Krispy Kreme are 10 times better for every type so I'm not sure what people are using as a base.

The lady helping was very nice but if I want this many calories and fat I want it to be worth while - very disappointed.
author: Tom L.

description: Best doughnut place in SF! Their glazed and their old fashioned are amazing. Ask them for the doughnuts that have been recently baked, since they are way much better than the ones that have been siting for a while in the counter ;-)
author: Javier S.

description:
OH MY GAH!!! 

Could not believe how amazing these donuts are.  We came here after a night out...a friends suggestions...my thought was "why the heck are we taking a cab all the way to one donut place when no donut is really a bad donut".  

One bite and I was done for.  Apple fritter, crumb donut, jelly filled, all were crunchy on the outside and super soft on the inside.  HANDS DOWN the best donuts I've ever had.
author: Sherley I.

description:
Love the old-school feel of the place. 

Gf and I bought an old-fashioned w/ glaze, an apple fritter, and a jelly filled. 

The old-fashioned w/ glaze was good - the glaze wasn't too sweet, and the donut was soft and cakey. 

The apple fritter wasn't anything special - I've had similar apple fritters from Safeway back in Vancouver.
