The jelly filled was interesting - basically a yeast donut cut in half, and filled with red jelly. Very soft and light, and I swear the jelly actually had some sort of cherry flavour instead of just being sweet and coloured red.

Overall, I liked the donuts, and they're not too expensive. However, they weren't anything incredible either. Get a donut from Johnny's if you want a mind-blowing donut, but you'll have to pay the price. Bob's is affordable and good quality.
author: Dan Y.

description:
Best EVAR apple fritter, hands down. No joke. Lots of apples, lots of cinnamon. Tons of YUM. 

Glazed buttermilk donut so yum too. There were so many other things that I wanted her to put in a bag, but decided that the apple fritters and buttermilk donut were enough. Too bad it's so far from where we live, but I suppose it's better for me so it can be a special occasion type of stop, lol.

Next time I want to try the custard danish and whatever that big loaf of whatever that was with all the apples sprinkled in.
author: Dina V.

description:
I love donuts! 

But I only like ole fashion and once in a blue moon, I like a maple bar and oh, maybe an apple fritter, or a bear claw.

Bob's donuts are fresh and yummy. The only thing that bother me is that they never seem to have chocolate ole fashion when I want them. And I don't like my donuts glazed...ever. They taste so much better plain or with chocolate on them. (Licks lips.)
author: Missy X.

description: Great doughnuts forsure!!! The boyfriend keeps raving about them, "I don't think there are better doughnuts in existence." We got an apple fritter, a maple ridged donut and a regular chocolate-all were good! We went at around midnight, will definitely go when I am in the city again!!
author: Katie C.

description: Omg! This place never let's me down. No matter what hour of the day or night I go to Bob's the donuts are delicious. It is so easy to devour 6 of their donuts in one sitting. I love that the old fashion donuts are crispy. They always have a wide variety to choose from. Their crumb donuts are on point! Whenever I'm in the area I pick up a dozen. The prices are also fantastic as well!
author: Nia R.

description:
I used to grow up in this neighborhood and my elementary school was close by. I never anticipated Bob's to stay open and be as popular as it has become today.

I say it is only worth going here when they make their donuts fresh. There's nothing more magical than this experience alone. I'll eat donuts that I don't even like if it's made fresh at Bob's.
author: Sandy T.

description: What's the perfect food after you've had a few beers? Donuts! These really hit the spot. We ordered the cinnamon roll, apple fritter, chocolate sprinkle and a chocolate donut. All were amazingly delicious! Friendly fast service and the perfect donuts. All you need in life.
author: Iv A.

description:
AHHH. If only donuts didn't have so many calories in them, i'd eat 5 every day.

I love that you can see the whole donut-making process while you sit at the bar and then get served a fresh hot donut late in the night.

They are just perfect and the staff is friendly and wonderful!

Get the maple- its deelish!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Love the BIG DONUT!! You can share the big donut with approximately six or more people. The crumb donut was yummy!!
author: Susan L.

description: My go to Donut spot in SF. I love this place donuts and apple fritters are on point!
author: Christa T.

description:
My boyf and I came here with the express purpose of indulging in what he claimed to be the absolute best apple fritter in the city. The fresh-baked glazed old fashioned we had instead was divine: tender, sweet, and a great balance between the cinnamon and dough.

I'm rating this 4 stars because I came here for the apple fritter, but they were sold out. It can only go up! I'm fairly confident that I'll be pleased, but until I try it...
author: Mea H.

description: If Bob's wasn't up the hill from my work, I probably would have a donut a from here a day.  Also, thank god that it is up the hill, as I tend to like the apple fritters, glazed donuts and french cruller.  I haven't had a bad donut from here, but honestly I don't think I have ever had a bad donut in my life.  Bob and I will definitely be seeing more of each other.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
A little small and dark...place could use a little cleaning up and a maybe a new coat of paint and some better lighting to make it inviting. 

Seems they make VERY small batches

The giant cake box sized doughnut is awesome!
author: Leo V.

description: Doughnuts,  great. Service HORRIBLE. The ladies kept talking and ignoring my questions. When I tried to order one of the women told me that the other lady was helping so she wasn't going to be able to help me. I was also very offended because I am latin and we tend to call people "mama" with good intentions but the women began to insult my friend and I saying "you Mexican Latin and street people call everyone mama" and continued saying such things. I have been a regular customer but not coming back.
author: Ava M.

description: Best Apple Fritter and Maple Old Fashioned!!
author: Jessie A.

description:
Well we all know the doughnuts at Bob's are by far the best in SanFrancisco :) however, the nice lady that was working there the late evening my sister and I came through was equally as good. She was so cheery and friendly... She was happy to joke around with us, even knew of VooDoo doughnuts of Portland (my sister is from there). We enjoyed the counter culture for a few as we killed our hot maple bars :)

See you next time!!
author: Alisa F.

description:
The donuts are mediocre; the selection is disappointing; the service is out- of- this world hideous.

We were finishing up our tacos from Nick's and eating our donuts when the owner (Bob?) came out and screamed at us for eating outside food in the shop. Completely taken aback by his aggressive tone and out- of- the blue attack, we immediately  apologized. We expressed that we were planning to buy more donuts to take home, to which Bob responded that he did not care and to get out of his shop.

  I have experienced bad service but never anything like this from any establishment. I will not come back.
author: Bethany T.

description:
THE best donuts i've ever had- hands down. All other donuts pale in comparison.
Get whatever's just come out of the fryer and prepare to be blown away.
author: Gianni M.

description:
Came here late night after the bars... There was an old asian guy making donuts fresh there right before my eyes... We ate them while they were still hot... best donut ever. 

I'm disappointed to say that I went back 2 days later on a sunday morning only to find normal, not super fresh donuts... so i guess timing is everything.

Coffee is not great.
author: Sasha B.

description:
It can't be good for your health when the donut lady knows your name. 
I don't usually like donuts because they tend to be dry and blah, but Bob's has the BEST donuts I have ever had. They are the ONLY donuts I will eat. The apple fritters and plain cake donuts with sprinkles are excellent. You have to ask for whatever is fresh and hot and get that, you can't go wrong with anything that just came out of the fryer. 

Best time to go here is late at night because that is when the donuts are super fresh. You will watch them make it from scratch and place it in your hand. There will be a line out the door if you go here late at night on the weekends, but the line moves fast.
author: Amanda K.

description:
This might sound crazy, but if I were an inmate and I had a choice of a last meal, I'd ask for a dozen of bob's donuts. That's how obsessed I've become with the cake donuts. The apple fritters are good, but not last meal type of good. The cake donuts, especially the cinnamon crunch one, are nothing short of amazing though. Definitely also recommend the chocolate and the half sprinkled ones (I don't know where they got the concept of half sprinkles, but it's a good idea and they probably save tons each year on sprinkles..). I think the dough is the best part of bob's donuts on the cake ones, because the outside is crispy and the inside is fluffy but not too sweet. Yum Yum Yum!  Best 70 cents ever!

- located conveniently on Polk street for late night munchies
-open 24 hours, there's no shame in coming at 7:05am for a donut before the sun comes up.
author: Christine B.

description:
I love Bob's donuts. The only negative is they sometimes have long lines, but they usually move fast. Pretty good prices considering how popular this place is and how good they are. I consider going here for the whole experience. The workers are very friendly too.

Oh  - I do wish they had better signs/labels so you could know what donuts you wanted to order. There are a few variations of similar things so it is hard to tell them exactly what you want without a lot of  pointing.
author: Olivia C.

description: I would like to say this first I AM NOT A DONUT EATER. My friend told me about this donut shop after a great night along Polk and we decided to check it out. As you can tell with the long line of dedicated donut eaters that these donuts might be worth the wait. The line went pretty fast and I picked one of the many freshly baked donuts that were out on racks. You can see the men frying and glazing the donuts right in front of you. I picked a chocolate donut and it was crisp on the outside and light and fluffy in the inside absolutely delicious. For all those non-donut eaters this place might change your mind
author: Isabell D.

description: After seeing a photo of a long line for national donut day, I was convinced this was a donut shop I had to try. Over a thousand reviews and 4 stars, I think my expectations were just a little high. Came here on a Tuesday afternoon at 1pm and the selection was dismal. The shop is a hole in the wall and the place looked dirty. Even the donut trays don't look clean. They ran out of everything and nothing looked appetizing so hubs and I just got donut holes and a jelly filled donut. Lady who rung us up couldn't decide on how much to charge us. First she said $2.50, then changed to $3.25 and finally settled on charging me $3.95 for 1 donut and a dozen donut holes. It was a strange experience.
author: Terry D.

description:
Bob's is literally the best donut shop ever. 

In fact, I've been there so many times since I moved to SF that this morning, when I was at Heydey (the opposite of Bob's), I tried to check into Heyday on Foursquare and it just assumed I was at Bob's (which mind you is located 30 min away).

Despite pressing the little GPS pin locator multiple times, it was still convinced I was at Bob's.

So tonight after work, I said screw it, and ate a Bob's razed glaze for dinner! 

I guess we both won this time, foursquare.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Stopped by at the ungodly wee hours of the night.

I honestly just wanted to go home but my friend wanted to try this place. And I'm glad we did.

I really wasn't in the mood for donuts so I just got the freshest donut they had which was the glazed old fashion and regular glazed.

Holy cow, were they good. I don't know what they put in the old fashion but it tasted amazing. I suspect it might be laced with cocaine and unicorn tears. It was sweet but not overbearing with subtle hints of other flavors. maybe cinnamon?? I'm not sure.

The regular glazed was quite good as well. The dough had just enough texture and weight to make chewing through the morsels of fluffy sweet heaven a pleasant experience. It was almost like eating a donut shaped brioche glazed in sugar.

Anyway, I will definitely be back if I'm ever in the area after midnight hungry for something fried and delicious.
author: Samuel P.

description:
I think this is the first apple fritter I've tried  (and I've tried many) that actually contained apple. Perfectly cooked, spiced, and glazed and you can tell it was fresh. 

I've actually seen them making the donuts at Bob's which I think is unusual for a donut shop, although I can't say I've really stuck around in a donut shop elsewhere to  check. Still, definitely cool to watch. The lady in front of me ordered several of the donuts they'd just cooked and she got to choose the different glazes she got on each. Pretty neat!

I've also tried the glazed twist donut, and just a regular glazed, both of which were exceptional. 

also open late, a great alternative or complement to pizza after the bars!
author: Laura S.

description:
When in need of a doughnut, you must give Bob's a try!

I must admit, I was a bit overwhelmed when I first came here. Too many choices usually means bad news for me (in a good way of course), because I'd want em all! 

We ended up opting for the huge crumb doughnut, (it was literally bigger than my head (no joke)), a few apple fritters (noted on SF's 7x& list), some old fashions, and one of almost everything else. I was quite pleased with the giant crumb doughnut. It was light and fluffy and the crumb topping was super yum. The apple fritters and old fashioned were also very good. Hit the spot for sure and helped satisfy my donut craving.

They make batches of their doughnuts fresh throughout the day. Definitely need to come back when they are piping hot and fresh!
author: Teese N.

description:
I promise you, this is a story about Bob's Donuts.  Kinda.

So, taking the bar in California is pretty messed up.

(1) You study for months, more often than not paying thousands of dollars to do so.  And when I say study, I mean your recommended course load is 12 hours worth of work a day, learning 16 or so entirely different and complex areas of law.  No big deal. 

(2) The test itself is three days long, six solid hours of testing a day, not counting all the time you have to wait just sitting around as proctors do proctor things, and the same announcements are read to you and your thousand test-taking peers over the mic in the convention center, where extension cords dangle from the ceiling and you imagine this is how cows feel nowadays.  Or as my friend Ryan astutely put it when describing the test-taking ambiance, "it's the exact opposite of Burning Man."  

(3) Then, it takes almost four months for you to wait for your results.  And if the wait alone isn't enough to make you want to cry/eat/drink yourself to death, you know the exact moment the score will be available (6:00pm on a Friday), so the months/weeks/days/hours/minutes/seconds leading to that time are excruciating. If you fail, you will have to repeat the whole process.  If you pass, holy shit, you're an attorney and you're really just relieved you don't have to repeat the whole process again.  This part, more than the others I think, is not so cool.  In fact, it's maddening.

Most people take that Friday off in anticipation of results, so they're not a flaming ball of stress at work.  I planned to do something like that.  And the actual night of said bar results?  Oh, I had it all planned.  I was going to check the results in the privacy of my dark, candle-lit bedroom.  I would be alone, but for the company of two critical mates: a dozen donuts from Bob's and a chilled bottle of champagne.  I expected the worst, so I also had a couple documentaries on standby about devastating stories happening in the developing world.  You know, for some perspective.  It's a goddamn test, not the end of the world.  Then I'd just stay in my room until I ran out of donuts.  This was, quite possibly, the most perfect plan I'd ever devised in my 25.5 years of living.

However, I had to take a meeting in the East Bay for work.  Okay, no sweat.  I bought the champagne early, tucked it away into the fridge, and went onward.  Distraction would be good, focus on something besides the clock ticking down toward my ego's doom.  

The meeting ran late.  

By the time 6:00pm came around, I was on the 1, homeward bound.  I called my mom to keep my mind and body from having spasms in public, and my phone from ringing/texting with inquiries or news.  It was 6:25 when I got to my stop.

But I didn't have the donuts.  

I needed the donuts.  

I couldn't do this without the donuts.  

So I detour to Bob's, order up my pastries of choice (primarily old fashions, FWIW), and even make a little small talk while in there to try to stay sane, while my mom was still on the line, getting pretty frantic herself.  Bob's wasn't very crowded, and I felt no need to rush the woman who helped me.  I even thought if I happened upon a homeless person en route to my dreaded login, I'd give him a donut or two.  You know, for some perspective.  And to be a good person, in which case I wouldn't have mentioned the good deed, it would have just been an anonymous act of kindness.  But alas, stumbled upon no such unfortunate soul, so I can tell you this part.  I proceeded home.  

By the time I was in front of my computer - after I had first washed my hands mind you, I'm no animal! - to finally check my results it was maybe 6:40 or so.  At some point around here, I can't quite recall because it gets a little fuzzy, I started crying on the phone with my mom.  But I do remember I popped open the champagne, poured some into the flute waiting patiently all day at my desk.  And I ate one incredible, calming, perfect donut as I readied myself for the most foreboding click of my life.  

This is a story about how important Bob's donuts are.  To me, at least.
author: Keeks K.

description:
Bob's satisfies my morning, noon, or late night sweet tooth cravings. They're open 24 hours and the sweet smell just drags me in. Before I know it I'm inside kicking myself for lack of restraint. I have yet to pass by without buying at least one donut or two. 

The huge $5 donut is a steal. I bought one for a friend's birthday and used it in place of a cake. Everyone loved it. Go early or call in for the big one because they do sell out. 

I usually stick to the French glazed, but was adventurous and got the cinnamon pretzel instead today. I'll tell ya how it is.
author: Jennie N.

description:
Bobs now takes cards!!!  Awesome!!

Fritterrrrr

Make sure you ask whats just come out of the oven!
author: Alan S.

description: I come here about 3 days a week. If you're lucky enough to catch a super hot batch out of the fryer - heaven!!! Apple fritter and maple old fashioned are my favorites. By the time I get there, cream filled yummies are always gone. It's next on my bobs donut wishlist !
author: Kaila L.

description: Crumb donut was good but small :( I also had a glazed donut and it was pretty good, definitely more dough taste compared ro kripsy creme's sweet glazed. The lady at the register was a bit rude and almost skipped my even though I was clearly in line and had no ordered yet... She uses tissues to grab donuts and then handles cash.
author: Cindy T.

description: OMG omg omg had a fresh MAPLE BAR LAST NITE! almost died amazing! I can't go back there! Lmao amazing
author: Lisa L.

description: How is this place not shut down by the health department? We just waited in line to try to experience the hype of this place, but by the time we made it to the front to order I was nauseated to say the least. This place is beyond dirty. We reluctantly ordered and paid $5 for soggy inedible donuts and after a single bite (by my boyfriend and not myself) we left them in a pile on the sidewalk for the pigeons! They (the pigeons) were pretty psyched though!
author: Shawna Q.

description:
Open 24 hours.

Has lots of doughnuts.

Owner is nice.

Cheap.

You need more? I don't think so. 

Oh and it's cash only. Bring like 5 dollar bill. You are welcome.
author: Brandon K.

description: Seriously the best donuts I have ever had. So fresh, light and fluffy! Make sure you go for breakfast and also get a fresh, HUGE croissant! So good! Pair it with a coffee from peets and you are golden!
author: Mel A.

description:
Best.donut.ever. 

Get the glazed twisted donut. Melted in my mouth. 

So jealous (a little thankful, for caloric reasoning only) that there is nothing like this that compares in Milwaukee. 

For under two dollars, there really is no reason to deny your mouth this happiness.
author: Melissa S.

description: Place was suggested to me. Stopped here twice. Both times customer service was mediocre... And was not busy at all. Both times things were given to me burnt. I judge donut spits by buttermilk donuts and theirs were just okay. Lemon bars, custard glaze and peanut butter cookies we def on point. 24/7 hours is awesome. Stop serving burnt pastries and smile sometimes could be 5 stars
author: Ruben L.

description:
Glazed donut with crumb cake topping!

All-Star Donuts (on Chestnut) is slightly superior, but Bob's is great and will do when in the Russian Hill neighborhood.
author: Mansi A.

description:
Hi Bob! Remember the last episode of "Newhart" (the one where Bob played the Vermont innkeeper) when he awakens and finds out the entire show was a dream and that he was indeed Dr. Hartley having a nightmare in bed next to his wife Emily in their Chicago apartment?

Well, in truth, Bob awakens from another nightmare in his shop on Polk after having a nightmare about being a Chicago psychologist having a nightmare about being a Vermont innkeeper. Bob is really the owner of Bob's Donut and Pastry Shop. Yes, Bob is a Chinese woman now.

Well, it feels like a place where Bob would have gone to meet Howard after having a fight with Emily. Little two-fer tables scrunched together against one wall. A long counter with a TV propped against the wall like in a hospital. And donuts, they have donuts. Big ones and bigger ones. Turnovers and fritters. The deep-fried works.

Jamie W. had a big piece of meringue that disintegrated like angel dust...not that I would know. I had a glazed raised (...I know my donut terminology). Eighty cents. It was nice...warm...chewy but not too chewy. More substantial than Krispy Kreme (...and they filed Chapter 11). But did I sacrifice a slice of kugel at Miller's East Coast Deli for this? I guess I did. Oy.

DONUTS - 3 stars...yep, it's a donut alright
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...like that place in the Michael Jackson video....Eat It! Eat It! Open up your mouth and feed it!
SERVICE - 3 stars...Hi Bob!
TOTAL - 3 stars...when will my retro-TV nightmare end?
author: Ed U.

description: "1 Star Sabrina" not sure why you used so much Yelp space with your negative remarks. this is a donut shop not La Parisienne Bakery. if you want simple, good donuts go to Bob's. we were walking down polk and saw the line (this tells you something about the place). the people were fun to chat with and the wait was short. the donuts are not the most beautiful, my husband actually ordered one of the more homely ones from the window case (because he felt sorry for it), and i ordered a plain old fashioned. man was it good! i don't know what they fry it in but it had a flavor i had never tasted in a donut before. awesome crunchy outside crust. i will be back...
author: K I.

description: So necessary to try if visiting SF. I don't even like donuts and this place blew me away. Get whatever is freshly baked.
author: Sam R.

description:
So, I wanted to do something crazy fun for my son's fifteenth birthday but he was sick that day. Never to be dissuaded by things like that, yesterday was his last day of 8th grade followed by a dress-up dinner/dance. I picked him up from the party and said, "are you up for midnight donuts to celebrate your new life (going to high school) and he said, "yeah, sure, why not?" 

Off to Bob's donuts we went just past 10:30. So we drive all the way across the city and lo and behold find a parking space right in front even though a line extended down the street. Yippee! We wait and wait and angry drunks, and happy rowdy drunks shout out to us about hot donuts tonight. While in the queue the lady behind me mentions that today, for the next 45 minutes, is national donut day! Who knew?

Finally, just before midnight we got our turn. Despite a no doubt grueling day of servicing donut crazed customers for hours on end the lady at the counter cheerfully took my Groupon, allowed me to upgrade for free to the red T-shirt, and tossed in a couple jelly donuts in lieu of the lesser cake ones. Hallelujah! As the clock stroked midnight we were well on our way back to our side of town and hopefully my son has some memories. Did I mention? We're nuts and saved the donuts for the morning!
author: Chanel B.

description: Great Donuts. Get them when there hot. Best of all.. Open late and take debit/credit card.
author: George A.

description:
Delicious gluttony...

The donuts are great, they're available 24 hours, they have weird limitations on what can and can't be included in the DIY dozen. It's not my favorite apple fritter in town (that's blasphemous, right?), but the glazed is about as good as they come. Always better when fresh.
author: Megan S.

description:
Just got back from Bob's and I have to say these donuts were great!

I got a glazed donut (still warm from the oven at 11:30pm.) I was expecting a circular donut, but this was shaped like a loaf and it was delicious! Also, there was a line at 11:30 on a Monday night which is saying something.
author: Emily D.

description: Maple bar all the way (not stuffed). Definitely lives up to the ratings. So so good. You will be glad you stopped here!
author: Jon P.

description: Friends from out of town were visiting and this was one of the places they wanted to try out. I'm not really a doughnut or pastry fan but I'm glad we stopped in.  My friend's husband wanted to try the large doughnut, I mean LARGE, like the size of your head large.  I was thinking it was going to be dense but I was quite surprised. The dough was very light and airy, and it tasted so good fresh out of the grease pit. It tastes much more appetizing than it sounds.  There's no way I could eat that whole thing by myself but was glad to partake in it with everyone else.
author: Kenson K.

description: After a drunken night on Polk for my birthday and the case of munchies, my friend suggested we get donuts here. She was like "it's not that far it's like up the block!" so i was like coo whatever i'm down. tell me why i walked damn near like 10 blocks in high heels in this cold ass weather for this damn doughnut. ANYWAYS there was hella options and shit i was like overwhelmed and didn't know what to get so i made my friend choose and we got sugar donuts. it was pretty good. my friends were eyeing the big ass donut they serve but we didn't get it lol. it's open 24 hours! and it's cheap too. i think. well i didn't pay for it my friend did. lol this place is good!
author: Kimberly T.

description:
A few months ago my husband purchased a groupon for Bob's doughnuts and was finally able to redeem it last Thursday. We've been to Bob's before so are well aware of how their doughnuts taste, hence the 2 star rating instead of 1. But, the experience he had on Thursday was AWFUL. We will NEVER return to Bob's again! Their doughnuts are not worth being made to feel like or treated like sh*t.

We can purchase delicious doughnuts elsewhere, where the menu does NOT include, "Let us treat groupon customers like crap!".

The woman who helped him was INCREDIBLY rude. Complaining about and practically blaming him for how "difficult" it is to ring someone up with a groupon and even threw the t-shirt that was part of the deal on the counter, towards him. She was, however polite to the other customers who did NOT have a groupon. Isn't it the business's choice to sign up with groupon to offer those promotions? So why would they be so blatantly rude to a paying customer?  It was BOB's decision to promote their business through Groupon, not their paying customers. Well guess what Bob's you just lost a customer and we'll be letting everyone we know how you treat your customers who pay for promotions that YOU decided to promote.
author: Row G.

description: Warm donuts, friendly service. I need to come here more often. Maple Old Fashioned was da bomb.
author: Jeff M.

description: Yummmmmmmm is all I think when I hear "Bob's". It's a classic donut shop - no tiny overpriced maple-bacon ghost-chili gold-leaf donuts, no lines around the block, no viral news articles about how they're disrupting donuts - screw all of that, I just want a donut, a hot, fresh, fluffy, sweet-but-not-lump-of-sugar, rich-but-not-dripping-in-oil, donut. I got a raised chocolate donut and it was just what I wanted. Definitely want to come back and try more - especially the crumb and apple fritter, which are my favorites but I wasn't in the mood for that day. Bonus points for being open all night, but that's not the only reason this place gets good reviews - this isn't just drunk-people food, it's a really solid bakery and donut shop. Probably going to request one of their giant donuts as my birthday cake this year haha.
author: Chris M.

description:
Yes! yum.  And at totally perfect prices! And they're always friendly.

The donuts are awesome, The old fashion I've had was perfect, as were the two sprinkled donuts...and the one maple...yum. 

Bring cash and enjoy your donuts!
author: Rebecca M.

description: Always the freshest donut around. I have not had a better donut in SF than this place. It's an experience you won't forget. My mouth is still watering even writing this review.
author: Bailey H.

description:
Best donuts in the city. I'm serious.

Whether you are looking for a breakfast indulgence or a late night treat, Bob's always satisfies. Your best bet, for ultimate freshness, is to go in the morning. That being said, if you are snagging your sugary, deep-fried-delight at 2am, I highly doubt you will be playing the role of donut snob. 

On a Fri/Sat night, be prepared to wait in line with the rest of the Polk street bar hoppers. 

I would highly recommend the buttermilk variety for those who like a crispier/denser donut (jelly, glazed, or chocolate- whatever tickles your guilty pleasure bone). Prefer a fluffier donut? Try a crumb, you won't be sorry. 
 
Don't forget the milk.
author: Daniel K.

description:
We stopped by Bob's after a late night event a couple weeks ago, and boy are we glad we found this gem! If we lived closer to Bob's I'm sure we'd make it a habit, but then maybe it's for the best (for our waistlines at least) that this will have to remain a special treat.

We arrived as the donuts were being freshly baked, and while there wasn't a huge variety available yet (it was around 10:00 pm), the choices were all scrumptious. My fiancé and I split a maple long john filled with deliciously creamy fresh custard (none of that nasty whipped cream that often masquerades at custard here), and while I think it's a little lame that the donut was cut lengthwise to be filled instead of piped, who am I to argue with deliciousness? Because we hadn't been gluttonous enough at that point, I also had a crumb donut, and the fiancé tried a chocolate frosted and sprinkled cake donut. We both agreed that those donuts were amongst the best of those varieties we've had in the city, and I personally can't wait to sample more of Bob's confections (I've got my eye on the giant donut challenge).

The shop isn't the fanciest place you've ever been to, but it definitely has its followers for good reason. The price is fantastic for the quality, and the staff was perfectly nice. Overall, our visit to Bob's was an experience to be repeated.
author: Kristen L.

description:
I always order my donuts to go in the morning.  NEVER spend more than 2 minutes in this place.  But this last time I rolled in about 10:45pm and my timing was perfect ahh the buttermilk bars and old-fashioned donuts were sitting in that  pool of grease getting fried up.  

So, this this time I figured, ok I'll just enjoy my hot donut here, when a minute later some dude completely sh*t faced rolls in stares at the lady working the counter like he's about to pass out.  He starts coughing like he's gagging and than it all came out of his mouth.  

Uhh....if I have to wait for my hot donuts, I'll wait outside cuz you just never know who's going stop by and puke on the floor!
author: David C.

description: Last year we were introduced to Bob's Donuts by a friend. We were amazed with the buttermilk donut. Fast forward one year. We are back in San Francisco for our wedding anniversary. We decided to walk a mile for the donuts we still remembered from our last trip. Once again, the donuts did not disappoint. They are nothing short of incredible!!
author: Terry M.

description: Had a glazed swirly looking doughnut guy. It was unlike any other doughnut I have ever had before...light and fluffy, like a cloud!
author: Molly M.

description: Giant Donuts at 1 or 2 am is all you need to get.   Well actually all of there donuts are really good but where else can you get a donut bigger than your face?
author: Michael T.

description:
I think a good portion of this review was based upon timing.

From what I have read, people LOVE the donuts when they are fresh. We however got there around 10:30-11:00. And to best describe them, they were ok. We ordered a couple old fashioned and a cream filled one. The only fashioned donuts were good, nothing AMAZING. One of the women we were with said she preferred Starbucks new old fashioned donuts. The cream in the cream filled was a delicious cream, but the actual donut part was a little stale and just uneventful. 

The selection by the time we got there was pretty picked over. But again we were there at 10:30-11:00 on a saturday morning (4th of July to add even more onto it).

To sum everything up, I think this is a place where timing is HUGE. I will definitely give them a second chance next time we are in San Francisco. By no means were they bad, just not as amazing as everyone else seemed to feel. We will stick with our Voo Doo Donuts out here in Denver for now.
author: M M.

description: It may have been an off day for them but we were not super impressed by the donuts.  We tried a variety of them and here is the countdown.  Cheese Danish - the best by far, generous amount of cheese filling that was very tasty, kind of sweet and buttery and a nice flakey crust - very good.  Cinnamon sugar - a good donut, not the best I've had but a solid 6 on a 1-10 scale.  Jelly filled donut - similar to the cinnamon sugar, good but not earth moving.  Sweet roll with nuts - basically tasted like white bread dough coated in cinnamon then rolled up with a few nuts sprinkled on top, not sweet or caramelize sugar tasting at all.  Old Fashion (sour cream?) glazed donut - probably worst of the bunch, basically tasted like grease with lots of sugar glazing on it.  Not much donut to it at all, normal size donut but only about  1/2 inch in diameter.  Also not the cleanest or best organized store I've been to.  Overall pretty disappointed since so much of the food in SF is way above average and Bob's was rated very high.  Heading down to Gayle's in Capitola tomorrow so we will get pastry redemption!
author: Bill P.

description:
Bob's Donut shop, YUCK!!!!!
If you want your artery clogged, I guess this is the spot. Otherwise this doughnut shop is not for me. There pastries have a lousy aftertaste.I prefer the recommended bakeries in Chinatown, that I stated. If I am in the mood 4 something sweet in the middle of the night, I would just go to sleep and wake-up with a big breakfast. Regret coming here ever.My wife loves Bob's donut shop, and bring something home for me to share. But I toss it in the shit-cannon. 
 
*How can anybody eat  any of those pastries at Bob's?
author: Matt G.

description:
Some people live their lives adhering to religious dogma whilst denying themselves their true lusts- all in hopes that one day they will be rewarded with heaven, paradise, nirvana...pick your religion.  

I say, why wait?  GO TO BOBS!  Have your bliss now.

And by "now" I mean the donut witching hour.  When the donuts and apple fritters are fresh out of the fryer, they are melt-in-my-mouth good and cause a total rush of serotonin to my brain.  Do you remember how you felt in 2008, the night Obama was elected?  It is like that...in your mouth!

I recommend trying the apple fritters, chocolate donuts, maple donuts (taste a bit like a pancake), and the danishes.  When is the donut witching hour?  Go late, but I would rather not get too specific...that would mean competition and I have my own donut needs ;-)
author: Floyd R.

description:
I really do like their apple fritters. 

Everything else tastes like donuts. But their apple fritters are different, bigger, darker somehow, with bigger chunks of apple in it. As anyone would say, they're best fresh out of the fryer. Somehow I lucked out and got a fresh one the first time I came to Bob's...never have been able to get a fresh one since and it hasn't been as good since. They only start making a fresh batch when they run out, so it's hard to gauge when to get there; all I can say is just try your luck and maybe you'll get a piping hot, drool-worthy apple fritter from Bob's.
author: Christine L.

description: Delicious late night treats. Has become a hipster haven. Here is a drawing my son/artist made in tribute to Bob's.
author: Moonbird G.

description:
Donuts are delicious, served warm and fresh. I came here with some friends really late on Halloween weekend after bar hopping in the area. The line looked long but I think it went by pretty fast. 

In terms of the donuts, they have a very wide variety. From traditional types of donuts to bear claws, fritters, and you name it. I definitely will hit this place up when I hang out with my friends there again!
author: Tom I.

description: Bob's Donuts has a large selection - the apple fritters are pretty gosh darn delicious.  Remember to bring cash.
author: Rose A.

description: Fresh and yummy! Only one other donuts place tops Bob's and that shop is in Brooklyn
author: Susan S.

description:
I won't write anything that hasn't already been said about Bob's Donut & Pastry shop because I simply agree with all of the positive reviews thus far.

As a new resident of San Francisco I'm glad I was able to find a 24/7 donut shop with a commitment to making consistently fresh and delicious fried dough at a good price.
author: Tim Q.

description:
I'm wary of late Sat night facebooking, but Yelping on the other hand has no such consequences because it doesn't include timestamps =D 

All I have to say is that pizza place that  I stopped at pre-Bob was amazing. Bob on the other hand was quite mediocre.

Good night.
author: Jess C.

description:
I love Bob's. It was the first place I ever ate at in San Francisco and if I ever leave San Francisco, I want it to be the last place I eat.

I'm a donut addict. I even once had a cat that I named Donut. I wouldn't call myself a donut connoisseur, but I think I know a good donut when I eat one.

I prefer the cake donuts at Bob's. The yeast donuts are good, but the cake are my favorite. The apple fritters are delicious right out of the fryer--and dangerous, too! It seems that warm foods right out of the fryer go down faster.

The only gripe I might have is that I never know how much something is going to cost there. The price is always different, depending on who is at the register. It's no big deal, since a donut probably won't break the bank.
author: Paul G.

description:
Oh lordy. Go here at 1-3 am to get the freshest and most delicious donuts. A few notes:

1. Your state of mind does not need to be altered in any sort of way to enjoy these, although it doesn't hurt.
2. I tried coming here at a normal time of day and they didn't have as robust a selection as 1:30am (wtf?)
3. I don't even like donuts.
author: Raina B.

description: This is a MUST stop in San Fran.  They're open 24/7 so you can definitely find time.  These are the best doughnuts EVER.  Their apple fritter is amazing too.  I wish they shipped to NJ.
author: Jeannine I.

description: Rude rude rude. Come here every week and the lady scoffed at me for trying to pay the usual 1.25 for a buttermilk when "they've always been 1.75". Did not appreciate the attitude. Then paid it and there was chocolate only on 1/4 if it.
author: Caroline R.

description: Ugh I was sadly disappointed by the donuts. She said they were fresh but they did not taste it! Tried the crumb, the French crueller and cake donuts and none were very good. Even tasted a bit greasy cold and stale. Service was very friendly but glacier slow. Would not try this place again.
author: Piper W.

description:
This place has over 1,000 reviews for a reason.  Seriously best, fluffy donuts EVER.  I came here with my bf the other day and we ordered 2 glazed, 1 crumbled donut and 1 buttermilk.  The total for 4 donuts was like $3.82.  So kudos for keeping the price super reasonable!  The donuts themselves were very fluffy and high quality.  I was surprised by them and will definitely go back to try the other flavors.

One thing I don't like about this place is that they don't have a menu with the name/description of each donut.  You have to pick the donut based on how it looks, which makes me wonder if I ruled a donut out that I could've liked.... But hey that could be part of their marketing scheme because it made me think I should come back for more, just in case I find something even better lol

They have about a dozen varieties of donuts (1 of them being one HUGE ass glazed donut).  They also have cookies and coffee.

Anyways, if you are nearby, definitely stop into Bob's! They are open 24/7 and seriously have THE best donuts in SF.
author: Anna G.

description: Everything in the window looks tempting, and I've tried a bite of most of them, but it's the apple fritter that's amazing here. I've had plenty of apple fritters in my time, but this one is somehow better. More Apple, more crisp, more ? Something more that makes me crave it even if it's not 2am in Saturday night.
author: Kokoe J.

description: Bob's Donuts is the bomb.  Open 24/7, their donuts are delicious and not big chain donuts.  Whether it's for your company donut run or after a late night of drinking, Bob's will not disappoint.
author: Tom W.

description: Fluffy, crunchy bits, yummy. And enjoyed seeing the server choose carefully a good looking donut for each client. Much love for this place!
author: Lanéa P.

description: I don't understand what the hype is with this place. I just tried the chocolate covered, custard filled donut and I was not impressed. The chocolate was bitter, I ended up peeling that part off. The donuts were not very fresh. Also, way overpriced. $5.75 for three donuts. No thanks.
author: Natalia M.

description:
About 14 years ago (wow, time flies), during a summer trip to SF with 4 other friends from college we discovered this place, late at night, walking down the street with no agenda other than looking for a convenience store. It was pretty much the only business on the street that was still open and the intoxicating aroma of fresh sweetness was emanating from it's open door. 

I will never forget the moment my friend asked the guy behind the counter what he was doing...making fresh crumb donuts. "Do you want one?" The man asked. And of course I did want one. And ever since then, I wanted another. But I didn't live nearby and I didn't remember the name of the place (remember, this was in the days before smartphones and digital cameras). 

Fast forward to more current days and my wife and I are living the Bay Area. One day, she is hanging out with some friends in the city, when she makes the exact same discovery I had made 14 years before. She brought home a few crumb donuts for me and we discussed it more and realized that the area she was in at the time was the same area me and my friends were at when we discovered the best crumb donuts in the world. 

So, naturally, we try to go there anytime we are around that area in the city....or at least as often as my wife will let me indulge my sweet tooth.

Best crumb donuts in the world. Period.
author: Nicholas P.

description: Best dam donut in San Fran dunkin donut my ass bobs is it the last true haven for a donut connoisseur. This is Homer Simpson's heaven.
author: Robert L.

description: Once you have a bobs donut, you can't go back! I'm always happy with two chocolate sprinkled cake donuts and a a small cup of coffee. Donuts are usually around $1-$1.50 and coffee is about a $1. It's fun to sit under the fluorescent lights at the bar and watch them make the donuts. I've only been there in the late afternoon when it is pretty slow and relaxing. Yep, it's a definite must if you are visiting San Francisco!
author: Alyssa J.

description: Only the most delicious donuts EVER! I'm scarred for life. I will never be able to eat donuts anywhere else and will have to live in San Francisco for the rest of my life because of this place! LOVE IT!!!
author: Nauti S.

description:
Alright, I am not a donut snob. I like krispy kreme donuts so I really am not a connoisseur. But I am a sucker for maple donuts. The maple donut at Bob's was alright. It wasn't amazing but it wasn't terrible. Since it was bigger than the krispy kreme donut, it was a little intense for me. But I still finished it!
I got the apple fritter for my grandparents and they liked it. They aren't too big on sweets but they didn't it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. It smelled good too.
author: Jessica H.

description:
If you don't like this place there's def something wrong with you :) 
I love their chocolate chip cookies and sugar cookies as well. I kinda hate that I work next door though cuz I can't stop eating their doughnuts lol. Plus everyone who works here is super friendly.
author: Lena E.

description:
Everyone comes for the apple fritters when they are fresh, or even after they've been sitting. I don't care. I don't buy into that hype or the 7x7 list. I am all about the maple old fashioned. Bob's makes the maple old fashioned the way it should be. It has a slight crisp bite to it on the outside and the maple frosting and donut batter literally melts in your mouth.
The best combination ever is to grab a cup of coffee from Philz on Van Ness, journey up to Bob's to get a donut, then people watch. 
OR
come here after partying all night. 

One time I came here at 2am and this lady asked if the apple fritters were any good. Then she had the nerve to ask how many calories there were in an apple fritter. If it wasn't 2:30am and I wasn't full off old fashioned maple donut I would've slapped her upside her silly lil head. HOney, you're in a DONUT SHOP AT 2AM. You're going to count calories?
author: Susy C.

description:
For someone with a massive sweet tooth, I can say this place is so satisfying. I went here around 10:30 at night with low expectations with 3 others but Bob's exceeded every single one. 

Location/aesthetics: Normal 
It's a donut shop. Don't expect something really fancy. Expect a regular shop. 

Staff: Helpful and Patient 
There were two men behind the counter and they both didn't rush us. Also, my brother had a groupon that he pulled up on his phone and still no rush!

Selection: Nice amount
They didn't have the apple fritters everyone keeps talking about but that's alright because they still had your classics. Glazed, maple, chocolate..you name it. 

Taste: DELICIOUS 
The donuts weren't warm or fresh but you could still taste quality. My new favorite? The crumb donut.
author: Joemae S.

description: Sooo disappointed :( My bf and I came to get the apple fritter and were super excited.. but then were disappointed. Maybe it was because we came around midnight but neither of us were impressed by the apple fritter. It was kinda hard and too sweet for my taste. It didn't taste fresh, and it probably wasn't considering how empty it was since it was late. We also got the apple bread pudding which was HEAVY. It tasted good though so that made up for the poopy apple fritter. I'll probably give Bob's another chance and come during more normal hours next time.
author: Sandra N.

description:
Walking out of a bar close to 2 am and making the brisk walk to the car I stumbled upon the smell of donuts down the street. I followed the smell and found a line about a half block long pouring out of a donut shop.

I can't turn down a doughnut.

I especially can't turn one down that's being freshly made so I hopped into line.

I ordered me a snail donut (I didn't know it was called that until the lady told me when I ordered the "one that looks like a cinnamon roll").

The donut was still piping hot, and the sugar glaze melted in my mouth as I walked back to the car.

By far one of my best 2 am snacks.
author: Vanessa F.

description: Love their donuts!! Taste so good!! If I'm not on a diet I will have it everyday!!! Love this little warm donuts shop ! N the ladies there is nice!!
author: Penny L.

description:
Yay for AMAZING apple fritters and delicious glazed-donuts! Staff is friendly! Open 24 hours to satisfy your breakfast, mid-afternoon-snack, post-bar cravings for an awesome sugary goodness! 

I love their apple fritters!!!!!!!!! Perfect amount of cinnamon and apple CHUNKS?! TOO GOOD to be true anywhere else but Bobs! Get your fix today!

They're a huge fan of locals so they typically run out of a lot of the popular items if you go super late. I've been fortunate enough to score an apple fritter each time. It's also SUPER cheap so buy a dozen. Or two and share that delicious good stuff!
author: Patricia K.

description:
I love their doughnuts! They are so delicious and make sure you try something that is fresh out of the oven because it is heavenly. I ate three in one sitting before, not the best thing to do but I enjoyed every bite. 

I have yet to try the large doughnut but I will for sure get it the next time I come here.
author: Ada W.

description:
Have been coming to Bob's for over 30 years now and it consistently has the best donuts around, for good prices as well. No matter who is behind the counter, they are always pleasant to deal with. 
Nice to see all the positive reviews here, they truly deserve it ! Have never had a stale item, and the jelly, custard and eclair-type are always generously filled unlike some other places where they skimp on these fillings.
author: W. Walter W.

description:
I really have nothing else to say about this place that Aesop Rock hasn't:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tMQzUfLbELM

Let me put you up on Bob's Donuts
Controller of the warm deep fryer that charms cobras
Mostly it was aggravated ulcers over goat's legs
Will they go for maple, custard, buttermilk or wolfsbane?
Hmm, late after your Cinderella pulsate and crash I was rotating casts
Picture if you will a witching hour on weeknight in the trenches
Where paranoia dead-ends in a bright florescent heaven
With sprinkles
I know right, YUM
Whether tummy ache or fever
Keep the funnel cake, I'm honey glaze in vitro
In the company of similar believers
Sleepless, who hear the walls breathe and foam at the facial features
Now the yeast, a phoenix in the partially hydrogenated
Equal parts flour/flower, faith, healing
Might replace your previously nominated Jesus
But only if you privy to the following secret of all secrets

Shh, every night at 12 they would march out from the back
With a tray of raw dough for the pool of hot fat
Show up around 1, never get your God back
If you're just tuning in, walk into the light

I boil oil too, not for scarfing
For CCs of Japanese innovation that screech into free parking
Purple Heart and 2nd chin that beseech him to squeeze the carbs into the motherboard
You can chew the Eucharist in cruller form
Locally a seedy danish underworld is bustling where jelly's not a celebrated stuffing; 
it's a puppet string
Pluck, nose for canola
5 cow stomachs like a mime with a rope going nowhere
Fast, right hand of God on my shoulder, crows feet swollen, dopey
Combing apple fritters over with folk of opposing cultures
Baby sitter cop thief reverend, body glitter, botched c-section, bronze teeth
Each progressively more sequestered
Yet if threatened will defend the raisin bread as co-defendants
Some lose religion or view it as superstition
You can tell a friend if you are down to kill them

Shh, every night at 12 they would march out from the back
With a tray of raw dough for the pool of hot fat
Show up around 1, never get your God back
If you're just tuning in, walk into the light

The Fat Boys are back, foam fingers over open arms
To feverishly reclaim their stomachs from golden jars
And stagger through the pulse ofthe gulch on a builder's dividends
Hiding high behind his guilty powdered-sugar fingerprints
Seething eventide fever, sidewalk feeling a little dicey
I'm snake-eye straight to the cakes icing
Might, fortune-teller up your favorite paper tiger stripe
Great grace invaders, the first-name basis patron haters
Who compromise the pilot lights and flavors
Silent night, holy night, invite the pious out the pagan
Midnight kitchen doors un-caging the enablers like butchers in bloody aprons
Can I get a fucking amen?
AMEN, hazelnut raiders of the lost, navigate consecutive pastries like stations of the cross
No name, no dayjob
Know the folk where it Virgin Mary toast by the loaf
Thanks, Bob

Shh, every night at 12 they would march out from the back
With a tray of raw dough for the pool of hot fat
Show up around 1, never get your God back
If you're just tuning in, walk into the light
author: Len L.

description: The greatest donut shop I've ever been to. Something as simple as a glazed donut hole is like mouthsex.
author: Sam B.

description:
Everything food wise about Bob's Donut is on point and delicious, but the customer service is not excellent.

There is one black hair overweight female employee that gives me a terrible, put down vibe. Unfriendly and a silent vicious sassiness when I request for the freshest donut. Her attitude alone deters me from going to Bob's Thursday Nights.
author: David L.

description:
The (XXL) donut, apple fritter, and meringue were all so good! The donut had more of a cake texture than a bread one, which reminded me of those old fashion-style donuts that I love so much.

The store is small and a little dingy, but the service was very friendly, and the sweets were excellent!
author: Samantha D.

description: My friends & I came here after a night of drinking. For most of us, it was our first time. There was a line and we waited for about 15 mins, but it was all worth it. I love simple, traditional donuts. My absolute must at any donut spot is a sugared donut. I almost died & went to heaven after taking one bite. It was fluffy, but not airy, and absolutely perfect. I also tried a chocolate one which came out warm - can't go wrong there either. The owners are super nice too! I definitely NEED to come back & buy one of their big $8 donuts!
author: Abby M.

description: Friendly staff w/ unusual flavors that are out of the norm. Bought a few for the hubs to try and he said they were pretty tasty.
author: Julie L.

description: the bee's knees in the world of donuts. if you want quality donuts, meaning the softest, most tender donut base, then look no further. I'm a donut purist and their glazed and sugar sprinkled are enough for me to be a believer!
author: Cara S.

description:
My fav donut place.  Perfect after 90 minutes of bikram yoga down the block.  Often after a nice meal in the city, I'll opt out of dessert at the restaurant to head here as it is guaranteed to hit the spot.  

Though I always order the glazed donut...pillowy soft and ever so perfectly sweet, it's best to order whatever is fresh out of the fryer.  I found the apple fritter a bit sweet, but the freshness made up for it...mmm mmmm.
author: Yvonne N.

description:
Ever since I first saw the giant donut, I've been wanting to throw it at someone, as I jump out from around a corner. Kind of life pie in the face, but donutted.

Regardless, I've tried a variety of bob's treats. The lady behind the counter always seems to eye me a bit oddly. Maybe because I show up at 4am by myself. Hmm. the cherry cobbler is awesome. Good crust/filling ratio and delicious cherry inside. 

Also, the apple bread pudding needs to be called out. It weighs about 1lb per slice and is only like $3. I lovee getting this, except I just want to gnaw on it all day once I have it. 

effing mmmm.

on behalf of yelpers recommendations I did try the maple bar. extremely sugary, but full of maple flavor n shiz, like a maple named treat should be. 

another plus, its a 24/7 establishment. 

anytime baby, anytime.
author: A K.

description: Perhaps one of the best doughnuts I have ever tasted. Anywhere..  The apple pan douty is a devastatingly delicious combination of doughnuts, apples, sugar and cinnamon.  Crowded on Friday, Saturday, Sunday.   If you are anywhere near this place, stop and experience it.  Amazing!
author: Brian R.

description: Apple fritters are awesome!  Only one guy working the counter and he kept the line moving and was nice. Great customer service. I'll be back
author: Paul H.

description:
2 words - apple fritter. 

This is a no frills bakery and you will not walk away disappointed. We grabbed a doughnut to go before biking over the Golden Gate Bridge, and enjoyed it once we got to the other side. It was so fresh and delicious. Hands down, the best apple fritter I have ever had.
author: Mary B.

description:
I'm getting fatter just thinking about it.. And it's worth it!

This place is amazing! The owner is about the nicest guy you'll ever meet and the donuts  are out of this world. I won't use the bathroom at crispy cream! I'm a fake donut man through and through! 

Keep up the good work.

Best donut in San Francisco!
author: Ben L.

description:
Best apple fritter I have ever had! 

My co-worker brought in a box of these delicious babies. It was crunchy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Very sweet and the apples were good. Made me want more, but I had to resist. 

I heard this place is pretty famous among the SF natives so I would like to come here in person next time.
author: Cindy K.

description:
This is a really good doughnut shop for all your favorite usual flavors and some different.  Here at Bob's, you will find the giganto doughnut, a doughnut the size of the box.  If you can down this humongous doughnut within a couple of minutes, you'll get your name on a wall of fame.  I attempted this and after a few bites I knew I wasn't getting my name on that wall, due to the immense size of the doughnut.  However, it was delicious!

I recommend stopping by there and trying a different item every day.  They're fresh and tasty treats.
author: Nerick M.

description:
As good as it gets. Exceptional quality and superlative costumer service
As I took my first bite of the apple fritter...I jizzed in my pants. Yes, it happened.
author: Soroosh P.

description:
An evil pleasure

I discovered Bob's shortly after I moved to SF from NYC.  Admitedly the food in SF is amazing but wow!  Probably THE BEST Donut I have ever had.  after working on budgeting a few weeks ago and putting in a 15hr day.  I popped in while walking my dog and we both had an old Fashion donut that was still warm.  Crispy on the outside and moist happieness on the inside.

Looking forward to grabbing one of the Apple fritters next time i have a rough day.
author: Rob S.

description:
I stop here every morning on my walk to work. Some of the highlights are the chocolate old fashioned (similar to the chocolate buttermilk), the cinnamon sugar french (it's light as air with a generous dusting of cinnamon sugar), the "ole reliable" chocolate sprinkle, and the crumb. Any time you get a french, you should buy two donuts because they're not that filling. 

Bob's has Square Up now, so you can pay with credit card. However, if you try to pay for your $.85 donut with a $20 bill or a credit card, you can expect a stern look and an exasperated, "I don't have change."

Sonia is passionate about donuts and makes great recommendations.

In the evenings, you can sometimes get fresh donuts as early as 8pm. I try to avoid Bob's on Saturday around 1am - line is long, although the donuts are fresh.
author: Lindsay W.

description: I would say it's safe to call this a light fork establishment. Though there are no actual forks used there, it still embodies the potential of a business without cumbersome utensils. If they did have forks here I would say they would weigh about as much as those carried at a successful restaurant. If you bring your own light cutlery you're sure to have an improved dining experience.
author: Meredith P.

description:
I went in there in the evening. They had a sign up saying that they had been closed for construction up until an hour before I got there so this may have just been bad timing. There were old fashioned and apple fritter bread pudding available. The old fashed was still warm. Even warm, it was at best slighty above average. I would imagine that it would be below average if it had not been so fresh. 

The apple fritter bread pudding was not good. It seemed to have a crust made with donut dough. The rest was still not good. Bread pudding should be made with eggs and cream. They dont even have eggs or cream in their fridge. Also, the bread should be dried out before you use it. This reminded me of that awful bread pudding you find at hometown buffet, only with apples. I would not eat it again if it were free. 

Two strikes. I dont see the hype of this place.
author: Eden R.

description: It's been on my list to do for a very long time and I manged to go there this time.  My favourite is cinnamon sugar cake and theirs was the best I've ever had.  Very light, soft and not greasy.  The lady at the counter was very sweet and friendly.  If I live nearby,  I would be a regular customer for sure.
author: Chris K.

description: THAT 10 INCH DONUT IS CRAZY!  Enough said.
author: Cecilia S.

description: Walked in and tried to order something from the window. They guy was like, "no, dude, these ones just came out." So I got a hot fresh one. Whoa! I've had Krispy Kreme hot light donuts and these are probably better. I'm glad I don't live nearby or I'd be here way too often.
author: max m.

description:
Bob's donuts of Nob Hill is equivalent to the dirty dog in the Mission. ZOMG so freaking good! They serve them up fresh at night as well. Killer place to fulfill all your beer munchies and sober up after a night at the bars. 

Yum! I think I had a bite of about 5 different donuts (donut hole, crueler (sp?), butter something, apple fritter) and they were all crispy, soft, moist, sugary, and bomb!

Nothing crazy about this place but my mouth is salvating just thinking about this place!
author: Grace Y.

description: line too long and I have had two homeless people harassing me for change and to buy food. . first and last time.  donuts was ehhh
author: Jomeo D.

description: Affordable, tasty, and local! Great pastries, good local vibe, and friendly service. Option to sit at counter or take out. Chocolate croissant is very good and can't go wrong with any type of donut!
author: Charles T.

description: Went today. Donuts did not look appetizing. Walked out. Use to like it.  Too much press.
author: Mkim S.

description: Best coffee hands-down in the morning and yummy donuts for the late night binge or office breakfast.
author: Sharon M.

description: The ideal donut. Walking into the outdated shop discouraged me after waiting in line, but the donuts are great! Very crispy and it's hard not to eat at least two. Only downside is there might be a line. Other than that, go for it.
author: Marcos B.

description: Yummy sweets. Biggest donut I've ever seen! They're open 24 hours! And there are bars everywhere on Polk.. so location is perfect! 'Nuff said.
author: Vol T.

description: 1000s of reviews for Bob's? Lol.  I have lived 5 minutes from Bob's for 30 years of my life, and never realized what a phenomena that Bob's is.  Well, I like it, don't love it, but can admit I have started to visit 2-4 times a week recently while en route to work in the mornings.  The window full of goodies can usually suck a person in and convert a sale....Super cheap, most things under or around $1.  The bear claws are fabulous at $2.10.  Will be back for sure!
author: Andy S.

description:
There's something about eating donuts at this small donut shop at those hours of the night when I start to lose the ability to maintain my social masks and shields.  This is a place that evokes a certain urban sanctuary on a quiet night, where the rhythmic sound of batter and dough being plopped in the fryer and quiet hum of evening news overcame the raucous laughter of inebriated youth waiting in line to satiate their induced hunger.

But all those elements came together and made that moment, of two friends discussing life goals and existential fears over a rather gluttonous array of confectionary treats, feel real with a rather terrifying clarity, however needed as it was.

So for no other reason than enabling that sort of moment in my life, I have to give Bob's Donut Shop 5 stars and hope that it enables other people to find some direction in a life that has grown disturbingly busy and chaotic.

The fact that those confectionary treats were superb (and surprisingly fresh) should invite you to try it out, too.  Sucks if you have a gluten intolerance.
author: Norman S.

description:
I have been putting off this review..because I just don't know what to say. I tried to think of a limerick, but that would mean Eduardo would have to write my review. I tried to think of a song or a poem..but I am just not that artistic. 

Within the last couple of weeks, for some reason donuts keep being a subtopic of conversation. I believe I might as well write the review, maybe then the donut thoughts will go away. 

It all started when I saw a thread about giant donuts. I then looked up giant donut in google, and found Bob's. I was ecstatic to see that a giant donut was within driving distance. 

Later that week, I had a commitment in Novato, so I figured I would drive down to the city to this so called donut haven. 

I got there around 10 in the morning, and from the outside all I could see was a giant row of pastries and donuts..just looking out into the world..enticing unsuspecting victims. 

The lady behind the counter was charming, oh so charming. My main goal was to get a giant donut..but once I saw the other options I knew I was in trouble.   I was having trouble deciding what to get, and the woman at the counter was very patient, but she was not helping matters. She recommended this one, then she recommended that one. So on and so forth. 

I ended up with a chocolate eclair and an apple fritter for my pastry selections. The smell was intoxicating, and the taste was heavenly. The apple fritter was probably one of the best things of the fritter kind I have ever put in my mouth. 

I also got a plain giant donut, and a chocolate giant donut. These suckers were huge. I am talking, one bite doesn't even make a dent kind of huge. I would imagine if Godzilla ate donuts, this would be the size he would need. 

While she was packing my supplies, I grabbed a cup of coffee and started chatting up the man sitting at the counter. He was also very charming. He said he stops by every single morning. With the coffee and sweets available, who could blame him? 

I actually have to come to the city to pick up a visa soon...I see another donut purchase in my near future. 

PS. Did I eat the whole giant donut? I will never tell...
author: Whitney B.

description: The average BMI near Bob's is significantly higher than for the rest of the city -- their donuts are so good they should be a controlled substance. The only better donut shop I've been to is Top Pot in Seattle, and that's mostly because they have better coffee and decor. If you grew up thinking donuts are what come from Dunkin', try some genuine donuts from Bob's. They will make you understand what Homer Simpson is so excited about.
author: Ethan J.

description: My god. Amazing doughnuts, open 24 hours a day. Cheap as hell. It's a good thing I don't live in this city, Bob's doughnuts are just too tempting.
author: Jane G.

description: I get a dozen of donuts from here when we visit. The owner is so friendly. Love their apple fritter, glaze and chocolate donuts. Top it off with fresh pot of hot coffee. Balances everything.
author: Trish M.

description: This place never disappoints. There might be a long line out the door, but it goes by super fast and its well worth it! I can always count on this place for that late night sugar craving. You can't go wrong with anything you order.
author: Nicole D.

description: Fast service. Good selection. Great prices. However, I didn't think the donuts tasted fresh. I think if the donuts were served fresh, I would have liked them better.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I've come here quite a few times.  

Sure, the donuts are decent...but I come here more for convenience, because they are practically open all day and all night.  But the donuts itself?  They're nothing special.  If you want a good donut, Stan's in Santa Clara is the best in the bay area.  It is worth the drive, so just do it.
author: Tanya P.

description:
Open all night - enough said?

No? Okay, well, how about that even after downing the most amazing, delicious, fresh-from-the-fat cake doughnuts I've ever had, I still found the slightly-less-fresh doughnuts tasty enough to choke down a couple of them. They didn't have apple fritters when we went, nor much of a selection that time of night, but they won us over anyway and we'll be back.
author: Amanda P.

description:
In all fairness, I came here at 10:30p on a Wednesday night, so the pickin's were slim.  There weren't too many types of doughnuts for the pickin' so I ended up getting an apple fritter.  The fritter looks like it was sitting in the display for awhile, and it surely tasted that way as it was dry and dense.  Thank God I bought a carton of milk to go with.

I probably should have gotten one of the freshly made doughnuts, but the only ones being made at the time of my visit were the round cakey ones--I was really in the mood for one of the fluffy round ones!

Bob's also makes large, jumbo novelty doughnuts that are fun alternatives to birthday cakes, but you need to call ahead to reserve one as they sell out fairly quickly.

Again, probably not the best idea to grab a doughnut that late at night, so I will have to try Bob's again in the morning when chances are that they will have a larger variety of fresh doughnuts.  Lesson learned.
author: Matt S.

description:
Being a SF newbie, I've been trawling yelp to find the best of everything. I was very disappointed with Bob's Donut shop. We visited the area yesterday with the sole purpose of trying their donuts. 

We were not greeted by the staff in the shop and were simply stared at while they went back to their conversation. When we finally lingered long enough for them to care, the woman asked tersely "can I help you" without even looking at us. We decided not to get anything in the end because we felt like a nuisance and the pastries/donuts looked stale. We visited a donut store few shops down instead. They were lovely and the donuts were awesome!
author: Madeline V.

description:
These doughnuts are some of the best that I've had. I try to limit using hyperbolic language, but these deserve yet more praise being heaped on top of them.
They have a huge selection of doughnuts if you get their at the right time, a little early, and you will be hard pressed to find one that you do not like. This place serves what I like to call "working man/woman" doughnuts. They aren't a Dynamo (SF) or a Doughnut Plant (NYC) type doughnut. I LOVE those doughnuts, but they are expensive, dense, and not always the right doughnut for the job. This place serves doughnuts that our grandparents would recognize. Nothing fancy, just honest doughnuts.
The price cannot be beat, the one lady that I've seen is prompt and courteous. You'll be in an out of their in no time flat if you know your order and there isn't a line. Even if there is one, she kills it quickly; be ready.
Eat here with confidence.
author: Corey H.

description:
If someone delivered the donuts to me, this would definitely be a five star review. In my opinion, the donuts themselves were complete perfection. We cut up and shared quite a few, and my favorite was the buttermilk with chocolate frosting. The buttermilk ones are dense, flavorful, and incredibly satisfying. I'm also a fan of the classic cinnamon sugar, and I even really liked the creme filled eclair (usually not my thing at all, but the custard was incredible!) 

They're very fairly priced, so you can walk out with a bunch to try them all. Or if you decide to just stick to one, I don't think you can go wrong with any choice. Honestly, I'm not even really a donut person, but I'm already craving more. Likely due to their dense and rich consistency rather than the standard fluffy airy kind (boring). 

So the only drawback is the place itself. The donuts are displayed in the window, which may work to attract customers, but for me it was a downfall. I already came out of my way to try the donuts, so I wasn't really in the mood to stand outside in the cold to decide which I wanted. While doing so, I also unfortunately witnessed a small roach scurry through the display. This was almost enough to make us turn around, but we decided to brave it and pretend that never happened. The donuts were worth it, but the atmosphere could definitely use some work.  It isn't a place where I'd want to sit and relax, but if I'm in the area again I'd definitely pick up a few to go.
author: Heather F.

description:
WOW WOW WOW

I'm not even a fan of donuts but...WOW! The Apple Fritters will make you a believer of Bob's Donuts. We got lucky and scored some fresh ones around 2am, early Sunday morning. The Fritter was warm, moist, cinnamon-ny & melt in your mouth goodness. My boyfriend inhaled his Glazed Donut and then immediately said, "That was the best donut I have ever had in my LIFE!" His cousin is a fan of the Jelly Donut which I also got to sneak a taste of...wow again!

And just when I thought the Apple Fritter was huge, I spot the ginormous donuts Yelper Kei H. was talking about. Bob's doesn't mess around, those donuts were the size of medium pizzas hahaha!

Damn, why can't all donut shops be as good as Bob's?!!? It's not faaaaair :(
author: Faye G.

description: So I finally tried the "famous donut" that everyone talks about. And to be honest, I was not  impressed at all. Donut  Tasted just like any other regular doughnut shop and plus is super pricey for a small donut. Not worth it at all.
author: Patrick S.

description: Truly a religious experience!  I stop by every time I'm in the neighborhood.  Super tasty doughnuts and awesome staff.  Keep doing great work, you guys!
author: Gloria L.

description: Having sampled donuts globally, I feel that I am uniquely qualified to award Bob's a full Five Homer rating.
author: Dan Q.

description: Buttermilk donuts are really to die for. So are the sour cream. Just ask for whatever's just come out so it's still hot- it's sure to be amazing. It's open all night and uses square. Also there's a microwave in case you want to warm up your donut anyway!
author: Cristina H.

description:
I heard this place was good, and its on the 7x7 list so me and a group of friends thought we'd give it a whirl. We made the drive out to the heart of the city instead of making the short trip to daly city krispy kreme.

We heard the apple fritter was the one to get, but the dude working suggested we get whatever is hot, and that's what we did. The maple cake donut was hot, so we got those. holy crap, let me tell you. ONE OF THE BEST DONUTS I'VE EVER HAD! First off, the texture and consistency is on point. A nice little crunch/crispiness to the outside, then soft and warm to seal the deal on the inside. The maple to top it off was sweet to perfection. Top that bad boy with a 2% milk, and that's something to cheer about after a rough day at the office. Bob's!!! I salute you!
author: Alvin P.

description:
I am in love and his name is Bob!

Open 24/7 to satisfy donut cravings any time, any day!! I love the old fashioned donut and I just recently discovered the humungo donuts that they make 12 am~3 am for all those late night barhoppers/party animals! ;) The workers are always super nice and helpful too!
author: Kei H.

description: Show at Palace of Fine Arts ended at about 9:30 and  we all agreed that we had a taste for donuts. Check Yelp for an open place and voila, Bob's. Long line outside, because the donuts are good or simply because it's open we wondered. Good selection although sadly out of custard filled. We bought a dozen assorted, including a couple so warm out of the dryer that the chocolate was melting away. Managed to wait until we got home to Oakland and the four of us ATE THEM ALL. The simple raised glazed were outstanding, the fresh cake ones were terrific. The lighter French style ones were a little soggy, likely not as fresh as the others but still pretty darn good. Bookmarking this place for the next time we get a donut craving in the middle of the night.
author: Dar V.

description: Club Bob's has free admission with donut purchase at the door. Stand in line and dress to impress because when the clubs start to shut down, club Bob's is open 24/7/
author: Burt H.

description: Came here yesterday night around 2 the wait was about 20 minutes but oh was it worth it. I love donuts and I've been to a lot of places including voodoo donuts in Portland and this place rocks the maple donut was amazing. Go here this is my new favorite go to donut spot
author: Adam B.

description: Not a donut fan, but the warm and fresh glazed buttermilk had a very pleasant taste to it. Still can't understand why there is a line for a donut shop at 12:30 AM!
author: Sasan A.

description:
I have always had a sweet tooth, and my favorite foods are always desserts, especially donuts! The best donuts here are the apple fritters.  Can't believe they make them fresh in the middle of the night! The donuts are always fresh and super tasty! The Groupon deal is awesome and I got a free t-shirt! 
I notched it down a star because it's a little worn on the inside and doesnt have the best atmosphere.
author: Megan A.

description:
Fresh, warm donuts. Mmmmmmmmmm.

I love this place and so happy it isn't in LA.  I would be here everyday.  Luckily, you can walk up and down hills in SF so you can burn off the fat consumed at this wondrous place.  Better than Voodoo.  Better than any other Mom and Pop donut shop.  Bob's Donut is ish!
author: Lauren T.

description: Bomb.com food was excellent and service was superb. The line out the door was telling that this place is definitely one that gets the local crowds.
author: Matthew H.

description:
I likey my donuts.  I really enjoy Bob's donuts but sometimes they are hit or miss.  I had an awesome crumb donut the other day, but I've had so-so chocolate donuts before from here.  It's definitely a huge difference when you get them fresh.  But if you come here late night there's a good chance you'll get some fresh donuts.

I really enjoy sitting at the counter and gettin a donut and some milk.  one day i will try to destroy the giant donut, one day.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Here's the thing, these people make an amazing glazed donut, by far the best I've ever had.
