I'm only giving them 2 stars though because other then the glazed their donuts are stale and down right flavorless.  If you want a fluffy piece of glazed heaven go here, if you want any other pastry try somewhere else (skip the place down the street, they're even worse).

Their Danish was stale, flavorless, lacking any sweetness and their croissant was the right flavor but the texture was all off, tasted like bread not folded buttery flakes.

Honestly I've been to about a dozen donut shops looking for a place that makes a decent Danish and/or croissant and am starting to think there isn't one in San Francisco.
author: Alvin B.

description: Thought I wasn't a fan of warm donuts... ok maybe there is a difference between hot and warm. Hot donuts are not for me. A warm glazed donut from Bob's? Perfection. This is not your average glazed donut. It's a good size, nice and puffy, one is enough to satisfy. It's sweet but not too sweet.
author: Kathleen M.

description: Best donuts. Best service. Best hours. Hahah. 24/7. I'd have the day the best times for super duper  hot n fresh out the kitchen donuts---come late night. My favs are chocolate bar or chocolate old fashioned. But the apple fritter is also right on the money!
author: Raquel F.

description:
The girl working the counter was so nice and it looks like its a family owned business so that is ALWAYS a plus because I love to support those mom & pop shops.

We came here after bar hopping and they were doing fresh donuts out of the fryer and everyone liked their donuts. They were your ordinary donuts nothing special except that HUGE donut that we did not buy lol.

I had their apple fritter which was basically a oil sponge :/ 

The place is great if you are super high or drunk.
author: Patrick N.

description: damn. had three different donuts and did not share!
author: Sweets N.

description: The maple bar was one of the best donuts I've ever eaten. So good! Glazed & cinnamon roll were average.
author: Dannah K.

description: Perfection! Warm, fluffy and warm when served to me. Visiting from Santa Barbara yelped around me and Bob's donuts came up with great reviews. Made the walk there from my hotel on Lombard ; every step was worth the exquisite glazed donut that brought sweet joy to my palate. First time here but not my last. Best donuts I will ever have. You must experience for yourself!
author: Aleida R.

description:
THEY HAVE HUGE DONUTS!!! I would think that a donut of that size would be very dense and yucky, but not at all!!! It's FLUFFY and light. It's not as sweet as Krispy Kremes, which I think is a plus. They were recognized on 7x7 i believe for their apple fritters, so I had to try it. I guess the flavors were compromised since I didn't eat it FRESH out of the kitchen I guess. But I'm planning to try it again! 

Also, owners are nice!
author: Tina S.

description: We tried the old fashioned donuts, fresh out of the fryer, coated in maple and chocolate this weekend.  They were very crispy, which was nice, but also extremely oily.  I guess I prefer light, airy donuts to crispy, oily ones.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Maybe I went at the wrong time...but I've had much better donuts.

I went to Bob's around 9pm with my friend after she recommended it.
I was really excited to have some donuts and you could smell them frying about a block away. Coming into the shop you get a glimpse of the glorious assortment of donuts: maple and chocolate dipped, french crullers, etc.

I got a glazed donut and my friend got some donut holes.

My donut was stiff and unremarkable. The donut holes were just as bad. I was pretty disappointed. Had the donut hid the spot, I would have probably bought a dozen to bring back home.

I have had much better donuts at chains. I will give it another shot; I might have just gone at the wrong time or something . At least the donut only set me back 85 cents.

I have had much better donuts.
author: Augusto T.

description:
FFFFF....what did I do?!?! 

Last night I was on my way from Bullit to Mayes when my nose picked up the scent of sweet freshly baked donuts whafting from a nearby shop. In no time I tracked it down and walked in to (well stumbled really) Bob's Donuts.  My senses were overwhelmed with delight as I scanned over all the sinful pastries. I took one look at the apple fritter and within minutes I owned that splendid sugary sweet goodness. 

Was it worth the 790 Calories (yes, I googled it)? Abso-freakin-lutely!!
author: Kristy M.

description:
I was new to San Francisco and wanted to take Anna and the boys to get donuts on the way to school one morning.  I was still learning the City so I looked up donut places on Google Maps to see which ones were on my route.  There was one named Bob's Donuts that was perfectly positioned. I clicked on the name and to my surprise I found myself on a Yelp page devoted to reviews of Bob's Donuts.  There was a whole screenful of Yelp reviews.  Wow! This was amazing. Who would bother to write a review of a donut place? 

I must have spent 20 minutes reading reviews for Bob's Donut Shop. There were 1048 reviews in all. They were so entertaining that I didn't even look at any other donut place. How could a donut joint attract 1,048 reviews?  To get somebody to write a single review, that would be pretty hard work.  To get over 1,000 seemed impossible.  I wondered how long it had taken to earn that many reviews.  I flipped back to the 1,048th review.  It had been authored by Stephanie D. on September 16, 2009, just over two years ago.  That worked out to more than a review a day.  I tried to imagine who wrote the reviews, but I couldn't really make it sensible. The only explanation I could think of was that the donuts at Bob's were just so amazingly unique that people were literally compelled to write.  I had to go there.

When I took Anna and boys there the next morning, I was as excited as if I were 12 years old.  This place had to be great, though you couldn't tell it by looking. The shop was about 20 feet wide.  There was a long counter that ran the length of it.  On one side were racks where the donuts were stored once they come out of the kitchen.  On the other side there were old fashioned soda fountain stools along a long counter.  Anna and the boys sat on the stools and turned around in circles while we waited for service.  

We all had donuts, theirs covered with chocolate, mine with sugar. They ordered a "side" of donut holes. Though it is hard to imagine that any donut could live up the hype that was contained in Yelp, the donuts were really good.   But best of all, after we had been there 5 minutes, the woman who was running the place asked me if I was going to be there for another 5 minutes. I said I would. She asked if I would mind if she left to move her car. 

I said that I would be honored. She walked out and left me in charge of Bob's. I rooted for customers to arrive - where were all these thousands of Bob lovers when I needed them? - but sadly after 10 minutes she was back and I had to turn the nuclear codes back over to her without a single transaction. But I was very satisfied with every aspect of Bob' Donuts.
author: Jay D.

description:
The woman behind the counter complained about my purchase of $8.75 worth of donuts - because we initially wanted a few pieces, but decided to buy more donuts - which meant we needed a box.  She complained to another customer behind us - never looking at us - about how we cause her to "waste" one paper bag worth 10 cents.  She continued to complain to this other person and how she wanted charge us for the wasted paper bag.

I prefer to buy from small businesses, but I draw the line at being made an object of ridicule.  I won't ever buy from this donut shop again.
author: G. T.

description: Walking from North Beach to Bobs burned off just enough calories to neutralize about.....one bite of that Apple Fritter. Even cold and sitting out, that was one of the best pieces of fried goodness I've had this year. When it is warm out of the fryer, its deadly. The freshly made choco glazed and maple glazed were crispy but cakey, totally solid. Their yeast donuts are denser and not quite as good as Krispy Kreme but still tasty. Open 24 hours and 85c a pop (can you think of ANYTHING you can get for 85c anymore?) makes this place ideal for stoners, drunks, cheapskates, and people with no regard for their coronary arteries.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
Crullers and apple fritters 24 hours a day?! I don't even like donuts but this place makes my mouth water just thinking about it.

Just go and judge for yourself it's so cheap so you really have nothing to lose.
author: JC C.

description: APPLE FRITTER. Oh my, you magnificent doughy goodness. I'll take five.
author: Will Z.

description:
I don't 'DO' donuts...let's get this straight- okay?
But I will 'Do' Bob's Donuts....not to be confused with Bob's Burgers (which is a cartoon).
The donuts here are delectable. I mean really, really good....there are many options beyond the standard apple fritter and glazed...they have lemon meringue things, raspberry strudel  thinga-magigs, and one giant donut that makes you think "where is this going to go?"
So get out of bed today you lazy bum and get a donut from Bob's!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Its a law of nature that donuts taste better at 4am. 

So while on a late night/early morning adventure with my friends, Bob's was the best place we could have ever stopped for a snack. Their glazed donuts were hands down the best I ever had. It was so soft and doughy. We also tried their cake donuts and maple bar. 

It makes complete sense that people are chilling at Bob's at 4 in the morning. If I didn't live in San Jose, I would be there a lot more frequently.
author: Courtney C.

description:
Smelled good. But their apple fritter didn't live up to the hype. 

Bonus cause it's open 24 hours. But my 5 star apple fritter goes to California Bakery. I think it's because they cooked it for less time than Bob's.
author: Emily D.

description: Wow.  Just wow.   This place is amazing.  Get a HOT donut if u can!!!!!  Last night I had the chocolate dipped crawler.  Fabulous.  Gooey , doughy , awesome.   Had a bite of a chocolate croissant too which was bomb.  It was an orgasmic expertise.   Open 24:7 , its an SF must.  Stop at kozy Kar bar first down the street and then cap your night here.  sit at the coffee bar with a milk.   Damn my mouth is watering just thinking about them.
author: T L.

description:
Probably 3.5...

Came here with Brian C. on a break from a late night photo shoot.  It's a neat concept to have so many donuts ready to go for the drunken clubbers who want donuts to soak up all the alcohol in their systems at 2 in the morning.  The place had this interesting mist of shortening filling the air which somewhat obscured the back of the room.

I got a buttermilk, a meringue and a cherry cobbler.  The buttermilk was a bit off... must have been an off night, because Brian C. swore by them, and he's more of a donut connoisseur than me.  The meringue was pretty standard.  The cherry cobbler was pretty good, with a good portion of cherries and a very flaky (lotsa shortening) crust.

This is an old fashioned place run by a few asian folks who work very hard.  It was kinda cool to have a seat at one of the barstools at the counter to just eat donuts.  Felt like they were properly respected, or something.

See my pix of the giant donut!

Tip: if it's late, park on Van Ness a block over.  There always seems to be a spot or two.
author: Wayne Q.

description:
We had been here 2 other times before, and the first time we had one of their apple fritters, they had been freshly made, straight out of the oven, and AMAZING. We had stopped by late at night, after having sushi across the street. 

Our second time, we didn't show up at the perfect time, so we didn't score donuts fresh out of the oven, and our experience dropped from AMAZING, to "okay".

Our third, and LAST time, we scored the "fresh out of the oven" warm apple fritters again, but we also scored a long, black hair embedded into the donut.  Tip: If when you are trying to pull a piece of donut off to eat, and it isn't pulling apart smooth and easy, like it normally would, as if something is keeping it stuck together.... LOOK CLOSELY -- you might be about to rip apart, and eat a long black HAIR!!!! :-O.  Luckily, that hair was good and strong, and was battling me, from trying to tear off a piece of donut ;)

My husband took the donut back, and they gave him 2 more donuts, and said they were sorry.

The worst part was... we had earlier in the day eaten at a Thai restaurant in Sausalito, and there was a hair embedded into the food there too -- and the owner didn't even apologize (read my review, to get the full, unbelievable story).

We had purchased about $15 worth of donuts, and were going to give some to the kids, as a major treat --- since it is SO RARE for us to eat donuts to begin with.  And, now it will be that much more rare!  We ended up throwing away the donuts, we were so turned off by this experience.

Restaurant cooks, and bakery cooks, should wear a HAIR NET!!!!

I noticed another review for Bob's Donuts on 1/23/2012 by Laurie, that also had a hair caramelized into her apple fritter glaze.  Who knows how many others are out there, not bothering to review, and warn us about the hair-glazed donuts?

The place is kind of dumpy looking, and they do not have public restrooms.
author: Tina I.

description: Rudest cashier ever!!! I know a lot of people voted it the best donut in San Francisco. However, the lady was so rude to me. The first time I was there, I pointed to a donut and asked gently "the classic donut". The lady answered,"there is no classic donut, why don't you find the name online and come back." ??? Really that was the answer? Just couldn't believe. There is no menu anywhere, no label I can take a look of the donut names. Then, the second time, I still wanted to try, the same thing happened AGAIN.
author: Song G.

description:
As is the case with most donuts, delicious when served fresh and hot, straight from the fryer. If you can't wake up at 6am for fresh donuts from other donut shops, then you still have chance. Come to Bob's after 10pm.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Bob's - growing up, you used to be my favorite. I'd always look across the street at you while my parents were buying groceries at Big Apple. On good days, I would get to stop in and have a donut or two, or six. As I grew older, I appreciated how you would stay open late at night, so I could come by after a night out on the town.

Over time, after I moved out of the neighborhood, we grew apart. I'm not sure if my taste buds changed, or if your recipes changed, but I can no longer. Your donuts are just too sweet for me now. I still drive by on occasion and see you filled with customers - and I'm happy for you.

Thank you for the fond memories, and for always filling the neighborhood with the sweet smells of deep fried sugary goodness.
author: Tony L.

description:
So we had just finished a late dinner with some friends and we had driven by Bob's Donut & pastry shop before we found parking. I don't know if it was the sign out front or the fact that there were people in the donut shop at 11:30pm at night but something gravitated me towards going in there despite the fact that I had already eaten dessert.

The aroma of donuts is one of the most delicious scents...yumm...and I a simple whiff inside brought me to sugary bliss. We ordered a hot cross bun and a bear claw. I really wanted the apple fritter but didn't see it as it was close to midnight.

Both the hot cross bun and bear claw were delicious. This is one of the best donuet places I have ever eaten at!
author: Betty C.

description:
Some people say the apple fritters are the best thing they make here, but in my opinion, the glazed donuts are where it's at. They taste like real donuts. It takes eating a donut like Bob's to realize how many not-donuts you've been eating. And if you were me, you had been eating a lot of not-donuts.

I bring anyone I can to Bob's donuts. Getting the freshest donut of any kind does depend on time of day. So come back all the time to see what's baking.
author: Halley S.

description:
My friend & I went here for a midnight snack. The French donuts were in the process of being dipped, instead of giving us the ones on display, she gave us the fresh ones. Their crumb donut is amazing as well.

The price was fair enough. They had a huge selection of donuts.

This is a good place for a late night adventure.
author: Hazel N.

description: Ordered my birthday donut last week paid a deposit and went in to pick up today.  When I got there I was told they had sold it and that it was my fault for not being there on time to pick it up.  Thought being I left a deposit all would be ok...or thought being they hadnmy phone number they would have called!
author: Tim B.

description:
After a long and literally sweet filled night of "dessert hopping" we chose Bob's to be the last stop! Why? Because if you haven't heard in the middle of the night they make fresh donuts! The magic starts around 1am, but what you're waiting for, is the gigantic cake sized donut, which comes in an array of flavors and feeds 4 easily. My personal reason to go though, would be for the  apple fritters which start dropping in at 1:40am and can be served piping hot at 1:48! 

The staff is really friendly, nice and they do a great job considering most of the people they deal with at that hour are usually drunk and loud. Get there a bit before the clubs get out and you're guaranteed your choice on any of the fresh donuts! If what you're looking for isn't ready yet and you don't want to wait in line when you finally see it drop into the fryer, prepay and ask for what you want, and the cashier will hand it to you once your delicious donut is ready!

Great late night stop to try out, whether you're sobering up or got a simple case of the sweet sweet munchies, Bob's is the place to go!
author: Jon K.

description: I got the giant donut and it was delicious. Served 6 people and we still had some leftover. It was very fluffy, very full, and very good. Highly recommended!
author: Ryan G.

description: Best donuts I've ever had hands down. The cinnamon cake donut, the chocolate glazed cake donut and the apple fritter are Ahhhhh-maxing. If you are in the area, and pass up going here.....your taste buds will hate you.
author: Kirtan U.

description:
Five stars for donuts? Really? I mean, I understand they are delicious, but really, when was the last time you had a sugar coated fried pastry that wasn't delicious? Bob's donuts have something more that makes them stupid good. 

My girlfriend, her roommate, and I walked in during a hectic pride weekend somewhere between 1am-2am. here was a line at the door that evaporated within a minute or two. The woman at the register was friendly, and even though there was a line, and I had yet to make my decision, I didn't feel rushed. I got a chocolate donut and a maple donut, my girlfriend got a chocolate, and her roommate got a lemon thing.

The smells coming out of the storefront were literally mouth watering, so after the woman behind the counter put our freshly fried donuts in the bag, I snatched one up, and began to devour it.

Oh god. My arteries are clogging at the thought of wolfing another one of these donuts down, in the best way possible of course. Imagine Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory in your mouth, without, you know, Willy Wonka being a bastard.

Probably the best, most fried thing I've ever eaten. Donut itself wasn't oozing oil, like other places (in my area) typically do - but hey, if you're eating a donut, it kind of comes with the territory - but this was a happy surprise. The inside was soft and airy, not at all dough-y or undercooked. the texture is what really sets Bob's aside; these are artesenal donuts, akin to $9 bottles of Voss tap water, only infinitely better, and way cheaper. 

The glaze was sweet without screaming diabetes; this is oft over looked, as when people think of donuts they think of sugary heart attacks. I really enjoyed the chocolatey bits as much as I enjoyed the cake bits; to have both come together in such a sweet, sweet union is almost too good to believe.

I want to go back and get an apple fritter; I've heard many gluttonous things about them. I hear they have great donut bars and cookies as well. Also, if you're lucky, you can see them deep fry one of their humongous donuts.

For those of you who expect healthy, green, non-carbon based donuts, this is not for you. This is for donut connoisseurs, manly men and women (or womanly men and manly women, its in the tender nob and all..)

All in all, delicious and worth the trip. Highly recommended.
author: Dan T.

description: BEST donuts I've ever had! Seriously, if you're in the area you have to stop. Definitely try the apple fritters, and if they're making anything fresh buy it! We also tried the crumb donut, and cinnamon sugar donut. Can't wait to return!
author: Lindsay S.

description:
Amazing doughnuts - apple fritters are to die for. Some might find the doughnuts very greasy and heavy but it's the real thing!
However they don't produce every doughnuts every day (no jelly doughnuts some days).
author: Will M.

description: Donuts are hot and fresh. Open 24/7, so they don't have the entire menu available all day. Kind of get what we got type place. Love how the donuts are done so the crust is crispy on the outside
author: Brian M.

description:
THEE best donut 95 cents can buy. Period. 

Hot, fresh, dripping glaze, melt-in-your-mouth at 1:30 in the f'n morning donuts. 

You might get mooned by a shirt-wearing-hooker, stirring her coffee 3 feet from your foaming tongue, but... that's a minuscule price to pay for this hot, creaminess in your mouth... wait. -_-

For FIVE BUCKS- I also bought the *pictured* pink box-sized glaze donut for my kiddos, who slept soundly in their beds, while Mommy trekked down the mean, under-policed streets of SF, in the pouring rain, barely able to see (due to alcohol, um, consumption), dodging homeless humpers and pimps, hopping in and out of bars for protection, being forced to eat ridiculously, um,  good Victor's Pizza and too-hot-to-touch donuts because it was the only thing open... oh, the painful memories... 

AND they fricken DEVOURED it. And, asked for another. 

*****
DISCLAIMER: No one was harmed during the devouring of this donut. During either donut trip. And, we understand that it's hard out here for a pimp, so we suggest you get a day job.
author: Kiki I.

description: Incredible. Coconut bar is a must!! So bloody good. Service is legit and Andrew is simply a legend!!!!
author: Amit D.

description:
Guess what I was told should be my New Years resolution for 2010??  

"Naomi, only eat 1 Bob's Donut a week....not 3, not 5.  Just 1."  

Yes, dead serious.  I know, so cruel.  Eating just ONE Bob's Donut is nearly impossible.  After 1, you just can't resist eating 5 more.  Everything is amazing.  The glazed donuts are glazed and fluffed to perfection, the old fashioned are just the right amount of firmness and softness...cover it with some glaze or chocolate and you're good to go.  The cinnamon rolls have just the right amount of sugar, spice, and stickiness to outdo cinabbon any day.  The apple fritter is not too sweet, not too sour - as goldilocks would say - just right.  The donuts taste amazing when you first get them (bc they are baked fresh and hot out of the oven), but they taste amazing even a few hours later too.  Even the next day.  I swear.

I would be lying if I said that Bob's Donuts didn't give me incentive to live where I do in SF.  Being able to walk past this place every morning and evening is one of the highlights of my day (this might sound pitiful, but don't pity me because I'm happy about it lol).  The ladies that work this place are very sweet and are always ready with their wax paper and paper bag.  To the point that you feel like you're taking too long to decide what you want, so you just order everything that looks good.  Which isn't bad when that craving for late night munchies hits :P

P.S. Don't get this place confused for Bob's Burgers which is 2 doors down....and no, I don't think it's the same Bob.
author: Naomi P.

description: I can never pass up an apple fritter, but what took me to a special place was the maple butter milk bar.  Sounds weird but was beyond what I ever expected.  Wasn't long in San Fran but went here twice.  That good.
author: Jared M.

description: Following the great reviews on Yelp, I decided to to give it a try. Not dissapointed! A good selection of donuts and pastries, nice looking and nice smelling. But most importantly all 3 choices I took were equally delicious.
author: Audrey B.

description: My friends and I were headed on a road trip to LA and at 4am we were needing a sugar and coffee fix so before coming to pick me up they went to Bob's and surprised me with an APPLE FRITTER  OMG I instantly fell in love if was the most amazing donut I've ever had and who doesn't love a good donut? It was still warm, crispy, not too sweet or sour, just pure perfection! I must admit I haven't had one since then because I'm trying to be good but there nothing wrong with day dreaming about Bobs donuts all day everyday
author: Rita A.

description: I came in to order a hot fresh donut and saw a roach on the wall. I needed to go on a diet anyway.
author: Court S.

description: I didn't think donuts could taste this good. I have tried the regular donuts, cake donuts, and old-fashioned donuts-- all of which are AMAZING. The shop is open 24/7 and the prices are extremely reasonable!
author: Fiana L.

description:
Run Forest Run....

A little over a mile away from the hotel, and armed with the knowledge that I would have to pass through the Tenderloin (imagine skid row), I was prepared to run like a cheatah. 

During my sprint, various emotions including sadness and empathy vacillate throughout my soul as I notice men and women on the streets of San Francisco (SF) incoherent and mentally dulled by narcotics. I wanted to hug them and tell them that it was going to be ok.

Fortunately, I reach Bob's Donuts without a physical encounter. Phew!!

As I am trying to order my donuts a man behind me is attempting to engage me with an arsenal of questions: "do you workout? How does that outfit work for you? Does it keep you warm?" As he checks out my posterior. I lose patience, but I also don't want to provoke him. 

The lovely lady behind the counter is not helpful as she also comments on my physique, "you have no stomach." "So flat".  All I can think is, "Oh brother".

The donuts: glazed donut - provocative, light but dense. Implodes upon slight pressure. Sugared twist - ethereal, light and delicious. Apple fritter - delicious, as it is crispy and possesses great texture and flavor. 

I took a taxi back to the hotel because I did not want to provide a second opportunity to the potential dangers lurking. Why test the waters again? 

Namaste!
author: MiYun C.

description:
This is, by far, hands down, in all of San Francisco, the BEST donut shop ever. Why? Here's why:

-Everytime I crave for a donut, this place is open. No matter what time it is. Noon? Yes. 3am? Yes. Always open!
-The freshly baked glazed donuts will top Krispy Kreme's airhead glazed "Hot Now" donuts anytime, any day!
-Have I mentioned the apple fritters? Dear jeebus, THE APPLE FRITTERS ARE THE BEST! Especially when it's warm and soft and with the the right amount of sweetness. Yum.
-This place is just a couple of blocks away from Polk St's nightlife. Wanna get sugar high before hitting Lush Lounge? Step right in here! It's waaaay cheaper than pregaming at 95 cents per donut! Want an after club snack after Mayes? Chances are, Bob's is still waiting for you with freshly baked goodies!

*Only downside is that they only accept cash. But it's all good because like I said, 95 cents per donut! Check the backseat of your car, beg people for spare change, dig through your pockets and the bottom of your purses! That's as good as it gets!
author: Michelle B.

description:
I heard good things about Bob's- 1. open 24 hours, and 2. you can buy a giant donut. 

I came into Bob's after a night on Polk, and shivered outside in the line looking in like a starving child. (They have a great location for those with drunchies!). Options, options, options! What donut do I get?? I couldn't decide between the Apple Fritter or the Maple Old Fashioned, and my friend kept saying "You won't come back for a long time" so I naturally opted for both. 

The Maple Old Fashioned was ahhhh-mazing!! So fresh and good. Would definitely get it again. 

The Apple Fritter....makes me not want to come back to Bob's. I ripped a hunk of it off and the moment I bit into it, my mouth filled with oil. I couldn't believe it! I don't think I've ever eaten anything so oily in my life. Gross. Some people may be into that, but waaaay too greasy for my tasting. 

I left Bob's on a disgusting, sad note. My friend was right- I won't be coming back for a long time.
author: Christine A.

description:
I approve the comments below- refer to those. 
P.S. just remember to do some workout after all that sugar and grease.
author: DeesQue N.

description:
I had seen how highly rated Bob's Donut was on Yelp, while we were looking at places to eat, and pushed it into the back of mind since we weren't really looking for donuts. But when we walked by and I saw the giant donut in the display window, I couldn't resist going in and eating a donut. So I dragged my husband in, and we bought 2 old fashioned (regular size) donuts from an extremely cranky lady. 

The donuts were still warm from the oven and oh by golly! They were marvelous. Each bite literally melted in my mouth. I wanted to go back there and eat a giant donut for dinner, but my husband reminded me that we had agreed to meet someone for dinner, and I couldn't really do that. Now, back in Michigan, I dream about those delicious donuts, and am on a failing-hunt to find Bob's Michigan equivalent. 

The amazing-ness of those donuts negates the star removal for the cranky lady and the fact that the store was a little on the dirty side.
author: Natasha P.

description:
I just don't get it. Why all the rave reviews?

I've had Bob's about 3 times, each time hoping that I will somehow have this gustatory revelation that will make me one of the many who have fallen in love with Bob. Alas, this was not meant to be so.

I've sampled several donuts. I've sampled their apple fritter. I've had it when they weren't fresh, I've had it when they were piping hot from the oven. I've had it sober, I've had it stumbling drunk (that STILL didn't change my mind!). Every time I just feel like Bob's is just a small step over your average donut shop. 

Perhaps I'm just not a donut person.
author: Sally T.

description: Forget about everything in the window. Just get whatever is freshly made. It will be amazing, regardless of what donut type it is
author: Monica S.

description: This place is a staple on Polk St for late night donuts. I see lines almost every night of the week, with people loading up on sugar both before and after hitting the bars. Inside is very low frills, with maybe a dozen or so seats to plop down in to chow down on some fresh made donuts.
author: Thomas D.

description:
As we're walking to our car we see a line outside this place. Well if there;s a line outside a place in the city, my husband thinks  - "this place must be worth it"- so we get in line. Mind you, we're totally full and have already had dessert and its only 11:30 pm. 

I yelp to see if its worth- and see the stars!

so we wait. luckily it was only a 5 min line. So thanks to the quick review of the reviews- I get the apple fritter and my husband loves french crillers so he gets that. 

the criller was not up my alley- it tasted a little oily. But I was also sober. so maybe it is good. But the apple fritter was awesome! I was hungry so we had a few bites and then I savored the rest of it in the morning with my coffee. Great way to start the day!
author: Komal B.

description:
Oh my lord. Finding a place that is open late isn't always easy.... finding an amazing place that's open late is even harder. 

Finding an amazing place open late that has DONUTS? This is madness. 

NO It's Bob's Donuts. This place blew my socks off on the first visit. My mouth is watering just thinking about their cheese danish. The likes of which are unknown anywhere else in California.

Every time I'm in the city and having a bad day Bob's is the perfect pick-me-up. Never disappoints. 

I'm not even going to bother writing about the staff, seating, location, lighting, parking etc. all you need to know is that the donuts are de-friggin-licious. 

STOP READING THIS. GO NOW.
author: Riza K.

description: My friend took me here on a random night after dinner.  Just so you know, I don't even like donuts but my friend kept saying it's the most amazing thing ever.  He was not wrong.  I tried the chocolate covered donut and OH MY FREAKING FOOD GOOD. It was the most orgasmic donut I've ever had.  From the crispy texture of the outside to the the soft, WARM, melt-in-your-mouth texture inside of that first bite, I was HOOKED and wish we'd gotten more.  Can't wait to come back and try some more.  Just wished there was another one somewhere closer to me because I don't often go into the area D:
author: Lisa L.

description: I always get the glazed donut. This place did not fall short. Especially when it's open late for the drunkies like myself to venture to. The donut was light and a little fluffy with the crisp glazed exterior.
author: Christina L.

description: Went to Bobs Donuts @ 1:45am to get some fresh donuts and everything was excellent! Especially the bear claws.. Go in the early morning for super fresh, mouth watering, delectable donuts ;)
author: Melinda N.

description:
True to the enthusiastic late night crowd declaration, Bob's is best visited after having a few drinks and after midnight. I came here at midnight when the chef was pulling fresh donuts out of the fryer for glazing and powdering. The nice cashier gave us donuts hot and soft from the chef's tray and fresh donuts are awesome! 85 cent donut to boot.
They still slice donuts in half and spoon in jelly or custard and call this abomination a jelly donut or eclair. They still serve stale donuts in the afternoon. Therefore, I will meet them halfway with my star rating.
author: Carrie H.

description:
A 24-hour donut shop in San Francisco that serves up the BEST Apple Fritter? What more can you ask for! 

All you need to know are two words when you walk into the door...
1. Apple
2. Fritter

It's seriously the best donut you will ever have. It's perfectly sweet and crunchy on the outside, and super soft on the inside with the perfect balance of cinnamon and apple chunks. They usually have freshly baked apple fritters since it's one of their popular donuts. 

The bread pudding is also worth trying! I'm not a huge bread pudding person myself, but their bread pudding actually had me wanting more! 

They also have an extra large glazed or chocolate frosted donut you can bring home to share, or if you dare, eat by yourself. It's literally the size of a large cake. The lines can get long, but it goes by fast since people are just ordering a couple donuts to scarf down. If you're ordering a dozen, or more, you can call ahead and they will put it together so you can just pick it up.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Not impressed.  Way too much yeast.  Way too sweet.  Grimy store. Unfriendly cashier. I won't be back.
author: Greg J.

description:
Wanted to love this place given the awesome number of high Yelp ratings. 

I bet these would've tasted awesome fresh out of the oven... but we got them late in the afternoon so they were already cooled. 

The texture and consistency of the cruellers were good as well as the donought holes. 

A small annoyance was that the cashier said that I might as well not order anything because I only wanted 1 doughnut hole and then reiterated stories on how people order half doughnuts and who wants to buy a half doughnut anyway. That was pretty rude - she could just tell me that they didn't sale just one and be done with it. 

But aside from that, the doughnuts were good, but probably better fresh and probably better if we weren't already full. :)
author: Mimi C.

description:
We came in @8am on a Saturday! Looks like it's been here forever. It's located right across Sushi Rock (yum) & (ahem) Good Vibrations.

We ordered a regular chocolate glazed donut, apple fritter, & coffee. The apple fritter was HUGE. The three of us shared it...had the right amount of apple and cinnamon.

The woman cashier was super friendly. Gave me a little history & info on the shop...they've been around since the 60's. They bake everything fresh & their busiest times are @night. Guess when everyone's done partying or what not, they pass by Bob's for some freshly baked goodies. I don't blame them. For the 20 minutes we were there, they had lots of people come in, lookin like more locals which was nice to see.

Bottom line: Bob's is a local SF gem & favorite!
author: Joy A.

description: Bob's ratings really speak for themselves: 2042 reviews with a 4.5 star average (at time of writing). Needless to say, Bob's is a loved destination among my friends, whether it be a Sunday morning or after a late night out. Even in the rain, the line stretches out the door.
author: Jay T.

description: Ordered Bob's Donuts as a secondary dessert for my wedding. We got raised glazed, raised crumb and cake crumb. These were a huge hit and the leftovers were clutch the next morning! Love, love, love Bob's donuts!
author: Erica L.

description: I don't get it. I've been by a couple times now and each time the selection was pretty depleted, regardless of what time we stopped by. If you're open 24 hours, shouldn't you constantly be replenishing the goods? Instead, I've yet to see any filled bars or buttermilk donuts. I've seen apple fritters - once. We went to dinner and when we came back, they were gone! Oh well. The crullers are decent but avoid the puffy glazed - they taste bitter and have a chemical aftertaste. Selection is pretty limited once you hit 4pm, which normally would make sense for a business that closes at 5 or 6pm, but when you're open 24/7 there's no excuse!
author: Bella L.

description:
Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop offers one a-ok Apple Fritter. 

My first trip to Bob's was just a few days ago & while my eyes were definitely telling me to get lots, the Apple Fritter was so big, my tummy knew that 1 would be enough 

We had an all-day offsite in the area so my fritter sat around most of the day but didn't dry out. A bit crunchy on the outside & soft on the inside - glaze didn't flake all over the place but stayed on the pastry. Not a lot of apple flavor but it was sweet & flavorful nonetheless 

I have a sneaking suspicion that many of these super high ratings come from the hoards of drunkards who frequent this place late at night - in combination with the freshly cooked up goodies coming out late at night.....much like how Krispy Kreme is good *only* when fresh out of the cooker but *nasty* ( not to my taste ) once it cools 

Maybe one of these days, I will get over my nerdy self & make it over late, late night to try a freshly glazed goodie & then understand the huge accolades 

Until then, definitely looking forward to trying more of their delish donutty offerings
author: Adrienne G.

description:
After a decade, I finally made my way back to Bob's. My one fond memory was their apple fritter. Unfortunately, the current day apple fritter barely had any apple :( 

The donuts are decent but nothing special
author: Peter L.

description:
Bob - you get 5 stars for making the best apple fritter in town.

TIP: Warm up your apple fritter in the convenient microwave for 30 seconds and eat it with a small carton of non-fat milk. That will balance out those calories...haha right?!
author: Monica Y.

description: I decided to go to Bob's on National Donut Day (didn't even realize that was a thing).  The line was out the door at 11:30pm.  Apparently, they make fresh batches of donuts late at night, so the drunk/club crowd always gets in line for a late night snack.  The fresh donuts were buttermilk donuts.  Not particularly a fan of that kinda donut, but since it was fresh, I couldn't turn it down.  I got a maple buttermilk, and oh good God...it was spectacular.  Fresh, moist, not overly iced with sugar.  That's the way all donuts should taste.
author: Gina J.

description:
Imagine you've just wandered out of a show at Red Devil Lounge and furiously trying to decide whether you should head to New Sun Hong Kong, or just go home and pass out.  Then the sweet smell of fried dough wafts into your nostrils and the decision has been made for you.

There are no unique or inventive donuts here... just a wide variety of standards.  I went with the maple-buttermilk and washed it down with some Berkeley Farms chocolate milk.  Yum!
author: Chad T.

description:
whatever you get here will be fresh if its still not hot. I have no certain recommendations but certainly  whatever i tried in this place over the years, are great and worth to try.
Note that after-bar hours on weekends the line gets long..
Like i said worth it...
author: Lyra S.

description: If you are craving a donut,  this is the place to go! The donuts were fresh and warm, but just remember to bring cash.
author: Monica C.

description:
We travelled half way around the earth to try these donuts, and we weren't disappointed.  Do try and get there just after baking though - eating these cold is just not the same.

If I had to gripe about anything, it would be the absence of real coffee - these treats would go down beautifully with a cafe latte.

But yes, in short, if you're in SF, forget Krispy Kreme and run to this place.
author: Kristian H.

description:
OMG!!!!  SOOOOO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!

lemon filed, soft light and gooey!  Amazingly excellent!

apple fritter, wonderfully delightful! moist, flavorful, the best!

glazed twist, what can I say, the best I've ever had. 

pecan roll, okay.  nutty but a little dry.

2 lemon filled, 1 apple fritter, 1 glazed twist, 1 pecan roll, $10.90.

Service was great.

Hard time finding street parking.

Overall, it was amazing.  Come here again? I would move in if they let me.
author: shannon t.

description: This place has really good pastries for such a good price! The workers here are also very polite. I ordered a cinnamon bun, a glazed donut, and something else, but I don't remember what it was. It was sweet and powdery though! The lady who took my order was very polite and patient while taking my order and looking for what I wanted. When I got my pastries, I finally took a bite out of the cinnamon bun first, and it was DELICIOUS. Instantly finished it! I then took a bite out of the glazed donut, and that was just as delicious. Lastly, I then took a bite out of the sweet, powdery pastry, (once again, I don't remember what it is) and that was pretty good too. I'll be back! :)
author: Cara H.

description:
After hearing Xue & Stan rant and rave about Bob's, I dragged my bf to go with me. This place is a tiny hole in the wall with homeless people around, but the donuts are (as Rachael Ray would say) "YUM-O". 

I went to Bob's twice and so far I haven't been able to catch them bring out the fresh & hot donuts. The donuts I've tried so far are chocolate old fashion, cinammon donut, glaze old fashion, and old fashion. My bf tried the donuts with custard, chocolate old fashion, and cinammon twist. My favorite so far is the chocolate old fashion. The first time I went into Bob's I saw a big donut and was so tempted to buy it. I think one day I will get it.

After reading a bunch of reviews by fellow Yelpers, I'm going to have to try their apple fritter since people said it's good.
author: Candice H.

description:
The absolute best!  

An old school establishment that knows how to craft a simply amazing donuts. Not to mention, they are just around $1/piece. My favorite is the classic cake with frosting and sprinkles. 

I LOVE BOBS!
author: Katie J.

description:
I dropped by at 10 PM on a Sunday night, and experienced this delectable pastry here they call the Apple Fritter. I was beyond stuffed from a heavy dinner, but I decided to try it out. One bite into that sucker and my appetite reappeared!

It's buttery and surprisingly light, and the glaze on the outside is just right! To be honest, I'm not really sure where the apple comes from. I mean there's a few chunks of carmelized apple in the center, but when you're biting into that amazing light and fluffy fried dough, you can hardly taste the apple at all.

It's also $1.75. At the counter I ready to take out 3 one dollar bills, and was pleasantly surprised at the low cost of it. I'm definitely coming back again.
author: Alan C.

description:
Every day Imma Frittering, Frittering, Frittering. (is that even a word?? lol )

If i did that i would be super fat!! 

The Apple Fritters here are huge and deeeeeelicious!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Best. Apple Fritters. Ever. 

They do their baking around 9-9:30pm, so late night is the best time to get fresh donuts.  I prefer my donuts a few hours later, so midday was a good time for me to go.  This place is no frills but does the donut world justice.  A SF must!
author: Genevieve M.

description: Get the apple fritter, dont think twice, dont look at anything else. Enjoy the fritter and explore the other offerings on your next visit
author: Stephen C.

description:
I had reviewed Bob's and had given 4 stars.  But the previous review had disappeared. 

Anyway,  I came by to get a treat after a long critical mass ride on the last Friday of June. 

The last time I was there was about a year ago. . 

I got there at 10 till 10 and the limited seating was already filled.  The windows was somewhat empty  with 2 full trays of Apple fritters,  a couple of donuts and not much else.  Looks like I'll get a Fritta'.  To my surprise it was warm and semi-crunchy. Thank god it wasn't super sweet.  But... 
 Yes there's a but when things get good.  I didn't know why it's rather oily.  I figured they had fry it like 15 minutes ago but it shouldn't be that oily.  I wouldn't have minded the oiliness if the fritter was more crunchy. It was on the soggy side.  Last thing was the greasy aftertaste.  It was in my throat for the rest of the next.  Not strong but lingering. 
Not sure why it' was there since I thought Bob's was a decent establishment.  Maybe they only change the grease in the morning and I might have gotten a donut from the first batch for the evening crowd. So it was likely that they didn't heat up the oil hot enough hence all the woes. 

Unfortunately, there aren't many donut shops within 15 blocks that's open in the wee hours. 
They win our business by default.
author: Toeknee T.

description: Holy sh*** the donuts are ridiculously good. My BF has a donut weakness so I took him here for our anniversary :). We got the glazed raised and an apple fritter. The raised glazed was somehow light and airy and puffy and delicate (don't ask me how a donut can be delicate but this one was). The apple fritter was like apple jacks in donut form. I want MORE! thankfully I don't live nearby. That would be dangerous. Very dangerous.
author: Alison H.

description:
Made my way to Bob's around noon during the week for the famous Apple Fritter. Since they are made fresh in the wee hours of the morning, I received mine cold. Still delicious -- glazed fried dough with yummy apple filling in the cracks and crevices -- but I couldn't help wonder what they would be like war. I ate half of the fritter and brought the other half home to heat up in the microwave. Mmm, I liked it better when it was warmed up for twenty seconds. I have to keep this place in mind when I'm stumbling out of The Red Devil Lounge at closing in the hopes of getting a fresh warm fritter.

Cash only. The woman at the counter was kind and motherly and directed me to my bank so that I could save on ATM fees.
author: Joel A.

description: Hard to go wrong for late night sweets craving stop. There was quite a line. They had run out of the twists we wanted but we still found good ole maple old fashioned and jelly filled glazed donuts. Pretty decent prices. I like the 24/7!
author: NJ A.

description:
It's not that I hate donuts, I basically love anything with sugar, so I love the outside of the donuts but the doughy inside just isn't sweet enough for me. I've always felt that no matter how good a donut is after you've eatin it you feel so crappy it's just not worth it.

My friends said I had to try one of Bob's so I went with the one that looked the sweetest and crispiest on the outside, the apple fritter.  It was everything I expected, good and bad.  The outside was so sweet, glazed and crispy - It couldn't have been more perfect.  However, the inside was the typical donut, soft doughy and not sweet enough.  I just think donuts aren't my thing.  They all seems to envoke the same reaction from me, the first bite is amazing then I just feel like a lil fat kid. 

-LAFoodGod
author: John S.

description:
"Apple Fritters."

That's all my boyfriend heard me say for a week straight before our trip up to San Francisco from LA. He had never been to Bob's, poor thing.

"Apple Fritters."

"Julie, is it really THAT GOOD? Like, better than Krispy?"

"Apple Fritters."

We got our first apple fritter 20 minutes after our arrival. Got another one after we went out that night. 

And...

The rest is history because at 4AM, he stumbled out of our hotel room on Broadway to walk to Bob's in the rain for an APPLE FRITTER. Then he went at 7AM for me when I was hungover.

Thank you Bob, you heavenly soul.
author: Julie W.

description:
YUM. I have been here before, but I don't think it has ever been late enough to get the extremely fresh hot donuts.

This weekend we went pretty late and got donuts literally as they were taken out of the fryer. They were SO delicious -- like lick-your-fingers good. There's a reason there's always a line!
author: K. D.

description: Neighborhood institution. Line out the door most weekends. The beautiful aroma of sweet, fried goodness will hit you from a half a block away. A rotating assortment of donuts, cruellers (not sure of the spelling), turnovers, eclairs, and all sorts fruity, gooey tart-looking things. You can either gawk in the window or better yet just go in and buy a few. Or a dozen...  Digression: One late night I saw some poor guy, possibly drunk, come out with one of those pink bakery boxes and dude stumbled out the door and most of his donuts fell out onto Polk St. But did he walk away, cursing his bad luck? Oh hell no, he quickly jammed them back into the box (5 second rule?) and sheepishly walked away. Which prompted my friend to call out to him: "hey those aren't donuts - those are some flo' nuts!"  Good times. But back to the review: friendly place, a little bit on the older, grubby side (wonder how often they change the oil in those fryers) but donuts are constantly in production and there's usually a huge rack of stuff alongside whatever they've got on display in the window. Presumably the fresher stuff is on the rack. I think they take credit cards now (I remember seeing a sexier iPad terminal recently). When you get a craving for sweets, and aren't watching your waistline, come support these people. I took a star off because I did get sick once from eating one of their donuts - not sure if it was undercooked or what - but I'm not a quitter and have been back since with no incidents. Homer Simpson would approve. D'oh nuts!
author: Barbara K.

description:
Awesome post-_______ spot!!!!

Easily the best donuts I've ever had. So easily I can have 3 in a row. Woot!

Don't come here if you're on a diet.
Don't come here if you don't like warm, soft, delicious donuts.
Don't come here if you hate generous fillings.
Don't come here if you hate friendly donut makers.

Everyone else.. have a donut for me too. Preferably custard-filled. Mmmmmmmmm..
author: Jade T.

description:
I've only been there once but was offered a few bites of some donuts from there as my friend and were barhopping on Polk.  When i went there myself I got a glazed donut with some kind of frosting. . not chocolate, I think it was maple. I ate it in about 4 seconds and exclaimed, "that was good.  . I wish I could eat it all over again."  I think they make new ones at 1 am. .  there's always a line.  
I love any food place, no matter what kind, that is open late, let alone 24 hours.
I am sick of everything around Polk being cash only. . but whatever.
author: Muriel D.

description:
No pretentions or frills, no credit cards, a bajillion types of pastries, and phenomenal coffee. A real neighborhood joint. 

My apple fritter was huge and amazing. My coffee I savored with my apple fritter as I read my book for the next hour and half. 

For less than $3, I couldn't ask for more. Wish I lived closer to it.
author: Aditi R.

description:
Nothing good happens after midnight.......except for Bob's.  

And there's no avoiding it because if you're within smelling distance of at least 1 block from the store roaming about Polk, you'll immediately be drawn by the familiar aroma of fresh sugary sweets and larded up donut goodness.  

And when you try to fight it, its almost impossible.  Your best bet is just avoid that street at all cost during the late hours on Polk.  

Otherwise, if you do succumb to the aroma spell, do try the Chocolate French Donut.  You won't regret it.  Some like the crunchiness of Old Fashions, but I'm a fan of the fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside donuts.  

Everything else in the world doesn't matter after that first bite.
author: Vincent K.

description: The was a 10 minute line but it was worth the wait. We shared a hot glazed donut and an apple fritter, both were excellent. We chased it with cold milk. There was even room to sit down and enjoy them.
author: George T.

description:
I'm really not that big of a fan of donuts. I think they're way too sweet, way too oily, and way too... cakey. I've hated Krispy Kreme since day one, and I'm always turned off by the fly-infested donut shops in my neighborhood. 

Bob's Donuts is the only donut shop that has completely changed my mentality on donuts. The donuts here are so fresh, so aromatic, so tasty, that I forget how much I used to not like them. 

I love the apple fritter here, especially when it's piping hot fresh at around 1am every night. It's the highlight of the night for me after drinking. To be honest though, you can give me ANY of the donuts here that are fresh and I'd be happy. That's why whenever I go, I always ask them what's fresh, and whatever they tell me, that's what I order. And I've never been disappointed... EVER.

I'm so glad I don't live on Polk St; otherwise, I'd become morbidly obese from these delicious crack cakes.
author: Roy C.

description:
"Hey...Wanna go to Bob's ?" 

Heard that come hither rallying cry enough times, and from enough different friends over the years, but being the not so sugar gravitatin' peeps that we be, we always politely declined.

But when our vegan friend unblinkingly solicited us with the same tickler, one late night after a show at the Hemlock, we took note. We'd only seen her cross the line once, and that was for the best cookie I ever had, so we knew our time had come.

One attempted apple fritter (turned apple bread pudding) plus a simple long twisted unholy sugar donut later, we had finally lost it: if I still smoked, I would've.  The apple bread pudding was fresh outta the oven, chock fulla ncely spiced apples. The twisted donut wasn't. but it was light and delicate nevertheless, and one could only imagine how transcendent  it would have been if it were.

The lady owner-provacateur shrugged off our sycophantic slavings with a WTF-ennui that only served to raise the mystique. "Somehow we are on the internet". "People visit from different countries to eat here". "Our donuts are cheap."

Massive diviness brought the whole experience to fever pitch.
author: Henry Y.

description: Best doughnut in SF! Fresh & tasty 24hours a day!
author: christine w.

description: Got their giant donut and it was good!! Not too heavy and the taste was just right! I finished half of it myself =p The bakery was small and lighting was dim. One star off from just not being comfortable at the store.
author: Vic L.

description: Located on Polk Street with all the expected persons and characters close at hand Bob's looks as if it has been exactly where it stands and exactly as it is for years, a family run business churning out hot donuts throughout the day and night for anyone with a few bucks to spare and a sweet tooth needing its fix.  Arriving early and told by the lady behind the counter that fresh fritters would be out in about thirty minutes I wandered the neighborhood and returned with the fritters ready on cue along with a crumb style cake donut and a still-cooling slice of Bread Pudding fresh from the oven - a total price of $5.95 cash for about a pound of surprisingly high quality baked and fried carbs.  From the crackling shell on the shellacked fritter with chunks of apple within to the dense crumb of the cake donut with glaze and a buttery crumble atop both donuts were classic in style and nice representations of their genre and moving on to the bread pudding there was donut, pie crust, raisins, apple pie filling, streusel, and even some sprinkles - a Frankenstein of leftovers soaked in custard and rebirthed into haphazard gluttony entirely embracing the roots of bread pudding as a means to use leftovers ...and entirely delicious.
author: Michael U.

description:
SWEET JESUS! THE APPLE FRITTERS ARE GLORIOUS!

Come in at 1am or so (if you're a night owl like me) when the donuts and other goodies come out FRESH! One by one, out they came, all throughout our wait, saving the best for last (the fritters). Being a huge fan of apple fritters, I wanted to see if this place could live up to the hype. 

The verdict: BOB IS KING.

The freshness of the apple fritter is unbelievable. Less oily than other fritters I've sampled and a perfect balance between crispy and soft. The chunks of apple are huge and nicely embedded within the canyons and crevices of the fritter, while covered in rich glaze and sugary goodness! MMMmmmMMmmmm...soo irresistible. Since they came out fresh for us, they were warm and tasty!

I heard all this hype about the apple fritters being highly coveted and yadda yadda. I guess my initial indication of their rarity was the availability upon first arriving. 

"Can I get 2 apple fritters, please?" I say to the lady. 

She replies "Oh, sorry we're all out. But we'll have more in an hour." 

"WHAAAAAT?!"

I was surprised to discover that they were bigger than I thought. My sister and I had come all the way from the South Bay just to sample one of these sensual delights. Like in search of the Holy Grail, we were not about to end our journey here. So, of course we were gonna wait! As hard as that wait was...having endured all the drunkards and d-bags...we stuck it through. And in the end, we were rewarded with our fritters.

I give it 5 stars because despite the wait, at least I know when during the day (or night) to get stuff fresh and that it'll be one of the best things I ever ate. Like I said, totally worth the wait. Let's hear it for Bob's.
author: Will S.

description: I don't know what's so awesome about this place. I've stopped by a few times and the donuts always seem old and sitting. The overly large raised donut is pretty cool for an ambitious eater or a birthday cake, but the donuts itself are just ok.  The donut holes are small and are doughy, rather than light and fluffy. The prices are average and I have looked more than once at the semi grimy window to see if flies were there. Luckily none. I honestly don't see what all the Yelp hype is about this one.
author: Rachelle T.

description: Why say no when you can say yes? Bobs is easily the best donut place in the city. Phenomenal donuts and unbeatable prices. Sign me up
author: Victoria W.

description:
Oh Bob's... I can't believe I ate that entire giant donut last night and still wanted to eat my other donuts for breakfast.  Your donuts are just that good.  

Minus one star because the huge donut is a bit too greasy but I'm guessing it's because it has to be fried longer to cook through.  I may also have to try eating it when I'm not scarfing it down during the 3 minute challenge so I can see what it actually tastes like.  

Voodoo still holds the key to my heart but Bob's is the best in California so far.  The apple fritter, buttermilk (maple, plain, etc) and of course any raised donut are delicious.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I don't eat donuts often, but if I have to have one, it has to be from Bob's. 

The donuts are so fresh that when you take the first bite, it's soft and warm. It practically melts in your mouth. 

Also available, donuts the size of a cake. 

Try it to believe it.
author: Joyce L.

description: Bob's apple fritter might be on a "100 Things to Try Before You Die" list, and while it was okay, their CRULLER is where it's at! The texture was just phenomenal. All in all, donuts were a good size and reasonably priced. But skip the croissants.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Bob's is okay. Not sure if it's worth all the hype, but the donuts are decent and the people there are really friendly.

My biggest problem with the donuts is that they're either kind of dry, or if they're freshly baked, they're much too greasy and heavy. They leave me feeling kind of gross. I prefer lighter, fluffier donuts, like the ones from Jelly Donut. That's just my preference though, so if you like them a little greasier, you'll probably like Bob's. I had the apple fritter, cake w/ maple, and cinnamon sugar. All good, but too greasy overall.
author: Rhea K.

description:
I go here just to get their HUGE ROUND DONUTS! I think it is a 10 inch one and it is very fun to try and finish in a sitting. Kind of like a food competition. The huge donut is cheap too (kind of forgot price). 

If you don't go early enough though the huge donuts all sell out and you have to settle for the apple fritters! Those are pretty tasty here also. It's been a while since I've came but every time I go to the dentist in SF I just have to pass by this shop since I'm not here often
author: M. L.

description: I first read about this place on a review site when looking for best donuts in San Francisco. I decided to give them a try and have been coming here ever since. They make some great tasting donuts. I especially like there original glazed with crumbles, I think they are the best. If you can get any of there donuts freshly made and warm they are even better. If you haven't tried this donut shop I would highly recommend it. The best part of all is that they are open 24 hours so you can enjoy them any time of the day or night.
author: Luis L.

description:
Came late at night on the last night of a Scoutmob offer for a free donut.  Miraculously, found parking not far away.  They were frying up a bunch of donuts at 11:00pm - the whole place was suffused with oily steam.

Got a fresh, hot chocolate cake donut that melted in your mouth and started a conversation about the best donutes ever.  My companion got a very good apple fritter ( though the amount of apple was moderate. )

Would go back and pay for donuts if I was in the area.  Folks were friendly, donuts were good.  Five stars perhaps influenced by free donuts, but hey - they really *are* that good.
author: Albert H.

description:
DELICIOUS apple fritter!  Also tried the apple turnover, custard danish, chocolate sprinkle donut, and chocolate croissant (it was pretty rich - but still good!).  

Fun neighborhood, good sweets!
author: Chrissy H.

description:
Well what can I say about Bobs? My friend took me on a polk street crawl awhile back and somehow, we ended up at a donut shop at 1:30 am. To my delighted surprise, they were making a FRESH batch of donuts at this time. C'mon, how many donut shops make fresh donuts this late? The glazed donuts were so damn hot you couldn't even hold on to them, let alone stuff em in your mouth. 

We waited about 20 minutes, which I've been told isn't bad at all. Waiting for hot donuts at the wee hours of the night? Definitely a first
author: Jim C.

description: The great thing about Bob's is that its open 24 hours ! To me the best item to buy is the apple fritter! On a Friday night there can be a line out the door and around the corner! The best time to get there is around 9pm, because thats when they make fresh donuts, and there is LITERALLY nothing better then a fresh donut from Bob's... NOTHING
author: Moran G.

description: Their gimmick is that they have just-made apple fritters coming out when people are in the neighborhood bar-hopping. If you see donuts already sitting out, you're going to find that those are mediocre. There really is nothing above average about their donuts. It's just the late night timing of the fritters.
author: Chuck G.

description:
If you can get there while they are cooking donuts, then you will be in heaven! 

Fresh, warm, moist, fluffy donuts are the best things ever. I get the plain ones since I don't have a sweet tooth. 

Donut cooking starts at 11pm unfortunately. I never really like donuts until I had fresh ones from Bob's.
author: Katie Y.

description: Seriously good donuts, great for a late-night craving. I got the maple and chocolate old-fashioned, and they were both perfect.
author: Aaron H.

description: Donuts are delicious and cheap (like a buck) but the cookies are god awful. So obviously just get the delish donuts. If you can eat a massive donut in under two minutes, you get it free. Gotta try that sometime
author: B H.

description: Donut Heaven! The donuts are so perfectly done, that they melt in your mouth. Best donuts in town!!! Highly recommended.
author: Javier V.

description: Liked the chocolate croissants, but unfortunately I also tried an apple pastry ( with a funny name) that was a cake made of donuts with sugared apples on top.  Might work if you have a massive sweet tooth, but it was a bit much for me.  Mine also had a hair firmly ingrained in the middle of it, though I guess that can happen.  Looks like they had cheap coffee though.
author: Anna Y.

description: It was a must on our San Fran trip. We made the lyft driver take us there before heading to the airport. worth the detour!! 100%.
author: Robin S.

description: Probably my fault that I didn't get a fresh donut since I went in at noon, but I had a really mediocre apple fritter. Looking forward to going back for fresh donuts.
author: Patrick U.

description:
If you come to Bob's at night or in the morning, ignore the occasional pimp and prostitute shootings, homeless zombies who watch TV there, and make sure to be in disguise (hoodie might help), you don't to be seen devouring a giant doughnut of shame at 3AM, not sexy, and you know it. I don't know who Bob is, might be the sweet asian lady's husband? We will never know...I love the maple, apple fritter, and the powdered sugar doughnuts, but always to go. 

Problem: My friend wanted to come here every week, I was seriously about to buy her a shirt there and add VIP to it, she knew the asian lady, the other dude that works there, tried every donut, knew the prices, hey, even was friends with homeless dudes I can imagine. I was just hoping to see a musical out of it some night. To a point where once I saw a friend of mine in line and every single time he would run into me would mention Bobs, seriously?! Awesome to know I remind you of Bob's Donuts, just great, sigh. I had to mastermind a plan to get my friend outta here, what to do ..what to do...and tadaa, lightbulb, must find her a boyfriend! 

Solution: so I got my friend a boyfriend a week later and we both stopped becoming hippos, woo! This place should be called "Donut-N-Out", if you a see a prostitute, run! Just make sure you take with you an old-fashioned maple and tip the asian lady, she's cool.
author: Stephanie M.

description: The donuts was okay. But whenever u see old chinese lady serving, dont bother come in. She is like godly rude...! So rude that u'd hope u got paid by earing their donuts...!!!
author: Abdullah N.

description:
Never been to any donut shop and had my mom rave about their chocolate covered glazed donut four times in the car ride. I had one bite, and I must admit it probably was the best chocolate covered glazed donut I've had. 

When I pulled it out of the bag, I questioned why there was a huge thumb print from when the woman packaged the donut, and now I know why. The dough was dense but so soft and fresh. It was slight weight warm from the fryer, not oily or greasy at all. The chocolate was delicious and more reminiscent of actually melted chocolate than chocolate flavored glaze.
The apple fritter I had was less impressive. I read raving reviews about their apple fritters, so maybe it was overhyped for me. They at first seemed darker than I had imagined, like maybe they were fried too long. Overall maybe I just had them on a bad day and they weren't as fresh as the other donut, but they were good, just not as amazing as I expected.

The place reminds me of a donut hole-in-the wall. It was ironic because they had this cool iPad as the touch screen for the register, yet the actual maintenance of the place could use some fixing. 
I questioned when i saw tubs of glaze just sitting on the side, and you can see the level marks when the glaze set for a while. 

Close your eyes, get your donuts, and don't think about sanitation. You're set.
author: Jenna H.

description:
OMG, these donuts are sooo good, they should actually be illegal (to stop me from eating so many). I have yet to figure out if they're still just as good when sober, as I have only been here after stumbling home from a long night out on Polk Street...but I think you can trust my slightly faded judgement here.

A true story I must tell: I once woke up with a pink box sitting next to my bed. Like a scene from a horror film, I opened the box to find half a dozen Bob's donuts with a bite taken out of each. And I was the ONLY culprit for this crime scene. I recommend bringing a friend when you order so they can keep you from ordering more than one or two.
author: Kristin H.

description:
i love donuts...how can you not like deep fried dough in different shapes and forms?

bob's donut is a normal donut shop that has an usual cult following.  krispy kreme is better in my opinion, but hey, i clearly don't know what im talking about right?

price wise, a dozen mixed is 8.95...very cheap.

service wise...i got kinda yelled at by an older asian lady...that totally sucked.  getting yelled at by an older asian lady before ive had my morning coffee is pretty irritating...especially when i order 2 boxes and asked her to take out a few out of one box and add in some creme filled ones, but she answers by saying "no, you take both boxes and if you want creme filled, ill put them in a separate box...there are customers behind you...." 

very well played asian donut nazi. you totally punked me and put me in my place...your donuts aren't that great...and the flies that are buzzing on and off those massive 6 dollar donuts of yours validate my decision that i will never come back ever again.

(unless im drunk or lit in the middle of the night of course...then ill swing by and all is forgiven....jerk)
author: Kyu L.

description:
So the husband and I was watching Man vs Food on the Food network channel and he was visiting a donut shop that had unique large donuts.  THAT started the wholeee craving! 

So we hoped online, googled it and came upon BOB's DONUT!!!! Of course we went RIGHT away! 

We pulled up and had a VIP parking right away.  Its right down the street from Crustaceans Restaurant.

So when we parked, I already had my eyes on the window where I saw tonssss of donuts just lined up, waiting for me to taste em all...As soon as we walked in, the smell of fresh donuts just took over my whole sense! I was in la-la land...I'm a original glazed donut kind of girl, but with all the talk about the apple fritter, I had to get that....But  then I got greedy, and bought an assortment and two BIG donuts.  The lady that helped us was SO nice and soo helpful.  

We decided to sit down at the counter and eat it right away, I opted for the glaze of course,  O.M.G!!!!! It was literally heaven in my mouth...melted right away but still doughy to savor the texture and quality of the dough in your mouth...MMmmmmm....then I haddd to take a bite of the apple fritter,, WOW...talk about GOOD! 

SOOO, if you're a donut lover, you HAVE to try BOB's donut. I will let it speak for itself...but of course all of the reviews does too =) I want one NOW! lol...
author: CoCo V.

description:
HOLY FUCKING SHIT!
(no joke)

Please come here at like midnight and on to get the best, freshest donuts ever!!!! Just get whatever they are making at that second and its guaranteed to be a straight up orgasm in your mouth!!! 

I waited an extra 30 minutes just to try the fresh apple fritters and trust me it was worth every second! Best apple fritters I have ever tasted, hands down. 

PLUS the staff is so friendly, will totally talk up a storm with you, plays some awesome music and sometimes you get a random neighborhood prophet that stops by and yells his wisdom at you, isn't that just perfect?!
author: Michelle H.

description: Hands down the very best donut I have every had.  I only limited myself to 3 donuts, but I wish I could have eaten a dozen.  The donuts were fresh and the service was extremely friendly. I must say the young gentleman who helped me genuinely appreciated the tip.   This place is not fancy on the inside, but please don't be fooled by the decor.   When you visit San Fransisco, this is a must stop on your visit to this amazing city!!!!
author: Mike R.

description: Love coming here at night! The donuts are fresh and hot. The jumbo donut is fluffy and just perfect. Even though the place is pretty small, it's cozy.
author: Josephine A.

description:
Sorry friends but I just don't get it. 

How is Bob's better than the local donut shop that you went to every morning on your way to first period? 

It's not. In fact, it's worse.

Never trust a donut place that isn't called Lee's.

Blah, it'll do.
author: Kiristen R.

description: The maple old fashioned is awesome!  It's a must go to while visiting SF. It's nothing fancy, but worth it for a donut & coffee or milk if you don't drink coffee.
author: Jake L.

description: Solid hole in the wall donut joint.  Cheap, fast, and relatively tasty.  Coffee is diner style drip self serve.  Coffee wasn't great.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Apple mother f-ing bread pudding!  Get one of these $2.35 babies and it'll feed you for days!
author: Jenn C.

description:
C'mon SF - are you kidding me?  This is the best donut you have to offer?  I am shocked!  Maybe the problem was that we were totally sober when we tried Bob's...

We tried the following:  apple fritter, old fashioned, crumb, glazed, butter milk - and every one of them was disappointing.  Very heavy with an over-the-top fried tasting - and no, not all doughnuts should have these characteristics (at least not the good ones).  Even our local Bakery in little Havre de Grace, MD has superior doughnuts.  Big miss SF.
author: Doug C.

description:
Bob's Donuts, you are exactly what I wanted from a donut shop: no frills, no outrageous prices, just damn good donuts.  You are IT.

APPLE FRITTERS (5/5):  

Bob's Apple Fritters are delicious.  Warm and fresh, the apple fritters at Bob's have a mild, cake-like consistency, but it's not overly dense and doesn't make you want to drink a gallon of milk.  The donut is like a sugary pillow that melts in your mouth, and the little bits of apple pieces sprinkled throughout the fritter make for an explosion of sweetness.

Yes, at 4 a.m., Bob's definitely came to our rescue and we found ourselves in donut heaven for a good few minutes (yes, it only took us minutes to consume our donuts, even though we ordered a whole bunch).

We asked the cashier, "Can you give us your best, most popular donut?"  The answer: apple fritter.  We then asked, "Can you give us the freshest one?"  The answer:  apple fritter.  

This conversation was deep for two reason: (1) it shows that apple fritters are the bread and butter of Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop; and (2) it shows that the apple fritters are fresh!  I know, not that insightful, but it means a lot when you're looking for the freshest and best donut.  At Bob's, you can fulfill both quests with one donut: THE APPLE FRITTER!  And it's nice to know that you're getting fresh donuts, rather than old donuts that have been sadly sitting at the window.

THE OTHERS (3/5):  

I also tried a regular sugar donut and a chocolate glazed donut.  I prefer Krispy Kreme's sugar donuts and old fashion chocolate glazed donuts.

VENUE: 

It looks like a donut shop.  Haha.  That's about it. 

This place is open 24 hours.  Y.E.S.  Great solution for drunken hunger and people who want to sober up with fast comfort food.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Apple fritter and coffee! Their donuts are perfection. I don't even know how to describe it. Perfect amount of glaze. Their coffee isn't bad either. 

Saw some people studying here. I'm sure there's no wifi, but there's plenty of coffee and snacks! Glad I didn't know about this place as a student.
author: Meredith M.

description:
DAMN!!!! Their Apple Fritters is to die for! It looks like shit, but damn, it was so good!

It was huge and cheap! Didn't think I would be able to finish one by myself, but I kept on eating and eating.. until I was literally licking on my fingers... it's THAT GOOD!
author: Jimmie L.

description:
Best doughnuts I have ever had: The outside is crispy, flavorful, and sweet without being overwhelming. I never get that sick greasy feeling after eating Bob's donuts and this is fried dough we're talking about here. Bob's donuts and their pastries, too, are simply baked and fried to perfection carrying the right amount of flavor and sweetness that you just can't get enough of. 

The owner is absolutely adorable and although this place may be a little pricier than other doughnut shops, the quality of their product is more than worth the price. If you have not tried a doughnut here, I'd say you haven't had a doughnut. 

Try the glazed old-fashioned, apple fritter, bread pudding, and the thingie with the jelly cross.  You will not be disappointed! 

I will never eat doughnuts anywhere but here ever again!
author: Amy T.

description: Every time I've been out late at night and walked past thus place, there's been a line out the door. I wondered how a donut place could be the go to place at 2 am, and i finally had a chance to try it. I went for the apple fritter, which is generally my dessert of choice. I'll admit that it was good, but honestly nothing that amazing. Pretty standard apple fritter, but nothing that really blew me away.
