I was kinda hoping for something more special given how popular the place is. That being said, it was good - a solid four stars
author: Amaresh S.

description: Grab a glazed giant donut fresh out the fryer. The soft center is like warm cloud in your mouth. I'm a sucker for warm fluffy donuts.
author: Justina L.

description:
We came here around maybe 7-8pm one night because this is supposed to be the best donuts in SF. My friends and I order a few different ones to try and share amongst our group. We got the apple fritter, a cookie, donut holes, a custard filled one and one other thing that I don't really remember(probably because it wasn't that great). The only good one out of that selection was the apple fritter.

HOWEVER, to be quite fair, we did catch the very end of that batch since I've read that a new batch comes out around 1-2am. So I'm not surprised we got the mediocre left overs. I will give this place another shot one day, hopefully early in the morning so that I can get a fresh donut to be able to fairly make my assessment.
author: Beanne N.

description: We passed by Bob's one night when we were visiting San Francisco while on a bus back to our hotel (the long line for a cable car at the Pier was too long). It was late (about 11) and the line was out the door. The gentleman next to us said it was the best donut place, and we must visit while we were in town. The next morning we went for breakfast, and it was great! The woman who helped us was very kind in watching us try to decide what to get. While we were there she continuously had a smile on her face and was extremely pleasant. The donuts? They were amazing. I had a maple cruller that melted in my mouth. The coffee was pretty good as well. A must do while in town!
author: Ruthe L.

description:
My boyfriend's been telling me about this donut shop and how it's a great spot to hit up at night.  So after a night of drinking with a girlfriend, we came around midnight for a visit. 

The line was out the door by the time we arrived already.  We started looking out the windows at all the different types of donut we were about to get.  Good thing was, we had a Scoutmob coupon for one free donut...so we took the opportunity to try the shop's most famous Apple Fritter.  The owner was really attentive and allowed us to take our time to pick out what was fresh.  We also got some glazed donuts (bomb!) and bread puddings (which was alright).

Overall had a great experience and could tell it was a good snack spot for after a night of drinking/partying.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Piss-poor attitude.

Hey, don't offer a ScoutMob 100% off any donut or pastry (exception giant donut), if you are going to bitch about people taking the most expensive item. Sure, I requested a ham and cheese croissant and thank-you for it, but cut out the poor me act. Suck it up or don't do 100% offers or be more specific about what you want to offer or hey, perhaps don't offer a 100% off offer if it's going to piss you off every time someone takes you up on it.

The ham and cheese croissant was decent, but overshadowed by the attitude.
author: David R.

description: Me and my bf were recently in San Fran and were craving donuts. We came across bob donutes on yelp and made the trip to try them out. MY GOODNESS were these some delicious donuts. They were so fresh, fluffy and a had a little crunch to them. If you have time to stop by bob donuts, its worth it!!!!
author: Sonia H.

description: Came here right after watching fireworks on New Years! There was a long line and it was the only place that was still open. Decided to get the giant donut (maple flavored). It was a goood donut! It was pretty cheap and it was too big for two people!
author: Allie Y.

description: Best buttermilk donut I've ever had. Best any other donut I've ever had too. My SIL, claims she is "not a fan of donuts, but I love Bobs".
author: Jessica K.

description: Best donuts. friendly and happy owners/staff, quality and good tasting donuts. I like their crispy no-topping donuts. Highly recommended.
author: Hems B.

description: This is the only place I want to go for doughnuts from now on! I love old fashioned doughnuts, especially chocolate. When I came in on Tuesday night the nice lady behind the counter told us they had FRESH chocolate old fashioned doughnuts. It was fried to perfection, dense like an old fashioned but with a crunch, which is why ill never have another doughnut from another place ever again. :) By the way I had two. Oops!
author: Krystina C.

description:
Apple fritter: $1.65.  What a steal!

Being one of two customers in the store: weird.

The lady behind the counter was having a conversation with the other patron while looking at my direction (we were on separate ends of the store).  She was nagging about turning on the TV to a sports channel.  Go figure.  I just wanted my food.

Another item off my 7x7 list!
author: Jenny L.

description: Had the plain sugar donuts and the little ball donuts, they are yummy!!! Will need to try other ones next time!
author: Yan Wei L.

description: I've lived in San Francisco all my life and I'm ashamed to admit I've never visited Bob's till tonight. It's a hole in the wall that sends you back in time, the young man who works there is sweet as can be, and the donuts are really good too. There is a huge donut that can be a cake, and if you eat it all in two minutes you get it for free and a t-shirt. We bought the fritter, a glazed and a crumb. All yummy and we will come back and I think anyone who's in the city should try it at least once.
author: Tkpasq P.

description:
I am a huge fan of Bob's. I've visited this palace of donut goodness twice now and both times I left satisfied and full of sugar.

The boyfriend and I can never have just one donut and at Bob's there are so many choices, even picking two is hard. All the donuts are on display in the window so you can take your time and drool over the options before you head inside and order. I chose a glazed twist and a chocolate cake and the boyfriend chose a jelly filled and a creme filled. Glazed twists are my favorite and bob's has one of the best.

We bellied up to the counter to enjoy our sweet treats. Even though it was 5PM on a Friday the stream of people coming in the door was pretty steady. And their donuts still tasted fresh. I can't imagine how good they would be at night when they are fresh from the oven. 

The atmosphere is very old-school donut shop and they have funky donut-related drawings on the wall which adds to the quirky flavor of the place. 

I can't imagine a trip to San Francisco without a stop at Bob's. My vacation would just not be complete without it.
author: Holly R.

description:
Open 24/7... need I say more
okay,, just imagine you leaving the bar as they start to kick you out  for last call, your plastered and need a little something something to sober you up before you stumble home.  May be something small, sweet, warm, yet light!!! How about fresh baked donuts baked at midnight ... Oh so yummy, fluffy, soft, and chewy!!!  Apple fritters right out of the fryer, perfectly glazed twist, butter scotch glazed twists filled with smooth creamy custard. And as you sober up with your one donut or two for there, you shamelessly order a dozen to go for your coworkers tm in hopes they don't notice how really hung-over you really are at work! I know great idea huh, just thank me with a dozen!
author: Michelle A.

description: When I ordered the giant donut I was worried that I would be receiving quantity over quality. However after one HUGE mouthful of that donut I was pleasantly surprised! The donut was perfectly soft and fresh tasting. The donut was just delicious and wasn't even really greasy! The old fashioned donuts here are delicious as well but if you're going to come here you really should just get the giant donut. Also, I love that this place is 24 hours! My boyfriend and I were eating a late dinner in the city and my sweet tooth kicked in. He took me here and we both were so happy with our goodies!
author: Beca P.

description: Lucky me got a fresh chocolate-dipped French crueler right from the hand of Bob herself! This place can seriously become an addiction especially since they are open 24hrs. Screw Taco Bell for 4th meal, I'm going to Bob's!
author: Tim H.

description: Note to self: wait for fresh donuts.  It is astronomically better and well worth the wait.
author: Derrick C.

description: We were craving donuts one morning, so of course I yelped "donuts" and found Bob's. I definitely don't consider myself a donut snob considering I rarely eat them, but I thought Bob's was just ok. We ordered a half dozen glazed donuts and they were cold. I'm used to donuts being served warm. They were sweet like they should be but definitely more cakey than my favorite flaky glazed donuts. I should probably return and try more of a variety next time, but I'm afraid I would be more inclined to try the next donut shop down the street. I did appreciate the fact that they accepted credit cards, though.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Ambiance is very rough on the surface but the best donuts I've ever had my taste buds exposed to! Get the Boston creme and the Maple.
author: Mojito G.

description: Ok, so I never heard of this place, but I was walking by at 7:30pm and saw people buying doughnuts. Ok, swing by on the way out....more people buying doughnuts. I had to stand outside for a few minutes. Once inside, I got the full view of the hole-in-the-wall nature of this place. I believe they would sell all day and night. I think I stumbled on a local legend here. Traditional doughnuts made right have a market, regardless of health consciousness or sobriety!
author: Steve N.

description:
Years, maybe even decades, ago, after leaving Fiddler's Green at 2am, some friends and I needed something to nibble on.  We wounded up at Bob's.  And they were frying the donuts fresh as we drooled.  When I asked if they had a custard filled, the guy said no, then he said wait.  He went in the back and put one together for me.  Excellent!  One of my fondest memories ever.

Nowadays, this is a post-HoPR stop.  After that meal, we troop down here and most, if not all, of us get donuts.  Some of us save it for the next day's breakfast but one or two of us usually scarf them down immediately.  Especially if the donuts are just out of the fryers and super fresh!
author: J. P.

description:
Best donuts ever!

I have gone here many times after drinking (one time I literally stumbled upon it and said "shit this is my favorite donuts place). There are always fresh, hot, and cheap donuts that are pure excellence and deliciousness.
author: Stephen S.

description: I've been coming here for years now but never realized I hadn't written a review yet. The times I usually go to Bob's are Friday or Saturday nights around 11:30 pm. I like this time because they're definitely always making fresh (right from the oil) donuts and also because most of their breakfast pastries come out fresh then too. I usually will get the hottest donut there and whatever I choose is always delicious. Personal favorites are: French, old fashioned, glazed, cheese danish. People are always friendly and always have a smile on their face (even when their are drunken customers that need some donuts to finish off their night). They sometimes tweet what donuts are fresh as well.
author: Rick T.

description:
I really can't believe I haven't reviewed Bob's yet.  

Many a college nights after the bars were closed, my fellow misfits and i would stumble up hills, through tunnels, and down pee filled alleys to get to Bob's.

We'd point out a selection of donuts, grab a chocolate milk, and sit at the bar in heaven.  HEAVEN.

Sometimes in the middle of the night, they have a giant foot-long glazed donut.  Perhaps we were never drunk enough to try, or TOO drunk to try, but we never have gotten one, though we've seen them plenty of times, always in the middle of the night.

This last trip up to SF we went to Bob's after a night at the bars.  

Maple Old-Fashioned please!  PERFECT.  They haven't changed a bit, and they ALWAYS have fresh donuts.  Fresh like fresh out of the oil.  Always.

I put an image up on my Instagram, and every time I come across it, my belly grumbles and my mouth salivates, looking forward to the next time I can make it back up to SF.

*Note, Bob's is for more than just drunken late night binges.  Several times on my way to photo shoots in the morning, I'd stop at Bob's for a big box of Apple Fritters (omg.), Donuts, and other assorted baked deliciousness, and fellow students/teachers/clients would always be very pleased.

My San Francisco experience wouldn't have been complete without Bob's.
author: Jess R.

description:
Bob's Donuts are like crack.

Addicting but so bad for you especially when you just finished partying or drinking at a lounge/bar.

CRACK I TELLS YOU!

Once you try their donut, you will come back begging for more.
author: Carol Y.

description: Donuts for dessert?  Don't judge.  There was a line out the door on a Friday night.  Decided to try it.  Result: a warm, gooey apple fritter, fresh out of the fryer!  What a treat!  Oh, and the maple bar was good, too.
author: Riz W.

description:
Mother of Donuts!!
Besides the snarky look one might get while asking "what's fresh?"
Served fresh and warm these donuts are truly naughty and delicious!!;)
Warm chocolate or maple are my favorites and my beau prefers the apple fritter.
Careful not to stop by between 1am-3am because one might eat more than one unconsciously ( if you get my drift, hiccup!) should!
Just in case you do, a sprinkle of turkey bacon bits on top  add that "wow" factor!! Too much wine;)
Bottom line Bob's Donuts Rule!
Drinking too much doesn't rule, well at least I had more donuts the next morning;)
author: yvette c.

description: Everything is really good here! Its open 24 hours and they have a wide variety of pastries you can choose from! I recommend sticking to the classics like onut holes or a glazed donut but the apple fritter is surprisingly tasty! The service is great and its not expensive at all! Definitely stop by!
author: Lena T.

description: I came here to get a donut.. But Thank god these boys behind me were talking about the fritters at Bobs, because the fritters are soooo good!  Got the fritters fresh out of the fryer.. Warm, moist, sweet, delicious fritter.  Think of a doughy cinnamon roll, but as a donut.
author: Keri K.

description:
Biggest glazed donut ever!!  And delicious!  Lasted a couple of days and was still able to keep its freshness.  It did not taste as if it was doused in buckets of oil and was bready, fluffy, and ever so tasty!  The service is always incredibly friendly and I would love to go back to try the apple fritters which I can see are also a popular choice!

It looks like they do take cards sometimes/ when the machine is working but make sure to have cash on you just in case!
author: Pb J.

description: Came here after seeing this place on a list of top donut places. Donuts here are average. They were fairly fresh and tasted ok, just not on a " best/top donut list". If you are close by and need a donut then sure, but I would not go out of my way to get one when most local donut shops are just as good.
author: S M.

description:
Dear Bob's Donuts,

I do not drink the Twitter Kool-aid.  While I love my friends, I really do not care that they are eating cereal for breakfast or what tv show they are watching.     

However what I DO care about is fresh donuts.  (I know, I clearly have my priorities in order!)  Namely, what you have just coming out of the fryer and what is coming along after that.  My friend suggests that you get a twitter account.  GENIUS!  

This way, I can get more of those amazingly warm Old Fashioned Cake Donuts dipped in Chocolate Glaze and covered with Colorful Sugary Sprinkles.

Example tweets:

Bob's Donuts  Just took some Apple Fritters out of the fryer. 

Bob's Donuts  A skinny Korean chick just came and ate all our Apple Fritters.  Ran-dom!

Bob's Donuts  Just took some Jelly Donuts out of the fryer. 

Bob's Donuts  A familiar looking but pudgy Korean chick just came and ate all our Jelly Donuts.  WTF?

Bob's Donuts  Just took some Original Glazed Donuts of the fryer.

Bob's Donuts  An enormous Korean chick just came and ate all our Original Glazed Donuts.  HELP!!!

You get the idea.

Love ya, 
Amy C.

--------------------

UPDATE 6/2012:  

Proof positive that dreams do come true. 

https://twitter.com/#!/whatsfreshest
author: Amy C.

description:
this five star review is for one item and one item only....that's the maple buttermilk bar. I'm sure the rest of them are perfectly good, but this maple flavored buttermilk doughnut is the best thing ever!

oh, and to make myself feel better about eating one, I get the fat free pint of milk!
author: Philip H.

description:
Pleeeeease someone tell me why this place is rated so high. 

Unless you're drunk, high, or in other drug-induced mental lapse of judgement, a donut is a donut is a donut. It tasted no better than some joe schmoe donut shop off the corner of every main street in every city in every country. Plus, when you sit at the bar, you can watch them drop the donuts into a vat of oil as you eat. Uh...gross?? I like to watch cute Mexican ladies twist my pretzels at the mall, not some overweight Asian dude, drop rings of batter like turds into a vat of oil. Don't bother unless you're heavily intoxicated in the area at 3am with no other avenue of getting an average donut.
author: Ray W.

description:
Scrumptious, melt in your mouth divine!!!!!!!

This place is perfect after  a night out - drinking, dancing or if you're just in the mood for a sugar high pick-me-up! 

Make sure you get the fritters fresh out've the fryer - even if you have to wait a bit for them!! It's well worth it. Same for the donuts. They're still amazing cold, but you can't gobble 'em fast enough when they're warm *sigh*
author: Sonal P.

description: Tiniest donuts in town $1 each! It was so thin, it fell apart. It was good & fresh, but 2/3rds the size of everyone else! Stop cutting corners! Charge a little more & give more.
author: Lou F.

description: One of the few restaurants I have 0 complaints about is surprisingly, Bob's Donuts. This place is a tradition among friends to go to after late night fun. Go at 1am, thats when they you can get their signature glazed donuts fresh. Safe to say that this is the best doughnut place in the city by FAR.
author: Marie O.

description:
BEST DONUTS! 

We visit this place everytime we're in the city. 
Great that they are open 24 hours. 
Last time went they had just started using Square on thier iPad for payments.
author: Xochitl L.

description: Great doughnuts! Really sweet lady. Maple glazed old fashioned doughnut was where it's at!
author: Martha B.

description:
Oh, how my mouth waters when I hear the word "Bob's". I want to high-five whoever makes those donuts on a daily basis!

Thank you to ScoutMob for giving me 1 free donut at Bob's; I was able to try one that's been on my radar. 

I already love the apple fritter & original glazed. This time I went for the cinnamon sugar donut on recommendation from the counter girl. She was spot-on! Not overpowering but definitely high in flavor. Lots of cinnamon/sugar dusted on top of the donut AND cinnamon BAKED INTO the donut dough....genius!! I'm stealing that secret. 

Friendly service, awesome donuts (haven't tried their other goodies), cash only. Perfect after a night bar-hopping or that afternoon pick-me-up. Yeah for Bob's!
author: Marissa H.

description: Nothing special about the donuts here. I felt nauseous after eating a piece of Bob's donut. Definitely not coming back to this place again.
author: Jun N.

description:
Glazed Donut. No, your eyes do not deceive you. It IS the size of the pastry box. Yes, this is the infamous $5.50 donut. It was pretty good, but I found it to be more bready than airy donuty. I guess I bought it for the gimmick, definitely sticking to the normal sized donuts from now on

Yes it's the one the size of my face. Actually I lie, it's bigger than my face, it's more like the size of my head.
author: Constance C.

description:
Bob's Donuts:  A 2AM institution for those who have found themselves lost and confused after a night out.

Imagine an old school donut shop, no frills, no foodie inspired experimental ingredients - just sugar, oil and dough made with tough love and expertise.  Try to come when the donuts are just made and dipped.  My particular favorites are the apple fritter, basic chocolate, and maple bar.  

Also: Cash Only - about $5 for a healthy snack.
author: Aasim K.

description:
Good lord. If you have never had a *really* fresh donut, do yourself a favor and order yourself one of whatever they say is the freshest. They're incredibly good. We're talking 11-am-completely-sober-changes-your-life-anyway good.

And after my still-warm slightly-melty maple donut, I also had an apple fritter to keep me company for the rest of the day. That turned out to be a very good idea indeed.
author: Connor Skye R.

description: Just got a Postmate to deliver these to the office. Divine smell when you open the box and the taste is excellent. Maple glazed? Oh my god - so good. I am trying hard not to go back for a second one.
author: Alex B.

description:
I'm a big fan of the old fashined doughnut.  Krispy Kreme fans get to steppin' cuz this is where it's at.

Ever so crispy on the outside, moist and delicious on the inside.
Haven't yet found anything less than fantastic here.
The entire shop is a bit of a throwback to a time when nothing but a sinker and a cupper was something to look forward to.

Have always met the friendliest staff, even though sometimes they come close to losing a finger as I snatch up my box of goodies!
author: Ken B.

description:
I had heard about this place then saw the line one night, and couldn't pass it up. With a line like that it must be good, right? I have a feeling the late night line is partly due to the simple fact that is a donut shop which is still open when the bars close, rather than good tasting donuts.

I got a glazed and a chocolate donut. The glazed was incredibly greasy. All I could really taste was the grease. No flakey dough, but rather just dough soaked in oil which made me wonder how this place is popular. The chocolate wasn't as bad, but still very sub-par. This place makes Dunkin Donuts taste so good. In the meantime, if you want a glazed donut, try All Star Cafe and you'll see what you've been missing.
author: Jay P.

description: Phenomenal donuts and pastries. We had the Apple Fritter and the Crumb donut, and both were great. The Apple Fritter was fresh out of the oven, and the Crumb Donut was warm as well. Highly recommend a stop by this place.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Ahhh this place satisfied my 2am donut cravings. However, not all the donuts and pastries in the windows are guaranteed fresh so you have to be careful. Also, the apple fritters are super greasy, they have an overwhelmingly oily smell. I like the giant donut though--it's really funny to see people try and eat it in under a minute haha. The service is good and the donuts are cheap (obviously). 
But yeah other than that this place is a tad bit overhyped to be honest.
author: Idk A.

description:
Bob's donuts remind me a bit of "In N Out". They're clearly better than most of the competition in the market, yet... I can't help but think we're only talking about fast food. It's not gourmet. It's not healthy.  Just plain old, sweet, convenient, delicious, fattening, fast food...

(I'll be right back. I'm going to grab a burger and a donut.)
author: Christopher K.

description: These donuts used to be better, but now are not as good anymore, even when fresh.  The main reason for the one star review is the HORRIBLE customer service from the younger guy who works there in evenings/late night.  He has been a huge dick to many customers who were extremely nice to him and just wanted to buy a donut.  The older Asian lady is very nice and helpful and I hope this review doesn't offend her, because she is awesome.
author: james b.

description:
Ok, so when I think of donuts I think of glazed donuts or chocolate bars filled with custard oozing out of them as you take that first bite. I don't typically think of old fashioned donuts or even apple fritters. 

Although, this place totally changed my mind. I've only had the opportunity to taste the crumb cake old fashioned donut and the apple fritter. Oh my god Willis, these are so good. One taste of the crumb cake donut and you will be asking, if not begging, for more. Is there like crack in this mixture because man, I think I kept going back for more at least three or four times and I normally don't eat that many donuts in one sitting. After having one of the crumb cake donuts, it was indefinite as to what my fate would be...another crumb cake donut. Soooo mmmm mmmm good. 

The apple fritter on the other hand was as big as my 7 year old son's head. It took all three of my kids to try and eat half of this monstrosity. The hubby and I even shared the last half of the fritter but of course I'm back to raving that there must be crack in these donuts/pastries because you can't just have one. The fritter does actually taste like fresh baked apple pie and it even smells like one fresh and warm out of the oven. Even the next day they still tasted fresh. The texture and the flavors just made you crave another one and coffee or even hot chocolate was a nice compliment to it. 

So if you are in town, or in need of a glutenous fill, seek these donuts, you won't be sorry. In fact, ask for more than you are craving because you will definitely be asking for more.

Hopefully I'll be back to try all their other tasty morsels.  Boy is my doctor going to be mad but oh well, once in awhile isn't going to hur.

I think the only problem is that this place isn't here in Sac.  Come on people, we eat food too.  Come over to Sac and feed us!
author: Mia D.

description: I am piling on here with my review.  I don't think of Cali as a donut state, but this place is amazing.  It's up there with Long's Bakery in Indianapolis and Dough in Brooklyn. I only get the cake donuts when I go because they do them so well.  The ones fresh off the cooling rack are the best.  And, in the event you stop by and they happen to be out of your fave, just circle back a few hours later, as they seem to make donuts 'round the clock. Do it!
author: Adria C.

description:
my opinion of Bob's never changes. well, the only thing i have to say is that its a very sinful indulgence. and i blame it for my recent slight weight gain. Now I know you're saying "well you don't have to eat it", but damn thats like going to a steakhouse and eating only salad and bread. WHO DOES THAT?!

Oh, i just wanted to update with "I find that the best days to go are Thursdays and Fridays because they seem to have freshest batches on those days, but I could be wrong."

I normally do NOT like crullers. I'll even go as far to say that I usually hate them very much, but Bob's crullers are amazing for some stupid reason that i can't quite fathom or explain. How the hell do you pronounce it anyways? Croolers? Krullers? anyways, they're delicious; please go try some. 

oh and get the cream filled eclairs and have a happy heart attack.
author: Sean L.

description:
My girlfriend's been raving about this place, so after leaving Cobb's Comedy Club on Monday, Chris and I stopped by.

They had just made fresh old fashioned and powered donuts, so we got those and a couple of glazed and Chris got a maple donut.  These are rustic donuts, man.  Actually a little crispy on the outside and moist and chewy on the inside.  Pretty delicious.  Obviously, I cheated that night and ate large amounts of gluten.  Totally worth it!

Next time I will get an apple fritter!  I should have read the reviews.  Dammit!
author: Susan C.

description: One of the best hole in the wall donut shop I've every been too! Had the cinnamon twist and maple cake donut.
author: Emily H.

description: Some of the best donuts I've had in the city :-) I always eat them too quickly to take a photo, whaha- great prices if yr down on polk street and need a donut :-) one of the only places in the city I have found to get a good powdered sugar cake donut- just about my favorite thing ever. gonna have to try the big ass donut one day!!!
author: Coco J.

description:
AMAZING!!! We walked to Bobs from our Hotel around 11 p.m. Watched someone (Bob?) make donuts and it was so awesome seeing how they were made. 

FELL IN LOVE with the chocolate cream bar. I loved how it was sliced in half and filled to the brim. Most amazing chocolate creme bar I have ever had in my LIFE!!!!

Price is def reasonable. But don't forget it is CASH ONLY!!

If we lived in SF, I would gain about 50 pounds just from wanting to be here every night.
author: Rebekah S.

description:
Delicious delicious fresh warm doughnuts 24hrs! and a block from home!

Is this a good or a bad discovery... only time will tell!

Best of all my first visit was free thanks to scoutmob coupon! 

I can recommend the glazed and crunchy, both were excellent!

Really helpful friendly staff, they helped me decide.. too much choice!
author: Chris M.

description:
Beyond obsessed with bon's for the terrific donuts at any hour of any day and kind of terrified at my own potential weight gain if I stop by there on my way home everyday. 
Rumored to have the best crumb donuts by "some guy" they are actually pretty great.
author: TJ H.

description:
This is how donuts are supposed to taste.

Living the first 35 years of my life on the East Coast allowed me to become a connoisseur of well-made junk food; pizza, subs, chinese food, ice cream, donuts-- if all of these things weren't invented there, they were perfected there. Aside from most New Englanders locking themselves indoors for 6 months every miserable winter, the availability of this food is part of the reason nearly everybody who lives there is overweight. But that's a conversation for another day.

getting back on track... My favorite Bob's donuts are the, well, we used to call them Honey Dipped. I'm sure there's no honey in the recipe anymore but they are still just the right amount of fluffy and dense with a light crackling of sweet glaze.
The Jelly donut is pretty damned good as well.

If you like the occasional donut, there is no reason for you to "check out this" or "try that" -- just go to Bob's-- this is how donuts are supposed to taste.
author: vincent t.

description:
the apple fritter. get it. if you can't get it fresh, curb your temptation until you can find a toaster oven. pop it in, wait those agonizing few minutes, and then dive into all that apple-y cinnamon sugar goodness. it would be nice to have just a little bit more apple though ;)

near muni stop, street parking available.
author: Julia H.

description: Their donuts are amazing. The donuts almost melt in your mouth. Their donuts are always fresh, and they always have a wonderful selection. I don't know what more I can say other than you haven't really experienced donuts until you've tried Bob's. Their customer service is always above par. Their prices are incredibly reasonable, and I'd dare say inexpensive. I can't say enough great things about Bob's Donuts. I've been a loyal customer of theirs for years. I only wish I still lived close to them.
author: dAvid s.

description: The donuts here are pretty good, and cheap, but definitely not the best I've had. Donut King in Concord is the best donut I've had so far. Aside from that, the lady behind the counter seem nice and looked like she was enjoying herself, which I think that's good to see when at a business.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
The magic happens at approximately 10pm.  

Last night I stopped by Bob's and was lucky enough to stumble upon hot, freshly made donuts, a first for me at a donut shop other than Krispy Kreme.  Having just come from dinner, I regaled myself to just one old-fashioned maple and one apple fritter.  

Both donuts were heavenly - crunchy, moist, and just plain finger-licking good (yes, I literally licked my fingers clean).  

One thing slightly off-putting?  As I was watched, excitedly, plops of dough dunking into the deep fryer, I also observed, less excitedly, gargantuan heaps of butter getting dumped into vat of deep fryer oil.  Yum.
author: Mel T.

description:
Two words...apple fritter (7x7 got it right to include this on the 100 things to eat before you die - SF). Even though it is basically fat/fried, it is light with layers of apple in between. 

Also, the donut holes and bread pudding are really great. 

For those who never carry cash, this is cash only.
author: Tif L.

description:
Late Night Case of the Munchies? You're in Luck, Bob's donuts is open late! Or shall I say early morning?

The best time to go is near 2am when they're making the donuts fresh. Lucky me, I used to live in Nob hill so this was walkable!! Yeah I know, they're probably injected with butter as they are fried in oil, but who cares? They are just so freaking goood! 

I recommend the Apple Fritters and the standard glazed donuts. They are just sooooooo soft, light, sweet, and hits the right spot to end the night. YUM!
author: Erin M.

description: LOVE Bob's! A must if you are out and about on Polk street. I love the giant glazed donut, the cheese Danish, and the jelly donuts. Yumm.
author: Emily S.

description:
I was highly impressed by the long line of folks on a Saturday night after the bar rush at 3AM. It was insane!!!! My friend raved so much about the apple fritter that we waited almost half an hour to get fresh ones. We did try other donuts but it wasn't super great. 

Was it really worth it? I mean, it was a pretty mean apple fritter, very tasty and scrumptious. The cashier even gave us a free donut for making us wait that long. :) 

The place itself is kind of dirty....I didn't feel comfortable sitting in there and watching the workers not wear gloves to handle the donuts. :/
author: Jeena L.

description:
Never have I seen lines outside the door for a donut shop. And never have I seen a thousand reviews for it either. Well, at Bob's donuts they are the exception. 

It was a great first experience. Although there was a constant line at 1AM in the morning, the sweet lady who helped us was very patient with our indecisive and curious minds. Using the Scoutmob free donut deal, I had to get the apple fritter that everyone raves about. And everyone was right because it was so delicious! This cinnamony, flaky, and sweet goodness is the perfect late night/breakfast snack. It is also HUGE so sharing is caring.

Before, I never really liked donuts but at Bob's donuts they are truly the exception.
author: Denise W.

description:
In this obsessively calorie counting culture of ours, it's been a struggle to find a donut shop in the city. And I'm not talking about fancy smancy pastries with Valrohna chocolate drizzle or some sort of caramelized something or other on top..I mean BIG, DOUGHY,WARM ,FRIED IN OIL donuts.

You know, the real deal.

Well, after traipsing down Polk with a date that night, we stumbled upon Bobs. And as my date  looked hungry ( I definitely could not have fit into his pants) , I bought him a half dozen old fashioneds ( my fave!!) and some sprinkles. It was the cheapest dinner date I've ever paid for in my life!! Beat that Taco Bell! $4 for half a dozen donuts and a big friendly smile from the proprietor behind the counter. 

Deeeeeelicious.

It reminded me of being in college and hauling ass down to KingPin in Berkeley around 9pm as they pulled their freshly fried donut holes out for display and smeared glaze over them in front of you.....
mmmmm...suddenly, my organic low fat yogurt doesn't seem so great now...
author: Kathy K.

description: Great classic donut shop. I would elaborate, but that would diminish the beautiful simplicity of a classic, old-fashioned donut.
author: Jon J.

description:
I found this shop on Yelp with lots of stars, so I went.
Got a box of donuts for family.  
Disappointing :(  
I don't understand why many people are giving 5 stars... 
Too oily.  We could not finish them and had to toss them away.
Maybe they taste better when they are fresh and warm?
I got them at 9am.
author: Maki M.

description: This place is amazing.  Maple raised fresh out of the oven- almost better than sex.   I'm bringing 3 dozen to the office tmrw which I expect will rocket me to stardom.
author: William M.

description: Open 24 hours. A great last stop of the night. Ask for what's fresh, and always grab a couple of the apple fritter donuts.
author: Maya C.

description: From the donuts, to the croissants, to the service, this place is a win! Always have had great food and excellent service at Bob's. Woman working behind the counter is nice and very efficient. You can get in and out in a breeze whether you're buying 1 donut or 3 dozen. Highly recommended.
author: Lauren P.

description:
the perfect ending to a night of drinking on polk.

fresh, hot, fluffy, non-greasy donuts. open 24/7. 

'nuff said.
author: Patricia Y.

description:
Bob's donuts is the ISH - but you gotta abide by the rules:
 
- Don't even bother if they aren't relatively fresh.  The best time, in fact, is post 10 pm when they're catering to the drunkies.  Take advantage!

- Don't be distracted by the trays and trays of different donut varieties.  Go for the plain glazed, especially if it's your first time.

- Be careful not to squish the donut in your fingers!  The fresh glazed donut is like a fluffy, sugary pillow (in fact, I've wondered to myself what it would be like if they made ACTUAL pillows out of Bob's donuts... mmmmmmm).  Treat it delicately as you nom.

- Don't deprive yourself when you want another immediately after your first.

To be honest, in 99.999% of circumstances I don't really like donuts.  But Bob's is special.  Bring cash (extra if you need milk!) and be happy.
author: Allison B.

description: I've lost my will power, and I've slowly succumbed to Bob's tasty chocolate custard bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GXu3PD4IPsxIHpo011aydg?select=x7Qfmcmfwp99tlInTFAchQ).  For the past three weeks I've found myself at Bob's six times in the late night hours after leaving my workplace just for a taste of the airy donut, the smooth and cool custard and the sickly sweet chocolate topping (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GXu3PD4IPsxIHpo011aydg?select=qPf9hkbbN2movHZ78bmpwA).  Damn you, Bob's!  Why do you have to stay open at all hours?
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: First of all, try to go in the evening when they are making the donuts fresh. And it doesn't matter what kind you like, just order whatever they're making right then because the hot-out-of-the-fryer donuts are MONEY.
author: Ashley E.

description:
Things you look for in donuts:

1. Freshness
2. Variety
3. Melt-in-your-mouth goodness.
4. Bob's

If you see a long line outside a small, dim-lighted shop amongst others, already it tells you that something is cookin'. Bob's Donuts attracts late-snack eaters, Polk Street bar-hoppers, as well as tourists and locals alike. 

Of course, everything you see in their display seem delicious, but my favorite ones are the old-fashioned plain and chocolate glazed. You can tell it's really fresh by the crunchiness on the outside and the soft, pillowy flesh. They came up with a regular glaze topped with donut crumbs. This one is a killer. So, don't miss it the next time you join the Bob's donuts' line.
author: Rika P.

description:
This is a shit-hole-in-the-wall place.  Described in the most deliciously endearing, loving way possible.
It's an old spot.
It looks like shit in there....
but...
It smells heavenly.
It tastes heavenly.
If you luck out and get in there when something just happens to be getting out of the fryers...
You wait.
You get whatever is hot/warm.
You don't complain about sugar, lard, calories, or if someone is nice to you or not.
You're there to send your tastebuds to heaven, not your self esteem.
You eat your ambrosia, you get your sugar high, you leave with a smile on your face, and love in your soul.
Thank you Bob's!
author: Barry A.

description: Dude. Inexpensive, quality, self-serve coffee and donuts? JUST DO IT.
author: Blake C.

description: The best donuts I've ever eaten. The folks running this place are  very friendly and the pastries are sooooo tasty.
author: Jason K.

description:
Bob's.... I love you, but you're going to make me fat!

I've never had anything less than delicious from here.  The apple fritter is SO GOOD!  I'm not a huge fan of apples but the flavor is perfectly balanced with cinnamon and the crunch.... oh god, the crunch!  Mmmm.

I'm a fan of the glazed twist as well... light and fluffy with a wonderful sweet glaze that flakes off as you bite into it.  Yum!  The chocolate old fashioned and french crullers are awesome too.

The older woman who works here is insanely sweet and kind.  I brought the 2 year old I nanny for in here and she literally showered him with free donut holes.  She handed him two, and later on when I opened the bag she had snuck at least 6 in there!!!!  So awesome, and was a very smart way of winning me over and guaranteed I'll be a return customer!

I had to take away one star for being cash only.  It isn't a huge deal, but it does inconvenience me most of the time because I don't usually have cash on me.
author: Tamara N.

description:
Sooooooo after eating a lot of Vietnamese food and feeling painfully full, my friend and I decided to walk some of it off by strolling up Polk St.

BAD MOVE.

The smell of cinnamon and freshly baked donuts were wafting down the street and like a dog, I sniffed my way into Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop.  Luckily I had totally remembered I had bookmarked this place on yelp for their apple fritters so I decided to buy one for tomorrow morning.

BAD MOVE...AGAIN.

I swear I just wanted a taste...a nibble if you will.   Yeah....we all know what happened next right?

So one apple fritter, a cinnamon donut, & an apple cake later, I decide that this place is pretty good.  kekeke.

Oh and by the way, can I just say the asian grandma who helped us (I don't know if she is an employee or someone who runs the joint), but she is just the CUTEST thang EVA!!  I just wanted to squeeze her she was too cute.  She was so friendly and telling us which donuts were just hot off the press and how we should add some ice cream to the apple cake to make it just like heaven, etc.   

The cinnamon donut is light in texture but a little too sweet for me.  The apple fritter is also a bit sweet but you can really taste the apple which I love.  The apple cake is like a more soggy heavier version of the apple fritter...good...but I think the fritter is better.  I would actually rate this more 3.5 stars, but bumped it up because of the cute grandma.  :-)
author: C A.

description:
OMG!!! I love you!! 

I had a giant Maple donut!  That thing was orgasmic explosion into my mouth ahhhhhhhhh!!! .....TWSS..lol Anyway  The Donut was super soft and moist.  Impossible for the smaller of our species to consume in one sitting, but I completed it.  Word of caution...You will have sugar comma after you finish it so make sure you have something like water or milk around to wash it down and balance the sugar. lol  The workers where so nice and made us feel welcomed.  They even gave us a free mini donut to try :)  Definitely come to Bob's when you are in town.
author: Carlos U.

description:
I had a Chocolate Custard Bar and Apple Fritter last night. Totally sinful specially when I am sleeping soon.

I didn't eat on the spot. It was cold when I reach home and I heated it in the microwave. Oishii!! Definitely will come back again.

P.S Always eat these pastry warm. Bread isn't as tasty when its cold nor hot.
author: Kenny K.

description:
I thought I'd only get Krispy Kreme donuts for the rest of my life but after a night of f@#$ing Jameson shots and coke backs my friend suggested we get beer sponges at Bobs Donuts. Ok. So we get there and it's like a willy wonka emporium for donuts because there's so many to choose from! From claws, to big, long, filled ones or round filled ones, nuts, sprinkles ^____^ CAN LOOK LIKE A MIRAGE TO A DRUNK DELUDED WOMAN!

The people are really nice, except I felt terrible. I was high as a kite and you could tell the shopkeep was like "Fu**, how many high assholes do I have to deal with tonight" He asked me how many ounces of milk I wanted, I stared at him blankly. 

The first thing you want to ask them is "If there's a recent batch from the oven" they usually have it behind them to the left and their donuts are the softest mmmm super cheap too!
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description: Bobs is the perfect donut dive. I can appreciate the boutique stuff like Dynamo and the vegan stuff like Pebbles but sometimes you just want a classic simple round sweet thing and this is what Bobs is for. 24 hour access, something is always fresh and the flavors are classic. I've been here twice in a month and I'm sure there are plenty more to come.
author: Justin P.

description:
Bob's... oh how I love thee.  I channel my inner Homer Simpson every time I venture into Bob's, which is quite often.

I stumbled upon Bob's when I first moved to SF three years ago and was living in the Tendernob (the Craigslist post said it was Lower Pac Heights!), and I'm so glad I did.  Moving to NoPa last year brought much sadness, as I was no longer blocks away from this delightful spot.  After spending six months in London without a decent donut to be found, I moved back to Pac Heights, in part because I would again be within walking distance of Bob's.  If only I were joking....

From the smell of fried goodness beckoning patrons in from Polk Street, to the MASSIVE super-sized glazed donuts, to the @whatsfreshest twitter account to track when donuts are fresh, Bob's is fantastic.

Minimalist decor?  Yes.
Prices that change depending on who's working?  Yes.
Do I care? No, just give me the donuts!
author: Kathleen H.

description: Just ok and what donut shop doesn't cook donuts around tge clock went there early and like 5 donuts to choose from and have to call a few days in advance for the big donut what the staff said crazy my local donut shop has fresh donuts around the clock
author: Sal L.

description:
BAH GAWD!!! I'm not the biggest fan of sweets but holy crap, the apple fritters are great! After a big dinner, I didn't really want to eat anymore but my friend mentioned this place was nearby and we decided to check it out. We were very fortunate to get the apple fritters fresh and hot. It really reminded me of a softer, apple-flavored churro. I was really surprised that it wasn't that oily and overly sweet. It was so good that I had to wash it down with milk; and I dislike milk (minus milk in cereal).

The place is open 24 hours and an awesome place to get your sweet tooth fix, especially if you are inebriated.
author: Jamie M.

description:
I have some friends who moved to San Francisco a few months ago and ever since I've been hearing about Bob's Donuts! 

I was visiting on Friday night and we decided to go get some donuts. As it was only 1am or so, a short line wound out the door and around the facade of the building a bit. Also, the nightly baking, I'm told, hadn't happened yet. 

Nevertheless, I am a fan! My cruller was crispy and the apple fritter we shared was perfectly constructed. I will have to make a return visit some time...
author: Nora G.

description: I think of this place as the donut Nazi shop.  I should say my review is based on only one experience.  The donuts are so flipping good.  The service is so bad that I actually found it pretty entertaining as it reminded me so much of the soup Nazi Seinfeld episode.  I will definitely be back.
author: Chris W.

description:
I don't get the hype.  As the reviews recommended, I tried the apple fritters and glazed donut when they JUST came out.  Meh.  I've had better.  The donuts were nothing extraordinary.  I wouldn't go back for more, that's for sure.  Now I can say, I tried the Bob's Donut and it was nothing special.  

Oh.  And the service can be better.  With the Yelp recommendations in mind, I chose the apple fritters and glazed donut, and when I asked the Asian lady behind the counter if she can recommend anything else, she simply snapped back, "don't you read the yelp?"  Uuuh, ooookkay.  She should have had better donuts for that kind of attitude.
author: Bayarea K.

description:
Bob's Donuts is pretty awesome. The fact that they are open 24/7 makes them even better. I'm pretty sure I got sick from 2 undercooked donuts I had there once, but I still go back frequently. Don't let that story scare you, I just wanted to be honest.

Go Bob's!
author: dr. L.

description: Not bad, not great. If you're in the area looking for breakfast or a late night snack, it may be worth a stop, but don't go out of your way. Apple fritter was about par for the course. The maple donut is what brought it up from a 2 star to a 3.
author: Kristian C.

description: All I have to say is I didn't even know I had love for donuts til I came across Bob's!! It's my go to every time I'm in SF and it truly is heaven on earth with each scrumptious bite!! It's worth getting that double chin and fat face...infact I eat3-4 donuts in each sitting. My favs are, apple fritter, crumb donut, and cheese Danish...mmmm!
author: sun b.

description: OMG, best donuts I have ever had and I am not even a donut fan!!! My boyfriend and I went at 11:00pm on a Saturday and the line was out the door and down the street, but well worth the wait. We got glazed, sugar, chocolate and the twist one (not sure of the real name) the chocolate one was warm and soooo good. I would definitely recommend this to other visitors.
author: Callie H.

description: There's no way you can walk past Bob's and NOT get a donut - - they should make a fragrance!  So delicious!
author: Ben N.

description: Bob's is a MUST! They are ALWAYS open so it's easy for my friends and I to just pop in and go! One of our favorites is the giant donut, HUGE thing, bigger than my head and fairly priced too! Whenever we go we each just pay two dollars or so and share it, and did I mention that it is MASSIVE? (haha) They have a great selection of donuts and lots of seating too!
author: Lexie N.

description:
So...let's say your gleefully self-destructive devil-may-give-a-shit-but-I-don't buddy is celebrating his birthday at a dive bar a handful of blocks away where the ranks of crackheads starts to get a little thicker.

Let's say he's been drinking since 10AM and you and about a half dozen others have each bought him a beer, a gin & tonic, and a shot of whiskey and now his liver is a warm puree and everyone else is sitting around him in a goofy-grinned whiskey-stinking circle watching him as if he were a campfire and delighting in his playfully belligerent  antics.

Let's say you were really digging this one chick you met who came to the party a little later, after your buddy had an encounter with law enforcement he only narrowly escaped because, despite being death-defyingly drunk, he was a white guy in a suit.

Well this shindig ain't about you, asshole, it's about your buddy. It's his fucking birthday and he wants to get donuts, so you're gonna ditch her ass and go get some Bob's Donuts!

I mean it's 1AM, but the joint is still open and still frying donuts. On a Monday night! So you line up, because there's a line out the door at 1AM on Monday (or rather Tuesday I suppose) and when you finally take a stool at the counter and bite into that ring of fried goodness, ohhhhhhhhh man.

Yes, whiskey can give you the shits and make your stomach do that weird gurgling turning itself inside-out-thing, and maybe you sobered up enough to feel your head hurt a little and you know you're not going to feel well tomorrow. But throw one of Bob's donuts down in your belly and it all melts away like the donuts themselves in your mouth.

Especially the glazed donuts, when they're fresh out of the fryer. Pure angel's light, fried into a ring of decadent fluffy goodness to exorcise you of your whiskey-induced demons.
author: Phi L.

description: The giant donuts here are great, perfect to share for two or three people.  Very nice family run business.  Plenty of parking on the street early in the morning during the week.   $6 for a giant donut.
author: Tim K.

description:
Been coming here for YEARS, before it got famous with this social boom. mom and pops shop, great service and the nicest people ever! 
If you're looking for a good doughnut, this is the place to be (after 12am) because its totally fresh and hot! best doughnuts in the bay area (IMO), havent had a doughnut/apple fritter as good. So wherever i go, i always compare other places with Bob's. 
Apple fritters and doughnut holes are the way to go!
author: Q W.

description:
My room-mate and I have been craving donuts for the past week.  So today, after dinner, we decided to go and try Bob's Donuts.  

From reading the reviews on yelp and seeing the the 7x7 list, I knew that I wanted the apple fritter.  Apple fritters are my absolute favorite (especially from Marie's Do-nut in Sacramento, but that's another review).  

We went into Bob's Donuts around 9:45 p.m. and for some reason the whole place was filled with smoke.  I would hope that this is not the usual, but either way, it was really weird.  The whole place was smokey and it was disappointing because I really wanted to smell the yumminess of the fresh donuts.  Anyway, I went with three other people and we were all going to get apple fritters, but there were only 3 left. :(  We bought those three and got some other donuts to try as well.

Friend #1 had a chocolate cake donut which she described as, "meh."  
Friend #2 took a bite of the apple fritter and said, "too sweet!"
Friend #3 had some apple fritter and thought it was decent.

I then ripped off a piece of the shared apple fritter and I'd say overall, it was a solid "meh."  The edges are crisp-ish, and the inside is soft-ish.  But overall, it tasted not that fresh (maybe I should have come around 2 a.m., as other reviewers have mentioned, to try and get a fresh apple fritter).  I wouldn't say it's a bad donut, but definitely not the best, and not worth a trip over to the area just for Bob's.
author: Samantha L.

description:
+4 for the delicious crumb donut and +1 for the scoutmob deal that got me a free one, with amazingly friendly service to boot. 

If I lived nearby, +1000 for being open 24 hours. SF needs more of these.
author: Richa A.

description:
BEST place for donuts!!
Good prices, many varieties & friendly workers. 
Even better when you're done bar hopping on Polk st cuz they will be open with a ton of donuts waiting for you to consume! 
Your eyes are bigger than your stomach when you come here (especially drunk).. but thats ok... just take them home and you have breakfast in the morning!
author: Viv D.

description: I had the pleasure of getting some donuts yesterday fresh after being cooked.  wow.  bob's is awesome.  always has been.  thank you for being in a city near me.  plain old fashioned.  what a treat.  crispy and soft and light.  great combo.  thanks again.
author: David M.

description:
What an experience!  I came in for the giant donut and left with 5 other normal donuts because they all looked so good.  The donuts are stellar and the shop has a old diner/Cheers feel to it with the regulars refilling their own coffee and watching Judge Judy on the tiny TV in the corner.  

I don't know if I can ever go to another donut shop again.  I'm a Bob's Donut customer for life.
author: Jordan F.

description: They say money can't buy happiness. They are wrong. If you have 80 cents, go to Bob's and get a fresh crumb donut. You will be happy.
author: wendella a.

description:
Bob's is 100% the best. The people are awesome and very cool and the donuts are definitely the right price. While there is definitely a hipster-Marina-esque component to the customers they never try to bow to marketing to those people by being ironic--which they easily could in a place that has so much history to it.

The coffee 100% sucks, but I'm also used to Jersey diner coffee so I'm not too surprised.
author: Paul C.

description:
Let me ask you a question:  aren't there, sometimes, some things that are so wonderous and ephemeral that they defy description?  Or ratings?  Or compliments or complaints?  

And yes, these experiences sometimes do take place in the physical world, in an existing space that can be captured and pinned down like a butterfly under glass, can be somehow communicated through online broadcast in the hopes that others would also, even for a moment, taste a bit of nirvana, a bit of I-am-at-one-with-the-world-and-with-everyone.  

I understand that the impulse to try and communicate something inexpressable is about sharing.  That yelping is an act of compassion for those you love and also for all the strangers who will read reviews. 

But sometimes, some things that take place are truly ineffable and indescribable and are just between you and the universe.

I don't know if this will happen to you when you go to Bob's Donuts and try a warm apple fritter with cold milk but it sure as hell happened to me.  Five stars.
author: julie m.

description:
Came here because my date couldn't stop yapping away about how great the donuts were and how we HAD to come when they had fresh donuts straight out of the fryer. Turns out that they make fresh donuts at midnight, how convenient for my diet. 

We got an old fashioned chocolate donut, a cinnamon donut, and a glazed french. They were all DELISH! Their old fashion donuts are slightly crispy, different than what I'm used to but I liked it. The cinnamon donut was perfection, and the glazed french was mouth watering. The fact that they were all still warm from the fryer made it 100x better. I was complaining about having to go at midnight but once that hot, sweet, sugary donut touched the tip of my tongue, I took back every complaint that was made.

-1 star because the inside could be spruced up a bit.
author: Tammie P.

description:
So I walked over this morning in the pouring rain to purchase an apple fritter, which is #80 on the 7x7 big eat list and boy was that the best donut and / or fritter I've ever had in my life.  

Bob's Donuts definitely beats Krispy Kreme, Dunkin Donuts, everything. . . And I don't even like donuts that much, so this says a lot! Glazed to perfection, lacking a bit of apple (but that was ok in my opinion b/c I prefer the sugar flavor over fruit), and huge, I split it with Patricia P, and we were both happy as can be this morning!  

The lady working behind the counter was friendly and small talking with me too. Props to you, Bob! Can't wait to come back. This may have to be a new Friday morning thing...
author: Jenny W.

description:
DELICIOUS SOFT FLUFFY DONUTS! 

I go for the classics: original glazed and/or sugar donut! Can't go wrong with that! Over the years I feel like the size of the donut has gotten smaller but quality is just the same.  Just the right sweetness and texture I feel like I can eat 5 and not kneel over unlike Krispy Kreme..
author: Annette Y.

description:
Came here as the last stop on a party trolley. Got a fresh plain glazed (the best kind of donut as far as I'm concerned) and a giant one for the birthday boy. They even put candles in it for us!!

The giant donut is $5 and the regular ones are under a dollar. We kept saying, "You are undercharging here!" 

Love the old-schooleyness of this place. I hope it stays there forever!
author: Claire b.

description: The service here is really friendly. They have a good selection of donuts and they're 24 hours. That's all I can say about it, really. When you have the craving, this is a good place to go any time of day or night.
author: Amy J.

description:
Just the thought of chomping into a massive Bob's Giant Donut brightens my entire day and makes me incredibly happy.  I will be trying one of these very soon.  

What I have tried here is their old fashioned donuts.  I love a good cakey donut, and Bob's are just perfect:  not too sweet, plenty of crunch on the outside, and soft on the inside.  The chocolate covered old-fashioneds are my absolute favorite, though I do have to agree that the apple fritters are awesome too.

Open 24 hours!  I can't think of a better cheap treat after a night on the town.
author: Joanne G.

description: Great donuts and open 24/7? Win. Got the French crullers. Hope I can try the apple pandowdy next!
author: Amanda H.

description:
OH.

MY.

GAWWWWWWWWWWWWWD.

For all you Mathletes and brainiacs out there, let me put it this way:

Sugar Sweet Sunshine Bakery : cupcakes
Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop : donuts

In other words, go there. NOW. (Or forever hold your peace.)

P.S.: [another blatant attempt at garnering some U votes of the U/F/C] Go beginning around 11PM and you will get them HOT off the press. Because they're open 24 HOURS. Yesssss! That is the sound of the New York in me, pumping my fist in the air as I revel in the fact that I found a 24 hour place in the city! And, trust me, if you haven't seen your own donut bobbing in a vat of maple glaze at midnight immediately prior to your consumption of said donut, your life is not yet complete. And we wouldn't want that, would we? [/another blatant attempt at garnering some U votes of the U/F/C]
author: Audrey J.

description: I got a deal on Groupon for an assorted dozen donuts and got it for a lunch with friends.  I thought the donuts were just ok - the glazed was good - but my friends loved them.  I agree that the setting is a bit shoddy, though.  Will stick with Dynamo.
author: B. Y.

description: Better than the chain stores, reasonably priced, and fresh. Not quite as good as Allie's Donuts in Rhode Island, but still very good.
author: jason w.

description: Hands down the best donuts that I've had the pleasure of stuffing in my face. My favorite are their maple bars, but their chocolate and glaze are bomb as hell too. I also like their crumb and cake donuts. My brother loves their french crullers, so much so that he almost ran into scaffolding devouring one walking down Polk. That was pretty epic. Unfortunately, my wife and I only live a few blocks up the street so we often find ourselves walking down to pick up a few for ourselves. Most of the time--who am I kidding, all of the time--we end up shamelessly eating them on our walk back. LAY OFF ME, I'M STARVING!!! They are THAT good.
author: Eric C.

description:
Who knew a donut could taste so good! Open late (which has a HUGE line) but if you go during the early evening there isn't a wait. Most things are made right on the spot but I went for the cream-filled chocolate donut. Savory, delicious and sweet. Most donut places are the same but this one really tasted so much better. 

That, or I was extremely hungry, I don't know.
author: Diana Y.

description:
My girlfriend lives less than half a block from Bob's and it's dangerous.  

Nicest employees ever, especially considering the location.

I once stood in line behind 4 hookers and their pimp, at 5AM, waiting for a donut.  Sooooo, this place is popular.

Ask for whatever is freshest, and just say yes.  Of particular note, are the buttermilk maple glazed, apple fritters, and really, whatever is hot out of the oil.

oh, and they are open 24 hours.
author: Alex T.

description: The best.  Glazed donuts are amazing, but they run out.  Get a box full of whatever they've got and you can't go wrong.
author: Thomas R.

description:
My friends and I are on a mission to complete 7X7's 100 Things To Try Before You Die. So immediately after we stuffed ourselves silly at Brenda's French Soul Food, we headed down Polk Street and went to Bob's to grab an apple fritter-- kill 2 birds with 1 stone, as they say.  And just cuz this was a donut shop, we decided to get a dozen donut holes as well.  We got all this to go of course-- we did just devour a huge brunch.  

We had the donut holes and fritter for an afternoon snack.  The donut holes were alright-- we could tell they weren't fresh.  I'll have to come back and make a late night donut run.  But the apple fritter was a hit as expected.  Probably one of the best apple fritters I've had.  It was crisp, wasn't too sweet, and it had just the right amount of apple in it.  The perfect pairing for my fresh cup o' joe =)
author: Anne A.

description: Fresh, delicious donuts that are substantially better than the ones at Krispy Kreme.  If you are ever craving donuts late at night, this is the place to go.
author: Abena O.

description: The best ham/cheese croissants I've had in the US -- they are just like the ones you taste in Europe.  Their apple fritters are fantastic, too.  Go early in the am when everything is warm and fresh.  They also have a cool way to collect tips!
author: Didi L.

description:
Methinks the majority of positive reviews are from liquor fueled carb cravings.

The gruff server thought her bare hands were towels, using them as she was to clean the window sill when we arrived. She proceeded to rearrange donuts on several platters, touching each one. Ick!

The donuts? Dense and a tad too sweet. Yes they have a novelty donut cake but it's a dry mess. Good to eye, not to eat.
author: Kim K.

description: This place is a must! It's a small shop with a line out the door and  around the corner. But it moves quickly ;) the glazed buttermilk is delish. Apple fritters are always my fav and this did not disappoint.  I am usually the type that orders essentially the same thing everywhere I go but Bob's is one place I get whatever is fresh (and an apple fritter). Tell yourself youll go to the gym tomorrow
author: Kelly R.

description: HOLY CRAP BATMAN! This place is amaze balls. Line out door! The donuts are made all day long and are little pillows of love.... so fluffy and so delicous. Go there NOW!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Fresh hot donuts- YUM!!!!

Had a fresh glazed donut and ate it while it was still warm. Be sure to ask for ones they have just made. You won't regret it! I've been reading about the apple fritters, which is one of my favorite kinds of donuts. Will definitely go across the city for another bite of these bad boys!

A helpful tip- cash only.
author: Nadiyah S.

description: Line out the door as the donuts come out of the fryer. And worth the wait! Anytime you need a snack, Bob's is there for you. Picked up an assortment of chocolate covered delights - raised, glazed, and old fashioned.
author: Cathy E.

description: Love this place!  Has the usual suspects (old fashioned, original and sprinkles) and a new favorite ($6 Giant donut).  Open 24 hour to satisfy you munchies/set tooth cravingl
author: Jason A.

description:
Apple Fritter is great! 

Light glaze to a fried goody.  What more can you ask for? 
Service was fast and they are open 24 hours!
author: AhLin C.

description: Apple fritter something is amazing. So good. Just enough sweet with the apples. It is so delicious. I have been here a few times and each time I get a donut I am ever disappoint.
author: Jenn K.

description:
I think some people need to get their apple fritter meters checked, because there must be some major glitches in their systems. I've had the apple fritters here on several occasions and they've always been the same: over-fried and lacking much apple or cinnamon flavoring. Most of the time, I can taste the oil that the fritters were friend in. Not a good thing. I'm looking for a slightly crisp exterior and a nice and chewy interior with juicy sweet bits of apple mixed in. Again, not the case here. 

Apple fritter rant aside, there are some things to redeem Bob's. The old-fashioned chocolate donuts are good. The chocolate frosting is good and they're decently sized. Still a bit over-fried, but not as big a deal with these. Everything else I've had from here has been pretty average. It just seems like a lot of cakes/pastries/cookies are either dry or bland. I've mostly stopped by when only if I happened to be nearby and wanted a donut late at night. The service here has been consistently very friendly. That definitely counts for something. 

Obviously people love it for some reason, but I don't think i'll be craving these guys again anytime soon.
author: Saunders C.

description: Used scoutmob to get a free donut. got the apple fritter. It was HUGE! However the taste an flavor was not accurately reflected. The dough was thick, sweet but that was it. No wow-factor.
author: Vanessa K.

description: This place has a line outside at 1:00AM. It's  that good!! It's actually very good. A must try if you're in SF. Make sure to try the crumbs donut and glazed donut.
author: Maricar F.

description:
Can't believe I found myself here at 1am in a line that was halfway down the block! And, I was sober, just having a midnight snack, since I couldn't sleep. 

The line up is worth, especially if you ask for what is hot & fresh. Yes, hot and fresh at 1am. Amazing!
author: Kristy B.

description:
Simply the best.  My mark of a good donut shop is how well they execute on the holy grail of donuts, namely the glazed or honey dipped.  Forget all the others, there really is nothing as perfect as a fresh honey dipped ring of yeast raised perfection.  And on this note, Bob's rocks.  Light and airy, just enough bite to sink your teeth into and pull away. 3 main bites in almost 1/3 portions, then that last little bite is followed by a lick of the finger.  Then it's off for round two.  

I've never had better, and someday I'll work my way up to the grandaddy of the honey dipped, their big 5 dollar one.  

Coffee gets at 4 our of 5 stars, I wish it had a little more depth and body.  Easily  overlooked given the other treats.
author: Va L.

description:
BEST. CRULLER. EVER.
Soft, fluffy, airy, beautiful ridges on its exterior.  There aren't many foods I would consider paying for that are filled with 50% air, but this cruller makes it work.

My one small critique would be the sugary mess it causes, but since when was walking and eating a sugar-covered donut ever a simple task?
author: Angela T.

description: Bob's is a place that makes me park in the 7am tow away yellow zone and hope I beat the meter maid.  Is their cinnamon roll or pecan twist (kinda small but tasty) worth the $500 tow/ticket? - NO but their donuts and my laziness makes me do that.  The customer service (one lady) is slow but that's cause I'm use to donut places throwing your selection in a bag and hurling it over the counter.  I haven't had their gigantic $5 donut yet but I see them get ordered by lots of people for events in the morning - saw a birthday one that had me salivating.  Call for any customization and they do (I've been told).  Place is a little divey but so far kicks butt over all donut places I've been to including the Happy Donut chain.
author: Andrea K.

description:
If you happen to come here while Ming, their donut master baker is in action, watch him. Watch closely. And salivate. If you don't see him, watch this video a friend filmed: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GN2fH-BohcE.

That said, this is probably the best donut store in the whole world. Among their many, many great flavors, I especially adore the apple fritters with a glass of ice cold milk. One of the ladies who's working here and who looks as if she's Asian but actually is from Brazil very much agrees with me and tries to steer my friends towards them every time they aren't sure what to take. 

That said, you must get what's fresh out of the hot oil, even if it's cake donuts. Which I normally hate. But not here.

Spread the love: buy a dozen donuts and just pay for ten. And do it 24/7, Bob's Donuts never closes. Never.
author: Roland A.

description: Showed up at about 6pm. Not impressed. Donuts all looked pathetic and shriveled. Asian lady behind the counter could not care less about being there. I don't know what you all are touting here, but this was a major let down. Got the apple fritter to share with a pal - it was good with big chunks of apple. Meh!
author: Carolyn F.

description: Came here for the first time looking for some dessert after our dinner. I ordered the chocolate cake donut (soft middle) and it was good but nothing different than other donut shops. My friend ordered the apple fritter and normally, I'm not a fan but this one tasted pretty good. So if you come here, try to stick to the apple fritter.
author: Krishna S.

description:
OMG. You guys aren't fuckin' around about the apple fritter. 
And neither is Bob's.

This place is a safe distance away from my house. Yet, a mere three blocks from stinky door yoga. Fuck a coconut drink. I bet Bob's is the perfect post-workout rejuvenator. Some things are meant to be.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
OMG. I am in love!! I was not a huge doughnut lover...until I encountered this doughnut shop at the bright hour of 2a.m. HOT doughnuts, and ham filled crossants....to die for. Love them! 
Wide variety of doughnuts and pastries. I have to say, if you are trying to watch your diet...this is not the place for you! They have huge doughnuts...and almost every kind of doughnut you can think of! 
Looks like a 'hole in the wall'...but so worth venturing inside!
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
After Donut King in LA, I was excited to look for its equal in San Francisco. Yelp led me to Bob's and after talking with a few SF locals, I decided it was worth a shot. 

I was excited to find my two favorites in the shop window: twist glaze and old fashioned cake donut. I ordered one of each (total came out to $2.20) and promptly sat down at the counter to eat the donuts. 

I started with the twist because everyone knows you need to move from less-rich to more-rich flavors. My first bite was a big disappointment. I like donuts to be light and airy and melty, more like Krispy Kreme than not, and Bob's donuts are not like this, at least not the twist glaze. The donut was doughy and kind of hard and chewy. I don't think it was particularly old but neither was it just out of the oven. However, I expected something more from the famous Bob's.

I moved on to the cake donut and was expecting to be disappointed again. I wasn't at first bite. It was rich and creamy with that buttermilk-y flavor. However, by the time I got to the middle of the donut, it was too much. Again, that doughy heaviness that made me feel like a doughboy (or girl). 

Overall, I was not impressed with my Bob's experience and will continue my search for the perfect donut in San Francisco.
author: Christine P.

description:
What can I say that has not already been said about this place? 
Probably nothing!

I usually go here about 1am to avoid the line... yes there is a line at this time of night... for a nice fresh maple bar and an ice cold milk.
author: Christy P.

description: Simply the best donuts ever made.  It's a hole in the wall establishment with traditional mom-and pop donuts, but it is worth the drive and wait for these magically warm and light donuts.  This place also holds a special place in my heart because we served 200 of these fresh donuts at our wedding, in addition to eating the BIG donut as our "cake cutting."  We love Bob's.
author: Kimmy D.

description: I am a fan. It's open 24 hours so that's a plus. Just like back in college we had a doughnut place opened always which is a good thing to eat after drinking, absorbs it all up. The doughnuts have good flavor and they seemed pretty fresh. Not the greatest doughnuts ever but I do enjoy them. Open always and pretty cheap and good selection. That spells success to me.
author: Jeromy G.

description: It was very good :) open all the time for the late night cravings ! and dont get the cooking unless it is fresh because it was hard when i got it but overall loved it !
author: Karen N.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of donuts, or anything bread-y for that matter, so maybe my review/rating isn't that fair.. But I do admit this was a preeetty good stop for drunchies after a night of drinking on Polk. Their donuts fresh out of the oven are amazing!

Be careful coming here under the influence though. My boyfriend almost convinced me to buy all the chocolate donuts with sprinkles.. I ended up buying 8 of them, haha. Unfortunately, they taste like any other not-so-fresh-out-of-the-oven donuts the next day :/

But, hay! They're cheap! Hurrah.
author: Aeramis F.

description: My husband and I actually got donuts from here to use as the grooms cake for our wedding. Being that my husband hates real cake, but LOOOVES crumb cake donuts. I'm not sure how many we got anymore, but I know it went faster than the expensive cupcakes I ordered! I had to snag the last one up for my husband before they were all gone! Since it's National Donut Day or whatever, I think I will be taking a little walk to get a donut today!
author: Amelia S.

description:
I've been wanting to try the Giant Donut for the lonnnnnngggggggestttttt time. I don't come into Sf often BUT I was flying down to LA and had this completely insane idea of making a pitstop to Bob's just to get a giant donut and bring it home. My sisters thought I was crazy for choosing SFO over Oakland Airport just for a goddamn donut but it was well worth it. It's so fluffy and soft and just.. beautiful. I bought two giant donuts and carried them with me through airport security. 2 giant donuts costed 13.90 and then I craved and got a regular glazed donut for only .95 which was pretty cheap. I was actually shocked because the closest donut shop for charges 1.50 for their donuts! 

My family loves them and basically gave me best sister of the year award for going out of my way, walking an hour back and forth from powell bart to this shop with a heavy duffle bag while the sky was being a b*tch pissing rain.
author: Emmy N.

description:
Okay, 5 stars for this place, and I'm one of those people that have yet to even experience their hot, fresh out of the oven donuts yet. But these donuts are the greatest of great. Such amazing cakey, sugary, fried goodness here. I can only imagine what a fresh donut would be like here. I probably wouldn't be conscious to tell you, it'd be so good I'd probably pass out. The ladies that work here 24/7 are friendly. Ask for a half dozen, and they'll put together a nice little magical, delicious package for you.

CASH ONLY. fyi. Donuts are about a buck each, or a bit more depending on what you get.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Ah rain..

I love eating a good donut in the rain while watching Regis and Kelly on the tube at Bob's. 

Scratch that-an apple bread pudding slice and an apple fritter. I couldn't decide between the two so I just ate half of each. 

I love you Bob. I love you like the old grandpa I never had. Now in 4 hours when I put my dress slacks on for work, I'll probably curse you but understand it's because my love affair with you is stronger than my affair with 24 hour fitness. 

There's a crispy, sugar armor coated goodness to each of Bob's donuts. Thank god they're open 24 hours. You can get your hangover on and stumble into Bob's with no one judging you.
author: Jessica K.

description: There are few pleasures in this world like biting into a freshly made maple buttermilk bar from Bob's Donuts. 10pm is when the magic happens.
author: Mike T.

description:
