One word to describe Bob's Donut: OVERRATED!  All of my friends have always raved about this spot espcially the apple fritters.  I live up the street from this spot and it took 4 years before I finally step foot into this establishment.  First, the lady that worked there wasn't very nice.  I tried to ask for her recommendation but she pretty much answered with an attitude that everything they sold was good.  We had a coupon from Scoutmob for 50% off at Bob's Donut, which she wouldn't accept because she said that we needed to buy at least $5 worth.  Yes, our apple fritter was only $1.60.  I'm not trying to be cheap but it's the principle.  The coupon said nothing other than the max discount is $7.  

Sadly, our apple fritter tasted burnt!  :(  I think it would probably taste a lot better if it didn't have the burnt taste.  

I might give this spot another shot.  I wonder if people like this spot because they're having it when they're drunk from bar hopping down Polk Street.
author: Vicky C.

description:
best.donuts.ever. APPLE FRITTERS! omg. 

I went this morning when they were fresh out of the oven and they are just heavenly. I haven't been here in a while even though I live just over the hill. Think I'll be coming here more regularly now. Normally not a huge donut fan but I will definitely check out the other donut varieties!
author: Melody C.

description: What happened?!?!  You're using a new flour?  Your donuts are way smaller.  They don't taste how I remember them.  I used to crave these donuts. Sorry, Bob's, you lost me as a customer.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I ordered the HUGE DONUT!!! It was GINORMOUSLY DELICIOUS!
Not much else to say, if you like donuts you'll really like this place.

And if you feel really lucky, you can try doing the giant donut challenge: pay $7 for a drink and giant donut. In order to win, you must finish the giant donut for a giant donut only (not the drink). If you succeed you get all your money back, a t-shirt, AND your picture on the wall. Totally worth it ;D
author: Christopher D.

description:
Omg!! So this is what donuts are supposed to taste like.

You can watch as they fry the donuts, and they will recommend items if you ask, based on what is freshest, most popular, or just their personal preference. 

I had a choc french kruller, apple fritter, and fresh from the fryer glazed donut holes.  Consistency was amazing, crisp but soft and airy, and hot! 

Friends also tried the old fashioned donuts and said they were great.

I convinced my friend to get the apple dough something...looked like a dense pie. One slice weighed a pound, literally. It's like bread pudding apple pie...wouldn't really recommend it but it was entertaining at least.  

will definitely come here again if i'm craving something sweet for a midnight BINGE.  this is binge food, people.  1 donut is probably like 800 calories...i saw the amount of lard they use.  but oh so worth it once in a while.
author: Trish G.

description:
It seems unlike most people in SF, I actually grew up in a small town where not only could you get home made donuts from a small family shop like Bob's, but it was the normal thing to do.

So I guess I don't really understand the hype about Bob's Donuts.  Yes, the donuts are good.  But I grew up on stuff like this.  I mean it's pretty amazing that places like this still manage to survive in a hoity-toity town like SF, but the donuts, though good, are hardly amazing.

I will say they are much better than Safeway donuts or Happy Donuts.
author: Jean K.

description:
Sweetness!

Delicious donuts w/out the hoity-toity stuff.

Following everyone's suggestion I came late (11:30p) and there was the beautiful GIANT donut in all it's glory! It was hard to choose... they had glazed, chocolate, and crumb. 

*GIANT crumb = AWESOME. The crumb pieces are chunks of glaze and ... doughnut crumbs (duh). I had friends scooping handfuls of the sweet remainders of this donut and topping it with ice cream later. 

*Apple fritter was wonderful. A friend said it reminded her of a funnel cake, but better.

*Old fashioned glazed= perfect, not in shape, but in taste, texture inside and out =9

(These three were still GREAT the next day.)

While we joyfully consumed our donuts and the bar we chatted with Bob (?) as he made fresh batches. Loved that even in SF there were places you can go and not get the "city" cold-shoulder from fellow patrons.

We tried a few other donuts, but were not totally impressed probably because they weren't fresh out of the oil.

TIP: Purchase the stuff off the tower of racks, those are the freshest!
author: Angel L.

description: I don't really eat that many donuts (could anyone really eat donuts that often??), but when I do eat donuts, I expect it to be fresh, fluffy and FROM BOBS. You cannot go wrong with Bobs. From the apple fritters to the classic chocolate to the old fashions, EVERYTHING is good at Bobs. Made fresh all day, you can count on Bobs satisfying my donut + milk craving any time. Just beware of the people coming out of bars at 2am because you could be standing in line for awhile trying to get these yummy treats on your way home.
author: Angela S.

description: My friend and I knew we had a while to wait for the next bus at the bus stop so we stopped in here to kill time. I got the thing that has donuts and apples in it that had a funny name that I cannot remember now. It was extremely dense and a huge serving for the price. It is very sweet and I liked it but after a few bites it gets to be too much. My friend got a chocolate frosted donut and she said it was good. They're happy to take credit cards so that's a nice plus. The woman working the register was friendly.
author: Yolanda Y.

description: Apple fritters!!!!!! The donuts are so fresh, its open 24 hours, and the apple fritters are hugeeeee! I love this place, the ultimate comfort donut for a long day.
author: Reiko n.

description:
This place seems so iconic! And after a night of eating and drinking - this is totally a place to wind down. My boyfriend Yelped this place on the fly and it was a great surprise to find that this place has such a loyal following (and for good reason).

I won't lie, the donuts aren't the most unique or best donuts I've ever had, but they are definitely delicious, fresh, and great late night. The cinnamon cake donut I had crumbled in my mouth so well, was sweet, and fresh! The chocolate old fashioned I had was JUST made, so the chocolate wasn't even dried yet, and the donut was still warm. So good. They also have a great variety (besides your standard cake donuts, and old fashioned, they have large cookies and other various pie/strusel looking pastries).

The place is also so friendly, at 11:30 pm there was a huge crowd inside, sitting at the tiny booths. There was an elderly Asian man eating donuts by himself, there were groups of friends, there was a couple on a date - I mean, how often do you see donut places filled with such variety of people at that late hour. Most donut places that I see that actually have people there late night are usually students. Or drunkards. The girl behind the cash register gave us stickers for free that say Bob's Donuts, and when someone requested it, she gave extra maple glaze on top of their maple glazed cake donut. Wow.
author: Katherine P.

description: it's 2am and you're kind of hungry, but want something sweet... where are you gonna go?  Bob's Donuts, of course.  they've pretty much got donuts being made all day, and if you are lucky, they are going to be making maple cake donuts when you arrive.  seriously... never had such a delicious donut.... hot, sweet, with a bit of cinnamon in the batter to really give it that kick.  yummmmmmmm.
author: Tina L.

description: Very fluffy, and doughy, not too sweet!  I'd highly recommend the chocolate custard filled donut, as the cream filling is not too sweet either.  Very efficient service, as they have their Square iPad register set up for quick checkout.
author: Corey C.

description:
It's ok...
Donuts way too greasy. I can't eat them. 
Guess I have to try the apple fritter.
Donuts & Things a block south is cheaper and friendlier. And I like their donuts - better selection of ones with nuts, sprinkles, etc.
A hooker and pimp got shot in the doorway a couple of months ago at night, so I don't think I'll be stopping on my way home from the bar anymore. 
Cash only.
author: Heart T.

description:
Giant Donuts!!!  

I'm so glad I don't live closer to this 'lil shop with big giant donuts - my mouth isn't, but my stomach is.  I went late at night when the donuts are made fresh, and the locals are out and about.  Fresh food and excellent entertainment - the perfect thing to end the night (or start the day) with.
author: Shinny L.

description:
OMG! Why didn't I come here sooner?!  It was a weekend of 1sts for me ~ Brenda's (brunch), Zuni's (din.), Bob's (dess.) ~ great places to drag my visiting friend to for a culinary cruise of The City.

N and I were fascinated by the old skool donut making process ~ got an old fashion out of the fryer - hot, crispy, and mmmm good.  Worth the wait.

Look forward to trying out others next time I'm in the 'hood.
author: Cathy K.

description:
Bryan K.- you lucky ducky. I want a Bob's Donut t-shirt!!
I would wear my Sprinkles tank underneath. That'll prove that I'm a saccharine-seeking junkie, ey?

I'm gonna be REAL helpful here and just say that you should order any and everything in this shop. They're open late- which means that you can start munching jelly-filled and chocolate glazed classics at like 5PM and work your way down to the crullers and glazed varieties. Go home and digest, then come back later. Woot!!!!

Self control is overrated. Apple fritters are not.
author: Elaine T.

description:
Open...24...hours...a...day.  Bliss!  

If Bob's was in my neighborhood a) I would gain 400 pounds and b) Dynamo Donuts would go under (wishful thinking).  

Bob's has deliciously fresh and warm donuts and pastries that are so good--not too sweet, not too greasy.  Don't get me wrong, this isn't health food, but after I eat my three donuts (yes, I have to get three and they never make it back to my home) I don't have that gastrointestinal post-donut regret.  Unless regret means "why didn't I buy a dozen?".  

Haven't had anything I didn't like there; my preference is for the plain old-fashioned and cake donuts.  Note that if you want maple bacon or lavender whiskey lemongrass you should hie thee to Dynamo - or, shudder, Humphrey Slocombe.  Then prepare yourself for a long line of highly gullible foodies.  (I'm refraining from saying douche-y about foodies.  I wait, I just did.).

EDIT: Last time I was there my donut was seriously oily.  Hoping that's a fluke.
author: Joe B.

description: Fritter..Fritter...Fritter! Try the Apple Fritter, especially after a night of drinking and craving a late night snack. Go at night, around 11pm if you want to sink your teeth into a mouthful of warm, yummy goodness.
author: Naomi C.

description: Delicious, and open 24/7! Chocolate, glazed and old-fashioned donuts were fantastic. Also, price is spot-on! Highly recommend.
author: Yael S.

description:
Ok, so here is the deal, I went late evening and the donuts were well picked over and they were tired! I got a glazed, a cake w/chocolate and sprinkles, and a maple rise. They tasted about two-days old. But because I went so late in the evening, I will try again when they are fresh and update my review. My husband has had them fresh and swears they are the best. 

I am just disappointed; it is apparent they make one batch for the whole day, so late evening donuts are stale donuts.
author: ME- G.

description: I love Bob's! I've come here on a late night and an early morning and both times the donuts were great.  Sometimes there is a line, but you get through it pretty quickly. You can see all the donuts in the window from the sidewalk, and there are more in the case once you get in. The staff is friendly, and the inside has a small area to sit if you're in there in the morning. There's even a giant donut you can buy. I mean, giant.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
I had a super craving for a donut at 3AM in the morning...but I thought it...where would I find a donut shop open that late, let alone serve FRESHLY BAKED DONUTS?

I was out of my mind and my stomach was playing tricks on me. At this hour, donuts could only come from the the wildest parts of my hallucinating imagination...but we so happened to drive by Bob's Donuts after walking around aimlessly for 30 minutes....looking for my donut. Wait...WHAA...a line for donuts at 3AM in the morning? IT MUST BE BOMB.

Although the wait was a bit long and chilly at 3AM in the morning...the touch of a warm, fresh-out-of-the oven, glazed donut immediately regenerated my energy-fatigued body...it was that damn good. 

$0.95. Yes it is a bit more expensive than your average donut, but you can't go wrong with that price at 3AM in the morning!
author: David W.

description:
In the middle of the night, looking for a place to chill and I was craving for sweets.  I check yelp and Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop was open 24hrs and had raving 4.5 stars so I came by check it out.

Early in the morning around 2:00am one of the guys were making fresh doughnuts!  You can smell those suckers all the way out side, they smell delicious.  I ordered 2 dozen of doughnut holes, and a doughnut with chocolate on top with custard filled in.  

The custard doughnut was good and the bottom of the doughnut was really fattening.  I can taste the excess oil still soaked on the bottom.  The doughnut holes were alright, a bit stiff and not soft.  I have had better.

One thing that really caught my attention was the super ridiculous size doughnuts.  They look like a foot long in diameter and seem a pretty good birthday present!  

Overall, this place was mediocre nothing really wowed me I will try something else next time and I'll let you know if it wows me.  In particular I would want to try the apple fritter.

**parking**

The parking is only street

Cash only no cards sorry!
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
this review is for their giant donut (plain glaze).
it is soooo delicious. who would have thought that a big donut would taste so good?
instead of wedding cake, i want a wedding donut. a tower of giant donuts.
author: Della Q.

description:
I came here last night at like 1am.  This was Stop Four, our last stop, on a multi-adventure day that consisted of drinking in a saloon-like bar, filling up on all-you-can-eat sushi, and relaxing with hookah.  At the end of hookah, fellow adventurer Tanya suggested we all get donuts.  

It was 1am.  Why not?  :)

We walked over to Bob's, and Tanya was telling us that this is the best place in the city to get donuts.  

Wow.  I don't really have a sweet tooth, but I was certainly curious.  Best donuts in the city?  Need to try.

This is a 24-hour place, and apparently 1AM is the best time to come because that's when they roll out all the freshly-cooked donuts, piping hot.

I got an old-fashioned glazed one + milk = $2.35.  My friend was smarter and got a coiled donut because she saw them bringing it out on the tray, meaning they had JUST made it.

SMART DECISION.

Tip for you: if you come here at 1AM, you should ALWAYS go for whatever is the freshest, whatever you see them making right there and then.  That fresh, hot donut was AMAZING. I have never had a donut like that in my LIFE.  It was scrumptious, hot, soft, crazily fluffy, perfectly sweet - wondrous!  I should've gotten one of those.  

So, we sat there in that shop, at like 1:30AM on a Tuesday night/Wednesday morning, watching Oprah, and eating our donuts and milk.  It was a delicious and perfect way to end the eight hours of adventure.  

Thank you, Bob's Donuts, for being open late and making fresh, delicious sweet treats for silly young souls in the middle of the night.  You made me very happy.
author: Vivian C.

description: Like many other reviews state, if you want hot fresh donuts from Bob's, you'll most likely have to be there late at night when they come right out of the oven.  I got a bunch in the morning and I really enjoyed their apple fritter (I imagine it would taste even better if it were toasty fresh) and a glazed donut with a crumb coating.  I actually prefer Randy's Donuts down in Inglewood hands down, but Bob's Donuts is pretty good for what they offer.
author: Albie F.

description: I was cravin' for some doughy, sticky, greasy, yummy, fantastical, magic this afternoon and got in my car and raced to bob's. I was welcomed by the cutest woman ever as she helped me pick out donuts and telling me which ones were her favorite and why. I brought these glorious things back to the office only to be left with happy faces and happy tummies.
author: Riley J.

description: I thought the donuts were just alright. To me they taste just as "good" as most neighborhood donut shop. I understand that it's fresh but frankly I'm not exactly sure what all the hype is about.
author: Esther A.

description:
1. 6am-6am= devotion
2. Donuts.
3. Cheap.
4. I've never seen or met Bob.
5. The windows are so clean, I actually tried to reach in and grab one. Then realized I couldn't when my head hit the glass.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
24 HOUR donut shop in the city. Frequent this place after a night out in the city.

I've had plenty of good things happen here. Last week, a guy offered to pay for all three of my friends' donut orders (+ people behind us, + he wanted us to order more). Thank you guy for you and your husband for being blessed to buy us donuts.

I met Bob once too... nice guy! Maybe I'll see ya again next time I'm here...Oh and get the APPLE FRITTERS and MAPLE BAR donuts. Yuuuum.
author: Chester A.

description: I don't really see the big big for this place. Big thumbs up to the variety of donuts, loss of thumbs to the blah staff person. Maybe if I did the 3 AM stumble into the place like others are gushing about, but I don't see a donut shop being that worthy.
author: Cronut C.

description:
A window full of donuts! Let's do this. I have a friend who is notorious for stopping by Bob's after the bars (Polk has some great night spots) and he is always determined to get his donuts before stumbling home. 
This is a smart man! The best surprises are the favors you do for yourself in advance, and forget about. 
Purchasing Bob's Donuts the night before, is one of those great surprises when you wake. It's tradition. You'll be glad you partook.
author: Adrienne K.

description:
This place is so magical.

Arrived with a friend after 12AM and two kinds of donuts were fresh out of the fryer and glazed in front of our eyes. We got a chocolate glazed buttermilk bar and a chocolate glazed old fashioned. Both were equally delicious -  a tie between the two for the title of most delicious donut i have ever eaten. ever. Both were moist in the middle with crunchy crumbly edges. Eating them was just a generally lovely and delicious experience. 

After we were done with those, we got a raised maple donut to share.... 

and then we got like 6 to take home. nuff said.
author: Mathilde H.

description:
Best damn donuts ever! Krispy shits, i mean kream is incomparable. I love the people there(working of course) and its good to get in there and watch people awwww and go crazy(especially the ones coming from the bar) over these delicious, melt in your mouth, gooey, sweet, delicacys the call, BOB"S DONUTS! see you soon with my gallon of milk, and a good tip!
(p.s.) - R.I.P  old t.v... u were soo cool.
author: Travis G.

description: I used to think these were the best around, but not anymore. The owner has made some production changes...size is noticeably smaller and either the oil is not hot enough or they're not fried long enough, resulting in oily donuts. Sorry to see them go :-(
author: H. B.

description:
WARNING: Extraordinarily addicitve. First visit, 12/17/09 @ roughly 12:45AM. Second visit, 15 min later. THAT good. 

It's wholly possible that what they're making is illegal in numerous states.
author: Scott S.

description:
Best doughnuts in San Francisco.  No jive-ass flavors.  Just good old-fashioned, traditional doughnuts: apple fritters, French cruellers, cinnamon and sugar cake, buttermilk bars, crunch, and old-fashioned.  
The staff is great.  They know me by name and remember my favorites.
I live close enough that I can roll out of bed and get an apple fritter or run out during a commercial and get a slab of bread pudding.
author: Tim O.

description:
I'm comfortable saying this - Bob, I love you. 

I can't resist you when I walk by and smell the fresh donuts. 

To top it off - you're cheap and open late. 

We need more of you in this neighborhood. 

I heart you. 

XOXO
author: Carlos A.

description:
Every now and then, a donut is a great treat.  My favorites are French crullers - light and airy, not too dense, perfection.

I've stopped into Bob's a couple of times recently - once for just one glazed French cruller (amazing) and then another time for donuts for the office.  They are quite delicious and they have a HUGE selection of donuts.  I haven't had anything but the crullers, but the mixed set of two dozen donuts I got were well-received by the office.  I've had to buy large quantities of donuts before, and the $17.50 for my two dozen donuts seemed like quite the steal.

Yay for Bob's!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Donuts are for winners. I am a winner, and Bob's donuts are mine.

Seriously, don't steal my cruller or you might lose a finger.
author: erica d.

description: This is my go to spot for some bomb ass donuts! Despite the parking, but hey this donut shop is worth it all. lol sometimes I'll double park to pick up some donuts. Also, the people that work here are pretty awesome.
author: Gerline R.

description:
Killer donuts.  Best way to end a night of fun is stopping off for donuts after the club!

We bought four different types of donuts, the traditional chocolate bar, glazed twist, and i think an almond twist with raspberry glazed (it wasn't my liking) and a cinnamon sugar braids.. YUMMY!   All so so so yummy!!  Didn't care too much for the almond twist, but overall it was good, just not for me!  Texture was just for weird for me... 


They have a huge donut that is about 12.x12 and I am sure it weights a few pounds, come in sugar, chocolate, and nut glazed.. they have a list of people times that were able to chow down the donut within ten minutes I think; the person with the longest time was 7:22 I think...... there were two customers in the donut shop that were going back and forth about doing the challenge, my girlfriends and I were excited, we wanted to see the challenge.   But, after several minutes of going back and forth they both of them back down.  I think once they seen the huge donut upclose and felt the weight, it was overwhelming.... One customer order the huge donut and it feed six young drunks!!!  So, awesome for $9.50!!!
author: Sissy T.

description: Good donuts good ham and cheese croissants good customer service :) and one of the few places only 24/7
author: Chelsea P.

description: Clearly this place is rated so well because a bunch of late night stoners, drunks, club goers, and partiers have the munchies at odd hours and are just so ecstatic that a place is open. It's just another pastry place. Nothing special. The lady at the counter was very very rude to me and my son. We just asked for a few seconds to figure out what we wanted. There wasn't even a line. We were the only people in there. No need to stand there tapping the counter, sighing repeatedly, and staring at us making us feel uncomfortable and rushed. I won't be returning.
author: Q T.

description: Wonderful donuts!  The apple fritters are huge and full of apples.  The donuts were so great that we came back for seconds!  Take a pass on the coffee and hit up Moka down the street.
author: R H.

description:
I finished that Giant Donut Challenge as promised in my previous review. 2min 50 sec, though had I know you just had to have it all in your mouth, I could have shaved an additional 3-5 seconds (TWSS). Still not good enough to even touch the 2:40 best time, but good enough for 2nd place. Still, a free meal with a cool shirt thats not on display? I'll take it. This challenge is a lot harder than it seems as well, and I ended up paying for it over the past few days.Youtube video to be posted by either Joe B or Ro.

Apple Bread Pudding - I overhyped it. Not nearly as good as I thought it would be. That doesn't go to say it wasn't delicious. It was pretty good. Very cinnamony and sweet. I gave some to my mom and she said "It tastes like Christmas". My sister polished the rest of the bread pudding in the morning. Ultra dense, a bit too sweet, and not as much apples as the apple fritters.

Cinnamon Roll. Joe B got this because it was ultra fresh. It was like eating a Cinnamon Toast Crunch donut. Nice, warm, not overly sweet or too much cinnamon. Well executed.

Still good, but the apple bread pudding overhype killed it for me. Stick with the apple fritters and cinnamon rolls.
author: Marc T.

description:
I love Bob's!  

Open 24/7, delicious donuts, line out the door ALL THE TIME, what more is there to say???

Once we even got the $5 giant glazed donut, as big as the pink box it comes in.  Mmm!

This is a must go to place on when on Polk.
author: Jill B.

description:
Great old timey shop. The Dounts are great. I have hit this places at 7 am before class and at 2 AM after bar runs.  
Great donuts really nice people. 
The of drunks at 2 am can be very entertaining so you get the added enjoyment of gorgeous high heeled women dressed to impress wolfing down maple bars and fritters!
author: Rob R.

description: They do accept credit cards at no charge (square reader) and they really are open 24/7! Their apple fritters do use real apples and taste very good. The people running the place are also nice.
author: Kay S.

description: I just moved to the area recently, and while out walking about I came across Bob's. They're open late at night, and the rows of donuts drew me in like a bee to a flower. Coming from the Midwest, I've had my share of my donuts, and this joint was stellar. The employees were friendly and helpful, and the chocolate icing on my donut made me want seconds.
author: Tim W.

description: Donuts are just as they should be, sugary, doughy but airy, with just the right amount of grease.  The French cruller was awesome!! If I could teleport myself back I would!
author: Aura S.

description:
Why would I ever trek all the way to the mission to buy a $4 specialty donut when I can walk down the street and grab a fresh and warm donut for less than a dollar? 

I had a friend that worked at krispy kreme that would hook it up with fresh ones and I thought  those were the best things ever. That was until I had a fresh buttermilk bar w/ chocolate frosting from Bob's. ORGASMIC!

They keep it real here. Also, they have a twitter that gets updated when fresh batches arrive. http://twitter.com/whatsfreshest
author: Phong D.

description:
Best late night food you can get!
Ask for whatever is the freshest, they're usually still cooling on a tall rack behind the counter. If you're lucky enough get get one that is still hot, they literally MELT in your mouth!
Great way to round out a night out on Polk St. Got a little over-zealous last time and couldn't finish all the goodies I brought home. Ate them in the morning, and they were still great!
author: Lauren R.

description:
I have to write this with a heavy heart, thier food is very good but today after visiting and eating while walking back home my wife and I found a fly on our croisant. We returned it immediately thinking, it could happen, thier pastries are out in the open, and were willing to over look. 

The woman at the counter just said "no" when we asked if we could exchange it. Wtf!!,.. She had a bad attitude about the whole thing. Needless to say, for a pastry that cost less than 2$ they have lost a good customer. This was on Sunday afternoon and with 7 month pregnant customer,.. I think she expected us to eat around it. Goodbye bobs
author: David C.

description: I woke up at 8 AM with a donut craving. Then again, I always wake up with a donut craving. But one morning, I woke up in San Francisco and found myself within walking distance of Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop. So off we went! Back in the day, when the first association was made between donuts and police officers, I imagine this is the place where those officers were spotted. Why? This place is open 24 hours. It's a hole in the wall with only a few seats, mostly at the counter. When we went, the sweetest lady was running the show. Finally, these donuts are delicious. Even the simple glazed donuts are what glazed donuts should be. I can only imagine what this place is like in the wee hours of the morning on the weekend ...
author: Jeff M.

description:
Why must these lil things taste so damn good? I stepped in around 11pm with the intent of having an apple fritter.  But we food lovers know that regardless of what you think you want, you must always get what's fresh! And fresh out of the fryer at the moment was a chocolate glazed buttermilk bar. 

OMG. HEAVEN in fluffy crispy creamy bites. Best donut I've ever had, hands down.  Buttermilk pancakes hooked up with chocolate glazed cake donuts and made deliciously sexy babies.  $1.10 very well spent.  I would have gone back inside for 10 more but sigh.. friends don't let friends get fat...

And really, something must be said about a donut shop making fresh rounds that late at night.. clearly their goodies are in high demand all night long... Why waste money at the bar?  Seduce your date with decadence..
author: Beatrice T.

description:
FIRST AND FOREMOST, THE APPLE FRITTER IS NOT THE BEST THING ON THE MENU. 

I had it and it was... aiiiiiiiiiite.  the edges of it was the best because it had the perfect soft dough to crunchiness ratio.  In the middle, it's just soft dough all over.  The edges... they're crisp and crunchy with the delicious flavor of apple while having the perfect balance of soft dough that evens out the sweetness of the glaze.  

We ordered a lot of other stuff too that were all pretty mehhhh. The blueberry muffin sucked.  AKA i'd rather buy a box from safeway and make it myself.  OOOOH we also got this apple coffee cake type thing that i don't know what it's callled cause my friend went in to buy everything while I circled the block.  BUTTTT the apple like coffee cake was the best thing we had there!!!.  The breading was so soft and moist and the crumbs were sooo good with the gooey apples!!

This was also not worth being on the SF 100 things to eat. I feel like these are one of the places that paid to be on the list and make people like me go waste money on it when I would've never eaten it if it weren't for the list. =/
author: Anna C.

description:
if I'm walking by after 2 am AND there is a fresh hot apple fritter just coming out of the fryer, I'm game. 

really delicious donuts, and great after bar hours. 

all this from someone that claims not to "like" donuts after all.
author: Beth P.

description: My favorite thing to do after eating somewhere on Polk street, or going shopping around the area, is to stop at Bob's to pick up a few donuts to go.  I absolutely love their apple fritters, and basically anything you order there will be soft sugary goodness.  I like to heat them up in the microwave for 20-30 seconds to make them even softer and more gooey.  The donuts are still very good the day after too.  Ah there's nothing like a warm donut on a cool winter night.
author: Karen W.

description:
OVERRATED!

They're just your typical donuts, nothing special.  I tried a chocolate glaze and an apple fritter.  Yes, the texture of the donuts is more cakey and it's yummy, but like I said, nothing extraordinary.  So don't expect to be blown away.  If I'm in the area again, I think I would stop by for another apple fritter... a nice little treat.  It was definitely not worth the drive from San Jose.
author: Saweena K.

description:
There is nothing pretentious about this little bakery. It is all a bakery should be: warm and inviting

Orders:
Apple Bread Pudding- I don't like bread pudding in general but this was amazing. So moist and full of flavor.

Total: around $2.75 for a huge slice.
author: Rosa L.

description:
The ladies working the counter were super sweet!

I got the crumb doughnut and the fan favorite apple fritter. The crumb doughnut was a little too sweet for my liking (it had donut crumbs sprinkled on it); the apple fritter was huge but really good and absolutely worth it! Bonus points for real apple chunks inside. 

Excuse me while I roll out of the shop now.
author: Wen L.

description: apple fritter and crumb donut.  that is all. Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
author: Patrick M.

description: they cooked their goodies very fresh.. and very yummy and if u crave a donut and pastries for midnight snack this.is a must place to go..
author: Gladys D.

description: These are the best donuts! Go early in the day to get more selection. Chocolate covered, maple covered, apple fritters, and donuts holes are my favorite!
author: Danielle W.

description:
Um, I woke up this morning and all I could think about was an apple fritter from Bob's... even though I had one yesterday morning. I see a bad habit forming.

I mean, it is open 24 hours... dangerous. It means at any given time I can just swerve my car in the direction of Bob's and be reunited with apple fritter. What joy that would be...
author: Abbey S.

description:
They use on old school fryer here, big enough to cook a baby whale for their doughnuts. The window to get fresh donuts is about 8 to 2AM and you will be rewarded with a steaming sweet guilty pleasure. Try the apple fritters you won't be able to eat just one. 

Coffee blows here but who cares?
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Not all bus stops are created equal. Some are near parks. Some are in the hood. Some are near all-night donut shops that'll give you a pastry and a coffee for a buck-80. Go late at night when they're making fresh batches. Your donut will come hot straight from the frier, still cracklin'. Nothing better than Bob's to help pass the time as you wait for the 1-California. 

By the way, Bob's is also a great place to learn new jokes from other patrons (What kind of socks do pirates wear?....ARRRRRGyle!!!!).

[Oh snap, just realized that Bob's was my 100th review! Does Yelp give out bumper stickers for this kind of milestone? I'm very glad it was Bob's. I can think of few other businesses more deserving of this honor. (Too much?)]
author: Andrew K.

description:
Delicious donuts. Less than $1.00. I am always tempted to eat like...15 of them.

If you get there when the donuts are fresh your donut eating life will be changed forever.

I don't know what else I can say that hasn't been said. This place makes walking up and down hills worth it.
author: Ben B.

description:
Go for the $5.50 oversize glazed donut. It will give you a sugar rush for days. And make sure to top it off with the donut crumbles...hey, if you're gonna consume 1000 calories, what's another 300 gonna do? :)

Love Bob's....I'm coming back for the apple fritter next time!
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
Delicious, delicious doughnuts. Best if you can get there just as a bunch are coming out of the deep-fryer, but even if you can't, they're still good. Probably the best apple fritters anywhere; maple bars are also good. Oh, and the old fashioneds. Really, everything's amazing.

Important rule: if you don't know how many calories are in the lard that the doughnuts are made out of, it doesn't count.
author: James B.

description: I alway passed this place but i thought it looked crummy so I never went but I had bought a groupon deal for a dozen donuts. Let me say OMG it was the best donuts I have ever tasted it fresh straight off the fryer my husband and I ate 6 donuts before we even left (mind you I'm pregnant). The worker are so nice and so helpful. this is def my new spot for donuts. BEST THING OF ALL THEY ARE OPEN 27/4!
author: Maylene M.

description: After a day of SF fun, I was tired and a bit hungry. Upon realizing that I needed some sugar or caffeine before my half hour date with 101 South, I decided to drive over to Bob's and buy myself a couple of French Crullers. There wasn't a better way to end the day.
author: Yusaku K.

description:
Oh Bob's. How I wish you were closer to my home. And how my hips are very glad you aren't, you sickeningly wonderful donut shop.

I love that this place is no nonsense. Cash only. Kind of gritty. But you know the donuts are going to be amaze-balls just by the scent you get walking through the door.

I had the apple fritter. And I ate the glaze flakes off my fleece after I finished it.

Enough said.
author: Christina K.

description:
These donuts are HEAVEN ON EARTH.

These donuts make you jizz in yo' PANTS.

I graciously welcome OBESITY as long as Bob's Donuts are involved.

Alton MOFCKN Brown from Food Network frickin' knows about BOB's. 

They're open 24 HOURS, not to mention you'd be supporting a small biz in SF that's been a part of that neighborhood forever.


ENOUGH SAID. Just eat a GOSHDARN DONUT already!
author: Theresa B.

description:
I enjoyed the best donut of my life at Bob's. 

The glazed buttermilk bar was lusciously sweet and soooo warm.

It tasted so good my burps are even savory! 

Perfect for that late night, I want to eat a fat ass donut, craving!
author: D. Miguel G.

description:
I've lived away from the Bay Area for two years now, and I still dream of Bob's Donuts.

The apple fritter is uranium dense and sinfully good.  It contributed to at least a dozen pounds of weight gain before I moved just far enough away from Bob's that I couldn't go there daily.  

Doughnut shops like Bob's are a throwback to a different time, and I can't imagine that a place where they still make the doughnuts on the premises will last forever.  Go to Bob's while you still can.
author: Kvatch K.

description:
donuts are like, totally A Thing right now and with places like Dynamo and stuff, people might expect to pay $3+ for a donut.

but you can get three donuts for LESS THAN $3 at Bob's.  sure, Bob's doesn't have passion fruit chocolate chip donuts or donuts with bacon baked inside but they have delicious, traditional, downhome donuts.

and not only are they open 24/7, you can check their twitter feed to find out what's fresh.  and their twitter name is @whatsfreshest which makes complete and total sense.

boom.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Bob's was great! We went around 2am, so while the donuts were freshly made, we missed them when they come out hot and delicious at 1am! However, I'd say these were delectable! I had a glazed twist, maple donut, and tried some of my friend's cheese danish.  The maple was delicious/my favorite of the three! Both the donuts were soft and tasty.  It was a great things to enjoy!  I'd never been before, but my friend loves Bob's so he suggested it.  There was a line out the door when we got there! That reflects how much people like it!  

Just so you know:

Cash only
Street parking only
Limited seating inside
No bathroom
author: Denise A.

description: Tried the apple fritter because it was on the 7x7 list and it was too sweet. Would have liked more apple bits. oh sooooo sweet. I needed a glass of milk.
author: Logan N.

description: Wow I think I just found the best donut place I've ever been to!  I live in Chicago and there are a bunch of fancy new donut places that have opened up recently.  None of them are as good as Bobs.  I wish there was a Bob's in Chicago.  If you are in San Francisco I definitely recommend a morning or evening stop at Bob's for some super fresh and warm donuts!
author: Matt S.

description: Today a couple of friends of mind went off the 7x7 list and came across Bob's donuts. On the list it mentions to try out their Apple fritter, the results? OHHH yes! The fritter was moist and not sweet at all.  The apples inside were delicious. Just perfect! I didn't realize that this place is 2 blocks away from my work!  I didn't get to take a picture this time, but I highly recommend this place! CHECK MARK =)
author: Kathy V.

description:
Fresh donuts at 2 in the morning? Why not!

I came here in the wee hours of the morning after attending my cousin's yacht party in Sausalito. I had a sweet tooth to satisfy and came across this place on Yelp. There was a really long line when I first arrived but it moved quickly and I immediately made nice with the gay couple in front of me. They were really pleasant and made the wait more enjoyable haha. Anyway, onto their donuts.. By the time it was my turn to order, they had made several fresh batches of donuts and I was really excited about that. I ordered half a dozen and the first one I tried was the choclate glazed donut with cream filling. Super yumz! It practically melted in my mouth. I definitely drove home a happy camper! :)
author: Abby V.

description: Holy crap.  I am currently overdosing on cinnamon sugar cake doughnuts, fresh out of the fryer.  Just the silkiest cake and amazing ratio of cinnamon & sugar.  I'd be terrified to see them on a weekend night, the place must be PACKED!  I'm in love with the hole-in-the-counter "tip jar" - it must be overflowing after the bars let out.  Great people, great doughnuts.
author: Tricia L.

description: Wow, EXCELLENT donuts! The best donut I ever had was from this place. Their crumb donut was the best donut I have EVER eaten! Omg, just thinking about it makes me want more. Next time I'm back in town, I will definitely have to get a dozen of just the crumb donuts!!!
author: Nari L.

description: Came here with a Groupon, will be coming here from now on when I make it to SF. Although I'm not much of a donuty (is that a word) person, these are by far the best donuts I have ever had. They don't leave you with the rock in stomach oh-my-god-what-did-I-do? feeling. My favorite was just the plain frosted ol' fashioned.
author: Amanda C.

description: Best donut I've ever had! The glazed is wonderful and so doughy! The staff is friendly and great. It's usually pretty busy and there is a bar you can sit at to stay and eat. Really great (donut) hole in the wall. LOL! Okay I'm done.
author: Erica J.

description:
I happen to find myself jaunting over to Bob's more often than I would like to admit. The donuts are amazing, and really hit the spot when you're hungover (speaking from personal experience). Apple Fritters=fantastic especially if they have just been freshly made, although they really are awesome all the time. I actually started to get the Apple fritters after reading all the reviews on yelp...these people really know what they're talking about. 

Just remember the place is cash only, and doesn't really offer the best seating. I tend to personally get my donut and head home to eat it.
author: Melinda S.

description:
This place is dangerously located between where I pick up the 49 and my house. Dangerous in a delicious way.

Nothing looks special about this place, except that they seem to always be popping out fresh, delicious doughnuts. They've got a variety, but I'd say always ask what's from the freshest batch and go for it (and maple -- if it's available). All for the low low price of a buck ten.
author: Adam D.

description:
Let's just start off by saying that I hadn't had a donut in YEARS. Then, one fateful night while walking home my husband and I passed by the heavenly scent of freshly made donuts. We saw the line out the door and fully intended to keep walking, but decided that if there was a line out the door at 12:30am that it HAD to be good.
WE WERE RIGHT. As every good drunk person does, we got three HOT donuts each and headed home. The glazed ones were fresh out of the fryer and the glaze was still drippy, so obviously those were the best. Here's how the rest were:

The Chocolate Glazed: as good as the glazed...
The Croissant: excellent (and my husband is a bread snob and has lived in france, so that'll tell you something)
The Apple Fritter: AMAZING. they are huge and delicious and wonderful.
The Old-Fashioned: good, but a bit crumbly. Would have definitely been better if I hadn't chosen to eat it two days later.

Here's where it only gets four stars: I will say that I've been to Bob's twice. Once at 12:30am (fresh! hot!) the other was around 11am (not so hot, but still good). The selection definitely dwindles, I'm sure it's from all us drunk gluttons on Saturday night that the selection for Sunday isn't superb. 

The craving for Bob's doesn't go away. Never again will I go years without having a donut, not with this shop around.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I wasn't a fan of donuts...until I had Bob's Donuts.  Seriously, I thought they were just okay, but Bob, you've changed my taste buds' lives...all of them! 

The french cruller is heaven!!! Especially when it's fresh. I have to refrain myself from ordering 3 of them.  I had to share my first cruller with two other friends and I found myself saying things like "Stop talking and take a bite so you can pass it back to me!"  And of course, it's the best snack for those late nights since it's open 24 hrs!
author: Helen V.

description: The best donuts!!  We drive from Antioch to buy these donuts!   It's best to get there late at night when they are warm and fresh!  Their Glazed, maple and chocolate raised are sooo good!  Also my favorite is their custard filled!  There is always a line but it's always worth the wait!!
author: Sue P.

description:
Hit this place up around 3am on Saturday night / Sunday Morning.  Gotta love places that don't close!  My buddy said this place is known for their apple fritter and they make a big ass donut.  

So there is a small line which at 3am says something for this place.  We get inside and I see the huge donut and I have to get one.  This thing has the circumference of a basketball!  I felt like i was on man vs food or something.

While i was in awe of this thing they just prep'd a fresh batch of apple fritters.  I don't even know what a fritter is but had to get one.  Now Krispy kreme is known for hot/fresh glazed donuts,  I will take a warm apple fritter from bob's over a plain glaze any day!
author: Hella B.

description:
Probably the BEST place to stumble into at 3 am after a fun evening. 
The line is out the door, but every bite of those melt-in-your-mouth donuts is well worth it!!!!

Chocolate donuts, Glaze donuts, Sugar donuts. Its ALL delicious.
author: Brusselz B.

description:
Went back at 10pm on a Thursday night and scored hot apple fritters. My ,oh my, this place is worth the drive!!

My favorite here is still the glazed old fashioned...
author: Michelle F.

description:
I traveled all the way from Australia for what I was hearing to be the best donuts in the bay... guys, these are the best bloody donuts in the world!

I stay in SF at least once a year and made sure that I'd trek up to Bob's  on the last trip (in the end I went a few times). The first time I entered I was greeted by a place that oozed character, bright glowing neon sign, a long counter running through the shop, glassed eyed locals, rickety tables & chairs and the special touch...a layer of smoke hovering just below the ceiling!

The girlfriend and I couldn't decide on what to get, so we took a dozen of whatever was fresh. Luckily I love maple syrup, because the majority of the fresh stuff was covered in maple glaze. My first bite was straight into a Maple Buttermilk Bar...oh my...I actually felt a little emotional at how good it was (we don't have buttermilk bars and maple only comes in syrup form Down Under). 
We made our way through, started to get full, so being the first time we just took bites out of everything and finished the one's we liked most (at $7-8 a dozen, you can't go wrong!).

Went back a few more times during our stay and sometimes I'd even skip dinner just so I could try more golden rings of dough. As with everyone elses tips, make sure you go late at night to get the fresh stuff.

Being back in Aus, I miss Bob's so much and counting down the days until I'm back.

My personal favourite - Maple buttermilk bar for the win!

*EDIT: I've run a trial, think I'm ready for Bob's challenge next... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tsa5rZql0oo
author: Josh M.

description: A couple of things made Bob's awesome.  1st the apple fritters were absolutely amazing! I typically don't even like them, but these were the perfect consistency & mix of fresh apple and doughy goodness.  2nd the women behind the counter was great. She was talkative and amusing, but let us do our own thing.  She checked on us to make sure we got our donut and coffee refills, but even better, was watching her take care of the regulars.  3rd-the super donut challenge looks amazing...and scary and I love the idea of a donut bigger than my head.  Finally, this place is voted one of the best donut shops in the city and I still got donuts and coffee for two people or under $7! Love that the hype hasn't gone to their heads!  I'll definitely be back the next time I visit this city.
author: Holli B.

description:
I went to go see a movie a couple nights ago at the AMC theater on Geary and Van ness. As if the movie popcorn and traditional candy wasn't enough to satisfy out sweet tooths, WE WANTED MORE. With all the crazy technology out, my friend whipped out her Iphone to research a good close place. Surprise surprise we where in a dead zone....gotta love AT&T....psych! Therefore, we pointed our car down Polk in hopes of finding something tastey. We ended up stumbling upon a crepe place, but low and behold it was closing so we didn't go there.....

We noticed, next door, there was a line accumluating outside of Bob's donuts. We thought, what the hell might as well try it. SO GLAD WE DID! The best apple friter I have ever had. Although they have a variety of donuts and pastries...the apple friters where just coming being iced and cooled. It is the best 2 dollar investment I had made in a while. It was nice and crispy on the outside and the prefect combo of doughy cookness on the inside! OM NOM NOM! I will never go anywhere else for donuts.Thank You Bobs Donuts!
author: Katie H.

description: Late night attack of the sweet tooth, go here!!!  Seriously needed to get that sour taste out of my mouth from having dinner at Toast, thank God we walked over to this place.  Totally crackin' at 11pm!  On the ride home we stuffed our faces with an apple fritter, chocolate croissant, custard filled chocolate bar, and donut holes.  So freakin' fresh!  Thank you Bob.
author: Emy B.

description:
My friends took me here after a drink at Bigfoot. It was 1am and the lady at the counter was super friendly. She answered all my questions (yes I had a lot of questions about a 24 hour a day donut shop). We (4 of us) ordered the HUGE donut (maybe 6inches in diameter) and waited patiently at the counter for it to be cooked. The entire process was so cool to watch (we watched the other donuts go from Dough to heaven for perhaps 20 minutes) Note: the donuts only take 3 minutes to be cooked (sans the dough making process). 

Finally the huge, chocolate dipped donuts was ours! They offered us forks and knives and of course napkins and we dove in. Honestly it melted in my mouth. It was incredible. We only could get through half of it, so the rest was put in a pretty pink box for later. The entire time, the staff was friendly and accommodating (and very knowledgeable as well!).
author: Allison B.

description:
Fresh donuts: 5 stars
Non-fresh: 3.5 stars

When the donuts are hot and fresh, they are AMAZING -- by the far the best donuts I've ever had. They're very light and fluffy and not so sweet that I get sick of them quickly. When the donuts aren't fresh, they're cold (they don't heat them up for you or keep them warm once they're out) and slightly more stale tasting -- but I imagine they'd taste almost as good if you heated them up at home. 

Try to go around 10pm, which is when they make them fresh at night.
author: Jackie C.

description: donuts are good if you can get past the employees. the fat guy who works the counter late nights has been consistently rude as hell when i have questions about their donuts. sorry dude, when you have no obvious menu im going to have questions. i get that you probably deal with a lot of drunk people at 3am but i actually just live nearby and am up late. no need to be an asshole.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I don't even know where to begin! I haven't been to this place in over 10 years. I used to stop by here on my way home from work at no o'clock in the morning 15 years ago. The donuts were awesome back then! 

Tonite (2 am) I had a massive donut craving attack and hiked from Union Square to Bob's Donut in the rain just for donuts. I was greeted by a very friendly young woman who served me 1 dozen of AMAZING donuts!! The fritters were still warm and so light and fluffy! The best I've had in YEARS!

Definately worth the walk in the rain! I'm so happy they survived over 20 years but then how couldn't they? Everyone loves incredible donuts!

Thank you for curing my late night craze!
author: Jamilah A.

description:
FINALLY made it here (after years of having it on my to do list).  An impromptu detour after a night out and I found myself actually waiting in line at 2:30am eagerly anticipating my first bite of the famed warm apple fritter.

I give it 4.5 stars but I'll round up to 5 because typically a build-up of such expectations almost inevitably leads to disappointment ... but not this time!  Yum!
author: F. P.

description:
Bob's is fantastic based on the following reasons:

1) Open 24 hours. Great after a night at the Big Foot Lodge. What is better than being drunk and happy, than munching on delicious fresh doughnuts while drunk and happy!?!

2) Bob's changes their oil very often, so what you get is a FRESH, warm, soft and "melt in your insatiable mouth" treat.

3) The owner is the sweetest lady ever. She's down to chat it up or play along after you take your first bite and start gushing about her doughnuts. She always remembers my name, too! 

4) Bob's sells massive doughnuts. They're the same size as my head, if not bigger.

5) I'm a simple gal, so I go for a simple doughnut. My favorite is Bob's plain glazed; I believe it's their most popular kind.
author: Patty L.

description:
Nothing beats Bob's at midnight for fresh donuts.

Nothing disappoints - Delicious donut holes, warm old fashioned donuts, gooey chocolate-filled donuts, enormous glazed donuts, flavorful crumb donuts

I would suggest getting a couple of donuts with some holes to share with your friends, and then each bringing a dozen donuts home.  Who doesn't love tasty donuts in the morning?
author: Andrew M.

description:
Hands freaking down the best Apple Fritters and Flazed Donuts at any Donut Shop nationwide!! Trust me, even better than Crispy Crème!!
Late night after club/bar spot to grab something sweet! The line was out the door at 02:00!!
I had the Apple Fritter. It was warm, crispy, cruncy, mapley, cinnamonly, appley goodness! Mmm Mmm Mmm Mmm GOOD!!
Bob's is a must have no matter what time of day
author: hans simon f.

description:
HAve i died an gone to donut heaven? No i have gone  to Bob's and had an amazing donut party in my mouth!

Granted i didn't have these donuts right after they were done (nice and moist and still hot), but i can imagine that they must be even better.  I dream for that day.

I used to live 2 blocks from bobs, I am glad i didn't know how great they tasted back then, or i would have been totally chunky from all the non-stop donut eating.
author: Michael E.

description: Go before 8 pm especially on a weekday, and there likely won't be fresh items. Go after 8 pm. Fresh = amazing. Apple fritters and donuts are IRRESISTIBLE when hot/warm. Melt in your mouth delicious. I haven't eaten anything outside of the apple fritter, glazed donut, or old-fashioned glazed - but worth every penny. Highly recommend.
author: Wendy L.

description: Exquisite. The glazed old-fashioned, king of all deep fried pastry, had hints of ginger and cinnamon. Glazing expertly proportioned to dough. Ratio of crispy outer to soft inner well balanced. Truly one of the best.
author: mathias m.

description: I love bobs donuts! The best are the glazed buttermilk and when they are hot and fresh the crulers rock.
author: Darren W.

description: Decent selection of treats and fair prices. They were all out of cinamon rolls so when we got there (mid-day) so we had a sticky bun and the "buttermilk" (looks almost like a thick apple fritter). Both were average. Will likely be back to try something new!
author: David G.

description:
Hands down best donut I have ever had... I don't have many fresh ones though.  We got there at 11pm (I think its open 24 hours) when they had just made fresh buttermilk and cake donuts. We got one of each, and also a honey cruller and old fashioned maple. We got a cup of coffee too which was perfect. The cake donut was too fresh to be good, because the oil was too wet. The honey crueller was a bit stale? The other two were SO good. you have to go here when they are making the donuts to get the full experience. 

It looks like an old fashioned breakfast bar- apparently the place is about 50 years old. I loved the feel. 

I went with a Canadian who said that it was comparable to Tim Hortons which is apparently makes bomb donuts. We asked the owners if they were from Canada- they are not.

After, we hopped over to Vertigo in Russian Hill dancing district and danced off the calories!!! SUCH a good late night snacky.
author: Sirina K.

description:
After an all-night drive back from SoCal I was starving and this being SF, there aren't many 24 hour eateries open.  Then a light bulb came on and I decided to stop by Bob's Donuts and Pastries to check another place off on my 7x7 100 list.  Mind you, I came at 4am when the crazies and prostitutes are out at night in TL.  Coming to TL after dark is an adventure in itself already.

Bob's is a no frills type of donut diner place.  It doesn't appear to have been updated for about 30 years or so, in a word it's "vintage" and they don't make em like they used to.  And I actually like it better that way. Even the TV was showing some old tv show or movie along the lines of CHiPs.

Great apple fritters which fulfilled my hunger cravings but too bad they were already cold and not fresh when I had them.  But it's a cheap eat, can't complain about that.  They had one giant glazed donut also about the size of a 12 in cake and it's only $5.  Maybe if I really liked donuts as much as Homer Simpson I would get it and frequent Bob's more often.
author: Tony L.

description: Mmmm, the fritters! Now this is what I call Nirvana!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Super delicious and inexpensive. Just don't make the mastake of getting a window treat. Always ask for what is the freshest. Otherwise the old fashioned donuts are amazing and it doesn't really matter if they are fresh or not. Also this place is open late which is awesome for a late night snack. Probably the best food you can get on Polk street.
author: Nicole B.

description:
Donut's are not just donuts. Period. 

Bob's is not your Saturday morning donuts. It is definitely not your Safeway donuts. And no, it is not even similar to Krispy Kremes. 

I first went there for my friend's bachelor party last year. I had heard of it, but needed to go with seasoned professionals. There is a way to order at Bob's. It goes like this: 

You get there between 10:30 - 11:00 pm, no earlier. You wait in line, and while you're waiting, you watch the Chinese guy who owns and runs the place prepare a brand new batch of donuts. (note: his name is 99.9% unlikely to be Bob). Then it's your turn to order. Sure they have a case full of donuts in the window display, and sure they have racks of donuts made within the last half hour, but that's not what we're after. All you have to do is point to the freshest donuts, still cooling off, maybe dripping with grease a little, and tell them you want it dipped in either their maple or chocolate frosting. 

This was my second time going, but I still went by the rule of only getting the brand new donuts. There are only 2 flavors of frosting here. I go for the maple and a pint of 2% milk. Milk and donuts is like a fine wine matched to perfection to some fancy meal.

My friend and I go sit at the donut bar, watch some Letterman and bite into our warm, fresh donut. I take my first bite. Rich, soft, warm, buttery, yet light at the same time. I look down to see what the heck I'm eating. This is not a maple bar, this is not a bready cake donut that is all spongy, this is the real deal. I continue. Another bite, then we talk about how good it is, then we take a swig of milk, then an "ahhhhh" and then another bite. This process continues, but not for long. It's time for round 2. 

The next batch are buttermilks. They are glazed this time. Again, another pint of 2% and we're ready for more. Again, warm, moist, sweet, and satisfying. I actually couldn't finish this one. I got too full. Noooooooooo! I hate that!

I ask my friend who lives in the bay area if he knows the owner. He responds by saying that the Chinese guy is too busy doing his thing. And that's what makes it Bob's.
author: Nick M.

description: I was kidding with my other review. I came here at 2AM one night and tried their apple fritter right from the fryer. Needless to say, that was life changing. Plus, the girl here was so cute and friendly and adorable I just wanted to squeeze her! I will definitely be back during late night for fresh eats!
author: Camille T.

description:
I've always enjoyed, but not been obsessed with, donuts. After having Bob's, I sometimes find myself being carried home by the scent of donuts baking down the street.
Incredibly cheap, incredibly delicious, incredibly awesome hours. These three facts make everything else (ambiance, long lines, at-times creepy fellow patrons, etc.) completely irrelevant. Order the apple fritter and be prepared for an amazing tasebud explosion. Bob's rocks.
author: Anne A.

description:
So I was under the impression that this Donut Shop was more of a specialty Donut shop. No. I was wrong but the place was still good.

We arrived on a Thursday afternoon and it wasn't really busy at all. The donuts are displayed in the window. From all the yelp reviews on this place, the apple fritter was highly recommended. I decided to get this apple bread pudding thing that I saw in the window. My boyfriend went for the apple fritter. My portion of pudding was like a pound. That thing was dense! 

I went home and warmed it up. The pudding tasted like it was made of donuts not bread. It was very good though but I'm sure it's something I shouldn't be eating.

My boyfriend never ate the fritter. So I guess that's something we'll never know. I don't think I would be back simply because It wasn't anything special or out of the norm.
author: Linda W.

description:
Most awesome donuts in town - hands down! The fritters are perfect every time- soft in the middle, just the right amount of crunchy and lumpy on the outside. 
The crumb donuts alone are worth the trip over from the Sunset at any time of day- but insomnia's gift has been the 5am batch as of late. 

Recently, hubby & I were eating lunch at Toast down the street from Bob's and stopped in for desert. I was going to stick to our "usual" but the blueberry cobbler was just out of the oven so I differed to the wonderful lady at the counter and we split a piece. 
Can I say- I grew up in the South and cobbler is a tradition  with all the pride of family recipes, blue ribbons, county fairs and the attached falderall. THIS cobbler is ( as you can tell ) WORTH WRITING HOME ABOUT! I have never been so  wonderfully surprised and thrilled at finding a surprise new favorite anything! 

Mu husbands fingers bear the fork scar as he tried for the last bite- but next time I'll buy him his own! 
Thank you Bob's!
author: Rocky S.

description:
Just recently visited Bob's donuts (my husband wanted a donut) and we had to walk out.  They keep the donuts in the window on trays, and these two grody people in front of us were leaning OVER the donuts, literally slobbering and drooling and pointing (maybe touching?) the donuts they wanted to order. The donuts looked all sloppy and droopy and gross.

I know we shouldn't judge the shop based on the narsty customers that were there, but I ask you this: If you see that your customers are drooling and pointing at the donuts, and getting slobber on the muffins, do you tell them to back the f**k up or do you simply stand there and let them do it while other customers watch? 

Unclean! Unclean! Sorry. Never gonna go there again.
author: Jessica O.

description:
So yummy!  You have to get these donuts when they are hot out of the oil!  Haha.  
We went right before the glazed donuts were ready and boy were they a bite of heaven!  DEEEELICIOUS.  I usually don't eat glazed donuts anymore, since they are usually too sweet, but the glaze at Bob's was just right.  My sister said the sugar coated ones (my fave) are even better...they just melt in your mouth.  Too bad my donut run buddy didn't want to wait another hour.  :(  I also heard the apple fritters were the best, but we really didn't want to wait that long since we had work the next morning!
author: Cheryl L.

description: I usually end up at Bob's after a show at the Great American Music Hall. (Did that sound lewd?)
author: Ericka V.

description:
My favorites here are the Apple Fritters and Buttermilk Bars , I have only gone here in the late evening which is good because that is when they are fresh :) 
Not really cheap for a dozen doughnuts but I only buy 2 or 3 at a time so it works for me.
Lacks good parking and not really a place to chat with friends but for a shop and go place it more then makes the cut.
author: Joseph A.

description:
i'm so disappointed! everyone's been raving about bob's, so i went out of my way to stop in after giving in to my donut cravings. there was a small line of 4 people at 11 am on a Thursday. so i thought, yes, this must be good.

i ordered the apple fritter and glazed donut, disappointed that they didn't have any blueberry cake donuts. cmon! that's a donut staple! anyway, i was even MORE disappointed that both tasted cold, stale, and the apple fritter slightly burnt!

it was $2.70 for both -- a little more than i thought it'd be,  but oh well. lesson learned. don't listen to hype. maybe it's because i didn't come at 2 am when they're made fresh for bar patrons. or maybe it's because i wasn't inebriated. 

either way, i won't come back unless it's one of the 2 above mentioned scenarios. 

p.s. "bob" the elderly asian lady behind the counter is really nice and friendly. she offered to make me a makeshift blueberry cake donut by pipping in blueberry filling into a donut.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Best French Glazed donut I've ever had. Liquifies in your mouth. Fresh and amazing.

After having my first two last night, they're all I can think about. I'm sure living in the near vicinity will be the end of me getting fit.
author: David C.

description: May appear good for late night donuts but mediocre at best for daytime donuts. Try to resist unnecessary calories!!
author: CL S.

description:
I went to San Fran for the first time this past November and as exciting as my trip was (saw the sites; did the bars; got thrown out on the street by my racist hosts--basically the usual.) besides hanging out with my "new" friends, the thing i miss most is those pink boxes filled with hot, freshly made DONUTS! My Friend Todd took me there after a night out at the bar and I was hooked. I'm SUCH a fatty, I asked the girl if she had any custard filled ones. She didn't at the time, so she smiled; went to the back & emerged with my glazed chocolate frosted donuts sliced horizontally in 2 with a thick layer of custard between them! GASP! --I immediately teared up (standard fatty protocol)  3 AM never tasted THIS good! ...I KNEW then, that very moment that I loved this city! LOL 

I even took a dozen with me as my carry on back to Miami. OMG!--they're SO GOOD! Don't miss out on this local Calorie pusher. They're even open 24HRS.  I need to get back to San Fran for more of Bob's Donuts!

xoxo, Missing Bob's in Miami.  : )
author: Pedri C.

description: Fresh, delicious and a good price.  You can't really ask for more from a donut.
author: Serena S.

description:
Bob's Donuts are like little pieces of heaven.

We were in SF for three weeks, and we had the good fortune to be staying three blocks away from this place. It became the BEST thing to eat in the city, period. Both my boyfriend and I developed an addiction to their donuts, so much so that we knew their frying schedules by heart and would pop into the shop just as they started frying their donuts. 

Tip: The freshly fried, warm donuts beat the fresh-but-have-been-sitting-there donuts HANDS DOWN. To get warm, straight-from-the-fryer donuts, go around 9:20 pm on weekdays and around 5:20 pm on weekends!

If you're visiting SF, you HAVE TO HAVE these donuts :D
author: Nausheen I.

description:
was lucky enough to be there when they had some fresh donuts and had a simple glazed donut that was great. The party  I was with raved about the apple fritter but I'm not an apple fritter fan. Solid spot.

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake

9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description:
Three words: Big a$$ donuts! 

There's even this gargantuan "Oh-my-gawd-Becky-look-at-her" donut that needs its own damn area code! Yeah, sure there are your trendy folks that stroll up into Bob's late night for a snack after bar hopping BUT what's is so ridiculously rad about this particular donut shop is you will see all types of people (yes, again, dude-looks-like-a-lady but those are my favorites - I'd like to think I'm a big drag queen inside, myself). Oh, yeah, I'm talking about Bob's... 

Seriously, it's such a fun place with your standard old school coffee shop/diner seating with a friendly person serving up cups of Joe (who is this Joe, by the way?) and these ginormous donuts. You wanna know how cool this place is...they don't even have a web site. Yup! You just have to go there yourself and check it out. You can see others pictures, you can hear about it from friend BUT there's nothing like just GOING there yourself on a late night with the miss or mister and staring into each others eyes over a piping hot cup of coffee and an apple fritter, or an eclair, or sugar glaze or a chocolate donut. 

It's quite magical, I tell ya. Magical.
author: Dorothy S.

description:
One of my favorite things to do in the city is to go check out 80's band at RDL.  Bob's donuts is a couple of storefronts down and there's NOTHING better than stopping in for the glazed donuts after a heavy night of drinking, dancing and belting out my favorite 80's hits.  

The donut isn't super sweet like krispy kreme and its so dough-y .  LOVE IT!
author: Cindy B.

description: Update: I have since visited this place twice in the morning.  Definitely not the same experience.  Donuts were not nearly as fresh (oddly enough).  When I asked the woman behind the counter what was freshest she looked annoyed and told me everything was fresh.  Not true.  If I go back, it will be in the middle of the night since that's when they seem to be at their best.
author: Betsy N.

description: There is just something about Bob's donuts that other shops can't touch. I love their midnight freshies. The apple fritters are amazing and nothing satisfies like a good old fashion. This place is bomb. Period.
author: Cal M.

description:
I'm not sure why the Big Eat 2011 listed the apple fritter at Bob's Donuts as THE thing to try... I got one with my girlfriends when we hit this spot up yesterday and eh, it was okay. Nothin special. Nothin over the top. It was okay, but not something to rave about.

Since we were there, though, I grabbed two other goodies to save for breakfast the next morning-- a donut w/ coconut shavings and crumbs on top, and a walnut-topped sticky bun. Had them this morning and... WOW. It totally changed my opinion about Bob's! Why didn't the Big Eat list THESE super delicious dough balls of goodness instead as the things to try at this donut shop!? The donut was still melt-in-your-mouth fluffy delicious even the day after it was baked, and the walnut-topped sticky bun was just the right amount of sweet without going over board, which makes a sticky bun perfect in my book. Soooo good, the both of them-- so now Bob's goes from a 2 to a 4, imo. :D

I guess what I'm trying to say is if you're going here, then, don't just get an apple fritter and leave because the Big Eat told you to. ;) Branch out and try other things as well-- I'm sure you'll find them to be super delicious, as I did.

PS: The lady working behind the counter when I went here was the SWEETEST, and you could tell that she really loves her job and loves talking to her customers. Major props for that-- I love it when business owners are super friendly! :) Oh yeah, and PPS: Cash only, so know before you go! :)
author: Shari B.

description:
I have no idea why this place is rated so high.  I tried their apple fritter and glazed donuts and both are just mediocre.

The old lady at the counter was very nice, but slow.  She forgot to put the donuts requested in the bag for two customers in front of me, twice!

When you are in a drunken stuper and can't figure out where your taste buds have gone, then this donut shop is probably the place for you.  Just saying.
author: Ny H.

description: DAMN. What a disappointment. I thought this place was going to be better than hot Krispy Kreme glazed donuts and I love supporting small businesses but Bob's donuts tasted like any donut I could buy from a corner shop. Granted I went during the afternoon and not after a hard night of drinking and maybe they don't make fresh donuts until the AM, but we all know everything tastes better when you're drunk so I'm inclined to believe this place is all drunken hype.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
#80 on 100 Things to Eat in S.F. Before I Die: Apple Fritter

I mean, it's an apple fritter, a donut, a bulge of sweet fat, a dipping apparatus for coffee, and when hard doubles as a doorstop.  With this many attributes, what could possibly be bad about it?  

I could say that, warmed up, this would be the perfectly sweet, delectably dense end to life.
author: Tamar D.

description:
So so good! It was bomb!! 

The next time i find myself on a bar hopping spree or just in the polk street area, I MUST stop by here at bob's donuts.. 

While overly happy, I ordered a chocolate donut (friend), 2% milk, and an original glazed (me).

My goodness! I've never experienced such deliciousness that's still warm and not overly sweet. so soft and sigh. so good but so far!! =(

I remember shouting to my friends that i would have bob's donuts at my wedding dessert buffet... well now that i think of it maybe at a closer celebration. =]
author: Connie M.

description: Five stars just for the old fashioned donuts straight from the fryer - I'm not even a big donut fan but they are dreamy!
author: Ming C.

description:
Let me tell you a little story about Bob's Apple Fritters.

Centuries ago, when San Francisco was at the ember stage of its creation a man named Bob planted himself on Polk.

He was a man of small stature but his dreams were that of legends. One late Friday night, as he stared out across the dirt road, he noticed a couple of misfits putting together a joke of a sushi restaurant and naming it 'Sushi Rock' to honor the rock they had just stepped on.

Looking up, he quietly murmured. "Oh... It's like that!?"

Deep into the night be pined in his kitchen box, but as the sun crept over the bridgeless bay, he pumped out the most enduring, delectable, sugar coated treat known to man kind. The heavenly aroma drifted down dirty polk ( yes, it was dirty back then as well, but beautiful nonetheless ).

The fellas of Sushi Rock awoke to a aroma that could cuddle with butter, and as they struggled to get in line for one, Bob simply looked over and said, "Go sell your Ginger elsewhere."

And that my friends, is how Bob's Apple Fritters came to be, and why throngs of young professionals forget how to eat with manners at midnight.
author: Mike K.

description:
I'm not even a apple fritter gal. I prefer glazed. But Bob's Apple Fritter is BOMB...like atomic BOMB. 

The apple chunks inside are fresh and the outside of the donut is perfectly glazed and crisp. I want one right now. I'd love to go back and try some of their other deadly delights.
author: Lisa H.

description:
How do you wrap up a night of bar hopping?
DONUTS.
Open late night, fat fluffy donuts, and cheap.
author: Aron L.

description: Great after-party spot on polk st for a quick sweet bite.  We had glazed donuts and choco chip cookie. They were perfect.
author: Astha S.

description: Glazed butter milk donut makes me wanna break dance and never wear skinny jeans again...well, not really.....I love my skinny jeans! But I'm divulging. There donuts are seriously great and when my co worker brings me one in, I can not refuse.
author: Alex L.

description: Came here just to see what they had, early morning and they had a good amount of selections this early. Very tasty and its open 24/hrs
author: Anthony G.

description: Came here on the night of my birthday after drinking. I don't remember much and my roommate was the one who wanted stuff. I just waited in line with her. I had a taste of her apple fritter and I guess it was really good but with so much alcohol in me, anything could've tasted great.
