From what I do remember, they have a lot of different things to choose from and they all seem pretty fresh. If I was hungrier, I would've opted for some donut holes.
author: edward k.

description: A good friend of mine and I were walking around Nob Hill late at night after a lovely meal and happened to pass Bob's. It sounded so so familiar and then she told me that their apple fritter was on the 7x7 top 100 things to eat in SF! Being a slight foodie, I went in (after a 7 course beef meal followed by smitten ice cream) and got one. For $1.75, their apple fritters are incredibly pleasant and not too sweet, with just the right amount of cinammony apple goodness! It would've been so much better if it was freshly made (which the man said happens at 8 AM and 1 AM) but it was great nonetheless! If anything, popping it in the microwave for a good 10-15 seconds definitely makes it slightly softer and warmer and tastes even better! :) I just kind of wish it had more apple bits, but it's one of the better apple fritters I've had!
author: Beatriz U.

description: This is my go-to donut place in the city when I need a fix.  Bob's donuts are light and fluffy, and not too sweet.  To me, this is the best combination.  Give it a try!
author: Jade F.

description:
GIANT DONUT!!!!!!!!!!!

Taste better than Krispy Kreme when its fresh...when its older its not bad but better than most donut places...

GIANT DONUT for $5.50....I took 4 people to eat...and 2 people didn't finish....
author: Brendan L.

description: I stumbled across this donut shop upon walking the streets of Nob Hill. The scrumptious display of their tasty treats in their window caught my attention and the warm smell of freshly baked goods drew me in. I had no idea that it was Bob's Donut Shop until I looked up at the sign! I had this place bookmarked and I've been meaning to pay a visit. They have a grand assortment of donuts to choose from...all very fresh.  Check out their enormous donut...I wasn't brave enough to try it. They open all night long =) I like.
author: Lynn V.

description:
This place is VERY VERY tempting..they have a glass window that showcases all the yummy donuts and sweets. My friends and I had lunch on Polk Street the other day and walked by Bob's- our temptations forced us to go inside to purchase SOMETHING sweet just to satisfy our stomach even thought we JUST had lunch..bad..very bad..

Opened 24 hours a day- if you come in the middle of the night you are most likely going to get some very warm and fresh donuts!
author: M W.

description: Whoa! You know you smell those delicious donuts every time you walk by and you know you want one. Small spiral glaze ones are my favorite, there soft and amazing, I think in one session I ate close to ten donuts! My recommendations is to get a mixed dozen to start and figure which ones are your favorite for next time, or you can just go with your sweet spot. They are open late and there will be a line and trust me it's worth it for anyone that's got the craving!
author: Manuel H.

description:
I just spent a week visiting a friend in Nob Hill and I went here 4 times while I was staying at her place.  I thank the gods that I don't live two blocks away from Bob's because I would gain twenty pounds and drop dead from heart disease within a year, though I would be deliriously happy the entire time.

I'm going to go against the grain and suggest you NOT get the apple fritter, which I thought was too heavy.  At the very least, split it with someone if you do get it.

The best way to experience Bob's is to head up to Nob Hill around 9:30 on a weekend night and pop into a bar for a bit-Kozy Car and Red Devil are close and therefore good for your ultimate purpose. Grab a drink, nothing too sweet,  and then every twenty minutes or so step out onto the street to check for the amazing aroma of frying dough.  Once it's good and strong, head over and ask for whatever they've just pulled out of the fryer, preferably with maple glaze, and prepare for a rush of delicious-endorphins.  It will be the best donut of your life.
author: Tori G.

description:
Great Place to go in downtown San Fran if you like donuts. Much better than at the national chains. Nothing fancy, clean and priced right.

It also seems to be the place Alton Brown of Good Eats goes in the morning when he is in town.
author: Dave J.

description: So I went here after the SF Marathon knowing I deserved a treat for my hard work. This place was raved about on Yelp so I walked the treacherous mile of homeless passed out on the sidewalk, vomit from the Saturday night prior, tranny's and prostitutes looking for a mid Sunday morning trick. And I did this with my kid on a bike, one in stroller and wife to boot (a nuclear family in SF we surely did stick out like sore thumbs.) Well, we got there and I got an apple fritter like everyone writes about. It wasn't warm and didn't seem that fresh. The rest of the family got regular donuts. To be honest, these were right on par with what you get Sunday after church in the hall. They weren't bad, they weren't great, but they weren't worth a 3/4 mile walk from the hotel. Perhaps I'll stop by at 2am on a Sunday, deuce and hungry and they'll taste better. Or maybe not.
author: D N.

description:
Came here for the first time with friends...word's can't describe how good their donuts are. Let's do a little comparison to show you how much BETTER these donuts are to their competition. 

Bob's Donut's makes Krispy Kreme look like something from another time that use to be good but now is out dated.

Bob's Donut's makes Dunkin Donuts taste like old cardboard. 

Bottom line is these donuts are HOT, FRESH, HUGE, and MMM MMM GOOD! 

***TIP: When coming here order whatever is fresh (just came out of the fryer...they are always making something hot and fresh.)
author: Nick C.

description: Wait one second!!!!  Ok they appeal to the young bar hoppers who come out over here at night.  But, the people who made their reputation, gave them mucho money over the years well they the baker has forgotten them.  Not the fine ladies at the cash register but they really don't like having to deal with our disappointment stretching over 40 years since we have lived in the neighborhood.  So, good luck to all those buried in your smart phones, bakers that forget where their success really came from and the young who are drinking too much now...just wait?
author: Timoty G.

description:
I ran to Bob's Donut on the way to work in a scramble to pick things up for a meeting!  Luckily I had good parking karma right in front.  

The lady was so helpful!  I told her that I needed 2 dozen donuts and she suggested what their most popular ones were (buttermilk, cinnamon twists) which made my job easy since I was in no mood to make decisions at 8AM!  They have a huge selection as well. 

The total came out to only around $28 for 2 dozen donuts!  They were a big hit at the meeting and I would definitely go back here next time.
author: Elise A.

description: I went in around 6pm and there was no line at all, so I was in and out really quick.  Parking was difficult to find around that time though so I drove around for a little bit before I found a metered spot (that someone left 49 minutes in). I bought one of the huge chocolate donuts for a friend's birthday gift. They said you could always call in earlier if you want a specific large donut saved, and that was helpful. I also tried the apple fritters because of the raves on yelp. They were definitely larger than you'd expect, and I said to myself I'd just eat half or part of it, and ended up finishing the whole thing because it was really good! The workers are also really friendly! They greeted me when I walked in and seemed like they loved what they were doing.
author: Samantha C.

description: Very nice service and great donuts! And they DO accept credit cards now btw.
author: Dan K.

description:
Bob's is a fairly well known donut place, so I wasn't going to add my two cents.  But Bob's provides me with other services in addition to my rotation of maple cake, raised chocolate, and buttermilk morning donuts. Well, I don't buy a donut here every morning anymore since that once tight 25 year old metabolism is now in sputter mode. But Bob's is part of my Mr. Rogers, "beautiful day in the neighborhood," circuit. Or its the last stop of the blurry night.

The girl who works in the morning always gives me a hard time. This is part of the experience. She points out all the other customers who buy dozens of donuts, proving that I am not their "number one" customer. Fine, I concede. But then the next day I come in wearing my Bob's Donut T-shirt. Who's the number one customer now?  Ummm, I'll take a buttermilk.  "Oh big spender, that's a dollar ten.  You're moving on up from your daily 85 cent donut...wow."

Also she gives me updates on the nightly riff-raft in the Polk cooridor, i.e, hookers, pimps, and general craziness.  She agrees things on the street aren't as bad as they were in 2004. Yeah, I don't hear the early morning click clacking sound of hooker heals as they run away from the circling pimps and cops as much any more.

Plus the late night lady gently suggested I curb my boozing down a couple notches. They are quite perceptive at Bob's.  So if you need some psycho therapy and a fresh tasty donut, Bob's is the place.
author: Georgio N.

description: Not that Bob's needs another five star review, but I just want to say that the donuts are fucking incredible (and this is coming from someone who doesn't really care for donuts). They're sort of crispy on the outside around the edges and fluffy on the inside. AND REALLY CHEAP.
author: Jessie A.

description:
Try the raised donuts!

Atmosphere/cleanliness:   Clean and simple black and white awning, beckons you to enter I came by in the middle of the afternoon and can only imagine how the east-facing storefront window filled with donuts looks like an oasis to tired and weary eyes as the morning sun rises over the buildings across the street.  

Service: Friendly and conversational.

Food:  I love donuts!  I said it, this simple breakfast device is so easy to screw up and fouled up by so many!  I read the reviews and craved the apple fritter, but while that was a decent pastry, a little on the thick side and not filled with enough apples, it was their raised donut that had me envisioning birds chirping in a flowery meadow as a flute plays some peaceful melody.  This pillowy lump of deliciousness is sure to please!  I ordered mine glazed at the suggestion of the friendly lady behind the counter and was delightfully surprised at how fresh this donut was even at 1:30 in the afternoon!  I'll be back and will be sure to follow my next order with a cup of Blue Bottle coffee...
author: Lyle A.

description:
I finally found this place! It's not like it was hard to find but I hardly go up the hill.

As much as I was tempted to buy the 5lb. donut, I resisted and opted out for a apple cinnamon something something. 

It was good, nothing too spectacular. 

Next time!
author: Jay C.

description:
I cannot believe it's taken me all the years I've lived in SF until now to try this place.

If you have not yet been to Bob's, but find yourself researching this establishment you MUST go, now!  The donuts are cooked fresh after 12am and I recommend you try them then.  You will experience the Donut Man (the cook) frying the beautifully glazed donuts before your eyes...ahh so delicious.

I can't wait for the next late night outing to Bob's!
author: Char C. B.

description:
OK, so we read these reviews, and it looks like this place has SPECTACULAR donuts.  I've had my Krispy Kremes, and I know you think they're too sweet or too commercial, but I can't think of much that beats a hot glazed from KK.

Johnnie's donuts in Lafyatte has great ones too, esp. if you get them hot., OMG.

So this place looked like it might take the cake.

Umm, these were about the most average donuts I ever had.  Nothing wrong with them, but certainly nothing special.  No way.  And yes, we tried about 5 different kinds. Glazed, chocolate cake, maple custard, cinnamon cake, and one other that escapes me.  Just average, all of 'em.

And the lady there, presuming she's the owner or co-owner or owner's relative, lacked much personality. I don't know if I would be super happy selling donuts myself, or would be just ho-hum.

What up wit dat?
author: Kristen L.

description:
Was recommended by a friend to stop by Bob's Donut for the real thing...no yuppie, hipster stuff here (insert your fav donut shop from the mission here).  

Wow, my homie was definitely keepin' it real.  This place is no frills, and you could almost mistake it for a large dumpsite, but they do make bomb.com donuts! this is the kind of spot you stop in at after 1am to load up on fried goodness.

if you're about keepin it street, and want some of those classic donuts you grew up on, assuming you didnt grow up in Yuppyville, USA, then definitely stop by Bob's donuts and eat to your heart's content (or death)!
author: David M.

description: best donuts in the city! you can't go wrong with bob's. they're also incredible fast at getting large orders ready for the office or parties.
author: Mandy A.

description:
I've been there like couple times before with friends, always during the midnight "coffee break". So donut for me is more like a memory than snack.
Tonight is another night like this I guess. Over 36 hours already, 3 hours sleep totally, drives me nuts. One friend who lives next block was willing to walk all the way down there and grab it. Thank you! 
Sales is very friendly and helpful. Very nice spot, who ever never try it, as my friends always said, this place probably is the best donut in SF. Well... I'm not a sweet eater, so don't really enjoy the dessert or snacks like donut. So I would say that, but they did. And before I leave my apt, mentioned it to the security downstairs. He said so too. 
OK then, 3 starts it is.
author: Flora F.

description: Fresh after-hours donuts AND those cute little cartons of 2% milk that I enjoy. A very splendid way to end the evening.
author: Loli L.

description: There's nothing quite like a donut fresh from the fryer.  If you're lucky enough to catch them making a fresh batch of donuts order one and enjoy!
author: Christine M.

description:
Best fresh french curls, EVER, when you get them when they come out! They are still lovely the day after, just pop them in the microwave(left of the register) for about 8 to 10 seconds. The late night crowd is an interesting bunch from the neighborhood bars and clubs as well as locals coming back from their night out. 

I love it that it's right around the corner from me. SWEET! I love Bob's Donuts for life for sure!
author: Juliet W.

description: If you're fortunate enough to walk by this building and see the smoke leave the door from the fryer you know your nose is going to lead you through that door to the deliciously fresh donuts. My faves are a fresh cruller without glaze or chocolate dipped and the large moist apple pandowdy.
author: Catalina C.

description:
24 hour shop that is frying and glazing donuts right in front of you...amazing.  it's a beautiful thing to see the donut you are about to eat being freshly prepared for you.

The service was the best.  The woman helping me was so sweet.  She made sure she packaged the donuts so they would arrive in still yummy condition and asked me to wait just a moment so she could make sure I was able to get all fresh donuts.

I brought in 2 groupon vouchers and there was no problem in having it redeemed.  


love it, can't wait to try the monster big donut sooon
author: Mimi X.

description: THe best donut i have ever had in my entire life, was a glazed donut from Bobs. Actually... it was two... but it WAS my birthday... and they were HOT from the fryer... dont get any other donut than the one they are frying up that minute. Why would you bother? the thing that makes it the best donut in the world is only because it just came out of the fryer. They do not use any special ingredients or anything (that I know of), you just have to get it fresh. The lady at the counter is super nice and they deserve your business!
author: K G.

description: Oh Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop. You must be so lonely right now at noon all the way over there on Polk Street. I am craving one of your German Honey and Fruit bars, a legacy recipe that was made and served by your former owner, it's knowledge passed sensibly and lovingly to the present owner. YUM! Also? You are the only donut shop I have ever been to that made a powdered sugar donut that crispy and delicious. If Bob's Donuts were healthful I would be there every day. Worth a trip.
author: Kimberley M.

description:
Woohoo!! Finally tried the infamous apple fritter featured on 7x7 magazine! Yup, they're right, it was the BEST apple fritter I have tried so far. 

My friend went there early this morning at 12:30am and waited half an hour before they fried a batch of apple fritters. Ding! ready at 1:00am and scored 3 apple fritters. For some reason they only fried 8 and it was GONE as soon as they made them!
author: Leeseuh K.

description: Love stopping by on the way back home n picking a donut or two! Apple fritter is amazin.!
author: Neha M.

description: I don't get to Bob's Donuts very often, so I tend to forget just how outstanding their doughnuts really are.  I was there Monday and had a raised glazed doughnut.  Compared to the ones I get at Safeway, Happy Donut and Lucky Donut, Bob's are the Rolls Royce of doughnuts.  Bob's seems to have several different recipes that are used to give their doughnuts unique flavors and textures and they make a wide variety of products.  I strongly recommend that you give Bob's a try.  I think you will agree that they are among the best in the City.
author: Ralph J.

description:
With 600+ reviews and 4.5 star average, Bob's doesn't need another review.  But I need another Bob's donut.

The still-warm chocolate dipped old fashioned was a delight.  I'm 100% a chocolate glazed kinda guy, but this day the old fashioned stole the show.

+1 star for sponsoring the yelp crew at last year's B2B.  I love my Bob's Donut tshirt.
author: Bryan K.

description:
Probably my favorite place to pick up a donut in a city.   They are the only places I know of that make giant donuts.   They have your normal staples and they are solid.   The last time I went here I had the bread pudding and it was really good.    What seperates this place from your normal donut shop other than the giant donuts is the sheer volume and speed they crank out everything.   Plus, they stay open super late.   I've never seen them closed once.    

Here's a tip, time your visit.  Get in line and let people pass you up so you can get to the fresh stuff.
author: Norm P.

description: Love the smooth melting hot glazed donuts.
author: Anil K.

description: We bought a Groupon for this place and thought it was fun. The lady that runs the place is a doll and super sweet. She cracked me up. The donuts weren't extraordinary but she was and I'd go back. Cute hole in the wall.
author: Jael J.

description: DAMN delicious ass donuts perfectly constructed. I walked in and asked the dude if he had the all time best donut which is the buttermilk glazed bar with the jelly filling on the outside. Unfortunately they were out but he said to get the buttermilk glazed mar with maple. Help me baby jesus!!!! WOW! that donut is fantastic. it really does taste like a pancake with a super crisp outside. I will always be a fan even if I have bypass surgery because of these yummy donuts.
author: Chuck G.

description:
Good donuts. Lady server was annoying. Took far too long to figure out that I wanted 2 dozen donuts when I said "two dozen donuts please" from the beginning. I wanted 1 dozen glazed and 1 dozen chocolate, and it took her a while to figure it out. She said "oh, you mean you want 2 dozen." YES.

As I waited patiently while she rearranged all the donuts on the many various levels of trays, I started screaming (in my head) JUST PUT THE DANG DONUTS IN THE BOX ALREADY! Finally she got to the glazed and chocolate donuts and put them in the box.

I counted my money of $18 dollar by dollar in front of her; the total was $17.90 for 2-dozen donuts. As she slowly gave me my $0.10 back (because heck no I wasn't gonna tip her!) I bolted out the door.

I have tried the apple fritters, which are good, but only when they are fresh. Otherwise, they can go into the mediocre batch as well.
author: Maria C.

description:
This place is one of the best donut shops I've been to. 

When I heard about this place, I was expecting a bigger shop, but when my friend and I actually looked at it from outside, I was like "hm... doesn't look like much".

I shouldn't judge a place by it's looks, because this place is a small diamond in a coal mine. The cashier was really cool and friendly. I was looking at the donuts near the window and he said "you shouldn't be looking at the donuts there, you should be looking at the ones in the fryer". 

It was midnight and we saw a bunch of dough being fried and glazed with sugar. My friend and I HAD to get a fresh glaze. 

We took a bite and it was hot, soft, sweet, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. We ordered another round of donuts and just sat on the stools and chatted while enjoying their fresh donuts. 

Where else can you see your donut being made RIGHT in front of you? I know Krispy Kreme does, but it's behind a close space while Bob's is literally in your grasp. They make their donuts fresh from about 10pm-2 or 3 am. 

I haven't tried their apple fritter but i will next time. If you want great donuts, definitely come to Bob's. Come in when they make it fresh because it is so worth it. I live in the sunset and I would go all the way there for a donut; that's when you know this place is good.
author: robin w.

description:
Hands down the best old fashioned donut I have ever eaten.  I would recommend these to anyone. I cant wait to go back and try others. 

Plus they are 24hr...perfect for sweet cravings at any time!
author: Blake M.

description:
OH MY GOODNESS! This place is heaven on earth.

Want a super down to earth, rightly priced, amazing doughnut experience.  Nothing compares to a doughnut from Bob's. A friend recently turned me on to this place and I drove all the way across town last night to get some more doughnuts. Every time I go, there are fresh doughnuts coming out. The are amazing....melt in your mouth and just make you feel like a kid in a candy store. I used to be a fan of krispy kreme but not anymore. This is the real thing. Make sure to get the Apple Fritter and the Buttermilk Bar. I love those as well as the cake maple with sprinkles, although I am sure all are good. Those are the main ones I have tried so far. Yum Yum Yum!
author: Zachary D.

description:
I rolled over here after Pete L put me on this spot.  I love donuts but try to stay away due to the high sugar content and fried nature of these delicious treats.  Nevertheless I came here and cheated on my diet lol. 

After I hit up a meal at Miller's East Coast deli, my fatass made the 1-2 block trek over here to get some donuts.  I hollered at an Apple Fritter, which was on 7x7 things to eat list or whatever that shit is called.  As I walked to Bob's and saw the display window, I knew it was time to make the donuts.

The Apple Fritter was around $1.75 but it's really big.  I suggest eating half there and then save the other part for later.  That what I did. I gorged on the other half when I got home and watched the news.

Donuts here are freshly made in front of you and there is a good assortment.  The place is more of a take out type shop so there's not many seats to sit at.  I came here around lunchtime and there were a few people eating donuts and sipping on coffee.

This place is 24 hours so your obese ass can holler at some donuts at 3am.  I'm sure this place is a big hit after the clubs.  The line goes out the door on the weekend so be patient.  I stopped by over the weekend and my friends had to wait for 5 minutes to get to the front of the line.  I decided to get out of the line after a got a whiff of the delicious donuts and stayed outside til they were done.

Parking here is ok if you're stopping by during the day.  At night, it's not so great but don't let that deter you.  The prices here for donuts aren't that cheap though.  It's not as great as people make it out to be but the shit is good no doubt.  It's kind of hard to fuck up a donut though.

Hey yo, what happened to Krispy Kreme?  Ya'll MFs don't go there anymore!
author: Jason Y.

description:
You will find me here at 11:00pm when the donuts are fresh and cooled off juuuuust a little, so when you bite into it you get a crunch!!! Drool!!!! My favorites are any cake donuts. Again Drool!!! 

I love getting a half dozen for long road trips.

***The staff has ALWAYS been friendly and the donuts have ALWAYS been tasty***   

This place is by no means overrated!!!
author: Rhy C.

description:
Screw the giant raised donut (although it's also delicious) - there's SO much variety here and everything is delicious!!  Try the raspberry crossed buttermilk donuts - holy moley!

Every time I visit, I always end up leaving w/ 6-12 donuts because I want them all.  

Their donuts have this deep fried crispiness to the edges and your teeth snap through in every bite.  

They're also open super late, which I find hand when I'm stumbling back home on Polk and want a little taste of heaven for the walk back.

I no longer live in SF... Bob's, oh how I miss thee.

PROS:
-Primo donut quality.
-Nice variety.
-Nice service behind the counter.

CONS:
-none, although the donuts are against the window that face the street so when you want to see all your options, you end up trying to pick them out from behind.  It's only until I leave that I think, "oh, I didn't see that one" but I just have to remember to do that before I dash in.
author: Ryan T.

description:
Hmmmm donuts.

Yes I am like Homer Simpson when it comes to the love of donuts. So when I heard Bob's Donut was a must try for apple fritters and donuts I was determined to give it a try. While I heard it was much better to go when the goods come out fresh, I did not have that type of planning in mind. Rather, I decided to stop by when I was driving nearby and decided it was the prefect time for donuts. 

Honestly... from a shallow perspective of the donuts, they were not the pretties donuts I have ever seen. But you can not always judge a donut by its looks. 

I really liked the apple fritter, it was not overly sweet. Only problem, it was cold. I am sure it would have been much better if it had come fresh out of the fryer.

I also tried the donut holes, nothing special about those. They probably would have been better fresh too.
author: Angela T.

description:
Sometimes food can be deceiving.  For example, that cheesecake that tastes so light and creamy in your mouth is a lot heavier on your hips. That's one of the things I like about the apple bread pudding at Bob's.  When Sonia hands you that bag of bread pudding, you feel like one of those actresses who's just received an Oscar and is apparently required to say "Wow, this thing is so heavy."  There's no delusion at Bob's.  You know when you feel that heavy bag on the counter that if you eat it, it's going to be a heavy bag on you!  

Eat it anyway.
author: P J.

description: Mom and Pop donut shop, the lady that helped us out has this little sarcastic humor which was pretty funny. I wish I could have tried a "hot" donut but you have to be here late at night when they're making it fresh. But the cold one I had at like 3pm wasn't that bad either!
author: Chris T.

description: I don't get the hype about the donuts here and i've tried them twice to give Bob's a chance.  They are greasy and sugary, yes, but delicious?  Perhaps they taste like manna from a drunken Jesus if you've been slamming down well cocktails at Kozy Kar for a couple of hours before stumbling over to Bob's, but I've had better donuts at at a Safeway bakery, which is also markedly cleaner. I gave up trying to find this place's allure when the last apple fritter that I bought from here was seasoned with a long hair that had been caramelized into its glaze.  Too tired to walk all the way back to complain, I ended up chucking it into the trash, along with the other two donuts that I had purchased for later.  So gross.
author: Laurie O.

description:
Delicious donuts-but not the best I've had. Very convenient-open 24 hours. They make their donuts fresh at 2:00 am so if you live in the area, that's the time to go! The donuts are decently priced.. 75 cents for a normal donut, $1.45 for the apple fritter, $1 something for a cinnamon twist thingy. 

The inside is modest, just basic donut shop. Cash only. The only thing that happened that I don't like is that when I went in with my friends the woman behind the counter pretty much offered one some coffee and he filled up one of those small paper cups like halfway (mind you, we had already paid and sat down with our donuts). When we were heading out, she yells out that he owes $1.35 for the coffee. It was just kinda rude to sorta offer him it then ask him to pay later and for the size of a medium when he hardly had half a small cup. Oh, and one night a scary dude who must have worked there kept asking where his money was to the other people working there and it made us all really uncomfortable..so ya it can be a shady place sometimes.
author: Misty M.

description:
I was instantly glad we'd made the trek to Bob's.  The moment we walked in we were surrounded by a thick haze of fried doughnut oil.  It smelled wonderful.

We had the truck stop coffee and a chocolate cream doughnut.  This evening they were watching American Gangster on their widescreen TV.

It was an experience just for the down-home local flavor atmosphere.  It was clear that Bob's had been there forever, and wasn't going away any time soon.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The Yelp reviews looked appealing for this place so, I decided to give it a try. The place was empty, and the cashier was watching TV. I ordered the easiest thing on the menu Donut Holes simple, there is no shaping required. All i tasted was dough that was old with no icing. Thank god it only cost .85 cents. 
Why Donut Hole? Because eveything looks old, and the same goes for the store.
author: Nathan M.

description:
I think I had really high hopes from reading the reviews, but this is just a good old fashioned donut shop.  The very opposite of Dynamo.  It's like comparing MItchell's to Bi-rite...they're just two different things.

I always order apple fritters at donut shops if they're available, and this one passed the test.  Everything is so big I couldn't manage eating more than one...so order a variety and share.
author: Tai N.

description: A gem open late whether you're craving something sweet in the middle of the night or need something after frequenting the nearby bars.  The apple fritter is well worthy of its place on 7x7's list of 100 things to eat in SF before you die.  Best thing is to catch em fresh nice n hot with a side of milk.  Its like an apple fritter party in your mouth.  They also have a giant donut which is a worth challenge to any of the fearless.  You might need to run a marathon after tho.  It took me 2 days or so to finish a BFD "big freaking donut".  If you love donuts you gotta eat here
author: Christopher C.

description: Nothing tastes better than hot, fresh donut holes at 2AM in the morning. Or when you've been drinking that night. The line is still pretty long at this hour, but it moves fast and is totally worth the wait. So good. The people behind the counters are nice too, and they have so many different types of donuts/pastries! I also had their regular glaze and a chocolate cake donut, god it was so good.
author: Eugi H.

description: Best donuts ever in life! Open 24 hours, crumb donut is the best thing I've ever put next to my face. The world is better for Bob's.
author: Claire S.

description: Their donuts are AMAZING. The big donuts are delish! You need to try it if you're in the area.
author: Kaycee P.

description: Holy cow that was the best donut I've ever had. And it was a real donut, not a flattened-cupcake-with-a-hole-in-it type deal. For the record, I don't even really like donuts unless they are hot-off-the-belt Kripy Kremes, but I will now add Bob's Donuts to my list of accepted center-less pastries.
author: Allison C.

description: I don't like doughnuts, that said, I love Bob's! You have to get them while they are hot to get the ultimate experience, but a cold doughnut is yummy too. It's something about the dough that they use. The doughnuts are crispy on the outside and soft, but not too soft, on the inside. Now I want a doughnut...
author: Jamie T.

description:
Their window display of donuts should be illegal. 

I walked up 8 blocks of Polk St, passing three donut shops and a bagel joint, refusing to enter any of them. And then I walked by a window that was filled halfway to the top with every donut, pastry and cookie you could think of.

As soon as I finished adoring the goods, I looked a little higher and saw a sweet old lady working the register all by herself. As if my will-power wasn't being tested enough, she noticed me and gave me the biggest smile I'd seen all day. I was sold.

I went inside and waited behind a guy taking his time looking through the donut choices. Two more came in behind me and waited as well. I don't know if it was the sweet lady, the nice weather or we were day-dreaming of how delicious our donuts were going to be but I'd never seen a group of foodies wait so patiently for anything.

Despite my obvious talent for articulating the hard-to-word, I won't tell you how good the donuts were. I'll let your imagination run wild until you find yourself victim to the seductive window display at Bob's Donuts.
author: Mack D.

description:
Bob's has earned a special place in my heart for their supremely tasty, just out of the oven, donuts. Their stand-out batter is a cinnamon and nutmeg infused blend of perfection. Morning or night, the donuts are always fresh. Minus one star because they don't make my fave flavor combo (vanilla rainbow sprinkle cake). 

Friendly service + deep fried scrumptiousness = a total winner!
author: Rebecca O.

description: Came here because my husband and I had a sweet tooth and it had great reviews. What a mistake! The donuts in the window all looked old and hard, but we decided to give the, a chance anyway. I got a glazed donut and my husband got an apple fritter. Both were hard and cold. I get that there is a microwave there, but c'mon. I asked when they were going to have a new batch of donuts coming out and the lady behind the counter couldn't articulate an answer for me. I threw half of my donut away, my husband isn't so picky I guess.
author: Sarah A.

description:
AMAZING pastries.  My favorite is the sticky bun. 

The owner + employees are really sweet (no pun intended) and helpful- they'll actually tell you what everything is without seeming annoyed that you don't know.

There are stools and tables to sit and eat, but this place is perfect to just pick up a few pastries and [try to] save them for dessert.
author: Cristina P.

description: Open 24/7. Crispy but soft apple fritters?!?!?  Under $1?!?  Yummy!!!
author: Catherine T.

description: My friend would NOT stop posting pictures of Bob's donuts on fb and since I was in the city, I thought I'd give it a try. Was saddened to hear they had run out of their famous apple fritters. I ordered a dozen mixed variety to share w/my coworkers. Tried the sugar and chocolate glazed. Pure heaven - so soft & fresh! The next day they were a little hard but after 10 secs in the microwave I couldn't tell the difference! Determined to come back for the fritter!
author: Cheryl P.

description:
I used to live a block from this shop.
Whenever I had midnight cravings, I went there for their freshly made donuts.  If you go around 1am, you can get fresh ones.  Aya usually works at night, so I used to go there just to chat in Japanese with her whenever I had trouble sleeping.  I could fall asleep easily with donuts smell in my hair and clothes after that. :-p
author: Noriko R.

description:
Pretty good donuts, washed down with milk, just like when I was a kid.  I love smelling the donuts as I near the place - it's like eating it twice, once with my mind, and again with my mouth!

I'm sure there are better donuts out there, but if you live in the area, you should support this place.
author: Dmytro A.

description: YES BOB's. Hands down the best donut place in San Francisco. Cheap, great, and the people are so nice. Just your neighborhood pastry shop. You'll love it!
author: Anna C.

description:
I love Bob's Donuts in the City plus it's been there for a long time and if you're not from the city you must give it a try!  They have to be the best in SF especially because it's always fresh and warm and sweet but not the overkilled type.  I definitely crave their Apple Fritter, Glaze Donuts and their Coolers (ask for it warm!) It has got to be the best!  Their other speciality pastries are not too bad - raspberry twist, their cookies and muffins and every now and then I'll buy a few for the office or my boyfriend but hands down their donuts - two thumbs up!

I work near Bob's and reason with myself why I shouldn't go there because if I went there everyday my waistline would hate me.

What more can you ask for - fresh donuts that leave you wanting more and more...
author: Caroline C.

description:
We have a love-hate relationship, Bob's and I. 

I am never a sweets person, but ever since Bob's and I have encountered, every visit is a failed battle. Seriously, where do you go to get FRESH doughnuts at past midnight?!

Chocolate Old Fashion: sweet chocolate, crispily fried dough, almost molten center. Warm and delicious sliding from your tongue into your stomach. 

Apple Fritters: unfortunately does not come out until 1AM, is absolutely amazing. 

Croissant: comes out at 1130PM, so soft, airy and buttery. It's my stable order. 

.. Of course, that is until I encountered one day, fresh croissant with HAM AND CHEESE BAKED INTO IT!!!! It was heavenly, warm, salty, happy, and cannot be over $3. Everything is cheap here and the Bob's Doughnuts Lady is the best person ever. I was sad to find her on vacation last time I went (mere 4 days ago).
author: Fiona S.

description: The food here is great and the service is wonderful. An old time classic I will definitely be back.
author: Yoshio B.

description: Fresh donuts.  (check) More fresh donuts. (double check)  I picked up an apple fritter, a plain glazed and a cream cheese croissant and love each of them (even after some had sat all day long).  Great place that is open 24hrs so you just can't go wrong with donuts being available 24 hours a day.
author: Brad S.

description:
Bob's Donuts makes even the shittiest week a little bit better.  It often ruins my workout as I sometimes walk up that way from the gym to the Bank of America on Van Ness to withdraw money for my day and I can't resist the extra block and a half trek to feed my habit.

They have this baked apple thing that's basically like crack.  And that said - they have a great variety of donuts and other baked goods - much better than your typical donut place in the Tenderloin.  There stuff is usually really fresh with tons of great choices.

I will never have washboard abs though because of this place, but its worth it.
author: Daniel H.

description:
WoW.  Best donuts I've ever tasted hands down.  Light, fluffy, sweet, tastes like baby angels.   I can imagine how long the line gets after the bars let out in the city.  I'll never eat a donut at 2 am, that should be punishable by death.  I will however have one right after lunch and make myself sick.  Totally worth it.  I've tried the apple fritter and the plain glazed donut.  Now I need to try every other donut in that goddamn place.  The maple glazed filled custard will be next on my list.  I wish I was skinnier so that I could get back to this weight on donuts alone.  Yea that's right.

Tip:  The lady who owns this shop is suppperrrr sweet!  She always offers me milk like a good mother.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I almost feel like there might be something wrong with my taste buds giving this place 3 stars, but I just don't see the big deal.  Ok, so the apple fritter is good but not enough for me to give 5 stars.  I came back to try custard filled chocolate bar, chocolate old fashioned, and a regular glazed, and they were ok and didn't really stand out.  Krispy Kremes tastes better to me, and Bob's falls way behind Dynamo Donuts.  Even the reviews here only mention the apple fritters but nothing really glowing.

The 7x7 seems to be referenced a lot, but I have a feeling that if it was never mentioned at #80, the reviews wouldn't be as many or as good.

service is ok
places could be cleaner but not bad
parking is difficult, metered

apple fritter review: Texture is totally awesome as it has a nice crunch and soft on the inside.  I was lucky that it was out of the oven not too  long after I purchased it, so it was semi-warm on the inside.  My only gripe is I wish it has more apple chunks on the inside.  It is big enough to fill you up a bit.  It probably is the best apple fritter I've had, but I'm not much an apple fritter fanatic to give more than 3 stars but again, everything else is just ordinary.
author: John D.

description:
I love donuts. I love fresh donuts. I love other people's excitement about donuts.

I got three donuts: chocolate old-fashioned, chocolate raised, and glazed jelly filled. Of the three, the old-fashioned is my favorite, BUT, the best tasting of the three was the jelly filled.

I look forward to a return trip, as my first had a "compromised" eating experience. Contact me privately if you want me to vent. This review is not the proper forum for such kvetching.
author: Marja M.

description:
After a fun night of booze and great food at mazu (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mazu-san-francisco), a group of 4 macho male friends and I headed to Bob's donut. Bob's donuts hit the legendary status among the group, so I was especially ecstatic to have a freshly made chocolate glaze.... 

Man friend JunPower! asked if I wanted a regular or the original, and I chose the FLUFFY one (I think that's regular.) While I'm used to the regular donut shops' donuts, Bob's donuts was fresh and fluffy, deliciously glazed with chocolate. Oh happy me! A group of 4 macho dudes and I were packed inside my tiny jetta, happily munching Bob's while enjoying the view of the chaotic late nightlife of Polk St. The perfect thing to do to end the night. 

Thanks Bob!
author: Gigi T.

description: Went here one night with the girlfriend because she was raving about it.  We must have come at the wrong time (before 2:00AM) and ordered the wrong thing because the pastries were average at best.  We got the bread pudding and a lemon pastry and neither were delicious or even appetizing looking.  We actually brought most of it home to throw away because she felt bad throwing it away at the location itself. Add in that it was past midnight and we had walked there for donuts and overall it was a below average experience.  It needs to be cooler in the actual restaurant because there were flies when we were there.
author: Marvin P.

description: I used to like this place.  Older Asian woman at night could NOT be nicer.  The younger Asian woman in the morning has real attitude.  I saw her arguing with a couple this morning who didn't think she had given them correct change.  There are just as good places that appear cleaner without having to deal with this woman first thing in the morning.
author: Scott B.

description: Very good donuts ! The Apple Fritter was delicious tasted fresh nice and crispy on the outside just the right amount of frosting great flavor. I am quite the doughnut snob so trust me I would not say these were good unless they were good.  So if you like donuts and you want one that taste fresh and not like it was made who knows when go here! Plus the lady who was running the place seemed super sweet.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
OMG I had the best donut ever tonight at Bob's!! It was quite late when I stopped in but thankfully they're open 'round the clock, how convenient. Judging from the time of night and still a vast array of options at that hour, it was obvious they get a steady flow of customers seeking their late-night fried dough fix! In fact there were people coming and going constantly during the five minutes I was there.

I got two donuts and a small thing of milk. The man who makes the donuts (Bob?) just yanked a fresh batch from the fryer. I got it plain, just before it was about to undergo glazing/cinnamon-ization and it was EFFing GOOD!! It had a crispy coat and once broken, this little treasure reveals an inside that is just like a freshly baked cake! And there was no old-grease taste to it. I've never had such a perfect donut and now I'm totally addicted! I definitely have to go back and get more before I head out of SF. The other kind I got was the traditional glazed, which I won't dare eat until the morning when I'm sure it'll be yummy!

Apart from donuts and the jumbo family-sized version which looks so fun! there are other fried dough offerings including danishes and other old-school pastries. Service is swift and everything is super-cheap, as in $5 will get you a serious feast! If you're in SF, make the trip to Bob's, you have no excuse since they're open all day and night!
author: CalamityJane T.

description:
In the immortal words of Keanu Reeves in Speed, "F-ck Me", is exactly how I felt after bulldozing an apple fritter.  I decided I'd be all healthy and walk the hills of Nob and Russian Hill.  On my way back down to lower polk, Bob's Donuts drew me in.  Just a look I told myself.  Um. Yeah. No.

This small divey donut shop is just what the doctor ordered.  They have cookies, donuts, sodas, coffee and apple fritters.  The fritter is on the 7x7 100 things to eat in SF before you die.  Well, it should be.  It's the best damn donut/fritter/apple thingy I have ever eaten.

It's a heavy solid doughy donut covered in delicious sugary glaze.  The apple cinnamon mixture is perfectly sweet without so overdoing it you feel like you just ate straight sugar.  It had to delicious crunch with a soft donut center.  I was genuinely surprised at how good it was.  I mean, can donuts be that different from each other.  Yes, a resounding yes!  I told myself I would only eat half.  It really is a heavy sucker.  But, looking at that lonely uneaten portion, I just couldn't walk away.  

I highly recommend Bob's Donuts for the apple fritter...although bring a friend if you plan on only trying to eat half.  You won't be able to just walk away, I promise.
author: Emily G.

description:
I live literally a block away and as I wait for the 19 bus I notice the line that fills up the store, people love buying a box of breakfast items for Friday meetings and what not... but I come here occasionally for the "oh so goodness doughnuts" 

I know it's like the other yelpers say it's not a great habit so I TRY to veer away from waiting for the bus at that stop..hah

A couple of my favorites are the mini doughnut holes and the chocolate frosting doughnuts. 

Five stars for the yummy doughnuts and friendly atmosphere! There's always the loyal customers, welcoming cashier and oh right ..doughnuts!
author: Jen L.

description:
Dear Bob's Donuts, 

You are so delicious when I have you for breakfast, lunch or dinner. But, you are at your best at 2:30 in the morning after a night of drinking. Your apple fritters are so hot, I can hardly eat them, but I want to so badly. Your chocolate glazed donuts are so soft, they melt in your mouth. Your glazed donuts are perfectly sweet. I can't wait to see you Saturday night my darling, and taste more of your delicious treats. Until then, I'll be thinking fondly of all of our memories. 

Sincerely Yours,
Caroline H.
author: Caroline H.

description:
Bob, where have you been all my life???

Sadly, I've only recently discovered this place about 3-4 months ago when the bf brought home some delicious apple fritters late at night.  

Apple Fritters, #80 on 7x7's 100 Big Eat list.....check!

He brought home 3 different donuts and my first thoughts were "Geez, it's only a donut.....why'd you have to wait so long for a freakin donut?!"  Like really, how good can a donut be?  Boy was I so wrong!  Apparently, it's very very good!  The best time to go is late night when batches are coming out fresh.  They're HUGE too.  As tempting as it is to not want to devour it all at once, I sadly felll victim to that -- warm succulent bites of heavenly bliss.

Sugar overload.  Fattening glaze.  Yum doesn't that sound good? Get ready to go into a diabetic coma!
author: Carmen Y.

description:
How many awards did this place win? Crazy. 

I shoulda yelped before I came here, but I did it as a spur of moment thing, and got donut holes. Missed the apple fritters, gosh darnit. 

Well, the donut holes were delicious. Cold, but delish.  

I don't know who Bob is, but I sure didn't see him, but I saw his lady. Ordered a donut for a friend and half a dozen of donut holes (total is $1.70). There were 4 in my party, and she must have known, b/c instead of 6 donut holes, she gave us 8. Such a sweet gesture! 

However, she didn't seem that friendly to us-- no Hi, no acknowledgment when we ordered, and no bye. Weirddd.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Late night doughnut eats.

I adore this place. Good bear claws (aka Bigfoot Claw) and extraordinary Apple Fritters, as mentioned in so many other reviews.

The doughnuts are priced well and are very fresh.

Walk up Polk Street to relieve guilt. True doughnut lovers can usually fit in a minimum of three doughnuts on the trek back down, lol.
author: Anna S.

description: hands down the best donut of my life. hot and fresh, amazing flavor and so fluffy. yum!!
author: J P.

description:
Sorry, but I don't LOVE Bob's like the rest of the world does. 

I have done my homework before going. I read many reviews...found out what I needed to get and what time was best to go...I've learned of their Giant Donut. Unfortunately, I couldn't wait around until 10-11pm where they "supposedly" make their fresh batches of donuts. I went at 8pm. Parking sucked that's for sure, I circled around about five times and there's still wasn't parking, I had to double-park and run in. I hate double-parking on a busy street. Of course, I brought an apple fritter to try. DUH. I got a maple-glazed donut as well. Service was OK. I held the donuts and it felt kinda hard from outside of the bag...hmmms...that didn't seem right. I got home, took it outta the bag and it felt rock-hard. Uh...really?...THIS was suppose to be THE best donut in SF???...kinda disappointed. I microwaved it for 30 secs and it did become softer. I cut a small piece of each to try. Here's my verdict...

Apple Fritter: I was surprised by it's size. It was like six inches in diameter! Huge and overwhelming. Taste was OK. I liked the apple slices inside, they did seem fresh, but not the BEST donut I've ever tasted. For all the hype, I expected WAY better, esp if it was for $1.50. 3 stars.

Maple-Glazed: This tasted just like any other donut...like just the same as if I've gotten it from Safeway. Nothing special. I could've actually gotten a better donut elsewhere for less than $1. 2 stars. 

One thing that did earn them some brownie points is that they are open 24 hrs...I've not heard of many donut/pastry shops that are open pass 7pm. 

I don't doubt how it could've actually tasted if it came out fresh, since most of the reviews from others were quite consistent of how good it was. I am going to give Bob's the benefit of a doubt. Perhaps it was really the BAD timing. I kinda lost my urge to go back again though, but I wouldn't mind IF I do go around that area again. Chances might be slim though...
author: Winnie L.

description: The apple fritters are a must and a great way to end the night. They are sweet but not so sweet that they hurt and there is a crunch to it. It is good the next day as well. The lady that works there is super sweet and the treats are cheap. After a night of booze and bad decisions, end it with a good decision and stop by Bob's.
author: Eve C.

description: These donuts are amazing.  Not only is it awesome that you can get a donut the size of your head, but... they taste amazing too!!  Best donut I'm pretty sure I've had in a very, very long time.  Staff is very nice and friendly too.  :)
author: Jenna G.

description: Just ask to have what is freshest it never disappoints. The folks who work there are friendly and work so hard to provide the best donuts is SF.
author: yoni s.

description:
Bob's is simply the best. The fact that it's open 24/7 makes it great for those late night donut runs, but the fact that the donuts are some of the best in the city definitely helps. The guy who works there at night usually is super friendly.

The lemon-filled donut is definitely my favorite. The slight addition of powdered sugar on top really puts it over the top!
author: Mario M.

description:
Have you ever passed by Bob's at 2am on a Saturday night/Sunday morning and seen a line here? Well, there's a reason for that...

You cannot beat the apple fritters here. You can try, but you will not be successful. 

I can't recall what else I've tried here but all I can say is that I haven't met a Bob's doughnut that I didn't like.
author: Christina C.

description:
I'm a donut eater.  I'm not going to lie, in college I used to go to Safeway and shop for the .99 dozen specials that were going to expire the day of.  I'd probably kill about 3-4 donuts in that one night.  Favorite?  I'm a simple person..I like regular plain donuts or powdered donuts.  Nothing fancy.  Definitely nothing in the middle.

Anyhow, I roll up to this place since it has some killer reviews.  Yelp, you do not disappoint.  This place has some of the best donuts I've ever had.  I think what makes it more awesome is that fresh batches are made every 30 minutes.  It's like a DONUT BAR...you grab a seat, some milk and sit there and watch them make fresh donuts straight out of the fryer!  It's a beautiful thang.  Trust.  

I've never seen donuts literally made within 3 feet of me.  Whereas a Krispy Kreme you're separated with a window..here - you're watching the donut maker (is that a word?) roll out some fresh dough and throw it in the fryer.  You also watch him put the glaze on...seriously, I wanna take a shower in that glaze.  Doze it ALL OVER ME!!!  Bliss.
I'll take a fryer while you're at it too!

So I hear for a late night this is a good place to go to after a night of drinking.  I think I will try that next!  

Now..what about Bob?  Who is he?  Someone let me know..I want to personally shake Bob's hand.
author: Yup S.

description:
I have tried a lot of apple fritters in my life, but Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop is as good as it gets! 

Especially with a nice box of moo-juice, this hangover helper is so good you will be happy to express the joy it brings people. 

Yeah, I hate to sugar coat this -pun intended- but this place has been around before I even knew what an apple fritter was!? 
+4 For the Awesome Donut(s)! 
+1 Star for the crazy sights and sounds of Polk St. at Night. 

Nothing more entertaining then watching bum fights... no wait, women with ridiculously sized adam's apple's and calves more buff than I can imagine drunk at 1am, shouting obscenities at people shouting at... Them. I guess it all reciprocates?
Nevertheless, they are freaking harmless, so just leave em alone and enjoy your donut!!!  

By the way I have been going to this place before I even got to know the owner(s). They are hella cool, and I am glad I can give a non-bias opinion to one of SF's Donut Havens!

God Bless you Bob's Donut, and everyone who goes there, yeah you too Drunken Jamie in the 5-inch Heels, you too.
author: Dave K.

description: They have a large variety of donuts. Staff here is nice. We could not decide what to have, the person behind the counter is very patient with us! I ended up with a simple fresh made glazed donut. It is like in heaven. Warm, puffy, and not too sweet. I am not a fan of donuts, but I just loved it! I will definitely go back, maybe 3 am in the morning? Since it is open 24/7!
author: Emmy P.

description:
parking is always tough on the polk...but this place is open 24hours so you may find parking right in front.

this is the BEST donut place in san francisco.  They do donuts thick and fresh.  The apple fritters have big fresh sweet pieces of apple inside.  They also do this AWESOME apple thingy...forgot the name.

I've been coming here for a LONG TIME and i'll still keep coming here.  Wish I lived closer.

They don't do any of the NEW FANCY donuts...but they have all of your FAVORITE CLASSICS!
author: Bing D.

description: For as long as I can remember Bob's Donuts has stood on Polk street and I've been coming here as long as I can remember. These guys know their way around an amazing donut and they are open to heavens knows when. Cheap donuts and easy access makes this place the best! They make a mean jelly-filled donut!
author: Michael N.

description: Awful.  All you taste is oil and undercooked dough.  Not sure why people love this place... Maybe because it's open all night and dirt cheap.  I would gladly pay more if it was halfway decent.
author: Nick J.

description: Wow, look at the size of those things. Customer service was great but minus one star for being overly sweet for my liking.
author: Fundella S.

description: I've never had anything like it. The price is right, the donuts are like no other. This place is a necessary stop.
author: Englands E.

description: Try to walk by this place and not think about buying delicious donuts.  Open 24 hours a day so you can crush apple fritters at 2am after a night out on polk.  Or you could pick up a box of donuts and bring them into your office on a Friday morning and become a hero/legend  at work for only a few bucks. I took my super bowl party up a notch by getting a bunch of bobs, cutting them into 1/4 and sticking a toothpick in them so it made it a classy snack- everyone loved it. Also, if you follow them on twitter @whatsfreshest, they tweet about what just came out of the oven.
author: Jeannine R.

description: Best donuts I've had.  Especially great when they're open when the bars close down.  Two favorites are the apple fritter, and the jelly crossed donut.  The best part is you can ask to wait for a hot donut off the press, highly recommended!
author: Darren A.

description:
I'm a big donut whore, so I have pretty high standards when it comes to evaluating donut shops. 

However, Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop is my hands-down favorite donut shop in the city. I will take a donut from Bob's over a $3 donut from the over-rated, pretentious Dynamo Donuts any day.

That's because the donuts at Bob's are simply amazing. They're fluffy, tasty, not too greasy, and always fresh. They're especially mouth-watering when they're fresh out of the fryer (mmm...), at which point they practically melt in your mouth. My favorites are the chocolate glazed and apple fritters, although just about everything here is great.

Bonus points for friendly servers, extensive selection, and being open 24 hours (yes, this is a popular perfect post-Polk St. bar crawl destination).

Overall, this place definitely deserves a "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" rating.
author: Joseph F.

description:
I am proud to give my first 5 star rating to Bob's Donut Shop.  They are not culinary masters of French Cuisine nor are they wizards of a fine dining experience.  They make donuts.  They are not JUST donuts, but the BEST donuts I have ever consumed in my life.  Every week for the past year, I make my way to Bob's Donut to pick up their World Famous Apple Fritter.  Bob's Apple Fritter is like an addicting drug that I need to take once a week to get my high.  The best way to eat an Apple Fritter is to throw it in a microwave for 30 seconds until it's warm and soft.  If you want a fresh Apple Fritter, they make them fresh at 2am every morning.  Bob's is open 24 hours, so if you work the graveyard shift or late nights, Bob's will always be there for you.            

When I need to run errands on Polk Street it's impossible to walk by Bob's window without stopping by to get something.  Donuts decorate the front window and call your name until you can't resist any longer.  The staff are really friendly and wave to us when we walk by (that's how often we go!!!).  If you want to find out why Bob's Donuts made the Top 100 things to eat in SF before you die...you need to check it out yourself.
author: Brian S.

description:
3.5 stars. It's pretty good. 

Came early in the morning and the trays of donuts were full.  The place had a nice sugary aroma. Grabbed some donut holes, old fashion, apple pudding and a few other items. It was pretty good.  Although I couldnt distinguish these donuts from ones from another shop, it was fresh, inexpensive and I got good service and sometimes thats all you can ask for,so 3.5 stars.

Just a warning though, I've been here in the afternoons and have seen flies on the donuts at the window. So go early.
author: Dima L.

description: Best donuts in the city in my humble opinion, especially anything old fashioned or cake style! I always get the raspberry buttermilk :)
author: Renée R.

description:
Yummy in my tummy! The donuts are melt in my mouth delicious, especially when they're fresh. My favorites are the apple fritters and old fashion donuts. I'm not sure what their secret is, but they hit the spot every single time. 

The only negative is that Bob's is cash only, but that's to be expected in SF.
author: Kamalpreet K.

description: Wonderful place! The custard filled was perfection--warm donut, cold filling, made right in front of us.  Shout out for the crumb donut, too!  My 6 year old wanted to do the challenge, but settled for donut holes, instead.
author: Nicole A.

description: This place is a haven at 2 a.m. The smell of freshly baked donuts waft out onto the street. I always pick up a maple glazed donut and small milk before heading home after a night out. Yum!
author: Shelley R.

description: Bob's is great! the staff is direct but friendly and amazing at handling drunken crowds.
author: ronda a.

description:
OK, so I got to Bob's Donut just fine, but why couldn't I find it? Oh, because there is a Bob's Diner on Clay St. and Sacramento St. too! 

I looked at Bob's diner on the outside and peeked inside, and didn't see any donuts. This can't be it. I referred back to my iphone navigation again, and Bob's is on Clay St. and Sacramento St. I went back inside Bob's diner, thinking there was a case of donuts way in the back. 

Wrong. It's a tiny diner with no donuts. Was Bob's diner trying to rip off Bob's Donuts by stealing their name? Who was there first??? 

I walk out, check the address, and I am at the wrong place. I went down a few doors, and there was Bob's Donuts! 

I had heard the apple fritters were the best, and it really was! 

Chunks of apples peeking out from the bottom, and nice and fresh (even though it wasn't right out of the fryer) with swirls of cinnamon throughout! 

I also got a blueberry danish was nice and soft with a good amount of blueberry in the center. Very good, but not as good as the apple fritter! 

They had cookies, brownies, fruit filled danishes, and other yummy breakfast treats in the display case. 

Come by Bob's! Just make sure it's the right one!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Brought some Apple Fritters to the office as treats.  One staff member's reaction sums it up ...

(eyes rolls back)  Ah god!  This is sooooo good I want to marry it!!!

Thought I wouldn't go that far.  Husbands shouldn't be eaten like that.  But I think my heart rate just went up THINKING about them fritters.

ouuuuu ... apple fritters ... (in Homer Simpson voice)

Gotta go!
author: Winnie C.

description: It's actually closer to one star... I don't know what happened but the last few times, it just tasted bad oily... like the oil was used too many batches over it's limit. Yep, I came back again several times just to make sure that it was as bad as it was. Sorry, not coming back anymore. The doughnuts were misshapen, tasted like old oil, overly sweet. Has my taste buds aged that much or did they change the recipe for those yummy doughnuts. Anyway, they're nice people, even late at night in a scary neighborhood. I'm glad they have a following.
author: jane f.

description:
Where else in SF can u find fresh donuts after midnight?  The prices are really low (1 big donut the size of a paper plate is only 4.20)  Plus Aya is chill and always brings a smile to your face. 

My favorites are glazed donuts, apple fritters, old fashion chocolate with custard, and the holes...

 I HEART Bob's Donuts
author: Mookey G.

description: I stopped here one afternoon to see what all the fuss was about. There was one person in line in front of me. I ordered a donut. I paid. The staff was so slow, it seemed like the whole transaction took 30 minutes (in reality, it was probably 4-6 minutes). I can only imagine how long it takes to get served when there is a line. The donut was good - a soft glazed twist, but nothing spectacular. Maybe I've been spoiled by Doughnut Plant in NYC.
author: Mike S.

description:
For a fancy, avant-garde flavor combinations that taste good and sound impressive, go to Dynamo Donut.

For delicious, fresh, traditional fried goodness, pay a visit to my friend, Roberto. When you get there (at any hour of the day or night, btw), it's best to just get whatever's freshest. Their maple buttermilk tastes like pancakes. And the staff is always convivial.
author: Bradley T.

description:
WHY the hell did I walk in here that fateful day?  I had passed by so many times before without walking in.  But they finally got me!

You know that saying "You can't want what you don't know"?  (which certainly doesn't apply to everything, as I wanna be hella rich, but I sure as hell don't know what that's about).

Well, I now KNOW these donuts all too well.  My hips know the donuts real well too.  Whenever I'm approaching Polk street on foot, my mind flickers to this donut shop and I....must...resist!

The real nice lady who works here and is a total sweetheart knows that her store is trouble!  When she's getting the donuts, she'll even ask you if you want the "one with sprinkles?"!

Yes ma'am, yes I do.
author: Karen F.

description:
Got a fresh batch of glazed donuts... D-LISH!  Warm, soft, lightly crisped outside, fluffy inside.  Just perfect.  

I'll be back for the others... that includes you mr. apple fritter.

Holding my 5 stars for Doughnut Plant in NYC though.
author: Anh D.

description:
Apple fritter, come to meeeeeeee.

Bob's is best appreciated at 3 in the morning in good company. The fritters are piping hot and fresh out of the deep fryer AND the most colorful people of San Francisco are out and about, which makes it prime time for people watching as well. Yum. No, seriously, yum.
author: Kim C.

description:
These donuts are SO GOOD - so good in fact I gained a few pounds eating them..so I stopped.  I will be back again someday, Bob's - you are too yummy to say goodbye to.

I highly recommend the jelly-filled - incredible!
author: Heidi B.

description: fresh and tasty....like the old fashioned ones!  and asian lady at the store is very funny.
author: Shuting Z.

description: This place was absolutely delicious!! I was visiting San Francisco and kept seeing little donut shops and found this place. The woman in there was very nice and knew a few of the people in there who had a usual order. The pastries and donuts were delicious, a friend and I ordered a box of them and ate them all!! And along with that the price wasn't bad at all. I definitely recommend this place if anyone is around the area.
author: Michelle K.

description: Excellent Donuts! We loved the old fashion maple donuts. Delicious!
author: Daniel-Ray C.

description: Hot, freshly-glazed donuts late night. If they have fresh apple fritters, they're amazing.
author: Sheila S.

description:
Had the apple fritter, plain glaze raised donut, and the maple bar, all cold.

The plain glaze raised donut and the maple bar were standard fare; though I did prefer the less 'bready' softness of the maple bar over the plain glazed.

On the other hand...

The Apple Fritter's consistency was a delicate balance between crisp exterior and fluffy soft interior, all right on mark.  Sweetness wasn't overwhelming; it all kinda just grows on you bite after bite after bite...

Will definitely be exponentially more delicious if had fresh.
author: Chase C.

description: Justine H. has the most brilliant drunken ideas. Immediately after stuffing our faces full of Yuet Lee, Miss Barbie thought she was Homer Simpson and demanded that we get donuts. She kept repeating, "I JUST WANT OOONNNNEEEE DONUT!!!" so off to Bob's we went. A few donuts later, we had offended all of the other customers in the store...all three of them. Anyway, I went home, passed out and woke up feeling super shitty and fat. The sad part is, I don't even remember how the donuts tasted. I'm pretty sure the apple fritter was the size of my head. And I have a HUGE head.
author: Suany W.

description:
Excellent donuts. Oh yum yum.

The donuts are so fresh from the fryer to a rack to your plate.

So fresh they were too hot to eat.
author: Travis L.

description:
Bob's "freakin" Doughnuts, one of the best late night snack stops in SF. Right around 2-2:30AMish the doughnuts are fresh out of the fryer, if you get there on time you can see them getting glazed! 

The doughnuts are good but what makes them great is having them while they're still piping hot - so when you get there order whatever has just been made! If you can though, opt for the Apple Fritter... these are the size of bear paws and are filled with just the right amount of apple to satisfy and if you've just come from a long night out at a club or lounge you might even be able to finish 2. 

The late night staff are also super friendly and are there ready to offer you a smile and a pastry!
author: Nicole L.

description:
It's 2:15 am and you've already had a slice of pizza from Escape from New York--please avoid from immediate judgment. 

You pass the prostitutes coming out of the shop, the post-bar crowd hovering over their cups of coffee, and the homeless man, like you, counting change to buy that old fashioned donut.

$0.95 of pure bliss. Warm. Dense. Divine.  I am a devout old fashioned glazed lover. And even though I take the risk of having my arteries close up for good after a night of drinking/pizza/donut, I ask my friend for a bite of hers too. Breathtaking.

I almost don't know how I lived this long in mediocracy. Bob's Donut, you have raised the bar.
author: Lexi B.

description:
I touch myself thinking about these donuts. 

Hands down, the best place on Earth. 

The people who work there rock as well. What's just as amazing as the donuts is their coffee. It's incredible.

If you have not been to Bob's you have not lived!
author: samantha r.

description: My question is, who goes here and doesn't get a giant doughnut? The cake to glaze ratio is THE BEST. In fact, giant doughnuts should be the new standard and current regular-sized doughnuts should be downgraded to miniature. I'm not kidding.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
FInally got to try Bob's donuts even though I passed by this place a million other times during pub crawls.

I got the apple fritter and donut holes. (Thank you Q.W.!) The donuts holes were light and fluffy and not too sweet. I wish it had more glaze on it but I really liked how they were fluffy and didn't have that nasty oily taste that safeway donuts do.

And my apple fritter was so good! It had nubbins of crunchy ness here and there. Not that greasy. A bit more bread/cake like than nasty OILY like (ie. safeway donuts).  

LOVED IT!!
author: Em F.

description: Hottest, freshest, bestest damn donuts I ever had!
author: Arman A.

description:
I do not understand anyone who caters specifically to drunk people... they're messy, loud, and have diminished taste buds. So tell me why Bob's chooses to make the freshest, best doughnuts at 2am?! 

Call me crazy, but I thought doughnuts were morning-time treats. Why wouldn't you make the best doughnuts in the morning and then leave the stale ones for the drunken masses? It makes no sense to me.

Anyhow, as you've probably guessed, I've never eaten at Bob's drunk. And thus I have realized that they're no better than most other doughnut places. The apple fritter is fine- not a lot of apple, which is nice. But overall, they're highly sugared and bland. If you told me it was from Safeway, I'd probably believe you.

Here's my tip: If you ask what's fresh and she says, "They're all fresh," it means nothing has come out of the fryer in awhile. If she says this to you, I would turn around and walk out. If something is really fresh, she'll be able to name it.

Doughnuts are like french fries... insane when just out of the fryer, but quickly lose their charm. Even the best french fry tastes gross 6 hours after it was fried and this holds true with Bob's Donuts. Maybe they were good once, but I'll never find out unless I come in the wee hours of the morning. Nothing like a stomach bomb at 2am! No thanks.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Bob's donuts are amazing! 

I love their cake donuts and the original glaze. The amount of dough is perfect and the glaze is not over the top sweet so you can eat a couple!

The first time I stepped foot into the little shop was around 1am and the guy was frying the glazed and chocolate donuts. I ordered one of each and WOW! I ended up eating 3.5 donuts that night. =)

Be careful, the smell of the oil does transfer to your clothes when you sit in the shop too long.
author: Milly H.

description: This place is the perfect 24hour donut spot. They have the best ham and cheese croissants I have ever eaten. And their recommendation of the fresh maple buttermilk donuts was just what we needed(they taste like pancakes from heaven).
author: HarleyQuinn L.

description:
I came here for the first time one night as the "sober friend."  One drunk idiot friend got a giant donut (bigger than my head) and sat on the curb for like 20 minutes gnawing on that thing.  Another drunk idiot friend got some maple bars and went M.I.A. in a corner to engage in drunk dialing.  Clearly, neither one of them were in any condition to give me, the Bob's Donut Virgin, any advice on what I should get.  The nice Asian woman at the counter came to my rescue and suggested the famous apple fritter.  That thing was a tanker of a fritter!!!  It was pretty good though, but it didn't give me the kind of foodgasms I was hoping for.  This may be due to the fact that I watched one of the employees pour a bucket of lard-like substance into the deep fryer, and I automatically envisioned my arteries crusting over and closing up.

Then again, this is Bob's Donuts, not Mixt Greens, so the lard should come as no surprise.
author: Christy L.

description:
Food - Their donuts are average. Nothing to go crazy about, but definitely good, especially after a night of drinking.
What sets Bob's apart from the rest is their Apple Fritter. It's definitely worth the hype, and if possible, it's a MUST to get it while it's fresh.

Service - Always someone super nice working the register.

Overall - If it wasn't for their Apple Fritter, this place would get 3 stars...But, with the fact they're open 24 hours, and also with an out-of-this-world Apple Fritter, they deserve 4 stars.
Call and find out when their apple fritters come out of the oven...and go check it out at that time.
author: Farbod D.

description: Poppy doesn't really stay out too late anymore but when she does Bobs is basically the last stop before home.  I can't say they are the most delicious doughnuts ive ever eaten but who can afford to be picky in this neighborhood after midnight?  They savory croissants must be delicious because on the few occasions when I've attempted to purchase one the next morning they are always sold out.
author: Poppy C.

description: Get a fresh out of the fryer still warm apple fritter and your belly will be happy for hours. They are so fluffy, flaky, sticky, apples so tendery, cinammony, sweety and yummy-y!!!
author: Patrick L.

description:
The apple fritters are a must. I've only had them once. I'm not really into sweets. Get them after 1am.

Aya [sp?] is super fun to joke around with.
author: L R.

description:
It's impossible to walk past this shop and not stop to smell these delicious donuts. I have stopped into Bobs a few times to pick up a few donuts to enjoy on a Saturday or Sunday and have been pleased on every visit. My latest trip to Bobs was to cross another tasty treat off the 7x7 top 100 Big eat list... The Apple Fritter... This was delicious!  I am glad I stopped in for the fritter because if it had not been on my list, I would have stuck to my normal choices at the donut shop. 
All in All, this is an ok place. a few homeless people walking around outside, but that shouldn't keep you from enjoying this little treat.
author: Miguel V.

description:
Oh you know, Bob's got my back 24/7 with the sprinkles, the old fashions, the twists and the like. He would never turn his back on me, even at 3 a.m. in the morning when I'm drumbling stunk, I mean, stumbling drunk.

Cuz, you know, there's just nothing quite better than a simple, deep fried maple bar at any time of the day. Morning, afternoon, evening, middle of the night -- I'm good for it, and Bob's good for me.

Bob did surprise me when he had a sex change and turned into a nice old Chinese lady, but you know -- our love is unconditional.
author: Nicole G.

description:
The fact that it's open 24 hours...makes me so happy. And the fact that they're warm at 2 AM and that they are so damn cheap!

The apple fritters really are good. Not TOO sweet so that you can really taste the dough itself, but sweet enough for sure. I think this was the best thing I tasted here.

The Apple Turnover had a shit-ton of sugar on it and wasn't flakey enough...see my favorite Apple Turnovers are the Apple Napples from Zippy's (Napoleon Bakery) in Hawaii (super flakey and buttery!). They were kinda too moist and the dough felt heavy.

The plain buttermilk donut was good but VERY dense. 

The crumble donut was...alright. Probably wasn't fresh enough.

The GLAZED crumble donut though was very good and fluffy inside. Good taste for sure.

But the fritter wins! Next time I want to try the plain old-fashioned!
author: Eryn K.

description: OK I was wasted, came out from Red Devil's Lounge and Wonder Bread 5 told me to go to Bob's Donut to I had to! I HAD TO, OK!! They had to force the Apple Fritter that was a million calories down my throat and it was good! I've actually never been to Bob's so I asked what's your most popular donut and they said the apple fritter. Ok I have to say, I was drunk but to be honest, I kinda had better at other places, sorry.
