I will go back and try other ones! My friend had a very soft one that was like eating a cloud, that was so good! Maybe next time I can add an extra star
author: Karen T.

description:
Supposedly Bob's is home to the best apple fritter in the City. Pretty spot-on. 
My friends (including Marcus L.) and I decided to go on a mini-food adventure in San Francisco to sample some of the places on the 7x7 Top Eat list and picked Bob's as our dessert. We split the first fritter between us and since I just finished a sandwich, I was unimpressed. However, I had another fritter later that night and man, it was delicious! I don't think we got a bum first fritter, I think we just weren't in the mood for it at the time. I wish we could've tried the fritters hot out of the oven, but even cold and half a day old, it's amazing! Make sure to get some milk with it. (:
author: Jen T.

description:
Date/Time: Saturday night - 11:30pm
Occasion: Quick bite dessert
Party of:  Two
Ordered:  Apple fritter
Location: Donut shop...enough said. Parking is a challenge!
Total incl gratuity: $1.60

Holy smokes their apple fritter is good.  This is actually the second visit I've made here...the first time the donut lady said the fritters were sold out and we'd have to make it back after 1:30am for a fresh batch.  After a night of drinking in the Marina, needless to say, we never made it back to Polk Street.  Anyway, this place certainly earned it's spot on the top 100 things you must eat in SF before you die.
author: Jess C.

description:
I would be remiss, nay, the sweat from drunk bum's butt if I didn't show a lil' Yelp love to Bob's. It's long overdue!

They've got everything you want and need, and they're open 24/7!! You can't beat that with a stick. The guys are always so friendly there, especially putting up with the nonsense from 3am clubbers. I actually feel sorry for them sometimes.

Everyone is like, "Bob's has the best doughnuts! Bob's has the best donuts!" They're pretty damn good, but I don't know if I'd say they're the best. One thing I do know is true, without question, is that Bob's is the best place to get donuts from. Truly this Bob must be a great man.

More than just donuts, it's coffee, muffins, and cookies, among other things. All of it tasty as hell. I want so badly to find this Bob guy, but I've been told, "You don't find Bob, he finds you."

If you're ever in that part of town, show Bob's Doughnuts some love, they do great shit. xD
author: Shirrod R.

description:
Bob's apple cobbler:  Complete and total fruitfillment.

Even better, take it home and throw some ice cream on top.
author: Andy B.

description:
I probably haven't had a donut since 98'...back in the day when I worked for a family owned - to die for - donut shop. Nothing was the same after good ol' Ma's Donuts :)

So...after plenty of Polk Street shennanigans, I had the infamous honey glazed donut and my oh my was I impressed. After already making plenty of bad decisions that night, what a perfect way to top it off with a boat load of calories :) 

Delightful. Delicious...and worth it!
author: Charlene A.

description:
Planned our SF trip around ths shop, after all the raves about it on yelp, we had to check it out right?! 

Not going to lie, this place knows their donuts, we spend about 20 bucks on donuts, 20 bucks!!!! Who does that? (considering the average person spends a dollar) haha but we had to try everything..

I mean they were alll delicious, the apple fritter was good too. But they tasted like average yummy donuts. I mean you can't really screw up donuts, there wasn't excately the WOW factor I expected but hey if you're in the are why not.

If I wanted donuts, the shop down my street does the same job. But the window display here will get you for sure!! oh yeah parking was a toughie, but it is SF, we parked a few streets away and walked which is probably a better idea to burn off those calories after!!
author: Diane P.

description: I had a plain cake donut, as they're the best and if anyone will argue with me, I will fight them. That's no lie. This place had a very good plain cake donut. I will go back to once again get this plain cake donut. I feel it's pretty hard to mess up a plain cake donut but nonetheless I now trust Bob's as a tasty donut joint and will go back there/recommend it. The inside reminds me of being back in the midwest (my mother land) as well, so that was an added bonus. Hurrah for donuts and the midwest!
author: Amy S.

description:
Reasons why Bob's Donut is my new favorite place to grab a fatty, ooey-gooey doughnut:

1. Chances are - your donut is still going to be warm, or in my case, piping hot! 
2. Open 24 Hours. Yep - That's important, as I'm most likely to eat donuts at god awful hours.
3. Really friendly service
4. Cheap, and in the good way! You won't see any hipster, $3 donuts here. 
5. Best apple fritter around - I think what makes their fritter so good is the thickness. You still get the crispy edges, but there's also some fluffy, doughy areas too. And, of course, a perfect ration of apple and cinnamon to icing.
6. Portion size. The fritter was a perfect size: not small by any means, but not the behemoth sized fritters you'll see at other places.
author: Amanda D.

description: The apple fritter...the fresh glazed donuts...the plain cake donuts...the chocolate glaze...i mean I could just go on listing donuts, but you get it. It's all amazing, amazingly cheap- seriously the best donut in the city. I've had some of the artisanal donuts in the mission and while I love everything artisianl, bob's is still #1.
author: Edmundo C.

description: Just had the apple fritter which was delicious. I know next time that I've got to call ahead to order one of the giant donuts. If you're driving don't forget to bring a lot of quarters with you.
author: Daniel R.

description: If you're looking for one of those newfangled doughnuts the size of a large muffin and in hip flavors like lavender and Earl Grey, then this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for the classic, tasty American breakfast treat, then make tracks to Bob's. It is a modest establishment but they have a huge selection of the standards - - chocolate glazed, buttermilk, crumb, old-fashioned, maple, apple fritters, etc. And they are delicious, with just the right texture and flavor. Definitely not like Krispy Kreme, which I find to be waaay too sweet, greasy, and smooshy. I love doughnuts and Bob's is my go to shop.
author: Holly H.

description:
Walked over to Bob's after dinner to see what all the hype was about.  The inside of the place does smell delectable, so we ordered the obligatory apple fritter and asked the shop worker if there was anything else that just came out fresh from the fryer?  She proceeded to recommend the chocolate covered old fashioned.

The old fashioned was really good - not hot but definitely fresh.  The apple fritter was just so-so, I suspect it would have been way better if we had a hot one.  Although there wasn't an iota of apple in sight, and I took about 3 big bites before I gave up.  

2 donuts for $2.40 is not as cheap as Krispy Kreme (who gives hot samples off of the glazing line).  To be honest, I'm not sure why this is on the 7x7 list, there is hardly a donut around that doesn't taste damn good just out of the fryer and covered in icing.
author: Burrito M.

description: Mmm nothing like a fritter so fresh out of the fryer, oil drools down your face as you take your first bite. Doughy, crunchy in the right spots, not too sweet, obviously a tad too oily. Knocked off a star for relatively high prices IMO.. but OPEN 24 HOURS!! Definitely a place I keep in mind for a sugar fix in the middle of the night.
author: Nicole L.

description: The fritter's such a hitter I would eat it on the shitter. Word up.
author: Trav W.

description:
As my friends and I were walking out of the My Life with the Thrill Kill Kult show at the Red Devil Lounge a few weeks ago, one of them mentioned that she really wanted a shower. I then commented that what I really wanted was a pastry... At which point we looked to our right and realized we were standing next to a donut shop which was still open.

We walked in and were greeted by a nice man who informed us that he'd just finished whipping up a batch of crullers... Which turned out to be the best I've ever had. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, fresh and warm and delicious. I didn't know a donut could melt in my mouth until I had one of those. 

I don't know which is better: the fact that their donuts are amazing, or the fact that I can get them whenever I want.
author: Kathleen P.

description:
If ever a friend suggests taking a stroll down Polk St to go for some donuts, don't question or complain, no matter how lazy you feel, how full you already are, or how cold and windy it is outside late at night. Just do it. Because when you sink your teeth into a buttermilk donut fresh out of the fryer, you'll never deny yourself another trip to Bob's ever again.

Suggestion: Go late at night and get whatever's on the cooling rack--the donut will be crispy with glaze on the outside and hot and fluffy on the inside. Great mouthfeel. The donuts stay fresh in the fridge until the morning, so take some to go and save for breakfast!
author: Frances S.

description: Super awesome donut place strategically placed for all the drunkards of San Francisco to soak up all that alcohol with sugary sweet donuts.  We went here and grabbed a chocolate croissant, which was pretty much the most amazing chocolate croissant I've ever had in my life.  It was still warm - amazing.  I will say though, I have had them when they aren't so fresh, and while they are still good, they aren't as amazing.
author: Jenna L.

description:
7x7's Big Eat SF list got it wrong...the standout here is not the apple fritter.  It's the HUMONGOUS DONUT!!!  I get really amped whenever I get my hands on a glazed, raised donut so I was going bonkers when I got my hands on this gigantic golden ring of goodness.  I thought I'd have to sacrifice some taste for the size, but I was completely wrong - it was amazing!  

In the future I think I'll get an old fashioned donut, a maple bar and maybe a strawberry crueller...to go with my HUMONGOUS DONUT!  

Also, I like the idea of saying you'll bring a box of donut to work and showing up with this wamma jamma.
author: Krystle S.

description:
This place rocks! The donuts are so fresh! Go on a Friday/Saturday night around one or two am when they are making fresh warm donuts, right out of the fryer! 
I will miss this place now that I left SF.
author: Connie P.

description: My favourite donut place in the whole wide world and I LOVE DONUTS especially at Bob's late at night.  I love you donuts.
author: Suz L.

description: Bob's is the best donut place I've tried in the city.  They're open late, and they continue to make fresh batches... which means you can get a fresh warm donut (or a dozen) on your way home from the Polk Street bars.  Try the apple fritter!
author: Michelle F.

description: Got the Apple fritters here after dinner down on Polk St. $1.75 for dessert? I am soooo here!! I wish it was a bit warmer but would not complain considering it was past 9:00 pm at night. Fully stocked with milk for the perfect dessert combination. YUM!!
author: Christina L.

description:
1. Donuts are amazing, especially when fresh.
2. Incredibly inexpensive.
3. Open really late.

and most importantly

4. The most unbelievably satiating thing you can eat while walking home from the bars drunkenly.
author: Glenn J.

description: Yummy donuts, but not the best. I had the apple fritter, glazed, and some other specialty donut. All were good, but the fritter was pretty amazing. I'm a huge donut lover and these were pretty satisfying late at night.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Open 24 hours, awesome range of donuts / shortbread cookies etc., and fresh eats late at night (they cook all night long). Whats not to like?

Love their chocolate shortbread and buttermilk dounuts!

Its cash only, so go loaded!
author: Sumit C.

description:
Best donuts Ive ever had...I think
Open all hours, everything I tried was fresh, and good.
Chocolate croissant+great
maple twist=great
bear claw=great
bread pudding=great, and a deal $2 for what felt like 2lbs of it
author: KELLEY C.

description: I searched out this place, because of all of the great reviews. While the donuts are definitely good, I didn't think that they were anything out of the ordinary. (Certainly not worth the half-hour or more I spent trying to find a parking space, nearby.) If you want a real donut, you gotta go to Dunkin' Donuts. Except that the 3,000 mile plane ride is gonna make that kinda difficult.
author: Steven P.

description: NOTE TO DONUTS LOVERS - fresh outta the frier time is 11pm. This is according to the lady that works there - and I tested the timing out a couple nights...on weekends and non-weekends. YUM.
author: Katy A.

description:
Okay, so SF may have more late night places than I original thought.  Oh how I regret that I was wrong.  

It's past 12 a.m.  I need something sweet.  I find Bob's Donuts (not Bob's Broiler which is several doors down) via Yelp.  Yelp, you are the best thing AND the worst thing to happen to me.

So, I had a freshly cooked donut, still piping hot...and several donut holes...and 1/2 of a bread pudding...and a hot chocolate...and then I waited 45 minutes for a fresh apple fritter...yes, I am a glutton with no sense of self-control.

I liked what I had.  I don't know if it's the absolute best, but very good.  The lady behind the counter was super nice and it's just a great place for late night eats.

By the by, if I don't yelp again in 24 hours, someone please call an ambulance.
author: Bob C.

description:
Let's start with the best part of this place: 24 hours. Can't beat fresh donuts after a night of drinking! 

This place is popular but I didn't think their donuts were something out of the ordinary. We got glazed, sprinkles, and a ham-&-cheese croissant. What makes this place special was that their donuts were FRESH and still warm from the fryer.

You know you're in the right place when there's a line out the door and you smell something fragrant! When you finally get in and order, the place is literally a hole in the wall, smoky air from the fryer, and very few seats. Is all this worth the wait? Absolutely.
author: Joel S.

description: I don't get the hype. Bob's was in my "go-to" list during my recent trip to san francisco. We came here at 11PM and there was a line. I believe my boyfriend had the crumble cake donut and i had the glazed donut. the donuts were not memorable at all and i left disappointed. I guess I expected much from this donut joint?
author: Krisleen N.

description: Great place for donuts. Really really good donuts. And good service as well. Highly recommended
author: Brian S.

description:
THE BEST DONUTS I HAVE EVER TASTED!

I went at night at around 10pm where they would be baking fresh donuts and I went in with low expectations so I just got a glazed donut first (only 85 cents!) and just with the first bite I was in HEAVEN. Their donut is so stuff and delicious it is just so hard to explain. I'm really curious now as to how they make their donuts but I gotta say the best one were their Apple Fritters ($1.60!) and they are really big apple fritters and they were still warm and oh my goshhhhh they were to die for! Because I loved them so much that I brought some more home and even though they're not as fresh anymore they were still EXCELLENT after just one night. As with all pastries these donuts taste best most likely within 18 hours of baking so if you really want the best of the best, go during the night when they will be baking them :] I definitely wanna go again and try the other donuts!

The place is pretty small and I dined there first with my donut and it wasn't bad. You just definitely can't bring a big group of friends to dine there, only four people max to be comfortable.

The lady who took my order too was super nice and friendly. It was just overall a great experience and I'm glad my friend brought me here :]
author: Kristine W.

description:
Not sure what all the hype is on the apple fritter.. Although decent, it definitely wasn't the best I've had. Did I not get it at the right time? I thought a 9am trip on a Sunday would be a great time to go but it possibly wasn't for these. It didn't taste fresh at all.

However, what I did enjoy were the little clouds of heaven I received.. Aka the glazed donut and crumb donut. Oh. My. Gawwwwd!! They were seriously out of this damn world. So light, fluffy, warm and delicious. I could literally eat a box of them in one sitting.

Thus, screw the apple fritter.. Go for the glazed and crumb donuts!! I will be back for them fooorsuuuuree!
author: Tay R.

description:
One of these days, when I'm feeling particularly brave or insane, I'm going to tackle that huge five pound glazed donut in the window. For now, I'm going to stick to the apple fritters and regular sized glazed donuts at midnight. 

The funnest part of going to Bob's is seeing the seedy ass characters sitting in the corner stool (sometimes they're funny, sometimes they're scary and sometimes they're smoking a cigarette!) The nice Chinese lady behind the counter is always very nice to them & seems unfazed by their lack of showering skills.

Prices can't be beat- i never spend more than $2 or $3 bucks here. My BFF loves this place & insists we stop by whenever we are in the area (like after having dinner at Shalimar.) It doesn't take much to convince me to go. And I love how late at night, there is always parking right in front.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I liked the master-donut chef who put on a little show for us, cranking out a few donuts and showing off his giant donut creations. The donuts themselves tasted light and very buttery. 

Very good quality and the layout is almost diner like with bar stools and small tables in a narrow location.

I live nearby and this is a great spot for a morning or late night donut.
author: Nelson C.

description:
Ah, I see what you guys mean about their apple fritters. Well done Yelpers!

(there was a tray of freshly made fritters past 2am and it was too hot too handle and that's the best part of it all)
author: kristin e.

description:
Is the reason this place is rated so high because its open late and all the reviewers were drunk when they ate here? I came here after a night of Kozy Car and hookah lounge next door and I was a little disapointed. I wasnt super drunk and I could tell right away that the chocolate old fashion that I got tasted pretty stale. Even my friends jelly donut tasted old.

Maybe I need to come here in the early morning when the donuts are fresh or when I am sh!t faced and ready to eat.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Wow.  The apple fritters here are incredible, but you probably already knew that.  Crisp glazing outside.  Soft, warm inside.  Chunks of apple scattered about.  I don't exactly know the definition of "fritter", but I'm guessing if I looked it up, there'd be a picture of one these bad boys.

Ready your dollar sixty and do yourself a favor - wait for a hot, fresh batch.  Nothing beats the warm gooey goodness of a fresh one.  Oh yeah, don't come here with a full bladder or plastic.  They don't have public restrooms, and they only take cash.
author: Michael C.

description: Mmmmmmm...that's all I could say when I first bit into these marvelous donuts. The dough is perfect. Its not too sweet so it perfectly compliments the sugary glaze. Definitely the best donut I've ever had.
author: Andrew H.

description:
It's hard to say enough good things about this place.  They're open 24 hours, and it's the perfect spot to hang out after a night of moderate-heavy drinking.

Get whatever's freshest, and you won't be disappointed.  If you're lucky you'll be there to see staffers plop fresh made dough into the fryer.  The buttermilk donuts and the apple fritters are my personal favorite, but the fruit bars are also a great choice.
author: Carlin E.

description: Its 4AM. You roam the streets accompanied by a gaggle of fun friends that are losing energy...and fast. The night has been fun. Perhaps too fun. The thing that could make the difference between smiling on the way home and hunger harshing your mellow is a doughnut. Drag everyone over tot Bob's doughnuts. You will not be sorry. The characters are all over the place, so be prepared for SF's finest, but the doughnuts will serve you well.
author: Mo A.

description: I crave donuts like, never.  All the spots always seem to under-deliver and I'd rather spend the calories elsewhere.  One rare occasion needing to get my donut on, I found Bob's on Yelp.  I remember seeing it before and it looked legit: open bake racks, windows displaying the goods with pride.  I'm in. The parking was tough, but worth it.  The crumb-cake (end of the window) dough-dizzinut?  Holy Shhhhhhniekies!  Get one, no, get 2 - f' it - 3!  I got home and 2 things I noticed:  1. still warm  2.  no greasy bag.  Wow..  Reaching in, that donut was so chewy, i needed both hands to break it apart.  Smiling as i took a much deserved bite, i thought, "OH HELL TO THE NO!!!". This might be the best I ever had.  Damn You Bob's, now I have to run another hour every week!  Worth it.  "Utah...Gimme 2!!!"
author: Sanford S.

description: I went in the afternoon and the donuts had just been made fresh. Had an old fashioned and a jelly and it was SO good. The cake donut wasn't that great but that didn't detract from the warm crispy deep fried goodness of the rest.  The staff was super nice too.
author: Tame P.

description:
Dude.  I had no idea this place was so popular.  I ended up here late one night, hungry and craving for some donuts.  I just looked for the freshest, warmest looking batch and asked for one of those.  It was a croissant and it was delicious.

So delicious that a few weeks later I went back for more.  The place is usually crowded when the treats are fresh.  If you go any other time, they have a little microwave for you to heat up the pastry just a bit.
author: Linda T.

description: F. Scott Fitzgerald once said something along the lines of it's always 3 a.m. in the darkest night of the soul. To paraphrase Fitzgerald, I think it's always 2 a.m in the deepest pit of the stomach. What is it that makes all food taste so good at 2 a.m.? And the worse it is for you, the better it tastes. (Willpower, however, is nowhere to be seen after 8 p.m.) Bob's is the perfect place to satisfy your stomach's inner demons in the middle of the night. I'm not even the biggest donut fan. Don't get me wrong, I love fat and sugar; I just prefer them in cookie and cake form. But fresh, piping hot Bob's donuts at two in the morning when the bars close? Perfect.
author: Susan S.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!  It's open 24hr!!!  WT...if I could eat donuts from this place all day every day without looking like a donut then I would!!  Sadly I have to limit my donut intake.

They have this apple bread pudding that is the bomb so I hear...I didn't actually get to sample as someone scarfed it down before I could even blink -ok maybe it was more bc I was too busy eating the glazed something donut to notice the apple bread pudding disappear -anyhow go here for donuts!!!

wonder when they will combine bacon and donuts together?  if they do that then fo sho I would risk looking like a donut and eat donuts all day every day!!!
author: Mao K.

description:
Apple Fritters! Yummy! Real big chunks of apples inside. Tastes delicious warm. :)

The smell here is intoxicating. Last time I was here, I got the male glazed donut at 3am. YUM.
author: Carol L.

description:
Maple Glazed. Holy Heaven. I don't believe in any gods but I believe in these doughnuts. They are real, you can see them, taste them, feel them. Apple fritter? Amen. Maple Custard filled? I'm a believer baby. Bob's, if loving you is wrong, I don't wanna be right. This NY boy has found love.

I just happened to stroll by last night on my way to Bigfoot Bar and the smell completely intoxicated me. I have a houndogs nose for Mapley goodness and I was hot on the trail! These babies just came out of the oven....unreal. The awesome guy Andrew just watched me eat it and smiled. "How fuckin' good is that dude?" I was speechless. 

When I returned for 2nds after the bar closed, Andrew gave me a chocolate frosted, raspberry filled. He claims they make ONLY 2 of these a night. I had #2 appearantly. Wow. 

Self control is almost impossible here. Tread carefully, but tread nonetheless. You will believe in the power of a handcrafted doughnut.

Amen.
author: Michael P.

description: It was okay. I had a regular donut, maple glaze donut, and the fritter everyone talks about. Maybe because it wasn't fresh (I came in the middle of the day) but I just thought it was okay.
author: Leily P.

description: Oh Bob's, how I miss you.  I wish we weren't so far from each other.  I look forward to the next time we meet.  Can't wait!
author: Jessica R.

description: I cross the street just to smell the donuts in this place. Once in awhile, I'll let myself indulge. And it's heaven, even if you're not a huge donut fan!
author: Amy L.

description: Donuts are fantastic! I purchased an assortment of 3 dozen donuts, including some of the premium/large donuts for a staff appreciation event today. $50 for 48 donuts isn't bad in my book and the feedback so far is great. Everyone is loving these donuts!
author: Andria W.

description:
I would have given Bob's a 4-star review because I'm trying to be more discriminating but the recent Dynamo Doughnut debacle is still fresh in my mind so I'm upping Bob to five stars because he knows what a delicious doughnut is all about and isn't all uppity and fancy like Dynamo. 

I went to Bob's for the apple fritters because they're on the list of 100 things to try in SF before you die but I'm not a big fritter fan so I wasn't expecting much and really just went to cross #80 off the list. My dad and sister-in-laws, however, are HUGE fritter fans so I figured they'd be able to give me an accurate review. 

The gist:

* It's not the big BOB'S something-or-other on the corner...it's a few doors further up the street. 

* The lady in there really is as nice and friendly as the other reviews say she is.

* I ate part of a fritter and it was, indeed, a fritter. The other doughnuts I picked were much more my speed and were really, really good. 

* My pregnant sister-in-law texted me the next day to tell me that she just polished off her fritter, that it was delicious, and that the baby was doing sugar-high-induced jumping jacks in her belly.

* If someone asked me to pick up a dozen doughnuts for whatever reason, I'd totally go back to Bob's.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Very good donuts, and friendly service.  Before you go into the store stand outside and look into the window as this is where all the donuts are.  This way when you go in you will know exactly what you want.  The only complaint I have is that it is full of homeless people both times I went.
author: Frank E.

description: Awesome doughnut shop!!! Great selection, great service and great flavor.
author: Jesse M.

description: Andrew is the man! Came here late last night and was going to order a donut from the window. Instead, Andrew suggested I take one of the fresh chocolate ones, and being the sprinkle lover that I am, he added sprinkles for me! Not a difficult task, but it was the thought that counted. Enjoyed the delicious warmth and gooiness of the chocolate sprinke donut as I walked home :) I will be back!
author: Jenna O.

description:
THE BEST donuts in SF

Tip: go around 12 or 1am and they are making a variety of fresh donuts right in front of you. 

Added bonus to making a late night/early morning visit: the old creepy bearded guy in a leather jacket who NEVER EVER leaves...& pimps rolling round on Polk St. picking up their money... (-; adds to the ambiance (lol)
author: Monica T.

description:
1:00 am on a typical Saturday night. I just came from Sip Lounge... I tell the boyfriend that I was hungry and I wanted to complete more of the 7x7 100 things to eat before you die... Bob's Donuts seemed to be the best bet and my girl Anne A. told me they are usually fresh after hours.

I head there and ask for an Apple Fritter and was sadly informed that it wasn't available for another 20 minutes... my slightly drunken form said to wait for a fresh one... so I curb the appetite by getting a regular glazed. 

This ain't your typical Krispy Creme Donut. This is deliciousness at it's finest. The doughy interior with a sweet, crispy exterior in its warmth was divine.  So divine, I got an additional 6 donut holes and coffee.

Then I was thoroughly entertained for the next 25 minutes watching the donut man (who I dubbed Bob) go through his process of donut making. Kid you not, I saw him make at least 100 donuts. From the fryer, to the kitchen to fetch more donuts, to glazing the donuts, crumbing the donuts, chocolate glazing donuts, flipping the donuts, then doing the process in an seamless fashion. I was in shock and awe and enjoyed my front row view from the counter top.  Screw the conveyor belt, Bob made his donuts with love! 

And finally, he brought out cinnamon rolls and apple fritters. He kept those bad boys on the fryer longer than the other donuts and I started questioning his craft as he continued to neglect the frying goodness and tend to the HUGE donuts and chocolate or maple covered donuts. I got nervous that I'd have a failed, burned apple fritter. But the boyfriend told me to trust and so 5 minutes later, I had a fresh apple fritter in the bag.

I'm no Apple Fritter fan... but Trust. This pastry is amazing, especially fresh, and especially after a night of drinking. The crispiness on the outside complimented the soft, gooey apple cinnamon goodness on the inside. The boyfriend and I enjoyed it til the very last bite.
author: Alyson C.

description: Confession:  I have Bob Donut's on speed dial.  I'll give them a call before heading out on Polk Street to ask when the apple fritters are going to be ready.  The lady there must think I am a lunatic... I sometimes think I am a lunatic!  But yes, I plan my friday night around these fritters.... they are that damn good.
author: Clarissa P.

description:
This place is absolute crack. 

I tried this apple bread pudding concoction as recommended by the little Asian lady who works there. She told me "DO NOT eat this without heating up and adding vanilla ice cream. If you do, you will be robbing yourself".

Oh how right you were, little Asian lady. You are the munchie magician and I am a failure. Even though it tasted AMAZING, I can see why you said to add the ice cream and heat it up. Well played, ma'am, well played.

In addition to the bread pudding, I also tried their BIG donut, which one of my friends ordered, and a couple of their assorted donuts.

Everything... was... heavenly caloric comforting goodness. 

Oh little Asian lady, you make amazing food. I will be crying in my Cheerios everyday till we meet again.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Warm.  Cinnamon Sugar.  Crispy on the Outside.  Soft and Perfect on the Inside.  Guilty Pleasure Late Eve One Night.  Please.  Please.  Don't.  Let Me.  Go Back.

;)
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description:
I guess if you HAVE to have a donut, this would be the place to go.

Fuck all that trendy Krispy Kreme nonsense.  Is America not fat enough that we have to glaze the whole donut??

Bob's keeps it real and reminds me of the pre-KrispyKreme California that I used to know and love.

I once got yelled at by a pimp outside this place.  Yes, the street pimp scene has moved north.

I guess the Tenderloin cops must be cracking down, because all that crap that used to be isolated below California has moved North.  I guess if you're at Bob's during the late night hours, there might be some added scenery.

My advice is to visit Bob's early and go for anything resembling an old-fashioned diet killer :)
author: Justin C.

description: I guess I'm just not feeling the hype associated with this place. The fresh donuts I've tried and the apple fritters are pretty good, quite satisfying and sweet. I've also had a chocolate old-fashioned from here which as alright, but I've definitely had better. Although I don't love the donuts and pastries here like seemingly everyone else, I'm sure I'll probably find myself stumbling in here a few more times during the very late evening hours and watching the characters of Polk Street pass by.
author: Erich D.

description:
I went to Bob's this morning with high expectations and unfortunately, it didn't meet them.  You have keep in mind that I grew up with Lou's Donuts in San Jose ... at least 1 or 2 a week for my entire childhood, so I have a pretty high donut standard.

The apple fritter was very good, the chocolate raised was ok and the crueler (sp?) was good.  I suppose I may be caught up this week in the novelty of my recent discovery of Dynamo (spiced chocolate and bacon maple) that Bob's was just too regular!

I would go here again for an apple fritter, maybe in a week where I didn't already make 3 donut shop stops!
author: Rod C.

description: 1AM stumbling home from the bars, Bob's sets a trap: cake-sized donuts, a perfect size for you and all your friends, and you're without the willpower to say no. Pure evil marketing genius.
author: Trevor H.

description:
Bob's has been on Polk forever!  

I use to buy donuts and pastries here as a kid when I lived in the area in the 60's and still do so now after all these years.  Can't imagine giving any donut shop 5 Stars, but the donuts and pastries here are fine and certainly deserve at least 3 stars. 

I usually buy a  custard snail. one of the combo jelly snails or a couple glazed donuts.  I was not too happy when Bob's reduced the size of the snails earlier this year, but kept the price the same.  Didn't notice a significant drop in size of the donuts, but it was obvious in the pastries.  Should take away a star for that, but they're still tasty. So, 3 Stars it is.

A few locals have coffee w/their donuts at the counter, but makes more sense to buy your donuts to go and to eat them w/the better coffee available at Royal Ground a few doors, which also has free wireless service available, but doesn't sell any donuts.
author: Martin C.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 5/5
Price: $
Portions: 5/5
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5
Overall: 4/5

WHEN YOU HAVE IT FRRRRRESH, YOU'LL KNOW WHAT I MEEEEAN. EVERYTIME I CAME (which usually round 12am-3am) WAS A VERY FRIENDLY KOREAN LADY WHO HELPS ME, SHE MADE MY FIRST VISIT VERY WARM. I CAME TO THIS PLACE 3x SO FAR =)
author: Eva H.

description:
i'm not impressed.

how about them apples, bob? 

i got the apple fritter because everyone and their mothers, mothers were raving about it.  it was seriously a big, sugary, crunchy, oily piece of dough.  i tasted grease, sugar, and nothing else.  what a way to waste my caloric intake.

got the crumb cake donut too.  i've had better and less greasy ones.  meh.
author: Sally T.

description:
Bob's is a no frills throwback to the trucker diner. Coffee, donuts. Popular for its simplicity, but in simplicity comes execution. Does Bob's succeed? Well I only had a cookie.

The selection at Bob's should please most. They've got a wide selection of donuts displayed in their window, cookies and pastries in a glass cabinet, and coffee on in the back. I wasn't intending on buying anything unless it looked especially indulgent. The donuts looked kinda stale but the cookies had a certain sheen to them I couldn't resist.

I opted for a raisin oatmeal cookie ($.99). It was alright. Visually it's a winner. I couldn't tell the difference between this and a packaged one.

I don't know if this warrants a return. I get the feeling this place is loved by locals who don't have anywhere else to turn to; although, I can see why many would love the simplicity of small town donutry.
author: Michael H.

description:
Came here at around 11 pm and Bob (ok the guy's probably not really Bob, but I like to pretend that he is) was busy making his crumb, chocolate, and maple covered donuts in the front of the shop. I ordered a glazed donut with two lines of strawberry jelly drizzled to resemble a cross on top. It was still warm. Crispy and sweet on the outside, moist and flaky on the inside. It was the best non-chain (aka non krispy kreme) donut I had ever had. It was perfect.

The inside of the shop is exactly what a traditional blue collar donut shop should be like: a quasi-wood counter with built-in stools and a flat screen tv in the corner that plays 70's music compilation infomercials. I could sit there for hours (and by hours i mean until the infomercial ends and the hits stop comin'). 

I may be a little biased and misled since I DID go right when the donuts were made fresh, but chances are, the next time I have a donut it will probably be around the same time. At least this shows that they make a fresh batch of donuts every night.
author: Will T.

description:
I feel so bad.  I cheated.

Seduced, I succumbed to the hype and strayed from my normal chocolate old fashioned to try their apple fritter.

I think I found a new doughy, fried love.

I didn't think it was possible for an apple fritter to taste as delicious as Bob's, but I was wrong.  How it's possible for a fried piece of dough to taste so greaseless is beyond me.  There was no oily aftertaste, so it wasn't as if the glaze had masked it.  All I tasted was cinnamon, apples and sugary glaze encased in a nice, fluffy, chewy dough.  Oh, how I want to go at 2am to get a fresh one right out of the fryer!!
author: Janet L.

description:
i came here once around 2 am and absolutely loved it.

maybe because i was super hungry. or maybe super tired. or super tired of spending tons of money. or wanted to go somewhere inside instead of standing out in the cold bay area weather.

regardless, i got a hot old fashioned donut dipped in chocolate. and a milk.

it was amazing. not as good as krispy kreme, but really REALLY good nonetheless.
author: Mathew K.

description:
Okay, if the drag show down the street at Cinch happens to feature over 60 drag queens, just theoretically, reboot the night at Bobs! The frisbee-sized chocolate glazed monstrosity I shared with 3 friends and a number of strangers (get a fork) completely redeemed the night and is fueling not only this review but also a few CL Missed Connections. 
I am a donut fiend, and there are no more words to describe them.
author: Julie B.

description:
There is nothing like Bob's donuts fresh out of the fryer. I actually don't like really sweet pastries, so I stick with the original glazed and the donut balls. The apple fritter is a bit much. They fry most of their donuts late at night, so come then to ask nicely for their freshest batch. In the mornings, the donuts are cold, but you can pop them in the microwave for 5-10 seconds there to heat them right up.

It's open 24 hours, but I wouldn't mind going there any time! I love how light and airy their dough is. I can eat a bunch but not feel completely bloated like at other places. It's also super cheap!!!

Let me tell you, there is nothing better than a cup of ice cold Contraband coffe and a bag of donut holes from Bob's donuts to start off your Saturday. I also had big ambitions to do this every morning before work until I realized that a donut a day is probably not the best of ideas...
author: Amy W.

description: Bob's Donut, is all right. This shop has no frills, but the products are tasty. I had a chocolate old-fashioned donut that was great. I'd stop through again for sure.
author: Erik S.

description:
I'm pissed off at myself for not going to Bob's on National Donut Day- which is apparently the first Friday of June.  

I ended up going on Saturday instead.   

We stopped by at around 11pm and the donut maker dude was just putting the finishing touches on those glazed cake donuts sprinkled with peanuts.   Man,  those suckers are fantastic warm and freshly sprinkled!

We sat outside on the bench adjacent to the bus stop in front of Bob's and noshed on our donuts while partaking in coffee(which kept me up all night) watching the inebriated walking on Polk Street.
author: Randal P.

description:
we asked, "what should we order?"
he said, "whatever just came out of the fryer."
i said, "what did?"
he listed 3 things. 
i said, "how about this one?" *points to something in display case that he didn't list*
he said, "trust me. you want the fresh ones."

BEST ADVICE EVER. someone give this man an award.
author: Spring L.

description: I loathe to admit my love for apple fritters. Bob's apple fritter was heavenly as a mid-afternoon snack. I cannot imagine how good they are fresh at 2am after a long night of drinking. Ah sweet indulgence...
author: Emily C.

description:
To satify my late night sweet tooth and the best spot to get an apple fritter in the bay is BOB's donuts! 

They are open late night. Parking could be challeging on some nights so it might be best if someone drives you there while you run in and grab the fresh, hot bad for you, but yummy fritter!

They also have glazed sugar donuts bigger than the size of shrek's head!  Of course I would never attempt to eat one of those, but I'd like to see someone that would.
author: Stacie T.

description:
Only eat when drunk.

The donuts were small, expensive and not all that great. Decent but just that. Nothing worth making a fuss over. I live further down the hill, closer to Union so it definitely wasn't worth the trip.

Open late, so more for the late night drunchies.
author: Sloane W.

description: Make sure you know which donuts have been made fresh before you pick what you're having.  There was a BIG difference in how good the donuts were.  That being said, if you're craving some good donuts and you pick ones that were made recently you really can't go wrong with Bob's.
author: Peter H.

description: The freshly made hot APPLE FRITTERS at 2 in the morning really fucking hit the spot...like woaaah. NOMS. Don't talk to me. I'm eating... ;)
author: Denise L.

description:
The boston cream long john donut is good because a) the cream is nice and light and b) they apply the cream like slatherin mayo on a sammich versus just a little blob somewher in the center.  

The apple fritter wasn't available on our first visit - we went late in the day and they were sold out :( - BUT we were victorious on our second visit (saturday, late AM).  It was DEELISHUSS!!

Thumbs up for the glazed old fashioned and bars as well as the choc sprinkle!  Yummmmmy!

The Azn lady working the counter was very friendly too!
author: Emily W.

description:
ONLINE PETITION

Dear Bob's,

We, the undersigned, ask that you cease 24/7 operations and conduct business during normal daylight hours in such a manner that my drunken self can't score a bag of fresh donuts for an affordable price at 3 am in the morning...

We ask that you reconsider your hours for the sake of the children and my sex life and puppies everywhere.

Warmest Regards,

My Growing Ass
author: Keane L.

description:
I am too old for this shiznit.
The smit, the heart-crushing, the army of butterflies which have been recently put back into active duty who threaten to fly out my mouth whenever I speak and the stupidity which goes along with when you meet someone who makes your stomach turn over and over and over and over again in a nauseating flip-flop spectacle of hormonal rush gymnastics...

How it seems that your brain (which you have spent multiples of tens-of-thousands of dollars to train into a razor sharp instrument of sarcastic wit and killer business instinct) has leaked out your ear into a puddle of goo on the ground in between you and your crush's shoes as you stand there going "Gah, gah... durrrr... me Kaaatee... youuu Crusshh... gaaahhh..."

I am TOO old to get so tongue tied in front of *some guy* that I can barely utter my own name or remember what city I am in... to turn fourteen shades of red every time my crush speaks my name (siiiggghhh)... I am too old to jump every time my cell phone rings, thinking that the crush will be the person calling me... I am TOO OLD to sit all pouty n' drunk on the couch watching bad Bravo reality shows and eating reheated Chinese food at two in the morning feeling half-a-step away from sobbing just as hard over my STUPID crush as I did when I was sixteen and Lael Pierce asked my friend Elisabeth to homecoming instead of me...

I am too Too TOO OLD  for this shiznit.

Here is what puts all of it right:
A Boston creme donut from Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop.

This came to me like a vision as I was on my way to Whole Foods and the #1 Cali was crossing over Polk Street and I was sitting there being all "meh" while listening to my iPod (appropriately loaded with wah-wah songs made to make me all self-indulgently sniffely...)

The light, airy donut combined with just the right amount of vanilla-goodness on the inside, chocolate frosting on the top... mmm... I don't care that one donut probably has 1,500 calories... I DON'T CARE... this is serious crushing, people - it is le smit - it is unrequited amour... it is random-drive-by-flirting which leaves my head spinning and my knees woobly and my hands shaky and my stomach in knots because I am such a moron that I allow my self to be sucked into that kind of crushy-drama (see my review on "Stupid Drama" if you have questions on that topic)...  I want it to go away, yet come closer... it is LE SUCK.

A donut is required.
Yes, it is.
From Bob's Donuts...

Crushes gone awry can only be remedied with a Boston creme donut.  It is a proven scientific fact.
author: Kate R.

description:
One donut.....
Nutrition Facts ( by bold helvetica)
Serving Size: 1/4,
Serving Per donut: 4
Calories  a lot,   Calories from Fat  a lot,
.........
Every time I come here,
I fell like .....a high school kid try to buy a bottle of vodka.
Or,
I am go into a porn... no.... an adult video store.

I look around to make sure that no one is watching......

I am not a pervert.

You know,
I want to have a day like..... 
Fried Chicken and Donuts Day! All Day!
And some Tem-pura Rolls, too!
Onion Rings and Deep Fried Calamari and Oysters!
Yah!
FXXX IT!
Let's get Fat!
Eat it!
Just Eat it!
Oh My God, I'll be Obese.

I've never thought about eating donut become a serious thing for your health like drinking alcohole.
But,
It is OK to eat donuts some times, 
isn't it?

This place is like the Last Man Standing!
Hey, Bob! I'm with you Man!

Does this place has something to do with the Bob's Sushi on Bay Street that closed?
.mary.a. said," How about Bob's Cafe on Polk Street?"
author: Nobu K.

description:
LOVE Bob's. LOVE it. I used to live only a few blocks away and it somehow manage to be (un?)fortunately on my way home almost every drinking night. I remember never being able to decide if I wanted maple, chocolate or regular old-fashioned donuts, so I usually got all three. oops. It is also true that they have the most amazing apple fritters I've ever had-they just never have them at 2am :/ but thats ok because it allows me to try other things!

Go Bob's!
author: Afton T.

description:
For Bay to Breakers, Bob's & Yelp combined to hook me up with an awesome donut t-shirt that doubles as my gym shirt and nightgown.

And might be the reason why I am single.
author: Janney B.

description: Their fresh-out-of-the-fryer donuts with sticky maple glaze is AMAZING.
author: Jaime L.

description:
I remember when I was young and I would go to slumber parties. It seems it was a prerequisite that all parents would go get donuts in the morning. As a result I know that there are some pretty crappy donuts out there. Stale, over frosted, old grease one star donuts. 

Bobs donuts are fresh and tasty, but call me crazy, shouldn't they be? I mean, it is a donut shop. They specialize in donuts. Which brings me to my next point.

IT IS A DONUT. It is not some complex delicacy I am paying $200 to experience. It is a deep fried ball of dough with a price tag of 80 cents. 

It is a deep fried ball of dough that is available to me at all hours of the morning and night for 80 cents. Thanks Bob for providing me another late night vice that is bad for my health but tastes oh so good.

But......it is still just a donut.
author: Drue C.

description:
Bob, Bay to Breakers, & a mountain of donut holes gave me a legitimate reason, no, a desperate *need* to yell:
 
HOT HOLES!  GET YER HOT HOLES RIGHT HERE!!!

Mighty fine holes they were too.
author: Ravena F.

description:
OH.

MY.

GAWWWWWWWWWWWWWD.

ok.. it's from my lovely friend, Audrey J.!

OH.

MY.

GAWWWWWWWWWWWWWD.

ok..  it's from ME!

PS: never thought there's going to be better donut than Krispy Kream..  
Holy Hallelujah!  I am kinda happy I can't get this in New York.. cuz I don't want to wear big donut ring on my belly..  24 hours?  Geeeeeeez!
author: Julie K.

description:
Man am I having a shitty week.  I'll leave out the gory details but it started with my car breaking down (to the tune of $600) and the final straw was me punching myself in the nuts while pumping gas.  And no, I have no idea how it happened but it hurt.  A lot.  
What to do, what to do...I don't like to drink in front of the kids so that was out.  Light bulb-how about a doughnut?  Hell ya, Bob's here I come.

I park right in front and run inside, scanning the rack for the freshies. Chocolate w/ sprinkles?  One please!  75 cents?  That's a hell of a lot cheaper than Zoloft and I gotta say, oh so tasty.

Here's my problem with doughnuts...to me they are kind of like masturbating--I really enjoy them/it during the act but after usually  feel all sticky and gross (Catholic guilt, gotta love it)

But there was something different about this doughnut...I feel so free, so liberated.  Who knows, maybe my luck is changing?
author: phil h.

description:
was dragged here once at 5 in the morning by a drag queen after consuming a mediocre mess of fried food at Sparky's. 

My friend was still wasted and we though a donut (or two) would sober her up.

She and I ended up ordering 4 donuts and a bearclaw and eating ALL of them. Mind you, this was after a meal at Sparky's. 

I somehow found my way into a cab and home into bed. Woke up with the taste of sugar in my mouth, guilt in my gut, and thanks to 4 donuts at Bob's, no hangover. 

I honestly couldn't tell you if the donuts were that great because anything fried and coated in sugar is THE BEST THING EVER when you're drunk.

I'm too ashamed to return.
author: Kelly Kate W.

description:
since the arrival of the krispy kreme empire shops have been forced into hiding or had to learn the ancient secret of chinese fastfood to partner with the glorious donut.

this is one of the rare spots like rolling pin that didn't have to change their formula to survive in this vicious biz.  the euge brought me here after a night of drunken bday soirees.

once we got passed the crowd in the front and up to order this nice lady working the counter yelled out...

OH YOU STILL HAVE HAIR!!!

i know she wasn't talking to me cause as frisco put it i have a fabulous mane...okay.   euge kept it simple and ordered a plain glaze & apple juice for both of us.

i remember him saying stuff as i gorged down the delectable, sexy yum-yums, but i really don't recall what nonsense he was telling me.  i was in sugar high heaven as he was back on earth...   

i will be here again, again, again and again.
author: omar b.

description:
You have to understand, I don't even like donuts.  But when a friend suggested going here a little after midnight, promising donuts fresh out of the fryer, I said I'd give it a try.  I have been on a few late-night/early morning quests to various pastry purveyors, and never been disappointed.

The donuts were 85¢.  Old-fashioned chocolate-glazed cruller thing = amazing.  The inside was cakey and dense (which is how I like my donuts, when I like them), and all the little crenellations on the outside yielded a fantastically crispy surface with tons of nooks and crannies to hold the chocolate icing.  The chocolate cake donut was also delicious.  I am not a huge fan of maple, but one of my friends bit into the maple old-fashioned and her face immediately broke into an enormous shit-eating grin.  I'm pretty sure she had a donut-gasm sitting on one of the stools at the counter.  All in all, pretty fantastic, and well worth a late-night trip.
author: claire l.

description:
Nothing like being in a Donut Nirvana like Bob's, waiting in line for what seems like eternity before that blissful moment at the counter when you're handed your bag or box of sin....

...only to look across the room at the TV up in the corner and see some 'Healthwatch' report on the local news involving Diabetes and someone putting a tape measure around some guy's waist to make you wonder why they can't just take a hint from 'Good Vibrations' directly across the street and put some butcher paper over it so you can't see anything unless you really, REALLY want to. Damn! 

Didn't stop us from walking out with a death-defying assortment of deep-fried, frosted and/or filled blood-sugar-and-cholesterol-raising-AND-waist-expanding joy. 

And get this: it's right down the street from Miller's East Coast Deli. Apparently, the end of my life is located squarely on a certain two block section of Polk Street. Now I know.
author: mnypny b.

description:
finally~!~!~!!...i ate an apple fritter~!~!!.....i believe the hype~!......it's good....thick...fat....big...moist....and mmmm mmm goooood.....i think the secret is the thickness....most donut shops make their apple fritters wide and flat...over glazed "hard"....

at bob's...it's over 2 inches thick...keeping the donut goodness moist and fluffy....soft...bite after bite...it's addicting..i wish i had ordered 2....there is always next time....
author: Hen A.

description:
I'd like to thank Bob's Donuts to contributing to my uncontrollable non-stop eating habits. And for sponsoring the lovely Yelp group during Bay to Breakers. We enjoyed the yumminess & handing out donuts to participants.

Fresh yummy cuddly plump donuts to devour at your needs 24 hours a day!! Really though, who doesn't need a donut fix at 2am?! 

Woohoo for donuts! DO-NUT be disappointed by Bob's!! 

*does a donut dance*
author: Catherine O.

description: I just don't get it!  Not the best donut by a long shot.  Plus they herd you in and out like cattle.  I still think Rolling Pin donuts in San Bruno are top notch!  And Happy Donuts on Gilman in Berkeley are far better!
author: Bahvee V.

description: So their apple fritter is sin on a bun... sinabon?  Cinnabon? errr... whatever it is, it is fantastic.  I would give it 5 stars - IF the 4 hour old donut mess was as good as the 15 minute old one.  I would give the 15 minute old hot fritter 5 stars and maybe the older not so fresh one about 3 stars - hence the 4 star average.  If you can time it right or just get lucky, try to get something fresh.  I think 11:00PM was when I had something super fresh.
author: Danny C.

description: This is the best donut shop.  As others said, go during the later hours when the donuts are freshest.  The food, service, and various crowds you'll run into are why this place is so great.  The apple fritters are as good as people say.  My personal favorites are the buttermilk bars, standard or chocolate glazed, and the cinnamon donuts.
author: W M.

description:
When I'm not on a diet, rarely, I like coming here for a late night treat right before I plan to go the bed. At around 10:30pm, they make their freshly fried up donuts and that's when it's the best time to eat it. It's not only me that likes to eat a freshly fried donut at night, their could be a line of ate night bar hoppers that get hungry. 

Their apple fritters are by far the best I've had, sugar coated donuts are me second favorite. I like to always buy a dozen of the donut holes for my ride back home. 

It's CASH only!!! I had to walk across the street to Sushi Rock's ATM in my pjs to get some cash before I devoured these gigantic monsters..
author: Juliane N.

description:
Thank you Bob's Donuts for the fantastic shirts for B2B and for sponsoring us and giving us all those YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMY donuts to give out to the runners. 

You guys rock! *Hi Hen!!*
author: Jen D.

description:
Sugar Heaven.

This is the perfect dessert after a La Folie dinner.  Just in case your arteries weren't completely closed.
author: Mokirobinson M.

description:
A few months ago I came here with a friend at drunk-o-clock for a glazed donut.  It was good, but I didn't know what the big deal was.

Well this morning I dropped in for an apple fritter, and I finally got it.  Holy crap, that thing was good.

Walking back to the 'loin with my pastry in hand, I contemplated turning around for another amaaazing fritter.

Then I flashed back to last week when the doctor wrote the word OBESITY in big capital letters on my medical record.  With THREE (3) exclaimation points.

I walked home before I hurt myself.
author: Rocco B.

description:
After a night of pounding Big Daddys at the Cinch, there is no greater glory than a Bob's crumb donut.  

The crumb donut is a messy little thing--it gets everywhere and you can't eat just one.  It's best to get when you're already a drunken mess.  It just makes you messier!

Dare I credit these donuts with the miracle of hangover prevention?  Last night I was so wasted that I was singing Lou Rawls songs on the bus.  I had two crumb donuts from Bob's, and today I was up with the sun (er, rain) and ready to run a marathon!  I did NOT run a marathon, but I could have.  Or I could have at least watched one on TV.  But with no headache!  There's the evidence, you decide.
author: Eric E.

description:
It's very hard to add a lot to the sentiments already expressed here.  So, rather than making any statements, let me ask some questions.

1. Who exactly is Bob and where did he go?  I doubt the Chinese woman I always interact with (and who is very nice) is Bob.

2. Why do I always order the French twist donuts with chocolate frosting, even though I always find them to be disappointing (not only here, but everywhere)?  Am I retarded?

3. Why do I always order more donuts that I can reasonably eat in the time before they go stale?

4. Why are old-fashioned donuts so damn good?

5. Why can't I find a place, other than Bob's, where, when you bit into an apple fritter, you find actually, chewy chunks of apple?

6. What would I need to buy in order to spend $10?  I've bought a lot of stuff here, and the price never seems to be more than $5.
author: Ben P.

description: Sort of shocked to see this spot open at 11:30pm on a Monday.  I got a cinnamon roll for $1.35.  It was ok, but not very fresh or big.  Compared to Happy Donuts, this paled, but it was still enjoyable and the selection looked good for another try.  They should be commended to for just existing.  Possible upgrade on another visit should I ever make one.
author: Marc S.

description: This is an SF institution - if you're in the area after a long night of hard drinking be sure to stop by and pick up some donuts.  You will not be sorry.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Was craving for donuts and went to this place , donuts are normal and thought krispy creme was much better.
author: Vijay R.

description: The apple fritter alone is worth the trip.
author: Miriam W.

description: This place is the bomb. Krispy Kreme steered me away from regular donuts ever since they opened the one in Daly City.  I feel like such a loser for admitting that I thought they were the best. Bob's is way better than the regular donuts I've had and I am never going back to Krispy Kreme. Besides..Bob's is way cheaper and is closer to me..I can walk here from my home in  about 20 mins. The big ass donut is yummo!!! It taste like the regular sized glazed but I think the fact that it's bigger makes it much yummier and chewier. I still haven't gotten a hang of the times they make donuts but they do run out. I was just there tonight at 8:25 and they had no donuts left...just other pastries. Some smart people actually called ahead of time to see if they had any donuts. The Asian lady told me they'd have some after 9. Going back now!!!
author: Mila B.

description:
I have been dying to try this place.  DYING.  So finally, last night, en route to Amelie, Amy C. and I pass it.  I turn to her and state, "I'm going there after we leave the bar."

The WHOLE f'in night all I can think about are those donuts.  Yeah, I engaged in the random chitter chatter.  "Mmm hmm.  Yeah, so our trip to Spain.  Yeah, so excited about it.  Mm hmm."  "So that new guy you're dating.  Huh, yeah.  Wow."  My internal conversation went more along the lines of, "So should I get the glazed or the apple fritter?  Maybe both.  Maybe an old fashioned.  Maybe all 3.  Damn, I shoulda brushed up on the yelps!"  FINALLY, we left Amelie.  And guess who got her donut urge filled?

Bob's did not disappoint.  The woman behind the counter was incredibly sweet and helpful.  She informed that the glazed was the most popular one.  And I can see why.  Heavenly.  DId you get that?  HEAVENLY.  The first bite was so good.  Light, fluffy, not greasy and buttery tasting.  How do they get those things so light?? I also tried the chocolate glazed and the apple fritter.  The Apple Fritter is huge!  Very cake like texture, denser and different from other AFs I've had.  Nice glaze job!  I've chowed down on these at other places and noticed that the glaze can get kinda stale & filmy.  Not that that would prevent me from finishing it.  That would be sacrilege.  

Word of the day sacrilege = "gross irreverence toward a hallowed person, place, or thing."
author: Natasha S.

description:
Comical. Grungy. Old Skool.

Pink donut boxes, gazillion donuts sitting sloppily in the window, long, brown-tinged counter, coffee that's been sitting too long in a too-old coffee pot.

The things that sets Bobs from any other donut shop, are:
1) GIANT glazed donut  ring (literally bigger than your face)
2) Korean lady that doesn't give a SHIT to who you are

Occurrences during my adventure to Bobs:
1) Her back is to me - I want to order - "excuse me?"
 "I can HEAR you!  You've been talking ever since you walked in"
2) I want to know what a pastry is
"It has apple in it"
3) I want a fresh donut
"There'll all the same!  They were all made today!"

Bless her heart.  She was so frighteningly mean, that it almost made her nice.  Bless her soul.

Yes, the apple fritter is deep fried bombsauce.

$2 average for a donut
$3-5 for pastry type goodies
author: Jane L.

description: delicous doughnuts........However, seriously surprised the health department hasn't closed this joint down. super dirty
author: Mister M.

description:
I always walk pass BDPS and have never had a donut from there.  

This morning as I was walking back from the bank going to work, the aroma stopped me dead in my tracks. The donuts look "ok" from the window but I thought I'd give it a shot. 

I ordered a chocolate covered long john (no custurd filling). They are freshly made daily, inexpensive, and delicious!! 

My plan was to take a pic of the donut but I couldn't even put it down to grab my phone. It was gone in seconds.

No joke, Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop will be seeing more of me.
author: Dorothea G.

description: If you're out on Polk Street you have to stop at Bob's.  It's an institution, and definitely the best place to go during a set break at Red Devil Lounge.  What else is there to say, if you like donut's you'll like Bob's, if not, you're not really living.
author: Mark S.

description:
My lovely companions for an evening of Indie-Rock at the Red Devil Lounge left the venue with stomachs-a-growlin', and while we were at another location getting a slice of pizza...the intoxicating scent of freshly baked donuts began to lure me in from about a block away.

If possible, I would have floated through the air like a cartoon character...but alas I'm human & that can't happen (yet).

The donuts were SUPER fresh & when I finished my first two, I immediately wanted more. Unfortunately, that would have meant going to the ATM just to take more money out for donuts-- after some deliberation, I passed.

One thing I did realize about Bob's Donuts though--everyone who comes in there walks out with a donut in hand and a smile on their face.
author: matt m.

description:
It's a donut shop, for goodness sake.

A single-wide room, early 70s decor, eleven broken down soda fountain stools against a counter overlooking a sparse prep kitchen stacked high with pink cake boxes.

A constant rabble of drunk, old, sexed up, gossipy customers gush as much nonsense in person as the reviewers on Yelp.  The place puts San Franciscans in touch with a side of life I don't understand, and makes them talk about it.  At length.  In verse.
author: Gil S.

description:
I sneak over here when my husband is out of town.  For some reason my husband hates donuts and makes a huge stink-face at the sight of one.  So when he is not around I'll go get a glazed old fashioned from Bob's.  I am sure all their donuts are great but that one is my favorite.  

Donuts here are always fresh and if they can get you one that just came out of the oven, they will hunt around to find you the best one.

I love the ladies that work here.  Always very friendly, I have no doubt they will keep my secret safe!
author: Kristine K.

description:
I sound like a broken record but the Apple Fritter is so good. 

Usually it's flat, too glazy, too sweet and not enough apples and over fried.  I regret that I wasted calories on it.  

Bob's Apple Fritter is thick, fat , doughy but not too doughy, perfectly sweet with chunks of cinammony apples.    I'd rather eat this then be skinny...well, sort of.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I'm all up in this here joint when the calling gets strong enough.
yes, I'm all about maple bars with the custard in it.

dayum it's been long since I last yelped.......

anyway, i'm just all about these donuts. I've been on a burger-in-between-two-glazed-donuts kick lately.....but I haven't tried with these, so that's on a damn checklist already. I have gone around a few blocks around to compare the other donut shops around...these take home the trophy...and me....(um)
Fuck warm apple pies..........................................................

But I'm telling you, if using these donuts as props for a drag show or just buying a box fo' yo heafaness to drown out feelings is tha reason for you to get a dozen, then you are on the right track - come up with more excuses for the next time.

my personal favorites are:
custard-filled maple bar
glazed old fashioned (I usually don't like old fashioned donuts NEwUURR!)
giant chocolate donut (the GIANT one [redundant])
buttermilk delightfulness.....

I'm not much on essentialism - but these ARE the best damn donuts in the city.

and I need to take a shit.........(non-essential detail)
author: Jay M.

description: I am a donut fiend. Chocolate old fashioned is my favorite and maple bars are a close second. However, one night we stopped by Bob's and they were dipping freshly made pieces of dough into the hot buttermilk glaze. When they handed it to us, it was still piping hot, soft, and the glaze was dripping off the sides. I was in donut heaven. I never knew a donut could be like this. Everytime my friend Naomi P. and I are together, whether in a car or on foot, we will somehow make a detour to Bob's.
author: Amy D.

description:
What else can be said that has not been said already??

I came here this past Saturday for the first time, after reading so much good stuff here at Yelp, and there was not much selection, but it was early afternoon.  I got the requisite apple fritter, and now, I will have NO other fritter.  This one had real apples in it.  Other places maybe have apple juice as apples.  

There were just 3 left, so I bought all three.  The lady behind me asked for apple fritters too.  This same nice lady behind the counter says I just bought the last three.  She turns to me as I was leaving and offers to double my money.  I politely said no thanks, and she offers to triple my money.  Now I KNOW these must have been good since she offered $15 for just three of them, and not ever having them before, I had to get out of there FAST to get them in the car, and speed away before she could make me an offer I could not refuse.  I later found out that these are THAT GOOD.

I also got some donuts as big as a frisbee.  The nice lady behind the counter says these go really quickly, as people order them for parties.  If there ever is a Yelp donut party, get them from here.

From what I see, these fried pastries are so good, not really sweet like some other Krispy fried pastry.

I wish my stories were as colorful as stumbling in drunk, but no .... just good donuts.
author: Michael M.

description:
Had these for the first time last week. Go in after 11pm for the fresh ones. The steamy, fluffy hot inside surrounded by the slightly crisp outside covered in a sugary sweet glaze. What a freakin' combo, donut heaven I tell ya. Not sure how they are when they're cold, but they're the best fresh donuts I've ever had. They're known for their apple fritters, but the traditional glazed donut was damned good as well. Do I even need to say it trumps a Krispy Kreme by far? Ohhhh, dooooough-nuuuuts... *slobber*

Oh a side note, is it donut or doughnut?
author: Al L.

description:
I don't care how many Health Code violations they may have, I'd eat these donuts if they were dunked in the Power Exchange mop bucket!

kudos, Bob.  and kudos again!!
author: Patrick A.

description:
Seriously, what can I say that hasn't already been said?  Bob's is the best in the land for donuts, especially when you're out late (or early, depending on how you look at it).  You can stumble in for something sweet, hot, and fresh.  The french donuts and apple fritters are my favorite.  The custard in their filled donuts is reeaaaaaally good too.

This place is also absolutely wonderful for people watching in the wee hours.  Prostitutes, drunkies, transients, giants, men with mullets, you name it... it's all pure entertainment.
author: A Mandolin D.

description:
[Me]: "No, I will not have a donut-eating contest with you!"
[Boyfriend]: "Why, because you know I'll beat you?"
[Me]: "No, because we are supposed to be trying to eat healthy."
[Boyfriend]: "Okay, I'll just have one."
[Me]: "Me too."

We have this same interaction every time we go to Bob's. Donuts are my weakness and they do them best.
author: Defne A.

description: There's not much I can say that other reviewers haven't already ... Bob's is amazing.  The donuts are fresh and delicious, and reasonably priced to boot.  There are a handful of seats so that you can enjoy your donuts in the shop, which my friend and I did.  Only, they were so good, that we we "coerced" into buying a second to munch while wandering the streets of Nob Hill.  We'll be back!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
They also have something akin to an old fashioned, a big blob of fried, glazed dough with a dollop of cherry goo on top that is spectacular.   

The giant donut will be a hit at any party.

And just go in and order some random sweet sometime.  There are some very interesting and unique delights.

Bob's is the best of the best of SF.
author: Robert C.

description:
Get off the treadmill, rent a movie, and eat Bob's doughnuts. 
The raised crumb is excellent. It's all homemade right there in the shop. Their Columbian coffee is surprisingly good too.
author: Shanna H.

description:
(Homer slobber here) ahhhhh....sweet, airy, fluffy, warm fatty friends available when ever you are... 

I, fortunately and unfortunately, usually eat a half dozen when I go. My favorites are the; Donut crumb donuts!!, Apple fritters, Maple French curllers, and choco glazed. I have yet to try the life preserver sized donut. 

The service has been nothing short of complete sweet heart. 

There's great bars all through the neighborhood and that stretch of polk. 

Not that the decor matters, but it has a very 50's/60's diner-tired linoleum feel. 

This reminds me of Chicago...some earthy, real, fat kid place.
author: Jake H.

description:
I'm becoming a big dough nut (el oh el) during my time here in SF.  Growing up it was all about Krispy Kremes, but even then I wasn't that into them like I am now.  I see now that they're a quick, convenient treat when you're walking trying to get to Point B from Point A, or when you're wandering around aimlessly like I do 99.99% of the time.

This shop in particular does it for me on multiple levels -- the trays and trays of donuts, fritters and pastries on display in the storefront window that entice you to pause on Polk and take a look; the long countertop with bar stools with that one dude always in the back sitting there watching the TV; the super helpful employee that answers all of my questions about the donuts and pleasantly rings up my purchase.  The price is always right, under $2 for even the more complicated offerings in my experience to date.  

I'm always getting my stuff to go, but it looks like a place I could just sit a spell and just be enveloped in this yeasty hug because the place ALWAYS smells so damn amazing and just looks comfortable and homey.
author: Charlotte M.

description:
The donut is one of the finest foods created by man. And yet, most donut shops treat their products with some measure of disdain. This place is no different. They make their donuts in the morning and let them get stale over time in a large bin with plenty of air exposure.

Now yes, the apple fritters are made with cinnamon, which is interesting. Unfortunately, their primary taste is of oil. To fill the bars with custard, they're cut in half. One can only imagine that either pastry bags are too expensive in the city or Bob's dough is too dense to use the normal method.

My search for a fresh donut at 7pm continues...
author: Richard B.

description:
Wen6t here because 1. its on the 7x7 list and 2. its really close to my new apartment and I don't like large breakfasts.....

But I do like fatty pastries so I scored!

My companion and I split two breakfast donut things.

1. the apple fritter - Great dough, slightly crispy, good cinnamon and sugar content -- i would have liked the apple chunks to be cut smaller and spread out more evenly through the bun.

2. a delicious cross between a puffy glazed donut and a cinnamon bun... obviously you can't go wrong with that

The place isn't super clean and kinda dark but everything looked tasty and fresh. The lady at the counter was nice and helpful, but lacked a sense of humor.... when my companion spotted humongous donuts twice the size my head and joked that i would take three of those for breakfast the lady almost started packing them up.
author: Sara K.

description:
I admit...coming to Bob's on a Sunday night at 8 pm probably wasn't the best time  for hot, fresh outta the fryer donuts, but we decided to make the trip anyway.  I'm not a big donut person, so I don't have much to compare to, but I didn't think that the donuts were THAT good.  I mean, yes, its fried dough...yes, its glazed....yes, its tasty, but they certainly didn't make angels come flying out or heavenly trumpets start playing when I took a bite of the donuts.  

To be fair, I was perfectly sober and the donuts seem to be at their best when A) one is drunk off one's ass and B) one happens to be there at 2 am when all the donuts are fresh.  They're not so great when they've been sitting in the window all afternoon.  In any case, from what we sampled, the crumb donut was best, while the old-fashioned was just okay.  I picked out this one doughnut sphere with jelly crossed on top- not sure what it was called, but it was unique.

I'd be back if I was in the area after a night of heavy drinking, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come...unless I can be guaranteed hot donuts and fresh apple fritters.
author: Angela H.

description:
I hate donuts.

But I'll split one from Bob's with you.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Last night, walking back to my friend's house, we ran into one of her neighbors on the street.  He was carrying a box of Bob's Donut's and while she distracted him with her flirting prowess, I ate about half of his apple fritter and a big bite of the most delicious cream filled donut ever (it tasted like vanilla and love).  I passed off the rest of the cream-filled to her and we went on our way.  

Bob's Donut's are so good I am not above stealing them from strangers on the street.
author: Katie S.

description:
2 stars:The apple fritters are delicious... BUT, and I mean BUT, they only make them fresh at like 11PM! I had one just a bit ago (8PM) and it tasted like a piece of bread with apple sauce! ewwwwwwww

0 stars: The worst part is that on our first time going there my boyfriend asked if they had fresh donuts (at like 7PM) and the lady working was absolutely RUDE to him! She essentially said - what do you think, you spoiled brat, that we make fresh donuts every hour!! She's lucky I respect my elders!
author: Marla Y.

description:
REPEAT AFTER ME... CINNNNAAAAMOOONN ROOOLLLLL.

Gosh, I have been here since I was a child.  The place hasnt changed since I was 10.  the cinnamon roll is to die for.  

The donuts are no fancy krispy creme new style donuts with sprinkles.  they are old school old fashions, just the way it should be.  gimme a old fashion maple any day.

When i want a donut, Bob's is the donut i want and think of.
author: Janet S.

description:
For those who know me - you KNOW its about the doughnuts. My not-so-secret pleasure...especially after imbibing far too many spirits and stumbling down Polk Street for delish' hot n' tasty treats.  I even sport the Bob's t-shirt on occasion to show my pride around town.

I don't know what it says about my personal eating habits but Bob's staff actually KNOWS me now....by name.  Glazed Doughnuts , cake doughnuts, Twists, maple, chocolate glaze is doesnt matter....everything here is worthy of 5 stars.   

I highly recommend the GIANT doughnut they serve on the weekends for 3.50 that is meant to be shared .....but I suppose that really depends on how much you drank at R bar or Hemlock before you stumbled over.
author: Morgan H.

description:
I just picked up the bad habit of getting addicted to Bob's Donuts 5 months out before my wedding.

I feel like Augustus Gloop when I look into their window and then walk into the store, the fat gluttonous kid that just can't get enough.
author: kate r.

description:
Even the ones who laugh are sometimes caught without an answer: these creatures who introduce themselves but we swear we have met them somewhere before. Yes, look in the mirror. What do you see? Is it a dream, or a nightmare? Are we being introduced against our will? Are they mirrors? I can see the smoke. I can smell the fire. The battle is drawing nigh.
