My log tells me that you should not go to Bob's on a Saturday night at 2 a.m. after a house party and/or bars with a debilitating case of the munchies, for you shall encounter much turmoil and strife at the sight of a drunken, drooling mob of zombified, doughnut-craving heathens pawing at the thin, transparent divide of window space that separates them from the sacred dwelling place where doughnuts go to die. 

Do heed my warning, yet bare in mind that one bite of an apple fritter will make you forget all of the trauma that you have just suffered.
author: amity b.

description:
Bob's donuts are mad-delicous!! Yes, they are open 24-7 and the nice friendly granny in there is always ready to style you out with apple-fritter-y goodness. 

- Don't go in here if your resolve is weak, 'cos you *will* lose and buy lots of donuts!

- Do go in here if you're off to the Lumiere Cinema or the Van Ness AMC and don't wanna do popcorn. Nothing quite like watching a movie and munching on an *illegally smuggled-in* bag of Bob's Donut holes!!! 5 Stars!!!
author: I. O.

description:
Best donuts ever. Makes me bummed to go to other donut shops because its so good. 

they bake ~11PM-2AM. So go then
author: Kenny S.

description:
My new lover.

The apple fritter totally made me it's bitch.  And I liked it.  A lot.
author: Evan L.

description:
The buttermilk donuts, when hot out of the oven, will CHANGE YOUR LIFE. They are so amazing. They are my new favorite baked dessert. Screw cupcakes!

I was back on the East Coast last week and realized that Bob's Donuts have totally killed my taste for Dunkin' Donuts. I didn't think that was possible! I am also a huge fan of Bob's chocolate glazed old-fashioned. It is crispy on the outside and crumbly on the inside and just really dee-lish all around. When my dad was visiting me, he flirted like mad with the lady behind the counter and got all kinds of free stuff. SO GOOD.
author: Sahra H.

description: i don't like their donut at all since there is some disgusted bad cooking oil smell. But their apple bread pudding is super delicious. not so sweet and with right amount of apple on the top.
author: Zoe C.

description: Very fresh and yummy.  Atmosphere is not so nice but if you are getting it to go it is a good choice for donuts.
author: April M.

description: Awesome donuts which melt in your mouth! Perfect dessert at midnight after dinner! :D
author: Sandeep S.

description:
Did we just come at *the* worst time? Did I miss out on the best doughnut ever? I guess so. We came, we saw, we smelled and it all seemed to add up to a great doughnut shop. So we ordered a vast array of doughnuts and other fried wonders as well as assorted pastries. We are walking back to the car all crazy psyched because these are of course "the best doughnuts in all of San Francisco" . Score! We get into the car and are as eager as can be so we rip into our finds and all split one type. Overfried, a bit dry, a bit heavy, and overall just not good. We figure it's fluke. We tuck into another, and another....and another. Disappointment after disappointment. 

So what did I gather from this experiment  ? 

Parking, Crap. 
Doughnuts, Crap. 
Every other pastry we ordered, Crap.
And that either I have terrible luck or San Francisco just has no idea what a good doughnut is. 

What did we do wrong?!
author: Natalie G.

description: I had a Groupon or something like that for one free pastry or donut. Naturally, I went to get the apple fritter because it's on this year's 7x7 list (I walked around a mile to get there, too). I would have gone at 2am at night, but I'm not really a night owl. I heard that it's fresh around that time, and other certain times. Anyway, I got the apple fritter, and despite being cold, it was delicious! Very oily--I swear you could get a heart attack. I probably clogged an artery somewhere (luckily I run, so I'm okay). The fritter was pretty crispy on the outside, and soft and chewy on the inside. I've never had an APPLE fritter, but I can tell you that it's more donut-tasting than apple-tasting. However, it's STILL delicious! It's also humongous. The other donuts also looked delicious. Definitely would go, if I'm ever in the area, and I'm still running...
author: Vera W.

description:
B. 
B-o. 
B-o-b. 
B-o-b-apostophe. 
B-o-b-apostophe-dramtic pause-s.
Oh, it's that time again...

Each weekend night, circa 3am, these are the opening lyrics I hear coming from my musician-to-be slash drunkard of an apt. mate. 

The song continues...

Oh Mr. Bob - I'm coming for you. 
Going to eat all yo donuts...
That's right - I be eatin' yo donuts. 
I ain't want no coffee. 
I ain't want no tea. 
I'm coming for yo nuts, Bob.
That's right mr. apostrophe...
 
Gimme yo donuts. 
I want an Apple fritter too, Bob
No, I ain't forgettin' bout that fritter
Gimme all yo donuts, Bob

So in closing, yes, Bob's donuts are amazing. The chocolate donut the size of a life raft is remarkable. As are the apple fritters. Do yourself a favor and visit B-o-b-apostrophe-s this weekend.
author: Tom C.

description:
seriously the best donut shop around. 

their glazed are ridiculous but everything else is top notch as well. 

cheap !!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Bob's rocks.  Seriously.  Absolutely.

I visited Bob's last night around 2am.  The fryer was in full production mode, spitting out plump and fragrant apple fritters.  My companion got one of those.  It was so hot that we couldn't eat it for 15 minutes - but worth the wait!  I got a maple bar.  Good God.  That thing was absolutely amazing.  It was warm, light, and it fell apart as I was eating it, flavor was out of this world.  That maple bar was seriously the best thing I have consumed in months.  

The lady at the cash register was really friendly, too.  Bob's on Polk.  Go there.  Now!
author: Rachel E.

description:
Truly awesome. No kidding!
And the lady is super nice.

If you need a good sugar fix but watches your calories this donut is worth it.
I bought some yesterday and I do not usually eat any thing in the morning but after all these great reviews, I had to take a bite.
In fact I had to take another bite but I actually had the will power to stop.

Well needless to say its one fantastic donut, I cannot explain it but the dough is so good and yet not super sweet, great dough!
Oh great now anytime I really need a donut fix I have to drive to Bob's Donut and that is a long drive for a donut but guess what it's worth it.
The owner told me people come from Napa and all over just for a donut.
Now I know why! I hope I can wait to go back! Their donut is truly sinful!
author: R K.

description:
Dear Bob's,

Ever since I discovered your delicious, delectable, dynamite donuts, I can't help but notice that more and more of the Male Folk are checking me out!  I know I've grown since we first met, but I actually think I kind of like it... and clearly, so do they!    

You put the junk in my trunk.  

Yours,
Whitney H's Derriere
author: Whitney H.

description:
After reading reviews on Yelp, I took Hubby and our friend, P, on a search for Bob's Dounts. We went on a Saturday afternoon and the donuts were almost gone!! We got some glazed donuts and coffee to go. I don't know wat it is but these donuts are crazy good. P sometimes surprises me at work with a donut from Bob's. 

I love Bob and his donuts. That is all!
author: Kayla N.

description:
I like big butts and I cannot lie, them other brother's can't deny. When a girl walks in with an itty bitty waist and a round thing in your face you get sprung!

I come here to get my big butt.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Real quick - in case your grossly uninformed and have no idea what Bob's is:  It's a simple old-fashioned counter serving generic coffee and fantastic donuts.

I almost didn't write a review about this place, because it would be NEARLY impossible to put into words the Magnificence of Bobby D's.  As a quick disclaimer before you continue - this is MY yelp on MY favorite donut spot in the world.  Disagreeing with me is simply not allowed for this one.  

Sometimes I like to make outrageous claims such as:  Bob Dylan was named after Bob's Donuts.  Old Fashioned Donuts are appropriately named after the drunken founder of Bob's favorite cocktail.  Bob's is on the corner of Polk and Sacramento aka the corner of My Street and My Town.  Doughnuts are spelled DONUTS because Bob's said so (not Dunkin).  Old Asian ladies are the best at handcrafting these delicious treats due to their nimble fingers and attention to detail.  The military mistakenly drops bombs over Iraq when they should be dropping Bob's over my office.    

I recently spent my 25th birthday at Bob's.  What did they give me? - oh nothing more than HONORARY Donut clerk for a few customers, a shit ton of Frits, and the whole entire store (customers included) singing happy B-day.  No matter what happens in life, I will die a happy man.  

When I ran into Barry Zito at Bob's he told me he's a fan of All Star Doughnuts on Chestnut (LoL).  I think I may have converted him to a Bobaholic (like me)  

My favorite bars in the city are probably Mays, Hemlock, McTeagues, RBar, etc.  You see a trend?  They're all within close vicinity to divinity.  Oh and if you think I go to Bob's only after getting trunked up at these bars, then you are exactly right.  They stay open late when I'm on the donut prowl.  

So what's good at Bob's?  Oh I donno - everything!  Lots of buzz on Yelp about the fritters, but a good move is to go with whatever is freshest.  You may even end up with a cinny twist or caked D, but those are still bomb ... you know what? those are ATOMIC bomb.  It is also a good idea to order a few extra Frits to munch on during a lazy of NFL watching.  This is not to say Bob's are better during Autumn, but my Sunday consumption gradually rises during this season.  

So - I have a 5 star rating, but 6 stars really does this place justice.  See ya soon Bob's!
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description:
There's nothing better than scarfing down a hot buttery apple fritter and then moving onto an equally tasty raspberry jelly donut at 5 in the morning after a long night's hard work of partying on NYE. 

Popped into this place sent by a recommendation from a coworker who absolutely raved about the fresh batch that comes out at midnight, and figured 5am... 12am.... kind of the same thing when day turns to night. The guy working the shift was very pleasant and recommended a whole bunch of different pastries (none of which I ended up buying, since apple fritters and raspberry donuts are my number 1 and number 2 in my playa book) then referred to me to the next customers as the "pretty lady who just joined out Twitter following group" as I stood nearby simultaneously pouring my coffee, scarfing down bites of apple fritter, and checking out Bob's Donuts on Twitter, all at once! Amazing what once accomplishes at 5am!

Would definitely go back, but man, why do donuts have to be so fattening?
author: Cheryl F.

description: I am seriously perplexed at the reviews who gave Bob's only four stars.  Seriously?  What, were you expecting a bj with your order and you got upset because all you got for your money was delicious donuts?  Get over yourselves.  That apple fritter is the bomb.  And they don't close.  THEY DON'T CLOSE!  You want an apple fritter at 2 a.m.  Boom, you got it.
author: Leigh F.

description:
There are few things in this world better than a still warm donut proffered by a sweet smiling lady at 2 am when you are drunk and are about to steal a construction sign on your way home. 
Thanks Bob's.
author: Melissa H.

description: Simple and tasty donuts. Customer service is always lovely:)
author: Erica R.

description:
Update.
Like my second home, literally!
Since I used to be good friends with the family here I have had the pleasure of enjoying Bob's for as long as I can remember.  Not only did I get to make my own customized doughnuts this was like a meeting spot for friends long time ago. It just brings me back to the nostalgia of my  teen years growing up in San Francisco.  I would like to thank don&hen for all the free fritters and cheese danishes with milk through the years! Oh and the steamed blueberry muffins with tons of butter we used to enjoy from their home on the weekend mornings when I spent the night. It's been years since I been here but I am sure the flavors stayed the same because they never changed during the time I frequented Bob's. But I do always visit when I am passing by the neighborhood. This is one of San Francisco's long time establishments that has been around for over 50+ years, you can almost call it a historical doughnut shop with all the characters who have passed through here.
author: Peter J.

description:
I really think this is the best donut I've had in my life. These epic, life changing, inexpensive little balls of sugar are seriously worth the hike down the hill. I love how non-judgemental they are of your "state of mind".  So long as you can sort of slur "apppple fritter", you're good to go.

I don't even like old fashioned glazed donuts, but I love them at Bob's. I don't know what sort of crack they put in them. I even like them when they're not fresh.

Asking the people working there what's fresh is the best way to go.
author: Jay S.

description:
I was introduced to this place by my ex-girlfriend.  At first I had my doubts but boy, she really did know her 'nuts!

Like others have said, the atmosphere is totally straight out of the 70's.  I'm sure 15 years ago, this place would have had the trifecta of smells to match it's character: cigarette smoke, coffee, and the sweet sweet smell of freshly baked donuts.  Man, just walking into this place puts a smile on my face.

Now if you don't know your 'nuts, this place is not going to be that special to you.  People who think that Krispy Kreme is the be-all end-all of donuts have NO IDEA what they are talking about.  Those sickly sweet cakes have given a bad name to donuts.  The best 'nuts come from mom & pop places, not chains.  You're not going to find those stupid pink glazed donuts filled with strawberries and creme and topped off with a big "E" specially made for Easter.  These are DONUTS.  Bob's has the basics, because donuts should be....basic.  Glazed, old fashioned, crumb, if you're lucky, you might find an eclair.

The tricky thing about Bob's is that they have limited holding space for the 'nuts, and they make different kinds at different times, so don't go in at any time of day and expect them to have "your kind."  I think their best are the GLAZED CRUMB and the BUTTERMILK BARS (loafs!).  I have no idea when the buttermilks are made but DID I SCORE when I left the Red Devil Lounge late one night (1am) and walked into Bob's to find fresh GLAZED CRUMBS less than 5 minutes old.  I have to say that those 'nuts, that night, were the best I have EVER had period.

Bless the women behind the counter.  They are so sweet and they put up with all the crap from the drunks coming in after the bars close and the weirdos who wander in or just give hand gestures through the glass window.

If I lived a little closer I would be down there right now...I'm sure there are some nice fresh glazed crumbs who are making someone's tummy happy.  Best donuts in the city.
author: Josh L.

description: We came late one night and they had very little selection so we decided to come back in the morning. The woman who greeted us was very friendly and by this time, they had a full selection of donuts. We picked out too many to eat!  The overall experience was pleasant and the donuts were tasty.
author: michelle w.

description: I really like the old fashion donuts and the apple fritters, this is As good as it gets! probably the best donut shop in this neighborhood / Nob Hill.
author: Mr Bolo B.

description:
Alright, so when visiting my cousin and is wife in S.F. they took us on a small city tour at night.  One of the stops was the great donut place she kept talking about. 

Bob's quite simply had the best old-fashions I've EVER had.  They were hot, fresh and deliciously glazed goodness.  I had both the glazed and maple old-fashions, both outstanding!

Now normally I like visiting yelp first to find great spots, but this time I came after my visit to Bob's.  I had no idea how popular this place was, and I see now this place has some of the best donuts ever.
author: Alex P.

description: Back in college I used to live near a donut shop. I'm glad I'm not near this one or I would add at least 2 inches to my waist line, especially when it's open 24 hours. Several donut varieties have this crispy texture I haven't experienced in other donuts. Be careful when you come at night, although the donuts are fresh, the people aren't. Expect stoners to cut in front of you to get their fix.
author: William H.

description: Delicious pastries.  Go inside and smell the sweet smell and you'll be hooked.  Not the healthiest snacks but they are yummy.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
The best apple fritters on earth. Hands down.

Huge warm chunks of fresh apples, fried around some donut bread and topped with a sugar glaze. Yummy...

If you dont like apple fritters, dont worry everything else is top notch..

A funny thing about this place is that four other stores on the same block are named Bob's __________. I get a kick out of it.

Wassup Bob
author: MishEddie G.

description:
I lived in the neighborhood and walked by here for 2 years - inhaling the wonderful smell of donuts.  But I had a boyfriend who had ate there and didn't like donuts .. so we always passed it by. Finally today happened to be in the neighborhood and decided to try it out - after all the boyfriend is long gone and I had deprived myself long enough I thought.
I found myself terribly disappointed with an apple fritter that was so bad I ended up  throwing it out.  I now think my foreign ex-boyfriend might not hate donuts -- perhaps it is just Bob's donuts.
The aroma from the donut shop is much more heavenly than the donut that sits in your stomach like a rock.  I don't know if the other donuts are better but I won't be tempted to go back and find out.
author: Cat C.

description:
Jules: Looks like me an Vincent caught you boys at breakfast. Sorry about that. Whatcha havin'?
Brett: Donuts. 
Jules: Donuts! The cornerstone of any nutritious breakfast. What kind of donuts?
Brett: Raised cr-cr-crumb. 
Jules: No, no no, where'd you get 'em? All-Star? 7 Flavors Coffee? Krispy Kreme? Where?
Brett: Bob's Donuts. 
Jules: Bob's Donuts? That's that spot on Polk street.  I hear they got some tasty donuts.  I ain't never had one myself. How are they?
Brett: They're good.
Jules: Mind if I try one of yours? This is yours here, right?
[Picks up donut and takes a bite]
Jules: Mmm-mmmm. That is a TASTY donut!  Vincent, ever have a donut from Bob's Donuts?
Vincent: Ain't hungry.
Jules: Well, if you like donuts give 'em a try sometime. I can't usually get 'em myself because my girlfriend's a vegan which pretty much makes me a vegan. But I do love the taste of a good donut. Mm-mm-mm. You know what they calI a donut in France?
Brett: No.
Jules: Tell 'em, Vincent.
Vincent: A beignet. 
Jules: A beignet! You know why they call it that?
Brett: Because they're French?
Jules: Check out the big brain on Brett! You're a smart Yelper! That's right. Because they're French.  What's in this?
Brett: Diner coffee. 
Jules: Diner coffee, good. You mind if I have some of your tasty beverage to wash this down?
Brett: Go right ahead.
Jules: Ah, hit the spot....
author: Lalo H.

description: Ehh.  Its alright.  I had the apple fritters.  Both occasions they were lacking of apples.  Same with the bluberry muffins.  Lacking fruit.  Hey guys, I thought this place was the shiznits.  I guess either Bob's is overhyped on Yelp or their trying to save a couple bucks by cutting corners.  Both times I went here, they were overstocked with apple fritters.  Don't expect to get a fresh one.  They have a microwave in case you need yours reheated.
author: Mike C.

description:
The apple fritter is orgasmic.  This is true.

I walked through the pouring rain to get some of Bob's mouth watering pastries.  I just downed two glazed donuts--already tasty when it's not warm, you could imagine how much better they are hot n' fresh out of the oven at midnight.  

Next time you're on a junk food kick, come to Bob's to indulge...anytime.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Came here around 10ish in the morning with my best friends and we wanted some doughnuts. But before that, I like how there is another place call BOB before this joint, a bit confusing much? Anyways they don't carry much of a variety as I thought. The service was not that great, and the doughnuts was okay, I wasn't that fully satisfy tho. 2 doughnuts came out to be $2 and some change.
author: Shirley G.

description: This is a classic old local neighborhood-type donut shop with a service counter. The help was friendly and all the donuts we tried were delicious. The prices were very reasonable.
author: Curtis H.

description:
I wouldn't call Bob's donuts sublime, but I have yet to find a better donut in the city. As an added bonus, it's around the corner from my place, so when my friends want to satisfy their donut fix after a night on the town, I always get a ride home. Thanks Bob's!

I tend to stick with the "plain cake" donut. I love the crunchy bits on the inside of the donut hole when they're fresh out of the fryer.

(Since someone will invariably ask, the best donuts I've ever had were from Donuts Delite in Irondequoit, NY. Sadly, it's now closed. http://rnews.com/Story_2004.cfm?ID=28311&rnews_story_type=18&category=10 )
author: Brad L.

description:
*************************************************
RICK'S QUICK RECAP:
Best Donuts when you're up during Baker's Hours
*************************************************

Sometimes things in life serve multiple purposes.  Bob's Donuts is one of those things.

I stumbled upon this shop during a business trip to the City and almost every trip to the City to party, eat and drink have included a pit stop here for some of their donuts before making the drive back to the South Bay.  It satisfies my sweet tooth desires AND has given me a high for the long drive home.

Aya is the friendly face who's so helpful everytime I enter after 2am and ask the same question, "what's the freshest batch"?  She then takes the time to give me a guided tour of the racks pointing out the goods.  

Not sure if it's the Asian influence but the donut batter generally isn't overly sweet.  I dig that.  It makes me end up LICKING my fingers at the end to get that last bit of sweet glaze to balance the batter.

Oh, and if you want an unconventional birthday cake...they make a huge 8 incher (...that's what she said!) donut I saw this girl buy for her husband's birthday.  

For those who enjoy an open kitchen...the damn fryer is right behind the counter.  If you're here after the bars close...I gur-ron-tee there's something fresh being fried.

4 stars for a consistently reliable hole in the wall sugar shack to keep me awake for the long drive home from late nights in the City.  For that alone....this place is priceless!    LOL
author: Rick N.

description: As a self-proclaimed donut expert, Bob's doesn't do it for me.  I assume the cult following is due to the location, ambiance (or lack thereof), or the perceived history.  Bottom line, the donuts can be heavy & greasy, your hand will have much oil on it.  The donut texture, specifically cake donuts, can be oily.  I question the cleanliness of this place.
author: mimi n.

description:
Mighty fine donuts!
None of that high sugar Krispy Kreme stuff----just good solid donuts of the kind that makes me think SF has the healthiest cops in the country-because I Never see cops in there!
I'd think they'd FLOCK to this place as the donuts are out of this world AND the milk is cold as can be! 
Perfect!!!
author: Chris D.

description:
there's the fairytale of the foot-sized donut that appears for you fresh and hot in the middle of the night. i'm here to tell you that the fairytale is true. 
once upon a time at 3am i wandered into bob's and as i walked in, they pulled a 12in donut fresh out of the oil and glazed it for me as i watched. i even got to choose the flavor of glaze. the donut was piping hot, melt in your mouth, amazingness. total donut heaven. if you're looking for the best donut in sf, go to bobs. (if you're looking for the best donut in the east bay, go to kingpin.)
author: lisa w.

description:
To give this donut joint anything less than 5 stars is a crime, because here you'll find all the donuty goodness there is to be had on this planet. They don't play favorites at this restaurant - they've got your light and fluffy krispy-kreme-style donuts AND your cakey Dunkin'-Donuts-style - a donut lover's dream!

And the women who work here are really sweet and suprisingly knowledgeable about donuts. I was quite impressed with the woman who works later in the day as she enthusiastically explained to me the difference between the glazed donut and the maple glazed donut. Did you know you can tell them apart if they're side by side? The maple glazed has a slightly opaque glaze but the regular glazed is crystal clear. You didn't know that? Well you do now and so do I!

The only drawback, and the one thing that keeps this place from five star status is the somewhat unappetizing clientele. I'm not talking about the transvestites. They merely add color to the place! I'm talking about the (occasional) great unwashed who, if they are seated at the counter or at a table, will put you off your donuts quicker than you can say "B.O." In fact you won't even get the "B" out before your stomach turns at the stench. So get those donuts to go, skip the slightly bitter coffee and head down to Peet's or Starbuck's for your joe.
author: Alison P.

description:
Came yesterday AM with the family.  I ordered a blueberry cobbler - Oh Yum! and of course a Raised Glazed.

The rest ordered old-fashions with OJ chasers. And loved them. Until they tasted a bite of the light fluffy goodness, no greasy Glazed I love. Yes, another sucessful donut day.
author: Karen H.

description:
I don't really like donuts in general.  I'll eat a donut if it's the only breakfast option.

However, I will go out of my way  to eat a Bob's Donut.  Even if it's a completely inappropriate time to eat a donut.

Bob's donuts warm and melty, fresh out of the oven (all you have to do is to ask for their freshest ones) taste like a delicious fluffy cupcake in donut-shape to me -- and i'm not even really into cupcakes either --- but it's truly heavenly.

I even enjoy the ambiance - the psychadelic mural depicting a donutland one might only dream of, framed drawings by Bob's Donut fans -- and something about the blazing fluorescent lights and the coffee counter really finish off the look.  

The last time we were there I think something exploded in the back!  Keeps you on your toes!  Exciting and delicious!

Oh yeah, they also sell a giant donut the size of your head - not kidding- that you can view in the front window.  I will probably eat one one day.
author: Liz C.

description:
I think the stars must have been aligned when i went here for the first time: parking right in front, no line, and fresh everything out for us to choose from, and i wasn't drunk so i remembered all the flaky gooey warm soft sweet goodness the day after! 

all i really need to say is wow, because really no other words can describe the truly homemade freshness... and i'm craving some right now!!
author: Maria B.

description:
My ex-boyfriend gave serious thought on going to General hospital to get his stomach pumped shortly after gorging on one of their creamy-looking puffs that pleaded "Eat Me, fool."

And he was foolish, as are all my exes - that's why they're exes.  If you're dumb enough to eat something exposed to sunlight for god knows how many hours and smushed up against a cold window that likely hasn't been washed since the Reagan administration, well - you're an oaf.

This place scares me...but I highly recommend it to all exes.
author: Mc Matty b.

description:
Mmmmm, dooough-nuts! Nom nom nom nom... (Say it in the Cookie Monster voice.)

On a Monday night at 1 am, Polk Street is almost empty and so is the shop. 

Lust is seeing those plump rings of dough floating face down in the maple sauce. Happiness is plunging one of these - warm and sweet and light - into your mouth.
author: Annee T.

description:
Bob Royally Makes KING PIN Look Like A Royal King!

Srini and i decided we wanted to give this 2.5 stars...but seriously, I can't do it...Unlike Carrie Bradshaw, i'm not a girl who needs a half!

Awful aftertaste, blah...
author: Wendy H.

description:
Bob's Donuts = Taste-gasm. New word. No joke.

I am not a life-long donut/pastry/french toast lover.  Only in the past few years, have I been able to really indulge in the mainstream junk food sensation of donuts.  Growing up, french fries and donuts used to make me gag, and most still do (something with the starch?).  It is this history that makes my love for Bob's Donuts special and pure.

Creations from Bob's not only make me want to eat a dozen on these fried dougy sweet wonders but also, these creations are so damn good that I don't feel guilty if I do eat a (half) dozen.  I've eaten Bob's sober and not-so-sober and the quality and deliciousness is consistent.

Cutting to the chase:  For the ultimate taste-gasm, go for the chocolate topped custard filled.  You will never have anything better.  For the adventuresome/inebriated/group eaters, try the giant donut which fits perfectly in a standard cake box.  As we all know, bigger isn't always better (and is sometimes worse i.e. cell phones), but Bob's giant donut maintains the optimal balance of fluffy texture and sweetness that it's normal sized donut cousins enjoy.   Also, it's worth mentioning that I have (on several occassions) managed to easily polish off a glazed donut before even stepping foot outside the bare bones shop.  

On top of all that donut goodness,  the shop is owned by good local people and is open late.  What more do you want?!
author: Deborah L.

description:
Isn't the truth of the matter that if you walk into any donut shop in SF, whether it is a Happy Donut or an Allstars Donut, that they all have the same exact donuts?  Is there a donut mafia that no one speaks about?  I thought this place was going to be different.  But, no.

Same SF Donut Mafia Donuts.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I've been here late at night post-drinking, early morning on a weekday, and early evening on a weekend. I've tasted the chocolate crueller, apple fritter, and the crumb cake donut.  I still can't seem to figure out why this place is considered so great.

I wish I could transport myself back in time to my childhood. I miss Winchell's. Now those were some great donuts!
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description:
I love this place...I've been going in here for 30 years...not every day
but often.....I don't know if anyone can really eat a whole one of their apple fritters though.....usually I just eat the icing off the top of
a chocolate old fashioned or chocolate buttermilk bar.....
I worry about their older employees though....
hope they have a nest egg when they retire...
Keep promising myself I'll buy a few of their t shirts
as souvenirs.....you never know what gentrification
will do
author: david f.

description: Tasty Donuts when they are right out of the old school fryer!  Tip-check the racks just behind cash register-  this is where you find whats fresh.  A certified greasy spoon extravaganza.
author: Kean F.

description: Enjoyed the apple fritters. They are the best! We also got to try the cake donuts freshly made with maple glaze. Highly recommended that you get whatever is being made fresh.
author: L M.

description: This place has ok donuts. I don't really see what the hype is all about. I guess maybe because they make them and you can eat them fresh here, but they still taste like regular donuts to me. I know this is going to sound bad, but I still prefer the simple Krispy Kreme glazed donuts right off the conveyor.
author: Emy s.

description:
This place reminds me of many great nights!  I have come here so often and am never disappointed.  One particular funny memory is when I came here with my boyfiriend.  I was raving about the chocolate-covered cake donuts so we ordered one and a fritter and shared.  Of course, both were delicious!

We sat at the bar and took in the diner-like environment.  Other than us and the cashier, there were only two other people there - two drunk girls sitting down the row, one loudly speaking on her cell while her friend was collapsing into her donut.  

Being open 24 hrs not only allows one to indulge in a late night fix, but to observe the animated Polk Street bar crawl aftermath.  Good people watching!
author: Lauren C.

description: Ate an apple fritter here last week upon the recommendation of my too-drunk-to-remember-the-conversation-later friend. I was not disappointed.
author: Nora G.

description:
For all you non-donut academics: Good donuts. Yummmmieeeeee. 

For all you donut connoisseurs: The truth is I did not get a chance to sample much. At 4:30 am, or god knows when it was, they only had a few donuts fresh out of the oven. I sampled a raised glazed. Very basic. Not too sugary, not too oily. 

Next time I will break into their apple fritters and jellies and update my review like the good little donut worshiper I am.

Update 8/5/07 and changed to 5 stars!
Finally got to sample another donut...

I had an apple fritter, probably a few hours out of the oven. 

The dough was delicious and hearty with a good mixture of apples, cinnamon, spices, and sugar. The cooking of the donut was perfect, just the right amount. Most non experienced donut shops will over cook their donuts which makes them dry and bready. This donut on the other hand was cooked just enough to be solid yet still creamy. MMMMMMM. The glazing was also well dispersed over the entire donut and not caked on. 

This is probably one of the best apple fritters I have had in years. Go Bob's! Definitely the BEST place to get donuts in the city!

Remember to support your local donut shops and buy lots of donuts!
author: Ali K.

description:
Nice counts for A LOT. Last night, after TOO much mead at Encore Karaoke Lounge (formerly Tango Tango), I wandered into Bob's with two things in mind: find my car and caffeinate oneself. 

Ladies and gentlemen (women), I've officially discovered the MEANING of life. Be KIND to people and eat donuts at Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop. 

ZANZIBAR (thanks Bucky K. for that line).
author: John T.

description:
When you walk by Bob's donuts, you will be accosted by a woman sweeter than the donuts and will end up getting 2 or 3 donuts when your stomach was not convinced that it wanted one.  She is a crafty donut, keeper, she is.  I am convinced that she is a direct agent of Homer Simpson as when you leave you feel the black hole pull of ,"Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm... donnnnnnnuts.  Is there nothing they can't do?".  

As a person that does not indulge in sweet things that often, I would describe their donuts as addictive.  They make a non-donut eater come back over and over.  Their buttermilk donuts are always fresh baked with the icing on the top melting like the way it will melt in your mouth when you devour it in two bites because they are that good.

They have birthday cake sized donuts that look like those pillows you sit on after you have ass surgery or something.   But, of course they taste much better.

I  highly recommend Bob's donuts whether you are drunk or sober, fat or skinny, make or female, nerdy or popular, sweet tooth or macro-neurotic in diet.

Bob's, the New Church of Slack.
author: Gwen P.

description:
I consider myself something of a donut connoisseur. This is the best apple fritter in town and a crumb donut not to be missed. Great vibe and open 24 hours. I love the counter.

PS you can microwave (they have one right there) the apple fritter if its not fresh out of the fryer.
author: Calvin W.

description:
Go to Bob's when the donuts are fresh out of the fryer (after 1am), and you'll realize how terribly overrated Krispy Kreme really is.

And P.S.: donuts are SUPPOSED to be artery-clogging.
author: The Other Jeff A.

description:
Oh Bob's, how I love thee, let me count the ways:

1. My late night best friend, sweetest gal you could find behind a counter, always a friendly smile.

2. Fresh, warm, delicious donuts at 4:00 in the morning after I have been dancing all night at Ruby Skye; what could be better.

3. The best donut I have ever had...and I know donuts.

Seriously, there is no better donut shop. Bob's, you are the love of my life. And now, I will proudly wear your T-shirt!
author: Trisha A.

description:
I'm only gonna say this once...

Best Donut Place In San Francisco By Far.

Delicious, price is good, convenient, fantastic, amazing, awesome, warm, wonderful.

You need to try this place.  If you don't like it, I fear your taste buds have gone rogue.
author: Jason L.

description: The trick about this place is coordinating your life with when they are just freshly made. Ah yes, piping fresh they are so delicious, it's just too hard to resist. My favourite is the plain cruller -- no glaze, no frosting, just fresh and it's so delicious with a simple cup of coffee.
author: Shauna S.

description:
THIS PLACE EFFING RULES!

The first time I passed by this place was when I was on my way to the deli up the street from here. The goodies displayed in the window lured me in. I damn near pressed my hands and face up to the glass and drooled at all the pastries I'd rather consume than the food we were on our way in trying. Since then I've been here three times or so.

Inside it looks like an old fashioned diner. Diner stools line a long bar-esque table where they can serve your donuts, or whatever you choose to get "happy" on. There are tables in there as well. The thing that drew it away from that old diner feeling was the LCD TV they had on the wall, which was cool because then you have something to watch, if you like, while you scarf down your sweets. Also the staff are awesome. I've been lucky enough to be helped by the same sweet ol' lady behind the counter. She's very nice and is actually a pleasure to speak to. Very friendly.

My personal favorite... the Apple whatever thingy's. It looks like an apple lasgna. Glazed apple baked goodness on top a fluffy pudding like bread that lines the bottom. I suggest trying one piece at first because it surely is heavy... seriously. One slice is like 3.5" thick, and its alllll goood. YUMMMMM.
author: Jay V.

description: Best to come around 1 a.m. My favorite donut here is the raised crumbly donut. The chocolate and maple donuts are good too. These donuts don't go stale as fast as other donuts and the make a great snack or breakfast.  It's great to have a donut that is fresh out of the oven when wanting a midnight snack or after a night of dancing. Probably not the best place for groups but still fun to come with friends.  Try their donut challenge: giant donut (est about 6-8 regular raised) to be eaten in under 3 minutes. Prize? get the donut for free and a shirt. According to the shop, only one person has succeeded. Definitely try their raised crumbly donuts.
author: Alex E.

description: I've heard much rave about this place from my friends in the city. I went during the afternoon hours to have a quick pick me up and ordered a glazed doughnut.  It was tasty, but I can imagine how much better it would be if I had ventured there during the midnight hours when they are fresh out of the oven.  The price is right, but keep in mind they only accept cash!
author: Amanda C.

description:
I haven't been here in a few years since I changed jobs.  But in my old job, I used to visit Bob's at least once a month to buy pastries for my staff.
Everything was fresh and tasty and inexpensive.  And my staff was delighted!
author: Philip C.

description:
Good coffee...Lady behind the counter tells me she has been working there 20 years and the owner has had it 30+ years.  The smell in there broke down my no donut but buying one for the kids resolve.  I don't think I had really tasted a donut before this one, not really.  

Back in line to get a few more to take home.....

Lady behind the counter smiled when I asked about Good Vibrations across the street...."many customers say its the perfect combination...buy donuts then go shoppping...."  I can almost imagine how good it would be.
author: Tracie P.

description:
Holy crap, what a donut! I'm drooling just thinking about the memory of that sweet, delicious Boston creme I had yesterday.

Bob's is the kind of establishment you can use to take the pulse of the neighborhood. Have a seat at the counter, order a donut (or two) & a cup of coffee, & watch the regulars stroll in. "I'll have the usual" you'll hear them say. And this is the kind of place where "the usual" is different for everyone. They've got every possible conceivable delicious baked treat you can think of (well, maybe not, but all the ones that matter).

Maybe not the best donut in the world (if you're ever in Portland, goto Voodoo Donuts & then try to get it off your mind, I dare you), but Bob's is worth the trek, & if you happen to find yourself in Nob Hill & in need of a sugar fix, well, you're in luck.
author: Pete J.

description:
Hellloooo Donuts! 

I used to live near here, no bueno - but in fact muy bueno if you catch my drift. 

They have this thing called Apple Pandowdy (pan-dauw-dee) that looks and tastes something like pieces of slightly cinnamony donuts packed into a baking pan, then topped with apple pie filling. Yes sir, that's the stuff I'm talkin bout. 

The apple fritters are a friend's favorite. They are HUGE. The biggest I've seen yet. Enough to last a couple days, if you have the will. 

My favorite are the cake donuts. Crumb to be exact. Delicious and not greasy. A close second is the maple bar, my childhood favorite. 

Fun fact: They make 6 donuts (one of each flavor - glaze, choc., etc.)  the size of a pink cake box on Friday and Saturday nights. It's huge, and oh so satisfying at 2am after a long night out.
author: kristen b.

description:
The crumbly goodness of the crumb cake donut I just wolfed down has reduced me to a stammering donut foo.  That donut was so freakin' good I almost want to return and get 72 more.  And I only bought one, dammit.

The 1 California does pass it in the morning... maybe I can eat 6 and bring in a crumb or two to share with my co-workers.
author: Conny W.

description:
Hands down, Bob's has some of the best doughnuts in San Francisco.  I used to walk by almost every day on my way to work.  Inevitably, I had to stop by Bob's and get an apple fritter.  Heavenly manna.

Fast forward over a year, I had moved to over a year ago Hawaii and was newly back in SF in May 2006.  I was wandering through my old 'hood and had to stop by Bob's.  The lady behind the counter actually remembered me AND my love of apple fritters.  Simply amazing.

Go there.  You won't regret it.  Well, you might regret the five pounds you'll gain, but they're worth it.
author: Todd X.

description:
EFFEN-AY!!! I've forgotten about Bob's Donuts. After moving out of the neighborhood, I haven't really made my way over to Polk Street much. But, after seeing ABC at the Red Devil Lounge last night, we walked past Bob's after the show. MMMMMMMM!!! After drinking all night (thanks to ABC starting at 10:30p and me thinking that the show actually started at 8:00p), there is nothing like a chocolate old-fashioned to stuff in your face.

BEST ADVICE - always ask what is the freshest and buy it, no matter what!
author: Rolo T.

description: I've been going to Bob's pretty much my whole life. Never realized it was so popular or famous. It's one of my hoods landmarks for sure.
author: Christina B.

description:
I am relieved and worried that I finally discovered this place.   I could never figure out why the Bay Area, with its world class baked goods, never could supply me with a world class donut.  Until now, my favorite donut could be found in San Diego (VG's in Cardiff) of all places -- In a region where I could never find a decent loaf of bread. Go figure... 

Well, the reigning title for best donut on the planet now goes to Bob's.   This is where I start to worry.  It was kind of nice knowing that my worst food temptation was 500 miles away and I could only indulge on the occassional trip to SoCal.  I am a donut fiend, and having a donut this good so close to home could be trouble.  I'll have to fight the daily temptation of the fresh, warm glazed donut and cold (hand-poured, nice touch) milk to wash it down. How can you be so fluffy AND gooey at the same time????
author: Val U.

description: My husband and I live dangerously close to this place, and I'm pretty sure he considers himself a Bob's doughnut connoisseur. They're a perfect treat at 2 in the morning when you have taken it upon yourself to close down a local bar, a great breakfast item for when out-of-towners are visiting, and, well, great anytime. Maple old Fashioneds and chocolate buttermilk bars are awesome. If you really want initiated into club Bob's, try seeing how much of one of their giant doughnuts you can eat. It's a lot harder than it looks. Yeah, Bob's!
author: Erin K.

description:
It's not hard to get a fresh from the fryer donut here, and you can actually watch the decadent morsels get glazed, crumbed, or frosted right in front of you! They have a wide variety of delicious looking pastries but nothing beats a freshly glazed donut! The donuts are not too greasy and not too sweet, they are just perfect! 
The service is also great! The owners are super friendly and they're great at remembering orders. The lady even noticed we needed a napkin when all we did was rub our sticky fingers together!!!It's open 24 hours but late hours does not mean lazy baking. I went there at 1AM and witnessed fresh donuts in the making. Make sure you have cash!!!!
author: Mimi N.

description: i always come stumbling in during the later hours of the night and i must say these are the best donuts in the city. always get what's hot! if you're lucky they'll be their old fashions. simply AMAZING.
author: Philip M.

description: Cheap delicious donuts 24 hours a day. And only a 3 minute walk from my apartment.
author: Teresa D.

description:
I can't stop thinking about this place.  

Stay away from the donut holes - the regular, plain glazed donut is much better.  But the glazed buttermilk is my favorite.  It's like a biscuit (a favorite of mine), but deep fried and then glazed.  Rich and delicious, not too sweet, I munch on one for a couple of days so I don't feel guilty.

The ladies can be nice and they can also be mean.  Dare not ask if they have anything hot during the day.  "No come at night.  We don't make them ALL the time, you know."

I have definitely been back since the older lady yelled at me.
author: Amy D.

description:
I think there is crack in the donuts.
The cravings will not stop!!!
I am officially an addict!  I would eat other donuts and it just does not fulfill the need to get a BOB's donut!  HELP ME!
IS there a BOBS ANONYMOUS?!?!
Apple fritters are sized to a baby's head!
The glazed is to die for.  And you can get little holes so you don't know how many you ate.  The guilt is less intense if you eat the holes.
The twist is a twist to the glaze...
There are soo many more varieties...but the glazed variations win me over EVERYTIME!!!  I SHALL try more varieties.
If you see me in there...Join me!!  We can sample everything together!!!

Parking?  Probably hard to find.  I do not remember how I get there. I just end up there!  I swear I think BOB's has teleportation and teleports me there.  I just end up there!!

Seating.  Limited but I always manage to get a seat!  Even if I am sitting at the bus stop.

Atmosphere....kitschy!  I LOVE IT!

SERVICE...  I love the lady that is there!  She seems to be there every single day and every hour!  I am convinced (by others) that she is a robot!

I think I am getting a donut...TELEPORT ME NOW!!!
author: Elisa O.

description:
Best donuts in SF.  And they're open 24/7.  There's nothing more you need to know.

Well, unless you think Krispy Kreme are good donuts.  Then you're just wrong.
author: Don H.

description:
Between 12am and 3am, Bob's becomes my secret weakness.  If I walk by  then, the happily lit storefront and the aroma of fresh donuts reel me in - hook, line and sinker. 

You won't tell anyone, will you? ;)
author: Hilary K.

description:
I've had this ridiculously bothersome craving for a maple bar for about 3 weeks now. It haunts me EVERY TIME I walk by Bob's on my way to the bus stop in the morning. 

Yesterday I finally gave in. 

1 maple bar please and some donut holes. That sounds weird, but let me tell you, 1 bite brought me right back into my younger years, when my dad would bring me a maple bar every Saturday morning. 

Now please, put some more mapley goodness on top of that doughnut, and it will be perfect. 

I can see a dangerous new habit forming....
author: Laura D.

description:
Oh Bob's, why do you tempt me so. Every morning on my walk to work the delicious aroma of fried dough wafts across Polk covering up the stench of the previous night's urine and beer. 

You draw me in, still bleary-eyed,  hungry for sustenance with your classic old-fashioneds and sell me a box to share with my team. They love you more than I do.
author: Sugam J.

description:
When going home alone after the bars, stop in to get your share of warm, gooey, ooohh's and aahhhh's before hitting the sack.

5 stars for always putting out!
author: Deanna T.

description:
I tried to be good and only order the fritter, but that makes for a boring review. Whatever - why are we reviewing donuts anyways? They are all sweet and fried and bad for you, so would it really matter if I said that this place had better donuts than another? The fritter tasted fresh and good, but I would eat a day old fritter and still say it tasted delicious. But really though, this little guy had bits of apple in it, so it  was probably better than most I have had.

The woman working was a slow poke, working on her clock. She didn't strike me as friendly, until I was leaving and she wanted to talk about my dog. Strange woman, but I think I liked her. And this place is cute - I love little diners with seating at the bar. It reminds me of home in the Midwest and all the little shitholes I used to eat at with the family.

Cash only, but duh - what donut shop takes Visa?
author: Brittany L.

description:
I like Bob...

His donuts are good too! Apple Fritters.
author: Anna S.

description:
I like donut shops in general, because people who go there always seem to have the most fascinating stories.  They are like the ones that show up on HBO's "Taxicab Confessions", drunk, lost, and definitely lonely. 

This one in particular is great, with its location, its fluorescent lights, and the tightly packed seats.  

Oh and the donuts are good.  They look freshly made.  You don't have to do much other than point and order.
author: Candice B.

description: The only thing not to love about this place is that it exudes delishious smells nearly around the clock and I displays it's treats right in the window and I can't always be eating them.  A place you can count on in the late hours of the night for an amazing treat that will work as breakfast in a few hours if you don't finsh
author: Matthew M.

description: I had the apple fritter.  It was cold but I can tell by the textures and the teeny bits of apple that this would possibly be amazing if it was fresh out the oven, but it wasn't.  I might change this if I go there again.
author: Matthew P.

description:
My friends Ryan and Wendy introduced me to Bob's Donuts less than a year ago, and it's been one of my favorite late night snacking places ever since.  

-Too many drinks and you need to fill your tummy?  Go to Bob's.
-Craving some freshly baked...fried...rolled  (or however they are made) donuts at midnight?  Go to Bob's.
-Curious to try a giant glazed donut the size of a medium pizza?  Go to Bob's.  

That's why I go... 

Make sure you also get a small milk to wash them down.  

So yummy.
author: Dudley F.

description:
My first school field trip took place in kindergarten and we went to a doughnut factory. These days that would be deemed totally unhealthy and boycotted by parents, school board, Department of Health and the neighborhood watch. However, I hail from the south and any good diet starts with sweet tea, real butter, RC Cola and doughnuts. It's how we do. 

So after moving out to San Francisco and living here for a bit I started to feel a little homesick. I missed that high-fructose high from my wonder years. Walking down the street, head hung low I caught a familiar whiff, unbelievably not the familiar whiff of gasoline, but of sweet buttery fried goodness. Bob's Donuts...Grandpa Bob's is now how I refer to it because I swear every doughnut and apple fritter and éclair gave me a little hug (just like Grandpa Bob would have) as I entered. Not being able to leave any of my newly found family members on display in a window I took them all home with me...and boy did we party.

Sweet, no frills, assorted, available 24/7, and cheap...like all my family members back home.
author: Delta C.

description:
The crumb donut is to die for. It's on my list for my "last meal on earth", it's that good. I've only been to Bob's during the day, but apparently I'm missing out on the fresh crumb donuts and apple fritters at 2am! 

The crumb donut is heavenly. It's very soft and cakey and the crumbs are the perfect compliment to every single bite. I love how the extra crumbs fall to the bottom of my bag so once I've finished inhaling my donut, there are still crumbs to munch on! I've also enjoyed their regular glazed and chocolate donuts. I did try the apple fritter, but I don't think they're as great as the crumb donut. Maybe I need to get a freshly made one? The chocolate old fashioned I didn't really care for though. 

Be prepared with cash as that's all they accept.
author: Joy L.

description:
The best donuts in town, hands down!  Especially if you go there at like 1 or 2 in the morning when the fresh donuts come out of the oven... oh, it's like a slice of heaven melting in your mouth.

If you haven't gone, go immediately.
author: Rose Q.

description:
Looking at the reviews for this place I was very skeptical.  "How good can a donut possibly BE, right?!"   Well, now I get it.  I just made it into Bob's for the first time today and enjoyed what was undoubtedly the MOST AMAZING Apple Fritter I've ever had. Exactly what a fritter should be, just SLIGHTLY crisp on the outside and wonderfully soft and fluffy on the inside.  And all this at around 1 PM, a time of day when the offerings at most donut shops tend to be rather stale and uninspiring.

I can't imagine how good this stuff must taste in the wee hours of the morning after a night of drinking in the nearby bars.

Believe the hype on this one, folks, this is one place where it's absolutely deserved!
author: Mike J.

description: The best donuts in the city, period.  Also the sweetest owner who remembers what I like!  Annnndddd, she sells Giant's tees...it doesn't get any better than that!
author: Kim W.

description:
Best Damn donut's in SF!!!
The later in the night the more fresh- so go late! No matter what time it is, the service comes with a smile( Ms. Dough). Maple is my flavor and she always double dip's for me!!! Yes I'm a fat ass!!! If It's jelly filled, I'm a fan!
Love this place

Check it out if you haven't yet!!!
author: ryan H.

description:
DONUTS THE SIZE OF YOUR HEAD!  Seriously!!!!  This is the busiest donut store you will find anywhere at midnight on the weekend.  This is when they fry up these INSANE donuts.  They are literally a make-up of 6 regular size donuts.  One donut fills up an entire standard pastry box which usually holds 12 donuts.

It is quite an experience to make a late night donut run.  They are fresh out of the oven and you get to enjoy them watching local transvestites and crazy drunk club people come in for their sugar fix.  Truly a SF experience.
author: Alex H.

description:
thanks to bob's donuts, i will never enjoy a donut that's not freshly made.  two nights in a row, we came to bob's at midnight for some sweet eats.  they're open 24hrs, so are always making something fresh.  

night 1 we had apple fritters and buttermilk donuts (both fresh).  i've never had a buttermilk donut and it was spectacular.  so hot, we couldn't even grab it.  the glaze wasn't too sweet (like i find krispy kreme to be).  it simply melted in my mouth.  the apple fritters we awesome too.

night 2 we had donut holes and raised donuts (both fresh).  what the heck is a raised donut?  a donut that's raised...duh.  it's just a bit thicker, and still delicious.

no one in our group tweets, so we had no idea what was being made fresh at what time.  we just showed up, waited about 10 mins, and very happily enjoyed our sweets.  why aren't there any donut shops like this near me?  :(
author: Judy H.

description: This is a great place to get your fritter on, after dodging trannie prostitutes a couple blocks South. Seriously, the pastries are yummy, cheap, in a grungy old-fashioned atmosphere.
author: Andrew K.

description: There is nothing better than a hot donut late at night, and every time I've been there, Bob's always rises to the occasion. After a little trial and error, I have standardized my order to "whatever is hot and maple flavored", which hasn't failed me yet. To my delight, I even got a free hot maple donut thanks to the Scoutmob deal - although a warm, melt-in-your-mouth donut is a cheap thrill I plan to keep paying for.
author: Caroline T.

description:
Despite the fact that I have the most absurd sweet tooth, I'm not all about donuts...but on occasion, when I'm walking by Bob's and feeling faint because I haven't eaten for oh, two hours, I have to make a stop. 

The donuts are really pretty good, but I'm giving two stars for the less than stellar service. The other day, the girl behind the counter scowled at me until I picked my donut (there was no line behind me) and then proceeded to give me the only donut that had an obvious thumb print through one side. Sounds weird, I know, but just picture it......a glazed donut....with a thumb-sized hole through the side...pretty gross, huh?
author: Carolyn C.

description:
The most randomly unrandom place to go after a night of bar hopping up and down Polk St. (or anywhere around San Francisco).  

For some reason, fresh warm donuts taste AMAZING when you've been drinking for a couple of hours.  If you're lucky enough on a Saturday night, you can get the Homer-sized donut for $3, which is big enough to feed a family of four alchoholics... but the secret is it's never enough!  

On top of that the donuts still taste good when you purchase them sober.  I've purchased donuts for the office several times from Bob's.  The only thing is you have to special order the Homer-sized donuts a few days in advance during the week because they only make them on the weekends. 

I am totally anti-krispy kreme and other donuts places just aren't as good (at least from the places I've gone to).  Take it upon yourself to enjoy in the warm greatness of drunken donut eating (or sober donut eating) if you love REAL donuts.
author: Ray P.

description:
Pretty solid place.  I've defiantly have had better donuts.  
The place- Kinda dark, old, and depressing.  I usually order and walk around. 
Price- Pretty decent pricing.  
Donuts-Large and in charge.  I've enjoyed the Apple Fritter, original, and a few other bites.  
Parking- Depends on time of day, but is usually pretty packed around this area.
author: Chase F.

description:
This one's a no-brainer. Ohh.. soo good, and really friendly service!  You must go at midnight and watch them prepare the donuts while you slowly sober up enough to finish your donut and holes. 

Oh, and keep an eye out for the giant donut, it's gotta be atleast 2-3 times the size of a normal donut, and I'm still working up the courage to eat one (and quite possibly develop diabetes all in one fell-swoop).
author: Mike S.

description:
word,

As Homer Simpson would say, "hmmmmmmm donuts." Bob's Donuts are wicked good. Chocolate, bear claws, apple fritters, glazed, all the colors of donut rainbow. All the donuts are made fresh and its open late, which is awesome if  you are on Polk st drinking late (Hemlock may haps?)

One minus is they took out the pinball machine they used to have inside, which is sad because I love me some pinball :( sadface

yups
author: david h.

description: Well color me pleasantly surprised! I've been to Bob's before, but I came by last night to take advantage of a free donut on Scout Mob. I knew the donuts were good, but I did not expect the staff to be so pleasant. When I came in I forgot how greasy and dingy the place looks and I just assumed the staff would fit in. The girl behind the counter was very friendly, patient, and accommodating. The donuts were, of course, fantastic.
author: Jeremy J.

description:
Bob's Apple Fritters are incredible. The best around bar none. Go at 1:30am and they are being made and still warm. Buy the t-shirt ($10 or $12) and have an instant conversation starter.

In fact the apple fritters are still awesome the next morning when you wake up and need something in your gut asap to soak up the alcohol from your previous evening's festivities.

Don't miss out on this spot.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Love a walk on Polk.. one of the hottest streets and some of the best eats in town. And of course Bob's donuts and pastry..they sell so much that almost anyone can get a super freshly baked or fried donut.  I love the french curls, I can kill a half dozen. These are your old fashion donuts the stuff that time cannot and should not change.
What would I do if Bob's .....I'm not even gonna say it.  , All yall have go to  Bob's and buy a dozen, support this place, when you walk in you know that you are keeping a local family afloat.
author: John L.

description:
My friend told me that I could get a donut the size of my head. I wanted to get one immediately. But it was 12 am and it was closed - that's was weird after seeing that it's open 24 hours according to everybody else here. I went back after a week or so and to my disappointment I had to order one in advanced for them to make it. So I just bought a cinnamon bun and a glazed donut. They were only average. Allstar Donuts in the inner Richmond has fresher and tastier donuts. 

Overall 3 stars, but I will have to go back and try the supersized one next time.
author: Colin H.

description:
People, people!  Bob's is good for one thing and one thing ONLY!  Apple Fritters.  S'it.  Nothing more to say.  Don't eat the other crap.  Just eat the Fritter.  Bob himself would tell you if you asked...

EAT
THE 
FRITTER!

ps... heather m just let me know that there is a donut the size of a DINNER PLATE!  IF this donut is glazed, not filled with anything, and is of the raised variety, I reccommend sight unseen.  

Love,
Sara
author: Sara W.

description:
Get the maple sugar or honeyglazed.

and get it to go - atmosphere is depressing and anyone i've ever seen sitting in there looks like they are about to commit suicide.
author: Ali G.

description:
I have to say donuts aren't usually my end of the night drunken splurge, I tend to prefer them in morning for the hangover. But last night we stopped at Bob's after a cocktail tour of the city. They were warm and fresh, right out of the fryer. I love the original chairs that appear to be from the 50's and I really wanted to park myself at the counter and watch the donuts fry. I am sure the 5 cocktails I had before hand had nothing to do with my fascination! 

Sadly they didn't have any apple fritters, but I hear those are the thing to have. Maybe next time.
author: Kai H.

description:
Bob's is wonderful.  And, they speak Drunk.

For instance, one night, my friend and I went drinking at the Cinch during one of our Polkstrasse sojourns.  After going home, my friend went into Bob's, tempted by the large window chalk full of donuts, and the sweet smell drifting out of the door.

He wandered in, and mumbled in Drunk:

"Hide hike un happllefitter plueezze."

To which the cash register girl replied, "Apple Fritter!  Right away sir!"

Bob's is GREAT at about 1am or so.  The best is getting a bag full of donut holes, and wandering the Strasse poppin' them every so often.  Right at around that time, the donuts are hot out of the fryer, and coated with sugary glaze....  Mmm....
author: David S.

description:
1.  Go to Bob's Donut.
2.  Ask them which donuts are fresh.
3.  Eat said donut or two.
4.  Enjoy the orgasm.
author: Poker B.

description:
Thank you Bob's for helping me making it through this!
That magical window of yours with them fresh yummies gets me sprung every time I pass that place! It gives me butterflies...
I would take those french crullers and the regular glazed ones over fine dining any day!

Too bad I'm far away now.... tear.

PS. Thanks for the heads up and for that T-shirt, David, i still wear it whenever I feel doughnutsy :)!
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description:
So for my first ever review, I would like to start out on a positive note with a special place close to home. What better place to start than with one of my all time favorite late night spots right? This one's for you Bob's!

 First of all, there are two important elements to what makes this place stand out:
1) You can get a donut here 24 hours a day. 
2) They continue to make fresh donuts late at night.

 A traditional donut shop generally makes most of their donuts early in the morning. This means that the later you get there, the older the donuts taste. Because they are continually making donuts, just ask the staff for one from the freshest batch and you will always enjoy that fresh donut taste. And there are only a few things as magical as the melt-in-your-mouth, fresh-from-the-fryer donut taste. Just ask any cop, lol. No seriously, ask them. That being said, most of the donuts I've tried are definitely above average in texture and flavor but at the same time not really anything extraordinary. To me, the fresh donuts are really the major appeal here.

 The other thing that sets them apart is their GIANT DONUT. You really haven't had the full Bob's experience until you've had their big donut. Yum! As far as I've seen when I go, they have at least three flavors. Glazed, chocolate, and crumb. I've gotten the big donut a few times now and I'm leaning toward the glazed as my personal favorite.
 I'd rather not ask how many calories is in one of these things but let me just say that I definitely recommend bringing a few friends along to help finish it off. And an equally GIANT glass of milk!
 Unfortunately, these are not as plentiful as the rest of their stock so they don't always have them ready but that's the unpredictability of supply and demand yeah? Also, on one particular occasion I brought home a big donut home and discovered it was not cooked all the way through. Many sad faces were earned that day =(, but that's the only time I've been disappointed it the few years I've been going. However, I still feel they deliver an above average product quite reliably and will make it a high priority destination next time I return to the mainland. 

Thanks Bob's, and may you continue to please donut lovers for years to come!
author: Freddy A.

description: There are two great donut institutions in San Francisco: Dynamo, and Bob's Donuts. Both make fantastic donuts. However, Dynamo doesn't open until 9am on Sundays, whereas Bob's opens at 6am every day of the week. So Bob's get my vote as top donut shop in SF! THE BEST apple fritter, and THE BEST crumb donut I've ever tasted. The jam donut is very good, maybe a 7/10. A perfect jam donut in SF is my white whale...
author: Jim M.

description: I'm boring and like just glazed donuts. You really can't mess that up. But this place is delicious with a big D!!!! Can't wait to get fat here!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
love the donuts here - fresh, homemade...can't beat that

There are a variety of delicious donuts behind the counter that are visible both in the shop and from the exterior. You could tell these donuts were going to taste really good just by looking at them.

We had the apple strudel, French cruellers (original and chocolate), crumb donuts, glazed donut,  bread pudding, and a chocolate cream filled donut. They were all a good size, moist, fresh, and not overly sweet. My favorite was definately the crumb donut. It's probably one of the best i've had. They were not warm b/c they were made earlier in the day, so I will definately come back in the morning between 10-3 when they make them. We got 10 donuts for a little over $10. Avg per donut was about $1+.

It's great that they are open 24 hrs, which means I can satisfy my donut craving any time of the day. We went around 8 pm on a Friday night and parking was difficult, but found a space nonetheless. There is about 8 counter seats, and a row of about 4-6 tables with two chairs each. You can also order coffee and milk to go along with your donut(s). TV for entertainment. Fyi, you might want to come early since it looked like a lot of the donuts were already sold out. There are def a lot more donuts i want to go back and try!

If you know you're going to be buying a few donuts, make sure you tell the person behind the counter to put them in a box or he/she may start stuffing 12 donuts into a single bag. The lady working tonight was very friendly.

Will come back several times!
author: Veronica H.

description:
ha ha, I love the people who get so pissed off about donuts.  Go to Whole foods damn, but no need to preach your heathy, pastry snobbery here.  
God forbid this donut shop isn't sporting the latest in interior design and comfort lighting.  You're clearly much too classy to ever find yourself stumbling home at 11:00 pm after a pint glass of whisky or two at Cinch only to pass Bobs where Ming is taking the French Curlers out of the fryer at that very moment.  I could explain, but you will never understand.  
11pm - 1:00 am = Ming makes fresh donuts everynight, he's a wizard!  The owner is really sweet and it's the latest crash diet... drink all day and eat hot donuts right before bed.  
Only down side, coffee is little more than hot, brown water.
author: Elle L.

description: Glazed donuts. Open late. Dunkin and krispy kreme are left in the dust. How can Bob's donuts be so light and fluffy? I really don't care, just give me some. Now!
author: Paula U.

description:
I would say 3.5 stars, but I'll round up for it being so close to where I live. :)

My dad used to bring me here after school and let me pick a donut of my choice as an afternoon treat.  I would always pick my staples (glazed or maple), which were also the most basic due to my lack of knowledge of all the donut world had to offer.

Fast forward to now, I've tried a much larger variety of their offerings, including the famous apple fritter, buttermilk bars, filled donuts, bread pudding, and even their muffins and croissants.  While nothing wows me, everything is consistently good, except for the occasional burnt tasting apple fritter.  Their variety of donuts is pretty large though, and I often have a tough time choosing what to get if I'm alone.  Usually, though, I just stick with my old favorite, the classic maple. :)
author: Miss C.

description: Bob's was on the way from the parking garage during our stay in SF, and we each got an old fashioned and spiced donut just to snack on - ended up coming back the next day for a dozen + apple fritter. Amazing while fresh, but also (equally? differently?) delicious over the next few days of refrigerating / melting in the backseat / re-refrigerating. Anything with filling stayed fluffy and light, anything with glaze or frosting maintained crispiness and didn't weep. I was not a donut person before, but about to hunt down an equally good old fashioned and fritter in NYC now...
author: e c.

description:
I managed to convince a coworker whose turn it was to bring goodies for the office to forgo baking a coffee cake and bringing us two dozen of donuts from Bob's.  The donuts were every bit as yummy as the reviews have said they are.  The apple fritter is absolutely delicious.  

My coworker's husband stopped by Bob's to pick up our donuts and bring them to the office.  He was a bit late due to a work related "incident" that delayed him.  His job?  He's a cop and he was late due to investigating a shooting.  My coworker's response after hearing why he was late?  "That's horrible!!  Now where are the Bob's donuts?"
author: Gordon A.

description: I came here on a late Saturday night craving something sweet and just plain bad for me.  As I approached the shop, I saw all kinds of baked goodies in the front window including the shop's giant eye-catching donut.  There was a bit of a line as people were ordering boxes of goodies including donut holes, jelly donuts and crullers.  Trying not to eat a thousand calories, I only tried the glazed donut and the apple fritter.  The glazed donut is smaller than most glazed donuts I've had but it definitely tasted like no other donut I've had before in a dense sense.  It was not overly glazed and had a soft but nice chewy bite to it.  As for the fritter, I definitely loved the crunch of the outer layer and the nice bites of apple in the fritter.  However, the fritter was extremely grease-laden to where if I bit the fritter, I could feel the oil squeeze out of the fritter.  Fritters wouldn't be fritters without its greasy goodness but this fritter was way too greasy for me.  While I probably won't order the fritter again, I plan to return to try more of their items.  The donuts and patries are definitely easy on the pocket.  Bob's is cash only and I noticed they didn't have a menu which would be nice to see considering they have a lot of goodies to offer.
author: Maya S.

description: The bestest donuts in the whole wide world.
author: Timothy M.

description:
Yes, Liz L, I suppose Bob's is only worth the visit for a midnight, drunken-necessity fix.  I visited this afternoon after reading all the great reviews awhile back.  I thought they were nothing special, and was glad I didn't bother making a special trip.  By the mid-afternoon when I got there, the selection was really low, and the donuts weren't fresh at all.  They weren't even close to as big as Donut World's (9th & Judah).  DW's donuts seem to be fresh at all times of the day, and you certainly don't need to be wasted to appreciate them!

Sorry Bob, but for me, Donut World on 9th & Judah is still holds the title of Best in SF!
author: Ari M.

description:
Sweet heaven goodness. This place is exactly that. 

If you come by close to the stroke of midnight, you get to witness heaven in the making-- the amazing steaming donut. That's right, freshly fried glazed donuts right outta the fryer. It doesn't get any better than that.
author: Lester L.

description:
Pretty much every single time I am up past 12am I go to Bob's.

I don't know the names of the donuts. I point and they bring.

Bob's is the best place in the city. I would die for them. 5^5 stars.
author: Jena E.

description:
I was so close to being happy. I figured I could just have a quick bite, and that would be enough. Yes, I was full...but you Bob...you made me burst.

The pastries here are delicious. Sadly, they're HUGE!

Well, not sad really, but you know what I mean. 

The register chick was cool, and very sweet. Chatted and smiled and all the good normal things.

The eats...gawd...my stomach is still sore...not in a bad way. In a "I ate your food and it was so much that it got me full" way.

Check it...for real...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Don't know if we went to the same place as everyone else!  Popped in about 9pm on Saturday night after hearing it was voted one of the top 10 donut stores in America.

The glazed donut was OK, but to be honest nothing amazing (maybe we've been spoiled by Stan's Donuts in Santa Clara, where we got them literally just cooked and glazed in-front of us).  Coffee was good, the bar had a bit of "charm", including a strange old-man local.  Also got a serve of apple cake thing that tasted OK but may have been the cause of dodgy-tummy related repercussions later.

A positive was the lady behind the counter who was quite pleasant.  Probably a 3 when we left, but a two the next morning!
author: Melinda K.

description: This is another one of those places that locals love, so thankfully I was there with one of those locals because I was able to dig into a still warm fresh baked donut and it was one of the most amazing experiences of my life.  I love donuts, a lot.  But I don't like when they are overly sweet and obviously they are usually cold (just something that is expected).  What ISN'T expected is a warm gooey amazing donut and that's what you get here.  Went here very late into the evening for a snack after some delicious sushi and I was very pleased.  Definitely adding this to my "every visit" list.
author: Kat L.

description:
APPLE FRITTER.

*dies*

Perfectly glazed. Crunchy on the outside. Soft on the inside. REAL APPLES. And HUGE. 

GO THERE. Get one. They're better when warm, but delicious nearly all the time. And the lady who's always there is super nice. FRIED DOUGH.
author: Regina L.

description:
Oh Bob's. What a great place to go after a long night of bar-hopping on Polk Street. I definitely recommend starting your night on southern Polk at Lush Lounge, hopping over to Hemlock, then making your way north to R Bar, or a random karaoke joint. After all this excitement, nothing is better than Bob's. 

A hot, fresh donut right out of the oven. Mmmmm.
author: Ava S.

description: I gave this place 5 stars and I hate donuts. That should say alot!
author: J.J. P.

description:
This place is awesome. We walked in just as they were glazing the donut holes right in front of our faces. The two ladies behind the counter were super nice. I wanted an eclair filled with cream, and they were out, but one of the ladies promptly said with a smile, "I'd be happy to fill one for you if you like." Excellent customer service. A++! 

And the donuts are super delicious. Fresh. Warm. Puffy. YYYUM!MM!

Not expensive. 

I haven't found a better donut shop in SF.
author: O. K.

description:
I give ten million billion stars for service.  The lady who runs it is perfect, talky but not too talky, warm, efficient, looks out for her regulars...and she told me I was slim enough to eat ALL THE DONUTS I WANT.  
The ham and cheese croissant has a good cheese to ham ratio.
The donuts are warm and comforting.
The 24 hour availability of said donuts is like god's blessing.
author: Flemm F.

description:
Oh sweet, sweet Bob's. 

The best time to go into Bob's is about  2am when the donuts come fresh out of the sizzling soy butter (yes they use soy, not animal) and you can request whatever topping you want on it. The apple fritters are a meal in and of themselves and the maple bars are like sucking on a big ole Maple tree log.
