I once even had a room mate's birthday inside Bob's and the lovely Aya (who owns Bob's with her husband) closed the shop for us.

I really don't reccomend going in here during the day, especially from 11am till about 6pm. The donuts are not very impressive at these times and it's much more fun in the wee hours of the night.
author: bo h.

description:
I used to think SF was lacking in the donut department until I found Bob's. These donuts are the real deal - skip all the teriyaki/donut shops and go straight to Bob's. 

Two notes:

Need to sober up with a bag of donuts late at night? The selection may not be great, since they run out and I'm not sure when they are restocked. If you figure out the delivery schedule let me know.

Be careful, the woman behind the counter keeps slipping maple donuts in my bag when I ask for chocolate - don't walk out of the shop with out checking your bag or you may be stuck with one.
author: Kimberly H.

description: After 9:00pm, it's two doughnuts for the price of one.  That's 2-for-1, folks.  What more need I say?  Run, don't walk, to Bob's Doughnuts. End of review!
author: Rick Y.

description: This is my late night donut place in SF! Go with whatever are the freshest donuts, particularly if it's the Apple Fritter or the Maple Buttermilk bar. Grab a seat at the counter and wash it down with milk!
author: Yi-Fang T.

description: Amazingly delicious donuts. Can't wait till I'm back in SF and can get some more :).
author: Bernadette H.

description:
Oh my holy god.  

This is the kind of place where you walk in, and you're not sure if you're alive or dead.  The glazed donuts are the best I've ever had in my life, beating out the usual Krispy Kreme and Dunkin Donuts by far.  

It's cash only, but very cheap, so don't sweat it.  I'm not sure what else to say, other than you should visit this place at least once just to check it out.  The pure frosting goodness is enough to change your life.  

Oh yeah, and they have t-shirts for sale too.  I totally have one.
author: Adam C.

description: Ok, so I have never actually been here but I was out with my friends a couple weeks ago and one of them had just gotten a bunch of donuts from Bob's.  Holy crap!  I mean, wow.  It was the most perfect crunchy outside with a sweet, chewy middle. If they develop some kind of new evidence that donuts are actually super healthy and recommended by doctors then I will start making this place a daily habit!
author: Kate J.

description: I love donuts. I always have. And I prefer donuts with character - those made with love, as opposed to the mass-produced variety. Since the first time I set foot in Bob's nearly five years ago, it's been my gold standard. The buttermilk bars are dense; the crumbs crumbly; the apple fritters are gorgeous; and everything else is wonderful in its own way - each donut a little bit different than the next. Having recently tried the infamous Voodoo variety in Portland, I can now say without equivocation that it doesn't get any better than Bob's.
author: Corey B.

description: Great donuts. Not as awesome as Pilgrim Kitchen in Belmont... Just sayin'
author: Jodie B.

description:
I haven't had a donut in years.
Neither had my bestie Natalie N.
We decided after a hard and productive day we deserved donuts!  Natalie had the traditional glazed and I had a fresh from the fryer glazed buttermilk.  We split a 2% carton of milk and moaned blissfully over the deliciousness of the donuts.
The service was excellent and so were the donuts.  I can't give them five stars because they didn't exactly knock my socks off but they're definitely made with better ingredients and more love than Krispy Kreme.
author: Jill D.

description:
I LOVE bob's. I've only been here once. And it was MONTHS ago. And I still have dreams about Bob's doughnuts.  It was in the middle of the afternoon when we got there and I'm pretty sure that the doughnuts had been sitting out there since that morning or so but those doughnuts STILL tasted good. It tasted SO good that we ended up getting a dozen doughnuts........ for three people...... and I'm pretty sure we finished it that same day. 

Bob's doughnuts and Philz coffee. Trust me, you don't need anything else.
author: PauLine R.

description:
Pros: good assortment of donuts, pastries, heart attack-inducing goodies, cheap 

Cons: it's not really 24/7

First things first.  They are closed Sundays 6 pm to 10 pm -- possibly the least  busiest hours.  But twice I came here with my boyfriend in a sudden urge for a donut to find the shop closed and dark, teasing us with its neon-lit open sign.  Even calling the phone number got no answer (obviously).  I asked the lady at the counter about their hours when I came back on a weekday.  "24 hours!" she said.  Then I asked, "Even Sundays?"  "Oh we're closed 6-10."  Ahem.  That's minus one star for not posting their hours.  Sorry, I become unhappy without a sugar fix.

Regardless, the pastries and donuts here are amazing.  I remember sitting at the mini tables on a "bad date" (not the current bf, mind you).  They are nice for an intimate post-dinner footsie, but obviously not for me.  I wished they were larger so I could get a good sugar fix without the bad date in my face.

Get the donuts and pastries when they're fresh from the oven.  I came here on a Saturday night around 10 pm and had a fabulous freshly baked glazed donut.  The other times I have come, I had the apple fritter, a cheese pastry and an apple turnover.  Amazing, but would be better if warm.  I often take the pastry/donut with me back on the 49 to the mission.  Convenient location too, a block from Van Ness!

I find it rather difficult to know what to get since the goods don't have labels.  It's all about pointing-- "the thing with nuts...no no, that one to the left, no a little farther..."  I often have to go outside to look through the window and decide what to want.  Was that an intentional design decision (give people fresh air? let pedestrians experience the goods?)  or just simply bad layout?

The ladies at the counter are unpretentious.  They happily accommodate both the rowdy club-goers and those coming for a quick sugar fix.  The walls are filled with glowing reviews of the place, but still they carry a community feeling.  "Friends are welcome here."

When I first came here, I went to Bob's diner on the corner.  Confused as to why I didn't see any donuts, I immediately saw some glazed eye people outside and followed them.  And so begins my love of Bob's donuts.  Just do a little improvement and you will be so much more loved!
author: Jenn N.

description:
When I was a drunk in the mission/castro area, Nizarrios and that elusive bacon-wrapped-hot-dog guy were my pit stops along the way home. I would never say that I don't dearly miss them; they're sacred to me.

But alas, I have relocated to the Nob Hill area, and have begun frequenting Bob's Donuts.

Between party donuts larger than the size of my face and donut holes about the size of human testes, they've more than earned my drunk loyalty. And in spite of the fact that gin is seeping out of my pores each time, that lovely Aya still smiles and even (I think...) FLIRTS with me! I would love to believe that her coquettish laugh is just for me, but I have my doubts. 

Bobsies only gets 4 stars, though, because their quality greatly decreases outside of the 12am - 2am time frame. In fact, I don't think I've ever been in there during daylight/sober hours after a rather disappointing 2pm visit.

Stick to a midnight schedule and two-drink minimum, and you should enjoy yourself.
author: Brian K.

description: This may not be a North Beach bakery but it's damn good. They are always baking and will tell you what's fresh. The also stay open until the wee hours and are super friendly. Love these guys.
author: Edward N.

description:
I am legitimately shocked that only one other person has mentioned the pretzel doughnuts.  Do yourself a favor and try one the next time you venture down to Polk and Sacramento.  They come in glazed and cinnamon & sugar varieties.  As an added tip, pop it in the microwave for 30 seconds before you sit down to eat it.  Incredibly moist and chewy.  I promise you won't be sorry you ordered it.

Pretzels aside, Bob's is an overall great doughnut and pastry shop.  I love knowing that if I'm awake and hungry around 11:30pm, I can walk a couple blocks to Bob's and pick up a freshly-made (and delicious) chocolate old fashioned.

In your excitement to stuff your face with some sugary goodness, make sure not to leave your cash at home; Bob's doesn't accept credit cards.
author: Patrick H.

description:
Dropped by at 1am and the place was packed with a line running out the door.  It was a bit of a wait, but I was transfixed with the donut making process, I really didn't mind.  The odd thing though, was the place didn't really smell like frying dough... it smelled like something else, though I couldn't put my finger on it.  Almost like soap or detergent.

The donuts were fresh and hot.  Too hot actually, and I had to give them a few minutes to rest.  The texture was great, but both the chocolate and maple glaze had a bit of the unidentified fragrance in it, and it really didn't taste quite right to me.
author: D X.

description:
I think I have found where god lives and it is at Bob's donuts!!!  I went there after a horrible dinner on Friday and let me tell you, I almost had an orgasm at the counter.  I sat there w/ my friend, and what a doll he picked up the bill and  let me do the ordering!!! 

Am I a lucky girl or what?

Let me tell you, there are 3 choices and that is plenty! Chocolate, maple, glazed!  All you need in life!!!  If i was not afraid of weighing 500lbs, I would move into the back corner and become the crazy donut lady.  God has created this spot as the best place ever!  This is for sure a new stop on gluttony gulch!
author: Nicole F.

description:
Donuts are best when fresh, but unfortunately, we came at a time that nothing was "hot out of the oven." Got an apple fritter nevertheless because we were already there. I was just OK, but I imagine it to be super duper good when hot and fresh. 

Amy C--genius idea about the twitter for Bob's.
author: Ava C.

description: The cinnamon cake donut was absolutely perfect, light, and very fresh. I'm pretty sure I could eat just those until dying (probably fairly quickly) of diabetes/happiness related causes. I was enjoying the apple fritter just as much - so nicely puffy and cinnamony and not TOO apple-y, with a nice crispy frosty exterior - until I had finished 3/4 of it (it's enormous, by the way - normally I don't have time to think until I've -finished- a baked good) and realized the glaze is too sweet (for me at least). At that point I thought I would probably not get the fritter again, but thinking about it again now makes me think I should try it again... just in case.
author: Lisa K.

description:
i was walking home on polk street looking at the shop windows, when suddenly in one of the shops i noticed a movement.

a bit confused i stopped in front of the window and looked closer. it was a bakery window - bob's donut&pastry. in front of me on the shelf, between the chocolate-covered donuts and the oatmeal cookies there was a beautifully-glazed apple fritter waving at me.

considering myself a devoted activist for pastry-rights, i stepped into the bakery. "this apple fritter -" i started saying to the woman behind the counter. "yes, an apple fritter" she smiled at me, picked-up the fritter and put it in a small bag.

"anything else?" she asked politely. i looked at the bag. the fritter, with a huge gratitude expression whispered "t h a n k - y o u".

"ehmm... just a medium coffee" i answered.

i took the fritter and coffee and sat by the table towards the end of the little shop. the coffee smelled great. i took the fritter out of the bag.

"oh thank you thank you thank you!!!" cried the fritter, smelling the sense of freedom. i looked at it. this chubby cake with beautiful baking tan and generous glaze above.

"free at last!!!" cried the fritter. such a pretty piece of bakery, i thought. what a divine smell.

"how could i ever -" were its last words when i raised it into my mouth and took the first bite.

the moist dough, the sparkling glaze, the small apple pieces hiding inside...

another sip from the coffee. another bite. mmmm....

three minutes later all's gone. i thanked the lady and sneaked back to the street on my way home.
author: Li L.

description:
Sometimes you feel like a nut..and sometimes you feel like a chocolate-frosted cake donut from Bob's.  It's okay, no one is judging you.  

Bobs--cheaper than therapy.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
So I watch the Simpson's film. I get a craving for doughnuts. That's basically all it took. 

Yelp search turned up this 24 hour gem. First of all this place is small. Before you enter you are smashed immediately into the line. Nothing like getting whacked with the door for the first 8 minutes. But the aroma traveling from the doughnuts make the pain worthwhile. Talk about character. This place has the strangest mix of clientele this side of a 24 hour Carl's Jr. inside a bus station. It's just odd to see a bunch of drunks in line for pastries. Sorry, back to the food.

I ordered 1 maple, 1 chocolate cream doughnut and milk. Chocolate...blah. Maple....sweet jesus. If Krispy Kreme is the crack cocaine of snack food, this is heroin chic. Unreal good. Staff was friendly and worked fast. Good feeling about this spot, will be back again.
author: Brian A.

description: The best donuts in the city.  Open 24 hours.  I don't think I have been there during daylight hours; I used to bring their donuts for my SO and her coworkers... you can imagine how beloved I am at her workplace.  Just prepare to stand in line with some really drunk people if you go after 11pm.  Sometimes it is entertaining, sometimes it is annoying, but it is always worth it to get an apple fritter.
author: Michael C.

description:
I too (actually I 35th) must also express my fondness for this particular donut establishment.

Keep track of the time of the evening when your favorite donut type is made, and you will be ooohhh soo happy uuuhhhgghhhhrrrr... (Do raised glazeds still come out at 10:30pm?)
author: Bruce L.

description:
A long, long time ago before the interwebs was blasting away, Bob's use to have a small printed sign on their door, "Bob's Donuts, the Official Donut Maker of the Knights of Columbus".  I knew right then the donuts would be great because you just can't put up a sign like that and not back it up.  The only higher endorsement would be the SFPD.  

This place is great because of the donuts and cool because everyone gets treated the same.  The sweet older woman who works the afternoon is great, always smiling and pleasant. Like an auntie handing out fried, doughy treats! 

I get the much underrated powder sugar cake donut.
author: milo a.

description:
The staff is always so amazingly nice and friendly. 
The donuts...well. 

They are ambrosia. Nectar of the gods and all that. So delicious. Their buttermilk bars, apple fritters, old-fashioned (plain, glazed, chocolate glazed, maple glazed), raised and cake are just amazing. Cooked to perfection and easy on the digestive system. Excellent all the way. I cannot get enough of these wonderful donuts! The fact that they are available 24 hours a day makes them even more amazing.
author: Desiree V.

description:
I just moved from Clay and Larkin (a mere block away from this tasty amazingness) to Nopa and while I love me some Alamo Square park, I can't get over the feeling that I've left something behind. And that something is Bob's.

Oh Bob, how I miss thee.

I miss thee in the morning, when I'm hungover with last night's boytoy in tow. 
I miss thee in the evening, when I'm too lazy to walk another block for a proper dinner and I decide that a cake donut is nutritional.
I miss thee at 3am after a long night at the Hemmy, stumbling home and chanting "Fresh off the hopper!" with friends.

Bob, you were my friend. You were my confidant. And now, you're not on my block - you're FAR AWAY. 

But don't think we're breaking up. I'll see ya next Saturday night, as always. Love ya, mean it.
author: Aubrey S.

description:
Nothing fancy.  No assembly line of fresh donuts like at Krispy Kreme.  It has the feel of a dive.  One lady at the counter, couple of tables and chair around.  But who goes to a donut place for ambiance?  

2 words, Apple Fritter.  Get it, eat it, and smile.  

Their buttermilk bar isn't bad either.
author: Jerry W.

description: I've been here twice and I've gotten the huge donut every time. DELICIOUS. It's probably one of the best donuts I've had...so fresh and flavorful.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Quite frankly, if you don't like Bob's Donuts, we are probably never going be friends.  (Possible exception if you're a hot chick, but that would only be temporarily until I found a chick that was maybe slightly less hot who liked Bob's.)

The 5 Commandments of Bob's:
(1) Ask what's fresh and stick to those choices.  
(2) Never pass up a fresh apple fritter.  
(3) If the apple fritters are gone, do not pass up something with maple topping.  
(4) Don't fear if no Fritters or Maple-topped selections, it will still be great.  
(5) Guys, if a chick is overly friendly to you in there, don't get too excited, she's a prostitute.  (Hey, it's Polk Street, you already knew that!)

Ok, enjoy!
author: Nick L.

description:
are you kidding me?!?!? did i miss something?!?!
hmm...... for some reason EVERYBODY and ther damn mom loves this place

yeah, its great because they make hot fresh donuts @ 2 in the morning when ou're drunk outta your mind, and you're just in the mood to eat something... ANYTHING
but c'mon its just a freakin' donut shop, nothing to call home about, and nothing to where you have to VEAR outta your way to get a damn donut...

even though their olde fashion is pretty decent.
author: Ken T.

description: Good Donuts but not as good as I remember.  I grew up about two blocks over and my grandma would take us to Bobs for a donut after school but its not as good as I remember.  They still offer great sweet treats but I would not go as far as saying this is the best donut shop ever.  Still pretty tasty though.
author: Henry S.

description:
Hands down, the freshest, best tasting donuts I have had.  It makes a world of difference when the donuts are freshly made.  

Watching the donut maker is a show in itself.  He's like a little donut ninja.  Its mesmerizing.  Another must see and must eat.
author: stephen s.

description:
I live down the street and frequently have passed this place time and time again.  It's just a donut shop, why would I ever give it a seconds thought?  Well wasn't until playing around on Yelp bored at work, (Shhh don't tell.)  I saw this place was not only down the street, but had insanely good reviews for a donut shop. (Not to mention a high quantity of reviews too.)  

High expectations, whatever...maybe I need to be drunk at 2am?  Maybe they need to be warm?  It's a donut shop, a good one yes, but a donut shop nonetheless.  Crazy fantastic?  Who knows...(Maybe)  Who am I to judge after 1 trip?  I mean, yes...they were tasty.  But I'm not a donut eater and I am partially glad I wasn't 5 star impressed, that would just be dangerous considering my close proximity.
author: Mary R.

description:
I've been looking for a good place to indulge in donuts, and Bob's isn't it for me.  I've been twice now and both times I've found the donuts to be over done, I like old-fashioned, apple fritters and buttermilks and I have tried all three of Bob's attempts at these fried dough gods.  The old fashioned are okay, but I found the apple fritters and buttermilks to be overdone on the inside, not doughy enough for my tastes, and I've found the glaze to be lacking.  Call me crazy, but if I'm going to eat a donut I want it to be covered in chocolate/glaze/maple goodness.  It's not like I'm trying to be healthy by stepping into a donut shop.

On both of my visits an older asian woman has been working the counter, she's very nice and the donuts are reasonably priced, I just haven't had an enjoyable trip yet.

The search for a good donut in San Francisco continues...

My advice is to pick another treat to indulge in, these donuts aren't worth the calories.
author: Josh T.

description:
I thought I was over donuts. I thought that relationship had ended a long time ago. But then came Bob and his 2am donuts. My girlfriend had a show that night @ Cinch and as we walked home around 2ish, she stopped in for what I can only describe as mouthwatering goodness for your soul. We didn't have any cash leftover to try the Homer sized donut, but they looked so fabulous sitting there all warm and pretty like. 

I am a huge fan of donuts again, thank you Bob. Now I have to start going to the gym again.
author: Kristin H.

description:
If it weren't for my co-worker I would have never known about Bob's Donuts. I absolutely love this place!

Their Apple Fritters, Ham & Cheese Crossiant and  the Chocolate bars are my absolute favorites!! There's not a moment where I cannot just walk past this place without having to stop and drool over the massive amounts of donuts in the window...and only to find myself going inside and purchasing one of them babies!

Best of all, it's opened 24/7!! PURFECT!!!! :D 

Sad thing for me....I don't work nearby anymore! :(
author: Serena W.

description: Wow, best old fashion donut!  I love places that don't try to be fancy and take pride it what they do, like making the best freshest donut possible.
author: Ryan T.

description:
I have gone here more times than I care to admit, they are excellently (or unfortunately) located very close to all three places I do grocery shopping. 

The good:
 - They start making fresh doughnuts around 9 pm. Go in any time after that and ask for whatever is freshest, whatever it is, buy it. It will be divine.
 - Fresh apple fritters are Delicious.
 - They are cheap, a doughnut will set you back 0.75 - $2 ish depending on what you get. 
 
The bad:
 - After you have fresh doughnuts from them, their normal ones are meh at best.
 - Their non fresh doughnuts are meh at best. Comparable to other doughnut shops, but nothing to rave about.

Conclusion:
If you are in the area, especially after 9 pm. Go here and try some fresh doughnuts, they will be delicious and you will enjoy them.
author: Zeke K.

description: Everything in here is delicious! The chocolate croissant is just heavenly! It's soft, melts in your mouth and not overly sweet. The bread pudding is also a must! It's not your normal recipe, it has sweet apples an cinnamon decorating the top! Plus, the lady that works there is sweet, respectful and helpful if you can't decide what delicious goody you want.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Will pay for an expensive cab ride to take me here at 2 in the morning. It's just that good. 

My personal faves: 

Apple Fritter 
Cruller
author: Regina A.

description: Had the apple fritter and glazed doughnut, have to say the glazed was the best I have ever had
author: Frank T.

description: I can go here and get a fresh donut and a small carton of milk at any time  of the day -- or night. I love sitting at the main counter. Be sure to take cash!
author: Jennifer S.

description: yes. the one and only. the place i dream about most when i'm not in san francisco.
author: rob-b s.

description:
This place is so popular, but WHY?

They didn't have glazed buttermilks, and the donut holes tasted 3 days old.

Luckily, the place down the block had a much better & fresher selection!
author: Misha F.

description:
Hot n' fresh donuts around the clock?  Fresh glazed or chocolate donuts the size of dinner plates at 1am on the weekend?  Are you kidding? The super nice younger woman who works here makes this a fun place to hang around late at night and people-watch all the weirdos.  That is, if people-watching is your idea of fun.

Edit: Holy shit.  Bob's is a black hole.  I dare you to take a step within a 5 square block radius and not get drawn in by the smell of maple frosted french donuts.  Can we give this place more stars?
author: Mike A.

description:
Back when I was a full-time fatty (I used to tip in at 396) this was my favorite place to get Apple Fritters.  Hands down the best, and maybe biggest, in the city.  I used to buy 3.  One for the wooble back to the car.  One for one-handed stuffing while driving home.  And, one for back home on my couch.  Pure sugar-adled bliss!

Now that I care about my health I no longer frequent this fine establishment.  But, for those of you who can eat such things and not bloat up like a Macy Day float this is the place to get sugar doughy warm evil goodness!
author: Travis E.

description:
In the words of the immortal Homer Simpson MMMMMMMMM...Donuts! 

If the immortal one could one day leave his beloved Springfield and meander here to our lovely city by the Bay. He would soil himself upon entering said fried dough nirvana. 

What more does one have to say, if it is good enough for a Homer Simpson creamy surprise it is good enough for you too.
author: Peter S.

description: I came in at 4:30am and it was just me, my friend, and a cop. My friend and I were indecisive about which donuts to get for work, and it was not made easier by the fact that nothing is labeled. We had to play this game where we would go outside, see something delicious, go back inside, get the dude's attention away from the tv, either describe the donut or walk back outside and point to it. This happened several times. Poor service and difficulty in ordering aside, the donuts themselves were pretty good. I had some almond ring thing and it needed more glaze or sweetness. I also had a gigantic slice of apple bread pudding and I was only able to eat about 1/3 of it. The apples at the top were obviously the best part. I'd probably come back here since not many places are open at 4am, but the dude who works here needs a serious attitude adjustment.
author: k h.

description:
Its hard to believe that anyone could rate this San Francisco institution with fewer than five stars....

Drop by around 1 am for fresh apple fritters on a Friday night.  For a brief moment  you can feel like you live in NYC, as there's a line out the door well after midnight for snack food... the late night crowd is fun to watch and the donuts are fresh... so fresh that a friend I'd introduced to Bobs said, "It's like eating a cloud."  Now, having never eaten a cloud, I can't vouch for his simile, but I can vouch for Bob's donuts, any time of day or night.
author: H.A. ..

description:
Hangover + Cheese danish = Not so hungover anymore.

Thanks, Bob's.
author: Sarah H.

description:
While a friend was visiting after a sad breakup, i decided what better time to check off an item from my top 100 eats list than now while vegging out venting on boys. So we threw on the uggs and hoodies and off the Bob's we went the goal was to try their apple fritter - and drown the sad situation in sugar. But alas they were out of apple fritters so we had to substite them with a few merenges, peanut butter cookie, bear claw and macaroons...all of which were very good w/ a side of milk, wine and vodka (I wouldn't suggest the vodka side - that was her drink of choice for the evening though). 
As we were waiting another set of girlfriends rolled in also on a mission for the apple fritter only to be disappoitned. I guess it was their 4th visit trying to score the item and they were out again. 
Well we scored the 2nd try. The hubby went last night and brought them back as a surprise. I saved mine for breakfast and after a minutein the toaster oven it was the perfectly sugary sweet - but not too sweet addition to my morning coffee. Very yummy and it's your typical old donut shop. But if you want their fritters be prepared to try a few times before lucking out.
author: Audrey V.

description:
AAAAA-Maziing. had these one late night super FRESH!. its best to go late night because they make the new batch later in the night. 

if you go around 8 or 9 they are ehhh cuz they've been there all day.
author: Jen M.

description:
Best donuts ever!  

You can even get a GINORMOUS one!  MmMMmmMmmm yom yom! 

Open all night and great if you want to challenge to owner to SUDOKU~( he sucks tho cant even do a 2 star one)!
author: C W.

description:
The hours and hours it takes to make the apple fritters is best understood when you make the pilgrimage at 1:30 am and find a fresh batch having 
just been pulled piping hot out of the oven.

A San Francisco gem.
author: Jim W.

description:
7x7.
Apple Fritter.
Done.

Not bad but if it wasn't for 7x7, I probably would not have wandered in here to try a donut.

Good times.
author: Jimmy N.

description:
Fresh made donuts that are the size of my head...err..face..

I plan to go back when my stomach lets me eat more than two donut holes.
author: Theary K.

description:
B - O - B - APOSTROPHEEEE - SSSSS

Bob's donuts is the best thing to hit Polk St since... hmm (crackhead, drug dealer, guy who dresses up like the chick from Wendy's commercials?)... the point is that Bob's brightens up the block with the sweet aroma of fresh-baked croissants, delightful apple fritters, and mouth watering eclairs. 

I LOVE you Bob's!  And the woman who works there, who we have appropriately named "Bob's Donuts Lady" is the nicest woman, happy to see us no matter what hour of the night, and appeared in our video for our buddy's birthday.

AND IT'S OPEN 24-7.  So you can get your sweet tooth on any time, day or night.  LOVE YA BOB'S!
author: Julie L.

description:
We went to find the famous Apple Fritter, but a gooey, rectangular, mass of apples, syrup and smooshed donut pieces (possibly some kind of bread pudding) stole our hearts, and we got that instead. She called it some name (not bread pudding) that I wish I could remember, but whatever it was, it was truly amazing.

The regular donut, on the other hand, (which Seth got in case the apple-brick wasn't enough) was just a donut...

But 5 stars for the Gooey Apple Whatever-It-Was-Called!
author: Alexa A.

description:
The cheese danish was just "eh." The pastry part itself was quite good, but the "cheese" part of the danish tasted more like watery cinnimon bun frosting. It was a bit off.  On an up note, my boyfriend went nuts over the eclairs.  

Out of nostalgia, I'll definitely give the place a second chance, and update y'all when I do.  According to my mom, I used to gorge myself on their doughnut holes when I was a wee one.
author: Cat W.

description:
Be smart! Go late and get the fresh stuff! 

Not really your CIA pastry chef gourmet donut place, but nice cheap fatty deliciousness! 

please check out my food blog for a full review with photos!
author: Lily K.

description: Damn it, Bob! You make it way too easy to get carried away. My absolute favorite is the double-raised crumb donut hot out of the oven. My second favorite: anything else hot out of the oven. Also recommended: extra pastries for breakfast the next morning, their bearclaws and cheese danish are like new after 30 seconds in the microwave.
author: carrie c.

description:
Dear Bob, 

Are you real? Like FO' REAL?  If so, REVEAL THYSELF, you magnificent BEAST of a donut baker!   We're practically wedded b/c I had two of your donut babies last night.  

Make an honest woman out of me...the only ring I need is your glazed donut.
author: S K.

description:
Just got some inside info on this place last night, went at 2AM. Okay when I say amazing.... I mean getting hit by the flavor train!!!! This place is an oasis of pastries. By far the apple fritter and honey glazed are the best you have ever had!!!! There donuts are like 3 1/2". Its like a double donut !!!!! I have to say being new to this city (from Orlando, FL) This is the ultimate donut shop. If they would serve beer I would move closer to it!



Not 5 stars.... 100 stars!!
author: Ray C.

description: Great donut shop - one of the best in the city. II have had friends who went on date, came here thereafter, and are now married. The donuts are awesome. I still remember meeting friends there after their birthday years ago. Great place - opens late.
author: Johnson H.

description:
I was let down by the Apple Fritter.  Maybe I should have waited for it fresh out of the oven.  But then again, I'm pretty sure that anything fresh out of the oven will taste delicious.

What I did appreciate was the ambiance of the place - a late night hangout when you're craving a cheap sweet fix, or something straight out of a gritty film noir.  Unfortunately, in my opinion the baked goods are serviceable, but still on the level of a Safeway bakery.
author: Jeremy C.

description: I'm in love with BOBS. Everytime time I'm in the city, late night is BOBS puts me right to bed.
author: J. Avid P.

description:
Bob's is one of the treasures of Polk street.  Full of perfect, fresh donuts, late-night characters striaght out of a Tom Waits number, and some of the kindest, most patient counter attendants on the planet, Bob's is one spot I pray will never disappear.  If you stay up late enough, a fresh apple fritter is a serious treat.  Whatever's  fresh and hot, though, is the thing to get.
Grab a stool, watch some fuzzy TV alongside a priest and a comic-book dude drawing vampires, and enjoy your donut.
author: Poppa W.

description: At 11pm, the hot and fresh donuts are out--- and freshly dipped donut is pretty delicious. And they are cheap. But not to die for. And at other times (normal hours when the donuts aren't fresh), they aren't better than any other donut shop.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Ummmm cholesterol...
BOB'S  Chocolate French Twists will be the death of me!
I cant not go past w/out munching 3 or 4 of them and as I live just 
up the hill and park in the garage around the corner I go by a lot.
Even have three of their tshirts. Smoking good donuts! If you 
know what I mean....
The lady who runs the place is an real angel.
It just dosnt get better than BOB'S DONUTS.
author: arthur c.

description:
The donuts here are amazing.  They're big, tasty, and fresh.  No matter what time of day or night I go in, they're fresh - I've never had a bad donut here.

I took off one point for ambiance - it's very bare bones, and more suited for take-out.
author: kiki d.

description:
Ack! OMG so good! I was visiting a friend in San Fran and after a late night show at the Rickshaw Stop we stopped here! I couldn't remember the name but I recognized it from the pictures (yay for Yelp)!

THE BEST DONUT HOLES! They were hot and delicious! I got a maple bar too, soooo good! The cabbie wasn't thrilled about waiting for us but we told him we'd buy him a donut so he was a-ok then! 

Totally cheap, and from what I remember cash only!

I can't wait to come back next time I'm in the city!
author: Lisa G.

description:
Yep
Bob's is the Shit....especially at 12:30 in the morning when you pop in and donuts are bobbing around in the fryer.  I ordered up a dozen and some of those were comprised of super hot old-fashioneds.  My favorites were, cinnamon and crunch cake donuts, and the super crispy old fashioned with the maple frosting.  The cake donuts have that soft chewy inside with the perfect hint of sweetness.  The crunch in the old fashioned was sublime (but I like certain baked goods overdone and the rest underdone (the Gemini in me;)) The Muni ride over there was soooo worth it.  And walking down Van Ness munching on donuts was a great end to my night.
P.S. I found the guy working there to be super nice and helpful as well as all the patrons behind me waiting while I ordered.
author: Sheila Y.

description:
Donuts as big as your head!! Only available at 1 or 1:30 in the morning on the weekends. Or you can order them ahead of time and pick them up.

Wonderful selection of donuts. Owner is super sweet and friendly. She puts up with a lot as there are many crazy homeless people wandering that part of the neighborhood in the wee hours of the night. She deals with them in a very chill "go away now, you don't know any better and you better not try to take my tip jar again!" kinda manner. 

This is my go-to place for late night sweet snacking and dessert after eating at Nara!
author: Christine C.

description: Really amazing doughnuts--so tasty that it almost (ok, it did for me) took the guilty feeling right away--all I have to say is: apple fritter, glazed buttermilk doughnut and maple bar--wow!!!
author: Rachael H.

description: I think one advantage to where I live is being able to walk to Bob's Donuts in 30 seconds at 2am in the morning. They have a huge variety of donuts and pastries to choose from, AND MILK! I always go for the maple glazed donuts, it's a must! Although their other creations are great as well, such as their bread putting. Even at 2 am sometimes their friers are still on and you can still get fresh donuts! what more can you ask for when your donut cravings hit you? however if it's a friday/saturday night always expect a line, it seems like all the high/drunk/normal/weird people decide this is the best time to get donuts. Although in the end the donuts are definitely worth the wait!
author: Grace L.

description: This place is amazing.  Hot donuts at 2:00am.  Myself and two other people shared one of their Giant Donuts, which all of us thoroughly enjoyed.  After spending an evening at the Red Devil Lounge, this is the place to hit up for a late night snack.
author: Chris C.

description:
Truly excellent donuts... try visiting late at night to get them fresh and warm.

They could improve on the custard though.
author: shaun l.

description:
We went here after going out to the bars one night.  Although I was drunk, I remember my apple fritter being pretty tasty.

A couple of my friends shared this cake sized doughnut.  They actually put it into a cake container.  There must be about 5,000 calories for the doughnut and they finished the entire thing!  I'll give it 5 stars for entertainment value on that alone and thank god it wasn't me eating that.

I don't know, I can't give this place 5 stars overall, because it is a fairly greasy doughnut shop, but overall, its really good.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Been here a few times hoping to experience "the joy."  Thus far, far from it.  Just your usual "old donut" taste.  So, I'm going back when they are supposed to be fresh and hopefully have a reason to put more stars on the review.

Fresh Tracker - Fresh donuts are made from 11pm to midnight.

UPDATE -- Came here when the donuts were fresh out of the oven (11:30pm for some old fashioned).  Holy Yum Yum!  Have to bump them up from 2 stars to 4!  If only they had them fresh all day...
author: Dan M.

description:
So I didn't realize how popular this place was until I read the yelp reviews. In fact I would have never known about this place if it wasn't for yelp. Whenever my friends and I spend a night in San Francisco I'm sick of eating at Mel's or the bacon hot dog cart (I got food poisoning and will never touch one again) a donut is a perfect why to get some carbs to absorb the alcohol. 

The place is abuzz after hours which seems like like a regular ritual for some. I got the glazed to eat right away and 1/2 dozen mixed with a apple fritter to bring back to my husband. I'm be sleeping until the afternoon and I would have breakfast ready! How sweet am I?
author: elizabeth o.

description: I saw this on a list of "must go to" SF things.  I found myself walking by on a tuesday night around 10:00pm and stopped in to grab some donuts because I had read such good things.  Maybe my problem was when I was there, but I wasn't impressed.  There was a large selection of pastries, but I didn't see anything fresh.  What we got tasted average.  If I am walking by I may give it a second shot, but I won't go out of my way.
author: Owen S.

description:
This place is the reason I gained five pounds in three days. 

Apple fritter donuts @ 1:30 AM. ONLY AT THAT TIME! Hot. Crunchy, Fried. Gooey. Warm. Sugary. Tender. Soft. Forget the orgasam--lay on the apple fritters! Speechless...
author: Wendy L.

description:
When I found myself in Bob's territory before a movie, I stopped in for a couple donuts.  It was mid-afternoon, so I realize that the donuts have probably been sitting around since midnight or so.  I found the donuts to be tasty but not exceptional.  I'll be sure to go back and try it again, but it won't be an enthusiastic-trek-across-the-city-just-for-this kind of trip.

In Seattle a couple months ago, I was spoiled silly by Top Pot donuts, and every donut since has to be measured against Top Pot.  So, alas, my experience with Bob's was simply average.
author: Brett N.

description:
1st attempt at tasting the infamous Bob's donuts was an abysmal failure.    Bob's is open 24/7 but happened to be closed on Monday for Labor Day.  Who knew?  Closed on the one day that I finally made it over there for donut deliciousness?  What a letdown.  I tried to not take it personally but when I am jonesing for a buttermilk donut, its hard not to....

Take 2 was Saturday morning.  So many choices and they all looked good.  Brought several varieties of buttermilk donuts, old fashioneds, glazed etc.  Brought over way too many donuts to a friend's house around the corner and we did a donut version of "cookie party."  More fun than watching Sarah Silverman.
http://sarahsilverman.comedycentral.com/video/index.jhtml?videoId=80925

It will take a while for Bob's to earn back my trust.  Leaving me in my donut needing lurch while they relaxed on "Labor Day" was painful.  Now I'll have to call ahead to be sure they are open.  My innocence is gone.
author: Aaron T.

description: When they're fresh off the stove, OMG! So light and delicious!  Better than any other donut I've tasted! Open 24 hours!
author: Julie M.

description: I love the lady that manages this shop.  So friendly, cares about her customers, and loves to talk about the neighborhood.  Delicious fresh donuts.  I like the buttermilk but everything I've tried is good.
author: John D.

description:
The BEST.

Raspberry Jelly-Filled Donuts.
author: Angie C.

description:
Bob's donut's at 12:30am after a hard night of drinking and smelling the sweetness in the air?  Priceless.

Great little hole in the Wall place.  The donuts were amazing.  Light and sweet, they did not have the greasy, heavy fell 99% of other donuts had.  The donut maker was busy making a fresh batch, and mine was still warm!
author: Zakk D.

description:
Wow!!! I seriously thought walking by this place after hitting up Red Devil Lounge that it was going to be like any other donut place. 

Was I wrong!!! I had the munchies and wanted to snack on something for my long ride home back to the south bay after a night of partying.  There's always something fresh coming out of the fryer. They powdered and glazed the donuts in front of us at 2am!!!  

We went with the glazed twist.  I've never tasted a fresh donut liked this one... so warm....mmmmm....

We loved it so much that we bought the oversized donut and an ice cold milk and walked it over to our new friend, the doorman of Red Devil Lounge. 

Bob's Donuts gives me the WARM FUZZIES!!!
author: Genevieve J.

description:
I really don't understand the love for this place.  It's OK, but it's still a freakin' 24hr donut shop with your typical neighborhood bums hanging out 24/7. Sure the donuts are great, but what donut store doesn't have good donuts?  Maybe too many transplants never had good donuts growing up.  I guess I'm just spoiled.  

Time for a blueberry danish.
author: Larry A.

description: the aroma lured me in so i stopped in and picked up a fresh apple fritter. Over flowed with Apple bits and glaze. Also got a buttermilk bar with maple another time. Must have.
author: Se L.

description: Well after reading all of the reviews & being an apple fritter junky, I decided to give this place a shot.. It was mediocre. Service was nice enough, but as another reviewer said, the fritters were burnt. I also tried the "apple cake," which was massive in size, but not in taste. My sister had the cherry cobbler & said it was ok. The coffee was basic & hot, the donuts looked better than they tasted.. Won't go out of my way to go back if I'm ever back in SF..
author: Karrie K.

description: Two words: Apple Fritter. It's not the healthiest breakfast option, but the sugar rush stays with you the whole day. One of those has to have the same "stay awakey" power of several Red Bulls. Tastes better too.
author: Johnny C.

description: Apple fritter was so good. I recommend using their microwave and heating it up 10-12 seconds to get maximum texture and flavor
author: Eric A.

description: Restored my faith in donuts (I'd been turned off by what I had been lead to believe were real donuts but were in fact commercialized impostors). Amazing. Delicious. Just a plain glazed donut is all you need to start your day off right. Or continue your day. Or end your night in style. You get the picture.
author: Katie V.

description: My experience neatly encapsulated the jist of other reviews. I stuck to late night when at least some donuts would be fresh. The sour cream, frosted with maple were fresh and sublime. The old fashioneds were not as fresh and pretty non-descript. At least they weren't oversweet like a chain place. The pastry seems worth a pass. The shop has a film noir look/feel. This is clearly not a place for Krispy Kreme fans.
author: Rich J.

description: So, my whole family has been raving about Bob's for years. Nope I have never had anything from Bob's until this week. Maybe it's because the recommendation it to get them HOT at 2 am. No donut is worth loosing sleep over. I finally gave in, it was a late night and someone said let go to bob's yea! I went along for the ride and got myself an apple fritter, because I think that's what they are known for. Gotta say even at 1:30 am it was a pretty damn good apple fritter, just the perfect amount of density and glaze and it was huge! I ate about half and thought I would  have the rest for breaky with coffee, yum. Mmmmmm doesn't travel so well. I was not as pleased with the remains as I was with the hot-out-o-the-oven fritter. So, on that note I would be hard pressed to get a fritter that wasn't out of the oven but I'm not going to do it at 2 am either. Might go back and try some of the others though like the cream filled bars, they looked pretty yummy as well.
author: Ann K.

description:
Cheap donuts that are light and fluffy make me a very happy boy. Entering this shop is like a time warp because the decor is something out of the mid 1970's with weird wooden stools and dark and dingy linoleum but that is what gives Bob's its charm.

Try the cinnanamon rolls, the white glazed donut, and chocolate bar. You won't be disappointed with the taste or the price.
author: Nerd A.

description:
I've ate their pastries. They are to die for.
Location is good. The shop itself is shabby to be honest. Open 24 hours a day.  Have not tried their coffee tho.
Cash only.
Enjoy.
author: Smooth R.

description:
I dont think I've had any donut that competes with the donuts from Bob's. Me and my friends used to crab and fish off the end of van ness and would always ritually stop here to grab a coffee and gang of donuts to eat while we sat around waiting to catch nothing!!!

Ever since I found out about this place like 3 or 4 years ago I've been coming everytime i get that damn donut craving!

It also helps that the lovely little asian lady and man know your face even if you dont come in for a couple months. They know you love the donuts and they have some interesting stories too lol. 

My friend wanted a custard filled donut really bad one day, and they had all sold out, but had just made chocolate bar donuts, so she went ahead and made one chocolate bar donut with custard filling and man was that a good one nice warm and made to order! Customer service from the lowliest little donut shop in the city! It also helps that they are open 24 hours, you can have the donut attacks at any time of the day!
author: Eric A.

description: Amazing donuts and nice service. Open forever.
author: Thomas C.

description: My cousins and brother told me about this place and recommended the apple fritter. I came here expecting a nice warm apple flavored pastry, but I was quickly disappointed. Although the fritter wasn't warm, it was still fluffy and tasty with the glaze an the subtle hint of apples. My friends and I bought two, but only shared one because we were waiting in line for Swan's oysters and didnt want to get too full. Apparently the 2nd fritter was eaten by my other two friends later in the night and both claimed that the fritter was a lot better. I guess I will have to come back to Bob's Donuts when I'm back in the city.
author: Marcus L.

description: This is the best donut place I've ever been to. Whenever I pop in the donuts are fresh and soft. The people behind the counter are always very friendly and eager to help. I  also love the fact that they are always open.
author: Chelsea J.

description:
I LOVE BOBS

I'm not even a big donut person..and I've taken others to bobs who claim the same.. but their donuts are just that good. they are made fresh every night at 2-3am (its 24 hrs!!!) so if you are ever up that late.. stop by for a freshie and a cup of joe.  The two women who work there are sweet. Don't miss the crumb, maple old fashioned and the maple cream filled. The also make giant donuts on special request.. (a great alternate to a b-day cake)

Next time you are having a bad day, do yourself a favor and let Bobs cheer you up...
author: K A.

description: It's all about the old fashioned donuts! Luckily, my friends and I walked by after they just finished baking a batch of donuts at 10:30pm.  My friend was so impressed by her chocolate old fashioned donut, she made us go again the next morning.  That morning, she again got an old fashion donut and I ordered the ham & cheese croissant (a great compliment to my Philz Coffee).  And although it wasn't warm it was still delicious.  The croissant was flaky and buttery, and the ham and cheese the perfect balance of the two.  I wish I lived in SF just for Bob's.
author: Leslie C.

description:
When I am in SF and need my weekend donut fix, I luv going to Bob's.
Huge selection of donuts at great prices.

BEST DONUT---APPLE FRITTER..
author: Raider J.

description:
how can you not love a 24 hour donut shop who makes their donuts fresh right in front of you.  we sat in awe for about 20 minutes last night watching the frying of various rings and logs, the icing and frosting of the fresh donuts, and the especially neat dough bowl with a hole in the bottom and a crank to turn out the perfectly sized and shaped rings right into the oil.

also, i don't know that i've ever eaten such a good and fresh buttermilk donut before.  straight off the icing block, hot to the touch, so deliciously divine.  

they may not have crazy conceptual flavors, but for your standard donut options, Bob's delivers. 

oh, and they're cash only and do not have a restroom for customers (which can be a real bummer at 2am when other nearby bathroom-sporting establishments aren't letting you back in)
author: Anne Marie B.

description: This place is awe.. no wait, AMAZING!! Its seriously heaven if you're craving carbs, and sugary gooey goodness. Just make sure you burn this off at a gym later!  Anyway, Bob's has the best mouth watering,  hugely portioned, greatest tasting donuts and pastries. Period. I loved their selection of old fashioned, glazed, filled, or crumb donuts, but their pastries were the kicker for me. I had their Apple Fritter and words cannot explain how finger licken' delicious this was....Sorry, started day dreaming. Anywho this place is great, I'll definitely go back when I can indulge once more and have me a piece of Bob's heaven! P.S service is great, they're open late, but only take cash. Enjoy!!!
author: Gabriella C.

description: OMG!!! Best glazed donut ever. Crispy who! The jelly donuts are out of this world too.
author: Dick T.

description:
Thank Bob's Donut for being within the walking distance. I tried what my friend called "every drunken man's fantasy," better known as the Apple Fritter. It indeed was fantastical. I was confused as to how that donut was so dough-y (which is ironic because I guess every dough-nut should be dough-y). The texture was soft and almost fluffy like cake. 
I'm really happy that I've moved to the right neighborhood with the right donuts.
author: Kelly G.

description: This place never disappoints me! Early am or late night... Mmmmm mmm yummy! I heart  this place!
author: Shima L.

description: $5.50 for a donut the size of your head. Nuff said.
author: Raymond H.

description:
Homer Simpson has wet dreams about this place...

when i moved to this area, everyone kept telling me about "Bob's Donut"...???  i'm not much of a donut lover, but on a few occasions, i pulled the ultimate "lazy ass dinner party guest" and volunteered to bring dessert (......Bob's Donuts).  well, they were always a huge hit!  i can say for sure that had i brought a bottle of wine, no one would've cared, but Bob's Donuts......they were always gone by the end of the nite.
author: Nana S.

description:
As someone who doesn't generally like crumb doughnuts, Bob's crumb doughnut is so enjoyable that I am forced to reject some of the tenets of natural selection. You see, tongues have evolved to have specialized receptors for sweet, salty, sour, bitter, and umami. I hypothesis the existence of sixth receptor, which was divinely given to appreciate Bob's, and no other place's, crumb doughnuts.

I've had the Apple Fritter twice, once at night and once at 7:45AM. They're not worth the hype-- both times they've been overcooked, leaden, and not really all that pleasant. 

The jelly doughnuts are better than average but not spectacular. They're sliced like bagels, so the jelly is evenly distributed across the inner surface. A weird technique that's becoming increasingly common.
author: Jason B.

description: too many nights at 3 am I have been lured into Bob's. Yummy and I'm not huge on donuts!
author: Tasha F.

description: Bread pudding w/apples and raisins... probably made with day old donuts: bonus goodness. Oh, and a chocolate milk.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
the old fashioned style donuts are the best. 

for ~80 cents a donut, you cant beat it. 

just be warned, they're really addictive, and I normally find my self eating 2-3 in one sitting :)
author: Jerimiah L.

description:
Lot of donut shop come and go but family own Bob's been making great donuts since the 60's (maybe 50's ?). The donut shop that brings all kinds of people together  for donuts and coffe.
Apple fritters just awesome you need to go there around 1am for fresh ones. Bob's coffe not only taste better than starbucks it's lot cheaper too.
author: Byung K.

description: This place is like heaven. I finally went here for breakfast (or well something to go with my tea) the other day, and luckily there were no lines! I got exactly what I wanted...mmm chocolate donut with sprinkles. It was the right amount of sweet and didn't leave me feeling like a huge fatty after....and that my friend, is a success!
author: Lauren S.

description: For some reason Polk St seems far away from me, but it's really only like 5 blocks. It's probably a good thing because if I lived closer to these delicious donuts I would probably be either a) fat or b) dead.
author: David K.

description:
Open 24 HOURS!!! Never closes...well, maybe on Christmas. Don't know. 

Get the buttermilk donut to go because this is quintessential circa 1970s Americana coffee donut dive decor. 

Warning: the applecoffee cake was hypoglycemic shock...smashed old glazed doughnuts mixed with apples in sugar syrup and raisins. Had not really inspected these before and it was TOO wild. Damn, pro'lly  1000 calories!!!!

Forget the Krispie Kreme hype. The stock tanked out because the reporting was all bs about flour, sugar and fat selling for more than what people actually were buying. 
Bob's is too much fun for about $2 bucks and a trip flashback to the past. Saccharin Carpenters songs should be playing in the background at 10pm if they really wanted to sweep up. Guess the alkee geesers sitting at the counter could give a crap, long as they have a warm and dry place to hang on Polk Street.

Hey, the Black Bob making, baking and shaking the dough is the BEST donut man in 24 hour life of a sugared puff daddy to appreciate.
He is dedicated, getting there at 2am in the morning and got the applefritters, old fashioned, french, all hot and glazed over. He is the best. THANK YOU Mr. Donut man... oh ...do you know the Donutman, the Donutman, the Donutman...oh ...do you the Donutman, he is just one good Donutman!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I guess one Chinese Bob may have retired after the difficult hours. Just guessing.
author: miriam b.

description:
the 'Royal Jelly Doughnut' of sf... convenient location too! Right between a Moroccan coffee shop/Hukka Bar and the #19's stop.
Grease is expected in a place like this, as in the apple fritters.
author: Eugene G.

description:
Bob's will always be there.  When the streets are filled with cats and dogs, Bob's store front of deep fried dough will warm your heart and your belly.

The chocolate buttermilk donuts fresh out of the fryer are the best.  They are actually crunchy!  Arrive around 12:30am and you will be in for a big surprise.  Come Friday nights, bring you friends and gather homeless beggars from the streets to indulge in the Party Donut.  

Say hello to Aia when you meet her.  She will laugh at you when you only ask for 3 donut holes, and give you 3 more at no charge.
author: Ben Z.

description:
You've been out at the bars, having a few drinks, or you just saw a show at Great American, and now you're a little hungry....

What better than some amazingly fresh donut's at midnight.

Seriously, when I say fresh, I mean, you watch them make the donuts, and you say, I'll have that one, and they take it out of the oil, and put it in your mouth.  And you say, "mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm".
author: Joshua E.

description:
There are very few places to get donuts in SF. We're just not really a donut kinda town. Therefore, it's especially hard to find a really GOOD donut in SF. But Bob's..... now those are some damn fine donuts.

I personally like the cake donuts. I think it's easy to cover up donut deficiencies with sweet icings and sprinkles. If you can do a plain cake donut well, you can do any donut really well. Bob's does.

I also really like their huge meringues. They are crunchy on the outside, fluffy on the inside. 

We always stop when we're in the 'hood.
author: Kellie P.

description:
The crumb donut is so yummy. Fluffy, slightly chewy, and not greasy at all. How can a donut not be greasy, considering it's fried in boiling hot oil? I have no idea, but Bob's manages to create the impossible. 
The ambiance is fairly bizarre--I'm sure it may be interesting for people-watching, but I'll take mine to go, thanks.
author: Marissa R.

description: Awesome.  I am no donut connoisseur, I actually don't really love them.  My boyfriend and his son do and we all love bob's donuts.  I always go in for their glazed old fasioned. Their donuts are super fresh, and on fri and sat they make alot of donuts fresh around 8:30pm to get ready for all the polk st. drunkies.  We grabbed a warm one or 6 ;) this friday which spawned this review.  Go Bob.
author: Katie M.

description: 12-2am If your up and have a taste for donuts then you should definitely be here. I been to Bob's countless times at wee hours and these donuts definitely hit the spot. They all taste great fresh but the apple fritter with some cold milk is my favorite tummy yum yum :)
author: Anthony S.

description: Today was the first time I've had Bob's and it wasn't 2am...and the donuts are STILL amazing.  I hang out with kind of a fatty friend who wanted to stop because we were in the neighborhood and i'm never going to say no to a good donut. That's exactly what Bob's has, good donuts...nothing fancy, but absolutely nothing crappy. Try the custard-filled chocolate long-john. At 2am the fritters are fresh and hot tho. Anyway, definitely worth a stop-you'll be glad you did.
author: Rob B.

description:
After a full day of craving a donut, and working out so I can enjoy one, or two without the complete guilt I would have if I hadn't worked out, I was ready to go to Krispy Kremes. 

But, being Easter Sunday, and it being 7pm, I was wise enough to call before making the trip to daly city. The phone rang and rang and no answer.....

So, left without a Krispy Kreme and this huge craving in my belly, I decided to check the two donut stores near my area only to find out that they too are closed.

i get home, get a message from my friend to watch rio at 8:40, but I figure it's a sunday night, and I have work early tomorrow and laundry that still needs to be done, so I pass.

Done with my laundry...I ask the boy to check for "late night donuts," he goes on yelp and finds Bob's and exclaims, "woah! that's a huge donut! look!"

I take a glance, and indeed I am impressed. Following Allison's tips, I decide to wait until 10p to leave the house, ironed a few more shirts, asked the parents if they were interested and off we went.

Go to Polk, parked the car, passed by Donuts and Things and wondered where Bob's was because I remember seeing California and Polk, but no, Bob's was Sacramento and Polk.

So after some searching, I find it...a not so brightly lit donut shop with its pastries displayed in the window.....pastries and donuts that looked...well....stale and a little digusting.... for a place with nearly 500 reviews and 4 1/2 stars, this was definately not what I was expecting. Also, it being 10:30p....and according to the late night reccomendations for fresh donuts....there definately were none.

And having craved donuts for the past few hours, I was not about to settle and get one here, no way! walked back to donuts and things, went through the doors and like a halo, there they were, a beautiful case full of donuts nicely placed, and looking FRESHLY made. 

ordered a dozen donut holes and a half dozen of regular glazed and cake crumb donuts. The nice lady went to the back to get me some warm ones, boxed them up and off i went, happy that i FINALLY had my donuts.

1 star for Bob's for looking like a donut reject bin and 4 stars for donuts and things for the great donuts, minus 1 star for not being nicely placed in the box.
author: P M.

description:
Yelpers, you have not let me down!  By far, these are the best apple fritters I have ever had.  Most fritters are either too oily or gooey, but these are just perfect.  Crispy on the edges and soft, flavorful in the middle.  Bought a dozen goodies for the Engineering staff and everything was good.  I tried the glazed twist as well and it was also fresh and fluffy.  

Most donuts/pastries are about $1.50 each but well worth it!

This is a destination when I get back into SF.
author: Erick P.

description: I have a problem.  It's not that I drink too much, it's that I always want donuts when drunk.  So I decided to try Bob's donuts when I was simply buzzed so I could not only savor the experience, but remember as well.  I remembered the fluffy warm donut, but one could hardly say I savored it as I stuffed my face gasping for air.  It's fat girl on a rampage for a reason people.  Glazed donut joy heaven ensued!  I'm still full.  Then again, I also polished off way too much dinner mere minutes before, but that is trivial information when we're talking donuts.  I now know why everyone rants and raves about Bob's and their homemade dough and I will keep demanding to eat donuts drunk since they are AWESOME!  And I'm pretty sure they never close.  Awesome!
author: Justine D.

description: Was introduced to this sweet spot by Kim A. http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=Wu9yVn0peO6P-Kb8ELH8_A during my last trip to SFO.  Straight from the airport we made it here early morning and everything was pipping fresh.  The most incredible pastries I have ever experienced.  Apple fritters, maple bars, glazed doughnuts, old fashioned buttermilk...shall I go on?  Delicious!!  The counter itself isn't much, but everything I happened to taste was mind blowing!  A MUST if your are even 10 miles within radius.
author: Kalani C.

description: Delicious affordable donuts in a variety of tasty forms. Would eat again.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Go late. If not just go when you can and get a fritter or a crumb. I like to pair my selection with a fresh whole milk. The fat in the milk beautifully compliments the fat and sugar in the donut. Bon appetit!
author: Randy C.

description:
ohmy ohmy, straight from heaven. i loved my first bite and was hooked. i only wish this was on my way to work, instead of less than a mile in the towards the ocean ; )
again, custard filled chocolate bar, except this dough is redonk. it is pure butteryness. soo goood. yay bob
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
My love Bob's is both passionate and, I know, a little unreasonable. Objectively, the donuts are good, but not amazing. The service is friendly and if you come in regularly you will be remembered and chatted with, but is neither lightning swift nor unerring. The ambiance is that of... a cheap donut shop.

But darn it, when it's midnight and the soft, crispy, sugary crullers are just coming out, it's my favorite place in the city.
And they're really cheap.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Donut are middling, but since it's open late (or possibly even 24 hours a day), I give it high marks. They definitely have a big selection of donuts to choose from, but the quality just isn't as good as other donut establishments.
author: Mike M.

description: Best Crumb Donut EVER... Try a late night stop anytimea after 10pm you will always find something hot coming out of the fryer....hmmm donuts
author: Curtis G.

description: The best donut in the city whenever you want them because they are 24 hours.
author: Katherine B.

description: must buy: donuts with their signature custard. i never tasted a custard that good. it had a different taste than the rest. we also bought the giant donut for $5.50 i think. hella good. place might look rundown but it's what it makes it good. they kept with the tradition of plain old fashioned, home made donuts. only downside is you have to pay cash
author: Zito R.

description:
Bob's?  Are you fuggin kiddin me?  The Holy Grail of all things sweet and greasy.  A fresh, warm cinnamon pretzel and milk at 2:35 a.m.  BOOM! 
Go.  Go now.  Sure, your gut will pay but dammit, life is for living.
author: Stephan J.

description: I am not impressed.  I was really expecting some great donuts from all the rave reviews.  This place was a hole in the wall and also very dirty...  I don't see what is so special about their donuts.  They taste average at best.  Won't be visiting again!
author: Liz F.

description: nice place my favorite is the chocolate cruller donuts or the apple turnover, very reasonable prices check it out
author: N A.

description:
i don't know what the hype is about. the donuts are "aiight." i think safeway chocolate old fashions are better. 

AND the korean woman isn't very nice. she, with the attitude that she hates the world and i, with an excited and cheery voice waiting to finally taste what the hype was all about.....
woman of anger: do you want them in a box.
me: yeah, if you've got boxes then i'm all for it.
woman of anger: if i didn't have boxes i wouldn't have a business.
me: ooookay. a box it is then. 

it was all not worth spending my lunch break driving all the way to effing Polk St. and double parking only to find an angry woman and cookies that look like they've been sitting there for a year. i got an assortment of donuts. cruellers, chocolate and not. maple custard bar. crumb. two chocolate old fashions. cinnamon twist. cinnamon sugar cake. all were just "aiight" as previously mentioned. ugh...waste of my time!
author: Regina C.

description: I love Bob's.  The service is friendly and the donuts are awesome.  I like simple cake donuts the best, which are typically made fresh around 10PM every night.  Nothing beats a freshly made hot crispy donut.  My GF and I typically come here at least once a week.  My friends rated the apple fritters as the best they've ever had.
author: Chris W.

description: Delicious donuts & pastries, open 24 hours, very nice service-- what's not to love?
author: Jason T.

description: Their apple fritters make me thankful for health insurance.
author: Alissa D.

description: I love the fact that this place is opened all day every day. I've never been here in the morning time because I think doughnuts should be eaten as a midnight snack. Sitting at the bar with a cup of coffee, eating a chocolate doughnut while stealing bites of my friend's apple fritter make life better. Doctors don't need medicine to cure disease, if people want to feel better, just direct them to Bob's.
author: Lauren L.

description: Fresh buttermilk maple bar hot from the fryer.  Crunchy-sticky maple-glazed crust yielding a tender almost cake interior.  Bob's bakes from 10 PM to 2 AM so plan your visit then and get whatever's hot outta the fryer.  We desperately wanted the apple fritter but sadly there were none left.  Will have to come back at 1 AM for a piping hot one.
author: Cynthia H.

description: Some of the best apple fritters I have ever had and I grew up in the South. They are outstanding and the lines get long when the fresh doughhnuts are out! Inexpensive and open all the time.....what more can one ask for?
author: Pierce B.

description: I never liked donuts until I found Bob's.  The maple glazed buttermilk bars and old fashioned donuts are to die for.
author: Jessica P.

description: Bob's Doughnuts is open 24 hours. They make FRESH doughnuts, right in FRONT OF YOU at 12am. I came here a couple of time after watching a movie at AMC on Van Ness. Wanted to eat some doughnuts. Right when we got there, they had FRESH glazed doughnuts. So we each bought two. While we were munching on them we saw some FRESH Doughnut holes come out, so we bought a dozen. Best fresh doughnuts at 12am. Awesome! Love this place, will definitely be back!
author: Daniel S.

description: Let me just say that I dream about this place. You have to go at around 1AM when they are making fresh glazed donuts. Get a little carton of milk, and munch away. The donuts literally melt in your mouth. They have a giant size donut for the bold eaters.
author: Toby W.

description: These are some of the best donuts in the city. They are warm, fresh, and very cheap. Plus, Joe's is open late so it's a great place to go if you are craving a sweet snack in the A.M.
author: Chris W.

description: On all of our vacations we like to seek out a local delicious donut shop. We found this one in San Fran and it definitely was up to par! We took yelp reviewers advice and got the apple fritter----delicious!!! (to say the least). My boyfriend commented that it's the best fritter he's ever had (and that says a lot). Also tried a plain cake with cinnamon and sugar which was delightful as well. If you want a good traditional style donut go here...it's simple, cheap, a classic donut shop, friendly, and YUMMMY!
author: Amanda Z.

description:
DAM.... I have some friends who have some bad habits, eating donuts being one of them.  They were buying so how could I say no.

I have to say eating a donut that that has just been freshly dipped in glaze is something everyone must try.  Bear claw honey dipped, MMMMmmmm.  Good going down, but bad and regrettable.

I think my heart still hurts from this.
author: Po L.

description:
Delicious doughnuts, perfectly fried and topped.  Seriously, the finest treat in town!  Drunk or not- these doughnuts are the best... IN THE WORLD.

You know how some people host Ice Cream Socials?  Well, I'd like to have a doughnut hoe-down slumber party where my lady friends and I feed each other dozens of Bob's doughnuts while making verbal toasts just before bumping our doughnuts together and then devouring them, followed by the licking  of our fingers, freeing them of all the icing and powdered sugar residue.  

I hope someone will someday buy me the Bob's birthday cake sized doughnut.  I want to eat it good.
author: Janene S.

description:
They're the best when they just came out of the oven---usually after 11pm. It's nice and moist and it's just melt in your mouth goodness! And you can get more than enough with just a few bucks.

The lady who worked there was extremely nice. And the bonus: OPEN 24/7. Anytime you need your donut craving satisfied, it's worth the trip to come down here to Bob's Donuts.
author: Van D.

description:
Ok the donuts are not bad tasting... but you don't know how long they keep them up on the shelves....

just a little warning put out there

-x3 shells
author: Lily X.

description: Old style donuts, I've finally found the ultimate donut experience
author: Alex A.

description: This place is amusing because of the "big donut" the size of a cake box (the ones you see at most asian bakeries). Stopped by here late one night when I was craving sweets and limited places were open; this one is open 24/7! The donuts were hot and freshly made. I would recommend this place if you're not down for super sweet Krispy Kreme ones.. where you know what to expect.
author: Nancy L.

description: The husband brought me a donut home after work one night because I had mentioned craving a giant donut. Sweet, right? So he got the giant glazed donut with chocolate icing. I picked up the box and could not believe how heavy it was! I cut into it and it was soft and dough like. Even though it was purchased late in the day, it still tasted really fresh. Yum! The chocolate icing was a perfect compliment to the light cakey bread and gave it the right amount of sweetness. Also, it was only $5, which is a great deal for a fresh and light donut. Just no one tell me how many calories it is because we ate the whole thing!
author: Melanie R.

description: Not only the best cinnamon roll in town, esp around 3am when they're still warm/hot; this is another dimension entirely. Any student of psychotronic film may want to bring a notepad when visiting this landmark.
author: Brent J.

description: When craving for donuts 2am, this is the place to be! The apple fritter and bread pudding are my top 2 favs!
author: E F.

description: i love how yelp removed my review of bob's donut recently, without cause.
author: Ethan L.

description: ... nom... nom... nom.... nom... I would write a review... nom... nom.... if I didn't have this delicious donut... nom... nom... in my mouth... nom... nom... and all over my fingers.... nom... nom.... gulp... ahhh... hole-y bliss at all hours...
author: Terry S.

description: Did I go to the wrong Bob's last night?  Expecting an omigosh this is so good experience, instead we consumed a cold, dry, baked this morning apple fritter and old fashion donut.  Lady working the counter was nice and the cold milk helped.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Read all these great reviews and went to get my glazed donut fix.  Store is a bit seedy, but that's ok, I have a high threshold for yuck when it comes to donuts... but it was gnarly!!! greasy and not holding its shape so well, I had two bites and threw the rest away, no sense wasting calories on a bad donut!!!  My search for a lovely glazed donut continues (not a fan of krispy kreme either, the donut melts in your mouth, but I'm looking for it be a bit more "hearty", like the donuts from my childhood...
author: I Love S.

description: I was very disappointed. I don't understand how this donut store gets 4.5 star. The store was poor and the lady looks dirty and not nice. The taste of the donuts were not impressive. The donut with cream made me want to throw up. I won't rely on yelp review anymore.
author: Cindy H.

description:
Some of the donuts come with holes in the middle and some of the donuts do not.  Metaphysical guilt leads me toward the former.

Super-friendly girl behind the counter erases the metaphysical guilt and I decide upon a blueberry muffin more oft than no.
author: herbert r.

description:
I was walking up Polk with a friend when the heavenly aroma of baking donuts wafted down towards us. We followed our noses until we saw a short line of people waiting to get into a hole in the wall type donut shop. It was 12:30am. 

We couldn't pass by without checking to see if this place tasted as good as it smelled. I am pleased to report that it did. 

We sat down and I got a classic cinnamon donut and my friend got raspberry jam filled. Both were still hot and were so soft they just fell apart. It was amazing. 

I couldn't go home to a house full of drunk roommates without bringing a few back for them, so I got a powdered sugar, another cinnamon, a coconut, a maple and an apple fritter. Each one was better than the next and I was hailed as a hero by my roommates. The apple fritter was the best I ever had, slightly crispy on the outside and warm and fluffy inside. 

**It seems like they make a batch of their donuts at about 10:30pm. The best thing to do if you've never been here is ask for whatever is freshest and be prepared to be amazed.

The only con is that the premises are a bit on the grimy side. If you are eating in, be prepared to wipe down your own table. No public bathroom.
author: Emma C.

description: Man this place has very good donuts very basic but always fresh and its open 24/7!  They have a maple long john to die for
author: Jim S.

description:
when the donuts are in the window (apple fritter, apple pudding, chocolate/sprinkles glazed or frankly anything), then they are probably your "just above average" donuts.  so for that I give it a 3/3.5.

when you come and they are freshly making the donuts, i give it a 6.5/7.

in my previous life, i used to eat bob's apple fritter (b/c everyone said it was the "thing to do") and i used to think "meh its just pretty ok", but everyone raved about it.  (this is during normal donut eating hours)

I was even told to take it home, and microwave it for a bit to warm it up (also softens it a bit) and even so . . . just better than "meh its pretty ok".

come one drunk evening at around 2am . . . and the revelation that we "should go to bob's" arose.  begrudgingly we waited in the line of some 15+ people, and lo and behold, those fresh apple fritters came out of the oil, and heaven and earth collided together to create a whole new world that i never knew existed before.

damn those suckers were hot - you couldn't even hold the paper bag b/c the stupid thing was searing through it.  but man, the hot apple chunks, the fritter dough just oozing and freshly fried.  it was truly the best donut i've ever had.

and all of the chocolate/sprinkle donuts fresh are freaking amazing at as well.  makes me believe that anything fresh here is a gift sent directly down from the heavens from the donut god himself - buddha.

on a side note, the apple pudding is pretty damn unique and good.  never had anything like it, and i'd definitely eat it again.  and again.  and again (when donuts are room temp).
author: Jason J.
