description: Every time I walk by this place on my way home from work, the window display looks exactly the same.  Are they selling any donuts?  I wonder how old they could be.  Maybe they just keep the same quantity out all the time.  But I keep looking at those meringues, yum.  But they look exactly the same every time, possibly just rearranged.  But sorry, I am never going in to try a donut.  I hate donuts in general.  But it always seems busy and they are open all the time.
author: Julie R.

description:
In agreement with Robert P.'s review. I don't really see what all the fuss is about. The donuts were just OK -- nothing out of this world.

I had a chocolate glazed donut and it was yummy, but a little skimpy on the glaze. 

But don't think I don't "get it." I know the power of a hot, sugary donut fresh from the fryer after the bars have closed. I just don't think it's a five star donut.
author: Jovi C.

description: Bob is probably long gone from you know, the best doughy, crispy, sugar bombs in the city. All night coffee and the merciless goldbrickers wondering up and down polk street... But damn he was one diabetic angel. I wonder if there ever was a Bob. If there was I would like to salute him for the fine tradition he started. my favorite treat since childhood the glazed ol fashion is made in fine style. A cup of coffee and a glazed after the after party for my finale, yeahe!
author: Rhasaan F.

description: the best dounts in SF for sure. try out their big donuts challenge, it will make you love their donuts even more!!
author: Joseph C.

description: if i could eat all this stuff and not get fat, i would. but i already have a vice, alcohol.  donuts go great with alcohol by the way.
author: Doug ..

description: The glazed doughnuts are like heaven!  They're fresh and yummy, just the way I remember them tasting when I was a kid in St. Louis, and would get one right off the line (my mom worked as a secretary for a bakery), just-glazed ... all nice and warm, and so much better thank Krispy Kreme.  (I know, I'll burn in Hell for saying that...)
author: Carly P.

description: Heard the buzz, and had the pleasure of hitting up the midnight preparation of all those ridiculous donuts.  Got an old fashioned glazed and some donut holes, and I had to have my friends take me out of the place before I bought another tray's worth and put myself into a diabetic coma.  Oh man.  So coming back here.
author: Andrew B.

description: The donuts were the best I have ever had. They're light and not too sweet. I'd give 5 stars, but the coffee wasn't great.
author: Rachel B.

description: If I lived in the neighborhood, I would come here for dessert every day, and the lbs I acquired wouldn't be in vain.  I've been in here twice and the selection and quality is amazing.  Much tastier than spending the cash for a mediocre slice of cake or pie at a caf.  I wish every neighborhood in SF had a Bob's to satisfy my heart's every dessert desire the way this place does.
author: Marie S.

description: I don't know about this place.  I tried it twice looking for the elusive tasty san francisco donut but to no avail.  The place felt gross and dirty and my donuts were below average both times.  I didn't think it warranted a third attempt.  Maybe I've been spoiled by experiencing superior donuts elsewhere? (but not in this city)  Others seem to love the place.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description: Now I have to admit I'm not the biggest donut person.  I eat one or two every year, but then I started dating my boyfriend.  He is OBSESSED.  So I've heard good things about Bob's and he took me there to try it.  Now the first time we went it was mid-day.  We got an apple fritter and I have to admit, it was just OK.  Would probably give it 2 1/2 stars or so.  BUT then one drunken night after a concert, we happened to pass Bob's at 1:30am.  We walk in and donuts are fresh out of the fryer.  We split a cinnamon roll and I have to admit, it was the best donut/dessert I had EVER repeat EVER had in my life.  It was fresh, warm, and melted in your mouth. My advice to you, call them up late night and see what they're making.  They usually start around 11:30 or so.  (I know this because my boyfriend had actually called.)  Fresh donuts will be nothing like you ever had before.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Bob's has gone down the dumper:(
I used to live a couple of blocks away and my SB (a huge donut fan) and I used to go here all the time during our "courtship".
My SB used to always get an Apple Fritter and proclaimed Bob's to have the best ones...EVAR!
Well today (several years later) we were in the neighborhood and decide to live a little and indulge in a rare treat. 
WTH happened? It seems like there used to be an overflowing display of magical donuts of all shapes and sizes practically overwhelming the counter. Today it was sort of your usual donut shop, picked over offerings. They did not even have my favorite, the fantabulous raisin snail:( Instead I got a glazed cruller...which tasted very un-fresh.
We were both pretty bummed about the whole experience. Maybe today was an off day? Maybe a truckload of teamsters got there first?
We will probably give them another chance for nostalgias sake.
author: Catty C.

description: Reminds me of the donut shops and bakeries of my childhood...awww.  Seriously, they do have some good meringues.
author: Amanda P.

description: Believe the hype! This place continually sells the best old-style donuts with amazing apple fritters.
author: Jane I.

description: Behold the power of Bob's Donuts (especially when you are suffering from severe inebriation)!
author: Clarice V.

description:
i liked the apple fritter.  i would love the apple fritter if it had more apples. ;)
the donuts are good.  very cheap but they are HUGE and leave you with a really dirty feeling, like a bad drunken wrong night out in town.  the krispy creme donuts in comparison are much smaller, lighter and they do not smell like cheap grease that Bob's smell like.

that being said, its hard to poo poo a 24 hr donut shop within 10 min from home that serves a decent donut. ;)  i wouldn't travel far and wide for this donut though.

the girl that served us at midnight was really nice and sweet and polite, which adds an extra star in my book, when dealing with teenage drunks and testosterone-pumped losers all night.
author: tc h.

description: Best chocolate crueller.  ever.
author: Beth H.

description: Really good old fashion donuts and sometimes if you're real nice...FREE!
author: Angela K.

description: I lurve this place. I'm sad it's not as close as it used to be. Yummy glazed and chocolate covered lumps of dough. Open whenever I have the inkling to drown my sorrows in something unhealthy or get locked out of my apartment for the night.
author: Fabian G.

description: YUMMMMMMY!!!!!  I'm not a big donut fan, but these are so good.  The best time to buy them are late Friday or Saturday night when they are the freshest and warm. French curls are my favs! I think I need one right now :)
author: Mina P.

description: I'm usually not into sweet baked goods and especially donuts, but I LOVE Bob's Donuts.  It's opened 24 hours and I've had the good fortune of getting freshly baked donuts at odd hours of the night.  The woman behind the counter is also funny and entertaining to talk to.
author: Helen T.

description: This place is the best and I have sure had my hair share of eating donuts. The lady at the counter isn't mean, you just have to become known to her as a regular customer and she will be happy to see you every time. She will also stuff any donut, even circle ones with what ever you want. Yeeeeeeuuummmmm!!!!!
author: Morgan P.

description: I must say, as a donut lover and overall lover of baked goods, BOB's ROCKS! The glazed crumb is always a favorite and so are the cruellers and apple fritters. mmm...
author: Chong H.

description: The glazed donuts are a Must Have!!!  The smell of piping hot glazed donuts straight from the oven is something to be desired...you can even hear the glaze oozing down the side.  Growing up on the East Coast where donut/pastry shops are on every block and Dunkin Donuts is always a stones throw away...I can say that Bob's is the REAL DEAL!!
author: Keith S.

description: Late at night Bob's sugary horrible for you donuts, make you eat with glee, as the fresh glaze crunches off the warm yummy donut's!  The best part are the huge glazed donuts that are meant for 2 people to share!
author: Cassie L.

description: The donuts are so good here. They're the best when they're fresh. You gotta know that they're the best when Alton Brown goes here when he comes to the city. If going to a bar nearby, go here after because it's open 24/7. The inside looks like it fell out of a dumpster and the video games suck but you have to go here and you'll be hooked.
author: Mike L.

description: OK this is THE late night snack place in Nob Hill. Often times after late-night parties we'd somehow get enough energy to stagger out the 8+ blocks from my place to Bob's to get some donuts. Try to get out there around midnight on Saturdays when they are baking up a fresh batch. They are the best right when they come out of the fryer.
author: Lee C.

description: There is an apple crumble-type item here that is really good-not too sweet.
author: Gillian F.

description: Incredible powdered sugar donut.  There's a reason why you rarely see them in the window.
author: Scott W.

description:
simple and perfect. 
nice lady working who is always friendly.

better then any chain donut place
author: justin b.

description: We discovered Bob's by accident really. We were attending a show at The Red Devil Lounge and meandered past on the way to our parking garage. We could not help but stop and indulge! I had a fresh yellow cake donut with chocolate frosting and sprinkles. The donut had a slight crunch on the outside and soft fluffy cake on the inside. The perfect taste of chocolate, not too sugary as some icings can be. We chatted it up with the other 'fans' and found out one guy actually pays money to take a cab from his apartment to pick up Bob's every Friday and Saturday night! WOW... if that's not an endorsement I don't know what is. Three words for you... WE LOVE BOB's!!!
author: Kelly H.

description: With a line out the door at 1AM, I knew they had to be good.  But the giant  donut exceeded my expectations.  We got two -- the chocolate glazed and the crumb topping -- and are still burning off the sugar high 24 hours later. I can see that there are going to be many late night trips to Bob's, and some early morning, late afternoon and early evening trips too.
author: Lon C.

description: They fry up the donuts TO ORDER here!  That's right folks, I mean while you wait.  It is literally impossible to get better, fresher donuts than this.
author: Matthew M.

description: Besides the doughy goodness that is a donut, Bob's donuts are the epitome of a donut. These people are professionals, true to their trade. No frills, no renovation needed, they are it. Trust them, they're professionals that make donuts. Wonderful donuts.
author: Layne C.

description: I had heard this place was good. And I'm all about donut shops that stay open 24/7. But I try (not very hard) to stay away from deep fried dough. Then one Friday morning, I woke up with a hangover and I couldn't get this place out of my head. I HAD to try it. Unfortunately, its about 10 blocks from my place which is really too far to walk with a pounding head. So I sucked it up, popped 4 advil, and walked over there on my way to work. I got a glazed twist and I swear it had some sort of magic ingredient.  I have no shame, so I just shoved the whole thing in my face in 30 seconds flat. And then I walked all the way down California to the Financial District. Hangover gone. A coincidence? I don't think so.
author: All About Town ..

description:
Oh, Bob you temp me with your sugary wears in the window!  Bear claws, glazed, old fashioned, how can I turn you down when it is late and I am in need of a delectable friend. 

If you find yourself out late on Polk street, you gotta stop by Bob's around 12am, because at any moment, brand new doughnuts hot out of the fryer are rolling on to racks! The best part is, if your are really intoxicated  you forgot you had them, hence no no guilt.  MM..good.  Got milk!
author: Niko P.

description: They have the best donuts in SF!!  But you have to go there after 10:45 pm--that's when the buttermilks are fresh.  The apple fritters (around 2/2:30 a.m.) are good, but not quite worth the hype.  The friendly service is also a plus.
author: seta a.

description:
Let me preface this by saying that I'm not a donut fan.  I just went last night because everyone else wanted to go.  This place is simple.  No frills, but the people are very nice.  They started to fry the donuts at 10pm.  It was already entertaining watching the guy poor the batter in and watch the prefried donuts plunk into the vat of hot oil.  Once he fished it out, they were dunked in either maple or chocolate frosting and were ready to serve.  

Wow.  My first bite was a moment not to be forgotten.  The freshly fried piece of sin was warm.  It was perfectly crispy on the outside and so soft on the inside.  It went so well with my cup of coffee.  If I'm ever in the neighborhood again, I'll make sure to stop by.
author: Josephine V.

description: loved the donuts.  sat on the bar and watched them make more donuts while i ate.  couldn't get any better than that.
author: Farhan D.

description: The family and I have travelled across country and have used yelp to find good places to get food. The other night, we were really craving some donuts and Bob's was right down the street. I must say that I didn't really see the big deal with this place. To me, it really wasn't anything special, but everyone has their own taste buds.
author: Megan S.

description: Best donuts ever! Go between 10 PM - 1 AM to get them fresh.
author: Mike S.

description: I must admit that I'm not a big fan of donuts, but I am a giant fan of coconuts, so I'm always on the prowl for a good coconut macaroon. The thing that makes the macaroons at Bob's so great is that they don't need to make them all swirly and fancy or dip them in chocolate to convince you they're good. What you get from Bob's is a big, sticky mountain of sweet chewy coconut. No frills, the way it should be!
author: Nicole B.

description: I keep going back to Bob's for their delicious bear claws. But the surly old lady who's been working there for years really needs to lighten up. Oh well, can't teach an old dog new tricks.
author: D'Andy C.

description: Best apple fritters in the city, hands down.  And I like the little outfits they wear.
author: Ben K.

description:
Sometime between 10 and 12 they start making fresh doughnuts... Oh lord.  Their crullers = deep-fried clouds. 

Eat them.
author: Jen T.

description: I love Bob's Donuts! If you get a freshly made donut right out of the fryer...that's just like heaven in your mouth. Also, the service is wonderful. The people who work there are so nice and friendly, an amazing feat at 2am with all these drunken revellers.
author: Anh-Thu N.

description: Ive been hearing about this place a lot. Everything ive read is true. The donuts have this real quality to them. They dont taste cheap like they do in other donut shops. The best time to go seems to be late at night, when the donuts are fresh. My girlfriend and I bought a variety dozen, and they were still excellent  a couple of days later. Believe the hype.
author: Art V.

description: Great place for 24 hour coffee, and THE BEST DONUTS!  The staff seem very codial.
author: Norman B.

description:
what you read about this 'place' here is true :D

coconut thingies 
chocolate topped donut

hmmm, hmm.

both for a song ($2-ish)

but wait there is more

polite friendly service!
author: mof m.

description: These are the best donuts I've tried. They don't really taste healthy, but they are sooo good. Besides the place is always open and really easy on your budget.
author: Janne K.

description: I gotta join the chorus and sing the praises of the holy grail of San Francisco donuts, Bob's Donuts on Polkstrasse, an institution that goes on and on like the energizer battery.  Food writers have sung the praises of this simple, unpretentious and classic little emporium of donut gastronomy and it hasn't changed things one bit, which breeds integrity and dedication to their primary purpose, to make and sell the best donuts in San Francisco.  They make them throughout the day and night so they're always fresh, and they use only high quality, FRESH oil so there is never a rancid or oily taste to these perfect little gems of donutry art.  Prices are better than the mass produced, chain variety and they don't taste like refined sugar, so they're what I think donuts were originally supposed to be.  They offer many varieties as well as cookies, scones and other breakfast pastries, but their true calling is good old fashion DONUTS, thanks Bob's for being the very BEST.
author: Stu S.

description: We were in San Francisco for vacation and read all of the great reviews for Bob's on yelp before we left and it did not disappoint.  The apple fritter wasn't quite as gooey as I like, but the chocolate donut filled with custard was amazing.  Best custard filling EVER.
author: Emily S.

description: One very early morning, my girlfriend surprised me with a giant bag of delicious goodness. I could tell what they were, from the small grease stains forming on the outside of the bag. Lo and behold, a chocolate glazed old fashion, a maple syrupy donut, an apple fritter and one of those donuts shaped like a tiny loaf of bread - you know what I'm talkin' about. They were really good. I loved the variety and, of course, they were donuts, so it's hard not to go wrong. Lookin' forward to another scandalous rendezvous with Bob...Bob's donuts.
author: Matt S.

description: I'm not quite sure why Bob's is so highly rated. I thought the donuts were dry and overly sweet. I'm not one to poo poo sugar, but this was like instant cavity level. I thought I got a representative selection: one crumb, one glazed, one famous apple fritter, and a glazed buttermilk for good measure. I took one bite of each, gagged, and then passed my greasy bag on to the homeless guy by the freeway. Does that still count as paying it forward?
author: Reina G.

description: Wow.  I don't give out 5 stars very often, but Bob's delivers the goods.  Very good donuts, from old fashioned cake-style donuts to light glazed donuts pretty much everything here is top notch.
author: Jake B.

description: This is a great place to go after a night of bar-hopping on Polk Street. Yummy! They start making fresh donuts around 11:30pm, so that is definitely the best time to be there. You can watch the donuts swim around in the deep fryer and the aroma is wonderful!
author: Gabby G.

description:
This is a terrific Donut Shop, where you can always go.  Though I highly recommend visiting at about 2:00 AM,  when you just need a donut break from an all-nighter of work. 
I have been a regular for quite some time,  I always wave to the donut ladies, everytime I walk by. Very friendly.
author: Mark Q.

description: Every now and then I crave a donut and you can be sure to find me at Bob's buying a chocolate covered old fashioned donut....yummy!  I also like their glazed and sugar donuts too.  Bob's has so many donuts to choose from so the next time you're on Polk street swing by Bob.
author: Oscar F.

description:
Increadible.  My first experience was at a b-day party where the cake was 2 GIANT glazed doughnuts.  These tasties were many hours old but were a perfect balance of chewiness and not to overwhelming sweetness.  My friends insisted that I needed to check this place out and get a fresh one.  I ony live a block away but due to the healthy eating kick lately decided not to indulge, until I brought an out of town buddy and his sis.

Lucky for us, fresh old fashioned and then cake doughnuts were just coming out of the fryer.  I didn't try a bite of the old fashioned one, but did take a bite of the cake doughnut.... it was like the best french toast I'd every had.  None of that dryness normally found in a cake doughnut where if you breathe wrong you end up choking on crumbs.
author: Kelly G.

description: donuts so awesome, you can smell them from a block away!
author: Emily Y.

description: My fiance and I went here on Sunday morning because I was craving some donuts but I was really disappointed. The selection was very limited and the donuts didn't look very fresh. I got a chocolate french crueller and it was ok but there was barely any icing on it. We went down the street to another donut shop and they had a much better selection and the donuts were fresh. I don't know if we just went at the wrong time but it seems like on a Sunday morning, they would have fresher donuts and a better variety.
author: susie r.

description: Cross your fingers and hope that some donuts are fresh out of the deep fryer.  Makes all the difference in the world.  If you catch them right, they are some of the best bits of fried goodness you can jam into your mouth.  No pun intended.  Apple Fritter goodness.  Lemon filled is just sexy like a Mike Tyson uppercut.  Mean!  They are open 24 hours!  Praise all the all mighty sugar flour gods!
author: Mike and Nance B.

description: Its 4 A.M. on a Wednesday and you have been out to the bars. You realize that you may have a bit of a problem with alcohol because you are out drunk on a Wednesday night but you quickly get over that because your stomach growls at you "feed me and get me some coffee bitch!" What to do? Thank goodness you live near Polk and Sacramento the location of Bobs Doughnuts. They are the Fleur De Lys of fried dough. And they are open 24 hours a day. I recently discovered this on a night similar to the one described earlier. In addition to the classics like old fashioned glazed and the cute little ones with rainbow sprinkles they also make a mean apple fritter. The coffee is always fresh and staff is patient with your drunk ass as you drool at the display window trying to make up your mind. They are constantly baking so the selection is different all the time. Bobs is the perfect stop weather you are grabbing a dozen doughnuts for your church group on Sunday morning or a dozen doughnuts for your intoxicated frat boy asshole friends on the way back from R Bar.
author: Adam M.

description: In my experience, the best time is to come here late at night, because that's when the freshest batch of donuts comes out. Maybe they do that for the benefit of people working afterhours and party-goers, and I've certainly ended my fair share of eventful nights here at Bob's. Unfortunately, by day this place is totally forgettable. But it earns 3 stars for those delicious fresh donuts, which are sometimes accompanied by other out-of-da-oven pastries. Oooh, memories of a warm apple fritter. I feel like going out for drinks right now just so I can hit up Bob's. Who's with me?
author: Joseph R.

description: after a wonderful dinner, we went down to polk street to get us some of their delicious crueller's donuts in maple and chocolate. despite the time to have our donuts at 8pm, it was amazingly fresh, soft and really appetizing. the lady at the counter was very friendly and talkative. moreover, while we were buying our donuts, a guy who parked his car at the bus stop, in front of the shop got a ticket while buying his own donuts!!!! so, this place must be really that good that a person will risk anything to get bob's donuts!!
author: Nelle A.

description: all the donuts in the window looked so delicious.  if we lived anywhere near here, we would probably put on about 10 pounds trying a new one every day.  since i could only have one we chose the apple fritter, since it seemed to be the most raved about.. but sadly, found it to be nothing extraordinary.  it was a little too dry for me.  BUT, i do think this place is really cool.  while we were sitting at the counter enjoying our donut, so many people came in, many appearing to be regulars since the lady working behind the corner seemed to know exactly what they would want.  if we're ever passing by here again, we will need to stop by and give this place another try.
author: Waynele Y.

description: The best and freshest donuts I have ever eaten.  You cannot go wrong getting any donut there.
author: Mary L.

description: delicious apple fritter, right amount of glaze, dough and apple, and huge too. last night i just spend $15 for donuts for my late night craving. 4 stars for being far from where i live.
author: Suki S.

description: Tiny hole in the wall doughnut shop with plenty of homeless people and/or locals. This place doesn't serve up organic this and that however they do make fresh batches of doughnuts every single day at different hours because they are open 24 hrs - 7days a week! My favorite: powder, cinnamon, maple w/sprinkles, and sugar.
author: Xuyen H.

description: while i'm a fan of the fun flavors offered by dynamo, sometimes i don't feel like spending $2-3 on a fancy donut. there are times when just a plain glazed will hit the spot. so after my husband and i ate an early dinner recently at miller's, we walked down the street and decided to get a couple of donuts at bob's. my husband was hankering for a chocolate glazed but, unfortunately, they ran out. so we ended up getting two plain glazed donuts. the donut itself was very fluffy, not at all oily, and tasted just slightly malty while the glaze was not overdone nor too sweet. a perfect glazed donut. the only thing that makes them better is that they were only 85 cents each! now i'll need to go back and try their famous apple fritter. i'm just sad they're not closer to my place!
author: stykkisholmur t.

description: If you are ever on Polk St. late at night, you must stop by. Bob's makes donuts fresh throughout the weekend nights and nothing compares to a fresh-out-the-frier-donut. You can debate which is the best donut, but I would just ask for whatever is freshest. They get so hot from the oil that they stay hot for a long time; you can pick up a box of fresh ones and arrive at a party with still warm, melt in your mouth sugar glazed apple fritters or ol' fashions. The place has an authentic, slightly greasy feel to it. Their drip coffee is surprisingly good against the sugar.
author: Sarah L.

description: best traditional glazed donuts on the planet. but also the worst thing you could ever put in your body. it's a tough call. have a drink at bigfoot across the street and think about it.
author: casey c.

description: mmm. bob's. i combined it with swan's yesterday for lunch. i was a happy camper..
author: Heidi L.

description: Donuts are my favorite food and these are my favorite donuts. Seriously. They are so soft and delicious. The first time I had a hot one from Bob's I finished it within a block of the store, so I headed right back and bought another. they're amazing.
author: Clark L.

description:
affordable:)
tasty:)
fresh:)
open late:)
luke warm staf:|
huge variety:)
great location:)
always a batch hot off the cooker:)
not crowded:)
5 stars:)
author: Dayman D.

description: Many a late, late, late night (morning?) have I spent at Bob's, chowing down on piping-hot, fresh donuts.  A comforting, homey place to hang and add some inches to the ol' waistline.  Great people too.  If I were ever to move back to Polk Street, Bob's Donuts would be the sole reason.
author: Sean F.

description:
you like donuts and know about this joint already i hope. otherwise, if you want to know what a donut is all about this is the place and it will take time. 
A hot donut is a completely different beast than some entimanns garbage. Millions of calories melting in your mouth and overwhelming any ideas you had in the past about what makes a good desert, crushing any fancy restaurant pastries beneath its glazed hoof.

But as with anything worth having there is a price, each type of donut is produced at a diffenent time and when you arrive maybe only some lame standard has popped out most recently... it may take a few visits at odd, disparate hours to hit perfection, perhaps a maple glazed old fashioned, maybe a plain glazed frenchy-style..

well worth it, and even the cold ones here top the tepid nonsense served at your average happy...
author: aaron h.

description:
i just got back from a run to bob's. i had the apple fritter and it was amazing. perfect consistency. nice and moist with big apple chunks. oh, i want another, but that would be bad for me. 

i really love going here. i feel like a child. i always lean over the cookie display case (does anyone ever get the cookies?) and point at every single donut and ask what it is. the young woman working is always so nice and informative and never annoyed. i always eventually ask her what her favorite is and she just says all of them. mine too.
author: Saikat P.

description:
these donuts are definitely incredible.  if you're lucky, you might arrive in time to see their giant donuts... i think they are a mere 3.50 or somewhere around there.  could probably satisfy 4 donut lovers.  would be one amazing birthday cake replacement donut.

if youre on polk and smell the greasy goodness that is bobs, try the crumb donut or actually, any.  delicious.
author: E. R.

description: Bob's is a Polk institution, and for good reason.  They make some of the best doughnuts around and the only doughnuts available after 10:00PM that you might want to eat  (tip of the hat also to Rolling Pin on 24th & Church, but that's a separate review).  Every neighbourhood high street in San Francisco used to have a doughnut shop like this in the halcyon late 70's-early 80's of my childhood and most are now long gone.  Get to Bob's and grab yourself a 1:00AM piece of pineapple upside-down cake while you still can.  You can go to the gym on Monday to make up for it.
author: Stephen N.

description: not a chain, so feels more inviting and is preferable to krispy kreme, but not nearly as good as dunkin doughnuts (yet to be found in san francisco). open very late. coffee and oj best left alone.
author: Hae-Jin K.

description: i am, quite frankly, NOT donut fan. in fact, i dislike most pastries that have frosting on them. but i seriously did not know that a donut was supposed to taste this way.  A FRESH, straight-from-the-fire donut. it was like paradise in a bite. the donut melted in your mouth in a perfect blend of mushiness and sweetness. i also had this donut around midnight on saturday night. apparently its a favorite place for the people who had a merry night with lots of drinks to come here and sink their teeth into what a REAL donut should taste like.
author: Angie K.

description: Open late so you can eat great!  My roommates and I often have late night donut cravings and Bob's always leaves us satisfied and begging for more.  Cake donuts, mmmmmm.
author: pat j.

description: My office moved to the neighborhood and as I was first going to Miller's East Coast West Deli, I noticed this donut shop.  After sampling several available treats, I've been back again  and again and again. Good thing I run marathons to keep going back again!
author: Bailey P.

description: Holy Crapamolie! Best donuts in the city (that i have tried). Basically get whatevers fresh out the oven when you get there and prepare for your mind to blow! I had a glazed old fashioned (which i never really liked mind you) and it was the shizzle! I hear the apple fritters are awesome too (I took one to go).
author: Casey Y.

description: Ever since I went here one late Saturday night and had a fresh out-of-the deep fryer donut, I have been in love with Bob's donuts! Anytime I have tried another place, it has not compared to Bob's so I have stopped trying. Nothing can beat the melt-in-your-mouth donut from Bob's! Mmmm, I want a donut!
author: Jenna W.

description: I used to love this place, but recently it's gone down hill.  Last week there was a cockroach running on one of the donut trays and when someone pointed it out to the manager, the reaction was almost nothing.  The tray with the cockroach was immediately was thrown away, but nothing else was done to the other trays.  Some else pointed this out and all the manager did was shrug.  I don't know if they changed ownership, but I don't think this would have ever happened to the Bob's Donuts I knew 10 years ago.  Sadly, I'm not going back anymore.
author: Lisa K.

description: just plain awesome donuts.  fritters cooked to perfection with lots of crispy grooves to satisfy my sweet tooth.  the old fashioned donuts here are the bomb too.  Yumm!  The lady was even nice enough to give us some water for my girlfriend to put her contact back in with despite the line, and even take the cup back real quick so she could wipe off the chocolate smear on the cup so it didnt get on my gf.  Mmmmm, donuts.  :]
author: Brett T.

description: kind of a bad neighborhood, but they're always open and offer something for everyone, unlike krispy kreme
author: Charles C.

description: forever and a day this all night police substation, this was the spot, and has fallen on hard times, and donuts even harder, lost its edge, and attention to donuts, coffee was better when there was no choice, just hot and decent, now hot and flavored? what with dat?  now where is the donut place to go in san fran?
author: tim y.

description: It's been years since I've been here so I'll let the others say how good it is now. Let's just say, when I ate my first donut here, I had an epiphany. As in "THIS is what a donut is supposed to taste like." Not the over-glazed, mushy donut or the somewhat crunchy, hard donuts that you get elsewhere. Bob's donuts are what people are trying to make when they open donut shops. Even after all these years, it's still the best donut I've ever had.
author: Alice C.

description: I picked up a dozen or so for a breakfast birthday party and they were a hit!  The donuts were very rustic and plump and the dough had a lot of chewy heft-in a good way. But I am taking away a star because the selection was sooo very limited, at least the day I was there.  I had to stop in at Donut and Things to get a couple of donuts that should be pretty standard- chocolate bars and chocolate old fashioned with peanut sprinkles.
author: amy y.

description: best crumb donut i have had.  interesting late night crowd.
author: Greg M.

description: non-fresh old-fashioned are the best, my 2am hookups. great after pinball.
author: John M.

description: i'll admit going to bob's donut shop during daylight hours, while completely sober. The place is actually pretty good. I passed by it everyday for months and gawked at how everything looked like it was slathered in some weird, shiny glace. One day, my brother wanted to stop in...i looked at him awkwardly and reluctantly went with him. I had to get a donut because, well, I was in the donut shop already. And let me just say, very impressed. Plus the woman working there was totally cute! She mans the place by herself apparently and (since business must not be that great during the day) she is always super excited to talk to you when you come in.
author: Sarah I.

description:
cake, old-fashioned, custard-filled, it's all good. freshness is unbeatable most of the time. did i mention 24 hours? also the place looks unchanged from the 70s and makes me feel like i'm in a kojak episode.

the best birthday gift i ever received was a dozen of these badboys. yeah, we stuck candles in them.
author: jigs m.

description: I never liked donuts as a kid. They were my least favorite treat. Dense, cold mounds of solidified lard - that's what I thought of them. But my first krispy kreme fresh off a conveyor belt converted me to the cult of light, fluffy fried fat. I became eager to try donuts of all shapes and sizes and began to crave donuts at the most inopportune moments (business meetings, yoga class...). I tried the flavors of the uber-gourmet donut and discovered the joys of the late night cold fritter. But Bob's, my friends, is the real deal. Watch your circle of raw dough float in a pool of oil and then be deftly flipped by two chopsticks. Then the golden dough is hand drenched in glaze, instantly melting on the scalding surface. A minute later it's in your hand. Perfection. In donut form. For a mere 80 cents. Go for the simple glazed. Less is more. And, as I was warned by a fellow patron before I ordered, you will never be able to eat Krispy Kreme again.
author: Jammy M.

description: Just a solid place that delivers what it says it will.  Plus, a couple donuts and a small coffee cost nothing.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Holy moly yelpers, thanks for the tip on this place! I tried a donut with some sort of jelly on top - delicious. Also tried the bread pudding - although it was messy, was very moist and filling. Sadly, I live 1,800 miles from Bob's, but if I get that late night craving, maybe they will ship some to me.
author: Darin E.

description: waaaaay better than krispy kreme when it comes to the glazed-raised. and for $0.75, you can't beat it! i love bob's. everything is delicious.
author: Jen V.

description: i love me some bobs donuts. please join twitter so i can go when they are fresh and hot, all day, every day. chocolate rocks, thank you, bobs donut.
author: amber d.

description: rarely have anything but chocolate. we love the wolf man, who is always there, with his one cuppa kawffee and his newspaper, pacing in and out, messing with the front door occasionally. we love the way the walls are decorated with donut cartoons, we love the friendly counter people, and most of all --- we love the donuts. especially when they're hot out of the fryer. yum.
author: kyle y.

description: I'm not a huge fan of donuts, but we tried this place last night.  The donuts are fine and cooked fresh especially late at night.  We had a chocolate glazed cake one and it was only 85 cents.  Not a very nice place inside to hang, but as long as the donuts are nice.
author: Brian L.

description: I have been living in this neighbourhood for 3 years now and never walked into this store- mainly cause well it didnt look so appetizing thru the window and the crowds around the store usually kept me away. but i chanced to read somewhere that when alton brown from food network came into san francisco, he always stopped by here. So I checked it out and OH MY GOODNESSS... all those wasted days and months ... the donuts at this place at amazing - i always have the glazed and i tried to coconut macaroons.. YUMMMYY .. to die for.:)
author: Aditi M.

description: The best donut ever!!! especially after I got drunk and walked back home. One time the owner made a big giant donut that I ever seen in my life. their donuts is fresh, and cheap!!! Love This Place:)
author: Grace C.

description: A little too charred by the frying, but other than that, the chocolate buttermilk bar I had last night was good enough to start an addiction.
author: Sam C.

description: omgggg. every single thing in this place is freakin' delicious - i just finished off a cake donut and might go back into my bag of deliciousness to get a glazed. getting a half dozen - best/worst idea ever. i might gain 10 lbs from all of the donuts/fritters/cinnamon rolls, but the extra gym time will be worth it. best donuts i've ever had. and the giant donuts that usually come out around 2am are out of this world. not to mention that the employee i usually see when i am in there is so nice. fml i love donuts.
author: Stephanie D.

description: glazed donuts, cinnamon twists, apple fritters, open 24 hours - nuff said
author: Anthony W.
